div0.head: *f
div0.entryFree: *f f, fei= (q.v.), to/, indecl., twenty-first letter of the Ion. alphabet: as a numeral f/ = 500, but f' = 500,000.
fa=, Dor. for e)/fa, e)/fh, v. fhmi/.
fa/anqen, faa/nqh, n. fai/nw.

fa^a/nteros, a, on, Ep. Comp. of faeino/s,
more brilliant, AP9.210: Sup. fa^a/ntatos, h, on,
brightest, a)sth/r Od.13.93.

fa/ba, atos, to/, (Lat.
faba) beans, Edict.Diocl.1.9 (CIL iii p.232858), 6.38, Hippiatr.7, 104, 129, 130.134, Gloss.

fa^bata/rion, to/,
tureen for lentil-soup, POxy.1657.6 (iii A. D.).

fa^ba/tinos, h, on,
made of beans, from Lat.
faba, a)/leuron Alex. Trall.3.7.

fa^bo-kto/nos, o(, (fa/y)
dove killer, Hsch.
fa^bo/-meli, v. fako/meli.

fa^bo-tu/pos [u^], o(,
dove-striker, a kind of
hawk, Arist. HA592b2.
fa/gaina [fa^], h(, = h( meta\ ta\s no/sous polufagi/a, Ammon.Diff. p.136V. = fage/daina 1.1, Hsch.
fa^ga/nqrwpos, on, = a)nqrwpofa/gos, Hsch., Phot.

fa^ga=s, a=, o(,
glutton, Cratin.451.

fa^ge/dain-a, h(,
cancerous sore, canker, A.Fr.253, E. Fr.792, Hp.
Aër.10, D.25.95, IG42(1).123.135 (Epid., iv B. C.), Gal.7.727. a disease of bees, Colum.9.13.10. = fa/gaina 1, Gal. 19.419.

fa^gedain-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of the nature of a cancer, pa/qh Plu.2.1087e; e(/lkh Dsc.2.78, 5.112, cf. Heliod. ap. Orib.46.22.3, Gal.6.750, 815.
of morbid hunger, Gloss.

fa^gedain-o/omai, Pass.,
suffer from cancer, Hp.Epid.4.19, 5.44: later in Act., Aq.De.7.23, dub. in Phld.Sto.Herc.339.20.
fa^gedai/n-wma, atos, to/, = fage/daina 1, Pall.Febr.7.

fa^gei=n, inf. of e)/fagon, with no pres. in use (exc. in late Gr., fagei= Anon. in EN448.16; fage/ois in edd. of Ps.-Phoc.157 is v. dub.), used as aor. 2 of e)sqi/w; later 1pl. e)fa/gamen LXX 2 Ki. 19.42 cod.B, 3pl. e)fa/gosan ib.Ge.18.8: later fut. is fa/gomai, ib.Si.36.23, Ev.Luc.14.15; 2sg. fa/gesai LXX Ru.2.14, Ev.Luc.17.8; fa/gh| LXX Ge.3.14; also fagou=mai ib. 2(v.l.); fut. fagh/sw is v. dub. in Lib.Or. 53.29:—
eat, devour, both of men and beasts, freq. in Hom.; a)zhxe\s fage/men kai\ pie/men Od.18.3, cf. 15.378, Pl.Lg.831e; reversely, pio/nta h)\ fago/nta Id.Prt.314a, cf. Phd.81b, E.Cyc.336 (dub. l.): mostly c. acc., Il.21.127, 24.411, etc.: c. gen.,
eat of a thing, Od.9.102, 15.373; o)/rniqos o)/rnis pw=s a)\n a(gneu/oi fagw/n; A.Supp.226; a)po/ tinos LXX Ge.2.16.
eat up, devour, squander, Od.2.76, 4.33. (Cf. pamatofage/w and Skt.
bhájati 'apportion, (Med.) enjoy'.)

fa^ge/swros, o(,
glutton, and gasth\r
fageswri=tis, Com.Adesp. 1183,1184.
faghlo/s, v. fa/gilos.

fa/g-hma [fa^], atos, to/,
food, victuals, Anon. ap. Suid., Demetr. Sceps. ap. Ath.3.91d, PMag.Berol.1.23.

fag-h/sia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
an eating-festival, and fa^ghsi^po/sia, ta/,
an eating and drinking festival, Clearch.62.

fa/gi^los, o(,
a lamb, either
when it begins to be eatable or
to eat alone, Arist.Fr.507; written faghlo/s, fanao/s in Hsch., fanulo/s in Eust.1625.38.

fa^goloi/doros, o(,
swallower of insults, Gloss.

fa/gos [a^], o(,
glutton, Ev.Matt. 11.19, Ev.Luc.7.34, Zen.1.73.

fa/gros, o(,
sea-bream or
braize, Pagrus vulgaris, Hp.
lnt. 1, Eup.38 (lyr.), Pl.Com.56.2, Antiph.193, Arist.HA598a13, 601b30, Speus. ap.Ath.7.327c, Numen.ib.322f, BGU1095.18 (i A. D.), Phylotim. ap. Gal.6.726, 12.800: written fagrw/rios in Str.17.2.4; fa/gwros in Hsch. Cret.,
whetstone, Simm.27.
fa/guloi: mastoi/, ma/rsippoi, Hsch.; cf. fagu/lion: marsi/ppion, Phot.

fa/gwn [a^], wnos, o(,
glutton, Varro ap.Non.p.69 L., Vopisc.Aurel. 50. fagw/n, o/nos, o(,
jaw, Hsch. (pl.).
fa/gwros, v. fa/gros.
fa^eqont-ia/s, a/dos, h(, = sq., Opp.C.1.219.

fa^eqont-i/s, i/dos, (fae/qwn)
of Phaethon, i. e.
the Sun, f. ai)/glh, marmarugh/, AP9.782 (Paul. Sil.), APl.4.77 (ld.).

fa^e/qw, (fa/w)
shine, only in part. fae/qwn (exc. 3sg. fae/qei, Hsch.),
radiant, epith. of the sun, Il.11.735, Od.5.479, 11.16, Hes.Th.760, S.El.824 (lyr.), E.El.464 (lyr.). abs.,
the sun, AP5.273 (Paul. Sil.), 9.137 (Hadr.); pa/nnuxa kai\ fae/qonta nights and
days, S.Aj. 929 (lyr.). of the moon, fae/qousa kai\ au)ga/zousa PMag.Par. 1.2558. as pr. n., *fae/qwn, o(, one of the
light-bringing steeds of Eos, Od.23.246. son of Eos and Cephalus, Hes. Th.987. son of Helios, famous for his unlucky driving of the sun-chariot, E.Hipp.739 (lyr.), Arist.Mete.345a15; subject of play by E. the
Sun, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr.2.82, Nonn.D. 5.81. the constellation
Auriga, ib.1.357, 38.424. the planet
Jupiter, Arist.Mu.392a24, Eudox.Ars 5.14, Cic.ND2.20.52.

fa^eino/s, h/, o/n (so always in Ep.), Aeol., Trag. (even in dialogue, E.Ph.84, al.) and Lyr. fa^enno/s, Att. fa_no/s (q.v.):—poet. Adj.,
shining, radiant, pu=r Il.5.215; selh/nh 8.555; *)hw/s Od.4.188; o)/sse Il.13.3; xalko/s 12.151; kassi/teros 23.561; o)rei/xalkos, xruso/s, Hes.Sc.122,142; krhth/r Il.3.247, al.; do/ru 4.496; a)spi/s, sa/kos, 3.357, 8.272; ph/lhc 13.805; qw/rhc faeino/teros puro\s au)gh=s 18.610; o(/pla E.Andr.1146; ma/stic Il.10.500; qu/rai Od.6.19; of
bright colours, zwsth\r foi/niki faeino/s Il.6.219, cf. 15.538; f. peplos, ta/phs, 5.315, 10.156; f. plo/kamoi
bright, glossy, 14.176; ei)=dos, of the stars, Sapph.3.2; a)/stron Pi.O.1.6, cf. E.Cyc.353, al.; e)/rebos w)= faenno/taton w(s e)moi/ darkness
bright as the day to me, S.Aj.395 (lyr.); of the Dawn, AP5.227 (Paul. Sil.). of the voice,
clear, distinct, far-sounding, Pi.P.4.283.
splendid, brilliant, a)retai/, qusi/ai, Id.N.7.51, I.5(4).30; krhpi\s e)leuqeri/as Id.Fr.77.—Very rare in Prose, e)n toi=s faeinoi=s xro/nois, of
clear nights, Aen.Tact.25.2; *fa/ennos is pr. n. at Rhodes, Chron.Lind. B.34.

fa^ei/nw, poet. form of fai/nw,
shine, give light, freq. of the sun, h)e/lios d' a)no/rouse . . , i(/n' a)qana/toisi faei/noi Od.3.2, cf. Hes.Op.528, Call. in PSI11.1218a7; [h)w\s] e)pixqoni/oisi f. Hes. Th.372; also e)n neku/essi, met' a)qana/toisi f. Od.12.383,385; lampth=ras trei=s i(/stasan e)n mega/roisin, o)/fra faei/noien 18.308; lampth=rsi faei/nwn
giving light by . . , ib.343:—Pass. in same sense, A.R.2.42;
appear, ib.4.1362, Call.Ap.9. metaph., lo/gos peri\ tou=de faei/nei Orph.Fr. 247.9. trans.,
bring to light, o(po/s' e(rpeta\ gai=a faei/nei Nic. Th.390.
fa^enno/s, v. faeino/s.

fa^esi/mbrotos, on,
bringing light to mortals, shining on them, h)w/s Il.24.785, B.12.128; *)he/lios Od.10.138,191, Hes.Th.958; *)apo/llwn IG14.2524 (Autun); *)hrige/neia ib.3.1326; o)/rgia . . faesi/mbrota *dhou=s ib.22.3661 (Eleusis, ii/iii A. D.); once in Trag., qeou= faesi/mbrotoi au)gai/ E.Heracl.750 (lyr.).

fa^esfor-e/w,
bring light, of the moon, Nech. ap. Vett.Val.154.31.

fa^esfor-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
bringing of light, illumination, Call.Dian. 11, Musae.302.

fa^e/sfor-os (parox.), on, (fa/os, fe/rw)
light-bringing, lampa/des A.Ag.489; *ku/klwpos o)/yis E.Cyc.462; e)n makra=| flogi\ faesfo/rw|, i. e. after many days, Id.Hel.629 (lyr.), cf. Call.Dian.204; *)hw/s A. R.4.885; of Artemis, IG14.2524 (Autun). Cf. fwsfo/ros.

fa/zaina, h(, a
disease in horses, Hippiatr.130.119 (acc. sg. written faza/nan cod.B, faza/nhn cod. M).
fazakhni/ais: deilai=s, Hsch. (leg. fuzakinai=s).

faza/lh, h(, a
disease contracted in the Red Sea, Id.
faqi/ or fa/qi, v. fhmi/.

fai/ac, a_kos, Ion. fai/hc, hkos, o(,
Phaeacian, Od.5.35, etc. pr. n. of an architect, who gave his name to
conduits or
sewers (fai/a_kes or faia_koi/), D.S.11.25.
faidi^m-o/eis, essa, en, = sq., Il.13.686.

fai/di^m-os, on, also a, on Pi. P.4.28, N.1.68 (not used by Hom. in fem.): (faidro/s):—
shining, radiant, glistening, esp. of men's limbs, f. w)=mos Od.11.128, Pi.O.1.27; gui=a Il.6.27, Hes.Th.492; ko/ma Pi.N.1.68; pro/soyis Id.P.4.28 (s. v. l.);
sleek, glossy, i(/ppoi Id.O.6.14. of heroes,
famous, glorious, fai/dim' *)axilleu= Il.9.434; fai/dim' *)odusseu= Od.10.251; fai/dimos *(/ektwr, ai)/as, Il.4.505, 5.617, etc.—Used by Trag. only in Ep. phrases, fai/dim' *)axilleu= A.Fr.131 (anap., ap.Ar.Ra.992); a)mfi\ f. w)/mois S.Fr.453; so f. braxi/ones Achae.4.
fai/dra, h(, = i(/ppouris, f. l. for e)fe/dra in Ps.-Dsc.4.46.

faidro-ei/mwn, on, gen. onos, (ei(=ma)
in bright attire, Agath.5.15.

faidro/-nous, oun,
with bright, joyous mind, light-hearted, A.Ag. 1229(s. v. l.).

faidr-o/omai, Pass.,
beam with joy, X.Cyr.2.2.16.

faidr-o/s, a/, o/n,
bright, beaming, fa/os Pi.Fr.109; a(li/ou se/las A.Eu.926 (lyr.); selh/nh Id.Ag.298; tra/pezai Cratin.301 (troch.); krath/r Alex.119.1; of
sparkling water, leukw=n faidrote/rhn liba/dwn (of a woman), AP7.218 (Antip. Sid.); a)h/r Poll.9.20. metaph.,
beaming with joy, bright, cheerful (opp. stugno/s, X.An.2.6.11), f. pro/swpon Sol.42.3, S.El.1297, etc.; f . . . o)/mmasi de/casqe . . basile/a A.Ag.520; f. freni\ de/casqai Id.Ch.565; f. ka/ra S.El.1310; o)/mma f. w(s ei)=don te/knwn E. Med.1043; faidroi=s w)si/n, of a horse pricking his ears, Ar.Pax156 (anap.); of persons,
of glad countenance, cheerful, X.Cyr.3.3.59, Gal.6.186, 16.615 (Comp.), etc.; faidro\s la/mponti metw/pw| Ar.Eq. 550 (anap.); o)/mmasi kai\ sxh/masi kai\ badi/smati faidro/s X.Ap.27; kune\s a)po\ tw=n prosw/pwn f. Id.Cyn.4.2; e)pi/ tini f.
glad at a thing, D.18.323. Adv. -drw=s
joyously, cheerily, f. bioteu/wn X.Cyr.4.6.6, cf. 4.2.11; neut. pl. faidra/ as Adv., f. gou=n a)p' o)mma/twn sai/nei me
with happy smile, S.OC319, cf. Fr.766 (anap.). masc. pr. n., properisp. *fai=dros: fem. *fai/dra, Ion. *fai/drh, parox. (Cf. Lith.
gi[etilde]dras 'fair, clear (weather, sky)'.)

faidr-o/ths, htos, h(,
brightness, brilliance, o)fqalmw=n Poll.6.199; li/qwn Lib.Or.11.89, cf. 221. metaph.,
joyousness, Isoc.15.133, Plu.2.595d.

faidrun-th/s, ou=, o(,
cleanser, Poll.7.37. faidruntai/, oi(, descendants of Phidias, who had charge of the statue of Zeus at Elis, Paus.5.14.5, Inscr.Olymp.466.5, cf. AB314: written faiduntai/ in Inscrr., Sammelb.2536 (Naucratis), IG22.1078.16, al., IGRom.4.1680.

faidrun-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for cleaning, Poll.7.37.

faidru/n-tria, h(, fem. of faidrunth/s, sparga/nwn f.
washer of baby-linen, A.Ch. 759.

faidru/n-w, Ep. impf. faidru/nesken A.R.4.671:—
make bright, cleanse (coupled with a)poplu/nein kai\ diaplu/nein by Poll.7.40), tina\ loutroi=si f. A.Ag.1109 (lyr.); qeai\ morfa\n e)fai/drunan
gave me
a bright form, says Helen, E.Hel.678 (lyr.); f. xro/a Call.Jov.32; de/mas, ei(/mata, A.R.3.1043, 4.671; stefanou=nta kai\ faidru/nonta to\n *(ermh=n kai\ th\n *(eka/thn Porph.Abst.2.16; xei=ras AP5.227 (Paul. Sil.); th=| glw/tth| to\ pro/swpon Ael.NA3.21; [*(/hlios] kosmw=n kai\ faidru/nwn Jul.Or.4.142a:—Med., loutrw=| xro/a faidru/nesqai
to wash one's skin
clean, Hes.Op.753, cf. Mosch.2.31. metaph.,
cheer, A.Ag.1120:—Med., to\n e(autou= bi/on faidru/nasqai Pl.Lg. 718b:—Pass.,
beam or
brighten up with joy, X.Cyr.5.5.37; e)pi/ tini at a thing, Callistr.Stat.9; tw\ o)fqalmw/ Poll.6.199. Pass.,
become more glaring, of a fever, a)ei\ ma=llon e)faidru/neto Gal.14.653.

faidrwpo/s, o/n, (w)/y)
with bright, joyous look, of a young lion (cf. xaropo/s), A.Ag.725 (lyr.); o)/mma f. E.Or.894.
faidunth/s, v. faidrunth/s.
fai/kanon, to/, = ph/ganon, Hsch.

faik-a/s, a/dos, h(, a kind of
shoe, worn by Athenian gymnasiarchs, Egyptian priests, and others, AP6.254 (Myrin.).
faik-a/sion [a^], to/, = foreg., Eratosth.9, Wilcken Chr.20 iii 7 (ii A. D.), App.BC5.11, Plu.Ant.33, etc.

fai/kla, h(, = Lat.
faecula, PHolm.16.2 (faklan Pap.); cf. fe/klh, sfe/klh.
faiko/s, h/, o/n, = lampro/s, S.Fr.1107. Adv. -kw=s Hsch.
failo/nh, h(, and felo/nh, h(, = sq., Gloss.

failo/nhs, = faino/lhs, 2 Ep.Ti.4.13 (wrongly expld. by glwsso/komon, ei)lhta/rion membra/i+non, Hsch.); written felo/nhs in PFay.347 (ii A. D.), v.l. in 2 Ep.Ti. l.c.:—Dim. failo/nion POxy.933.30 (ii A. D.); written f[e]lo/nion in PGen.80.14 (iv A. D.).

faini/nda^ pai/zein, to play
at ball, Antiph.283, Juba 81, Ath.1.14f, Poll.9.105: written feni/nda in Com.Adesp.711.
faini/s, i/dos, h(, Laced. for a)nemw/nh, Sosib. ap. Sch.Theoc.5.92.

faino/lh, Dor. faik-o/la, h(, = Lat.
paenula, thick upper garment, cloak, Rhinth.7, cf. faino/la: to\ u(/fasma, Hsch.; fai/noula Edict.Diocl. 19.51 (Megalop.), pai/noula ib.52, pe/noula ib.51 (Megar.):—but usu. faino/lhs, ou, o(, Arr.Epict.4.8.34, Ath.3.97e, Artem.2.3, Poll.7.61, POxy.736.4 (i A. D.).

faino/lis, h(, (fai/nw)
light-bringing, light-giving, h)w/s h.Cer.51, Mosch.4.121; au)/ws Sapph.95.

fainome/nws, Adv.,
apparently, opp. w(s a)lhqw=s, Procl. in Prm. p.499 S.; opp. a)fanw=s, ib.p.618 S.; f. kai\ ei)dwlikw=s Id.
in R.1.77K.

faino-mhri/s, i/dos, h(,
showing the thigh, with bare thigh, Ibyc.61; cf. fano/mhris.

faino/-pous, podos, o(, h(,
with shining feet, Theognost. Can.12.

faino-proswpe/w,
show one's face, put in an appearance, coined by Cic.Att.7.21.1:—hence faino-proswphte/on,
one must put in an appearance, ib. 14.22.2.

fainou=klon, to/, Lat.
foeniculum, = ma/raqron, Et.Gud. s. h. v.

fai=noy, opos, o(, h(, (w)/y)
bright-eyed, conspicuous, a)e/lion Hymn.Is. 31, cf. Man.4.239: in Il. only as pr.n.

fai/nw, Od.7.102, etc., Ep. also faei/nw (q. v.):—fut. fa^nw=, A.Fr. 304.5, Ar.Ach.827, etc. (fa_nw= acc. to A.D.Adv.187.26, but fa_nw=, Ar. Eq.300, and a)nafa_nw=, E.Ba.528, are dub.); Ion. fa^ne/w（a)po-) Hp.Steril. 213, opt. fa^noi/hn S.Aj.313 (cod. rec., rightly): aor. 1 e)/fhna Il.2.318, Hdt.1.95, etc.; Dor. e)/fa_na Pi.I.4(3).2, IG42(1).123.28 (Epid., iv B.C.), also later Att., subj., a)po-fa/nh| dub. l. in IG22.1631.379 ( = 2.811c133); fa/nh|s Philem.233 (e)k-fa/nh|s Men.Mon.418 = Chares Iamb.4b20); so in late Prose, (e)c-) Ael.VH12.33, (e)pi-) Ev.Luc.1.79, (a)na-) Act.Ap. 21.3; Ep. iter. fa/neske (intr.) Il.11.64, al., Hes.Fr.14.3: pf. pe/fagka Ps.-Callisth.2.10, (a)po-) Din.1.15, al.: intr. pf. pe/fhna (v. infr.A 111.2), Dor.3pl. e)k-pefa/nanti Sophr.83; plpf. e)pefh/nein D.C.46.10:—Med., fut. inf. fa^nei=sqai Od.12.230, Ion. fa^ne/omai Hdt.3.35; opt. fanoi=sqe Lys.26.10 (nisi leg. fanei=sqe); the forms fanh=sqon and Dor. imper. fa/neu are corrupt in Pl.Erx.399e, Teles p.58 H. (leg. fai/neu): aor. 1 e)fhna/mhn (trans.) S.Ph.944, (a)p-) Hdt.7.52, etc.:—Pass., Ion. impf. faine/sketo Od.13.194: fut. fa^nh/somai Hdt.8.108, Sicilian Dor. (inf.) fa^nh/sein (fort. -hsei=n) Archim.
A ren.4.20; Ep. fut. pefh/setai Il.17.155: aor. 1 e)fa/nqhn A.Pers.263 (lyr.), S.OT525, etc.:rare in Prose, X.HG6.4.11, D.58.13, (a)po-) IG12.10.35, D.19.44; Ep. 3sg. faa/nqh Il.17.650, 3pl. fa/anqen 1.200: aor. 2 e)fa/nhn [a^], Ep. fa/nhn Il.1.477, etc.; Ep. 3pl. fa/nen Od.18.68; Ep. subj. fanh/h| Il.19.375; Ep. inf. fanh/menai 9.240: pf. pe/fasmai S.OC1543, 3sg. pe/fantai Il.2.122, 16.207, Pi.P.5.115, A.Ag.374(lyr.); pe/fa^tai in B.9.52, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.28.19 belongs either to fai/nw in sense A. 1.5, or to fhmi/; inf. pefa/nqai Pl.Euthd.294a, etc.; part. pefasme/nos Il.14.127, Thgn.227, A.Pr. 843, S.OC1122, Pl.Phdr.245e, etc.; 3pl. plpf. e)pe/fanto Hes.Sc. 166. Act.,
bring to light, cause to appear, in physical sense, te/ras tini\ f.
make a sign
appear to one, Il.2.324, cf. Od.3.173, etc.; sh/mata fai/nwn Il.2.353; ge/nusi f. o)pw/ran Pi.N.5.6; du/o morfa\s f. A.Fr.304.5; to\n au)xe/na Hdt.2.132; e)/fhn' a)/fanton fw=s, i.e. fire, S.Ph.297; lampa/das Ar.Ra.1524 (anap.); f. qhsauro/n E.El.565; f. mhrou/s, e)pigouni/da,
show by baring, i.e.
uncover . . , Od.18.67,74; fai/noisa pro/swpon a)la/qeia Pi.N.5.17;
reflect an image in water, ta\ de/ nin kala\ ku/mata fai/nei Theoc.6.11:—Med., ta\ to/ca . . toi=sin *)argei/oisi fh/nasqai qe/lei
exhibit them
as his own, S.Ph.944.
make known, reveal, disclose, e)s to\ fw=s fanei= kaka/ Id.OT1229; kakw=n e)/klusin E.IT898 (lyr., prob.); to\n miaro\n tw=| xro/nw| a)podo/ntes fh=nai Antipho 4.4.11; o(do/n tini Od.12.334; ta\ o)nei/rata kai\ to\n po/ron X.An.4.3.13, cf. Cyr.6.4.13, S.OT725; toi=s polemi/ois su/nqhma Din.3.10, etc.; fanei= . . kwku/mata wailings
will show forth [the truth of what I say], S.Ant.1078: with a predic. added, h(ma=s su\ deilou\s fanei=s wilt
make us
appear . . , Id.Aj. 1362; to\n *aai/+ou fo/non fanei= dikai/ws o)rqo/n Id.OT853. go/non *(ele/nh| f.
show her a child, i. e.
grant her to bear one, Od.4.12; f. para/koiti/n tini
show (i.e.
give) one a wife, 15.26. of sound,
make it
clear to the ear,
make it
ring clear, a)oidh\n fai/nein 8.499; sa/lpigc . . u(pe/rtonon gh/ruma faine/tw stratw=| A.Eu.569.
show forth, display in action, a)reth/n Od.8.237; a)eikei/as 20.309; bi/hn Hes.Th.689; eu)maxani/an Pi.I.4(3).2; eu)/noian Hdt.3.36; u(/brin ib.127; o)rga/s A.Ch. 326 (lyr.).
set forth, expound, noh/mata Il.18.295; lo/gon Hdt.1.116; trifasi/as lo/gwn o(dou/s Id.1.95; but ta\ lampra\ . . f. e)/ph
make them
good, S.OC721.
inform against one,
denounce, fanw= se （se fanw= codd.) toi=s pruta/nesi Ar.Eq.300 (lyr.), cf. Ach.824, S.Ant.325:
denounce a thing
as contraband, Ar.Ach.542, 819, al.; fai/nein ploi=on D.58.9; ta\ fanqe/nta articles
denounced as contraband, ib. 13: abs.,
give information, o( fh/nas h)\ o( graya/menos IG12.45.3, cf. 4.24, Isoc.18.20, X.Cyr.1.2.14, Phld.Rh.2.207 S., etc. fai/nein froura/n,
call up a levy, at Sparta, X.HG3.2.23, al.; also f. qusi/an
proclaim, order a sacrifice, Philod.Scarph.112:—Pass., pe/fatai qnatoi=si ni/kas u(/steron eu)frosu/na has been
ordained, B.9.52. abs.,
give light, shine, fai/nontes nu/ktas . . daitumo/nessi Od.7.102, cf. 19.25; of the sun, moon, etc., f. tini/ Ar.Nu.586 (troch.); ei)s a(/panta f. to\n ou)rano/n Pl.Ti.39b; a)lla/, sela/na, fai=ne kalo/n Theoc.2.11; oi( lu/xnoi f. h(=tton Thphr.Ign.11; cf. fa/w: so h)=ri me\n fai/nonti in spring
when it shines forth, A.Fr.304.4 codd. (leg. fane/nti); of the Dioscuri
shining in mid-air, E.El.1234 (anap.): metaph., a)ganh\ fai/nous' e)lpi/s soft
shining hope, A.Ag.101 (anap., dub.). *fai/nwn, ontos, o(, the planet
Saturn, Arist.Mu.392a23, Cic.ND2.20.52, etc.; *f. o( tou= *(hli/ou Eudox.Ars5.19; acc. -wna Placit.2.15.4. Ep. iter. fa/neske
appeared, meta\ prw/toisi fa/neske Il.11.64; u(pe/nerqe de\ gai=a fa/neske Od. 12.242, cf. 11.587, Hes.Fr.14.3. pf. 2 pe/fhna is also used intr., S.OC328, etc.; less freq. in Prose, Hdt.9.120, D.3.22, Plb.9.13.8. Pass.,
come to light, appear, fa/nen de/ oi( eu)re/es w)=moi, being stripped bare, Od.18.68, cf. Il.22.324, Od.19.39: freq. of fire,
shine brightly, pura\ fai/neto *)ilio/qi pro/ Il.8.561; e(/kaqen de/ te fai/netai au)gh/ 2.456; deinw\ de/ oi( o)/sse fa/anqen
shone like fire, Il.1.200: freq. of the
rising of heavenly bodies, a)/stra faeinh\n a)mfi\ selh/nhn fai/net' a)riprepe/a 8.556, cf. Hes.Op.598; of the first
gleam of daybreak, h)=mos d' h)rige/neia fa/nh r(ododa/ktulos *)hw/s Il.1.477, Od.2.1, al.; a(/m' h)oi= fainome/nhfi at
break of day, Il.9.618, cf. Od.4.407, al.; a)kti\s a)eli/ou, to\ka/lliston . . fane\n . . tw=n prote/rwn fa/os, e)fa/nqhs pot' S.Ant.100(lyr.): of a
rising wind, ou)de/ pot' ou)=roi pnei/ontes fai/nonq' a(liae/es Od.4.361; of a vapour, e)k nefe/wn e)rebennh\ f. a)h/r Il.5.864. of persons, oi)/w| fainome/nh
appearing to him alone, Il.1.198, cf. Od.15.517, etc.; e)fa/nh li\s ei)s o(do/n Il.15.275; ou(=per ka)fa/nhs where
thou didst first appear, S.OC77; xro/nios fanei/s Id.Ph.1446 (anap.); o(do/n fanh=nai a pregnant expression for e)lqei=n o(do\n w(/ste fanh=nai, Id.El.1274 (lyr.); ke/leuqon fanei/s Aj.878 (lyr.); po/qen fai/nh|; whence
come you? Pl.Prt.309a, X.Mem.2.8.1; ou)damou= f.
is nowhere
to be seen, Id.An.1.10.16.
come into being, fanei\s du/sthnos
born to misery, S.OC974, cf. 1225 (lyr.);
become, e)k basile/ws i)diw/thn fanh=nai X.An.7.7.28; duoi=n e)fa/nh trih/rarxos D.18.104;
to be made out, dou=los lo/goisin . . fanei/s S.Aj.1020, cf. 1241. of events,
come about, te/los ou)/ pw/ ti pe/fantai Il.2.122; fa/nh bio/toio teleuth/ 7.104; e)/rgon, a)/eqlon, etc., 16.207, Od.21.106, etc.; to\ fanqe/n S.Tr.743; of sayings,
to be set forth, lo/gos a)rxai=os fanei/s ib.1, cf. OT474 (lyr.), 848.
appear to be so and so, c. inf., dmw|a/wn h(/ ti/s toi a)ri/sth fai/netai ei)=nai Od.15.25, cf. 11.336; ou) ga/r sfin e)fai/neto ke/rdion ei)=nai 14.355; tou=to/ moi qeio/taton fai/netai gene/sqai Hdt.7.137; eu)= su\ le/gein fai/nei Ar.Nu.403 (anap.), cf. A.Pr.319, etc.: freq. with inf. omitted,
ou(= kai\ pro/sqen a)ri/sth fai/neto boulh/ Il.9.94, cf. 2.5; o(/s tis fai/nhtai a)/ristos Od.14.106; smerdale/os au)th=|si fa/nh 6.137; e(/rmaion a)\n e)fa/nh Pl.R.368d, etc.: but in Hdt., etc., also c. part.,
to be manifest: thus, e)moi\ su\ ploute/ein me/ga fai/neai you
appear to me to be very rich, Hdt.1.32; but eu)/noos e)fai/neto e)w/n he was
manifestly well-inclined, Id.7.173, cf. 175, Th.1.2; ou)k a)/kaira fai/netai le/gein he
appears to be speaking . . , A.Pr.1036; but fane/ontai le/gontes ou)de/n it
will be manifest that they talk nonsense, Hdt.3.35; fai/nomai du/o kaqora=n ei)/dh Pl.Sph.235d; but ou)k a)\n fanei=men ph/mat' e)/rcantes A.Pers.786; plagkto\s ou)=s' e)faino/mhn Id.Ag.593, cf. Hdt.9.89, E.Andr.343; e)fa/nhsan peponqo/tes Pl.Ap.22c: with part. omitted, pe/fantai a(rmathla/tas sofo/s (sc. w)/n) Pi.P.5.115, cf. N.6.14; krathqei\s h(merw/teros fanei= A.Ag.1632; *ka=res e)fa/nhsan (sc. o)/ntes)
they were seen to be Carians, Th.1.8; ti/ fai/nomai (sc. w)/n） dh=t'; what
do I look like? E.Ba.925; w(s a)gaqoi\ . . e)fa/nhsan Pl.R.408a: hence fai/nesqai, opp. ei)=nai, ei)=nai me\n o(/sper ei)mi/, fai/nesqai de\ mh/ E.Fr.698 (ap.Ar.Ach.441); strathgo\s a)gaqo\s mh\ w)\n fai/nesqai X.Mem.1.7.3; o)li/goi kai\ o)/ntes kai\ faino/menoi Id.HG6.5.28. in Philosophy, fai/nomai (abs.) is sts. used of what
appears to the senses, fai/netai d' ou)de\n
is observed, Arist. Ph.204b35, cf. Cael.312b30; f. kata\ th\n ai)/sqhsin Id.GA716a31: sts. of what
is mentally
manifest, Id.EN1175a29;
to be evident, Id.APr.24b24: esp.
appear to the imagination (cf. fantasi/a 2), Pl.Sph. 264b; f. kai\ mu/ousin o(ra/mata Arist.de An.428a16; f. de/ ti . . oi(=on ta\ e)n toi=s u(/pnois ib.a7: distd. from ai)sqa/nesqai and doca/zein, ib.b1: esp. in part. faino/menos, h, on:
appearing in sense experience, ta\ f. kata\ th\n ai)/sqhsin Id.Cael.303a22, al.; ei)/te ta\ dokou=nta pa/nta e)sti\n a)lhqh= kai\ ta\ f. Id.Metaph.1009a8, cf. de An.404a29 (sg.); ta\ f.
sense-data, Id.PA639b8, Epicur.Ep.1pp.9,10 U., al.: Astron., ta\ f. = celestial
phenomena, title of a work by Eudoxus, versified by Aratus, Hipparch. 1.1.8, cf. Arist. Cael.293b27; pro/s tinas do/cas au(tw=n ta\ f. prose/lkontes ib.293a26: generally, to\ mh\ e)k fainome/nwn to\ blepo/menon gegone/nai Ep.Heb.11.3. mentally
apparent, opp. o)/nta th=| a)lhqei/a|, Pl.R.596e, cf. Arist.Top.100b24, EN1113a24; ta\ ou)=n e)moi\ faino/mena ou(/tw fai/netai Pl.R.517b; [nou=s] tw=n f. qeio/taton Arist. Metaph.1074b16; to\ f. ei)pei=n to express one's
opinion, Plu.2.158c: hence,
specious, fallacious, f. e)nqumh/mata, opp. o)/nta, Arist.Rh.1402a28. ta\ f.
what is to be seen, show, Lib.Or.30.28. freq. in answers in Plato's dialogue, fai/netai,
yes, Prt.332e, R.333c, al.; w(/s ge/ moi f. Prt.324d, cf. R.383a, al.: [tou=to] fh\|s ei)=nai; Answ. fai/nomai (sc. le/gein) X.Mem.4.2.20. later impers. c. dat. pers. et inf.,
it seems good, e)a/n soi fai/nhtai Wilcken Chr.304.11 (iii B.C.), cf. PCair.Zen.44.7,16 (iii B.C.), etc.; o(po/te au)tw=| fanei/h stratia\n e)ca/gein D.H.2.14, cf. 4.85. joined with doke/w, ei) dh\ kako/s te f. dokw= te/ soi E.Hipp.1071; dokoi=men a)\n . . xei/rous fai/nesqai Th.1.122, cf. Pl.Phdr.269d, Erx.399c, X.Mem.2.1.22. ou)damou= fai/nesqai 'to be nowhere', metaph. from racing, Pl.Phd. 72c, cf. Grg.456b, D.18.310. ta\ fanqe/nta, v. supr. A. 1.4.
fai/nwn, o(, v. foreg. A 11. b.
fainw=pis, idos, h(, pecul. fem. of fai=noy, Man.4.177.

faio/s, a/, o/n,
grey, of any colour mixed of black and white, Pl.Ti. 68c, cf. Arist.Cat.12a18, Top.106b6, al.: opp. to both me/las and leuko/s, in a negative sense, Pl.R.585a; f. a)/rtoi, opp. to leukoi/, Alex.120; to\ canqo\n h)\ f. Jul.Or.4.138d; of mourning, f. i(ma/tia Plb.30.4.5; a)poqe/sqai ta\ f. Id.15.25.11; f. e)sqh/s SIG1219.5 (Gambreion, iii B.C.)), D.H.5.17, D.C.49.12, al.; i)w/dhs kai\ f. xolh/ （kalou=si d' au)th\n i)satw/dh) Gal.15.35;
dark-complexioned, P.Strassb.79.2 (i B.C.). of sound,
harsh, Arist.Top.106b7, Aud.802a2, Poll.2.117, S.E.M.6.41. faia/, h(, name of a plaster, Androm. ap. Gal.13.906, etc. (Cf. Lith.
gaĩsas 'reflected light of a blazing fire'.)

faiouro/s, o/n,(ou)ra/)
sable-tailed, Lyc.334.

faioxi/twn [i^], wnos, o(, h(,
dark-robed, A.Ch.1049 (where the second syll. is apparently long metri causa).
fairi/ddw, Lacon. or Boeot. for sfairi/zw, and fairwth/r for sfairwth/r, Hsch.
fakari/s, i/dos, h(, prob. an error for fala_ri/s, Gloss.
fa^ka=s, a=, o(, (fako/s 11.2) a nickname of Dioscorides, Suid. s.v. *dioskouri/dhs.
fake/a, h(, v. fakh=.

fa^keinopw/lion (i.e. faki^no-), to/,
shop where lentil soup is sold, BGU9i8 (iii A. D.).

fa/kelos [a^], o(,
bundle, faggot, fruga/nwn, r(a/bdwn, Hdt.4.62,67; cu/lwn E.Cyc.242; dona/kwn Opp.H.4.419 (sfake/lous codd.); u(/lhs Th.2.77; oi( f. tw=n r(a/bdwn, = Lat.
fasces, D.C.53.1; also written fa/kellos Arist.Metaph.1016a1 (but fa/kelos codd. EJ and Alex.Aphr. and so all codd. in 1042b17), Aen.Tact.33.1, D.H.7.11, J.AJ5.7.4 (v.l. fake/lous), Polyaen.7.6.9, but the form fa/kelos is corroborated by Phld.Rh.1.74 S., Edict.Diocl.32.26, and required by the metre in E. and Opp. ll.cc.; distd. from sfa/kelos by Ptol.Asc.p.406 H.; cf. kompofakelorrh/mwn. = fakio/lion, Phot., Suid.

fakeyo/s, o(,
one who boils lentil soup, PPetr. cited in PHib.1.112.77 note (iii B.C.), PPar.67.16 (Ptol.), PBouriant 13.1 (i A. D.), PLond. 3.944.2 (iii A. D.).

fa^kh=, h=s, h(, contr. for fake/a, a form found in Epich.33, ridiculed by Euphro 3:—
dish of lentils (fakoi/),
lentil-soup, Ar.Eq.1007, V.811, al., Diocl.Fr.141, PHib.1.112.77 (iii B. C.), etc.; in parodies of Trag.Adesp.89,92 ap.Ath.4.156f: prov. tou)pi\ th=| f. mu/ron 'pearls before swine', Sopat.14, Clearch.53, Cic.Att.1.19.2; title of Menippean satire by Varro; o(/tan fakh=n e(/yhte mh\ 'pixei=n mu/ron Stratt.45.

fa/khlos [a^], o(,
the middle finger, PLond.1821.297.
fa^khyo/s, o(, = fakeyo/s, PSI4.402 (iii B. C.).

fa^kia/lion [a_l], to/, (Lat.
faciale) face-cloth, turban, towel, Dura4100 (iii A. D.), PTeb.406.18 (iii A. D.), Edict.Diocl.26.99, 114, 29.38, Lyd. Mag.1.32; also written faino-a/rion, to/, POxy.114.7 (ii/iii A. D.), etc., and pakia/lion, fakio/lion (qq.v.).

fa^ki^na=s, a=, o(,
lentil-seller, BGU9iv20, 1087 ii13, v15 (iii A. D.).
fa^ki^nopw/lion, v. fakeinopw/lion.

fa/ki^nos [a^], h, on,
made of lentils, a)/rtos Sopat. 1; fa/kinon dei= poiei=n i.e. of the consistency of fakh=, Zos.Alch.p.172 B.
fa^kio/lion, to/, = fakia/lion, Sch.Ar.Pl.729; written fakiw/lion Stud.Pal.20.245.23 (vi A. D.).
fa^ki/olos, f.l. for fa/kelos D.H.10.16.

fa/kion [a^], to/,
decoction of lentils, used as an emetic, Hp.Morb.2.43.

fa^ko-eidh/s, e/s,
lentiform, Arist.Cael.287a20, Str.17.1.34, Dsc.4.139, Gal.10.448; esp. f. xitw/n, of the capsule of the lens of the eye, Ruf.Onom.153. fakoeide/s, to/, = e)/mpetron Dsc.4.179.

fa^ko/-meli, itos, to/, a
compound of lentils and honey, as a desiccative application, Paul.Aeg.6.22 (v.l. fabo/meli).

fa^ko-pti^sa/nh [sa^], h(,
a decoction of lentils and barley, Gal.6.527,540.

fa^ko-pw/lion, to/,
lentil-shop, PTeb. 402.38 (ii A. D.).

fa^ko/s, o( ( fako/n, to/, Pap. in Philol.80.340 (s. v.l.)),
lentil, Ervum Lens, and
its fruit, Solon 38.3, Hdt.4.17, IG12.334.7, Thphr.HP8.1.4, Diocl.Fr.117, etc.; fako\n e(/yein Theoc.10.54; e(/yhma fakou= LXX Ge.25.34; a)fe/yhma fakou= Sor. 1.121. pl. = fakh=,
lentil-soup, Pherecr.67.3, Amphis40, Gal.6.770, Vict.Att.7. f. o( e)pi\ tw=n telma/twn,
duckweed, Lemna minor, Dsc.1.12, 4.87.
anything shaped like lentils:
hot-water bottle, POxy.1088.46 (i A. D.); f. o)stra/kinos Hp.Nat.Mul.34; puri/h fakw=n tw=n keramh/wn Aret.CA2.5; f. tou= e)lai/ou
oil-flask, LXX 1 Ki.10.1; tou= u(/datos ib.26.11.
spot on the body,
mole, birthmark, PPetr.3p.2, al. (iii B. C.), Dsc.1.13, 5.118, Plu.2.563a, 800e, Gal.11.845, etc.
ornament on beds, Theodor.Hierap. ap. Ath.10.413b. (Cf. Albanian
baqe 'Vicia Faba'.)

fa/k-oyis [a^], ews, o(, h(,
with moles or
freckles on the face, Gloss.

fa^kousia^ko/s, h/, o/n,
from *fakou=ssai (later *fakou=sai) in Egypt, a)fro/s Aglaïas 20 (i.e. ni/tron, which was called fakou/sion acc. to Sch. l.c.).
faktona/rion, to/, perh. = *paktwna/rion, Dim. of pa/ktwn, PLond.5.1904.6 (v/vi A. D.).

fa^k-w/dhs, es,
lentil-coloured, Hp.Epid.3.14; of the kidneys, Ruf. Anat.51.
freckled, Diocl.Fr.179.

fa^/k-wsis, ews, h(,
a being freckled, Heph.Astr.1.1 (pl.).
discoloration of the white of the eye, Gal.14.768.

fa^lagg-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
commander of a falaggarxi/a 1, Arr.Tact. 10.6, Ascl. Tact.2.10, Ael.Tact.9.8.
commander of a falaggarxi/a 11, Ascl.Tact.9, Ael.Tact.23.

fa^lagg-arxi/a, h(,
corps of 4096
men, Ascl.Tact.2.10, Ael.Tact.9.8, Arr.Tact.10.6.
contingent of 64
elephants, Ascl.Tact.9 (cf. Ael.Tact.23).

fa^lagg-hdo/n, Adv.
in phalanxes, Il.15.360, Plb.3.115.12, Polyaen.7.44.2, Onos.21.6.

fa^lagg-ia/w,
to be venomous, prob. l. in Hsch. for falaggw=sa.

fa^laggio/dhktos, on,
bitten by a venomous spider, Dsc.4.52, 115, Gal.14.180.

fa^la/ggion, to/, (fa/lagc v) a kind of
venomous spider, esp. Lathrodectus or
malmignatte, Pl.Euthd.290a, X.Mem.1.3.12, Thphr.HP8.10.1, Diocl.Fr.145; distd. from a)ra/xnion, Arist.HA622b28, cf. 555b12.
spider-wort, Lloydia graeca, a herb, said to cure this spider's bite, Dsc.3.108.
log or
roller put under a ship, Hsch., Eust.140.9, 469.20: written fa^lagg-ei=on, EM786.45.

fa^laggio/plhktos, on,
stung by a venomous spider, Gal.13.66.

fa^lagg-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
soldier in a phalanx, Plb.4.12.12, D.S.18.2, D.H.4.18. = fala/ggion 11, Gal.12.150:—also fem. fa^lagg-i=tis, idos, h(, Dsc.3.108.

fa^lagg-i_ti^ko/s, h/, o/n,
armed like the phalanx, spei=ra Plb.18.28.10.

fa^laggo-ma^xe/w,
fight in a phalanx; generally,
fight in the ranks, opp. i(ppom-, purgom-, X.Cyr.6.4.18, cf. D.S.19.30.

fa^lagg-o/w, (fa/lagc 11.2)
furnish with rollers, Polyaen.5.2.6: ta\s prosagwga\s toi=s mhxanh/masi Ph.Bel.98.5.

fa^la/gg-wma, atos, to\,
roller, Phryn.PSp.124 B.
a Dionysiac procession, Hsch.

fa^la/gg-wsis, ews, h(, an eye-disease,
relaxation or
fall of the eyelid, Sever. ap. Aët. 7.68, Paul.Aeg.6.8. = distixi/a
or tristixi/a
of the eyelashes, Ps.-Gal.14.767,771.

fa^lagkth/rion, to/,
block of wood, SIG57.33 (Milet., v B. C.).

fa/lagc [fa^], aggos, h(, (v. sub fin.)
line of battle, battle-array, Hom. only in Il., once in sg., *trw/wn r(h=ce fa/lagga Il.6.6: elsewh. pl.
the ranks of an army in battle, *danaoi\ r(h/canto fa/laggas 11.90; fa/lagges a)ndrw=n 19.158, Hes. Th.935; tw=n ka/tw *dio\s fala/ggwn S.Ichn. (lyr.) in PTeb. 692 iii 10.
heavy infantry (o(pli=tai)
in battle-order, X.An.1.8.17, al.; h( f. tw=n o(plitw=n ib.6.5.27, cf. D.9.49; opp. peltastai/, X.An.6.5.25; opp. i(ppei=s, Id.Cyr.6.3.2, Ages.2.9; tou\s i(ppei=s pro\ th=s f. e)/sthsan D.S.20.10, cf. Plu.Crass.23; but oi( *(/ellhnes i(ppei=s w(/sper f. e)pi\ tetta/rwn paratetagme/noi X.HG3.4.13: esp.
line of battle, opp. ke/ras (column in marching order), e)pi\ fa/laggos a)/gein, opp. kata\ ke/ras or e)pi\ ke/rws a)/gein, Id.Cyr.1.6.43; of ships, Id.HG6.2.30; e)k ke/ratos ei)s f.
katasth=sai to form from column into
line, Id.Cyr.8.5.15; par' a)spi/da paragago/ntas th\n e)nwmoti/an e)pi\ fa/laggos Id.An.4.3.26; e)pi\ fa/laggos kaqi/stasqai Id.Cyr.6.3.21, cf. An.6.5.7,25.
main body, centre, opp. the wings (ke/rata), Id.Cyr.7.1.6, al.
camp, ei)/sw, e)/cw fa/laggos, Id.Ages.2.15. Lac.12.3, cf. Eq.8.12. esp. of the Macedonian
phalanx, Plb.18.29sqq., etc. in writers on Tactics:
corps of 16384 o(pli=tai, Ascl.Tact.2.7, Ael.Tact.8.3.
corps of 8192 yiloi/ ( = e)pi/tagma, q.v.) Ascl.Tact.2.7, Arr. Tact.14.2.
contingent of 64
chariots ( = two ke/rata), Ascl. Tact.8, Ael.Tact.22.2.
contingent of 64
elephants, ib.23. metaph., lopa/dwn paratetagme/nh f. Diph.44.3; of a
band of pupils, Lib.Ep.145.1; of a governor's
staff (Lat.
officium), Id.Or.46.11.
round piece of wood, trunk, log, fa/lagges e)be/nou Hdt.3.97; e)k koti/noio f. A.R.2.843; f. pu/cinai IG11(2).287 B145 (Delos, iii B. C.). pl.,
rollers for moving heavy loads, A.R.1.375sq., Orph. A.270: sg., Phryn.PSp.124B.
arm of a balance, Arist.Mech. 849b36;
arm of the Danish steelyard, ib.853b25. = fa/ragc, BGU 282.18 (ii A. D.).
bone between two joints of the fingers and toes, Arist.HA493b29; pl., Ruf.Onom.84 (but
metacarpals, [Ruf.] Oss. 22).
row of eyelashes, Paul.Aeg.6.8. = fala/ggion 1, Ar. V.1509, Ra.1314 (lyr.), Pl.Com.22, X.Mem.3.11.6: masc. in Arist. HA609a5. (The orig. sense was prob.
log, cf.
OHG balcho 'beam', Lat.
sufflamen (for
sub-flag-men) 'brake'.)

falai/keion (sc. me/tron), to/, metre
used by the poet Phalaecus, Anon. Metr.Oxy.220 viii 8, Heph.10.3, etc.
fa/laina, v. fa/llaina.

fa^la/kr-a, h(,
bald bare hill, St.Byz.:—hence freq. as a placename.

fa^lakr-ia/w,
to be baldheaded, Suid. s.v. a)wro/leios.

fa^lakroeidh/s, e/s,
rather bald, D.C.76.8.

fa^lakr-o/omai, Pass.,
become bald, Hdt.3.12, Arist.HA518b26, GA783b8:—later in Act., falakrw/sousi falakrw/mata LXXEz.27.31 cod.A.

fa^lakr-o/s, a/, o/n, (falo/s, a)/kros)
baldheaded, Anacr.68, Hdt. 3.12, 4.23, Hp.Aph.6.34, Pl.R.495e, Sammelb. 4637.16 (ii B. C.), etc.; prop.
bald on the crown, Arist.HA518a27; f. th\n kefalh/n Luc.Luct. 16; pro/swpon falakro/n E.Cyc.227; oi( falakroi/ Ar.Nu.540 (lyr.), Pax767 (lyr.), etc.: prov. of labour in vain, falakrw=| kte/nas danei/zein Plu. Prov.26; falakro\n ti/llein Suid.
like a bald head, blunt, knobbed, f. sidh/ria of cauterizing irons, Hp.Art.11; stroggu/lwsis ib.61; falakro/teros (v.l. -w/teros） eu)di/as Sophr.108.
bald spot, e)/xein falakro/n tina Anon.Incred.17. o( f. name of a fallacy, D.L.2.108. [fa^la^kro/s E.l.c., Ar.Nu.540.]

fa^lakr-o/ths, htos, h(,
baldness on the crown, opp. a)nafalanti/asis (in front), Arist. HA518a28.
smoothness, f. kefalh=s of a bone, Hp. Mochl.41.

fa^la/kr-wma, atos, to/,
bald head, used for
a bald man, Cic. Att.14.2.3.
bald place, LXX Le.13.42, al.: pl., ib.Ez.27.31 cod. A.

fa^la/kr-wsis, ews, h(,
a becoming bald, baldness, Plu.2.652f(pl.), 919c, Aq., Sm.Mi.1.16, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.2, Sor. ap. Gal.12.420 (pl.).
falakto/noio: ei)=dos i(e/rakos, Hsch.; cf. fabokto/nos.
fala/messin, written for pala/maisin in MAMA1.382 (Phrygia, iv/v A. D).
fala/nqeios, o(, epith. of Hermes, IG22.4855.

fa/lanqos [fa^], on,
bald in front, bre/gma AP9.317, cf. D.L.7.160, Phryn.PSp.124 B. cod.; neut. fa/lanqon, to/,
bald patch, ou)lh\ fala/nqw| deciw=| PStrassb.81.29 (ii B.C.).

fa^lant-i/as, ou, o(,
bald man, Luc.Philops.18.

fa^la/nt-wma, atos, to/,
bald place, v. l. in LXX Le.13.43.

fa^la_ri/s, Ion. falhri/s, i/dos, h(:—
coot, Fulica atra, so called from its
bald white head, Ar.Ach.875, Av.565 (anap., in Ion. form), Arist. HA593b16 (v.l. falhri/s), Fr.350, Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath.9.395e; falhri/des tarixhrai/ Cleomenesap.eund.9.393c.
canary grass, Phalaris nodosa, Dsc.3.142 (both forms in codd.);
phaleri (sic), Plin. HN27.126.

fa^la^rismo/s, o(,
tyranny, like that of Phalaris, Cic.Att.7.12.2.

fa^la^ri=tis, idos, h(,
furnished with fa/lara, name of Athena, Call. Fr.503.

fa/la^ron [fa^], to/, (fa/los)
boss or
disc, mostly in pl., once in Hom., ba/lleto d' ai)ei\ ka\p fa/lar' eu)poi/hq', of metal
bosses on a helmet, Il. 16.106; basilei/ou tia/ras fa/laron pifau/skwn A.Pers.662(lyr.). pl.,
cheek-pieces of a horse's head-stall (expld. by paragnaqi/des Hsch., ta\ tw=n gna/qwn skepa/smata Phot.), Hdt.1.215, E.Supp.586, X.HG 4.1.39, Ptol.Euerg.9J.; but fa/lara is a gloss in a)mpukth/ria f. pw/lwn S.OC1069 (lyr.); cf. Lat.
phalerae.
bandages for the cheek, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.44, Sor.Fasc.18. metaph.,
ornaments, Plu.2.528a, D.Chr.78.26.

fa/la_ros [fa^], a, on, (or fala_ro/s, a/, o/n Hsch.), Dor. for the Ion. fa/lhros (v. infr. 11),
having a patch of white, o( ku/wn o( fa/laros the dog
with a white spot, Theoc.8.27; o( *fa/laros, as a ram's name, Id.5.103. o)/rh xio/nessi fa/lhra hills
patched with snow, Nic.Th. 461. (Cf. falo/s, falakro/s.）

fa^lerou=xos (fa/laron, cf. Lat.
phalera), o(,
wearing fa/lara, epith. of the Sun, PMag.Berol.2.90.

fa^lhria/w,
to be patched with white, ku/mata falhrio/wnta waves
crested with white foam, Il.13.799; falhriw=san spi/lon
white with breakers, Lyc.188: f. sto/rqugc
white with foam, Id.491; li/qon leuka\ falhrio/wnta App.Anth.3.79 (Posidipp.).
fa^lh/rion, to/, = falari/s 11, Ps.-Dsc.3.142.
fa^lhri/s, v. fala_ri/s.

fa/lhron [a^], to/,
Phalerum, the western harbour of Athens, Hdt. 5.63, etc.: falhroi=
at Ph., X.Eq.Mag.3.1, Plu.Thes.17; falhro/qen
from Ph., Pl.Smp.172a; falhro/nde
to Ph., Th.1.107:— falhreu/s, e/ws, o(,
a Phalerian, Hdt.5.63, etc.; fem. falhri/s, i/dos, St.Byz.: Adj. falhriko/s, h/, o/n, Th.2.13, Ar.Ach.901, al.
fa/lhros, v. fa/la_ros.

fa^lh=s, h=tos, or fa/lhs, htos （fa/lew Hippon.14 Diehl), o(, = fallo/s, S.Ichn.145 (pl.), Ar.Lys.771 (hex.), Theoc.Ep.4.3. fa^lh=s, h=tos, o(,
Phales, *f. e(tai=re *bakxi/ou Ar.Ach.263 (lyr.): also written *fa/lhs, htos (which acc. to Sch.Ar.l.c. was the Dor. form), Sophr.39, Luc.JTr.42.
fali/zei: qe/lei, Hsch. falikro/n: a)/kraton, Id.(cf. xal-).

fa^lio/pous, o(, h(, neut. poun, gen. podos,
white-footed, Id.
falio/s, a/, o/n, = fa/laros, Call.Fr.176, PPetr.2pp.115,117 (iii B. C.), Procop.Goth.1.18.

fali/ptei: mwrai/nei, Hsch. fali/ssomai, (falo/s) Pass.,
to be white, Id. fa/lkh, h(,
bat, Id.; also = o( th=s ko/mhs au)xmo/s, Id.

fa/lkhs, ou, o(, part of a ship,
rib, acc. to Poll.1.85,86 to\ th=| stei/ra| proshlou/menon. (Cf. e)mfalko/omai.）

falki/dion, to/,
the minimum share of an estate which must be left to the heirs under the Lex Falcidia, PMasp.97v71 (vi A. D.), al.

fall-a^gwgei=on, to/,
platform or
wagon used in the fallhfo/ria, IG 11(2).144A 34, al. (Delos, iv B. C.).
fall-a^gw/gia (sc. i(era/), ta/, = fallhfo/ria, Corn.ND30.

fall-a^gwgi/a, h(,
carrying of the phallus, IG22.673b7.

fa/llaina, h(,
whale, A.Dict. in PSI11.1209.9, Arist.HA489b4, 521b24, 537a31, al., Str.3.2.7, Ael.NA9.50, 16.18, Philostr.VA2.14, Nonn.D.6.298, Babr.39.1, Gal.6.728,737, UP3.12, al., Porph.Abst. 3.20. of
any devouring monster, Ar.V.35,39, Lyc.841.
moth, Nic.Th.760 (Rhodian in this sense acc. to Sch.).—In late codd. (as those of Gal.) freq. written fa/laina; but cod.Rav. of Ar., and the best codd. of Arist., Str., Babr., Lyc., Nic., Philostr., and Nonn. (the Pap. of A.Dict. is indistinct) have fa/ll-; cf. sq.; the metre requires a long first syll. in Babr., Nic., Nonn., and admits it elsewhere; in Lat. the best spelling is
ballaena.
fa/llh, h(, = foreg. 1, Lyc.84,394. = foreg. 11, Hsch.

fallh/n, h=nos, o(, (fallo/s) a name of Dionysus, Paus.10.19.3 (kefalh=na codd., corr. Lobeck); cf. *falh=s:—Adj. fallhno/s, o/n, fallhno\n timw=si *diwnu/soio ka/rhnon Orac. ap. Eus.PE5.36 (s. v. l., falhnotimw=si cod.A, *fallh=nos timw=si Lobeck).

fallhfor-e/w,
carry a phallus in procession, Plu.2.365c.

fallhfo/r-ia, ta/,
festival of Dionysus
in which a phallus was carried in procession, ib.355e.

falliko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the fallo/s: to\ f. (sc. me/los)
the phallic song, Ar.Ach.261, Arist.Po.1449a11; restd. in IG12.187.33; also a dance, Poll.4.100.

falloba/ths [a^], ou, o(, (bai/nw)
one who mounts on a phallusshaped pillar, phallic priest, Luc.Syr.D.29.

fallo/s, o(,
membrum virile, phallus, or
a figure thereof, borne in procession in the cult of Dionysus as an emblem of the generative power in nature, IG12.45.13, Hdt.2.48,49, Ar.Ach.243, Luc. Syr.D.16.
fallofor-e/w, = fallhfore/w, Philomnest.2.

fallo/for-os (parox.), on,
bearing a phallus, Semus 20; fem. in AJA37.252 (Latium, ii A. D.).

fa^lo/s, h/, o/n,
white, Hsch. (Cf. Skt.
bhālam 'brightness, forehead', Welsh
bal 'having a white spot on the forehead', etc.)
stammering, deaf, stupid, Id. (Cf. fali/ptei and perh. Old Slav.
z[ucaron]l[ucaron] 'wicked', Skt.
hva/rate 'to be crooked', etc.)

fa/los [a^], o(,
horn of a helmet, Il.3.362, 4.459, 13.132,614, 16.216, 338; cf. a)mfi/falos, trufa/leia. (Expld. as a
boss or
ornament by Gramm., Apollon.Lex., etc.)
falu/gmata: u(gra/smata, Hsch. falu/nei: lampru/nei, Id.
fa/lura [fa^], ta/, = la/fura (q.v.), SIG56.9 (Argos, v B. C.).
falu/ssetai: katarrh/ssei, perie/rxetai, Hsch. falwqei/s (i.e. Dor. for fhl-, unless fa^l-）: paratrapei/s, Id.

fa^lwto/s, h/, o/n,
furnished with fa/loi, perikefalai=ai Eust.425.44.
fa/ma, h(, Dor. for fh/mh.

fa^mi^l-i/a, h(, = Lat.
familia, BCH14.370 (Caria), Gp.2.7.2; f. monoma/xwn Inscr.Cos 141.1, IGRom.4.1454 (Smyrna); stratiwtw=n BGU316.10 (iv A. D.).
fa^mi^l-iariko/s, h/, o/n, = sq., Edict.Diocl.26.31; also famel- ib.10, al.; famhl- MAMA3.100 (Diocaesarea).

fa^mi^l-ia/rios, o(, = Lat.
familiaris, Edict.Diocl.26.96,117, PStrassb.40.11, 24 (vi A. D.); also famel- Edict.Diocl. 26.75, al.
fa^mi^l-iari/s, i/dos, h(, = fem. of foreg., ib.28.43,53.

fa_misto/s, a/, o/n, Dor. for *fhmisto/s (which is not found),
famous, Bull.Soc.Alex.7.245 (i B. C./i A. D.).
famma/stria: ta\ yaista/, kai\ e(orth/ tis, Hsch. fa/mmh: a)/lfita, Id.
fa/n, poet. for e)/fasan, v. fhmi/.
fa/nai [a^], inf. of fhmi/; but fa=nai, inf. aor. of fai/nw.

fa^nai=os, a, on, (fanh/)
giving or
bringing light, of Zeus, E.Rh.355 (lyr.); of Apollo, in Chios, Achae.35.

fa/nac, =
lanterna, prob. an error for fano/s, Gloss.
fanao/s, v. fa/gilos.

fa_na/pths, ou, o(,
lamplighter, Stud.Pal.10.251A2 (vi A. D.), etc.
fa_na/rion, to/, Dim. of fano/s, Eust. 1571.4, Sch.Opp.H.5.430.
fa^na/w, = <fai/nein> qe/lw, Hsch.

fando/n, Adv.
openly, Hdn.Gr.1.509.
fa/ndouros, o(, = pandou/ra (q.v.), Nicom.Harm.4.

fa^nero-mi_sh/s, e/s (v.l. fa^nero/-mi_sos, on),
openly hating, opp. fanero/filos,
Arist.EN1124b26.

fa^nero-poie/w,
explain, reveal, Heph.Astr.3.37 (
Cat.Cod. Astr.5(3).85); ta\ pra/gmata Sch.Ar.Eq.1253, PLond.5.1708.70, 1729.40 (vi A. D.).

fa^nero-poi/hsis, ews, h(,
illustration, explanation, Gloss.

fa^nero/s, a/, o/n, but o/s, o/n, E.Ba.991 (lyr.): (fai/nw):—
visible, manifest, h( sth/lh e)/xei pa/nta f., i.e. all that is in it can be plainly seen, Hdt.3.24; f. o)/mmasin e)moi=s E.Ba.501; f. ti dei=cai S.Tr.608 (v.l.); qh/sw fane/r' a)qro/' Pi.O.13.98; f. poih=sai Pl.Lg.630b, etc.; e)s f. o)/yin bai/nein E.El.1236 (anap.); tou)/rgon pare/stai f. S.Ph.1291; f. xarakth\r a)reta=s E.HF658 (lyr.); f. phgai/ Th.2.15; e)sbolai\ e)s *ai)/gupton Hdt. 3.5; f. e)/xqran kth/sasqai Th.1.42; diafora\ f. e)ge/neto ib. 102; f. qa/natos, o)/leqros, opp. a)fanh/s, Antipho 3.3.7, And.1.53; f. u(poyi/a ei)s e)me\ i)ou=sa Antipho 2.2.6; f. geno/menos
if detected, Lys.7.12:— Constr.: fanero/s ei)mi c. part., a)piko/menoi faneroi/ ei)si they are
known to have come, Hdt.3.26; e)pispeu/dwn fanero\s h)=n Id.7.18; o( me/n e)sti f. e)kba\s e)k tou= ploi/ou kai\ ou)k ei)sba\s pa/lin Antipho 5.23: folld. by Conj., faneroi\ gigno/menoi o(/ti poiou=sin X.Cyr.2.2.12; f. h)=n o(/pws e)gi/gnwsken Id.Mem.1.1.17: impers., fanero/n [e)stin] o(/ti . . ib.3.9.2; ei) fanero\n gi/gnoito o(/ti . . Pl.Phd.70d.
shining, illustrious, proedri/h Xenoph.2.7; o(do/s Pi.O.6.73;
conspicuous, remarkable, f. mhde\n katerga/zesqai Th.1.17. f. ou)si/a
real property, opp. personalty (a)fanh/s), Lys.32.4, Fr.79, D.50.8. property
in possession (opp.
in action), And.1.118, Is.6.30, D.38.7.
in hand, in cash, mhde\n fanero\n kekth=sqai to have no
cash in hand, Din.1.70; labw\n a)rgu/rion f. kai\ o(mologou/menon D.56.1; po/ros f. Id.14.24; f. ou)si/a Id.27.57; f. xrh/mata Lys.12.83; f. poiei=n D.28.4; fanero/n ti
a certain sum of money, Sch.Ar.Pl.330, Sch.Aeschin.1.102. of votes, f. yh/fw| by
open vote, opp. kru/bdhn (ballot), D.43.82, cf. Arist.Ath.68.2; yh=fon f. dienegkei=n Th.4.74; th\n yh=fon f. fe/rein Pl.Lg.767d; f. h( yh=fos tiqeme/nh ib.855d. Adv. -rw=s
openly, manifestly, boulo/menos f. Hdt.9.71; stei/xein A.Pr.1090 (anap.); oi)/xesqai S.El.833 (lyr.); a)kou=sai Ar.Nu.291 (anap.); a)podei/knusqai th\n gnw/mhn Th.1.87; f. e)ra=n, opp. la/qra|, Pl.Smp.182d; to\ f. e)cei=nai Isoc.2.3: Comp., fanerw/teron e)kpolemei=n Th.6.91; -te/rws Arist.PA 657a2: but, to\ f. freq. with Preps. in advb. sense, e)k tou= f.
openly, Hdt.5.96, 8.126; pole/mios ou)k w)\n e)k tou= f. not
openly declared, Th.4.79; e)k tou= f. th\n ma/xhn poiei=sqai X.HG6.5.16; e)k tou= f. a)pofeu/gein Id.Mem.3.11.8; a)po\ tou= f. D.H.4.4; also e)n tw=| f. sauto\n parei=xes X.Cyr.7.5.55; a)kou=sai e)n tw=| f. Id.An.1.3.21; bouleu/esqai D.18.235 (rarely e)n f. X.Ages.5.7); e)s to\ f. a)podu=nai Th.1.6; ai( e)s to\ f. lego/menai ai)ti/ai, Id.1.23; to\n si=ton fe/rein e)s to\ f. into
public, Id.3.27, cf. Pl.Grg.480c, etc.; ei)pei=n kata\ to\ f. Ar.Th.525(lyr.); e)pi\ faneroi=s cunelqei=n on
public, acknowledged terms, Th.1.69. of persons,
manifest, conspicuous, ei) [*dio/nusos kai\ *pa\n] f. e)ge/nonto e)n th=| *(ella/di Hdt.2.146; fanera\ . . h)=lqe ko/ra S.OT507 (lyr.); *ku/pris . . fanera\ tw=nd e)fa/nh pra/ktwr Id.Tr.861 (lyr.); pa/ntwn -w/tatos *brasi/das e)ge/neto Th.4.11, cf. X.Cyr.7.5.58; oi( -w/teroi
persons of distinction, Philostr.VA2.20.
open, frank, opp. e)pi/boulos, Arist.EN1149b15. = tis, f. xre/a
certain debts, Mitteis Chr.71.3 (v A. D.), cf. PMasp.167.10, 194.5 (vi A. D.), etc.

fa^nero/ths, htos, h(,
display, show, Ph. ap. Eus.PE8.14.

fa^nero/fi^los, on,
open friend, opp. faneromish/s, Arist.EN1124b27.

fa^ner-o/w,
make manifest, seauto\n tw=| ko/smw| Ev.Jo.7.4, cf. 2.11, 2 Ep.Cor.5.10 (Pass.);
reveal, make clear, tini\ th\n a)lh/qeian POxy.925.4 (v A. D.); a)lhqh= pefane/rwtai
have been demonstrated, Olymp. Alch.p.88 B.
make known or
famous, D.H.10.37:—Pass.,
become so, e)fanerw/qh e)s tou\s *(/ellhnas dapa/nh|si megi/sth|si Hdt.6.122.

fa^ne/r-wsis, ews, h(, = shmasi/a 1, Hsch. (f. dia\ sa/lpiggos Phot., Suid.).
disclosure, h( a)po\ tou= oi)/nou f. tou= logismou= Anon.Incred. 17.
manifestation, tou= pneu/matos 1 Ep.Cor.12.7, cf. 2 Ep.Cor. 4.2. Astron.,
becoming visible, Jul.Laod. (?) in Cat.Cod.Astr.5(1).189(pl.).

fa^ner-wth/s, ou=, o(,
one who makes manifest, tw=n a)pokekrumme/nwn PMag.Leid.V.7.12 (pl.).

fa^nh/, h(,
torch, Hes.Fr.47. fanai/, ai(,
torch-processions, such as took place in the cult of Dionysus, E.Ion550 (troch.); musthri/wn te tw=n a)porrh/twn fana\s e)/deicen *)orfeu/s Id.Rh.943.
fa^nh/h|, Ep. for fanh=|: fanh/menai, Ep. for fanh=nai; v. fai/nw.
fa/nhs [a^], htos, o(, a divinity in the Orphic system, representing the first principle of life, *fa/nhta . . , prw=tos ga\r e)fa/nqh Orph.A.15.

fa^nhti-asmo/s, o(,
love of show and ostentation, Eust.894.8, 904.62.

fa_ni/on, to/, Dim. of fano/s, AP12.82,83 (Mel.). name of several
eye-salves, Gal.12.755. fani/on (or *fa/nion), name of a courtesan, Men. ap. Ath.13.567c.
fa^noi/hn, fa/noisqe, fut. opt. Act. and Med. of fai/nw.
fano/mhris, idos, h(, = fainomhri/s, Poll.2.187.

fa^no/pths, ou, o(,
opening for light, window, Sch.Lyc.98. gloss on cunoiki/a, Sch.Ar.Eq.997.

fa_no/s, h/, o/n, (contr. fr. faeino/s)
light, bright, Parm.8.41, Phryn. Com.93; a(/ma fanota/tw| tini\ puri/ Pl.Phlb.16c; i(/na w(s fano/taton h)=| to\ e)/sw X.Cyn.10.7; to\ f.
brightness, light, ib.5.18; stre/fein pro\s to\ f. e)k tou= skotw/dous Pl.R.518c, cf. 478c (Comp.); fana/ te kai\ kala/ ib.506d, cf. Phld.Po.2.45; fano/tatos a)h/r Gal.18(2).285; toi=s fanota/tois qew=n *(hli/w| kai\ *selh/nh| Hld.10.4. of garments,
washed clean, xlai=na Ar.Ach.845 (lyr.); sisu/ra Id.Ec.347.
bright, joyous, fanai=s e)n eu)frosu/nais A.Pr.538 (lyr.); f. bi/on dia/gein Pl.Phdr. 256d.
conspicuous, e)llo/gimos kai\ f. Id.Smp.197a. Adv. -nw=s
clearly: Comp. fano/teron Jul.Or.4.145b; Sup. fano/tata, Luc. Hist.Conscr.44. *fa=nos, o( (properisp., cf. Hdn.Gr.1.175), name of a sukofa/nths, Ar.Eq.1256.

fa_no/s, o(,
torch, Ar.Lys.308; u(po\ fanou= poreu/esqai X.Lac.5.7; poi=os f. toiou=tos oi(=os o( h(/lios; Alex.87; distd. from lu/xnos, Anaxandr.48, cf. Phryn.40; but prob. = lu/xnos in UPZ5.18, 6.15 (ii B. C.), Stud.Pal.10.251.2 (vi A. D.); meta\ fanw=n kai\ lampa/dwn Ev.Jo.18.3, cf. PLond.3.1159.59 (ii A. D.): the form pa_no/s (prob. a different word) is found in A.Ag.284, S.Fr.184, E.Ion 195 (lyr.), Fr.90, Diph.6, Men.62. f. u(elou=s glass
cover, Olymp.Alch.p.75 B. a form of
still, Zos.Alch.p.224 B.

fa_no/ths, htos, h(,
brightness, clearness, Aristid.Or.43(1).24, Gal. UP10.1, Iamb.Comm.Math.34: metaph. in pl. of words, ai( f. tw=n o)noma/twn Phld.Po.2.45.
visible appearance, h( gnw=sis f. [tou= gignwskome/nou] Dam.Pr.6.

fa/nsis, ews, h(, = fa/sis (A) 11.1, Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.4, Suid. s.v. e)pitolh=s.
morning twilight, Gloss.

fanta/zw, (fai/nw)
make visible, present to the eye or
mind, ti Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.18, Hsch.: but, f. th\n ai)/sqhsin,
deceive, Callistr. Stat.14:—Med., with aor. Pass.,
place before one's mind, picture an object
to oneself, imagine, ti Longin.15.2, 8, M.Ant.10.28, Porph. Sent.33, Iamb.Myst.3.20, Chor.p.16 B.; xwri/on Id.Milt.29 F.-R.; ku/na e)n u(/dati Hp.Ep. 19 (Hermes 43.68); peri/ th=s fu/sews Him.Or.14.24;
fancy, imagine, o(/ti . . Arr.Epict.1.5.6; o)/nar e)fanta/sqhn Hp.Ep.15; toi=s mhde\ fantasqei=sin w(s kalo/n . . Plot.1.6.4; c. acc. et. inf., Polem. Phgn.36, Iamb.Myst.2.10. in early writers only in Pass., fut. fantasqh/somai Pl.Smp.211a: aor. e)fanta/sqhn Id.Phlb.51a:—
become visible, appear, sfi Hdt.4.124; o)/neiron fanta/zetai/ moi Id.7.15; mhde\ fanta/zou do/mwn pa/roiqe E.Andr.876, cf. Ph.93; f. a)/llote e)n a)/llais i)de/ais Pl.R.380d; also,
to be heard, mukai\ shkoi=s e)/ni f. A.R. 4.1285; fobero\n h)=n to\ -o/menon Ep.Hebr.12.21.
to be terrified by visions or
phantasms, PMag.Lond.121.888.
make a show, Hdt.7.10. e'. fanta/zesqai/ tini
make oneself like someone,
take his
form, fantazo/menos . . gunaiki/ A.Ag.1500 (anap.).
appear so and so,
to be imagined, Pl.Hp.Ma.300c; h(donai\ fantasqei=sai Id.Phlb.51a; tw=| nohqh=nai h)\ fantasqh=nai Arist.de An.433b12. com. for sukofantei=sqai,
to be informed against, Ar.Ach.823 (Megar. fanta/ddomai).

fanta^si/-a, h(, verbal noun of fanta/zomai and (in sense) of fai/nomai,
appearing, appearance, = to\ fai/nesqai, pa/ntes e)fi/entai tou= fainome/nou a)gaqou=, th=s de\ f. ou) ku/rioi do not control the
appearing, Arist.EN 1114a32; usu. with less verbal force,
appearance, presentation to consciousness, whether immediate or in memory, whether true or illusory, fai/netai me
 o( h(/lios podiai=os, a)nti/fhsi de\ polla/kis e(/tero/n ti pro\s th
 f. Id.Insomn.460b19; h( tou= ga/laktos f. the
appearance of the milky way, Id.Mete.339a35; h( tou= prosw/pou f. Phld.Acad.Ind. p.50 M.; esp. of visual
images, e)pei\ h( o)/yis ma/lista ai)/sqhsi/s e)sti, kai\ to\ o)/noma a)po\ tou= fa/ous ei)/lhfen [h( f.] Arist. de An.429a2; katoptrikh\ f.
image reflected in a mirror, Placit.3.1.2; also of other sense=perceptions, f. kai\ ai)/sqhsis tau)to
 e)/n te qermoi=s kai\ pa=si toi=s toiou/tois
appearance is the same as perception, whether we are talking of hot things or of anything else like them, Pl.Tht.152c, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.21; tau=ta e)/sti me/n ti, a)ll' ou)x w(=n e)mpoiei= th
 f. Arist.Metaph.1024b24; h( f. e)sti
 ai)/sqhsi/s tis a)sqenh/s . . ka)
 tw=| e)lpi/zonti a)kolouqoi= a)
 f. tis ou(= e)lpi/zei Id.Rh.1370a28; ai( [ai)sqh/seis] a)lhqei=s a)ei/, ai( de\ f. gi/nontai ai( plei/ous yeudei=s Id.de An.428a12; f. a)lhqei=s a(pa/sas Epicur.Fr.254; a)pelqo/ntwn tw=n ai)sqhtw=n e)/neisin ai( ai)sqh/seis kai\ f. e)n toi=s ai)sqhthri/ois Arist. de An.425b25; dia\ to\ e)mme/nein [ta\s f.] kai\ o(moi/as ei)=nai tai=s ai)sqh/sesi ib.429a5; th=s ai)sqh/sews a)lloioume/nhs e)c h(=s gi/nesqai th
 f. Thphr.Sens.63; e)le/gxein ta\s a)llh/lwn f. kai\ do/cas Pl.Tht.161e; freq. in later Philos. esp. in meaning psychic
image, Epicur.Ep.1p.12U., S.E.M.7.152, M.Ant.4.24, al.; defined as tu/pwsis e)n yuxh=| Chrysipp.Stoic.2.23; f. katalhptikh/ Zeno Stoic. 1.17, etc.; [f. k.] h)
 krith/rion ei)=nai tw=n pragma/twn fasi/, th
 gignome/nhn a)po\ u(pa/rxontos kat' au)to\ to\ u(pa/rxon e)napesfragisme/nhn Stoic. 2.21, cf. 26, al.; dianohtikai\ f. mental
images, Cic.Fam.15.16.1; nukterinai\ f. Phlp.
in de An.486.13, cf. Gp.12.17.15;
apparition, Arist.Mir.846a37. less scientifically,
appearance, e)mpoiou=nta th
 f. (sc. tou= e)le/gxein) Id.SE165b25; to\ para/docon th=s tw=n zw/|wn f. Plb. 3.53.8, cf. 5.48.9, App.BC4.102, Hann.15; kata\ th
 prw/thn f. Plb.11.27.7; sunau/cein th
 f. [th=s ni/khs] Id.16.8.3; douleu/ontes th=| tw=n e)kto\s f. Id.30.19.4; f. poiei=n kai\ prosdoki/an Id.18.10.7, cf. 14.2.4; zw=|a . . me/xri f. faino/mena (in a conjuring trick) Cels. ap. OrigenesCels.1.68; kata\ th
 pro/xeiron ou(twsi\ f. Gal.6.105, cf. 15.17,115, 19.206; tw=n a)peptou/ntwn e)ni/ois f. . . gi/nontai Id.18(2).73, cf. 71, al.
imagination, i.e. the
re-presentation of appearances or images, primarily derived from sensation (cf. ai)/sqhsis 11), o(/tan mh\ kaq' au(to\ a)lla\ di' ai)sqh/sews parh=| tini to\ toiou=ton au)= pa/qos (sc. do/ca） a)=r' oi(=o/n te o)rqw=s ei)pei=n e(/tero/n ti plh
 f.; . . "fai/netai" de\ o(\ le/gomen (i.e. fantasi/a） su/mmeicis ai)sqh/sews kai\ do/chs Pl.Sph.264a, 264b; ou)de\ do/ca met' ai)sqh/sews ou)de\ di' ai)sqh/sews ou)de\ sumplokh\ do/chs kai\ ai)sqh/sews f. a)
 ei)/h Arist. de An. 428a26; h( f. kaq' h(
 le/gomen fa/ntasma/ ti h(mi=n gi/gnesqai ib.428a1; e)/sti de\ f. h( u(po\ th=s kat' e)ne/rgeian ai)sqh/sews ginome/nh ki/nhsis Id.Insomn.459a17, cf. de An.429a1; ei) e)/sti kai\ tou=to [to\ noei=n] f. tis h)\ mh\ a)/neu f. ib.403a8; c. gen., me/llontos kakou= Id.Rh.1382a21, cf. 1370a30, b33, al.; ai)sxrou= f. Cic.Att.9.6.5; also peri\ a)doci/as f. e)sti
 h( ai)sxu/nh Arist.Rh.1384a23; gi/gnetai e(ka/stw| f. o(/ti toiou=to/s [e)sti] ib.1371a9; h( kata\ th
 su/llhyin f. th=s gunaiko/s Placit.5.12.2, cf. Sor.1.39 (pl.); ta\ pro\s th
 f. xrw/mata colours as judged by the f.,
apparent colours, Placit.1.15.8; fwti/zesqai pro\s th
 f. ib.2.28.6. in Aristotle,
faculty of imagination, both presentative and representative, opp. ai)/sqhsis, [f.] ou)k e)/stin ai)/sqhsis Arist.de An. 428a5; opp. do/ca, because pi/stis is absent, ib.22, 24; opp. e)pisth/mh,
nou=s, dia/noia, ou)de\ [f.] tw=n a)ei\ a)lhqeuo/ntwn ou)demi/a e)/stai, oi(=on e)pisth/mh h)\ nou=s ib.428a17; f. e(/teron kai\ ai)sqh/sews kai\ dianoi/as: au)th/ te ou) gi/gnetai a)/neu ai)sqh/sews kai\ a)/neu tau/ths ou)k e)/stin u(po/lhyis ib.427b14; f. gi/netai h)\ dia\ noh/sews h)\ di' ai)sqh/sews Id.MA702a19; o)rektiko
 [to\ zw=|on] ou)k a)/neu f., f. de\ pa=sa h)\ logistikh\ h)\ ai)sqhtikh/ Id.de An.433b28.
creative imagination, f. sofwte/ra mimh/sews dhmiourgo/s Philostr.VA6.19. the
use of imagery in literature, teqoru/bhtai tai=s f. ma=llon h)\ dedei/nwtai Longin.3.1; h( r(htorikh\ f. Id.15.2; a)po\ tou= a)podeiktikou= perielko/meqa ei)s to\ kata\ fantasi/an e)kplhktiko/n Id.15.11; ai( poihtikai\ f. Plu.2.759c; e)s ta\s f. tw=n legome/nwn tw=| sxh/mati tou= sw/matos sunefe/ronto App.Pun.134, cf. Hisp.26, Syr.40.
prestige, reputation, mega/lhn e)fei/lketo f. w(s mo/nos ei)dw\s ti/ le/gei Plb.22.9.12, cf. 24.7.2, 24.11.5, Fr.233; e)k tou= tou\s a)/llous e)le/gxein f. a)pene/gkasqai proairou/menos Hipparch.1.1.6;
parade, ostentation, poie/ein mhde
 perie/rgws mhde\ meta\ fantasi/hs Hp.Decent.7, cf. Plb.15.25.22, 16.21.1, 31.26.6, Posidon.36 J., D.S.12.83, Vett.Val.38.26, al.; h( e)fh/meros th=s a)rxh=s f. Sopat. ap. Stob.4.5.55; meta\ pollh=s f. Act.Ap. 25.23, cf. D.L.4.53.

fanta^si-a/zomai,
to be presented to the mind, to\ o)\n fantasiazo/menon do/ch| Ph.1.464.

fanta^si-asth/s, ou=, o(,
one who is fond of display, cj. in Polem.Phgn.27.

fanta^si-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
receptive of impressions or
images, Epicur.Nat.Herc.1398.1, Plu.2.431b; to) f. ib. 432c. Adv. -kw=s, tou= me/llontos ib.433c.

fanta^sio-kope/w,
indulge vain fancies, LXXSi.4.30(35).

fanta^sio-ko/pos, on,
conceiving vain fancies or
hopes, EM673.46, Eust.1700.53.

fanta^sio-plh/ktws, Adv.
like one who is mad on showing off, M.Ant.1.7.

fanta^s-io/w,
bring images before the mind of, tinas S.E.M.8.406: abs., ib.397. mostly in Med.,
have or
form images or
presentations, Aristocl. ap. Eus.PE14.21, S.E.M.8.406; pefantasiwme/nos
subject to hallucinations, Ruf.Fr.79; e)/myuxon fantasiou/menon
having the faculty of presentation, opp. a)fantasi/wton, Plu.2.960d; to\ fantasiou/menon th=s yuxh=s Gal.4.445; f. h( dia/noia dia\ tw=n ai)sqh/sewn S.E.P. 2.72, cf. Stoic.2.22, al. c. acc. rei, fantasiwqei/s daimo/nio/n ti Plu.2.236d, cf. Ph.1.55, al.

fa/nta^s-is, ews, h(, = fantasi/a, fh/mh kai\ f. Pl.Ti.72b, cf. Demetr.Lac.Herc.1055.3, Plot.3.6.7, 13: pl.,
portents, teratolo/goi fanta/seis e)s a)ei\ prou)/legon Procop.Pers.2.30.

fanta^s-iw/dhs,
fantastic, ptoi=ai Philostr.VA7.14;
unreal, imaginary, Dam.Pr.7. f. u(/pnoi
troubled by dreams, Gal.1.361 (Comp.); of persons, f. toi=s o)nei/rasin ib.327.
showy, pompous, of persons, Vett.Val.39.1; do/ca ib.355.12; e)/nduma EM506.47, Suid. s.v. kesto/s. Adv. -dw=s, Eust. 1699.35.

fa/nta^s-ma, atos, to/, = fa/sma,
apparition, phantom, e)nu/pnia fanta/smata A.Th.710; nukte/rwn f. e)/xousi morfa/s Id.Fr.312; f. dai/monos Plu.Dio 2, cf. E.Hec.54,94 (anap.), 390, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.22, Ev.Matt.14.26; peri\ ta\ mnh/mata . . w)/fqh a)/tta yuxw=n skioeidh= f. Pl.Phd.81d;
vision, dream, Arist.EN 1102b10(pl.), Theoc.21.30. pl.,
phenomena, ta\ e)n a)e/ri f. Arist. Mu.395a29: pl.,
portents, D.H.4.62. = fantasi/a 1, Pl.Prt.356e, Tht.167b, Prm.166a, R.598b, Arist.de An.428a1, Epicur.Ep.2pp.37,51 U.; distd. from ei)kw/n, Pl.Sph.236c.

fanta^s-ma/tion, to/,
miserable phantom, Plu.2.766b.

fanta^s-mo/s, o(,
mental image, Epicur.Ep.1p.12U. pl., of the
vain imaginings of philosophers, Timo 45.
vision, fantasmoi\ o)nei/rwn PMag.Lond.124.25 (iv/v A. D.).

fanta^s-th/s, ou=, o(,
one who makes a parade, boaster, Polem.Phgn. 27 codd. fanta^s-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to produce the appearance of something, Pl.Sph.266d, 268c: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
the art of producing appearances, opp. ei)kastikh/, ib.236c; f. e)pibolh\ th=s dianoi/as Epicur. Sent.24, cf. Ep. 1p.13U., Phld.Sign.Fr. 1 (pl.): to\ f. Arist.de An. 432a31, Plot.4.3.29: the
imaginative faculty, faculty of being deluded by images, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.22. Adv. -kw=s,
by means of mental images, Epicur.Nat.28.7; tupou=sqai M.Ant.3.16, S.E.M.7.373, cf. Jul.Or.5.164c, Syrian. in Metaph. 115.37, etc.

fanta^s-to/s, h/, o/n,
acting upon the fantasi/a (q. v., signf. 2), Arist.Mem.450a24; only of real objects acc. to Chrysipp.Stoic.2.22; to\ u(popi=pton f. M.Ant.3.11. Adv. -tw=s Syrian. in Metaph. 117.14.
fa/nths, ou, o(, = sukofa/nths (for which it is perhaps f.l.), Phot. s.v. potagwgi/des (pl.). fanti/, Dor. 3pl. pres. of fhmi/.

fantiko/s, h/, o/n,
significant, Ammon. in Int.59.25.

fan-to/s, h/, o/n, (fai/nomai)
visible, Orph.Fr.75.

fa/n-twr, oros, o(,
one who displays, semnw=n f. nuktw=n IG22.3411 (ii A. D.).
fanulo/s, v. fa/gilos.
fa/o, Ep. imper. pres. Med. of fhmi/, Od.16.168, etc.

fa/os, fa/eos, to/, Att. contr. fw=s, fwto/s, and resolved Ep. fo/ws (fw/wsde, though read by Ar.Byz. and Aristarch., is to be rejected in Il.16.188); Aeol. fa/os Sapph.Supp.25.9, but cf. fauofo/ros:—Hom. uses fa/os and fo/ws, never fw=s; of the oblique cases he uses only dat. sing. fa/ei and acc. pl. fa/ea; dat. pl. fae/essi Hes.Fr.142.4, Call. Dian.211, etc.:—fa/os is the only form used by Pi.: Trag. use fa/os or fw=s, both in lyr. and dialogue, as metre requires: Com. use fa/os in lyr. only, Ar.Eq.973, Ra.1529; fw=n is a late acc. in BCH51.380 (Cyme, Hymn to Isis); in Prose fw=s is the only form used in nom. and acc.: gen. fa/ous X.Cyr.4.2.9, 26, Oec.9.3, Arist.de An.429a3; dat. fa/ei A.Ag.575, Ch.62 (lyr.), S.Ph.415, 1212 (lyr.), etc.: pl., fa/h B. 8.28, Gal.18(2).250, AP7.373 (Thall.); gen. fae/wn Arat.90; dat. fa/esi Call.Dian.71; in Prose gen. fwto/s Pl.R.518a, Ax.365c; dat. fwti/ Luc. Musc.Enc.9, etc. (fw=| E.Fr.534); pl., fw=ta IG11(2).203 A33 (Delos, iii B. C.), etc.; gen. fw/twn ib.42(1).110.43 (Epid., iv B. C.); dat. fwsi/ (v. infr. 1.2): (fa/w）. [a^ regularly; but Hom. always has a_ metri gr. in fa_ea; and so dat. pl. fa_esi in Call.Dian.71]:—
light, esp.
daylight, h)/dh f. h)=en e)pi\ xqo/na Od.23.371; f. oi)/xeq' u(po\ zo/fon 3.335; kate/du lampro\n f. h)eli/oio Il.1.605; *)hw\s . . *zhni\ fo/ws e)re/ousa 2.49; a)qana/toisi fo/ws fe/roi Od.5.2; nu\c a)pokru/yei fa/os A.Pr.24; to\ tou= h(li/ou fw=s Pl.R. 515e; pro\s to\ fw=s ble/pein ibid.; ou)ra/nion fw=s, ai)qe/ros fw=s, S.Ant.944 (lyr.), E.Ph.809 (lyr.); h(me/ras a(gno\n fa/os Id.Fr.443; h(merh/sion fa/os A.Ag.23; to\ h(merino\n fw=s Pl.R.508c; e)n fa/ei by
daylight, Od.21.429; e(/ws a)\n fw=s ge/nhtai till
daybreak, Pl.Prt.311a; a(/ma fa/ei at
daybreak, Plu.Cam.34; a(/ma tw=| fwti/ Plb.1.30.10, al.; e(/ws e)/ti fw=s e)stin while there is still
light, Pl.Phd.89c; e)/ti fa/ous o)/ntos X.Cyr.4.2.26; kata\ fa/os nu/ktas te E.Ba.425 (lyr.); kata\ fw=s, opp. nu/ktwr, X.Cyr.3.3.25; also, of moon
light and star
light, fae/essi selh/nhs Hes. l. c., cf. Pi.O.10(11).75, Bion Fr.8.5, etc.; a)ste/ros thlauge/steron Pi.P.3.75; ta\ fw=ta, sc. sun and moon, Ptol.Tetr.37,38. in Poets, freq. in phrases concerning the life of men, zw/ei kai\ o(ra=| f. h)eli/oio Il.18.61, cf. Od.4.540, etc.; lei/pein f. h)eli/oio Hes.Op.155, Thgn.569; e)s fa/os ou)k a)ni/eske, a)ki/kesqe, Hes.Th.157,652; zh=| te kai\ ble/pei fa/os A.Pers.299; o(/stis fw=s o(ra=| S.OT375; o)/nta e)n fa/ei Id.Ph.415, etc.; *dio\s e)n fa/ei E.Hec.707 (lyr.); pe/myat' e)/nerqen yuxh\n e)s fw=s, a)nagagei=n ei)s fw=s, A.Pers.630 (anap.), Ar.Av.699 (anap.); pro\s fw=s a)nelqei=n S.Ph.625; pro\s fw=s a)/gein Pl.Prt.320d; lei/pw fa/os Ar.Ach.1185 (paratrag.); ei) sterh/somai tou=de tou= fwto/s Pl.Ax.365c: but also ei)s fw=s i)e/nai to come into
the light, i.e. into
public, S.Ph.1353; ei)s fw=s le/gein ib.581; to\ fw=s ko/smon pare/xei
light (i. e.
publicity) is a guarantee for order, X.Ages.9.1. simply
a day, fw=s e(\n h(li/ou katarke/sei E.Rh.447; no/stimon ble/pein fa/os, = h)=mar, A.Pers.261: pl., krisi/mwn fae/wn of critical
days, AP11.382.11 (Agath.).
the light of a torch, lamp, fire, etc., ti/s toi fa/os oi)/sei; Od.19.24, cf. 34,64; fa/os pa/ntessi pare/cw 18.317; fw=s dai/wn A.Ch.863 (anap.); poiei=n X.HG6.2.29; pro\s fw=s pi/nein to drink by
the fire, Id.Cyr.7.5.27;
a light, fw=s e)/xwn . . a)fhgei=to Id.HG5.1.8: pl., Plu.Pel.12, Ant.26, etc.; ta\ f. the
illuminations, IG11(2).203A33 (Delos, iii B. C.); me/sois fwsi/n at a moderate
fire, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.46 B., cf. Zos.Alch.pp.147,155 B.
the light of the eyes, fa/os o)mma/twn, o)/sswn, Pind.N.10.40, Opp.H.4.525: pl., fa/ea
eyes, Od.16.15, 19.417; ti/eskon i)/son fae/essin e)moi=si Mosch.4.9; fa/h Gal. l. c.: sg., of the Cyclops'
eye, E.Cyc.633.
window, IG42(1).110.43 (Epid., iv B. C.), Plu.2.515b;
opening in a machine, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.7.14.
light, as a metaph. for deliverance, happiness, victory, glory, etc., kai\ tw=| me\n fa/os h)=lqen Il.17.615; fo/ws d' e(ta/roisin e)/qhken 6.6; e)ph\n fa/os e)n nh/essi qh/h|s 16.95; e)n xersi\ fo/ws 15.741; [pu/lai] petasqei=sai teu=can fa/os 21.538; f. a)reta=n Pi.O.4.11; dw/masin fa/os me/ga A.Pers.300, cf. S.Ant. 600 (lyr.), Aj.709 (lyr.); lampro\n f. ge/nous Trag.Adesp.9; of persons, h)/n pou/ ti fo/ws *danaoi=si ge/nwmai Il.16.39, cf. 8.282, etc.; esp. in addressing persons, h)=lqes, *thle/maxe, glukero\n fa/os Od.16.23; w)= fa/os *(ellh/nwn Anacr.124; *)akraganti/nwn fa/os Pi.I.2.17; w)= fi/ltaton fw=s S.El.1224, 1354; w)= me/giston *(/ellhsin fa/os E.Hec.841; in late Prose, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. w)= fw=s: pl., AP7.373 (Thall.). of God, o( qeo\s f. e)sti/ 1 Ep.Jo.1.5; f. kai\ zwh/ e)stin o( qeo\s kai\ path/r Corp.Herm.1.21; of Christ, f. ei)s a)poka/luyin e)qnw=n Ev.Luc.2.32, etc. with reference to
illumination of the mind, th=s a)lhqei/as to\ fw=s E.IT1026; f. e)n tw=| filosofei=n Plu.2.77d, cf. 47c; to\ f. to\ e)n soi/ Ev.Matt.6.23; to\ f. th=s zwh=s Ev.Jo.8.12; e)n tw=| f. ei)=nai 1 Ep.Jo.2.9; te/kna fwto/s, o(/pla tou= f., Ep.Eph.5.8, Ep.Rom.13.12.
the dark ring round the nipple, Poll.2.163.

fa^osta^si/a, h(, coined as etym. of fantasi/a, Sophon.
in de An.121.19, interpol. in Ph.1.279.

fa/r, faro/s, to/, Lat.
far, spelt, Sor.1.98, Aret.CA2.2, Alex. Trall.5.5(prob.). fa=r, to/, apoc. form of fa=ros, Hdn.Gr.1.394.

fa^ragg-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
of, from a gully or
ravine, of the wind Iapyx, Arist.Vent.973b15.

fa^ragg-o/w,
convert into gullies or
ravines, [gh=] pefaraggwme/nh (by the Nile floods), PGurob 26 intr.p.44 (iii B. C.), PTeb.151 (ii B. C.).

fa^ragg-w/dhs, es,
full of chasms or
ravines, to/poi Arist.HA578a27, cf. D.S.1.32, J.AJ5.2.11, Corn.ND27.
found in ravines, of the plant o)/strus, Thphr.HP3.10.3.

fa/ragc [a^], aggos, h(,
cleft, chasm, esp. in a mountain side,
ravine, gully, Alcm.60.1 (pl.); f. pro\s dusxeime/rw| A.Pr.15, cf. 142 (anap.), al., E.IT277, X.HG7.2.13, Thphr.HP9.5.2 (pl.), Schwyzer 289.161 (Priene, ii B. C.), etc.; pa=sa f. plhrwqh/setai LXX Is.40.4; pa/ntas . . e)s fa/ragga e)se/balon Th.2.67; e)n pu/laisi ga\r staqei\s fa/raggos
of the cave, E.Cyc.668; fa/ragga daktu/lou pia/smati su/rei, of shaping a roll before it is baked, Eub.75.11:—metaph., of Cleon, fa/ragga kai\ *xa/rubdin a(rpagh=s Ar.Eq.248 (troch.). metaph., of the anus, Sotad.2.2.
fa/rai: u(fai/nein, ple/kein, Hsch. faraida/kh: muri/kh, Id.

faran-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
native of *fara/n (between Palestine and Egypt), a)nnw=na tw=n f. b' a)/lhs PFlor.297.192, 219 (vi A. D.).

faran-i=tis, idos, h(,
a kind of amethyst found at *fara/n, Plin.HN37.122.
faratri/tas, v. faretri/ths.

fa^ra/w,
plough, a)/faron faro/wsi (sc. gh=n) Call.Fr.183 (ap.E.M. 788.24); cf. faro/w.
farbo/, v. farumo/s.

fa/rg-ma, atos, to,
enclosure, precinct, Schwyzer 89.8 (Argos, iii B. C.), cf. Hsch.
fa/rg-nu_mi, v. fra/gnumi.
fareo/s, o(, = fa=ros, Chron.Lind. D.36.

fa^re/tr-a, Ion. fa^re/tr-h, h(, (fe/rw)
quiver for arrows, i)odo/kos Il.15.443; w(s ei)/ te fare/trh| pw=m' e)piqei/h Od.9.314; a)mfhrefh/s Il.1.45; be/lh e)/ndon e)nti\ fare/tras Pi.O.2.84, cf. E.Rh.979, HF969; w(/sper e)k fare/tras r(hmati/skia . . a)naspw=ntes Pl.Tht.180a; f. toceuma/twn
a
quiver-full of . . , IG12(5).647.28 (Coressus, iii B. C.).
fa^retr-ew/n, w=nos, o(, = foreg., Hdt.1.216, 2.141, 7.61.
fa^re/tr-ion, to/, Dim. of fare/tra, Mosch.1.20.

fa^retr-i/ths [i_], ou, Boeot. fa^/retr-tas, o(, = toco/ths,
member of a military club, Supp.Epigr.3.354 (Thisbe, iii B. C.), IG7.2714.2 (Acraeph.); also written faratr- Schwyzer463(3).5 (Tanagra).

fa^retrofo/ros, on,
quiver-bearing, AP5.176 (Mel.): but faretrh/foros i)o/s
borne in the quiver, Ath.Mitt.56.122 (Smyrna).
farqe/nos, = parqe/nos, IG5(2).262.28,31 (Mantinea, v. B.C.), 12.555, 650.

fari/a, h(, a
vessel of some kind, PRyl.224 (
a) introd. (ii A. D.).

fa_riko/n, to/, some kind of
poison, Nic.Al.398, Dsc.5.6; fariako\n fa/rmakon in Phylarch.10 J.

fa/rinos, h, on,
of cloth, xitw/n Schwyzer 462 B 42 (Tanagra, iii B. C.).
fa/rion, to/, Dim. of fa=ros: = e)reou=s kekru/falos, Poll.7.66.
farka/zw, = kle/ptw, Hsch. fa/rkes: neossoi/, Id.

farki_d-o/omai, (farki/s) Pass.,
to be wrinkled, expld. by stugna/zontes, Hsch.

farki_d-w/dhs, es,
wrinkled, Hp. ap. Erot.; to be restored for forakiw/dhs in Id.Mul.2.172.

farki/s, i=dos, h(,
wrinkle, S.Fr.1108 (farmaki/da cod. Phot.), Erot. s.v. farkidw=des.

farkt-oomai,
guard oneself, Hsch., Phot. (-esqai cod.).
farkt-o/s, h/, o/n, = frakto/s, EM667.23.

farma^k-a/w,
suffer from the effect of drugs or
charms, D.46.16, Thphr.Fr.105, Plu.2.1016e, etc.
require a remedy, Luc.Lex. 4.

farma^k-ei/a_, h(,
use of drugs, esp. of
purgatives, Hp.Aph.1.24, 2.36 (both pl.), PCair.Zen.18.5 (iii B. C.), Gal.15.447, etc.; ai( a)/nw f., i. e. emetics, Arist.Pr.962a3; of abortifacients, Sor.1.59: generally,
the use of any kind of drugs, potions, or
spells, Pl.Lg.933b: pl., Id.Prt. 354a, Ti.89b, Men.535.9.
poisoning or
witchcraft, D.40 57, Plb.6.13.4, POxy.486.21 (ii A. D.); ai( peri\ ta\s farmakei/as, = ai( farmaki/des, Arist.HA572a22. metaph.,
remedy, paidia\s prosa/gein farmakei/as xa/rin Id.Pol.1337b41.
farma^/k-eia^, h(, = farmaki/s, name for si/tth （dia\ to\ polu/idris ei)=nai), Id.HA616b23.

farma^k-erga/ths [ga^], ou, o(,
apothecary, Tz. H.8.918.

farma^k-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
poisoner, sorcerer, S.Tr.1140, Pl.Smp.203d, etc.; gnh/sioi sofistai\ kai\ f. Jul.Or.6.197d.
druggist, apothecary, Aret.CD2.12.
farma^/k-eusis, ews, h(, = farmakei/a, in pl., Hp.Prorrh. 2.4, Pl.Lg.845d.

farma^k-eute/on,
one must use a purge, Gal.16.123, 17(2).665.
farma^k-euth/s, ou=, o(, later form for farmakeu/s, Ph.1.449, Ptol.Tetr. 161, Vett.Val. 17.10, etc.

farma^k-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
by means of drugs or
pharmacy, ka/qarsis Pl.Ti.89b: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), = farmakei/a, opp. surgery. Gal.15.425, D.L. 3.85; f. i)atro/s
one who prescribes drugs, Gal.Thras.24.
farma^k-eu/tria, h(, fem. of farmakeuth/s, Eust. 1415.64; pl., title of the second Idyll of Theoc.

farma^k-eu/w,
administer a drug or
medicine, Pl.R.459c, Ti.89d.
use enchantments, practise sorcery, farmakeu/santes tau=ta e)s to\n potamo/n
having used this
charm upon the river, Hdt.7.114. c. acc. pers.,
purge, tina Hp.
Acut.(Sp.)55; f. a)/nw kou/fw| farma/kw|
purge upwards, i. e. by an emetic, Id.Art.67, cf. Aph.4.12:—Pass.,
to be purged, ib.2.37, Men. Her.Fr.5;
to be physicked, Arist. Top.111a2.
drug a person,
give him
a poisonous or
stupefying drug, E.Andr.355, SIG1181.4 (Rhenea, ii B. C.); f. tina\ e)pi\ bla/bh| mh\ qanasi/mw| Pl.Lg.933d:—Pass., ou) pefarma/keusai a)lla\ mema/g<e>usai Astramps.Orac.25.4(ii A. D.), cf. POxy.472.1 (ii A. D.).
season in cookery, [i)xqu\n] pefarmakeume/non turoi=si Philem.79.5. metaph., peiqoi= kakh=| th\n yuxh\n f. Gorg. Fr.11 D.

entryFree.foreign: h( xu/tra h(\n h(toi/mazon toi=s kaqai/rousi ta\s po/leis,

div0.entryFree:
farma^k-hro/s, a/, o/n, (fa/rmakon 111)
treated with preservatives, kwpw=n zeu/gh BGU544.21 (ii A. D.).
glazed, of bronze vessels, ib. 17.
farma^k-i/a, Ion. -ih, = farmakei/a, Hp.Decent.10, LXXEx.7.11 (pl.), Man.2.310.

farma^k-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a fa/rmakon, Tz.ad Lyc. 1137.

farma^/k-ion, to/, Dim. of fa/rmakon,
mild remedy, Pl.Phdr.268c, Tht. 149c, PPetr.3p.115 (iii B. C.), Plu.2.43b; AP11.333 (Callicter).
purgative, f.l. for farmakei/h|si in Hp.Aph.1.20.

farma^k-i/s, i/dos, fem. of farmakeu/s,
sorceress, witch, D.25.79, Arist.HA577a13, A. R.4.53:— as Adj., gunh\ f. Ar.Nu.749; irreg. Sup., farmakisto/tatai gunaikw=n J.AJ17.4.1, cf. Suid. s.v. *mh/deia. fem. Adj.,
poisonous, venomous, sau/ra Nic.Al.538.
farma^k-i/stria, h(, = foreg. 1, Hsch. s.v. bambakeu/triai.

farma^k-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
drugged or
medicated, daktu/lios f. a ring
containing poison, Eup.87; oi)=nos f. Semus 5a; fem. farmaki=tis gh=, = a)mpeli=tis 11, Dsc.5.160; f. sau/ra Aët.13.56; also h( f. (sc. bi/blos)
On Drugs, title of lost work by Hippocrates, Hp.Aff.9.15, 28, al.; farmaki/tides bi/bloi, by Andromachus, Gal.13.891. = a)dhfa/gos, Hsch.; cf. fageswri=tis.

farma^k-i/wn, wnos, o(,
pharmacist, nickname of Asclepiades Junior, Gal.13.441.

farma^ko-dosi/a, h(,
poisoning, Mich. in EN17.23.

farma^ko/-eis, essa, en, = farmakw/dhs,
poisoned, i)o/s Mosch.4.30:
poisonous, Nic.Al.4; of a person,
sorcerer, Nonn.D.21.144.—In Nic.Al.293, we have nom. pl. fem. farmako/eis for -o/essai.

farma^ko-qh/kh, h(,
medicine-chest, POsl. 54.6 (ii/iii A. D.), Cat.Cod.Astr.1.104.

farma^ko/-mantis, ews, o(, either
one who is at once farmako/s and ma/ntis, or
who uses fa/rmaka
to divine from, title of play by Anaxandrides.

fa/rma^kon [v. sub fin.], to/,
drug, whether healing or noxious: in Hom. the sense is freq. determined by an epith., fa/rmaka, polla\ me\n e)sqla\ . . , polla\ de\ lugra/ Od.4.230; to/de f. e)sqlo/n 10.287, cf. 292; f. h)/pia, o)dunh/fata (v. infr. 2); kaka\ f. ib.213; f. lugra/ ib. 236; f. ou)lo/menon ib.394; a)ndrofo/non 1.261; qumofqo/ra f. 2.329; so, after Hom., prosane/a f. Pi.P.3.52; paiw/nia A.Ag.848; xrh/simon Pl.R.382c; qana/sima Ph.Bel.103.31; o)le/qrion Luc.Herm. 62.
healing remedy, medicine, in Hom. mostly of those applied outwardly, e)piqh/sei fa/rmax' a(/ ken pau/sh|si melaina/wn o)duna/wn Il.4.191; e)p' a)/r' h)/pia fa/rmaka pa/sse ib.218; o)dunh/fata f. pa/sswn 5.401,900, cf. 11.515,830, 15.394; prosa/leifen e(ka/stw| f. Od.10.392; f. perialei/fein Ar.Eq.906; also of potions, piw\n fa/rmak' Od.10.326; f. pepwkw/s Hdt.4.160, cf. Pi. l. c.; para\ tou= i)atrou= Pl.R.406d, cf. Grg.467c; f. xristo/n E.Hipp.516; e)/gxriston Theoc.11.1; e)pi/xriston Str.17.1.10; e)pi/paston Theoc. l. c.; kataplasto/n Ar.Pl.716; poto/n E.Hipp. l.c.; freq. in Medic. writers, Sor. 1.4, Gal.6.265, etc.; of
medicines for cattle, PFlor.222.11 (iii A. D.). c. gen. (v. infr. 11), f. no/sou
a medicine for it,
remedy against it, A.Pr.251,606 (lyr.); bhxo/s Phryn.Com.60: kefalh=s
for a head-ache, Pl.Chrm.155b; straggouri/as Arist.HA612b16, cf. 624a16; me/qhs Amphis 37; di/yhs AP 6.170 (Thyill.); but u(giei/as f.
a medicine to restore or
maintain health, Aristid.Or.37(2).11.
enchanted potion, philtre: hence,
charm, spell, Od.4.220 sq., Ar.Pl.302, Theoc.2.15, PSI1.64.20 (i B. C.); farma/kois to\n a)/ndr' e)/mhnen Ar.Th.561; toiau=ta e)/xw f. such
charms have I, Hdt.3.85, cf. Apoc.9.21.
poison, S.Tr. 685, E.Med.385; piei=n to\ f. Antipho6.15, Pl.Phd.57a, 115a; fa/rmaka e)sbeblhke/nai e)s ta\ fre/ata Th.2.48; f. dhlhth/ria SIG37 A 1 (Teos, v B. C.); tociko\n f. BGU21 ii 14 (iv A. D.).
lye for laundering, Stud.Pal.22.56.12 (iii A. D.). generally,
remedy, cure, Hes.Op.485, Alc.35, etc.; mei=zon . . th=s no/sou to\ f.
the cure too strong for, i. e. worse than, the disease, S.Fr.589.4, cf. Com.Adesp. 455; f. prau/+, of a bridle, Pi.O.13.85; f. tini
for a thing, Thgn. 1134 (pl.), Archil.9; pro/s ti Arist.Pol.1321a16; potto\n e)/rwta Theoc. 11.1; but most freq. f. tino/s
remedy against . . xlai=na . . f. r(i/geus Hippon.19; *zeu\s pa/ntwn f. mou=nos e)/xei Simon.87; to\ siga=n f. bla/bhs e)/xw A.Ag.548; f. po/nwn, lu/phs, E.Ba.283, Fr.1079; do/loi . . xrei/as a)na/ndrou f. ib.288; fo/bou Pl.Lg.647e; lh/qhs fa/rmaka (of gra/mmata) E.Fr.578.1; v. eu)diano/s. c. gen. also,
a means of producing something, f. swthri/as Id.Ph.893; mnh/mhs kai\ sofi/as f. Pl.Phdr.274e; u(pomnh/sews ib.275a, cf. 230d; a)qanasi/as Antiph.86.6; h(suxi/as Arist.Pol.1273b23; f. mani/as, of the oil applied to wrestlers, D.L.1.104. e)pi\ qana/tw| f. e(a=s a)reta=s eu(re/sqai
a remedy or
consolation in his own virtue, Pi.P.4.187.
dye, paint, colour, Emp.23.3, Hdt.1.98, A.Fr.134, Ar.Ec.735, Pl.R.420c, Plt.277c, PCair.Zen.789.13 (iii B. C.), etc.
chemical reagent, PLeid.X.25, PHolm.13.46, 22.10, Ps.-Democr. ap. Zos.Alch.p.160 B.;
used by tanners, Sch.Ar.Eq.44,368.—Cf. farma/ssw. [ma^; but ma_ in farmako/s.]

farma^ko-poie/w,
prepare dyes or
colours, Suid. s.v. ba/yas.

farma^ko-poii/a, h(,
preparation of drugs, D.L.7.117.

farma^ko-poio/s, o/n,
preparing drugs, e)/qnos f. A.Eleg.2, cf. Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).211.

farma^ko-posi/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
drinking of medicine, Hp.Aph.4.19 (pl.), X.An.4.8.21 (unless in sign f. 2), Pl.Sph.227a, etc.
drinking of poison, Luc.Nec.18, Porph.Chr.96.

farma^ko-pote/w,
drink medicine, Hp.Aff.27,41, Thphr. HP9.15.4.

farma^ko-pwle/w,
to be a druggist, Ar.Fr.28 (anap.), Epicur.Fr. 171.

farma^ko-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
druggist, apothecary, Ar.Nu.767, Critias Fr. 70 D., Theopomp.Com.2, Aeschin.3.162, Phld.Rh.1.34 S., etc.

fa/rma^kos (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.150), o(, h(,
poisoner, sorcerer, magician, LXXEx.7.11 (masc.), Ma.3.5 (fem.), Apoc.21.8, 22.15.

farmako/s [v. ad fin.], o(,
one sacrificed or
executed as an atonement or
purification for others,
scapegoat, Hippon.5, al., Ar.Ra.733 (troch.), Ister 33; and, since criminals were reserved for this fate, a general name of reproach, Ar.Eq.1405, Lys.6.53, Call. in *dihgh/seis ii 29, D. 25.80. [a_ Hippon. and Call., a^ Ar.Eq. l.c.; on the accent v. Hdn. Gr.1.150; farma=kos Did. ap. Harp.]

farma^ko-tri/bhs [i^], ou, o(,
one who grinds drugs or
colours, D.48.12, Ael.NA9.62.
farma^ko-tri/pths, ou, o(, = foreg., AB314.
farma^kourgo/s, o/n, = farmakopoio/s, Lyc.61.

farma^kofo/ros, on,
producing drugs, Eust.1415.54.

farma^k-o/w,
medicate, farmakw/sais' a)nti/toma o)duna=n
having endued them
with healing power against pains, Pi.P.4.221. in Pass.,
to be poisoned, meli/kraton pefarmakwme/non Plu.2.768d; of an arrow, Dsc.Eup.2.144 (v. l.).
to be bewitched, POxy.1477.20 (iii/iv A. D.).
farma^k-th/r, h=ros, o(, = farmakeu/s, Opp.H.2.483.
farma^k-th/rios, a, on, = farmakeutiko/s, Lyc.1138.
farma^/k-ths, ou, o(, = farmakth/r, Opp.H. 4.648,693.

farma^k-to/s, h/, o/n,
poisoned, be/lh Str.11.2.19; ge/nos Man.4.540.
poisonous, do/los Id.4.52.

farma^k-w/dhs, es,
of the nature of a fa/rmakon,
medicinal, Arist.HA624a18, Mir.835b32, Pr.863b32; ga/la Thphr.HP9.15.4 (Sup.); xumoi/ Id.CP6.4.6 (Comp.); poth/mata Sor.2.29; ta\ -wde/stera fa/rmaka ib.33.
poisonous, Plu.Ant. 47, 2.974c;
poisoned, toceu/mata Dsc.3.80; to\ f. Plu.2.17b. of places,
rich in medicinal herbs, Thphr.HP9.15.4 (Posit. and Sup.).

farma^k-w/n, w=nos, o(,
dye-house, S.Fr.1109.

entryFree.sense: = farmaki=tis (which shd. perh. be read), Gal.13.890.

div0.entryFree:
fa/rmacis, ews, h(,
medical treatment, Pl.Phlb.46a.
witchery, Numen. ap. Eus.PE14.8. = Lat.
veneficium, Gloss.
treatment of metals, f. peri\ to\n xalko/n Plu.2.395b.

farma/ssw, Att. farma^/k-ttw, prop.
treat by using fa/rmaka: generally,
treat, once in Hom., w(s o(/t' a)nh\r pe/lekun . . ei)n u(/dati yuxrw=| ba/pth| . . farma/sswn Od.9.393; cf. foreg.11. after Hom.,
heal or
relieve by medicine, Pl.Lg.933b, A.R.4.1512. f. me/qu
medicate it, Nic.Th.619.
enchant or
bewitch by potions or
philtres, A.R.3.478, 4.61 (and in Med., Id.3.859):
bewitch by flattery, Pl.Smp.194a, Men.80a:—Pass., oi( pefarmagme/noi Hp.Morb.Sacr.1; pefa/rmaxqe Ar.Th.534: metaph., of a lamp, farmassome/nh xri/matos . . parhgori/ais A.Ag.94 (anap.).
poison, kre/a Plu.Art.19 (Pass.); be/lh, to\ u(/dwr Id.2.681f (Pass.), 978c: a)peyi/as, di' a)\s farma/ssetai to\ ga/la Sor.1.94.
dye, colour, e)/ria Poll.7.169: metaph., farmassome/nh
eu)morfi/a
painted, false, Philostr.Ep.27.
season, thgani/tas shsa/moisi f. Hippon.36.
farmiano\n ma/lagma, a plaster, Asclep. ap. Gal.13.975.

farna/keios [a^], a, on,
of Pharnaces, tetra=xmon Inscr.Délos 1444
A a 17 (ii B. C.). *farna/keion, to/, in Lat. form
Pharnaceon, = pa/nakes *kentau/reion, Plin.HN25.33; cf. Gloss.

fa/rcis, ews, h(,
fencing, naou= IG42(1).102.75 (Epid., iv B. C.).

fa=ros, eos, to/, later also fa/ros [v. sub fin.]:—
a large piece of cloth, web, fa/re' e)/neike *kaluyw\ . . , i(sti/a poih/sasqai Od.5.258, cf. E.Hec.1082 (lyr.). commonly,
a wide cloak or
mantle without sleeves, malako\n d' e)/ndune xitw=na . . peri\ de\ me/ga ba/lleto f. (of a man) Il.2.43; porfu/reon me/ga f. e)/xwn e)n xeiri/ 8.221, cf. Od.15.61, Xenoph.3.3, Pherecyd.Syr.2, Hdt.9.109, E.El.1221 (lyr., pl.); also worn by women, Od.5.230, Hes.Op.198, A.Ch.11, etc.; drawn over the head, me/ga f. e(lw\n . . ka\k kefalh=s ei)/russe Od.8.84, cf. E.Supp.286, Ar.Th.890; used as a
shroud or
pall, Il.18.353, 24.580, S.Aj.916; pu/maton f. my last
rag, Pl.Eleg.12; ei)s o(/ ke f. e)ktele/sw . . *lae/rth| h(/rwi+ tafh/i+on Od.2.97, 24.132; also of
bed-spread, demni/ois . . strwta\ ba/llousan fa/rh S.Tr.916: a)naidei/as f. (expld. by Hsch. from Il.2.262), S.Fr.291.—Ep., Trag. (for Ar. l. c. is paratrag. and Philetaer.19 is corrupt), and twice in Hdt. (Corinthian acc. to AB1096). [a_ in Hom. and mostly in later Ep.; fa^re/essi Hes.Op.198 codd., A.R.3.863. A. has a_ always; S. has a^ in Tr.916, Frr.360, 373, 586, and never certainly a_; E. has both a_, E. El.191, Hec. l. c., IT149 (all lyr.), al., and a^, HF414 (s. v. l.), Andr.831, Or.840, Hipp.133 (all lyr.), Supp.286, cf. Hdn.Gr.2.942.]
fa/ros [a^], o(, = fa/rugc, Lyc.154.

fa/ros [a^], to/,
plough, Alcm.23.61 (cf. Sosiph. ap. Sch.), Antim. Eleg.p.293 B. = a)/rosis,
ploughing, Hsch. s.v. bou/faron, EM175.36. (Cf. Lat.
foro, OE.
borian 'bore'.)

*fa/ros [a^], ou, h(,
Pharos, an island in the bay of Alexandria, Od. 4.355, E.Hel.5, Th.1.104, etc.; famous for its lighthouse, Str.17.1.6, etc.: hence *fa/riai: skopiai\ *fa/riai the watch-tower
of Pharos, Alciphr.2.4. as Appell., fa/ros, o(,
lighthouse, AP9.671, 11.117 (Strat.).
farofo/ros, v. faurofo/ros.
faro/w, = fara/w, Hsch.

fa/rsos, eos, to/,
any piece cut off or
severed, portion, ( = tru/fos, kla/sma, pteru/gion, a)krwth/rion, Hsch.; part of a house, Poll.7.121); fa/rsea po/lios
the quarters of a city, Hdt.1.180; e)n fa/rsei+ e(kate/rw| ib. 181, cf. 186; f. bo/truos AP6.299 (Phan.); f. draxmai=on Nic.Th.664; sxi/zein to\ i(ma/tion ei)s dw/deka f. J.AJ8.7.7. =
