velamen, Gloss.; r(ou/sion f., =
vexillum, ibid.; f. skepasth/ria protective
sheets or
coverings, J.AJ3.8.2; w(rai=on to\ f. a)/qesi pantoi/ois ib.3.6.4; li/neon f. ibid.

farsofo/ros, o(, =
signifer, vexillarius, Gloss.

fa/rswma, atos, to/,
ship's timbers, Demetr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(3).98.
fa^ru/ggeqron, to/, = fa/rugc, Hp.Anat.1, Ruf.Onom.62, Aret.SA 1.7:—faru/geqron Poll.2.207 (with v.l. -etron ib.99); faru/gaqron Hsch.
fa^ruggi/zw, = laruggi/zw, Poll.2.207.

fa^ruggotomi/a, h(,
laryngotomy, Asclep. ap. Cael.Aur.CP1.14, Antyll. ap. Paul.Aeg.6.33.

fa^ru^gi/ndhn, Adv.
like a gulf, Com.Adesp.1185.

fa/rugc [a^], h(, less freq. o( (v. sub fin.), also fa/ruc Ar.Ra.259 (lyr.), 571; gen. fa/ru^gos (always in Hom., Trag. and Com. (exc. fa/ruggos E.Cyc.356 (lyr.)), as ib.410,592, Cratin.186,257 (troch.), Telecl.1.12 (anap.), Ar.Fr.614), later fa/ruggos Nic.Al.363: (fa/ros):—
throat, fa/rugos d' e)ce/ssuto oi)=nos Od.9.373; fa/rugos la/be deciterh=fin 19.480; o( f. eu)treph\s e)/stw, for dinner, E.Cyc.215, cf. ll.cc.; w)= miara\ f., of a glutton, Ar.Ra.571; hu)/cato/ tis o)yofa/gos w)\n to\n f. au(tw=| makro/teron gera/nou gene/sqai Arist.EN1118a33: of singing, kekraco/mesqa/ g' o(po/son h( f. a)\n h(mw=n xanda/nh| Ar.Ra.259 (lyr.), cf. Hp.Carn. 16, 18, Acut.59, al.—Used of the
windpipe by Arist.PA664a16, 665a10, cf. de An.421a4, Gal.6.176; opp. pari/sqmia and la/rugc, ib.674, cf. 15.789,792, Aret.CA1.9; th\n f. ke/rxnein Diocl.Fr.147; of the
oesophagus by EM557.17; of the
pharynx by Hp.Prog.23 (cf. Gal.18(2).264), Poll.2.207; both of
pharynx and
windpipe by Gal.UP8.1.
dewlap of a bull. Hld.2.1. pl., of
diseases of the throat, Hp.Aph.3.5.—The gender is indeterm. in Hom.: fem., in Att., Phryn.46, cf. Cratin.and Ar.ll.cc., Pherecr.69, Th.2.49, Call.(?) Fr.331 (cf. Fr.51 P.); masc. in Epich.21, Telecl.1.12, E.Cyc.215, etc.: both genders in Hp., Arist., etc., and later writers (h( Aristid. Or.48(24).57, Ael.NA1.30, Paus.8.37.8, o( Plu.2.698f, Luc.Asin.38).
farumo/s, = tolmhro/s, qrasu/s, Hsch.: also farbo/ (sic), Id.
fa/rxma, atos, to/, = fra/gma, IG42(1).102.253 (pl., Epid., iv B. C.).
fa/rw, Locr. and Dor. for fe/rw, IG9(1).334.5 (Locr., v B. C.), EM 114.20.

fa/sac, akos, o(,
informer, = sukofa/nths, Com.Adesp.1186.
fasga/n-ion [ga^], to/, = fa/sganon 11.1, Dsc.4.20, Corn.ND35, Plin. HN25.137. = ca/nqion, Gal.12.87.

fasgan-i/s, i/dos, h(, in pl., barber's
knives and scissors, AP6.307 (Phan.).

fa/sgan-on, to/, poet. Noun,
sword, dw=ken me/ga f. h(/rws su\n kolew=| te fe/rwn kai\ e)u+tmh/tw| telamw=ni Il.23.824; koleou= gumno\n f. Pi.N.1.52b; a)mfiplh=gi f. S.Tr.930, cf. E.Fr.373 (Cypr. acc. to AB 1095). = cifi/on,
corn-flag, Gladiolus segetum, Thphr.HP7.12.3, 7.13.1, Nic.Fr.74.63. = ca/nqion, Dsc.4.136. = a)spa/laqos, f.l. for sfa/gnon in Id.1.20. = ci/fos 11, Opp.H.3.556.

fasgan-ourgo/s, o/n,
forging swords, *ai)=sa A.Ch.647 (lyr.).

fasga/n-w,
slaughter with the sword, Hsch. (Pass.).
fash/lion, to/, Dim. of fa/shlos, POxy.1656.8 (iv/v A. D.), Gloss. = i)so/puron, Dsc.4.120.

fashloeidh/s, e/s,
like the fa/shlos 1, Choerob. in Thd.1.288 H.

fa/shlos [a^], o( (cf. Ath.2.56a, 4.139a: Lat.
phaselos is fem., Colum.10.377), a kind of bean,
calavance, Vigna sinensis, Epich. 151, Ar.Pax 1144 (troch.), Demetr.Com.Vet.5, Wilcken Chr.198.18 (iii B. C.), etc.; cf. fasi/olos. hence Lat.
phaselus, a light boat, canoe, skiff, from its like ness to a bean-pod, Catull.4, Hor.Od.3.2.29.
fa/sqai, inf. pres. Med. of fhmi/, Il.1.187, Od.11.443.

*fa_sia_no/s, o/n,
from the river Phasis (v. *fa=sis):—o( f. (sc. o)/rnis),
the Phasian bird, pheasant, Phasianus colchicus, Mnesim.9, Ar.Nu. 109 (where some took it for
a Phasian horse, cf. Sch.ad loc., Ath.9.387a, and cf. *fasianoi\ i(/ppoi, *fasianikoi\ de\ o)/rneis Hdn.Gr.post Phryn. p.459 Lobeck), Arist.HA557a12, 633b2, Thphr.Fr.180, Ptol.Euerg. 2(b) J., Edict.Diocl.4.17 (Aeg.); *f. o)/rniqes Callix.2, cf. Ath.14.654c, etc.:—also fasianiko/s, Ar.Av.68 (with a play on sukofantiko/s, as fasiano\s a)nh/r represents sukofa/nths in Id.Ach.726), Paul.Aeg.1.83; *f. o)/rniqes Poll.6.52; *f. ste/ar Aët.5.118.

fa/simos [a^], h, on,
denounced, informed against, GDIivp.885 (Erythrae, iv B. C.). dub. sens., f. ku/lic, para\ th\n fa/sin th\n e)/ndeicin, Phot., EM789.2.
fa^si/olos, o(, = fa/shlos 1, Poll.1.247, Gal.6.542, 545,557, 11.891, interpol. post Dsc.2.107: fasi/wlos Edict.Diocl.1.21 (Aeg.); pasi/olos ib.6.33: fasiou/luos Hippiatr.130,134.

fa/sis (A) [a^], ews, h(: (fai/nw):—
denunciation, information laid, grafai\ h)\ fa/seis h)\ e)ndei/ceis h)\ a)pagwgai/ And.1.88, cf. Lys.Fr.209 S., Din.Fr.89.36, D.25.78, Lex ap.eund.35.51; h( peri\ to\ ploi=on f. Id.58.5, cf. SIG695.83 (Magn.Mae., ii B. C.). (fai/nomai)
appearance, of stars, Ti.Locr.97 b, Arist.Mete.342b34, Nic.Th.122, Phld.D.3.10, etc.: special uses, pro\s to\n o(ri/zonta f.
appearance above the horizon, opp. u(po\ to\n o(ri/zonta kru/yis, Gem.13.2.
heliacal rising, opp. kru/yis, f. e(w=|ai, e(spe/riai, Ptol. Tetr.99, cf. Alm.8.6, al. including the previous signf. and kru/yeis, Id.Phas.p.3 H., al. (pl.), Vett.Val. 241.30 (pl.). pl.,
phases of the moon, Gem.8.11, Gal.9.904, Man. 2.491,497.
an appearance, trace, tinos Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. fasi/.

fa/sis (B) [a^], ews, h(: (fhmi/):
utterance, expression, Arist. Int.16b27, 17a17.
statement, proposition, comprehending both kata/fasis and a)po/fasis (
affirmation and
denial), these being ai( a)ntikei/menai f., ib.21b18, Metaph. 1011b14, 1062a6; a)napo/deiktoi f. Id.EN1143b12: opp. zh/thsis, ib.1142b14. = kata/fasis,
affirmation, opp. a)po/fasis, Pl.Sph.263e, Arist.APr.51b20, 62a14, Metaph. 1008a9.
mere assertion, without proof, PCair.Zen.620.20 (iii B.C.), Hipparch 2.2.23, Phld.Rh.2.296 S.: pl., Mitteis Chr.31 ix 8 (ii B.C.), Hipparch.1.1.9, Phld.Mus.p.77 K.
judgement, sentence, Greg.Cor. in Hermog. in Rh.7(2).1121 W.
rumour, Act.Ap. 21.31; but,
tidings, kalai\ f. POxy.805 (i B. C.); pe/myon moi th\n f. send me
word, ib. 2149.17 (ii/iii A.D.), cf. 293.4,8 (i A.D.), 530.30 (ii A. D.). in Music, dub. sens., e)nh=s ( = e)nh=n） e)n tw=| me/lei polla\ f. IG7.1818.7 (Thespiae, iii B. C.).

*fa=sis, ios, also idos Arist.Fr.83, o(,
the river Phasis in Colchis, Hes.Th.340, Hdt.1.2, etc.; xqono\s eu)rw/phs me/gan h)d' *)asi/as te/rmona *fa=sin A.Fr.191 (anap.).
faskai/nw, baskai/nw, EM190.28.

faska/s, a/dos, h(, a kind of
duck, Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath.9.395d, cf. baska/s.

faski/a, h(, = Lat.
fascia, bandage, strip, Sor.1.56, Poll.2.166, Dura4 93 (iii A.D.), Edict.Diocl.28.37 (faski/nia Geronthr.),38, BGU814.10 (iii A. D.):—hence faskio/w,
bind with bandages, Dsc.Eup.2.69 (v.l.), Cyran.55.

fa/skon, fa/skos, v. sfa/kos 11. fa/skos, to/, = Lat.
fascis, bundle, Edict.Diocl.14.7,12.

fa/skw, used by Ep. only in impf. e)/faskon Il.13.100; Ep. fa/skon Od.24.75, Hes.Th.209: freq. in Trag. and Com. (but perh. never in pres. indic., v. infr.): as impf. of fhmi/ S.OT110, etc., also Ar. Ra.742; also imper. fa/ske E.Hel.1077, Arist.Rh.Al.1429a6; subj. fa/skw A.Ch.93, Ar.V.561 (anap.), Antipho 3.4.3, Lys.25.11, Is.10.11, PHal.1.134 (iii B. C.); opt. fa/skoimi S.Aj.1037, D.30.27; inf. fa/skein S.El.9, OT462, Ph.1411 (anap.), Ar.Ra.695 (troch.), X.Mem.1.2.52, al., Isoc.8.1; part. fa/skwn IG12.66.6, E.HF1382 (the only part of the Verb used in Th.（3.70) and Pl. (R.337e, al.), exc. e)/fasken Id.Lg.901a):—Pass. is not found, e)fa/sket' is for e)fa/skete S.Ph.114. Rare in pres. indic. before iii B.C.: fa/skei Is.6.16 (fa/skoi Reiske, Wyse), PMich.Zen.82.6 (iii B. C.), PSI8.921.7 (ii A. D.), dub. in S.E.P. 1.17 (v.l. fa/skoi), Gal.15.35, Gp.9.14.2, Hsch.; fa/skeis PSI9.1011.10 (iii B. C.); fa/skousi（n) Aeschin.Ep.11.11, PCair.Zen.21.25, 244.5, al. (iii B. C.), Plu.Ant.86, Ath.10.429b, Gp.5.2.9, etc.; fa/skomen is dub. cj. (for pa/sxomen) in Alex.146.4:—
say, affirm, assert, c. acc. et inf., Od.4.191, 8.565, al.; fa/skein as imper., in this constr., S.OT 462, Ph.1411 (anap.); ou) fasko/ntwn xrh/sein
saying they
would not . . , Hdt. 3.58; ou) fa/skwn a)nekto\n ei)=nai Th.8.52; the inf. is freq. to be supplied, e)n th=|d' e)/faske gh=| (sc. eu(reqh/sesqai) S.OT110; fhsi/n ge: fa/skwn d' (sc. h(/cein) Id.El.319; tw=n fasko/ntwn gone/wn (sc. ei)=nai) Pl. R.538a, etc.; rarely f. w(s . . , o(/ti . . , Mosch.2.12, Plu.2.215f: c. acc., tou=to f. tou)/pos A.Ch.93, cf. E.HF1382, etc.: abs., w(s e)/fasken S.OT 114; fa/skousa kai\ ou) fa/skousa Pl.Tht.190a.
think, deem, expect, o(\ ou)/ pot' e)/gwge teleuth/sesqai e)/faskon Il.13.100; ou)/ m' e)fa/skeq' . . oi)/kad' i(ke/sqai Od.22.35; fa/skein . . o(ra=n
believe that you see, S.El.9.
say, promise, c. inf. fut., me . . e)/faske qh/sein a)qa/naton Od.7.256; fa/skwn prospoih/sein au)th/n Th.2.85, cf. Pl.Ion541e.

fa/skwlos, o(,
leathern bag, wallet, scrip, Ar.Fr.319:—also fa/skwlon, to/, Lys.Fr.90 S., Is.Fr.171S.: a Dim. faskw/lion, to/, Teles p.38 H., D.Chr.7.55, Ael.NA7.29, Gal.2.559, Agath.4.22 (Phot. and EM789.5 distinguish faskw/lion
bag from fa/skwlon
purse).

fa/sma, atos, to/: (fai/nw):—
apparition, phantom, Hdt.6.69, 117, A.Ag.415 (lyr.), etc.; f. a)nqrw/pou
spectral appearance of a man, Hdt. 4.15; f. gunaiko/s Id.8.84, cf. Pl.Smp.179d; f. nerte/rwn E.Alc. 1127;
vision in a dream, o)nei/rwn fa/smata A.Ag.274, cf. S.El.644, etc.; f. nukto/s ib.501 (lyr.); nu/xia f. E.IT1263 (lyr.).
appearance, phenomenon, Pl.Tht.155a; a)natolh=s f. kai\ du/sews Epicur.Nat.11.8 (pl.), al.: so, of
strange phenomena in the heavens, Arist.Mete. 338b23, 342a35; of
images apprehended by sense, Diog.Oen.Fr. 7. of
shows or
mysteries, as
images or
types of realities, eu)dai/mona f. muou/menoi Pl.Phdr.250c.
sign from heaven, portent, omen, Hdt.3.10, 4.79, 7.37,38, 8.37, S.El.1466, Pl.Plt.268e, etc.; f. *kroni/da Pi.O.8.43, cf. A.Ag.145 (pl., lyr.); *palla/da . . eu)/shmon f. nauba/tais Eur.IA252 (lyr.).
monster, prodigy, periphr., fa/sma tau/rou, u(/dras,
a monster of a bull, of a hydra, S.Tr. 509 (lyr.), 837 codd. (lyr.); of the Sphinx, Epigr.Gr.1016.3.

fasma^tia/w,
see visions or
hallucinations, Hp.Ep.19 (Hermes 53.68).

fasma^to-loge/w,
to speak of prodigies. Sch. Luc.Icar. init.

fasma^to-fa/neia [fa^], h(,
spectral apparition, Sch.AristId.p.343 D.

fasma^tw/dhs, es,
like a vision, Sch.Luc.Icar.init.
fa/soulos, = fa/shlos 1, Cyran.30 (cf. fasi/oulos v. l. in Gal.6.542).

fa/ssa, Att. fa/tta, h(,
ringdove or
cushat. Columba palumbus, Ar.Ach.1104, Av.303 (troch.), Pax 1004 (anap.). Arist.HA544b5, Sor.1.51, 2.41, Gal.6.700, Vict.Att.8, Aret.CD1.2, Gp.15.1.19; labei=n f. a)nti\ peristera=s
a wild pigeon for a tame one, Pl.Tht.199b, cf. Alex. Aphr. in Top.117.9.—Luc.Sol.7 coined a masc. form fa/ttos.

fa/ssion, to/, =
palumbina, Gloss.

fasso-fo/nos, on,
dove-killing, i)/rhc Il.15.238:—as Subst., the name of a kind of hawk, Arist HA615b7, 620a18, Gal.UP11.18, Porph.Abst.3.8:—so fasso-fo/nths, ou, o(, = foreg., Ael.NA12.4.

fa^teio/s, h, o/n,
speakable, ou)/ ti fateio/s un
utterable, un
speakable, of horrid objects, *ke/rberos, *fo/bos, o)/fies, Hes.Th.310, Sc.144, 161; fa/sma kartero\n ou)/ ti f. Menoph.Damasc. ap. Stob.4.21.7.

fa^te/on, (fhmi/)
one must say, Pl.Lg.864a, Sph.237e, Plb.2.21.8;
one must call, eu)genei=s Jul.Or.2.83b: abs.,
one must say 'yes', assent, Pl.Phlb.40b, etc.

fa/ths [a^], ou, o(, (fhmi/)
talker, liar, Hsch.
fa_ti/, Dor. 3sg. pres. of fhmi/.

fa^ti/zw, Ion. and Dor. Verb, used also in Trag.,
tell of, diakosmon Parm.8.60; e)fa/tisan [ta\ gra/mmata] . . *foinikh/i+a keklh=sqai
they spoke of them by the name of Phoenician, Hdt.5.58; ou)de\n a)nau/daton fati/saim' a)/n S.Aj.715 (lyr.); generally,
say, fati/zw pa/lin "a)ga/lleu" Dius ap.Stob.4.21.17, cf. Hsch.;
make a statement in court, PGrenf. 2.78.22 (iv A. D.):—Pass.,
to be expressed, pefatisme/non e)sti/n Parm. 8.35;
to be said to do, c. inf., A.R.1.24, Eus.Mynd.63; to\ fatizo/menon
as the saying is, S.OC139 (lyr.); kata\ ta\ fatizo/mena Eus. Mynd. l. c.
promise, engage, betroth, pai=da/ tini E.IA135 (anap.):— Pass., e)mh\ fatisqei=sa my
promised bride, ib.936. Pass.,
to be called, named, *(ierh\ de\ fati/zetai A.R.1.1019; pefa/tistai Call. Jov.39, A.R.4.658, Nic.Fr.74.30; *qe/mis fati/zetai para\ toi=s ou)rani/ois qeoi=s, *di/ka de\ para\ toi=s xqoni/ois Theag. ap. Stob.3.1.117.

fa^tiko/s, h/, o/n, (fhmi/)
assertory: esp. of unsupported
assertion. Phld. Rh.1.8, 2.119 S. Adv. -kw=s ib.1.120 S.; f. mo/non xwri\s pi/stews ib. 1.40 S.

fa/tis [a^], h(: acc. fa/tin: voc. fa/ti S.OT151 (lyr.), fa/tis Id.Aj. 173 (lyr.): contr. acc. pl. fa/ti_s Pi.P.3.112 (s.v.l.): not found in any other cases: (fhui/):—poet. Noun, used also by Hdt.,
voice from heaven (not in Hom.),
oracle, f. *dio/s S.OT151 (lyr.), cf. 1440, E.Supp.834 (lyr.); a)po\ qesfa/twn ti/s a)gaqa\ f. brotoi=s ste/lletai; A.Ag.1132 (lyr.); a)p' oi)wnw=n S.OT310; *mousa/wn Ar.Av.924 (lyr.); of a dream, A.Pers.227 (troch.); of the interpreter of dreams, ib. 521.
voice or
saying among men,
common talk, rumour, ai)sxuno/menoi fa/tin a)ndrw=n h)de\ gunaikw=n Od.21.323, cf. Sol.2.3; f. a)nqrw/pous a)nabai/nei e)sqlh/ good
report. Od.6.29; eu)kleh/s E.Fr.242; f. barei=a A.Ag.456 (lyr.); e)pi/yogos ib.611; kaka/ S.Aj.186 (lyr.); f. e)/tumos, nhmerth/s, E.IA794 (lyr.), Lyc.1051; mayi/dios, yeudh/s, E.Hel.251 (lyr.), AP7.239 (Parmen.); in Doric Prose, PSI9.1091.5: c. gen. objecti, f. mnhsth/rwn
a report of the suitors, Od.23.362: but kata\ tw=n i(re/wn th\n fa/tin as the priests'
story runs, Hdt.2.102; w(s f. o(/rmhtai Id.7.189; f. kratei= A.Supp.294; w(/sper h( f. S.OT715; w(s f. a)ndrw=n Id.Ant. 829 (lyr.); ou(/tw f. au)da=| E.Ion225 (lyr.): h( f. min e)/xei
the report goes of him . . , Hdt.7.3, cf. 8.94; e)xqra\ *fa/larin kate/xei fa/tis Pi.P. 1.96: reversely, in same sense, e)/xei tina\ fa/tin a)nh\r *)efe/sios Hdt.9.84, cf. E.Hel.l. c.: fa/tin a)gge/llein, fe/rein, Batr. 138, A.Ag.9, etc.; a)=rai S.Aj.191 (lyr.); katabalei=n f. w(s . . Hdt.1.122; klu/ein fa/tin S.Aj.850; f. e)pe/rxetai, h)=lqe/ tini, Id.Ant.700, E.Hipp.130 (lyr.); e)s tou\s dh/mous f. a)pi/keto w(s . . Hdt.1.60; e)nqeu=ten f. kexw/rhke ib.122; h)= s' e)pi/ane/n tis a)/pteros f.; A.Ag.276;
proverb, f. au)toi=sin marturei= Heraclit.34 (cf. Trag.Adesp.517).
subject of a saying or
report, *ne/stora kai\ *sarpado/n', a)nqrw/pwn fa/tis
themes of many a tale, Pi.P.3.112 (s. v. l.); de/rkomai fa/tin a)/fraston
a thing unspeakable, S.Tr.693.
speech. words, of a single person, Id.Ph.1045, El. 329,1213.
speech, language, *(/ellhn' e)pi/stamai fa/tin A.Ag. 1254.
a name, Id.Fr.6.

fatn-eu/w,
feed at the manger, Thd.Pr.14.4 (Pass.), Oenom. ap. Eus.PE5.34 (Pass.).

fa/tn-h, h(,
manger, crib, [i(/ppous] a)ti/tall' e)pi\ fa/tnh| Il.5.271; i(/ppos a)kosth/sas e)pi\ f. 6.506; i(/ppous me\n kate/dhsan . . fa/tnh| e)f' i(ppei/h| 10.568; e)u+ce/sth| e)pi\ f. 24.280; h( f. tw=n i(/ppwn Hdt.9.70, cf. E.Ba.510 (pl.), X.Cyr.3.3.27 (pl.), Ev.Luc.2.7, al.; fa/tnai *zhno\s, of the
manger of Pegasus, Pi.O.13.92: also of oxen, w(/s ti/s te kate/ktane bou=n e)pi\ f. Od.4.535, 11.411. bou=s e)pi\ f., proverb. of ease and comfort, Philostr.Im.2.10; also plousi/an e)/xein f. E.Fr.378; fa/tnais a)rgurai=s xrh=sqai Str.3.2.14; h( e)n th=| f. ku/wn 'the dog in the manger', Luc.Tim.14, cf. AP12.236 (Strat.); qerapeu/ein th\n f. tino/s to court one who feeds you, Ael.Fr.107; tou\s e)k th=s au)th=s oi(onei\ f. e)dhdoko/tas ib.39: th\n au)th\n f. zhtei=n to return to their old
haunts, Eub.129. = fa/tnwma 1, IG11(2).161 A46 (Delos, iii B. C.): pl., ib.42(1).109 iii 85, al. (Epid., iii B. C.), D.S.1.66.
socket of tooth, Poll.2.93. the
Manger, name of the nebula (star-cluster) between the o)/noi in Cancer, Thphr. Sign.23, al., Arat.892,898, Eratosth.Cat.11, Ptol.Tetr.23. (Later Gr. pa/qnh acc. to Moer., but fa/tnh in Attic and Delian Inscrr., IG22.1487.37, 11(2).l. c.,
Inscr.Déios504 A6, B9:
bhndh, cf. Skt.
badhnāti 'tie', Celt.
benn 'wicker chariot'.)

fatn-i/zomai, Pass.,
to be kept at rack and manger, i(/ppos fatnizo/menos Hld.7.29:—also fatn-a/zomai, Aq. Pr.14.4.

fatn-i/on, to/, Dim. of fa/tnh,
socket of a tooth, Sor.1.118, Gal. 2.754, UP11.8:
gum, to\ a)nwte/rw f. Ph.2.238.
fa/tn-ios, o(, epith. of Zeus at Laodicea Combusta. MAMA1.7.

fatn-o/w, (fa/tnh)
roof, ceil, LXX 3 Ki.7.40(3):—Pass., ib.Ez.41.15.

fa/tn-wma, atos, to/,
coffered work in a ceiling, A.Fr.78: pl.,
coffers or
compartments, Plb. 10.27.10, Callix.2; cu/lina f. IGRom.4.556 (Ancyra).
projecting platform, Moschio ap Ath.5.208b. = fatni/on, Gal.14.778, Simp. in Ph.371.21, Eust.547.4; =
mandibulum, Gloss.

fatn-wma^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
coffered, ste/ghs paraskeuh/ Plu.2.227c; in form paqnwmatiko/s (cf. fa/tnh fin.) MAMA4.293 (Dionysopolis, i A. D.).

fa/tn-wsis, ews, h(,
ceiling in coffers, LXX 3 Ki.6.14(9) cod.A (pl.), Sm.Ca.1.17.

fatn-wto/s, h/, o/n,
coffered, Hsch., Phot.

fa^to/s (A), h/, o/n, (fhmi/)
spoken or
that may be spoken, mostly with negat., ou) f. un
speakable, un
utterable, in
effable, Hes.Sc.230, Parm. 8.8, Pi.O.6.37, I.7(6).37; to\ mh\ f. mhde\ r(hto\n ka/llos Plu.2.383a; pleon., ka/llos ou) f. le/gein Ar.Av.1713. Adv. ou) fatw=s, = a)fa/tws, Hsch.
famous, notable, a)/ndres a)/fatoi/ te f. te Hes.Op.3.

fa^to/s (B), h/, o/n, (qei/nw 11)
slain, dead, Hsch.
fa/tra, fatri/a, fatria/rxhs, v. fratr-.

fatria/, h(,
brother's wife, Gloss.
fa/tta, h(, Att. for fa/ssa.

fatta/ghs, ou, o(, perh.
pangolin or
scaly ant-eater, manis, Ael. NA16.6.
fa/ttion, to/, Dim. of fa/tta. nhtta/rion a)\n kai\ f. u(pekori/zeto Ar.Pl. 1011, cf. Ephipp. 15.8.
fa/ttos, v. fa/ssa.
fau/zw, = fru/gw, Hsch., Phot.; cf. fau=sigc.

faulepi/faulos, on,
bad upon bad, bad as bad can be, AP11.238 (Sup., Demod.).
faul-i/a, h(, v. fau/lios.

faul-i/zw,
hold cheap, nomoqe/tas Pl. Lg.667a; th\n di/aita/n mou X.Mem.1.6.5, cf. 4.4.14; ta\ prwtotokei=a LXX Ge.25.34.

fau/l-ios, a, on, = fau=los, only used of fruits,
coarse, mh=la f. Telecl.4, Theopomp.Com.19; f. e)lai/a, and fauli/a alone,
a coarse kind of olive, produced from the ko/tinos or wild-olive, Thphr.CP6.8.3, HP2.2.12 (prob.), Od.15, Luc.Lex.5, Poll.6.45.

fau/l-isma, atos, to/
disparagement, contempt, LXXZe.3.11.
faul-ismo/s, o(, = foreg., ib. Is.51.7, al.

faul-i/stria, h(,
she that despises, ib.Ze.3.1.

faulo/-bi^os, on,
living disreputably, Sch.Ar.Ra.425.

faulo/-nous, oun,
ill-disposed, Sch.Ar.Nu.629.

faulo-rrhmo/nws, (r(h=ma) Adv.
speaking evilly or
ill, Poll.8.81.

fau=los, h, on, also os, on E.Hipp.435, Fr.1083.9, Th.6.21: (cf. flau=ros):—
cheap, easy, slight, paltry, first found commonly in E., twicein Hdt.1.26, 126（Comp., elsewh.flau=ros), six times in Democr., Fr.87, al., twice in S., Frr.41,771: Adv. fau/lws once in A.: A. Pers. 520. of things,
easy, slight, f. a)qlh/sas po/non E.Supp.317; faulo/taton e)/rgon ''tis as easy as lying', Ar.Eq.213; f. pra=gma Id.Lys.14; to\ zh/thma ou) f. Pl.R.368c; f. e)rw/thma Id.Phlb.19a; fau=lon au)toi=s prosta/comen Id.R.423c: freq. with negat., ou) f., a)lla\ xalepo\n pisteu=sai ib.527d; ma/xh ou) f. Id.Tht.179d; ou) f. te/xnh Id.Sph.223c; ou)/toi basile/a fau=lo/n [e)sti] ktanei=n 'tis no
slight matter to kill a king, E.El.760; nukto\s ga\r ou)/ti f. e)mbalei=n strato/n no
easy matter, Id.Rh.285; ou) f. plhgai/ D.54.13; filou=sin i)atroi\ le/gein ta\ fau=la mei/zw Men.497; fau=la e)pife/rein bring
paltry charges, Hdt.1.26; ta\ f. nikh/sas e)/xw have gained
petty victories, S.Fr.41 (wrongly glossed by me/ga in Phot., Suid., and EM789.43, cf. Hsch); su/mmaxon *troi/a| molo/nta *(rh=son ou) fau/lw| tro/pw|, i. e. with no
trivial force, E.Rh. 599; para\ fau=lon poiei=sqai/ ti D.H.Rh.4.2, cf. Lib.Or.14.26. Adv. -lws eu(rei=n, tuxei=n, Ar.Eq.404 (troch.), 509 (anap.); f. pa/nu Id.Lys. 566 (anap.); f. e)kfugei=n to get off
easily, Id.Ach.215 (lyr.); f. a)podra/s Id.Th.711 (lyr.); faulo/tata kai\ r(a=|sta Id.Nu.778; ou)/ti fau/lws h)=lqe
with no
trivial force, E.Ph.112; f. bohqh/sein D.15.13; fau/lws kai\ gli/sxrws parei/xonto xrh/mata Hell.Oxy.14.2; ta\s e)lpi/das f. e)/xein to be
slight, Hdn.1.3.1.
simple, ordinary, di/aita Hp.Fract.36, Art.49, Eur.Fr.213.4; si=ta kai\ pota\ faulo/tata X.Mem.1.6.2, cf. Hp. Vict.3.68 (Comp.); but freq. with sense
poor, indifferent, stratia/ Th.6.21; a)spi/des, tei/xisma, paraskeuh/, Id.4.9.115, 6.31; i(ma/tion X. l. c. Adv. -lws, diatri/bein e)n filosofi/a| Pl.Tht.173c; mh\ f. mhde\ i)diwtikw=s Id.Lg.966e.
mean, bad, prh=cis Democr.177; lo/goi E. Andr.870, yo/gos Id.Ph.94 (perh. both in signf. 1.1 and in 1.3);
ou) f. o)/yis Pl.R.519a; f. do/ca D.24.205; ta\ pra/gmat' e)sti\ f. Id.19.30; fau=la diapepragme/nos Philem.229; o( fau=la pra/ttwn Ev.Jo.3.20; mhde\ praca/ntwn ti a)gaqo\n h)\ f. Ep.Rom.9.11; to\ f.
evil, E.IT390; ta\ f., opp. ta\ a)gaqa/, X.Smp.4.47; tu/xh f., opp. a)gaqh/, Arist.Ph. 197a26, cf. Metaph.1065a35; th\n po/lin mhqe\m f. paqei=n OGI765.35 (Priene); komi/sasqai . . ei)/te a)gaqo\n ei)/te f., of rewards and punishments, 2 Ep.Cor.5.10; f. mai/wsis Sor.2.17, cf. 1.91, al. of persons,
low in rank,
mean, common, E.Fr.688; oi( faulo/tatoi
the commonest sort (of soldiers), Th.7.77; [ga/mos] o( e)k tw=n faulote/rwn, opp. e)k meizo/nwn, X.Hier.1.27, cf. Pl.R.475b; of outward looks, ai( faulo/terai
the plainer ones, Ar.Ec.617, cf. 626 (Comp., both anap.).
inefficient, bad, dida/skalos S.Fr.771.3; to\ f. kai\ to\ me/son kai\ to\ pa/nu a)kribe/s
the inefficient, the middling, and the perfect, Th.6.18; f. au)lhth/s, opp. a)gaqo/s, Pl.Prt.327c; toco/ths Id.Tht.194a; ou) de\ fau/lwn a)ndrw=n ou)de\ tw=n e)pituxo/ntwn Id.Cra. 390d; opp. spoudai=os, Isoc.1.1, Pl.Lg.757a, etc.; esp. in point of education and accomplishments, opp. sofo/s, oi( ga\r e)n sofoi=s fau=loi par' o)/xlw| mousikw/teroi le/gein E.Hipp.989, cf. Ph.496, Ion 834, Pl.Smp.174c, Alc.1.129a; to\ plh=qos to\ -o/teron E.Ba.431 (lyr.); oi( -o/teroi, opp. to oi( cunetw/teroi, Th.3.37; oi( faulo/teroi gnw/mhn ib.83; ta\ gra/mmata fau=loi Pl.Phdr.242c (so in Adv., faulote/rws pepaideume/noi Id.Lg.876d); generally,
inferior, Id.Grg.483c: c. inf., fau=loi ma/xesqai E.IT305; f. le/gein, f. dialexqh=nai, Pl.Tht.181b, Prt. 336c: of animals, f. ku/wn D.26.22; faulo/tatoi i(/ppoi X.Mem.4.1.3.
careless, thoughtless, indifferent, E.Med.807:—esp. in Adv., fau/lws e)kri/nate judged
lightly, A.Pers.520; f. eu(/dein E.Rh. 769; ou)x w(=de f. Id.Ion1546; f. parainei=n
off-hand, Id.HF89; lo/gisai fau/lws mh\ yh/fois a)ll' a)po\ xeiro/s
off-hand, roughly, Ar.V.656 (anap.); f. ei)pei=n
casually, Pl.R.449c; f. fe/rein to bear
lightly, E. IA850, Ar.Av.961. in good sense,
simple, unaffected, fau=lon, a)/komyon, ta\ me/gist' a)gaqo/n E.Fr.473 (anap.), cf. D.L.3.63. Adv. -lws, paideu/ein tina/
by a very simple method, X.Oec.13.4; f. kai\ braxe/ws a)pokri/nasqai Pl.Tht.147c. of health, etc., fau/lws e)/xein to be
ill, Hp.Aph.2.32; f. pra/ttein to be
in sorry plight, Men. Sam.165; f. e)/xei ta\ pra/gmata D.10.3, al.

faulo/ths, htos, h(,
meanness, poorness, badness, of persons and things, Pl.Lg.646b, Isoc.4.146 (pl.); th=s stolh=s X.Cyr.2.4.5; tw=n brwma/twn ib.5.2.16; f. xw/ras, opp. a)reth/,
poorness of soil, Pl.Lg. 745d; opp. e)piei/keia, Arist.EN1175b25; f. monarxi/as h( turanni/s ib. 1160b10: in pl.,
states of bad health, Dsc.2.49.
want of accomplishments or
skill, Hp.Art.77 (v.l. for flauro/ths), E.Fr.641; strathgw=nf. D.18.303; h( e)mh\ f. my
lack of judgement, my
poor judgement, X.Mem.4.2.39, Pl.Hp.Ma.286d. in good sense,
plainness, simplicity of life, h( a)mfi\ to\ sw=ma f. X.Ages.11.11, cf. HG4.1.30.

faulourgo/s, o/n,
working ill, Ar.Fr.882: cf. flaurourgo/s.
fau=nos: fai/nwn e(auto/n, Hsch.; fauo/n: a)kanqw=des futo/n, Id.
fauofo/ros, h(, Aeol. = i(e/reia, Hsch. fau=ros: kou=fos, Id.

faurofo/ros, on, dub. sens., pa/ntes faurofo/roi po/ktoisi fe/ron Call.
Fr.anon.132( = Lyr.Adesp.73) ap.Et.Gen.cod.A (faurote/rois cod. B); farofo/roi, referring to sheep
clad in leathern coats, cj. Reitzenstein Ind.Lect.Rost.1891/2p.4.

fau=sigc, iggos, h(, (fau/zw)
blister from burning, also
any blister or
pustule, Ar.Fr.883 (pl., fau/stigges Phot.), Hp. ap. Gal.19.150, Poll. 7.110.
fausi/mbrotos, on, = faesi/mbrotos, Pi.O.7.39.

fau=sis, ews, h(, (fa/w)
lighting, illumination, th=s gh=s LXXGe.1.15, cf. Ju.13.13. Astron. = fa/sis, f. e)k tw=n tou= h(li/ou au)gw=n heliacal
rising, Theo Sm.p.137 H.
fau/skw, cited in EM673.51, al., but only found in the compds. dia-, e)pi-, u(po-fau/skw, and in redupl. pifau/skw.

entryFree.foreign: spla/gxna e)k si/twn pepoihme/na kai\ ai( a)parxai\ tw=n pemma/twn,

div0.entryFree:
fausth/r, h=ros, o(,
lamp or
candelabrum, or perh.
large window, IG42(1).109 ii105.147 (Epid., iii B. C.).
fausth/rios, o(, epith. of Bacchus, from the torches used in his orgies, Lyc.212.
fau/w, Aeol. form of fa/w, Hsch., EM789.28, Eust.1728.6.

fa/y, h(, gen. fa^bo/s,
wild pigeon, A.Frr.210, 257, Arist.HA593a15, al., Lyc.580.

fa/w [a^],
shine, fa/e de\ xruso/qronos *)hw/s Od.14.502; *xhlai\ lepta\ fa/ousai Arat.607:—Hsch. also cites a part. fw=nta = la/mponta, and Ep.aor. 2 pe/fh = e)fa/nh. (fav-, cf. fa/os, fau=sis.）
fawto/s, a/, o/n, = faio/s, xlai=na Schwyzer 323 C24 (Delph., iv B.C.).

fe/bomai, poet. Pass., only pres. and impf., = fobe/omai,
to be put to flight, flee in terror, oi( d' e)fe/bonto kata\ me/garon Od.22.299; e)/nqa kai\ e)/nqa fe/bonto Il. 15.345; e)/nqa kai\ e)/nqa diwke/men h)de\ fe/besqai 8.107; ai)/ ke fe/bwmai plhqu\n tarbh/sas 11.404; me/non e)/mpedon ou)de\ fe/bonto 5.527; u(p' *)argei/oisi fe/bonto 11.121; pedi/onde fe/besqai A.R. 3.1345: c. acc.,
flee from, febw/meqa *tude/os ui(o/n Il.5.232. (Cf. fo/bos, fobe/w, fobero/s, Lith.
běgti 'run'.)
feggai=on, prob. f.l. for fegge/wn (gen. pl. of fe/ggos) in Aen. Tact.10.26.
feggi/ths [i_], ou, o(, = selhni/ths, Plin.HN36.163, Alex.Aphr.in Sens.29.7, Tz.ad Lyc.98.

feggobole/w, = a)ktinobole/w, a)kti=si *selh/nhn Man.4.367, cf. 264, 571:
shine, ib.527.

fe/ggos, eos, to/,
light, splendour, lustre, th=le de\ f. a)po\ xroo\s a)qana/toio la/mpe qea=s h.Cer.278; to\ f. th=s xro/as Duris 14 J.; to\ f. th=s do/chs *kuri/ou LXXEz.10.4; f. a)straph=s o(/plwn ib.Hb.3.11: freq. like fa/os, of
daylight, either abs. or with some word added, f. h(li/ou A.Pers.377, S.Tr.606, etc.; to\ f. tou= qeou= E.Alc.722; without the Art., f. ei)sora=n qeou= Id.Or.1025, cf. S.Aj.673; w)= fe/ggos ib.859, E.El.866; w)= f. h(me/ras A.Ag.1577; deka/tw| fe/ggei e)/tous in the tenth year, ib.504.
moonlight, X.Cyn.5.4; nukterina\ fe/ggh, opp. h(merino\n fw=s, Pl.R.508c; e)a\n to\ f. e)klei/yh| Cat.Cod.Astr.4.172, cf. Nonn.D.38.255; fw=s h(me/ras, fe/ggos selh/nhs Hsch. s.v. fe/ggos; to\ f. [tou= ga/laktos], of the milky way, Arist.Mete.346a26. of men, f. i)dei=n, prosidei=n, to see
the light, come into the world, e)pei\ pa/mprwton ei)=don f. Pi.P.4.111; a)eli/ou prosidei=n f. B.5.162; lipei=n f. E.Or.954; o)/lwla, f. ou)ke/t' e)/sti moi S.Tr.1144.
day, tritai=on h)/dh f. E.Hec.32, cf. Sosiph.3.1; moiri/dion f. = m. h)=mar, E.Eleg.2.
the light of torches or fire, f. lampa/dwn A.Eu. 1022; puro/s ib.1029, Ch.1037:
a light, torch, Ar.Ra.448, X.Smp.1.9; pl. fe/ggh
torches or
watch-fires, Aen.Tact.10.26 (cj.), Plu.Cam.25, etc.
the light of the eyes, f. o)mma/twn E.Hec.368, 1035; o)/sswn Theoc.24.75; tuflo\n f, i.e. blindness, E.Hec.1068 (lyr.).
light, as a metaph. for delight, glory, pride, joy, Pi.P.8.97, N.3.64,4.13; ti/ ga\r gunaiki\ tou/tou f. h(/dion drakei=n, a)po\ stratei/as a)ndri\ sw/santos qeou= pu/las a)noi=cai; A.Ag.602; of persons, Pi.N.9.42; me/ga brotoi=si f. *)asklhpio/n Ar.Pl.640 (lyr.); *mouse/wn f. *(/omhron AP7.6 (Antip. Sid.); w)= tai=s i(erai=s f. *)aqh/nais Ar.Eq.1319 (anap.); plou=tos . . a)ndri\ f. Pi.O.2.56; f. o)pw/ras, of wine, Id.Fr.153.
lustre, dikaiosu/nhs kai\ swfrosu/nhs Pl.Phdr.250b; f. e)le/ous LXX 3 Ma.6.4; th=s yuxh=s to\ ga/nwma kai\ to\ f. Plu.2.792a, etc.

fe/ggw, = fai/nw,
make bright, Hsch.:—Pass.,
shine, gleam, flogi\ fe/ggetai leimw/n Ar.Ra.344(lyr.). intr.,
shine, o( lampth\r fegge/tw Aen.Tact.26.3, cf. A.R.4.1714, J.AJ3.8.3.
fei=, to/, name of the letter f, Callias ap.Ath.10.453d, Hellad. ap. Phot.Bibl.530B.; fei= shd. be restored for fi= in Pl.Cra.427a, etc.; a pun on ff = *fidi/s (leg. *feidi/s) in AP7.429（Alc.).

feidalfi^te/w,
to be sparing of barley: hence,
to be thrifty, Com. Adesp.1187. Adv. faulo/-tws,
thriftily, Phryn.PSp.180 B.

*feidia^ko/s, h/, o/n,
made by Phidias, a)ndria/s Arr.Epict.2.19.23.
feid-i/ths [i_],
feid-i/tia, v. fid-i/ths, -i/tion.

fei/domai, Anacr.101, etc.: impf. fei/donto (without augm.) even in S.El.716 after a diphth. at the end of the preceding line: fut. fei/somai Ar.Ach.312 (troch.), Pl.Ap.31a, etc., Ep. pefi^dh/somai Il.15.215, later fut. Pass. in med. sense f<e>isqh/somai PUniv.Giss.21.6 (ii A.D.): aor. 1 e)feisa/mhn Sol.32.1, A.Th.412, And.2.11, etc., Ep.3sg. fei/sato Il.24.236: Ep. redupl. aor. 2 pefi^do/mhn, used by Hom. in opt. pefi^doi/mhn, pefi/doito, Od.9.277, Il.20.464, inf. pefide/sqai 21.101: pf. part. pefeisme/nos Luc.Hist.Conscr.59 (in med. sense, D.C. 50.20); Ep. imper. pefi/dhso IG14.1363.16; part. pefidhme/nos Nonn. D.12.392:—
spare:
spare persons and things, e.g. in war, i.e.
not destroy them, c. gen., *trw/wn Il.21.101; a)ndro/s 24.158, cf. Od.9.277, 22.54, Pl.Ap.31a; *)ili/ou Il.15.215; *)/arhs ou)k a)gaqw=n f. Anacr. l. c.; a)p' a)ndrw=n w(=n *)/arhs e)fei/sato A.Th.412; gh=s patri/dos Sol. l.c.; mh\ fei/sh| bi/ou
spare not my life, S.Ph.749; mh\ fei/desqe . . stratou= Id.Aj. 844; f. mh/te i)di/ou mh/te dhmosi/ou oi)kodomh/matos Th.1.90, cf. 3.74: abs.,
spare, be merciful, ib.59.
spare persons and things in using them,
use sparingly, i(/ppwn feido/menos, i. e.
taking care of them, Il.5.202; pi/qou messo/qi f. Hes.Op.369; f. o(\n ei)=xe bi/on （bi/on by attraction to the relat.) Thgn.908; i)di/a| me\n tw=n <o)/ntwn> fei/domai dhmosi/a| de\ lh|tourgw=n h(/domai Lys.21.16; fei/desqe tou)lai/ou sfo/dra Pl. Com.190: in this sense, most freq. with a negat., ou) f. not
to spare, i. e.
to use or
give freely, ou)de/ nu tou= per [de/paos] fei/sato Il.24.236; mh\ fei/deo si/tou Hes.Op.604; qnh/|skwmen yuxe/wn mhke/ti feido/menoi Tyrt.10.14; ta=s zwa=s Id.15.5; sfete/ras ou) fei/sato neura=s Pi.I.6(5).33; fei/deo tw=n new=n, mhde\ naumaxi/hn poie/o Hdt.8.68. a/; tou/twn f. mhdeno/s Id.9.41, cf. 39; fei/donto ke/ntrwn ou)de/n S.El.716; ou)de\n f. au)tw=n ou)/t' e)n po/nois ktl. X.Cyr.4.2.1, cf. 7.1.29; ou)/te tou= sw/matos ou)/te tw=n o)/ntwn And.2.11; ou)deno\s a)\n e)fei/sato tw=n e(autou= Lys.19.24; ou)/q' i(erw=n ktea/nwn ou)/te ti dhmosi/wn f. Sol.4.13; mh/te xrhma/twn mh/te po/nwn Pl.Phd.78a: later also c. acc., tw=n summa/xwn and ta\ tw=n summa/xwn both in D.C.50.20. abs.,
to be sparing, live thriftily, fei/desqai me\n a)/meinon Thgn.931; tou\s feidome/nous kai\ tou\s a)kribw=s diaitw=ntas And.4.32; oi( gewrgou=ntes kai\ f. D.24.172, cf. Antipho Soph.53; freq. in part. feido/menos, h, on,
thrifty, Ar.Pl.247,553 (anap.), etc.; o)/mmasi feidome/nois with
shrinking, shy eyes, AP12.21 (Strat.), cf. 5.215 (Agath.), 268 (Id.); ai( mh\ f. (sc. me/lissai) the un
thrifty ones, Arist.HA627a20: also e)/painoi pa/nu pefeisme/noi Luc.Hist.Conscr.59; pefidhme/na da/ktula Nonn.D.12.392; cf. pefeisme/nws, feidome/nws.
have consideration for, th=s tou= lo/gou summetri/as Plu.2.114b: with neg.,
pay no
heed to, ou)/t' a)nqrw/pwn fei/detai ou)/te qew=n AP5.278 (Paul.Sil.), cf. 7.706 (Diog.).
draw back from, refrain from, qala/ssas Alc.Supp.4.13 (prob.); keleu/qou Pi.N.9.20; kindu/nou X.Cyr.5.5.18; ta=s qh/ras BionFr.10.12; tou= le/gein, tou= a)kolouqei=n, X.Cyr.1.6.19 (v.l.), HG7.1.24; fei/dou mhde\n w(=nper e)nnoei=s S.Aj.115, cf. E.Med.401, etc.; ou)deno\s feisa/menos ou)/te tw=n pro\s tou\s qeou\s ou)/te tw=n pro\s tou\s poli/tas dikai/wn SIG708.36 (Istropolis, ii B.C.): (abs., mh\ fei/desqe E.Tr.1285; fei/dou mhde/n Id.Hec.1044; mh\ fei/dou, ei)/ ti e)/xeis dida/skein X.Cyr.1.6.35): c. inf.,
spare to do,
forbear from doing, dub. in E.Or.393 (fort. abs., post fei/dou d' distinguendum); also f. mh/ ti dra=sai tw=n turannikw=n Pl.R.574b; ti/ feido/mesqa tw=n li/qwn . . mh\ ou) katacai/nein to\n a)/ndra; Ar.Ach.319 (troch.). in LXX, with Preps., f. e)pi/ tini
have mercy upon . . , Je. 15.5, 21.7; e)pi/ tina Id.28(51).3; f. peri/ tinos
to keep one's hands off . . , 2 Ki.12.6 (but f. peri\ kakw/sews
spare to hurt,
ib.Si.13.12); f. u(pe\r th=s koloku/nqhs Jn.4.10; a)po/ tinos 1 Ki.15.3, Ez. 24.21; f. ti a)po/ tinos
keep it
off, Jb.30.10; f. th=s yuxh=s a)po\ qana/tou ib.33.18, cf. Ps.18(19).14; feideu/menoi (from contr. feide/omai) is cj. for fileu/menai in Eus.Mynd.17.

feidome/nws, Adv.
sparingly, thriftily, 2 Ep.Cor.9.6, Plu.Alex.25; cf. pefeisme/nws.

feid-o/s, h/, o/n,
sparing, thrifty, Com.Adesp.101: written fido/s by Call. (Fr.460) acc. to EM791.12 (cod. V): Comp., feido/teros e)s ta\ xrh/mata Democr.279: hence Com.pr.n. *feidu/los, Philippid.6.

feid-w/ o/os, contr. ou=s, h(:
sparing, veku/wn Il.7.409; bi/ou E.Fr.438 (dub.); a)/neu panto\s oi)/ktou kai\ feidou=s LXXEs.3.13; ou)/te f. tw=n pai/dwn ou)/t' e)/leon e)/sxon D.H.8.79 (but th=s ai)dou=s o)li/ghn poih/sasqai feidw/
consideration for . . , S.E.M.2.27); feidw\s (sic cod. P) tw=n paradeigma/twn e)/stw Longin.22.4; o)pw/ras f. e)/stw Orib.Fr.55; f. tis e)gi/gneto . . mh\ proanalwqh=nai (sc. th\n eu)pragi/an) Th.7.81. abs.,
thrift, sparing, kth/mata darda/ptousin u(pe/rbion, ou)d' e)/pi feidw/ Od.14.92, cf. 16.315, Hes.Op.369; f. kai\ limo/s Democr.229; f. ponhra/ E.Fr.407; opp. a)swti/a, Arist.Rh.1390b1.
feidwl-h/, h(, = foreg., Il.22.244, Sol.13.46, AP12.31 (Phan.).
feidwl-i/a, h(, = feidw/ 11, Ar.Nu.835, Ec.750, Pl.R.572c, etc. = a)kri/beia, to/cou xrw/menos feidwli/a| Trag.Adesp.569.

feidwl-o/s, h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n Ar.Nu.421 (anap.), Lys.1.7:—
sparing, thrifty, and as Subst.,
niggard, miser, Ar. Pl.237, Eup.154, Democr.228, Pl.R.554a, al.; f. gasth/r Ar.Nu. l.c.; f. glw=ssa
a niggard tongue, i.e. sparing of words, Hes. Op. 720: c. gen., f. xrhma/twn Pl.R.548b; to/cwn Anon.Trop.p.209 S. (cf. feidwli/a 11); f. peri/ tina Eus.Mynd.6; to\ f. au)tou= th=s yuxh=s Pl.R.560c; to\ f. e)n dapa/nais Plu.Galb.3; qnhta/ te kai\ f. oi)konomou=sa pursuing earthly and
niggardly practices, Pl.Phdr.256e; f. me/trw| Alciphr.3.57 (nisi leg. *feidwni/w|, cf. sq. 11). Adv., teqramme/nos . . a)paideu/tws te kai\ feidwlw=s Id.R.559d.
merciful, PMag.Leid.V.9.3.

fei/dwn, wnos, o(,
oil-can with a narrow neck, that lets only a little run out, Poll.10.179, cf. 11.1. as pr.n. *fei/dwn, king of Argos, the author of Peloponnesian weights and measures, Hdt.6.127:— hence Adj. feidw/neios or feidw/nios, a, on, me/tra Arist.Ath.10.2, Fr.480, Thphr.Char.30.11, Str.8.3.33 (Poll. l. c. connects signf. 1 with the Adj.); me/dimnoi *f. Delph.3(5).3 ii 3 (iv B. C.). name of an old man in Com.,
Thrifty, Antiph.191.21, etc.:—hence Com. patron. feidwni/dhs [i^], ou, o(,
Thrifty-son, Ar.Nu.65.

feidw/s,
parsimonia, Gloss.
feira/w, v. qhra/w.

feismonh/, h(,
sparing, mercy, Phot., Suid.

feiste/on,
one must spare, Isoc.14.15.
one must use sparingly, e)pai/nou Plu.2.91a; klusmw=n Ruf. ap. Orib.8.24.31, cf. Archig. ap. Aët.9.42, Philum.ib.12.

fe/klh, h(, = Lat.
faecula, Ruf.Fr.115, Critoap.Gal.12.490; cf. sfe/klh, fai/kla.
feli/zw, dub. sens. in Hippon.14.3.
fella^gwgi/a, h(, perh. due to a confusion with fall-, Suid. (expld. as a Roman festival).

fella/ta_s [la_] li/qos, gen. a Polem.Hist.73, o(:—a kind of
stone, of which statues were made, Polem.Hist. l.c., Hsch.; also fellea/tas, called Dor. and expld. by kisshrw/deis li/qoi in Sch.Ar.Nu.71 (felle/tas, Suid.); prob. the same as
pilates and
pelastes cited (acc. to codd.) fr. Cato by Fest.p.268L. (Cf. sq.)

felleu/s, e/ws, o(,
stony ground, Cratin.271 (pl.), Is.8.42 (acc. sg., xwri/a a)/tta delendum), IG22.1582.53; fe/llera is corrupt in AB 315 and fello/s in Hsch. felleu/s, name of a
rocky district of Attica, Ar.Ach.273, Nu.71, Pl.Criti.111c:—fellei/ths, ou, o(,
a man of Phelleus, St.Byz.

felleu/w, (fello/s)
float like a cork, Hsch.
fellew/n, w=nos, o(, = felleu/s 1, Arr.Cyn.17.
felli/nas: kou=fos, a)po\ tou= fellou=, Hsch.:—pl. felli=nai (fort. felli/nai) as name of a kind of water-fowl, Dionys.Av.3.23.

fe/lli^nos, h, on,
made of cork, Luc.VH2.4.
felli/on, to/, = felleu/s 1, X.Cyn.5.18 (pl.).
felli\s gh=, = foreg., Poll.1.227: *fellei=da is pr.n. of a piece of land in IG22.2492.1,32 (the older form was prob. fellhi/+s （fellh/|s）: a)fellh/s is v. l. in Poll. l. c.).

fello/dru_s, u^os, h(,
holm-oak, Quercus Ilex var.
agrifolia, Thphr. HP1.9.3, 3.3.3, 3.16.3.

fello/pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
cork-footed, Luc.VH2.4.

fello/s, o(,
cork-oak, Quercus Suber, Thphr.HP1.2.7, 1.5.2, al.
cork, fellw=n kai\ bi/blwn kai\ desmw=n e)rgastikai\ [te/xnai] Pl.Plt.288e: esp. of the
corks on a net, Pi.P.2.80, A.Ch.506; in a cistern or bowl, Hero Spir.1.20, POxy.2146.7 (iii A. D.).

felloxa^laste/w,
loosen corks which hold nets (?), apptly. function of an official in a guild of worshippers of Isis, IGRom.1.817.10 (Callipolis).

fellw/, ou=s, h(,
Cork-land, Com. word in Luc.VH2.4.

fellw/dhs, es,
of cork or
bark, Poll.10.85.
felo/nhs, felo/nion, v. failo/nhs, failo/nion.
fe/lwn, = a)lazw/n, Theognost.Can.12.
fe/nagma, atos, to/, (as if from *fena/ssw) = fena/kisma, Phot.

fena/kh [a_], h(, = phnh/kh,
false hair, wig, Luc.Alex.59, DMeretr. 11.3.

fena_k-i/zw,
play the fe/nac,
cheat, lie, Theopomp.Com.8, Ar.Pl.271; of the
deceptive appearance of certain unripe figs, S.Fr.731; with neut. Adj., tau=t' a)/r' e)fena/kizes su/ Ar.Ach.90, cf. D.19.66, Hyp. Ath.2: abs., f. a)thrw=s Phld.Mus.p.104K. trans.,
cheat, trick, tina Ar.Pax 1087 (hex.), D.2.7, Men.Sam.100; w(=n pefena/kike th\n po/lin (by attraction for a(/) D.19.72:—Pass.,
to be cheated, Id.6.29; oi(=' e)fenakizo/mhn u(p' au)tou= Ar.Ra.921.

fena_k-ikw=s, Adv.
with a pun, EM 402.39.
fena_/k-isma, atos, to/, = sq., Hsch. s.v. phlhki/smata: ta\ peri\ tou= a)gaqou= f. Socr.Ep.36.

fena_k-ismo/s, o(,
cheating, quackery, imposition, D.24.194, Jul.Ep.202: freq. in pl., Ar.Eq.633, D.5.10, Din.1.92.
fena_k-isth/s, ou=, o(, = fe/nac, Phld.Piet.27, Sch.Ar.Ach.88.

fena_k-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
cheating, Poll.4.21. Adv. -kw=s, ib.24,51, 9.135.
fenakni/s, i/dos, h(, = fidakni/s, Demioprat. ap. Poll.10.74.

fe/nac, a_kos, o(,
cheat, quack, impostor, Ar.Ra.909, Heraclit.Ep.6.3, Porph.Chr.29, etc.; in Ar.Ach.89, perhaps with a play on foi=nic (the bird); in Eq.634 *fe/nakes are addressed as the tutelary gods of cheats.
feni/nda, v. faini/nda.

fenn-hsi/a, h(,
office of fennh=si, Ostr.416, al. (i A. D.).

fenn-h=si, o(, transcription of Egypt.
p-hn-n-ēse, 'the priest of Isis', ib.416 (i A. D.); nom. sg. also fenn-h/sios ib.413 (i A. D.) and fenn-h=sis, ib.420 (i A. D.).

fenni/on: *mhdikh\ o(do/s (Pamphyl.), Hsch. fenni/s, i/dos, h(,
a game of ball, Id. (Perh. corrupted from faini/nda, since Hsch. gives acc. fenni/da as well as nom.; cf. feni/nda.）
fe/nnos: qa/natos, e)niauto/s (i.e. ve/nos), Id. *fe/nw, v. qei/nw 11.
feo/gw, = feu/gw, SIG194.3,24 (Amphipolis, iv B. C.), 283.11 (Chios, iv B. C.).
ferai+ko/s, dub. sens. in Herod. Med. in Rh.Mus.58.90.
ferai=os, o(, a kind of kestreu/s, Arist.Fr.318 (cf. perai/as).

fer-a/lios [a_], on, Dor. for *ferh/lios,
bringing sunshine, Hymn.Is. 30.

fer-anqh/s, e/s,
flower-bringing, e)/ar AP9.363 (Mel.).

fe/r-aspis, idos, o(, h(,
shield-bearing, h.Mart.2, A.Ag.693 (lyr.), Pers.240 (troch.), AP7.152.

fer-augh/s, e/s,
bringing light, Nonn.D.38.81, al., PMag.Berol.2.92.

ferbh/ths, ou, o(,
herdsman, Hsch. (-tas cod.).

fe/rbw, only pres. and impf., exc. plpf. e)pefo/rbein (v. infr.):—Poet. Verb (used by Hp. (v. infr.) and v.l. in Pl.Criti.115a, and later Prose, e)/ferbe fone/a e(autou= App.Syr.62);
feed, nourish, of the earth, h.Hom.30.2; [a)/nqema] u(/dwr fe/rbei Pi.O.2.73; m' e)/ferbe so\s do/mos E.Or.869; of shepherds, f. bota/ Id.Hipp.75; c. gen. rei, e)pei\ bota/nhs e)pefo/rbei bou=s h.Merc.105.
preserve, patrw/i+on oi)=kon Hes. Op.377. Pass.,
to be fed, feed upon a thing, pare/cw dai=q' u(f' w(=n e)ferbo/mhn shall make food for those by whom
I fed myself, S.Ph. 957; ta/de fe/rbetai e)k se/qen o)/lbou h.Hom.30.4.
eat, consume, c. acc., h( yuxh\ to\ sw=ma fe/rbetai Hp.Epid.6.5.2; metaph.,
feed on, sofi/an E.Med.827 (lyr.): c. dat., e)lpi/sin Hp.Ep.17: abs.,
to be fed, live, A.R.4.1016.
enjoy, have, kre/ssona a(liki/as no/on Pi.P.5.110:—late in Act., fe/rbein prhu/+taton . . no/hma Opp.H.2.643.
fere-augh/s, e/s, poet. for feraugh/s, AP9.634.

fere/-botrus, u, gen. uos,
bearing bunches of grapes, Nonn.D.19.55.

fere/ggu^os, on, (e)ggu/h)
giving surety:—hence, generally,
to be depended upon, trusty, frou/rhma, prosta/tai, sqe/nos, A.Th.449,797, Eu.87: c. inf.,
capable, sufficient, ou) f. ei)mi du/namin parasxei=n tosau/thn Hdt.5.30; limh\n f. diasw=sai ta\s ne/as Id.7.49, cf. A.Th.396,470: c. gen. rei,
warrant for a thing,
able to answer for, ti/ . . keleu/eis, w(=n e)gw\ f.; S.El.942;
trusty in face of danger, pro\s ta\ deina\ feregguw/tatos Th.8.68.—Cf. e)xe/gguos.

fere-gla^gh/s, e/s,
bringing or
giving milk, Orph.L.218.

fere/-zu^gos, on,
bearing the yoke, i(/ppos Ibyc.2.

fere/-zwos, on,
bringing life, Nonn. D.12.6.

fere/-ka^kos, on,
inured to toil or
hardship, Plb.3.71.10, 3.79.5.

fere/-karpos, on,
yielding fruit, spe/rmata, gai=a, Plu.2.495c, AP9.778 (Phil.); *ba/kxos, *selh/nh, Orph.H.50.10, 9.5, cf. Fr.44.

fere-kleh/s, e/s,
renowned, prob. in Euph.79.

fere/-kosmos, on,
ornamental, Sor.1.2.

ferekra/teion me/tron, metre
used by Pherecrates, Heph.10.2.

fere-ku_dh/s, e/s,
renowned, na=sos B.12.182; ge/nos IG12(9).1179 (Chalcis).
fere/-mhlos, on, = polu/mhlos, na=soi Pi.Pae.5.38.

feremmeli/hs, ou, o(, poet. for *feremeli/as,
spear-bearing, fw/s Mimn. 14.4.
fe/rena, Aeol. = fernh/, Hdn.Gr.2.939, EM790.43.

fere/-ni_kos, on,
carrying off victory, victorious, name of a race-horse of King Hiero, Pi.O.1.18, etc. (The fem. pr.n. *bereni/kh is Maced. for *fereni/kh.）

fere/-oikos, on,
carrying one's house with one, of the Scythians in Hdt.4.46. Subst.,
house-carrier, i.e.
snail, Hes.Op.571: acc. to others, a kind
of wasp, or
a tortoise, Hsch., EM790.35, cf. fe/roikos.

fere/-oinos, on,
wine-bearing, gh= A.D.Synt.8.24.

fere/-polis, ios, o(, h(,
upholding the city, *tu/xh Pi.Fr.39; poet. also fere/ptolis, Opp.H.1.197, Nonn.D.2.86, al.

fere-pone/w,
endure toil or
hardship, Eustr. in EN90.10.

fere-poni/a, h(,
patience in toil or
hardship, App.Prooem.11,12, al., Iamb.Protr.21.ka/.

fere/-ponos, on,
bringing toil and trouble, a)mplaki/ai Pi.P.2.31.
bearing toil or
hardship, patient thereof, e)n tai=s ma/xais App.Gall.1.3; to\ f. th=s yuxh=s Them.Or.11.149d, cf. Eust.1488.44. Adv. Sup. -w/tata App.Mith.74.

fere/-pteros, on,
bearing wings, winged, Max.610: gen. pl. ferepteru/gwn from fere-pte/ru^gos, on, or fere-pte/ruc, o(, h(, Opp.H. 2.482.

fere-pto/lemos, on, poet. for *ferepo/lemos,
warlike, gai=a Jahresh.18 Beibl.35 (Olba); nhusi\ f. ships
of war, prob. in Orac. ap. Paus.10.9.11.
fere/-ptolis, v. fere/polis.
feres-anqh/s, e/s, = feranqh/s, xoroi/ prob. in h.Hom.30.14.

fere/s-bi^os,
on,
life-bearing, life-giving, gai=a h.Ap.341, Hes.Th.693; ou)=qar a)rou/rhs h.Cer.450; a)/roura h.Hom.30.9; *(/hrh Emp.6.2; *dh/mhtros sta/xus A.Fr.300.7; *dhw/ Antiph.1:—Poet. word, used in Arist.Mu.391b13.

feres-sa^kh/s, e/s, gen. e/os,
shield-bearing, of men, Hes.Sc.13, Nonn.D.26.291, al.; also potamo/s, nh=es, ib.23.11, 36.447; telamw=nes Tryph. 11.
feressi/ponos [i^], on, = fere/ponos, IG14.1015.

fere-sta/fu^los [a^], on,
bearing bunches of grapes, *)eruqrai/ Archestr.Fr.4.17; of Dionysus, AP9.363.11 (Mel.), Opp.C.3.79.

fere/-sta^xus, u,
bearing ears of corn, au)=lac Nonn.D.42.330, al.

fere-ste/fa^nos, on,
bringing victory, *xa/rites B.18.6.
winning the crown of victory, IG22.3118.

feretreu/omai, Pass.,
to be carried on a fe/retron, Plu.Marc.8.

fere/trios, o(, Lat.
Feretrius, epith. of Zeus, D.H.2.34, etc.

fe/retron, to/, (fe/rw)
bier, litter, frame, Plb.8.29.4; cf. fe/rtron.
fe/ristos, h, on, v. fe/rtatos.

fe/rma, atos, to/, (fe/rw)
that which is borne, fruit of the womb, A.Ag. 119 (pl., lyr.).
fruit of the earth, Id.Supp.690 (lyr.).
fern-a/rion, to/, Dim. of sq., BGU1052.10, 1101.18, etc. (i B. C.).

fern-h/, h(, (fe/rw):—
that which is brought by the wife, dowry, Hdt.1.93, E.IA47 (anap.), Hipp.629, X.Cyr.8.5.19, Aeschin.2.31, OGI218.65 (Ilium, iii B. C.), etc.; qeraponti\s f.
a dowry of handmaids, i.e.
given as a dowry, A.Supp.979 (anap.); pl., of
a dower, as consisting of divers presents, E.Or.1662, Anaxandr.41.23 (anap.); fernai\ pole/mou, of a wife won in battle, E.Ion298; also,
bridal gifts, la/zusqe f. ta/sde, pai=des, of Medea's presents to Creüsa, Id.Med.956. Dor. ferna/,
portion of victim reserved for the God, IG42(1).40.6, 41.7 (Epid., v/iv B. C.).

fern-i/zw, fut. iw= UPZ2.15 (ii B. C.):—
portion, endow, fernh=| ferniei= parqe/non LXX Ex.22.16:—Pass., pefernisme/nh u(po\ tou= patro/s PEnteux.9.8 (iii B. C.), cf. PLond.1.177.15 (i A. D.).

fe/rnion, to/, (fe/rw)
fish-basket, Men.717, Com.Adesp.1342, Ael. NA17.18, Alciphr.1.9, Poll.6.94:—in Hsch. written fe/rmia, ta/.— On the accent, v. Hdn.Gr.1.360.

fe/r-oikos, o(, a white animal like a
squirrel, Cratin.94 (o(/moion galh=| Phot., cf. Hsch. s.v. fere/oikos, EM790.36, sed fort. galew/th|).

fer-o/lbios, on,
bringing happiness, Orph.H.64.12, 68.2.
fer-o/mbron, to/, = si/kus a)/grios, Ps.-Dsc.4.150; = pe/plion, ib. 168.

fe/r-oplos, on,
bearing arms, Pae.Delph.8, Max.380.

ferrefa/ttion ( fer-ei=on AB314), to/,
sanctuary of Persephone, D.54.8.

ferse/fassa, h(, = *perse/fassa, *persefo/nh, S.Ant.894, E.Hel.175 (lyr.): Att. ferre/fatta, Ar.Th.287, Ra.671 (with vv. ll.), Pl.Cra. 404c, 404d, Hesperia 4.21 (Athens, iv B. C.); also Dor. ta\n *ferre/fattan Epicr.9.3; fersefa/assa Epigr. ap. Arist.Mir.843b27:—hence fersefa/ssia, ta/, festival at Cyzicus, IGRom.4.949（Chios). (Etym. uncertain: para\ to\ fe/rbein th\n fa/ttan Porph.Abst.4.16.)

fersefo/nh, poet. for *persefo/nh, Pi.O.14.21; *fersefo/nas e)/dos, of Acragas, Id.P.12.2, cf. Pl.Cra.404c; fersefo/neia Orph.H.24.11, al.:—Adj. fersefo/neios, a, on, dw/mata AP7.483. (Expld. as to\ dia\ tw=n karpw=n fero/menon kai\ foneuo/menon pneu=ma Cleanth.Stoic.1.124.)
ferta/zw, collat. form of fe/rw, Hsch.

fe/rta^tos, h, on,
bravest, best, polu\ f. Il.1.581, etc.; me/ga f. 16.21, cf. Lyr.Alex.Adesp.25, etc.: c. dat. modi, xersi/n te bi/hfi/ te f. h)=san Od.12.246; peri\ d' e)/gxei *)axaiw=n f. e)ssi Il.7.289; o)/lbw| f. Pi.N. 10.13: of things, kakw=n fe/rtaton
the best, i.e.
least bad, among evils, Il.17.105; lo/goi f.
best, Pi.P.5.48; o)/ ti fe/rtaton a)ndri\ tuxei=n Id.O. 7.26. in form fe/ristos, a)/ndra fe/riston Il.9.110; mh\ fu=nai fe/riston B.5.160, cf. Pi.Fr.126 (fe/rt- cj. Boeckh): mostly voc. fe/riste, Il.6.123, 15.247, Theoc.7.125, etc.; fe/ristoi Il.23.409; fe/riste *kadmei/wn a)/nac A.Th.39; w)= f. despotw=n S.OT1149; ei)=en, w)= f. Pl.Phdr.238d; Comp. fe/rteros, a, on,
braver, better, of persons, polu\ f. Il.4.56, etc.: c. dat. modi, bi/h| kai\ xersi\ kai\ e)/gxei+ f. 3.431, cf. Od.6.6; f. ou)k o)li/gon e)/gxei Il.19.217: c. inf., qeoi\ . . fe/rteroi/ ei)si noh=sai Od.5.170; f. go/nos patro/s Pi.I.8(7).35; pai=da f. patro/s A.Pr.768: of things, a)gw/n, no/stos, Pi.O.1.7, P.1.35; polu\ fe/rtero/n e)stin 'tis much
better, Il.1.169; ti/ f. h)\ . . c. inf., B.4.18: c. inf., Od.12.109, 21.154; ei)s to\ f. ti/qei to\ me/llon E.Hel.346 (lyr.). Adv., te/ttigos fe/rteron a)/|deis Theoc.1.148. (From root fer- 'bring', 'produce': a)po\ tou= fe/rein be/ltion Hsch.）

ferto/s, h/, o/n,
endurable, ou) tlata=s ou) ferta=s E.Hec.158 (lyr.).
fe/rtron, to/, = fe/retron, Il.18.236, Ael.VH12.64.
fe/rtrus: a)=qlos (Thurii), Hsch.
ferfere/tas, o(, epith. of Zeus in Thessaly (cf. *perferai=os), IG9 (2).1057.1 (Mopsium, i B. C.).

fe/rw (Locr. fa/rw [a^], IG9(1).334.5 (Oeanthea, v. B.C.)), only pres. and impf. (late 1 aor. 3pl. h)/feran IG3.1379), Il.21.458, etc.: Ep. forms, 2pl. imper. fe/rte Il.9.171; 2sg. subj. fe/rh|sqa Call.Dian. 144; 3sg. subj. fe/rh|si Il.18.308, Od.5.164, al.; Ep. inf. fere/men Il.9.411, al.: impf. e)/feron, Ep. fe/ron 3.245; also fe/reske, fe/reskon (3pl.), Od.9.429, 10.108. fut. oi)/sw Il.7.82, etc.; Dor. oi)sw= Theoc.3.11; 1pl. oi)seu=mes Id.15.133; 3pl. hoi/sonti Tab.Heracl.1.150: the foll. act. forms are not fut. in sense, imper. oi)=se Od.22.106, 481, Ar.Ach.1099, 1101, 1122, Ra.482; oi)se/tw Il.19.173, Od.8.255; 3pl. oi)so/ntwn Antim.15; inf. oi)/sein Pi.P.4.102, Ep. oi)se/men Od.3.429, oi)se/menai Il.3.120, Od.8.399, etc.: aor. 1 inf. oi)=sai Ph.1.611 codd. (a)n-oi=sai is prob. in Hdt.1.157):—Med., fut. oi)/somai Il.22.217, S.El.969, etc. (in pass. sense, E.Or.440, X.Oec.18.6; so Dor. oi)sei=tai Archim.Fluit.1.7, al.): fut. Pass. oi)sqh/somai D.44.45, Arist. Ph.205a13, Archim.Fluit.1.3, al., (e)c-) E.Supp.561:—Pass., pf. prooi=stai Luc.Par.2; cf. oi)ste/on, oi)sto/s （a)n-oisto/s). from e)negk- (not found in Hom. or Hdt., exc. as v.l. in Il.19.194, but in Pi.O.13.66, I.8(7).21, (pros-) Id.P.9.36, also B.16.62, and normal in Att. and Trag., also in codd.Hp., Epid.1.1.2, al.) come aor. 1 h)/negka, and aor. 2 h)/negkon:—Indic., 1sg. h)/negkon S.OC521 (lyr.), 964, Ar.Ra.1299, Th.742, Lys.944, (di-) Isoc.18.59, but h)/negka S.El. 13, E.Ion38, Aeschin.2.4, and in compos. with Preps.; 2sg. always h)/negkas Ar.Av.540 (lyr.), (e)c-) S.Tr.741 (in Ar.Th.742, de/ka mh=nas au)/t' e)gw\ h)/negkon is answd. by h)/negkas su/;); 3sg. h)/negke, common to both forms; dual di-hnegka/thn Pl.Lg.723b; pl. always h)ne/gkamen, -ate, -an (3pl. a)p-h/nenkan IG22.1620.37, al., once a)p-h/negkon ib. 1414.2; di-hne/gkomen is f.l. in X.Oec.9.8): imper., 2sg. e)/negke E. Heracl.699, Ar.Eq.110, X.Mem.3.6.9 (e)/negkon cj. Pors. in Anaxipp. 8); 3sg. e)negka/tw Ar.Pax1149 (troch.), Th.238, Pl.Phd.116d, (pros-) X.Smp.5.2; but e)c-enegke/tw IG12.63.33, 76.61; Dor. 3pl. e)negko/ntw ib.5 (1).26.16 (Amyclae, ii/i B. C.); 2pl. e)c-ene/gkate Ar.Ra.847: subj. e)ne/gkw common to both forms: opt., 1sg. e)ne/gkaimi E.Hipp.393, Pl.Cri.43c: 3sg. e)ne/gkai (cod.A, but -koi cod.Laur.) S.Tr.774, but e)ne/gkoi Id.Fr.84 (anap.), Pl.R.330a, (cun-) Th.6.20, etc.; 2pl. e)ne/gkaite （e)ne/gkate codd.) E.Heracl.751 (lyr.): inf. e)negkei=n A.Supp.766, S.OC1599, IG22.40.18, etc., (pros-) Pi.P.9.36, Hp.VM15; Hellenistic e)ne/gkai Arist.Oec.1349a27 (ei)s-), PAmh.2.30.35 (ii B. C.), Ev.Marc. 2.4 (pros-), etc., found also in codd.Hp., Aff.3 (pros-), Nat.Mul.19 (di-): part. e)negkw/n Pi.I.8(7).21, S.El.692, Th.6.56, etc., e)ne/gkas IG22.1361.21 (ei)s-), 333.4, D.49.51 (and later, Demetr.Com.Nov.1.10 (ei)s-), Arist.Oec.1351a14, etc.; in X. we find e)c-enegko/ntes Mem.1.2.53, and di-enegkou=sa, sun-enegko/ntes, vv. ll. in ib.2.2.5, An.6.5.6):— Med., only h)negka/mhn, Ar.Ec.76 (e)c-), etc. (exc. imper. e)negkou= S.OC470); 2sg. h)ne/gkw E.Supp.583, X.Oec.7.13; 3sg. h)ne/gkato S.Tr.462, Pl.R.406b, etc.; 1pl. h)negka/meqa Id.Ion530b, (pro-) Phlb. 57a; inf. ei)s-ene/gkasqai Isoc.15.188: part. e)negka/menos Aeschin.1.131, (a)p-) X.Ages.6.2. from e)neik- comes aor. 1 h)/neika, found mostly in Ion. (but not in codd. Hp.), Ep. and Lyr., also at Cos (v. infr.) and implied elsewh. in pass. forms (v. infr. v):—the endings are those of aor. 1, exc. in imper. e)/neike Od.21.178, inf. e)neike/men (v.l. e)negke/men) Il.19.194, e)nei/khn (v. infr.), and part. met-eneikw/n, e)cenikou=si (v. infr.), cf. sunenei/komai:—1sg. a)n-e/neika Od.11.625; 2sg. a)p-e/neikas Il.14.255; 3sg. h)/neike Od.18.300, al., Hdt.2.146, Ep. e)/neike Il.15.705, al.; 1pl. e)nei/kamen Od.24.43; 3pl. h)/neikan Hdt.3.30, Ep. e)/neikan Il.9.306; imper. 2sg. e)/neikon Anacr.62.3; 2pl., e)nei/kate Od. 8.393; 3pl. e)neika/ntwn Schwyzer 688 B 3 (Chios, v B. C.); inf. e)nei=kai Il.18.334, Pi.P.9.53, Hdt.1.32; e)neike/men (v. supr.); Aeol. e)nei/khn Alc.Oxy.1788 Fr.15ii 20; part. e)nei/kas Il.17.39, (a)n-) Hdt.2.23; met-eneikw/n Abh.Berl.Akad.1928(6).22 (Cos, iii B. C.):—Med., 3sg. a)n-enei/kato Il.19.314; 3pl. h)nei/kanto 9.127, Hdt.1.57, (e)s-) 7.152; part. e)neika/menos Alc.35.4. aor. 1 h)/ni^ka is found in the foll. dialect forms: 3sg. h)/nike IG42(1).121.110 (Epid., iv B. C.); h)/niken SIG239 Bi11 (Delph., iv B. C.); a)n-h/nike IG4.757A12, al. (Troezen, ii B. C.); a)p-h/nike ib.42(1).103.16, al. (Epid., iv B. C.); but h)/ni_ke is prob. written for h)/neike in IG4.801.3 (Troezen, vi B. C.); 1pl. a)n-hni/kames [i^] GDI 3591b21 (Calymna); 3pl. h)/nikan SIG239 Bi 17 (Delph., iv B. C.), IG 12(2).15.15 (Mytil., iii B. C.); 3sg. subj. e)ni/kei Berl.Sitzb.1927.161 (Cyrene); e)s-eni/kh, and inf. e)s-e/nikai, IG12(2).645b43,39 (Nesus, iv B. C.); part. (dat. pl.) e)c-enikou=si IG4.823.49 (Troezen, iv B. C.); so in later Gr., ei)s-h/nika Supp.Epigr.7.381,382 (Dura-Europos, iii A. D.); h)/nigka ib.383 (ibid., iii A. D.):—Med., part. e)c-e[nik]a/menos IG12 (2).526a5 (Eresus, iv B. C.). Boeot. aor. 1 in 3pl. ei)/nican IG7.2418.24 (Thebes, iv B. C.); 1sg. h)/neigca Hdn.Gr.2.374. other tenses: pf. e)nh/noxa D.21.108, 22.62, (e)c-) Luc.Pr.Im.15,17, (met-) Pl.Criti.113a, (sun-) v. l. in X.Mem.3.5.22:—Pass., fut. e)nexqh/somai Arist.Ph.205b12, Archim.Fluit.2.2, al., (e)p-) Th.7.56, (kat-) Isoc.13.19: aor. h)ne/xqhn X.An.4.7.12 and freq. in compds.; Ion. a)p-hnei/xqhn Hdt.1.66, etc.; (peri-) ib.84; 3pl. written h)nei/xtqhsan in Schwyzer 707B9 (Ephesus, vi B. C.); Dor. part. e)c-eneixqei/s IG42(1).121.115 (Epid., iv B. C.); Hellenistic e)negxqei/s PCair.Zen.327.42 (iii B. C.), (sumperi-) IPE12.32A31,78, B70 (Olbia, iii B. C.); in dialects, 3sg. indic. a)p-hni/xqh IG42(1).103.111 (Epid., iv B. C.); 3sg. subj. e)cenixqh=| ib.12(5).593 A23 (Ceos, v B. C.), Abh.Berl.Akad.1928(6).21 (Cos, iii B. C.); Boeot. e)n-enixqei= IG7.3172.150 (Thespiae, iii B. C.); part. (neut.) e)p-enixqe/n Abh.Berl.Akad.1928(6).53 (Telos, iv B. C., ined.); Att. pf. e)nh/negmai, e)nh/nektai Pl.R.584d, ei)s-enh/nektai E.Ion 1340; a)n-enh/negktai IG12.91.4; e)pan-enh/neigktai ib.22.1607a7; Ion. e)c-enhneigme/nos Hdt.8.37; Att. plpf. pros-enh/nekto X.HG4.3.20; part. kat-, met-enhnegme/nos Plb.10.30.2, Str.13.1.12. (With fe/rw cf. Lat.
fero, OE.
beran, Skt.
bhárati 'bear'; oi)/sw is of uncertain origin; e)negk- is prob. redupl. e)gk- （e)nek- in Pass. forms and in dourhnekh/s, etc.), cogn. with Skt.
náśati 'attain,' Lat.
nanciscor, Lith.
nèšti 'carry, bear'; e)neik- （e)ni^k-) is of uncertain origin; the glosses e)ne/eikan: h)/negkan, and e)neei/kw: e)ne/gkw (Hsch.) are not corroborated.) Act.,
bear or
carry a load, e)n tala/roisi fe/ron melihde/a karpo/n Il.18.568; me/ga e)/rgon, o(\ ou) du/o g' a)/ndre fe/roien 5.303; h)=gon me\n mh=la, fe/ron d' eu)h/nora oi)=non Od.4.622; xoa/s A.Ch.15; f. e)p' w)/mois S.Tr.564; xersi\n f. Id.Ant.429; f. o(/pla braxi/oni E.Hec.14;
bear (as a device) on one's shield, A.Th.559, etc.; gaste/ri kou=ron f., of a pregnant woman, Il.6.59; f. u(po\ zw/nhn or zw/nhs u(/po, A.Ch. 1000(992), E.Hec.762: in Trag. stronger than e)/xw, a(gna\s ai(/matos xei=ras f.
to have hands clean from blood, E.Hipp.316 (v.l. forei=s）; a)lao\n o)/mma fe/rwn Id.Ph.1531 (lyr.); glw=ssan eu)/fhmon f. A.Ch.581, cf. Supp.994; kalo\n f. sto/ma S.Fr.930 codd. (nisi leg. forh=|）; a)/yofon
ba/sin f. Id.Tr.967 (lyr.).
bear, convey, with collat. notion of
motion, freq. in Hom., ph=| dh\ . . to/ca fe/reis; Od.21.362; pro/sw f. ib. 369; ei)/sw fe/rw s' e)nteu=qen Ar.V.1444, cf. Pl.Lg.914b; po/des fe/ron Il.6.514; pe/dila ta/ min fe/ron 24.341, etc.; of horses, 2.838; i(/ppw . . a(/rma oi)/seton 5.232, etc.; of ships, Od.16.323, cf. Il.9.306; ta\ sw/mata tw=n zw/|wn sune/sthken e)k tou= fe/rontos kai\ tou= ferome/nou Diocl. Fr.17. of persons,
bring to bear, me/nos or me/nos xeirw=n i)qu/s tinos fe/rein
hurl one's strength right upon or against him, Il.16.602, 5.506; f. th\n o)rgh/n, th\n ai)ti/an e)pi/ tina, Plb.21.31.8, 33.11.2.
lead, direct, th\n po/lin Plu.Luc.6. of wind,
bear along, [pnoih\ *zefu/rou] f. nh=a/s te kai\ au)tou/s Od.10.26; [sxedi/hn] a)/nemoi fe/ron e)/nqa kai\ e)/nqa 5.330, cf. 4.516, Il.19.378, etc.; e)pe/lasse fe/rwn a)/nemos Od.3.300, 7.277, cf. 5.111, etc.: abs., o( bore/as e)/cw tou= *po/ntou ei)s th\n *(ella/da fe/rei
is fair for Greece, X.An.5.77: metaph., o(/ph| a)\n o( lo/gos w(/sper pneu=ma f. Pl.R.394d; f. tina\ fre/nes du/sarktoi A.Ch.1023, cf. Th.687 (lyr.):—Pass., v. infr. B.
endure, suffer, lugra/ Od.18.135; a)/thn Hdt.1.32; xalino/n, zugo/n, A.Ag.1066, 1226; phmona/s, tu/xas, Id.Pers.293, E.Or.1024; cumfora/s Th.2.60; ta\s ou) proshkou/sas a(marti/as Antipho 3.2.10; also of food, e)sqi/ousi plei/w h)\ du/nantai f. X.Cyr.8.2.21; of strong wine,
bear, admit, kai\ ta\ tri/a fe/rwn kalw=s, i.e. three parts of water, instead of i)/son i)/sw|, Ar.Eq.1188, cf. Ach. 354; so ta\s e)pidei/ceis . . fe/rousin au)tou= (sc. *)isokra/tous） oi( lo/goi, tou\s de\ e)n e)kklhsi/ais . . a)gw=nas ou)x u(pome/nousi D.H.Isoc.2: metaph., h(=| fe/rein pe/fuke Pl.Ti.48a. freq. with modal words, ph/mata ko/smw| f. Pi.P.3.82; sigh=| kaka/ E.Hec.738; o)rgh=| to\n po/lemon Th.1.31; qumw=| f. Id.5.80; xara=| f. ti J.AJ19.1.13: esp. with an Adv., [u(/brin] r(hi+di/ws f. Hes.Op.215; deinw=s, bare/ws, pikrw=s, xalepw=s fe/rein ti,
bear a thing impatiently,
take it ill or amiss, Hdt.2.121.g/, 5.19, E.Ion610, Pl.R.330a, etc.; duspetw=s, barusto/nws f., A.Pr. 752, Eu.794; proqu/mws fe/rein to\n po/lemon
to be zealous
about the war, Hdt.9.18,40; proqu/mws ta\ tou= pole/mou e)/feron Th.8.36; ai)=san fe/rein w(s r(a=|sta A.Pr.104; sumforh\n w(s koufo/tata f. Hdt.1.35; r(a|di/ws f. Pl.Grg.522d, al.; eu)petw=s f. S.Fr.585, X.Mem.2.1.6; eu)po/rws （eu)fo/rws Brunck) e)negkei=n S.Ph.873; eu)menw=s, eu)xerw=s f., D.Ep. 3.45, Pl.R.474e; these phrases are used mostly c. acc. rei; also c. part., bare/ws h)/neike i)dw/n Hdt.3.155, cf. Ar.Th.385, etc.; f. e)lafrw=s . . labo/nta zugo/n Pi.P.2.93; r(a|di/ws fe/reis h(ma=s a)polei/pwn Pl. Phd.63a: c. gen., tou= e)ndeou=s xalepw/teron f. Th.1.77, cf. 2.62; e)pi/ tini, xalepw=s f. e)pi\ th=| poliorki/a| X.HG7.4.21, cf. Isoc.12.232; pra/ws e)pi\ toi=s gignome/nois f. D.58.55: c. dat. only, bare/ws fe/rein toi=s parou=si, th=| a)timi/a|, X.An.1.3.3, HG3.4.9, cf. 5.1.29; later, xalepw=s f. dia/ ti, pro/s ti, D.S.17.111, Jul.Or.1.17c codd.
bring, fetch, ei) . . qeo\s au)to\n e)nei/kai Od.21.196; f. a)/poina Il.24.502; a)/rne 3,120, cf. Sapph.95; u(/dwr, oi)=non, Anacr.62.1; e)/ntea Il.18.191; to/ca Od.21.359; knhmi=das A.Th.675; da=|da Ar.Nu.1490, etc.; gh=n te kai\ u(/dwr Hdt.7.131:—Med.,
carry or
bring with one, or
for one's own use, poda/niptra Od.19.504; oi)=non Alc.35, cf. Hdt.4.67, 7.50, X. Mem.3.14.1; ferna\s do/mois E.Andr.1282;
fetch, Od.2.410; xoa\s e)k krh/nhs S.OC470.
bring, offer, present, dw=ra Od.8.428, etc.; me/los Pi.P.2.3; xoa/s tini A.Ch.487; f. pe/plon dw/rhma/ tini S.Tr.602; pro/s tina dw=ra X.An.7.3.31; xa/rin tini\ f.
grant any one a favour,
do him a kindness, Il.5.211, Od.5.307, al.; e)pi\ h)=ra f. tini/ Il.1.572, Od.3.164, etc.; f. tisi\ eu)noi/as, o)/nhsin a)stoi=s, A.Supp. 489, S.OC287; but after Hom., xa/rin tini\ f.
show gratitude to him, Pi.O.10(11).17; mh=nin f. tini/
cherish wrath against . . A.Niob. in PSI11.1208.12. = a)/gw iv. 1, a)/xri nu=n kaq' w(/ran e)/tous le/gontai pe/nqos e)pi\ *melea/grw| fe/rein Ant.Lib.2.7; *)ia/lemos: o( e)pi\ toi=s a)polwlo/sin a)ni/an fe/rwn, Suid.:—Med., tou= gone/ws e)f' w(=| ge to\ pe/nqos fe/resqe Phalar.Ep.103.1.
bring, produce, cause, [a)sth\r] fe/rei pureto\n brotoi=sin Il.22.31; o)/ssan . . h(/ te f. kle/os a)nqrw/poisi Od.1.283, cf. 3.204; f. kako/n, ph=ma, a)/lgea, etc.,
work one woe, Il.8.541, Od.12.231,427, etc.; dhi+oth=ta f.
bring war, 6.203; e)p' a)llh/loisi f. *)/arha Il.3.132, cf. 8.516; po/lemon Hes.Sc.150; qa/naton f. B.5.134; tou=to eu)doci/an soi oi)/sei Pl.Ep.312c; to\ swqh=nai to\ yeu=dos fe/rei S.Ph.109; te/xnai . . fo/bon fe/rousin maqei=n A.Ag.1135 (lyr.); w(/sper to\ di/kaion e)/fere as justice
brought with it, brought about, i.e. as was just, no more than just, Hdt.5.58; a)n' o)/ ka fe/rh| o( lo/gos o( tami/a *filokle/os IG42(1).77.13 (Epid., ii B. C.); of a calculation,
yield a result, Vett.Val.349.27;
produce, adduce, bring forward, paradei/gmata Isoc.7.6, etc.; pa/sas ai)ti/as D.58.22; a(rmo/ttousan ei)ko/na Id.61.10:—Pass., ei)s th\n sunhgori/an . . toiau=ta/ tina fe/retai Sor.2.3.
bring or
carry with one, involve, to\ pa=n h(mi=n tou= pole/mou fe/rousin ai( ne/es Hdt.8.62; ou) cu/lwn a)gw\n o( to\ pa=n fe/rwn e)sti\ h(mi=n, a)ll' a)ndrw=n ib.100. mu=qon f. tini/
bring one word, Il.10.288, 15.202; a)ggeli/hn f.
bring a message, ib. 175, Od.1.408; lo/gon Pi.P.8.38; e)pistola\s f. tini/ S.Aj.781, cf. Tr.493; e)pistolh/n X.Ages.8.3: hence,
tell, announce, peuqw/, fa/tin, A.Th.370, Ag.9; safe/s ti pra=gos Id.Pers.248 (troch.), cf. Ag.639, etc.;
report, a)gh/n (breakages) PCair.Zen.15r27 (iii B. C.); f. kexwneukw/s
reports that he has . . , ib.741.26, cf. 147.4, 268.24 (all iii B. C.);
enter, book a payment made, PBaden47.12:—Med., lo/gous f. E.Supp.583; but also a)ggeli/as e)/pos oi)/sh| thou
shalt have it
brought thee,
receive, Id.Ph.1546 (lyr.); manth/i+a . . fe/rontai Hes.Fr.134.9:—Pass., qa/naton a)na/gkh fe/resqai tou= diaqeme/nou the death of the testator must be
announced, Ep.Heb.9.16.
pay something
due or
owing, fo/ron te/ssara ta/lanta f.
pay as a tax or tribute, Th.4.57, cf. IG12.57.9, Pl.Plt.298a, PCair.Zen.467.7 (iii B. C.); dasmo/n X.An.5.5.10; su/nodon f.
subscribe to the expense of a meeting, IG22.1012.14, 1326.6; xrh/mata pa=si ta/cantes f. Th.1.19; misqo\n f. X.Cyr.1.6.12 (but usu.,
receive, draw, pay, misqo\n du/o draxma\s th=s h(me/ras Ar.Ach.66; te/ttaras th=s h(me/ras o)bolou\s fe/rwn Men.357; ai( nh=es misqo\n e)/feron Th. 3.17, cf. X.An.1.3.21, Oec.1.6); f. e)nne/a o)bolou\s th=s mna=s to/kous Lys.Fr.1.2, cf. Lycurg.23; also of property,
bring in, yield as rent, f. mi/sqwsin tou= e)niautou= Is.5.35.
apply, refer, ti e)pi/ ti Pl. Ti.37e, Chrm.163d, R.478b, cf. Plb.3.36.7, al.; f. ta\ pra/gmata e)pi/ tina
confer powers upon, Id.2.50.6. yh=fon f.
give one's vote, A.Eu.674,680, And.1.2, Is.11.18; yh=fos kaq' h(mw=n oi)/setai (Pass.) E.Or.440; peri\ tau/ths h( yh=fos oi)sqh/setai D.44.45; u(pe\r a)gw=nos Lycurg.7, cf. 11: hence f. tina/
appoint or
nominate to an office, f. xorhgo/n D.20.130, 39.7, cf. Pl.Lg.753d, Arist.Pol.1266a10:—Pass., ibid.; o(/pws fe/rhtai e)n tw=| stratiwtikw=| UPZ15.10 (ii B. C.); tw=n ferome/nwn e)n *kleopa/tra| klhrou/xwn PRein.10.13, al. (ii B. C.); ferome/nou mou e)n th=| sunoxh=| since I
am enrolled in prison, i.e. am in prison, BGU1821.21 (i B. C.):—Med.,
choose, adopt, tau/tan f. biota/n E.Andr.785 (lyr.).
bring forth, produce, whether of the earth or of trees, f. a)/roura fa/rmaka Od.4.229; a)/mpeloi f. oi)=non 9.110; [nh=sos] f. w(/ria pa/nta ib.131, cf. Hes.Op.117; [ou)] gh= karpo\n e)/fere Hdt.6.139; gu/ai f. bi/oton A.Fr.196.5, cf. Pi.N.11.41, E.Hec.593, etc.: abs.,
bear fruit, be fruitful, eu)=t' a)\n ta/de pa/nta fe/rh|si h.Merc.91; h( gh= e)/fere （karpo/n add. codd. quidam) Hdt.5.82; ai( a)/mpeloi fe/rousin X.Oec.20.4; also of living beings, to/pos a)/ndras f. Pl.Ti.24c; h)/negken au)to\n *laodi/keia Philostr. VS1.25.1; h( e)negkou=sa
one's country, Hld.2.29, Lib.Or. 2.66, al., Chor.p.81 B., Lyd.Mag.3.26, dub. in Supp.Epigr.4.439 (Milet.) without Art. (also h( e)negkame/nh Jul.Ep.202); or
Mother Earth, M.Ant.4.48: generally,
create, form, *phneio\s *te/mph f. Philostr.Im.1.25; [ta\ bre/fh] a)/rxetai fe/rein tou\s o)do/ntas Aët.4.9; f. tou\s kuno/dontas Gp.16.1.14.
carry off or
away, *kh=res e)/ban qana/toio fe/rousai Il.2.302; f. tina\ e)k po/nou 14.429, 17.718, etc.; of winds, [e)/pos] fe/roien a)narpa/casai a)/ellai may the winds
sweep away the word, Od.8.409; of a river, Hdt.1.189:—Med.,
carry off with one, Od.15.19.
carry away as booty or
prize, e)/nara, teu/xea, Il.6.480, 17.70; ai)=ga le/onte f. 13.199; dei=pnon f., of Harpies, A.Eu.51; e)ne/xura bi/a| f. Antipho 6.11; in the phrase fe/rein kai\ a)/gein (cf. a)/gw 1.3), IG12.69.19; fe/ronta h)\ a)/gonta Lex ap.D.23.60; ai)/ ka . . a)/gh| h)\ fe/rh| Leg.Gort.5.37; h(/rpazon kai\ e)/feron Lys.20.17; kei/rwn h)\ fe/rwn IG12(9).90.10 (Tamynae, iv B. C.); ai)/ ti/s ka . . fe/rei ti tw=n e)n ta=| i(ara=| ga=| Tab.Heracl.1.128; of a divorced wife, ai) de/ ti a)/llo fe/roi tw= a)ndro/s, pe/nte stath=rans katastasei= kw)/ti ka fe/rh| au)to/n Leg.Gort.3.2; fe/rein alone,
rob, plunder, qew=n i(era/ E.Hec.804; a)llh/lous Th.1.7; abs., SIG38.23 (Teos, v B. C.):—Pass., fero/menoi *bakxw=n u(/po E.Ba.759:—Med. in same sense, e)/nara Il.22.245; pele/keas oi)=ko/nde f. 23.856; a)terpe/a dai=ta Od.10.124, cf. 15.378.
carry off, gain, esp.
by toil or
trouble, win, achieve, both Act. and Med., h)/ ke fe/rh|si me/ga kra/tos h)= ke feroi/mhn Il.18.308; fe/rein tri/poda Hes.Op.657; ta)pini/kia S.El.692; timh/n Ar. Av.1278; ta)ristei=a, ta\ nikhth/ria, Pl.R.468c, Lg.657e; pe/ra . . ou)de\n f. S.OC651; e)k sou= pa/nt' a)/neu fo/bou f. Id.OT590; ti/s . . ple/on ta=s eu)daimoni/as fe/rei h)/ . . ; ib. 1190 (lyr.), cf. El.1088 (lyr.); in bad sense, mei/zw th\n ai)sxu/nhn f. Pl.Lg.671e: also,
receive one's due, f. xa/rin S.OT764; w(s tou=to/ g' e)/rcas du/o fe/rh| dwrh/mata Id.Ph. 117; misqo\n fe/rein (v. supr. iv.5); of a priest's perquisites, fe/rei o( i(areu\s ge/rh ske/lh ktl. BMus.Inscr.968 A9 (Cos), cf. IG12.24.10, al., SIG56.35 (Argos, v B. C.):—Med. (v. ad init.),
win for oneself, ku=dos oi)/sesqai Il.22.217; de/pas, teu/xea,
carry off as a prize, 23.663, 809, al.; a)e/qlia or a)/eqlon f.
carry off, win a prize, 9.127, 23.413; ta\ prw=ta fe/resqai (sc. a)/eqla) 23.275,538; ou) smikro\n a)=qlon th=s e)rwtikh=s mani/as fe/rontai Pl.Phdr.256d; of perquisites, to\ . . ske/los toi\ i(aromna/mones fero/sqw (i. e. ferou/sqw from *fero/nsqw) IG42(1).40.13 (Epid., v/iv B. C.): hence ou) ta\ deu/tera Hdt.8.104; ple/on fe/resqai
get more or a larger share
for onself, gain the advantage over any one, tinos Hdt.7.211, cf. S.OT500 (lyr.), E.Hec.308; tau=ta e)pi\ smikro/n ti e)fe/ronto tou= pole/mou this
they received as a small help towards the war, Hdt.4.129; h)nei/kato para\ *)egestai/wn ta\ ou)dei\s a)/llos 5.47; i)/dia ke/rdea prosdeko/menoi para\ tou= *pe/rsew oi)/sesqai 6.100; xa/rin fe/resqai par' u(mw=n And.2.9; f. th\n a)pe/xqeian au)tw=n Antipho 3.4.2; o)nei/dh Pl.Lg.762a; eu)se/beian e)k patro\s oi)/sh| S.El.969; da/kru pro\s tw=n kluo/ntwn A.Pr.638; a)po/ tinos boska/n Id.Eu.266 (lyr.); e)c a)nandri/as tou)/noma Aeschin.1.131: generally,
get for one's own use and profit, take and carry away, esp.
to one's own home, tou= . . pa/mprwta par' a)glaa\ dw=ra fe/roio Il.4.97: hence fe/rein or fe/resqai is often used pleon., v. infr. xi. abs., of roads or ways,
lead to a place, o(do\n fe/rousan e)s i(ro/n Hdt.2.122, cf. 138; th\n fe/rousan a)/nw (sc. o(do/n) Id.9.69; th=s me\n e)s a)risterh\n e)pi\ *kari/hs f., th=s de\ e)s decih\n e)s *sa/rdis Id.7.31; e)pi\ *sou=sa X.An.3.5.15; a(plh= oi)=mos ei)s *(/aidou fe/rei A.Fr.239; h( e)s *qh/bas fe/rousa o(do/s Th.3.24 (but h( e)p' *)aqhnw=n fe/rousa ibid.); also h( qu/ra h( ei)s to\n kh=pon f. the door
leading to the garden, D.47.53; ai( ei)s th\n po/lin f. pu/lai, ai( e)pi\ to\ tei=xos f. kli/makes, X.HG7.2.7, cf. PMich.Zen.38.27 (iii B. C.), Plb.10.12.3. of a district or tract of country,
stretch, extend to or towards, fe/rein e)pi/ or e)s qa/lassan Hdt.4.99; e)s th\n meso/gaian ib. 100; pro\s no/ton Id.7.201; h( a)po\ dusmw=n au)th=s (sc. th=s *kimbrikh=s） kai\ e)pi\ to\n *)/albin fe/rousa Ptol.Geog.2.11.2, cf. 3. of time, th=| nukti\ th=| ferou/sh| ei)s th\n b/ tou= *paxw/n PPetr.3p.x (iii B. C.), cf. PTeb.61 (
b) 288 (ii B. C.), BGU1832.5 (i B. C.), etc. metaph.,
lead to or towards,
be conducive to, e)s ai)sxu/nhn fe/rei Hdt.1.10; ta\ e)s a)/kesin fe/ronta Id.4.90; e)s bla/bhn, e)s fo/bon fe/ron, S.OT517, 991; ei)s o)/knon E.Supp.295: esp. in good sense,
tend, conduce to one's interest, e)p' a)mfo/tera/ toi fe/rei (impers.) tau=ta poie/ein Hdt.3.
134; so ta\ pro\s to\ u(giai/nein fe/ronta X.Mem.4.2.31; trofai\ me/ga f. ei)s a)reta/n E.IA562(lyr.); me/ga ti oi)o/meqa fe/rein (sc. koinwni/an gunaikw=n te kai\ pai/dwn） ei)s politei/an Pl.R.449d; ta\ kala\ e)pithdeu/mata ei)s a)reth=s kth=sin f. ib.444e, cf. X.Cyr.8.1.42; tou=to e)/feren au)tw=|
was for his
good, M.Ant.5.8.
point to,
refer to a thing, e)s ti/ u(mi=n tau=ta fai/netai fe/rein; Hdt.1.120; fwnh\ fe/rousa pro/s tina
addressed to him, Id.1.159; e)s a)rhi/+ous a)gw=nas fe/ron to\ manth/i+on Id.9.33, cf. 6.19; [o)/yis] fe/rei e)pi\ pa=san gh=n
refers to . . ,
extends over . . , Id.7.19; ta\ i)/xnh th=s u(poyi/as ei)s tou=ton f.
point to him, Antipho 2.3.10; pro/s tinas Pl.R.538c; tau/th| <o(> no/os e)/fere Hdt.9.120; h( tou= dh/mou fe/rei gnw/mh, w(s . . , the people's opinion
inclines to this, that . . , Id.4.11; e)pi\ to\ au)to\ ai( gnw=mai e)/feron Th.1.79: c. inf., tw=n h( gnw/mh e)/fere sumba/llein whose opinion
inclined to giving battle, Hdt.6.110, cf. 5.118; ple/on e)/fere/ oi( h( gnw/mh katerga/sesqai his opinion
inclined rather to the view . . , Hdt.8.100, cf. 3.77.
carry or
have in the mouth, i. e.
speak of, polu/n tina e)n tai=s diabolai=s fe/rein Aeschin.3.223;
use a word, ou)k oi)=da kaq' o(pote/rou tou/twn oi( palaioi\ to\ th=s zeia=s e)/feron o)/noma Gal.Vict.Att.6, cf. 7.644, 15.753,876;
record an event, oi( deute/rw| meta\ th\n e)/codon . . e)/tei fe/rontes au)th/n D.H.1.63: more freq. in Pass., ponhrw=s, eu)=, fe/resqai,
to be ill or well
spoken of, X.HG1.5.17, 2.1.6; a)ti/mws u(po\ tw=n a)nqrw/pwn f. Pl.Ep.328e; abs., fe/retai [the report]
is carried about, i.e.
it is said, c. acc. et inf., toio/nde fe/retai prh=gma gi/nesqai Hdt.8.104 (v.l.); e)n xro/nois fe/retai mnhmoneuome/nois
is recorded as occurring within historical times, Str.1.3.15; o(/te kai\ *dhmo/kritos fe/retai teleuth/sas Sor.Vit.Hippocr.11; kri/nomen . . ta\ grafe/nta u(f' h(mw=n prosta/gmata e)n toi=s i(eroi=s no/mois fe/resqai par' u(mi=n OGI331.60 (Pergam., ii B. C.); w(=n ta\ o)no/mata fe/retai
are in use, Ptol.Geog.7.4.11; of literary works,
to be in circulation, e)pisto/lion au)tou= toiou=ton fe/retai Plu.2.808a, cf. 209e, 832d, 833c, al., Jul.Or.6.189b, Gp.2.35.8, Eun.VSp.456 B.; pro/logoi dittoi\ fe/rontai Arg.E.Rh.; o( sti/xos ou(=tos e)/n tisin ou) fe/retai Sch.E. Ph.377, cf. Sch.Il.8.557. of words, fe/resqai e)pi/ ti to
refer to something, A.D.Pron.61.5, Synt.21.14, al. imper. fe/re like a)/ge, as Adv.,
come, now, well, before another imper., fe/re ga\r sh/maine A.Pr.296 (anap.); fe/r' ei)pe\ dh/ moi S.Ant.534; f. dh/ moi to/de ei)pe/ Pl.Cra.385b; so fe/rete . . peira=sqe Hdt.4.127. before 1sg. or pl. of subj. used imperatively, fe/re a)kou/sw, fe/re sth/swmen, Hdt.1.11,97; f. de\ nu=n . . fra/sw Id.2.14; fe/r' i)/dw, ti/ d' h(/sqhn; Ar.Ach.4; fe/re dh\ kati/dw Id.Pax361, cf. 959; f. dh\ i)/dwmen, f. dh\ skeyw/meqa, Pl.Grg.455a, Prt.330b, cf. E.Or.1281 (lyr.), Ph.276, etc.: less freq. before 2 pers., fe/re . . ma/qh|s S.Ph.300. before a rhetorical question, fe/re . . tropai=a pw=s a)nasth/seis; E.Ph.571; f. dh\ nu=n . . ti/ gamei=q' h(ma=s; Ar.Th.788 (anap.), cf. Ach.541, Pl.R. 348c; f. mw=n ou)k a)na/gkh . . ; Id.Lg.805d; f. pro\s qew=n pw=s . . ; Id.Grg.514d; freq. in phrase fe/re ga/r, fe/re ti/s ga\r ou(=tos; Ar.Nu.218; f. ga\r pro\s ti/nas xrh\ polemei=n; Isoc.4.183, cf. Antipho 5.36; also f. dh/ Pl.Grg.455a, al.: usu. first in a sentence, but th\n a)ndrei/an de\ f. ti/ qw=men; Id.Lg.633c, etc. fe/re dh/, e)a/n ph| diallaxqw=men . .
come let us see if we can . . , Id.Cra.430a. fe/re c. inf.,
suppose, grant that . . f. le/gein tina/ Plu.2.98b; f. ei)pei=n
let us say, D.Chr.31.93, 163, Porph.Abst.3.3; oi(=on f. ei). Iamb. in Nic.p.47 P., al. (oi(=on fe/re alone, Hierocl. in CA11p.439M.). part. neut. to\ fe/ron, as Subst.,
destiny, fate, to\ f. e)k qeou= [kalw=s] fe/rein [xrh/] ye must bear nobly
what heaven
bears to you, awards you, S.OC1693 (lyr., codd., sed secl. kalw=s, xrh/）; ei) to\ feron se fe/rei, fe/re kai\ fe/rou AP 10.73 (Pall.). part. fe/rwn in all genders freq. joined with another Verb: to express a subsidiary action, fe/rwn e)/dwke
he brought and gave, Od.22.146; do\s tw=| cei/nw| tau=ta fe/rwn
take this
and give it him, 17.345; e)/gxos e)/sthse fe/rwn
brought the spear
and placed it, 1.127; si=ton pare/qhke fe/rousa ib.139, al., cf. S.Tr.622; tou=to e)lqw\n oi)/kade fe/rwn tw=| patri\ e)/dwka Pl.Hp.Ma.282e, cf. R.345b; so o( me\n *)epi/xarmon . . ei)s de/ka to/mous fe/rwn sunh/gagen Porph.Plot. 24; e(ka/sth| e)nnea/di ta\ oi)kei=a fe/rwn sunefo/rhsa ibid., etc.; sts. translatable by
with, w)/|xonto fe/rontes ta\ gra/mmata Th.7.8. intr., in pass. sense, to denote unrestrained action, nu=n se ma/l' oi)/w . . fe/ronta . . filhteu/sein h.Merc.159; fe/rousa e)ne/bale nhi/+ fili/h| she
went and rammed, rammed
full tilt, Hdt.8.87; o(/tan e)pi\ qa/ter' w(/sper ei)s truta/nhn a)rgu/rion prosene/gkh|s, oi)/xetai fe/ron
down it sinks, D.5.12; ta\ me\n a)/lla me/rh tou= pole/mou parh=kan, fe/rontes de\ panti\ tw=| strateu/mati pro\s au)to\n *)akra/ganta prosh/reisan
hurling themselves, Plb.1.17.8; ei)s tou=to fe/rwn perie/sthse ta\ pra/gmata Aeschin.3.82; u(pe/balen e(auto\n fe/rwn *qhbai/ois ib.90, cf. 1.175, 3.143,146; in the foll. passages fe/rwn accompanies a Verb of throwing, giving, entrusting, or dedicating, and expresses wholehearted action, whether wise or unwise; there is always an accus., freq. of the reflex. Pron., governed by the principal Verb (or perh. by fe/rwn): e)pei\ e)s tou\s krath=ras e)mauto\n fe/rwn e)ne/balon (sc. o( *)empedoklh=s) when I
went (or
took) and threw myself . . , Luc.Icar.13, cf. Fug.1, Plu.
Comp.Arist. Cat.1, Fab.6, Per.12, Paus.1.30.1, Ael.VH8.14, Frr.10,69, Philostr. VA3.4; th\n kataskeuh\n . . fe/rwn e)dwrh/sato th=| mhtri/ D.S.31.27, cf. Ach.Tat.1.7; seauto\n . . fe/rwn a)phmpo/lhkas Luc.Merc.Cond.24; ti/ paqo/ntes . . toi=s a)te/knois tw=n gero/ntwn e)spoiei=te fe/rontes au(tou/s; Luc. DMort.6.3, cf. Ind.19, Laps.22; tau/th| (sc. th=| o)rgh=|） fe/rwn u(pe/qhken e(auto/n Plu.Them.24, cf. Per.7; tou/tw| fe/rontes u(poba/llousi tou\s ui(ou/s Id.2.4b, cf. Luc.6, Pomp.27, Ael.VH6.1, Max.Tyr.1.2; prose/qeto fe/rwn e(auto\n e)kei/nw| Eun.VS p.456 B., cf.pp.461,465 B., Dam. ap. Suid. s.v. *sebhriano/s; a)lla\ soi\ me\n, w)= qew=n pa/ter, e)mauto\n fe/rwn a)naqh/sw Jul.Or.7.231b. e)/kkrisis . . e)k mikrw=n fe/rousa diasthma/twn
occurring at short intervals, Sor.2.45. fe/rein, fe/resqai are freq. added epexegetically to di/dwmi and similar Verbs, dw=ken . . tri/poda fe/rein Il.23.513, cf. 16.665, 17.131; teu/xea . . do/tw fe/resqai 11.798, cf. Od.21.349, E.Tr.419,454(troch.). Pass. is used in most of the above senses:—special cases:
to be borne or
carried involuntarily, esp.
to be borne along by waves or winds,
to be swept away, fe/resqai a)ne/moisi, que/llh|, Od.9.82, 10.54, cf. A.Pers.276 (lyr.), etc.; pa=n d' h)=mar fero/mhn, of Hephaestus
falling from Olympus, Il.1.592; h(=ke fe/resqai he sent him
flying, 21.120; h(=ka po/das kai\ xei=re fe/resqai I let
go my hands and feet, let them
swing free [in the leap], Od.12.442, cf. 19.468; me/ga fe/retai pa\r se/qen, of a word uttered,
comes with weight, Pi.P.1.87; bi/a| fe/retai Pl.Phdr.254a; pneu=ma fero/menon Id.R.496d; to\ pneu=ma kata\ ta\s a)napnoa\s ei)/sw te kai\ e)/cw fe/retai Gal.16.520; r(ei=n kai\ fe/resqai Pl.Cra.411c; f. ei)s to\n *ta/rtaron Id.Phd.114b; simply,
move, go, poi= ga=s fe/romai; S.OT1309 (anap.); ou)k oi)=sq' o(/poi gh=s ou)d' o(/poi gnw/mhs fe/rh| Id.El.922, cf. E.Hec.1076 (anap.), etc.; of the excreta, ta\ fero/mena . . ei) me\n au)toma/tws fe/roito Philum. ap. Aët.9.12; pro\s koili/an ferome/nhn Aët.4.19: metaph., ei)s to\ loidorei=n fe/rh| E.Andr.729; pro\s th\n tou= ka/llous fu/sin Pl.Phdr.254b, cf. X.Mem.2.1.4; e)pi\ tau)to\ fe/rontai
have the same
tendency, Phld.Vit.p.42 J.; a)po\ dogma/twn kai\ a)po\ qewrhma/twn f. Vett.Val.238.30; of veins,
to be conveyed, Gal.15.531; also h( ferome/nh ou)si/a (the doctrine of)
universal motion, Pl.Tht.177c; oi( fero/menoi qeoi/ the
moving gods, i. e. the stars and planets, Plot.2.3.9. freq. in part. with another Verb of motion, fero/menoi e)se/pipton e)s tou\s *ai)ginh/tas they fell into their hands
with a rush, at full speed, Hdt.8.91; a)po\ . . e)lpi/dos w)|xo/mhn fero/menos Pl.Phd.98b; h(=ke fero/menos ei)s th\n e(autou= fu/sin Aeschin.3.89. of voluntary and impulsive motion, i)qu\s fe/retai me/nei Il.20.172; o(mo/se tini\ fe/resqai
come to blows with him, X.Cyn.10.21; dro/mw| f. pro/s tina Id.HG4.8.37; fugh=| ei)s e(autou\s f. Id.Cyr.1.4.23; h(/cei e)p' e)kei=non to\n lo/gon fero/menos Lycurg.59; fero/menos u(p' o)rgh=s D.H.Comp.18. metaph., kalw=s, kakw=s fe/resqai, of things, schemes, etc.,
turn out, prosper well or ill,
succeed or
fail, ou)/t' a)\n . . no/moi kalw=s fe/roint' a)/n S.Aj.1074; kakw=s f. ta\ e(autou= X.HG3.4.25; eu)= fe/retai h( gewrgi/a Id.Oec.5.17; o)ligw/rws e)/xein kai\ e)a=n tau=ta fe/resqai to neglect things and let them
take their course, D.8.67; less freq. of persons,
fare well or ill, eu)= fero/menos e)n strathgi/ais
being generally successful . . , Th.5.16, cf. 15; kalw=s fero/menos to\ kaq' e(auto/n Id.2.60; f. e)n protimh/sei para/ tini D.S.33.5; xei=ron ferome/nh para\ ta)delfw=| J.AJ16.7.6; of euphonious writing, su/nqesis kalw=s ferome/nh Phld.Po.5.26.
behave, u(pokritikw=s, a)sta/tws, etc., Vett.Val.38.20, 197.8, al.
have an opinion, o(/pws h)ne/xqh peri\ tou= sfugmou= what
his opinion was about . . , Marcellin.Puls.233. Med.: for its chief usages, v. supr. A. VI. 3.

ferwnu^m-e/omai, Pass.,
bear a name from . . , Eust.656.62.

ferwnu^m-i/a, Ep. ferwnu^m-i/h, h(,
name received from an event or action, Opp.H.1.243:
accordance of a name with an event, Eust.776.49.

ferw/nu^m-os, on,
bearing the name of, named after, tino/s Nic.Th.666, Orph.A.719, Coluth.246, Theol.Ar.19, Nonn.D.13.69; e)/k tinos Id.5.71:
well-named, like e)pw/numos, Ael.NA17.8. Adv. -mws Arist.Mu.399a19, Heraclit.All. 22.
feska/sion: ma/gganon ploi+ko/n, Phot., Suid.

fetia/lioi, oi(, = Lat.
Fetiales, D.H.2.72; written fitialei=s in Plu. Num.12; fhtialei=s Id.Cam.18: sg. fhtia/lios D.C.50.4.

feu=, exclamation of grief or anger,
alas! freq. in Trag.; f. ta/las S.Aj.983, etc.: freq. c. gen., f. tou= o)/rniqos . . A.Th.597, cf. S.El.920, 1183; f. th=s brotei/as [freno/s] E.Hipp.936: joined with other exclam., oi)oi= da= f. A.Eu.841 (lyr.); papai= f. or f. p., S.Ph.785,792; f. w)= *(ella/s X.Ages.7.5, cf. Cyr.7.3.8. of astonishment or admiration,
ah! oh! E.Heracl.552, El.262, Ph.1740 (lyr.), Pl.Phdr. 273c, etc., cf. Sch.Ar.Av.162; doubled, f. f. E.Heracl.535, Ar. l.c., Theoc.5.86: c. gen., f. f. th=s w(/ras, tou= ka/llous Ar.Av.1724 (lyr.); f. tou= a)ndro/s
oh, what a man! X.Cyr.3.1.39 (where, however, there is also a sense of
grief): also f. to\ kai\ labei=n pro/sfqegma toiou=d' a)ndro/s
oh, but to get speech of such a man! S.Ph.234; folld. by a relat., feu=, o(/sw| le/geis ktl. Pl.Phdr.263d; f. w(s eu)= le/geis Id.Hp. Ma.287b.—feu= in Trag. and Com. Poets sts. stands extra versum, A.Ag.1307, Ch.194, Ar.Nu.41, etc.; when it forms part of the verse, it is usu. at the beginning, but not so in S.Ph.234, 1302.

feu/gudros, on, (u(/dwr)
shunning water, Polybus ap.Cael.Aur. CP3.9.

feu/gw, Il.21.472, etc.: Ep. inf. feuge/men, feuge/menai, 10.147, 21.13; impf. e)/feugon 22.158, etc., Poet. feu=gon 9.478, Tyrt.5.8, Pi.N. 9.13: iter. feu/geskon Il.17.461, Hdt.4.43: fut. feu/comai Il.18.307, etc.; also feucou=mai in E. and Com., E.Med.341, 346, Hel.500,1041, Ba.659, Ar.Ach.203 (cod. R), 1129, Pl.447, Av.932 (a)po-), Men. 283 (but dub. where found in Att. Prose, Pl.Lg.635c, al., D.38.19; feucei=tai is dub. l. in IPE12.24.11 (Olbia, iv B. C.); fut. Act. e)k-feu/cw only late, v.l. in Aesop.349b, cf. Chambry ii p.479): aor. e)/fu^gon, Ion.fu/geskon Od.17.316: pf. pe/feuga Hdt.7.154 codd. (v. infr.11.1a); opt. pefeu/goi Il.21.609 (e)k-pefeugoi/hn S.OT840), part. pefeugo/tes Od.1.12; part. pf. Pass. pefugme/nos in act. sense, Il.6.488, Od.1.18, etc. (in pass. sense, Epicur.Fr.423); Ep. pefuzo/tes (cf. fu/za) Il.21.6,528, 532, 22.1, later sg. pefuzw/s Nic.Th.128; Aeol. pefu/ggwn, v. fugga/nw:—Med., mh\ feu/ghsqe Anon.Hist. in PLit.Lond.115: aor. 1 dia-feu/casqai Decr.Ath. in Hp.Ep.25. abs.,
