flee, take flight, opp. diw/kw, Il.22.157, etc.; bh= feu/gwn e)pi\ po/nton 2.665; ph=| feu/geis; 8.94; po/se feu/gete; 16.422; poi= fu/gwmen . . xqono/s; A.Supp.777 (lyr.); poi= tis ou)=n fu/gh|; S.Aj.403 (lyr.); e)nqe/nde e)kei=se f. Pl.Tht.176b:
with Preps., f. a)po/ tinos Od.12.120; feu/contai a)f' e(autw=n ei)s filosofi/an Pl.Tht.168a, etc.; e)k pole/moio, e)k qana/toio, Il.7.118, 20.350; e)k kakw=n pefeuge/nai S.Ant.437, cf. Hdt.1.65; u(pe\k kakou= Il.15.700, cf. 17.461 (rarely c. gen. only, pefugme/nos h)=en a)e/qlwn (v. infr. 11) Od.1.18; th=s no/sou pefeuge/nai S.Ph.1044); f. e)s patri/da gai=an Il. 2.140, 159, al.; e)pi\ *sa/rdewn, e)pi\ to\n *(elikw=na, X.Cyr.7.2.1, Ages. 2.11; pro\s to\ o)/ros Id.HG3.5.19; u(po\ ga=n A.Eu.175 (lyr.); u(po\ delfi=nos i)xqu/es f. Il.21.23, cf. 554 (cf. infr. 111.2): c. acc. cogn., fu/ge laiyhro\n dro/mon
ran the course full swiftly, Pi.P.9.121; ti/na fugh\n feucou/meqa; E.Hel.1041; f. th\n para\ qa/lassan (sc. o(do/n)
flee by the shore route, Hdt.4.12; cf. infr. 111; for fugh=| feu/gein, v. infr. 11.1, fugh/ 1.1. pres. and impf. tenses prop. express only
the purpose or
endeavour to get away: hence part. feu/gwn is added to the compd. Verbs katafeu/gw, e)kfeu/gw, profeu/gw, to distinguish
the attempt from
the accomplishment, be/lteron, o(\s feu/gwn profu/gh| kako\n h)e\ a(lw/h| it is better that one should
flee and escape than stay and be caught, Il.14.81; feu/gwn e)kfeu/gei Hdt.5.95, cf. Ar.Ach.177; f. katafugei=n Hdt.4.23. f. ei)s . .
have recourse to . .
take refuge in . . , e)s tou\s a)fw/nous ma/rturas E.Hipp.1076. c. inf.,
shun or
shrink from doing, Hdt.4.76, Antipho 1.13, Pl.Ap.26a; with inf. omitted, feu/gousi ga/r toi xoi( qrasei=s
shrink back, S.Ant. 580. c. acc.,
flee, avoid, escape, *(/ektora Il.11.327, etc.; f. tina\ e)k ma/xhs Hdt.7.104; f. e)s th\n *)asi/hn tou\s *sku/qas Id.4.12; f. qa/naton Il.1.60; e)/nq' a)/lloi me\n pa/ntes, o(/soi fu/gon ai)pu\n o)/leqron, oi)/koi e)/san po/lemo/n te pefeugo/tes h)de\ qa/lassan Od.1.11; e)/fugon kako/n, eu(=ron a)/meinon, formula used by mu/stai, D.18.259; with modal dat., f. o)/neidos lo/gois, a)maxani/an e)/rgw|, Pi.O.6.90, P.9.92;
avoid, shun, xrh\ . . feu/gein ta\ paxu/nonta Gal.Vict.Att.12; th\n a)rgi/an kai\ th\n a)kinhsi/an tou= sw/matos Sor.1.93, cf. 46, al.; fo/non f.
flee the consequences of the murder, E.Med.796; ai(=ma suggene\s f. xqono/s Id.Supp.148; ta\n *dio\s mh=tin f. A.Pr.906 (lyr.); o)smh\n . . , mh\ ba/lh|, pefeugo/tes S.Ant.412; feu/gwn fugh=| to\ gh=ras Pl.Smp.195b; e)s po/nton . . fu/ge pe/tras nhu=s Od. 10.131; ou)demi/a [po/lis] pe/feuge (sed fort. leg. a)pe/fuge） doulosu/nhn pro\s *(ippokra/teos at the hands of . . , Hdt.7.154: part. pf. Pass. also retains the acc. in Hom. in periphrastic phrases, moi=ran d' ou)/ tina/ fhmi pefugme/non e)/mmenai a)ndrw=n Il.6.488; pefugme/non e)/mmen o)/leqron Od.9.455; ou)/ oi( nu=n e)/ti g' e)/sti pefugme/non a)/mme gene/sqai Il.22.219, cf. h.Ven. 34:—but in pass. sense, to\ pa/rauta pefugme/non kako/n Epicur.l.c.
seek to avoid, shirk, stratei/an D.21.162; ei) tou=to feu/contai kai\ mh\ 'qelh/sousi poiei=n Id.20.138; so in aor., h)\n fu/gh| tis, zhmiou=n Ar.Ach. 717. of things, h(ni/oxon fu/gon h(ni/a
escaped, slipped from his hands, Il.23.465; *ne/stora d' e)k xeirw=n fu/gon h(ni/a 8.137, cf. 11.128; to\ feu=gon the
part which slips, X.Eq. 10.9, cf. Hp.Off.9, Gal.18(2).735: c. dupl. acc., poi=o/n se e)/pos fu/gen e(/rkos o)do/ntwn Il.4.350, Od.1.64, etc. of wine, '
go off', turn sour, Gp.7.7.8.
flee one's country, Il. 9.478, Od.13.259; oi( feu/gontes the
exiles, Th.1.24, X.Ages.7.6; patri/da f. Od.15.228, X.Cyr.3.1.24; th\n au(tou= Th.5.26; a(/pasan th\n *)aqhnai/wn cummaxi/da IG12.10.30; f. e)c *)/argeos Od.15.224, cf. Th.8.85; e)c *)aqhne/wn, e)k th=s patri/dos, Hdt.6.103, X.An.1.3.3. f. u(po\ *skuqe/wn
to be expelled, driven out by . . Hdt.4.125: but esp.
to be exiled, f. u(po\ tou= dh/mou Id.5.30, X.HG1.1.27; f. e)c *)arei/ou pa/gou by their sentence, Din.1.44: also c. acc., f. *peisistrati/das Hdt. 5.62. abs.,
go into exile, live in banishment, A.Ag.1668 (troch.), Antipho 2.2.9, Pl.Mx.242b; du/o e)/th feuge/tw Id.Lg.867c; f. a)eifugi/an
to be banished for life, ib. 871d, al.; feo/gein *)amfi/polin a)eifugi/hn SIG194.3, cf. 24 (Amphipolis, iv B. C.); but also e)n a)eifugi/a| Pl.Lg. 877e; feu/gwn a)p' oi)/kwn a(\s e)gw\ feu/gw fuga/s E.Andr.976; feu/gontes
being in exile, opp. fugo/ntes
having gone into exile, Lys.14.33; with play on words, "me/xri ti/nos feu/ch|, *)arkadi/wn;" kai\ o(/s, "e)/s t' a)\n tou\s a)fi/kwmai oi(\ ou)k i)/sasi *fi/lippon" Duris 3 J. as law-term (mostly in pres. and impf., but cf. Lys.12.4 (v. infr.)),
to be accused or
prosecuted at law: o( feu/gwn the
accused, defendant, Ar.V.893, Pl.R.405b, etc.; opp. diw/kw, ou)/te feu/gwn a(lou\s ou)/te diw/kwn h(tthqei/s D.23.66; c. acc., f. grafa/s, di/khn, Ar.Eq.442 (lyr.), Nu.167; u(po/ tinos di/kas f. Pl.Ap. 19c, cf. D.49.1; ou)deni\ pw/pote ou)/te h(mei=s ou)/te e)kei=nos di/khn ou)/te e)dikasa/meqa ou)/te e)fu/gomen Lys. l. c.; f. a)pologi/as Aeschin.3.201; the crime being added in gen., fo/nou di/khn f. Antipho 5.9; grafa\s f. parano/mwn D.18.235; more freq. c. gen. only, f. fo/nou
to be charged with murder, Lys.10.31, Lycurg.133, etc.; f. deili/as Ar. Ach.1129; ceni/as Id.V.718 (anap.); with gen. of the penalty, e)a\n . . feu/gh| desmw=n OGI218.92 (Ilium, iii B. C.); also peri\ qana/tou f. Antipho 5.95; f. e)pi\ mhnu/sei tino/s And.1.18; a)sebei/as f. u(po/ tinos
is accused of impiety by . . , Pl.Ap.35d; rarely of things, to\ feu=gon yh/fisma the decree
that is on its defence, the decree
in question, D.23.58:—in Hdt.7.214 ai)ti/hn f. has the older sense,
flee from a charge,
quit one's country on account of a charge.
plead in defence, dei= toi/ se feu/gein . . w(s ou)k e)/xousi ku=ros [oi( no/moi] A.Supp.390; e)/feuge mh\ ei)de/nai
pleaded ignorance, S.Ant.263, (Cf. Lat.
fugio, Goth.
biugan 'bend', etc.)

feu/zw,
cry feu=,
cry woe, ti/ tou=t' e)/feucas; A.Ag.1308.
feuk-tai=os, a, on, = a)potro/paios, Hsch.

feuk-te/on,
one must flee, a)po/ tinos Pl.Phd.62d; deu=ro toi=s kakoi=si f. they
must flee, E.Heracl.259, cf. Ar.Av.392 (lyr.): pl., Sch.Il.10.149. c. acc., a)kolasi/an Pl. Grg.507d, cf. X.Mem.2.6.4, etc. feukte/os, a, on,
to be avoided, Gal.18(2).850; ta\ f. Iamb.VP31.190.

feuk-tia/w, Desiderat. from feu/gw,
wish to flee, Arist.Fr.130.

feuk-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to avoid, opp. o)rektiko/s, c. gen., Arist.de An.431a13; opp. ai(retiko/s, Phld. Mus.p.93 K.

feuk-to/s, h/, o/n,
to be shunned or
avoided, Arist.EN 1153b2; opp. ai(reto/s, ib.1119a23, 1172b19, Epicur.Ep.3p.63U., Phld. Herc.1251.13: Comp., Arist.Top.116b5.
that can be escaped or
avoided, a)ggeli/an a)/tlaton ou)de\ feukta/n S.Aj.224 (lyr.), cf. Pl.Ax. 369b; cf. fukto/s.
feucaspi/dion, to/, = po/lion, Ps.-Dsc.3.110.
feucei/w, = feuktia/w, prob. for feuciw= in E.HF628.
feu/ci^mos, on, later form of fu/cimos, to/pos Plb.13.6.9; e)/sti dou/lw| f. bwmo/s Plu.2.166e. = feukto/s, Hsch.

feuci^p . . , dub. in Cerc.6.7 (fort. feuciph/mon' or feuci/ponon
avoiding trouble or
toil).
feu=cis, ews, h(, = fu/cis, S.Ant.362 (lyr.).

feya^lo/omai, Pass.,
to be burnt to ashes, A.Pr.364.

fe/ya^los, ou, o( (also fe/yelos, gloss on feya/luc, Hsch.):—
spark, piece of the embers, Ar.Ach.668 (lyr.), V.227, Arist.Mete.367a5:— feya/luc [a^], u^gos, o(, Archil.126, Ar.Lys.107, Plb.1.48.6: prov. phrases, a)spi\s e)n tw=| feya/lw| kremh/setai, i.e. will be hung in the chimney, of things laid by and unused, Ar.Ach.279; ou)de\ feya/luc not so much as . . , Id.Lys. l. c.

fe/ws, w, o(, = stoibh/,
Poterium spinosum, Thphr.HP6.1.3.
fh/, enclit. for fhsi/, Anacr.40:—but fh=, Dor. fa=, for e)/fh.

fh/ ( fh= Aristarch.) = w(s,
as, like as, read by Zenodotus in Il.2.144, 14.499, said by Sch.A on 14.499 to occur in Antim. (he cites Fr. 79) and in Call. (v. Frr.366,518), fh/ r(a prob. for dh/ r(a (v.l. qh=ra) in h.Merc.241.
fhgi^ne/os, h, on, = sq. krhth/r, nhu=s, AP6.33 (Maec.), Orph.A.67.

fh/gi^nos, h, on,
oaken, a)/cwn Il.5.838; o)/zos Call.Epigr.36, cf. Dsc. Eup.1.102.

fhgo/s, Dor. fa_go/s Theoc.9.20, h(, = dru=s a)gri/a,
Valonia oak, Quercus Aegilops, Thphr.HP3.3.1, 3.8.2, etc.: freq. in Il.(not in Od.), *dio\s perikalle/i+ fhgw=| Il.5.693; fhgw=| e)f' u(yhlh= . . *dio/s 7.60; h( palaia\ f., of
the oak of Dodona, S.Tr.171, cf. Hes.Frr.134.7, 212 (but dru=s S.Tr.1168).
acorn of the same tree, Ar.Pax1137 (lyr.), Pl.R. 372c, Theoc. l.c., D.Chr.6.62. (Cf. Lat.
fāgus 'beech', OE.
bóc 'beech'.)

fhgo/teuktos, on,
oaken, mo/ssun Lyc.1432.

fhgw/n, w=nos, o(,
oak-grove, Lat.
aesculetum, Gloss.
fh/h|, Ep. 3sg. pres. subj. of fhmi/ (q. v.).
fhlhki/zw, = fhlo/w, EM160.41.
fhlhko/qreptos, on, = e)rinasto/s, Hsch.

fh/lhc, hkos, o(,
a wild fig (perh. from fh=los,
deceitful, because it seems ripe when it is not really so), Ar.Pax1165 (cf. S.Fr.731).
fhlhteu/w, fhlh/ths, v. filhteu/w, filh/ths.

fh=l-os, on （fhlo/s is prob. an error in Theognost.Can.61),
deceitful, EM130.51, 160.45, Sch.Ar.Pax1165, Suid. (The connexion with Lat.
fallere is doubtful.)

fhl-o/w,
cheat, deceive, e)fh/lwsen fre/nas A.Ag.492; e)pe/essin A.R.3.983; lw/baisi kai\ klauqmoi=si Lyc.785, cf. Men.17:—Pass., glw/ssais fhlou/menoi E.Supp.243.

fh/l-wma, atos, to/,
deception, cheat, Antipho Soph.71.

fh/l-wsis, ews, h(,
deceit, EM791.33.

fh=ma, atos, to/, (fhmi/)
that which is said, word, Hsch. (pl.).

fh/mh, h(, Aeol. and Dor. fa/ma, Sapph.Supp.20
a.12, Pi.O.7.10; pseudo-Dor. fh/ma B.5.194, al., Isyll.80: (fhmi/).
utterance prompted by the gods, significant or
prophetic saying, xai=re de\ fh/mh| *)odussh=os fi/los ui(o/s Od.2.35, ubi v. Sch.; in the prayer of Odysseus to Zeus, fh/mhn ti/s moi fa/sqw Od.20.100; folld. by fh/mhn d' e)c oi)/koio gunh\ proe/hken a)letri/s ib. 105; f. and klehdw/n are interchanged, Hdt. 5.72, cf. S.El.1109 sq.; f. about a te/ras, Hdt.3.153; ei)/te tou qew=n fh/mhn a)kou/sas ei)/t' a)p' a)ndro\s oi)=sqa S.OT43, cf. 86,475(lyr.); tou= o)nei/rou h( f. the
message of the dream, Hdt.1.43; f. mantikai/ S.OT 723; f. qesfa/twn Id.Tr.1150; ma/ntewn fh=mai E.Hipp.1056. cf. Ion 180 (lyr.); fh/mh tis oi)/kwn e)n muxoi=s i(drume/nh Id.Hel.820; fh/mas te kai\ mantei/as Pl.Phd.111b, cf. Isoc.9.21; fh/mas kai\ e)nu/pnia kai\ oi)wnou/s X. Smp.4.48, cf. Cyr.8.7.3, etc.; fh/mhs e(/neka
ominis causa, Pl.Lg.878a, cf. 908a; th=| po/lei (sc. Aquileia) a)eto\s oi)/kizome/nh| th\n au(tou= f. xari/zetai Jul.Or.2.72a; hence, comically, fh/mh g' u(mi=n o)/rnis e)sti/ Ar.Av.720; f. a)gaqh\n le/comen = eu)fhmi/an pare/comen, Id.V.865 (anap.).
report, rumour, usu. of uncertain and mysterious origin, fh/mh ou)/ tis pa/mpan a)po/llutai, h(/n tina polloi\ laoi\ fhmi/cwsi: qeo/s nu/ ti/s e)sti kai\ au)th/ Hes.Op.763, cf. Aeschin.1.128 (citing fh/mh d' e)s strato\n h)=lqe as from Il.); *fh/mhs bwmo/s Sch. ad loc., Paus.1.17.1;
common report, opp. sukofanti/a, Aeschin.2.145; fa/ma d' h)=lqe kata\ pto/lin Sapph. l. c.; a)/mbrote *f. S.OT158 (lyr.); f. e)se/ptato e)s to\ strato/pedon Hdt.9.100; f. dhmo/qrous A.Ag.938; ti/n' e)/xwn f. a)gaqh\n h(/keis; Ar.Eq.1320 (anap.); f. u(porrei= Pl.Lg.672b; fh/mhn kataskeda/sai Id.Ap.18c.
report of a man's character,
repute, deinh\n de\ brotw=n u(paleu/eo fh/mhn: f. ga/r te kakh\ pe/letai, kou/fh me\n a)ei=rai—r(ei=a ma/l', a)rgale/h de\ fe/rein, xaleph\ d' a)poqe/sqai Hes.Op.760; u(podee/stera th=s f. Th.1.11; peri\ to\n tw=n a)nqrw/pwn bi/on . . kai\ pra/ceis a)yeudh/s tis plana=tai f. Aeschin.1.127; toiau/thn f. sauth=| perifuome/nhn Isoc.5.78: pl., e)pife/rein gunaikei/ous e(autoi=s fh/mas Pl.Lg.935a; e)pw/numos e)n fh/mais brotw=n Antiph.105:—esp. of
good report, fame, perixarh\s th=| f. Hdt. 1.31; kata\ th\n eu)logi/an kai\ tou\s e)pai/nous kai\ th\n f. Isoc.5.134, cf. 4.186; o( d' o)/lbios o(\n fa=mai kate/xont' a)gaqai/ Pi.O.7.10: but also f. ponhrai/ A.Ch.1045; ai)sxra\ f., opp. kalh\ do/ca, Isoc. 1.43; yeudh= f. u(mnei=n kata\ qew=n Pl.Lg.822c, cf. R.463d. fa=mai
songs of praise, Pi.P.2.16; fa/ma filofo/rmigc A.Supp.697 (lyr.), cf. Th.866 (anap.).
any voice or
words, speech, saying, lo/gwn f. poet. periphr. for lo/goi, S.Ph.846 (lyr.); esp.
common report, tradition, legend, a)ll' e)/sti fh/mh . . A.Supp.760; poliai\ fh=mai E.El.701 (lyr.), cf. Pl.Phlb.16c, Lg.713c; ai( a)rxai=ai f. Plb.12.3.2; mnh/mhn para\ th=s
fh/mhs labw/n Lys.2.3.
common report or
parlance, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.242; o(/sous h( koinh\ f. parade/dwken [qeou/s] Phld.Piet.17.
message, A.Ch.741, S.El.1155, E.Hipp.158 (lyr.).

fhmi/, fh/|s, fhis PCair.Zen.316.1 (iii B. C.), PSI7.846.7 (Pap. of Ar. (?), ii/iii A. D.), cf. Hdn.Gr.2.147, 419; fhsi/ (apocop. fh/ Anacr.40); pl. fa^me/n, fa^te/, fa_si/; Dor. fa_mi/, fa_si/ or fa_ti/ (Ar.Ach.771, Anon. in PSI9.1091.11, 18), 3pl. fanti/; Aeol. fa=mi Sapph.32, 2sg. fai=sqa Alc.Supp.20.6, 3sg. fai=si ib.26.5, Sapph.66, 3pl. fai=si Sapph. Supp.5.2: aor. 2 e)/fhn, Ep. fh=n Il.18.326; e)/fhsqa 1.397, al., Ar.Lys. 132, X.An.1.6.7, Pl.Cra.438a, Aeschin.3.164, etc. (rarely e)/fhs Il.22.280, X.Cyr.4.1.23), Ep. fh=sqa Il.21.186, Od.14.149 (v.l. fh=|sqa）, fh=s Il.5.473, Od.7.239 (v.l.); e)/fh, Ep. fh=, Dor. fa= Pi.I.2.11; 1pl. e)/fa^men Isoc.3.26 (e)/fhmen A.D.Adv.184.7, Gal.1.158, Papp.524.16, Choerob. in Theod.2.341 H.); 2pl. e)/fa^te And.2.25; 3pl. e)/fasan, Ep. fa/san Il.2.278, also e)/fa^n, fa/n, 3.161, 6.108; imper. faqi/ (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.431, al., A.D.Synt.264.4; fa/qi is found in codd. of Pl. Grg.475e, al.); subj. fw=, fh=|s, fh=|, Ep. fh=|sin Od.1.168, fh/h| 11.128, 23.275; Dor. 3pl. subj. fa=nti Tab.Heracl.1.116; opt. fai/hn, 1pl. fai=men Il.2.81, 24.222, Pi.N.7.87, 3pl. fai=en Th.3.68, etc.; inf. fa/nai, Hdt.1.27, etc., poet. fa/men Pi.N.8.19; part. fa/s Il.9.35, Hdt.1.63, 141, SIG279.18 (Zeleia, iv B. C.), fa=sa Hdt.6.135, pl. fa/ntes Il.3.44, 14.126, Pl.Alc.2.139b: fut. fh/sw, Dor. fasw= Ar.Ach. 739, etc.; 1pl. fasou=mes Diotog. ap. Stob.4.1.133: aor. 1 e)/fhsa Cratin. in PSI11.1212.9, Hdt.3.153, PCair.Zen.19.3 (iii B. C.) (e)/fasen is dub. ib.140.7); Dor. 3sg. fa=se Pi.N.1.66; 2sg. subj. (Dor.) fa/sh|s [a_] Simon.32 (fh/sh|s etc. codd. Stob., corr. Bgk.); opt. fh/seie Hdt.6.69, A.Pr.503, part. fh/sas X.Mem.3.11.1, Isoc.12.239, inf. fh=sai Thphr. Char.2.7:—Med. (chiefly poet. in early writers), impf. and aor. 2 e)fa/mhn, e)/fato (also SIG437.6 (Delph., iii B. C.), PCair.Zen.343.8 (iii B. C.), PSI4.437.8 (iii B. C.), Parth.4.5, etc.), Ep. fa/to Il.20.262, fa/sqe Od.6.200, 10.562, e)/fanto, Ep. fa/nto 24.460; imper. fa/o 16.168, 18.171, fa/sqw, fa/sqe; inf. fa/sqai; part. fa/menos (also Archim.
Spir. Prooem., Eratosth.Prooem., SIG364.83 (Ephesus, iii B. C.), PCair.Zen.236.4 (iii B. C.), PHamb.4.14 (i A. D.), J.AJ17.12.2, Gal. 6.228, etc.): Dor. fut. fa/somai [a_] Pi.N.9.43:—Pass., pf. 3sg. pe/fatai A.R.2.500; 3sg. imper. pefa/sqw Pl.Ti.72d; but part. pefasme/nos Il.14.127, A.Pr.843 shd. be referred to fai/nw: aor. e)fa/qhn （a)p-, kat-) Arist.Int.18b39. The pres. indic. fhmi/ is enclit., exc. in 2sg. pres. fh/|s: fame/n is 1pl. pres., fa/men poet. inf.: fanti/ is 3pl., fa/nti part. fa/skw supplied all moods of pres. except the indic., also impf. e)/faskon; cf. h)mi/. [a^, except in fa_si, and in masc. and fem. part. fa/s, fa=sa: in inf. fa/nai a^ always; fa=nai is corrupt in Eub.119.11 codd. Ath.]:—
say, affirm, assert, either abs., or folld. by inf., e. g. *lusi/qeus *miki/wna fili=n ( = -ei=n） fhsi IG12.924, cf. 57.48, or acc. et inf.; the inf. is freq. omitted, se\ kako\n kai\ a)na/lkida fh/sei (sc. ei)=nai) Il.8.153; also *korinqi/ous ti/ fw=men; what
shall we say of them? X.HG3.5.12; f. pro/s tina, pro\s cei=non fa/sqai e)/pos h)d' e)pakou=sai Od.17.584: less freq. c. dat., au)toi=s Ev.Matt.13.28; kata/ tinos f. to
speak against him, X.Ap.25: sts. folld. by w(s, Lys.7.19, v.l. in X. HG6.3.7; by o(/ti, Pl.Grg.487d, Corn.ND30; by an interrog. clause, mh/ pote fa/sh|s o(/ ti gi/netai au)/rion Simon. l.c.; by part., dub. in Pl. Grg.481c (fort. leg. qw=men); also parenthetic, ti/nes, fh/|s, h)=san oi( lo/goi; Pl.Phd.59c. since what one says commonly expresses a belief or opinion,
think, deem, suppose, fh= ga\r o(/ g' ai(rh/sein *pria/mou po/lin Il. 2.37; fai/hs ke za/koto/n te/ tin' e)/mmenai a)/frona/ te
you would say, would think, he was . . , 3.220; i)=son e)moi\ fa/sqai
to say he is (i. e.
fancy himself) equal to me, 1.187, 15.167; mh\ . . faqi\ leu/ssein
think not that you see, Theoc.22.56; ti/ fh/|s; what
say you? i.e. what
think you? (v. infr. 11.5); le/g' a)nu/sas o(/ ti fh/|s Ar.Pl.349:—so f. dei=n, f. xrh=nai,
deem it right, And.3.34, Isoc.3.48.
say, i.e.
write, of an author, w(s e)/fhmen Gal.1.158, etc.—The Med. has all these senses as well as the Act. Special Phrases: fasi/,
they say, it is said, Il.5.638, Od.6.42, etc.; parenthetically, Arist.EN1109a35, Men.Epit. 223, etc.: Prose writers use fhsi/ when quoting, D.23.89, etc.; fhsi/n
saith He, 1 Ep.Cor.6.16; esp. of an opponent's objection, Plu.2.112c; even after a plural, o(/ toi/nun me/giston e)/xein oi)/ontai . . "kai\ au)to/s", fhsi/, "tw=n ei)sio/ntwn h)=sqa" Lib.Or.52.39; "to\n de\ met' ei)seno/hsa", e)/fh *(/omhros as H.
said, Pl.Prt.315b. joined with a synon. Verb, e)/fh le/gwn, e)/fhse le/gwn, Hdt.3.156, 6.137, etc.; e)/lege fa/s Id.1.122; le/gei ou)de/n, fame/nh . . Id.2.22; ti/ e)rou=men h)\ ti/ fh/somen; D.8.37, cf. 25.100; ti/ fw=; ti/ le/cw; E.Hel.483. in repeating dialogues the Verb commonly goes before its subject, e)/fhn e)gw/, e)/fh o( *swkra/ths,
said I,
said S., but the order is sts. inverted, e)gw\ e)/fhn, o( *swkra/ths e)/fh, I
said, S.
said. inserted parenthetically, though the sentence has been introduced by le/gei, ei)=pen, etc., o( *)isxo/maxos . . ei)=pen: a)lla\ pai/zeis me\n su/ ge, e)/fh X.Oec.17.10, cf. Pl.Chrm.164e; h( kri/sis . . diarrh/dhn le/gei "dio/ti", fhsi/n, "e)/doce ta)lhqh= ei)saggei=lai" Lys.13.50. ti/ fhmi/; S.OT1471, and ti/ fh/|s; Ph.804, E.Hel. 706 (dub.), are used extra metrum, as exclamations. kuriw/tata fa/nai, in parenthesis, strictly
speaking, Ph.2.374; w(s ou(/tw fa/nai, = w(s ei)pei=n, a(/pasai w(s ou(/tw fa/nai
practically all, Gal.Vict.Att.9; sunelo/nta (v.l. -o/nti）fa/nai, = sunelo/nti ei)pei=n, Id.16.502. *oi)di/poun . . a)\n mo/non fw= if I only
mention Oedipus, Antiph.191.6, cf. Pl.Cra.411a, 435a. like kata/fhmi,
say yes, affirm, assert, kai\ tou\s fa/nai and they
said yes, Hdt.8.88; kai/ fhmi ka)po/fhmi S.OC317; e)/gwge/ fhmi Pl. Grg.526c; fa/nai te kai\ a)parnei=sqai Id.Tht.165a: c. inf., fh\|s h)\ katarnei= mh\ dedrake/nai ta/de; S.Ant.442; but ou)/ fhmi means
say no, deny, refuse, c. inf., h( *puqi/h ou)k e)/fh xrh/sein
said she would
not . . , Hdt.1.19, cf. 8.2; ou)k e)/fasan e)pitre/yai Lys.13.15, 47 (leg. -tre/yein): c. acc. et inf., ou)/ fhm' *)ore/sthn s' e)ndi/kws a)ndrhlatei=n A.Eu.221, cf. Hdt.2.63: abs., ka)\n me\n mh\ fh=| if he
says no, Ar.Av.555 (anap.); h)\ fa/qi h)\ mh\ a(\ e)rwtw= answer me
yes or no, Pl.Grg.475e; so in answers, fhmi/ or ou(/tws fhmi/
yes, Id.Phdr.270c, al., Grg.500e; ou)k e)/fh he
said no, Id.Phd.118a.— In this sense Att. writers, besides pres., mostly use fut. fh/sw and aor. e)/fhsa, but in impf., inf., and part. pres., to avoid ambiguity, they prefer e)/faskon, fa/skein, fa/skwn (v. fa/skw): fa/nai is distd. fr. fa/skein, e.g. e)/fh spouda/zein
he said he was in haste, e)/faske spouda/zein
he alleged he was in haste; but e)/fhsqa is found in this sense, X.An.1.6.7.
command, order, e)/fhn tw=| *)orqobou/lw| e)calei=yai/ me Lys.16.13 (so e)/fasan, v. l. for e)/frasan in X.Cyr.4.6.11).

fhmi/zw, aor. e)fh/misa A. (v. infr.), E. (v. infr.), Ep. subj. -i/cw Hes. Op.764, Dor. e)fa/mica （kat-) Pi.O.6.56:—Med., aor. e)fhmisa/mhn A. (v. infr.), Ep. -ica/mhn D.P.90, Nonn.D.3.276:—Pass., fut. fhmisqh/somai Lyc.1082: aor. e)fhmi/sqhn Plu.2.264d, etc.: pf. pefh/mismai Str.1.2.12: (fh/mh).
prophesy, utter, h(=| kai\ *aoci/as e)fh/mise A.Ch.558.
spread a report, fh/mhn f. Hes.Op.764; diabola/s J.BJ1.23.2, cf. Q.S.13.538, etc.:—Pass., oi( teqna/nai fhmisqe/ntes Plu. l.c., cf. J.BJ1.29.4, Arr.Peripl.M.Eux.6, PGiss.19.4 (ii A. D.); *mi/nws o)aristh\s tou= *dio\s e)fhmi/sqh ei)=nai Plot.6.9.7: abs.,
to be slandered, Supp.Epigr.4.648.12 (Lydia, ii A. D.).
call, name, tina/ ti Call.Aet.3.1.14, 58, Nonn.D.9.23; ou)/noma f. Opp.H.5.476:— Med., Euph.57.
promise, h(\n (sc. eu)nh/n） e)fh/misen path/r moi E.IA1356; o(\ e)fh/misen . . parasxe/sqai Sch.Call. in *dihgh/seis xi 3. Med.,
express in words, sunto/mws e)fhmi/sw A.Ag.629, cf. 1162 (lyr.), 1173(lyr.):—Pass., Zos.Alch.p.169B.
fh/mios, o(, name of a minstrel in Od. (1.154, al.). epith. of Zeus, SIG1014.27 (Erythrae, iii B. C.); *fhmi/a, epith. of Athena, ibid.

fh=mis, ios, h(, poet. for fh/mh,
speech, talk, Il.10.207; but e)s qw=kon pro/molon dh/moio/ te fh=min the
place of talk Od.15.468.
common opinion or
judgement expressed in talk, xaleph\ d' e)/xe dh/mou f. 14.239, cf. 16.75; tw=n a)leei/nw fh=min a)deuke/a their 'bitter
gossip', 6.273; *kassa/ndran . . fa=mis e)/xhsi brotw=n Ibyc.9. f. a)oidw=n their
praise, Euph.40: hence,
reputation, xaleph\n de/ te fh=min o)pa/ssei . . gunaici/ Od.24.201; later of
good report, Man.3.183,237.
fhmismo/s, o(, = fh/mh, Suid.

fhmosu/nh, h(,
oracular utterance, Inscr.Cret.1.xvi7 (Lato, ii/i B. C.).

fh/nh, h(, a kind of
vulture, perh.
lammergeyer, Gypaëtus barbatus, fh=nai h)\ ai)gupioi/ Od.16.217, cf. 3.372, Ar.Av.304, Arist.HA592b5, 619b23, cf. fi/nis; sacred to Athena, Ael.NA12.4.
fhno/s, = lampro/s, Hdn.Gr.1.176.

fh/r, o(, gen. fhro/s, Aeol. (cf. Hsch.) for qh/r, pl. fh=res Simon.59 (cf. Rh.Mus.38.378); of
the Centaurs, Il.1.268, 2.743; in sg., Pi.P.3.4, 4.119:—in Ion. writers of Satyrs (v. sq.), Gal.17(2).38; of Marsyas, Telest.1.5.

fh/rea, ta/,
swelling of the parotid glands, so as to be like the budding horns of Satyrs (fh=res), Hp.Epid.6.3.6 (nisi leg. fhrei=a), cf. Gal.ad loc.: hence Adv. fhreatikw=s, Gal.19.151.
fhri/a, Aeol. for qhri/a, Hsch.

fhroma^nh/s, e/s,
madly fond of wild animals, epith. of Dionysus, AP9.524.22. fh=ros: h( tw=n a)rxai/wn qew=n trofh/, Hsch.; fh=ron Hdn.Gr.1.385.
fhti-alei=s, fhti-a/lioi, v. *fetia/lioi.
fh/trh, fhtri/a, v. fra/tra.
fqa/zw, = fqa/nw, Sch.A.R.2.1219.
fqai/rw, Dor. for fqei/rw, Eust.1648.6, EM269.50.

fqa/nw, Il.9.506, impf. e)/fqanon X.HG6.2.30, AP9.272 (Bianor): fut. fqh/somai Il.23.444, Th.5.10, Pl.R.375c, etc.; but fqa/sw [a^] Hp. Morb.3.13 (s. v. l.), X.Cyr.5.4.38: aor. e)/fqa^sa Hdt.7.161, A.Pers. 752 (troch.), Th.3.49, X.Cyr.7.1.19, etc.; imper. fqa/son J.AJ6.11.7; opt. 3sg. fqa/seie Isoc.8.120, pl. fqa/seian X.HG7.2.14 (this tense prevails in later Gk., Plb.3.66.1, etc.); Dor. e)/fqassa Theoc.2.115: but the only Ep. aor. is e)/fqhn, not found in A. or S., but the more usual form in E. and Ar., less freq. in Th., X., D.; pl. e)/fqhmen, -hte, -hsan, E.Ph.1468, Isoc.5.7, Antipho 2.2.5, Ep.pl.3 fqa/n Il.11.51; subj. fqw=, Ep. 3sg. fqh/h|, fqh=|sin, 16.861, 23.805; Ep. 1pl. fqe/wmen Od.16.383; 3pl. fqe/wsi 24.437; opt. fqai/hn, Ep. 3sg. fqai/hsi （para-) Il.10.346; inf. fqh=nai Hdt.6.115, Th.4.4; part. fqa/s Hdt.3.71; Ep. part. Med. fqa/menos Il.5.119, al., Hes.Op.554: pf. e)/fqa^ka Philipp. ap. D.18.39, LXX 2 Ch.28.9, IG12 9).906.26 (Chalcis, iii A. D.); pe/fqaka Ps.-Callisth. 2.10 (v. l): plpf. e)fqa/kei Plu.Galb. 17, Luc.Philops.6:—Pass., Arist.Mu.395a18: impf. e)fqa/neto AP9.278 (Bianor); e)fqa/nonto J.BJ5.2.4 (v.l. e)foneu/onto): aor. e)fqa/sqhn D.H. 6.25, Epigr.Gr.315 (Smyrna), IPE2.197 (Panticapaeum, ii A. D.), J.AJ8.12.4. Gal.4.560. [fqa^nw always in Att. (so also in AP9.272 (Bianor), APl.4.382, 384); fqa_nw in Il.9.506, 21.262 (where Zenod. read fqane/ei for fqa/nei）]:—
come or
do first or
before others: c. acc. pers.,
to be beforehand with, overtake, outstrip, in running or otherwise, fqa/nei de/ te kai\ to\n a)/gonta Il.21.262; fqh= se telos qana/toio 11.451, cf. Hes.Op.554,570, Hdt.7.161, E.Heracl.120, IT669, Isoc.9.42, etc.; ou) mh\ fqa/swmen tou\s koimhqe/ntas 1 Ep.Thess.4.15; so e)/fqhsan to\n xeimw=na they
anticipated the storm, Hdt.7.188; fqa/sas to\n logismo/n D.21.38:—Pass.,
to be overtaken, u(po/ tinos Arist. Mu.395a18, AP9.278 (Bianor); e)fqa/sqhn (v. supr.). abs.,
come or
act first, opp. u(stere/w or u(steri/zw, E.Ph.975, X.An.6.1.18, cf. Th.4.121; tou= fqa/santos a(rpagh/ the prey of
the first comer, A.Pers.752 (troch.), cf. Fr.23 (lyr.); pri\n e)lqei=n au)tou\s fqa/sai boulo/menoi Th.7.36; mh\ fqa/sh| e)s to\n *(ellh/sponton e)spleu/sas Id.8, 100; fqa/sai pri\n a)dikhqh=nai Arist.Pol.1302b23, cf. Rh.1373a23;
in later writers, ta\ fqa/santa the things
before mentioned, Ael.VH 1.34, Arg.D.46; part. fqa/nwn, fqa/sas
previous, tw=n fqasa/ntwn duei=n bibli/wn Porph.Abst.3.1; e)n toi=s fqa/nousin e)/rgois Dex.Hist.Fr.26 J.; toi=s fqa/nousi katorqw/masi Id.Fr.6 J.; oi( fqa/santes po/noi Agath.5.16; to\ fqa/non
previous time, Ael.VH14.6; to\ fqa/san, ta\ fqa/santa, the
past, Agath.3.2, al., Procop.Gaz.Ep.32; o( fqa/sas xro/nos Men. Prot.p.127 D. with Preps.,
come or
arrive first, e(/ws tw=n ou)ranw=n LXX 2 Ch.28.9; e)/fqasen e)f' u(ma=s Ev.Matt.12.28, Ev.Luc.11.20, cf. 1 Ep.Thess.2.16: f. ei)s . . , simply,
arriveat, attain to, Ep.Rom.9.31, Ep.Phil.3.16, Plu.2.338a; fqa/somen ei)s *phlou/si<on> PPar.18.14 (ii A. D.): abs., of Time,
arrive, kairo\s th=s tomh=s e)/fqake (v.l. e)/fqasen) LXXCa. 2.12; e)/fqasen o( mh\n o( e(/bdomos ib.2 Es.3.1.
extend, me/xri gh=s Plot.3.27; ei)s borra=n PFlor.50.87 (iii A. D.).
reach, ai)qe/ra APl.4.384. Gramm.,
to be applied or
applicable, e)p' a)mfote/ras ta\s diaqe/seis A.D.Synt.211.22, cf. 217.23, al. the action in which one
is beforehand is expressed by the part. agreeing with the subject, [*)/ath] pollo\n u(pekproqe/ei, fqa/nei de/ te pa=san e)p' ai)=an bla/ptous' a)nqrw/pous and
is beforehand in doing men mischief, Il.9.506; a)ll' a)/ra min fqh= *thle/maxos kato/pisqe balw/n Telemachus
was beforehand with him
in striking, i.e. struck
first, Od.22.91, cf. 16.383, Il.10.368; e)/fqase/n me proapelqw\n *xa/rmos PCair.Zen.16.3 (iii B. C.); e)/fqhsan a)piko/menoi arrived
first, Hdt.4.136, cf. 6.115; so f. eu)ergetw=n
to be the first to show a kindness, X.Mem.2.3.14; o(/pws fqa/seian bohqh/santes Id.HG7.2.14; e)/fqasan prokatalabo/ntes Th.3.112; fqa/nousin au)tou\s prokatafugou=sai Id.2.91; h)\n fqa/swsin pro/teron diafqei/rantes to\ stra/teuma Id.7.25; f. go/nasi prospesw\n patro/s E.HF986, etc: part. Pass. is also used, h)= ke polu\ fqai/h po/lis a(lou=sa, i.e. it would be taken
first, Il.13.815; ei)/ ke fqh/h| tupei/s shall be wounded
first, 16.861; fqai/hte ga\r a)\n . . e)candrapodisqe/ntes h(\ . . Hdt.6.108; mh\ fqa/swsi proepibouleuo/menoi Th.3.83; e)/fqh katakwluqei/s X.HG1.6.17; fqa/nein dei= pefragme/nous toi\s po/rous they must
first be blocked up, Id.Cyr.2.4.25: these clauses, being compar. in sense, are folld. by a gen., fqa\n de\ me/g' i(pph/wn . . kosmhqe/ntes were drawn up
before the drivers, Il.11.51; more freq. by pri\n . . or h)\ . . , e)/fqh o)reca/menos, pri\n ou)ta/sai 16.322, cf. Antipho1.29, X. Cyr.3.2.4; fqh/sontai tou/toisi po/des kai\ gou=na kamo/nta h)\ u(mi=n Il.23.444; e)/fqhs pezo\s i)w\n h)\ e)gw\ su\n nhi/+ Od.11.58; e)/fqhsan a)naba/ntes pri\n h)\ . . Hdt.9.70; e)/fqhsan e)kpeso/ntes pro/teron h)\ . . Id.6.91. in later Gr., c. part. to express
previous action or happening, fqa/nw u(mi=n pro/teron gegrafhkw/s I have
already written to you, POxy.1666.3 (iii A. D.), cf. 237 vi30 (ii A. D.), etc.; e)/fqasa ei)rhkw/s Luc.Pisc.29; w(s e)/fqhn ei)pw/n Id.Par.3; cf. 111.2b. in the same sense, part. fqa/s or fqa/sas, Ep. fqa/menos, is used like an Adv. with a principal Verb, o(/s m' e)/bale fqa/menos, for o(/s m' e)/fqh balw/n, Il.5.119, cf. 13.387, Od. 19.449; ou)k a)/llos fqa\s e)meu= kath/goros e)/stai no other shall be an accuser
before me, Hdt.3.71; a)ne/w|ca/s me fqa/sas you opened the door
before me, Ar.Pl.1102; fqa/sas prospesou=mai Th.5.9, cf. 2.91, X.Cyr. 1.5.3, etc.; even with a part., fqa/sas . . a(rpa/sas Hdt.6.65; rarely part. pres., fqa/nontes dh|ou=men X.Cyr.3.3.18. in signf. 111.1b, fqa/santes e)plhrw/samen au)tou/s we had
already paid them, POxy.1103.6 (iv A. D.); but w(sei\ kai\ o(mogenh= fqa/sas ei)=pon as if I
had said (not
had already said) o(., Gal.16.502. rarely c. inf., o( fqa/sas qarsh=sai he that
first gains confidence, Th.3.82; speu/dein o(/pws . . fqai/hs e)/t' ei)s e)kklhsi/an e)lqei=n (v.l. e)lqw/n) hurry
to be in time to get to . . , Ar.Eq.935 (lyr.), cf. Nu.1384 (v. infr. IV. 1); mo/lis fqa/nei qro/noisin e)mpesou=sa mh\ xamai\ pesei=n hardly
manages by falling
first on the seat not to fall on the ground, E.Med.1169; more freq. in later writers, of actions which one
manages to do,
does before or
has done first or
already, A.R.1.1189, D.H.4.59,61, Sor.1.111, Gal.15.2,93, Luc. DMort.13.2, Harm.2; e)a\n fqa/sw pro\ th=s tru/ghs a)nelqei=n PSI8.971.10 (iii/iv A. D.); e)a\n o( i)atro\s au)to\ fqa/sh| kenw=sai Gal.16.499; fqa/nontos h)/dh pure/ttein e)k tetta/rwn h(merw=n tou= nosou=ntos
having already begun, ib.498; mh\ fqa/nwn proshko/ntws tre/fesqai if he
is not
first suitably nourished, Id.18(2).36, cf. 84,103; sumbai/nei fqa/nein a)poqnh/|skein tou\s newte/rous the young die
first, ib.222; ei) fqa/saimen palaiou\s pi/qous e)/xein mega/lous if we
already have . . , Gp.6.3.11, cf. 10.22.2, al., A.D.Pron.90.1; e)/fqaken ou)=n tau=ta e)yhfi/sqai kai\ th=| boulh=| IG12(9).906.26 (Chalcis, iii A. D.). with negatives, with ou) and part. (inf. is v. l. in Ar.Nu. 1384), folld. by kai/ or kai\ eu)qu/s, of two actions following close on each other, ou) fqa/nein xrh\ suskia/zontas ge/nun kai\ . . o(rma=n you must
no sooner get your beard than you march, E.Supp.1219; ou) fqa/nei e)cago/menos kai\ eu)qu\s o(/moio/s e)sti toi=s a)kaqa/rtois
no sooner is he brought out than he becomes unclean, X.Eq.5.10, cf. Ar.Nu.1384; ou)k e)/fqhmen ei)s *troizh=n' e)lqo/ntes kai\ toiau/tais no/sois e)lh/fqhmen e)c w(=n . .
no sooner had we come to Troezen than . . , Isoc.19.22, cf. 5.53, 8.98, 9.53; ou)k e)/fqh moi sumba=sa h( a)tuxi/a kai\ eu)qu\s e)pexei/rhsan diaforh=sai ta)/ndoqen
scarcely or
no sooner had misfortune befallen me when . . , D.57.65, cf. 43.69, Isoc.4.86. ou)k a)\n fqa/nois, ou)k a)\n fqa/noite, with part. pres., express a strong exhortation or urgent command, ou)k a)\n fqa/noite th\n taxi/sthn o)pi/sw a)pallasso/menoi you could not
be too quick in departing, i.e.
make haste and be off, Hdt.7.162; ou) fqa/noit' e)/t' a)/n qnh/|skontes
make haste and die, E.Or.936, cf. 941, Alc. 662, Heracl.721, Tr.456 (troch.), IT245; ou)k a)\n fqa/noiton tou=to pra/ttonte Ar.Pl.485; a)potre/xwn ou)k a)\n fqa/nois ib.1133; ei)s a)gora\n i)w\n taxe/ws ou)k a)\n fqa/nois ib.874, cf. Ec.118; ou)k a)\n fqa/nois le/gwn Pl. Smp.185e, X.Mem.2.3.11; these phrases are not to be treated as questions, cf. ou)k a)\n fqa/noimi (sc. le/gwn) Pl.Smp.214e, cf. Phd.100c, D.25.40, Luc.Fug.26, Symp.2, Anach.14: c. part. aor., once in Luc., Vit.Auct.26. in 1, 2, or 3 pers., to express immediate futurity, ou)k a)\n fqa/nois a)kou/wn you
shall hear
in a moment, Pl.Euthd. 272d; ou)k a)\n fqa/noi to\ plh=qos tou/tois toi=s qhri/ois douleu=on
will soon (or
inevitably) be enslaved to . . , D.24.143; also to express what is logically inevitable, ou)k a)\n fqa/noien au)tou\s proskunou=ntes they
will soon be (or
cannot logically help) worshipping them, Aristeas 137; tou=to me\n ou)k a)\n fqa/nois kai\ *)empedoklei= pro\ au)tou= e)gkalw=n Luc.Fug.2; ou)k a)\n fqa/noi ka)me\ ma/ntin le/gwn Id.Hes.8; ou)k a)\n fqa/noi tis a(pa/sas a)nairw=n ta\s toiau/tas prostasi/as Id.Apol.11: c. part. aor., Id.Tox.2.

fqa/r-ma, atos, to/,
corruption, LXXLe.22.25.
outcast, castaway, J.BJ5.10.5.

fqar-si/a, h(,
destruction, Thalesap. Fulg.Myth.2.11.

fqar-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
destructive, c. gen., fqartika\ a)llh/lwn ta\ e)nanti/a one of another, Arist.Ph.192a21; h( kaki/a f. a)rxh=s Id.EN1140b19; po/lews f. Id.Pol.1281a20: abs., Id.Po.1452b11; opp. poihtiko/s, genhtiko/s, Id.Top.114b17, 124a25; zw=|a ou) f. Porph.Abst.1.11; f. farmakei=ai Plu. 2.134e; fa/rmaka
deadly poisons, Dsc.3.45; e)mbru/wn f., v. l. for fqo/rios, Id.2 166, cf. 1.105; f. du/namis Gal.11.764. Adv. -kw=s Arist.Top.153b32.

fqar-to/s, h/, o/n,
destructible, perishable, opp. a)i/+dios, Id.APo.75b24, 85b18, Metaph.992b17, 1058b26, Ocell.1.4, Plu. 2.106d, S.E.M.9.141, etc.; gloss on qnhto/s, Sch.Theoc.24.171 (Antinoë Pap.).

fqaste/on, (fqa/nw)
one must anticipate, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.7.8.2.
fqa^te/w, aor. subj. fqath/sh|, glossed fqa/sh|, Hsch.; cf. katafqato/omai (or rather -e/omai); also ya^ta=sqai, = prokatalamba/nein, Id.; yath=sai, = proeipei=n, Id.

fqe/ggomai, Od.10.228, etc.: fut. fqe/gcomai Il.21.341: aor. e)fqegca/mhn, Ep. and poet. fqegca/mhn 18.218, Pi.O.6.14: pf. e)/fqegmai, 2sg. e)/fqegcai Pl.Lg.830c, 3sg. e)/fqegktai (trans.) Arist.APo.77a2, (Pass.) Id.Cael.279a23: —
utter a sound or
voice, esp.
speak loud and clear, freq. in Hom., fqegca/menos para\ nho/s Il.11.603, cf. 10.67, al., Pl. R.336b (properly of all animals that have lungs, Arist.HA535a30): of the human voice, a)nqrwphi/+h| fwnh=| f. Hdt.2.57; a)po\ glw/ssas Pi. l.c.; dia\ tou= sto/matos Pl.Sph.238b; [yuxh=s] fqegcame/nhs a)i/+wn Xenoph.7.5; fqegcame/nou teu h)\ au)dh/santos Od.9.497; with a part. expressing the kind of cry, fqe/gcom' e)gw\n i)a/xousa Il. 21.341; toi\ d' e)fqe/ggonto kaleu=ntes Od.10.229, cf. 12.249; so sfodrw=| tw=| pneu/mati f. Archyt.1; f. meta\ boh=s Pl.Lg.791e, etc.; me/giston a(pa/ntwn D.19.206; kalo\n kai\ me/ga ib.216, cf. 337; e)leu/qeron kai\ me/ga Pl.Grg.485e; also of weak, small voice, fqegca/menos o)li/gh| o)pi/ Od.14.492; tutqo\n fqegcame/nh Il.24.170; of the battle-cry, X.An. 1.8.18; of the recitative of the chorus, Id.Oec.8.3; ou)ke/ti po/rrw diqura/mbwn f. Pl.Phdr.238d; ou)d' a)\n fqe/gcasqai dunhqei/h would not be able to
utter a syllable, Isoc.15.192, cf. Pl.R.368c; opp. silence, X.Mem.4.2.6; ei)=ta su\ fqe/ggei . . ;
open your mouth . . ? D.18.283; of children just born, Arist.HA587a27:—Constr.:—c. acc. cogn.,
utter, e)/pos Hdt.5.106; a)ge/lasta Heraclit.92; o)durmou\s kai\ go/ous a)nwfelei=s A.Pr.34; kai/ria S.Ph.862 (lyr.); a)ra/s, lo/gous, blasfhmi/an, E.Ph.475, Med.1307, Ion 1189; r(h=ma moxqhro/n SIG1175.19 (Piraeus, Tab. Defix., iv/iii B. C.); ta)lhqh= Pl.Phlb.49b; u(pe/rogka mataio/thtos f. 2 Ep.Pet.2.18: the pers. addressed added with a Prep., f. ei)s h(ma=s E.Ph.l.c.; pro/s tina Pl.Ion534d; later tisi/, Plu.Crass.27; f. ti peri/ tinos Isoc.10.13; to\ fqeggo/menon, abs., that
which uttered the sound, Hdt.8.65. of animals, as a horse,
neigh, whinny, Id.3.84,85; of an eagle,
scream, X.An.6.1.23; of a raven,
croak, Thphr.Sign.16; of a fawn,
cry, Theoc.13.62; of birds, opp. a)/fwnoi/ ei)si, Arist.HA618a5; e)n tw=| qe/rei a)/|dei [ko/ttufos], tou= xeimw=nos . . f. qorubw=des ib.632b17; of worms, f. oi(=on trigmo/n Thphr. CP5.10.5; of certain fish, Arist.Fr.300, Opp.H.1.135. of inanimate things, of a door,
creak, Ar.Pl.1099; of thunder, X.Cyr. 7.1.3; of trumpets, Id.An.4.2.7, 5.2.14; of the flute, Id.Smp.6.3, Thgn.532; of the lyre, fo/rmigc f. i(ro\n me/los Id.761, cf. Arist. Metaph.1019b15; of an earthen pot, ei)/te u(gie\s ei)/te saqro\n f. whether it
rings sound or cracked, Pl.Tht.179d; f. pala/mh|si
to clap with the hands, Nonn.D.5.106, cf. AP9.505.17 (dub.). = o)noma/zw,
to name, call by name, Pl.R.527a, Phlb.25c, 34a; tw=| ple/gmati tou/tw| to\ o)/noma e)fqegca/meqa lo/gon
gave it the name of lo/gos, Id.Sph.262d; f. ei)/dwlon e)pi\ pa=sin w(s e(\n o)/n ib.240a; f. gigno/mena
speak of things as coming into existence, Id.Tht.157b; kai\ to\n ku/llastin fqe/ggou
use the word k., Ar.Fr.257; also th=| duna/mei tau)to\n f.
have the same
meaning, Pl.Cra.394c. c. acc. pers.,
sing, or
celebrate one
aloud, Pi.O.1.36; also,
tell of, recount, qew=n e)/rga Xenoph.12.1.
fqeggw/dhs, es, corrupt word in Hp.Praec.7, cf. Erot.Fr.7.

fqegk-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
vocal, Max.Tyr.14.2.

fqegk-to/s, h/, o/n,
capable of being sounded, Plu.2.1017f.

fqe/g-ma, atos, to/ (written fqe/ggma in late Inscrr., Epigr.Gr.1002, 1003),
sound of the voice, voice, Pi.P.8.31, A.Pr.588 (lyr.), S.OC1623, Ar.Nu.319 (anap.), etc.; periphr. of a person, w)= fqe/gm' a)naide/s, for w)= fqegca/mene a)naidh=, S.OC863, cf. Aj.14, El.1225.
language, speech, Id.Ant.354 (lyr.).
saying, word, utterance, Id.OC1177, Pl.R.616a, LXXWi.1.11: pl.,
accents, words, Pl.Lg.655a, Polyzel. 12. of other sounds, as of birds,
cries, S.El.18, E.Hel.747; of a bull,
roaring, Id.Hipp.1215; bronta=s f. Pi.P.4.198; quei/as f. the
grinding of the mortar, Ar.Pax235; of
musical notes, Id.Av.683 (lyr.), Pl.Lg.812d; of the nightingale's
song, Ar.Av.204, 223.

fqeg-matiko/s, h/, o/n,
vocal, mantei=on Max. Tyr.41.1.

fqe/gcis, ews, h(,
speech, utterance, Hp.Epid.2.6.4, Aret.CA1.1, Porph.Abst.3.3, EM430.55.

fqei/r, o(, later h(, Phryn.277: gen. fqeiro/s: dat. pl. fqeirsi/:—
louse, Archil.137, Heraclit.56, Hdt.2.37, 4.168, Ar.Pax740, al., IG 42(1).122.45 (Epid., iv B. C.), etc.: prov., pro\s fqei=ra kei/rasqai, i. e. to be close shaven, Eub.32; of the
morbus pedicularis (fqeiri/asis）, th\n sa/rka ei)s fqei=ras metaba/llein Plu.Sull.36; tou= sw/matos dialuqe/ntos ei)s fqeirw=n plh=qos D.S.34/5.2.23; o( geusa/menos . . fqeirsi\n e)ce/zesen Ael.NA9.19. of
lice that infest animals, Arist.HA556b22; birds, ib.557a11; fish, ib.557a22; also vegetables, mh\ o( si=tos fqeiri\ ze/sh| Luc.Ep.Sat.26, cf. Ctes.Fr.57.21, Gal.6.572; ou) poih/sei fqei=ras h( a)/mpelos Gp.5.30.1.
sea-fish attendant on the dolphin,
Naucrates ductor, Arist.HA557a31, Marc.Sid.86, Ael.NA9.7.
the seed of a kind of pine, Phot.
middle part of the rudder, Poll.1.89.

fqeir-a/rios, a, on,
lousy, Gloss.

fqeir-i/a_sis, ews, h(,
morbus pedicularis, Dsc.4.152, 5.105, Archig. ap. Gal.12.463, Plu.Sull.36, Porph. VP55; of fowls, Gp.14.17.3.

fqeir-i/aw,
to be lousy, D.L.5.5: esp.
have the morbus pedicularis, Com. A desp.280, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.463, Plu.Sull.36; toi=s e)k no/sou fqeiriw=si Dsc.1.37; of bees, Gp. 15.2.13; of oxen, ib.17.29; also fqeiriw=sa a)/mpelos Str.7.5.8.

fqeir-i/zomai, Pass.,
pick the lice off oneself, Arist.Fr.76, Thphr.Sign.16, Apollod. ap. Ath.13.586a:—Act. (with fut. -iw=) LXXJe.50(43).12.
fqeir-iasmo/s, o(, = fqeirismo/s, Gloss.
fqei/r-ion, to/, = stafi\s a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc. 4.152.

fqeir-ismo/s, o(,
picking lice, Gloss.

fqeir-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
seeking lice:—h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
the art of louse-hunting, vermin-killing, Pl. Sph. 227b.

fqeiro/-brwtos, on,
lice-eaten, Hsch.Mil.69.

fqeiro-gra/fos [a^], name of a
plaster, Androm. ap. Gal.13.913.

fqeiro-komi/dhs [i^], ou, o(,
lousy fellow, Com.Adesp.1188.

fqeiro-ktone/w,
kill lice, ib.1189.
fqeiro-kto/non, to/, = stafi\s a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.4.152.

fqeiro-poio/s, o/n,
producing lice, li/non Plu.2.352e; e)/rion ib.642c, Gp.15.1.5. (fqei/r 111) pi/tus f.
pine that bears small edible seeds, Pinus brutia, Thphr.HP2.2.6.
destructive, pneu=ma daimo/nion f. PMasp.1884 (vi A. D.).
fqeiro-pu/lh [u^], h(, nickname of the courtesan Phanostrate, e)peidh/per e)pi\ th=s qu/ras e(stw=sa e)fqeiri/zeto Apollod. ap. Ath.13.586a.

fqeiro-tra^ge/w,
eat lice, or perh.
pineseeds (fqei/r 111), Hdt.4.109.
fqeiro-trwkte/w, = foreg., Arr.Peripl.M.Eux. 18.

fqeiro-fa/goi [a^], oi(,
lice-eaters, name of a tribe in the Caucasus, Str.11.2.19 (but perh.
eaters of fir-cones, as they lived near *pituou=s), Porph.Chr.69.
fqeiro-fo/ros, on, (fqei/r 111) = fqeiropoio/s 11, Thphr. CP1.9.2.

fqei/rw, Aeol. fqe/rrw Hdn.Gr.2.303, al.; Arc. fqh/rw IG5(2).6.17 (Tegea, iv B. C.): Ion. impf. fqei/reske （dia-) Hdt.1.36: fut. fqerw= X.HG7.2.11, (dia-) A.Ag.1266, etc.; Ion. fqere/w （dia-) Hdt. 5.51; Ep. fqe/rsw （dia-) Il.13.625: aor. 1 e)/fqeira A.Pers.244 (troch.), X.HG7.2.4; poet. e)/fqersa Lyc.1402; Arc. 3sg. opt. (?) fqe/rai IG5(2).6.8 (Tegea, iv B. C.): pf. e)/fqarka Din.1.64, (di-) E.Med. 226; Arc. part. e)fqorkw/s IG5(2).6.10 (Tegea, iv B. C.): —Med., fut. fqerou=mai (in pass. sense) S.OT272, E.Andr.708, Th.7.48; Ion. fqere/omai （dia-) Hdt.8.108 (v.l. dia-fqare/etai), 9.42 (vv. ll. dia-fqare/ontai, dia-fqoreu=ntai); later fqarou=mai Archig. ap. Orib.8.23.5:— Pass., fut. fqa^rh/somai Hp.VM13, Arist.Metaph.1066b30, Epicur.Ep. 1p.7U., (dia-) E.Hec.802, etc., Dor. -hsou=mai Ti.Locr.94d: aor. e)fqa/rhn [a^] S.OT1502, Th.7.13, Pl.Lg.708c; poet. 3pl. e)/fqaren Pi.P. 3.36: also part. kata-fqerei/s Epich.35.13: pf. e)/fqarmai S.El.765, 3pl. e)fqa/ratai Th.3.13; inf. e)fqa/rqai Arist.Metaph.1021b27, (di-) Is.9.37, Aeol. e)/fqorqai Eust.790.8: plpf. 3pl. e)fqa/rato App.BC3.15, (di-) Hdt.8.90. The compd. diafqei/rw is much more freq. than the simple Verb:—
destroy things, mh=la kakoi\ fqei/rousi nomh=es Od. 17.246; f. tw=n *suri/wn tou\s klh/rous
waste them, Hdt.1.76, cf. X.HG 7.2.11, An.4.7.20; tou\s qew=n no/mous S.Aj.1344; ta\s nau=s v. l. in Th. 2.91; th\n po/lin kai\ no/mous Pl.Lg.958c, cf. X.Mem.1.5.3; eu)daimoni/an Din. l. c.; e)/mbrua Dsc.2.163; to\ sullhfqe/n Sor.1.60 (also abs.,
miscarry, ib.59); to\n koino\n oi)=kon Mitteis Chr.284.11 (ii B. C.): —Pass.,
to be destroyed, S.Aj.25, etc.; e)k tw=n au)tw=n kai\ dia\ tw=n au)tw=n kai\ gi/netai pa=sa a)reth\ kai\ fqei/retai Arist.EN1103b8; ei)s to\ mh\ o)\n f.
pass away, cease to be, Epicur.Ep.1p.5U.; dua\s prosqe/sei mona/dos ei)s tria/da fqei/retai mhke/ti me/nousa dua/s Ph.2.509; of animals,
perish, PStrassb.24.15 (ii A. D.). of persons, mayau=rai . . . nau/tas f.
destroy them, Hes.Th.876 (but perh. only Act. of signf. 11.4); strato/n A. Pers.244 (troch.), Ag.652:—Pass., Id.Pers.272, 283(lyr.); geito/nwn polloi\ a(ma=| . . e)/fqaren Pi.P.3.36; no/sw| e)fqa/ratai *)aqhnai=oi Th.3.13, cf. 7.48; pro/rrizon e)/fqartai ge/nos S.El.765; e)/fqarmai I
am undone! Men. Her.13; mh\fqarw=sin PMich.Zen.80.4 (iii B. C.).
corrupt, bribe, tina D.S.4.73;
lure, entice, trap, khmoi=si plektoi=s porfu/ras fqei/rei ge/nos S.Fr.504 (s. v. l.); fqei/rei ga\r h( pro/noia th\n a)bouli/an
entices to its ruin, entraps, Trag.Adesp.484 (s. v.l.);
pervert, fqei/rousin h)/qh xrh/sq' o(mili/ai kakai/ E.Fr.1024:—Pass., v. infr. 11.3.
seduce a woman, u(po\ th=s qugatro\s a)dikou/menon kai\ *dionusi/ou tou= fqei/rantos au)th\n kinai/dou PEnteux.26.11 (iii B. C.):—Pass., E.Fr.485, D.Chr.11.153 (but not Att. acc. to Phryn.53, Moer.p.103 P.), Artem.5.17.
ruin, spoil, posi\n fqei/ronta plou=ton a)rgurwnh/tous q' u(fa/s, of one who treads on rich carpets, A.Ag.949; bafa\s fqei/rousa tou= poiki/lmatos, of blood, Id.Ch.1013; of a poison, w(=nper a)\n qi/gh|, fqei/rei ta\ pa/nta S.Tr.716; farma/kwn fqei/rein pefuko/twn ta\ sw/mata Gal.15.541; dou/lhn (wet-nurse) mh\ fqei/rousan to\ ga/la BGU1058.29 (i B. C.), cf. Sor.1.88; tou= sw/matos (sc. tw=n nosou/ntwn） fqei/rontos to\ qre/yai duna/menon ib.90, cf. 63, al. ta\ mignu/mena tw=n xrwma/twn oi( bafei=s "fqei/resqai" kai\ "fqora/n" th\n mi=cin o)noma/zousin Plu.2.393c (where miai/nw 1 is compared). Pass. (cf. supr. 1.1, 2), fqei/resqe (as a curse)
may you perish! ruin take you! Il.21.128, Sannyr. 10; fqei/rou as an imprecation,
go to the devil! be off! Ar.Ach.460, Pl.598,610(anap.), E.Fr.610; e)kpodw\n h(mi=n fqei/resqe Herod.6.16:c. gen., fqei/resqe th=sde
off from her! unhand her, let her go, E.Andr. 715 (so in fut. indic., ei) mh\ fqerh=| th=sd' w(s ta/xist' a)po\ ste/ghs if thou
dost not
depart . . . ib.708). with a Prep., fqei/resqai pro\s tou\s plousi/ous, of hangers-on and flatterers, D.21.139, cf. Plu.Phoc.21, Eum. 14, Ant.24; ei)s h(dona\s a)po\ . . po/nwn Anon. ap. Stob.4.31.84; a)kou/w se lurw|dou= gunaiko\s e)ra=n kai\ ei)s e)kei/nhs fqeiro/menon pa=san th\n e)fh/meron a)/gran katati/qesqai Alciphr.1.18. Medic., h( koili/h fqarh/setai
will be deranged, disordered, Hp.VM13.
to be morally corrupted, e)fqa/rh h( gh= e)nanti/on tou= qeou= LXXGe.6.11, cf. Ho.9.9, al.; e)/sti e)n *)alecandrei/a| skhnw=n e)n toi=s *)aristobou/lou fqeiro/menos PCair.Zen.37.7 (iii B. C.); fqarei\s *eu)/tuxos u(po\ th=s *)arsino/hs ib.620.7 (iii B. C.); but e)n *sikuwni/ai e)fqarme/nous is f.l. for e)n *sikuw=ni diefq. (cj. Sintenis) in Plu.Arat.40. of seafarers,
wander, drift (cf. supr. 1.2, polu/fqoros 11.2, fqora/ 8), po/son xro/non po/ntou 'pi\ nw/tois a(/lion e)fqei/rou pla/non; E.Hel.774; vauti/lous e)fqarme/nous sailors
driven out of their course, Id.IT276; i(ke/tas de/xesqai ponti/ous e)fqarme/nous Id.Cyc.300; of shipwrecked persons, new=n （e)k new=n Elmsl.) fqare/ntes A.Pers.451; also of travellers or wanderers by land, ou)x e(/na nomi/zwn fqei/retai po/lews no/mon (v.l. to/pon) E.El.234; o( *mene/laos xro/non polu\n e)fqei/reto pantaxo/se th=s *)ella/dos D.Chr.7.95; ou)de\n dei= fqei/resqai perio/nta ( = periio/nta） th\n a)rxh\n a(/pasan Aristid.Or.26(14).33; a)/nw ka/tw diaqe/ontas th\n *(ella/da kai\ fqeirome/nous Id.1.420 J.; tw=n metoi/kwn tw=n e)c *(ermio/nhs ou)k oi)=d' o(/pws ei)s *peiraia= fqare/ntwn Alciphr. 1.13; mh\ perii/+dh|s a)gaqou\s gei/tonas ei)s steno\n tou= kairou= fqeirome/nous ib.24; [*)ale/candron] u(pe\r to\n *)indo\n ktl. fqeiro/menon Arr.An.7.4.2; fqarh=nai ei)s ba/rbara e)/qnh （e)n barba/rois e)/qnesi or e)/qesi codd.) Phalar. Ep.49; fqare/ntwn e)s a)llh/lous
falling foul of one another, App. Praef.10 (s. v. l.). of women, xe/rsous fqarh=nai
pine away in barrenness, S.OT1502, cf. El.1181 (unless
wander, cf. supr. 11.4). (Cf. Skt.
ksárati 'flow', later 'wane, perish', Avest. gz^ar- and z^gar- 'flow'.)

fqeirw/dhs, es,
infested by lice, lousy, kefalai/, gunai=kes, Arist.HA 557a7,9.
fqei=sai, fqei/sei, fqei=to, fqei=sqai, v. fqi/w.
fqersi/-brotos, on, = fqisi/mbrotos (q. v.), Epigr. in Paus. 3.8.9.

fqersi-genh/s, e/s,
destroying the race, *erinu/es A.Th.1059 (anap.).
fqe/wmen, fqe/wsi, fqh/h|, fqh=|sin, v. fqa/nw.

fqi/a [i_], as, Ep. and Ion. fqi/h, hs, h(, Phthia in Thessaly, the home of Achilles, Il.1.155, al.; fqi/hnde
to Phthia, 1.169, etc.; fqi/hfi
at Phthia, 19.323.—Hence fqi_w/ths, ou, o(,
a man of Phthia, Hdt.7.132, Th.8.3, etc.; *fqiw=t' *)axilleu= A.Fr.132, cf. E.Tr.575 (anap.), IA237 (lyr.): as Adj., *phneie\ *fqiw=ta Call.Del. 112:—fqi_w=tis gh=,
the land of Phthia, E.Andr.664, etc.; a)ktai\ *f. Id.Tr.1125; gunai=kes Id.Andr.1047:—Adj. fqi_wtiko/s, h/, o/n, Str.9.5.8:—also Adj. fqi=os, a, on, whence fqi=oi = fqiw=tai, Il.13.686; with pecul. fem. fqi_a/s, a/dos, h(, E.Hec.451 (lyr.), etc.

fqi/dios, a, on, (fqi/w)
perishable, Hsch. (post fqo/sis).

fqi/na, h(,
mildew, Id. a kind of
olive, Id.

fqi^n-a/s, a/dos, h(, (fqi/nw) intr.,
wasting, waning, mhnw=n f. a(me/ra E.Heracl.779 (lyr.); f. w(/ra Heraclit.All.71; e(/ws dixoto/mou fqina/dos Str.3.5.8. Act.,
wasting, no/soi S.Ant.819 (anap.); thkedo/nes Ph. 2.432; f. no/sos, technically,
consumption, = fqi/sis, Hp.Gland.14 (pl.), Paus.5.26.5; and without no/sos, Hp.Mul.1.2; also; =
empyema, Ruf.Ren.Ves.2.36.

fqi^/n-asma, atos, to/,
declining, sinking, h(li/ou fqinasma/twn A.Pers.232 (troch.).
fqi^n-a/w or fqi^n-e/w, collat. form of fqi/nw, fut. fqinh/sw Gp.1.12.34: aor. e)fqi/nhsa Hp.Epid.7.122, Luc. Par.57, (kat-) Plu.2.117c: pf. e)fqi/nhka Dsc.1 Praef.6, (kat-) Plu. Cic.14.

fqi^no/-karpos, on,
having lost its fruitfulness, of a tree
stripped of its branches, Pi.P.4.265.

fqi^no/-kwlos, on,
with wasting limbs, Man.4.500.
fqi^no-meto/pwron, to/, = meto/pwron, to/, An.Ox.1.108, EM371.50.
fqi^n-opwriko/s, h/, o/n, = sq., sh/samon PLille41.4, al. (iii B. C.).

fqi^n-opwri^no/s, h/, o/n,
autumnal, Hp.Aph.2.25, Plu.2.735b, Gal.6.443; i)shmeri/a h( f. Arist.HA543b9, PHib.1.27.170 (iii B. C., without h(), Plb.4.37.2.

fqi^n-opwri/s, i/dos, pecul. fem. of foreg., a)ne/mwn pnoa/ Pi. P.5.120. h( fqinopwri/s (sc. e)lai/a), = kolumba/s,
an olive, Call. Fr.50.
fqi^n-opwrismo/s, o(, = sq., Anan.5.3 [fqi_-, metri gr.].

fqi^n-o/pwron, to/,
the waning of o)pw/ra (also called meto/pwron or
the season following o)pw/ra),
autumn, Hdt.4.42, 9.117, Hp.Aph.1.18, Th.2.31, Arist.HA601b25, al., PCair.Zen.20.4 (iii B. C.), Sor.1.22, Gal.6.127; metaph. nehni/hs fqino/pwron, ge/rwn xeimw/n Pythagorasap.D.L.8.10: —fqino/pwron (fem.) i)shmerinh/n is dub. l. in Orph.Fr.285.34.

fqi^n-u/qw [u^], poet. for fqi/nw, only pres. and impf.; Ep. impf. fqinu/qeske Il.1.491. trans.,
waste, fqinu/qousin e)/dontes oi)=kon e)mo/n Od.1.250; oi)=non de\ f. 14.95; oi(/ meu f. fi/lon kh=r
cause it
to pine away 10.485 (so perh. Il.1.491); i(/na mhke/t' o)durome/nh . . ai)w=na fqinu/qw
waste my life, Od.18.204; in later Ep., mayi/dion f. po/non Opp.C.4.186. intr.,
waste away, decay, perish, of men, laoi\ me\n f. peri\ pto/lin Il.6.327, cf. 21.466, Od.12.131; pauro/teroi . . fqi/nuqon Il.17.364; tou/sde e)/a fqinu/qein, as an imprecation, 2.346; also a)/xei+ f. pareiai/ Od.8.530, cf. 16.145.

fqi^/n-ulla, h(, (fqi/nw) nickname for a thin or delicate woman,
starveling, Ar.Ec.935, cf. fqi=sa.
fqi^/n-w, v. fqi/w.

fqi^n-w/dhs, es,
consumptive, oi( f. Hp.Aph.4.8, etc.; to\ f.
a consumptive habit, Id.Epid.1.2; f. dia/qesis, no/sos, Androm. ap. Gal.13.18, Gal.17 (1).62; ta\ f. pa/qh Id.6.775, Paus.10.2.4. Adv. -dw=s Gal.17(1).61, al.
fqi^n-wdiko/s, h/, o/n, = foreg., Id.17(1).722, al.
fqi=os, a, on, v. *fqi/a.
fqi=sa, h(, = fqi/nulla, Hsch.

fqi_sh/nwr, oros, o(, h(, (fqi/w, a)nh/r):—
destroying or
killing men, po/lemos Il.2.833, 9.604, al., Hes.Th.431; qumo/s AP9.457. [i_ perh. metri gr., but in Il.2.833 fqeis- is found in some codd. (including polla\ tw=n palaiw=n a)ntigra/fwn ap.Eust.356.20), and Choerob. in An.Ox.2.273, and shd. perh. be read.]
fqi/sqai, v. fqi/w.

fqi^sia/w,
to be consumptive, Hp.Aph.5.12, Arist.Pr.949a27.

fqi^si^k-eu/omai,
to be consumptive, Androm. ap. Gal.13.17.

fqi^si^k-o/s, h/, o/n,
consumptive, Arist.Pr.884a11, Dsc.1.72, Sor.Vit.Hippocr.5, Plu.2.674b, Arr.Epict.3.13.20, etc.: metaph., se . . fqo/nos fqisiko\n pepoi/hke Men.540.7.

fqi_si/mbrotos, on, (fqi/w, broto/s)
destroying or
killing men, ma/xh, ai)gi/s, Il.13.339, Od.22.297; fqi_si^br- in Epigr. ap. Plu.Lys.22 (sed fqersi^br- (q. v.) ap.Paus.3.8.9). [i_ perh. metri gr., unless fqeis- shd. be read.]

fqi/sis [i^], ews, h(, (fqi/w):—
wasting away, perishing, decay, karpou= Pi.Pae.9.14; of the ko/smos, Ocell.1.4; opp. au)/chsis, Hp.VM6, Pl. Phd.71b; opp. au)/ch, Id.R.521e: pl., Id.Phlb.42d. of the moon,
waning, Arist.HA582b2, GA767a4. of persons,
atrophy, emaciation, Hp.Art.1. esp.
consumption, Hdt.7.88, Hp.Epid.1.24, Aph.5.11 (pl.), Arist.HA518b21 (pl.), EN1150b33, IG42(1).122.69 (Epid., iv B. C.), cf. fqo/h.
contraction of the pupil of the eye, Gal.19.435, Aret.SD1.7, Aët.7.55.

fqi_si/frwn, onos, o(, h(,
destroying the mind, Opp.C.2.423 (fqeis-).
fqi=to, v. fqi/w.

fqi^to/s, h/, o/n, (fqi/w) Trag. (never in S.), only pl. fqitoi/ (always without Art.)
the dead, A.Pers.220 (troch.), 523, Eu.97, E.Alc.100 (lyr.), Hipp.1437, HF1026 (lyr.); also in later Prose, Plu.2.955b: with the Art., Luc.DDeor.26.2: sg., AP9.117 (Stat.Flacc.), Sch. Call. in *dihgh/seis vi 4, Id. in PSI9.1094.28, dub. in IG9(1).881.4 (Corc.).
liable to decrease, decline, opp. au)chto/s, Arist.Ph. 201a13.
fqi^to/w, = fqi/nw (fqi/w) 11, Lyc. 1159 (Pass.).

fqi/w, e)/fqion, each once in Hom. (v. infr. 1.2), the common pres. being fqi/nw, Od.5.161, al. (also fqinu/qw, q. v.): impf. e)/fqi^non Hdt.3.29, Pl.Ti.77a: fut. and aor. fq（e）i/sw, e)/fq（e）isa and e)/fqi^sa (v. infr. 11): pf. e)/fqi^ka v. l. in Dsc.Praef.6 (cf. fqina/w), (a)p-) Them.Or.28.341d:—Med. and Pass. (in same sense), fut. fqi/somai (leg. fqei/somai, in view of fqei/sw, v. infr. 11) Il.11.821 (fqeitai PGen. (ii B. C.)), 19.329, 24.86 (v.l.), Od.13.384: aor. 1 fqi/sasqai （a)po-) Q.S. 14.545: 3pl. aor. Pass. e)/fqi^qen, v. a)pofqi/nw: aor. 2 e)fqi/mhn, e)/fqi^so A.Th.971 (lyr.); e)/fqi^to Il.18.100, Thgn.1141 (nisi leg. e)/fqitai), A.Eu.458, S.OT962, E.Alc.414 (lyr.); 3pl. e)fqi/ato Il.1.251; imper. 3sg. fqi/sqw （a)po-) 8.429; Ep. subj. fqi/etai 20.173, fqio/mesqa 14.87; opt. fqi/mhn （a)po-) Od.10.51, fqi=to （fqi=t') 11.330 (the v.l. fqei=t' is incorrect); inf. fqi/sqai Il.9.246, 13.667, Od.14.117, 15.354, (kata-) 2.183 (always with incorrect v. l. fqei=sqai); part. fqi/menos, v. infr. 1.2: rare in pf., e)/fqitai Od.20.340, 3pl. e)c-e/fqintai A.Pers.679 (lyr.). [Hom. has i_ in fqi/h|s (infr.1.2), i^ in e)/fqien (infr.), fqio/mesqa, fqi/etai: i_ always in fut. and aor. fqi/sw, fqi/somai, e)/fqisa (sed v. infr. 11), cf. fqi_sh/nwr, fqi_si/mbrotos (qq. v.): i^ always in aor. and pf. Pass. (v. supr.), exc. in opt. (v. supr.):—Hom. also uses i_ in fqi/nw (prob. fr. *fqi^-nvw, cf. fqi/nuqw) whereas i^ always in fqi^nw in Pi. and Trag., who use i^ even in e)/fqisa, v. infr. 11.] (Cf. yi/nw, yina/s, yi/sis: fqi^- and yi^- correspond to Skt.
k[snull ]i-, pres.
k[snull ]iṇā´ti, k[snull ]iṇóti, 'he destroys', Pass.
K[snull ][imacracute]yante 'they perish',
ák[snull ]itas ( = a)/fqitos) 'imperishable', fut. stem
k[snull ]e[snull ]ya- ( = fqeiso-), aor. stem
k[snull ]e[snull ]- (= fqeis-).)
decay, wane, of Time, pri/n ken nu\c fqi=to (opt. aor.) first would the night
be come to an end, Od.11.330: th=s nu=n fqime/nhs nukto/s S.Aj.141 (anap.); in this sense mostly in pres. fqi/nw, fqi/nousin nu/ktes te kai\ h)/mata they
wane or
pass away, Od.11.183, etc.; mhde/ toi ai)w\n fqine/tw
let not thy life
be wasted, 5.161: esp. of the moon,
wane, [selh/nh] au)canome/nh kai\ fqi/nousa Arist.Cael. 291b20; hence, in monthly reckoning, mhnw=n fqino/ntwn in the moon's
wane, i.e. towards the month's end, 10.470, etc.; later, mh\n fqi/nwn, the last
decad, IG12.298.17, 328.13, Th.5.54, etc.; opp. i(sta/menos （i(/sthmi B. 111.4), mesw=n, but in Hom., the
second half of the month (tou= me\n fqi/nontos mhno/s, tou= d' i(stame/noio), Od.14.162, 19.307. of the stars,
decline, set, A.Ag.7 (prob. interpol.). of persons,
waste away, pine, perish, w(/s ke do/lw| fqi/h|s Od.2.368 (perh. aor. subj. with i_ metri grat.); h)/toi o( th=s a)xe/wn fre/nas e)/fqien
was wasting away in mind, Il.18.446 (perh. trans.,
causing his heart
to pine; prob. impf., but possibly aor.); fqi/nei kai\ marai/netai no/sw| E.Alc.203; e)k fo/nwn S.Tr.558; oi( fqi/nontes
consumptive people, Hp.Aph.3.10, cf. Epid.1.24. of life, strength, etc., ou) fqi/nei a)reta/ Pi.P.1.94; fqi/nei me\n i)sxu\s gh=s f. de\ sw/matos S.OC610, cf. OT665 (lyr.); u(/bris . . a)nqei= te kai\ pa/lin f. Id.Fr.786; h(/bhn th\n me\n e(/rpousan pro/sw, th\n de\ fqi/nousan Id.Tr.548; toi=s me\n au)/cetai bi/os, tw=n de\ fqi/nei E.Fr.415.5, cf. Pl.Phd.71b, Ti.81b, etc.; c. dat. modi, po/lis fqi/nousa me\n ka/lucin . . , fqi/nousa d' a)ge/lais S.OT25; of things,
fade away, disappear, e)desto\n e)c au(tou= f. kai\ yh=| Id.Tr.677; to\ sw=ma fqi/nei Hp.Loc.Hom.24; metaph., fqi/nonta *aai/+ou qe/sfata S.OT906 (lyr.), cf. Ant.1013:—Pass., au)to\s fqi/etai Il.20.173, cf. 14.87; more freq. in fut. and aor., h)/dh fq<e>i/sontai 11.821, cf. 19.329, Od.13.384; thlo/qi pa/trhs e)/fqito Il.18.100; du/o geneai\ mero/pwn a)nqrw/pwn e)fqi/ato 1.251; nou/sw| u(p' a)rgale/h| fqi/sqai 13.667; no/sois o( tlh/mwn e)/fqito S.OT962; pro\s fi/lou e)/fqiso
wast slain by . . , A.Th.971 (lyr.), cf. E.Med.1414 (anap.): freq. in part. fqi/menos,
slain, dead, Od.11.558, al.; xersi\n u(p' *)argei/wn fqi/menos Il.8.359; e)n pole/mw| fqi/menon IG12. 976; fqi/menoi
the dead, fqime/noisi metei/hn Od.24.436; penqh/sei basilh= f. Orac. ap. Hdt.7.220, cf. Euph.21; fqime/nwn zw|w=n te fwtw=n Pi.I. 4(3).10(28), cf. B.5.83; fqime/noisin A.Th.732 (lyr.); fqi/menos S.Tr. 1161, cf. Ant.836 (anap.); mhde/tin' ei)pei=n . . fqime/nwn E.Hec.137 (anap.): less freq. c. Art. (cf. fqito/s）, to\n fqi/menon A.Th.336 (lyr., codd.); tw=n f. Id.Ag.1023 (lyr.); tw=n pro/teron f. Id.Ch.403 (anap.); f. de/mas, sw=ma,
mortal, IG9(1).882.9,12 (Corc.); *fqime/nh
Perishing, personified as a goddess, *fusw/ te *f. te Emp. 123.1: rare in Prose, toi=s fqime/nois X.Cyr.8.7.18. Causal, in fut. fq（e）i/sw, aor. 1 e)/fq（e）isa (usu. written fqi/sw, e)/fqisa in codd., but correctly fqeisan (Od.20.67) in PHib.1.23 (iii B. C.), fqei/sei (Il.6.407) in cod. A and Et.Gen.cod.B (Miller
Mélanges 300)),
cause to decay or
pine away, consume, destroy, fq（e）i/sei se to\ so\n me/nos Il.6.407; to\n *pa/troklos e)/melle fq（e）i/sein 16.461, cf. 22.61; oi(\ mema/asin *)odussh=os fq（e）i=sai go/non Od.4.741; i(/na fq（e）i/swmen e(lo/ntes au)to/n 16.369; to/n r() e)/qelon fq（e）i=sai ib.428; tokh=as . . fq（e）i=san qeoi/ 20.67: rare in Trag. (only lyr., and in the form e)/fqi^sa）, *moi/ras fqi/sas A.Eu.173; to\n . . u(po\ sw=| fqi/son keraunw=| S.OT202; futo\n h(/meron mh/te fqi/nein mh/te si/nesqai Pythag. ap. D.L.8.23; nu=n se moi=ra . . fqi/nei, fqi/nei dub. in S.El.1414 (lyr., fort. soi).
fqi/wsis, f.l. for fqi/sis in Dam.Pr.86.
fqiw/ths, fqi^si^k-w=tis, etc., v. *fqi/a.
fqogg-a/zomai, = fqe/ggomai, *palla/dos ai)gi\s muri/wn fqogga/zetai klaggai=s drako/ntwn Pi.Dith.2.18, cf. Ion Trag.53 (lyr.); *ku/klwy fqogga/zeto mu/rmhc AP9.539.

fqogg-a/rion, to/, Dim. of fqoggh/,
sounding-pipe, Hero Spir.2.35.

fqogg-h/, h(, poet. form of fqo/ggos,
voice of men, Il.2.791, A.Supp.197, etc.; of the Sirens, v.l. for fqo/ggon in Od.12.198; oi)=kos ei) fqoggh\n la/boi safe/stat' a)\n le/ceien A.Ag.37, cf. E.Hipp.418; tw=n a(lo/ntwn kai\ krathsa/ntwn . . fqogga/s A.Ag.325; of the voice of Orpheus, h)=ge pa/nt' a)po\ fqoggh=s ib.1630; ba/llei me . . f. tou S.Ph.206 (lyr.); of birds and animals, w(/st' a)hdo/nos sto/ma fqogga\s i(ei=sa E.Hec.338; f. o)i/+wn te kai\ ai)gw=n Od.9.167; mo/sxwn E.IT293 (pl.).

fqogg-h/eis, essa, en, contr. fqoggh=s,
sounding, Hdn.Gr.2.618, al.; fwnh/entas kai\ fqoggh/entas, of vowels, Nicom. Exc.6.

fqo/gg-os, o( (both Poet. and Prose),
any clear, distinct sound, esp.
voice of men, Il.5.234, etc.; of the Sirens, Od.12.41,159; fqo/ggw| e)perxo/menai 18.199; f. a)rai=on oi)/kois A.Ag.237 (lyr.); go/wn ou)k a)sh/mones f. S.OC1669; f. oi)kei/ou kakou=
voice, telling of . . , Id.Ant.1187; to\n *ai(/monos f. ib.1218, cf. 1214; of birds, a)lektruo/nwn f. Thgn.864; a)gnw=ta . . f. o)rni/qwn S.Ant.1001, cf. 424; fqo/ggos ou)/t' o)rni/qwn ou)/te qala/sshs E.IA9 (anap.); kunw=n kai\ proba/twn kai\ o)rne/wn Pl.R.397a.
speech, *(ella/dos fqo/ggon xe/ousan A.Th.73; f. e)/mmetros, opp. peza/, poetical
speech, Phld.D.3.13;
utterance, saying, Trag.Adesp.417. generally,
sound, a)ne/mwn Simon.37.11; dai/monos pedarsi/ou . . pterwto\s f. Ar.Av.1198 ( = Trag.Adesp.47); fwnh=s me\n ou)/, fqo/ggou de\ mete/xonta/ tinos, of semi-vowels, Pl.Phlb. 18c, cf. Arist.Aud.801b2, 804b9; a)/neu fqo/ggou kai\ h)xh=s Pl.Ti.37b, cf. Epicur.Ep.1p.32U.; ei)s tou\s f. kai\ ta\s sullaba/s Pl.Cra.389d, cf. Plu.Alex.27, Gal.15.6. of musical
sounds, lwto\s fqo/ggon kela/dei E.El.716 (lyr.); lu/ras Pl.Lg.812d, etc., cf. fqo/ggous a)lu/rous qrhnou=men Alex. 162.6 (anap.). pl.,
notes on a musical instrument;
strings of lyre, D.Chr.10.19;
stops of flute, Philostr.VA5.21; cf. Corn.ND14.

fqo/h, h(, Att. = fqi/sis (q. v.), Pl.Lg.916a, Pl.Com.184, Isoc.19.11, D.Ep.3.30, Luc.Cont.17, Tab.Defix.98.5, Gal.6.421, etc.; esp. of
empyema, Aret.SD1.8. (*fqoy-a_ from root of fqi/w, fqi/nw.）

fqo/i+s, i+os, o(: acc. sg. fqo/i+n （fqo/i+g kai\ e)rmhth/n) GDIivp.883 (Erythrae, iv B. C.); nom. et acc. pl. fqo/eis Hp.Mul.1.104, Ath.11.489d (written fqo/i+s in Plu.2.292f); Att. acc. pl. fqoi=s Ar.Pl.677; dat. fqoi=si Eup.373; Dor. and poet. acc. pl. fqo/i+as SIG1025.31,38 (Cos, iv/iii B. C.), Call.Fr.337:—also Att. fqoi/+s, i/+dos, h(, acc. fqoi/+da AP6.258 (Adaeus); nom. pl. fqoi/+des or fqoi=des IG12.301.103,109, 116:—
a kind of
cake, Ar. l.c., GDIl. c., SIG l. c., Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath. 14.647d, Porph.Abst.2.7: Lat. abl. pl.
pthoibus CIL6.32323.140, 145 (Rome, i B. C.); nom.
fthois = uuum (i.e.
libum), Gloss. Medic.,
pastille, used for fumigation, Hp. l.c.
bar of precious metal, xrusi/ou *skapthsulikou= IGl. c., cf. 22.1443.20, al.; but f. xrusi/ou gold-
dust, Hsch. a kind of
cup, prob. the same as fia/lh o)mfalwth/, Eup. l. c., cf. Ath.11.502b; fqo/eis kukloterei=s ib. 489d.
fqoi/+skos, o(, Dim. of foreg. 1.2, Hp.Mul.1.51; used as a pessary, ib.74.

fqoner-i/a, h(,
enviousness, Arist.MM1192b18, Stoic.3.103, PMich.Zen.23.4 (iii B. C.); peri\ fqoneri/as, title of work by Cleanthes, Stoic. 1.107.

fqoner-o/s, a/, o/n,
envious, jealous, of persons, sofi/hs mh\ f. tele/qein
grudging of wisdom, Thgn.770, etc.; o)/yon lo/goi fqoneroi=sin Pi. N.8.21; f. tai=s e(te/rwn eu)tuxi/ais D.H.6.46: Sup., o)rni/qwn -w/tatos AP5.2 (Antip.Thess.). Adv., -rw=s e)/xein pro\s ta\ paidika/ to be
enviously disposed, Pl.Phdr.243c, cf. Isoc.15.302, X.Cyr.1.4.15, etc. of the gods,
jealous of those who abuse their gifts, or who enjoy unbroken felicity, o( f. dai/mwn Corinn.4; to\ qei=on pa=n e)o\n f. Hdt.1.32; e)moi\ ai( sai\ mega/lai eu)tuxi/ai ou)k a)re/skousi, e)pistame/nw| to\ qei=on w(s e)/sti f. Id.3.40, cf. 7.46; fqonerai=s e)k qew=n metatropi/ais by
jealous changes of purpose, Pi.P.10.20; cf. fqo/nos 1.2. of feelings, etc., f. gnw=mai, e)lpi/des, Id.I.1.44, 2.43; a)/lgos A.Ag.450 (lyr.); o)du/na S.Ph.1141 (lyr.); f. o(doi/
full of envy, Id.Fr.353 (lyr.); f. te/xnh Anacreont.16.38.

fqon-e/w, aor. e)fqo/nhsa, later e)fqo/nesa LXX To.4.7, JHS46.45 (Athens, iii/iv A.D.), AP5.303, 7.607 (Pall.), Nonn.D.3.159:—Med.,
fut. in pass. sense fqonh/somai D.47.70:—Pass., fut fqonhqh/somai X.Hier.11.15: aor. e)fqonh/qhn E.El.30, X.Mem.4.2.33, etc.: pf. part. e)fqonhme/nos J.AJ6.11.10, Vett.Val.330.2: (fqo/nos):—
bear ill-will or
malice, grudge, be envious or
jealous, abs., ei)/ per ga\r fqone/w te kai\ ou)k ei)w= diape/rsai, ou)k a)nu/w fqone/ousa Il.4.55,56; krei/ttwn do/ca tw=n fqonou/ntwn too high for
envy, D.3.24; ei) pe/fuke fqonei=n to\ qei=on (cf. fqonero/s 1.2) Arist.Metaph.982b32: c. acc. etinf., ou)/te tina\ fqone/w do/menai I do not
grudge that any should give thee, Od. 18.16; ou) fqonw= s' u(pekfugei=n S.Ant.553; to\ me\n so\n ou) fqonw= kalw=s e)/xein E.Med.312; e)fqo/nhsan [oi( qeoi\] a)/ndra e(/na basileu=sai Hdt.8.109; e)/fh (sc. o( *swkra/ths）fqonei=n tou=s e)pi\ tai=s fi/lwn eu)praci/ais a)niwme/nous X.Mem.3.9.8; o( fqonw=n e)pi\ kakoi=s toi=s tw=n pe/las h(do/menos Pl.Phlb.48b. c. dat. pers., ptwxo\s ptwxw=| fqone/ei kai\ a)oido\s a)oidw=| Hes.Op.26; ou) f. a)gaqoi=s Pi. P.3.71; f. fasi\ mhtruia\s te/knois E.Ion1025; tisi\ f. kai\ dusmenw=s e)/xein Isoc.12.241, cf. 8.13; freq. with part. added, f. tini\ eu)= prh/ssonti
to envy him for his good fortune, Hdt.7.236,237; paidikoi=s f. ou)si/an kekthme/nois Pl.Phdr.240a, cf. Lys.27.11; without a Noun expressed, kalw=s pra/ttousi, ploutou=nti f., Isoc.1.26, Lys.21.15, etc.: c. dat. rei, f. toi=s a)gaqoi=s tinos X.Cyr.2.4.10 (v.l. e)pi\ toi=s a)g., cf. Isoc. 1.26; e)f' oi(=s e(/teroi poih/santes e)timh/qhsan f. D.20.151): c. gen. rei, tou= eu)tuxe/ein fqone/ousi kai\ to\ kre/sson stuge/ousi Hdt.7.236; ou)de/ ti/ se xrh\ a)llotri/wn fqone/ein
to be envious because of other men's goods Od.18.18: c. dat. pers. et gen. rei,
bear a grudge against a person on account of a thing, E.HF1309.
resent, c. gen., th=s dokh/sews tw=n kerdw=n Th.3.43: c. dat. rei,
feel righteous indignation at, tai=s eu)pragi/ais tinw=n Isoc.8.124; also c. dat. pers., Id.4.184, D.28.18. f. tini\ folld. by ei . . , or e)a/n . .
take it ill or
amiss that . . , Hdt.3.146, X.HG2.4.29; mh/ moi fqonh/sht', ei . . Ar.Ach.496: abs., f. e)a/n tis . . Lys.3.9; fqonei=s a)/pais ou)=s', ei) . . E.Ion1302; also f. tini\ o(/ti . . , X.Cyr.3.1.39; f. o(/ti . . Lys. 24.3, dub.l. in 18.16.
refuse from feelings of envy or
ill-will, grudge, c. inf., ou)k a)\n fqone/oimi a)goreu=sai Od.11.381; mh\ fqo/nei kirna/men Pi.I.5(4).24; fra/sai E.Med.63; sauto\n e)pidou=nai Ar.Th.249; mh\ fqonh/sh|s is freq. in dialogue,
do not refuse to do a thing, mh\ f. dida/cai Pl.R.338a, cf. Hp.Mi.372e, Smp. 223a; also mh\ fqo/nei moi a)pokri/nasqai Id.Grg.489a; mh\ fqonh/sh|s alone, Id.Prt.320c; dh=lon o(/ti ou) fqonh/sei *(ippi/as a)pokri/nesqai Id.Hp.Mi.363c; ou)deni\ pw/pote e)fqo/nhsa Id.Ap.33a: c. part., mhde/ moi fqo/nei le/gwn A.Th.480 (nisi leg. lo/gwn): c. acc. et inf., ti/ fqone/eis . . a)oido\n te/rpein; Od.1.346: c. dat. et inf., th=| d' ou)k a)\n fqone/oimi . . a(/yasqai 19.348; ou)/toi fqonw= soi daimo/nwn tima=n ge/nos A.Th. 236.
grudge, refuse to grant a thing, fqonh/sas mh/t' a)p' oi)wnw=n fa/tin, mh/t' ei)/ tina . . mantikh=s e)/xeis o(do/n S.OT310: c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, ou)/ toi h(mio/nwn fqone/w Od.6.68; mhde/ moi fqonh/sh|s eu)gma/twn A.Pr.583 (lyr.), cf. E.Hec.238; mh/ moi fqonh/sh|s tou= maqh/matos Pl.Euthd.297b, cf. X.Cyr.8.4.16; f. toi=s e(alwko/si th=s swthri/as Plb.6.58.5: c. gen. rei only,
to be grudging of a thing, pe/plwn, karpou=, E.HF333, Pl.Mx.238a; mhd' o)li/ghs fqone/sh|s gai/hs JHS l. c. Pass.,
to be envied or
begrudged, Hdt.3.52, S.Fr.188, E.El.30; dia\ sofi/an f. u(po/ tinos X.Mem.4.2.33; e)p' e)sqloi=s E.Fr. 814 (lyr.); fqonhqe/nta u(po\ *moi/rhs JRS18.30 (Phrygia): c. gen.,
to be grudged a thing, f. tou= ga/mou u(po\ daimoni/ou tino/s Plu.2.772b.

fqo/n-hsis, ews, h(,
jealous refusal, S.Tr.1212.

fqon-hte/on,
one must envy, ou)deni/ Ph.1.319, Ap.Ty.Ep.91.

fqon-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
envious, e(/cis Plu.2.682d; fqonhtikh/, h(, Phld.Vit.p.43J. Adv. -kw=s Plu. l. c.

fqono/letros, on, dissim. fr. *fqono/leqros,
enviously destructive, dai/mwn Jahresh. 23 Beibl.402 (Prusa).

fqo/nos, o(,
ill-will or
malice, esp.
envy or
jealousy of the good fortune of others (Pl.Def.416b, Arist.Rh.1387b22), Pi.O.8.55, etc.; fqo/nw|
through envy, Hdt.3.30, 9.71; opp. eu)/noia, Pl.Lg.635b; opp. e)/painos, Lys.24.1; i)/sxei o)/lbos fqo/non incurs
envy, Pi.P.11.29, cf. Isoc.5.68; fqo/non pro\s a)stw=n a)lfa/nousi E.Med.297; fqo/nw| xrh=sqai pro\s ta\ paidika/ Pl.Phdr.253b; kre/sswn oi)ktirmou= fqo/nos better
to be envied than pitied ! Pi.P.1.85, cf. And.2.6; pro\s ga\r to\n e)/xonq' o( f. e(/rpei S.Aj.157 (anap.), cf. OT382; e)s ta)pi/shma d' o( f. phda=n filei= E.Fr.294; f. sunestiw/menos, of wealth, Secund.Sent.9; f. [e)sti\] toi=s zw=si pro\s to\ a)nti/palon Th.2.45; kata\ fqo/non A.Eu.686, Pl.Grg. 457d; su\n fqo/nw| E.Andr.780 (lyr.); dia\ fqo/non Ep.Phil.1.15: c. gen. objecti,
envy for, jealousy of, tw=n pepragme/nwn Lys.2.48; fqo/non de\ swma/twn e(/cei qeo/s i.e.
will grudge, deny, A.Pr.859: c. gen. subj.,
envy or
jealousy felt by another, Pl.Hp.Ma.282a; also f. e)f' e(te/rois Plu.2.39e, etc.; ei)/s tina AP6.257 (Antiphil.); pro/s tina Luc.Rh.Pr.22: pl.,
envyings, jealousies, heartburnings, Isoc. 15.163, Pl.Lg.679c, 801e, etc. a
cause for indignation, a
reproach, a)poktei/nein fqo/nos [e)sti\] gunai=kas E.Hec.288. esp.
jealousy of the gods (cf. fqonero/s 1.2), qew=n f. A.Pers.362, Ag.947; f. mh\ ge/noito/ tis qew=n E.Alc.1135: hence abs., to\n f. de\ pro/skuson S.Ph.776; eu)labou/menos fqo/non D.18.305.
refusal from feelings of ill-will or
envy, grudging, fqo/nos me\n ou)dei\s . . A.Pr.628; ou)dei\s f. or f. ou)dei/s, c. inf., said in granting a request willingly, a(\ tugxa/nw a)khkow/s, f. ou)dei\s le/gein Pl.Phd.61d; ou)dei\s . . f. au)tw=| dielqei=n au)ta/ Id.Sph.217a, cf. b. Lg.641d, 664a.

fqor-a/, Ion. fqorh/, h(, (fqei/rw)
destruction, ruin, Hdt.2.161, 7.18, Hp.Vict.1.5, A.Ag.406 (lyr.), etc.; of persons,
death, esp. by some general visitation, as pestilence, Th.2.47, Pl.Lg.677a (pl.), GDI 5104c11 (Crete, pl.); a)ndroqnh=tas *)ili/ou fqora/s A.Ag.814. of animals,
loss by death, PStrassb.24.26,31 (ii A. D.). Philos.,
passing out of existence, ceasing to be, genome/nw| panti\ f. e)sti Pl.R. 546a; peri\ gene/sews kai\ fqora=s Id.Phd.95e, title of work by Arist., cf. Pl.Phlb.55a, Arist.Ph.229b13, Gal.6.6; h( f. metabolh/ ti/s e)sti tw=n fqeirome/nwn ei)s tou)nanti/on e(ka/stw| Plu.2.948f: pl., Pl.Phd.96b, R.490e, al.: with dat. (instrumental), h( megi/sthfqora\ u(/dasin Id.Ti.23c, cf. 22d.
deterioration, ei)s karpogoni/an in respect of . . Thphr.CP 5.8.2.
loss by deterioration, e)kfori/ou . . a)nupolo/gou pa/o hs fqora=s PTeb.105.3,18 (ii B. C.);
damage, e)ktei=sai th\n gegonui=an u(p' au)tw=n tou= xo/rtou . . f. BGU1824.29 (i B. C.); misspelt fqara/ ib.1866.3 (i B. C.).
seduction, e)leuqe/rwn Lexap. Aeschin.1.12; parqe/nwn, gunaikw=n, Plu.2.712c (pl.), Vett.Val.2.37 (pl.), cf. Parth.35.3, D.H.2.25;
rape, Str.6.1.6.
abortion or
miscarriage, IG22.1365.22, 1366.7, Sor.1.56, Gal.17(1).800; tou= e)mbru/ou Sor.1.59.
gradation of colours in painting, Plu.2.346a; ta\s mi/ceis tw=n xrwma/twn oi( zwgra/foi fqora\s o)noma/zousi ib.725c, cf. 393c. = fqo/h, Hp.Aph.7.80.
storm-tossings or
shipwrecks, ti/ toi le/goim' a)\n ta\s e)n *ai)gai/w| fqora/s; E.Hel.766; cf. fqei/rw 11.4.

fqor-ei=on, to,
drug for producing abortion, SIG985.20 (Philadelphia, i B. C.): pl., IG12 (1).789.12 (Lindos, ii A. D.); cf. fqo/rios 1.

fqor-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
corrupter, seducer, Ph.2.53, al., Plu.2.18c, Arr.Epict.2.22.28, Vett.Val.119.12, Jul.Caes.336a, AP5.256 (Pall.), etc.: metaph., f. a)gaqw=n Ph.1.412.— Hellenistic acc. to Moer.p.390P.

fqorhgenh/s, e/s,
breeding corruption, PMag.Par.1.2865 (fort. leg. fqorhgo/ne metri gr.).

fqor-i/a, h(,
corruption, mischief, Hp.Jusj.

fqor-iko/s, h/, o/n,
destructive, c. gen., Horap.2.79 (fqoro/oikon ed. Pauw, fqoriko\n cod.Vat. ap.Bast.Ep.Crit.p.83).

fqo/r-i^mos, h, on,
destructive, Man.2.346.
perishable, to\ f. tw=n swma/twn Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44.

fqo/r-ios, on,
destructive: esp. of means
to produce abortion, pesso/s Hp.Jusj.; f. e)mbou/wn Dsc.5.67, cf. Sor.1.60: fqo/ria, ta/, = fqorei=a, Dsc.2.164, Plu. 2.134f. fqo/rion e(/dnon sum given to a bride as compensation for loss of virginity, PSI9.1075.6 (v A. D.).
fqoro-ergo/s, o/n, = fqoropoio/s, Dam.Isid.204.

fqoro-poie/w,
commit injury, Dsc.Ther.Praef., Suid. s.v. loimeu/etai.

fqoro-poio/s, o/n,
causing destruction, Boëth.Stoic.3.265, Petos. ap. Vett. Val.80.7, Dsc.
Alex. Praef., Placit.5.30.1, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr.2.196; du/namis Ph.2.96; pa/qos Simp. in Cael.436.26: c. gen., Ph.2.327, al.; tw=n zw/|wn Gp.2.27.5; metabolh\ f. tou= metaballome/nou Dam.Pr.414.
abortifacient, Ps.-Dsc.1.1.

fqo/r-os (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.191), o(, = fqora/, Thgn.833, Th.2.52, Pl.Euthd.285b, Arist.Pr.879b26; polu\s e)ge/neto f. tw=n polemi/wn Plb.3.51.3: mostly in phrases, i)/t' e)s fqo/ron = fqei/resqe (v. fqei/rw 11.1), A.Ag.1267; ou)k e)s fqo/ron . . ; Id.Th.252; a)/pag' e)s to\n fqo/ron [Epich.] ap.Ath.2.63d. like o)/leqros,
pestilent fellow, Ar.Eq.1151, D.13.24; of a woman, Ar.Th.535; fqo/ros a)rguri/w Theoc.15.18.

fqor-w/dhs, es,
corrupt, pestilent, to\ f. tou= a)e/ros Hdn.1.12.2; au)xmoi/ Lyd.Ost.36.

fqow/dhs, es （fqo/h),
consumptive, no/sos Paus.10.2.6.
fqu/zw, only in compd. e)pifqu/zw (q.v.). fin, sfin, v. sfei=s.

fqo/r-fi^, fqo/r-fi^n, case-suffix with locative, ablative and instrumental sense, freq. in Ep.; also Aeol. acc. to Sch.D, Gen.Il.3.338, Sch. Opp.Hal.1.709; Boeot. acc. to Hsch. s.v. passalo/fin (who cites *)/idhfin = *)/idhs); found in Lyr., su\n o)/xesfi Ibyc.2.6; *mw=sa . . , w)rani/afi Alcm.59 (voc. acc. to A.D.Adv.165.8); passalo/fin in a Com. parody, Hermipp.55 (anap.).

fi^a/lh [a^], h(,
bowl or
pan used as a saucepan for boiling liquids, a)mfi/qetos f. a)pu/rwtos Il.23.270; also used as a
cinerary urn, [o)ste/a] e)n xruseh| f. kai\ di/plaki dhmw=| qei/omen ib.243, cf. 253. after Hom.,
broad, fiat bowl or
saucer for drinking or pouring libations, fia/las te kai\ a)/lla e)kpw/mata Hdt.9.80, cf. 2.151, 7.54; dwroforou=sin . . fia/las Ar.V.677 (anap.); oi)nodo/kon f. xrusw=| pefrikui=an Pi.I.6 (5).40; a)rgurwqe/ntes su\n oi)nhrai=s f. Id.N.10.43; of gold, Hdt.2.151, 7.54, Pi.I.1.20, Pl.Criti.120a (pl.), PCair.Zen.21.16 (iii B. C., s. v. l.), Apoc.5.8, etc.; e)/labe su/mbolon para\ basile/ws tou= mega/lou f. xrush=n Lys.19.25; of silver, Pi.N.9.51, IG12.313.15, al., Lys.12.11, PCair.Zen.327.5, al. (iii B. C.); a)rgurhla/tous xruse/as te f. E.Ion 1182; f. lukiourgei=s D.49.31; as a votive offering, Hdt.1.50, PTeb.6.27 (ii B. C.), etc.; pi/nein e)k f. mega/lhs e)pi\ decia/ Pl.Smp.223c, cf. X.Smp. 2.23; f. karuwth/, v. karuwto/s 11. used for unguents, a)/llos d' eu)w=des mu/ron e)n f. paratei/nei Xenoph.1.3; for administering medicines, IG42(1).122.125 (Epid., iv B. C.). to\ e)k fia/lhs revenue, perh. from a
collecting-bowl, IG11(2).161A116 (Delos, iii B. C.), cf. Inscr.Delos 442A156 (ii B. C.). from its broad flat shape, fia/lh *)/arews metaph. for a)spi/s,
shield, cited from Tim. (Fr.22) by Antiph.112, cf. Anaxandr.80, Arist.Rh.1412b35.
ornament used in a coffered ceiling, Agatharch.102.—The form fie/lh was less Att., Moer.p.389 P.

fi^a^lhfo/ros, h(,
cup-bearer, title of a Locrian priestess, Plb.12.5.9; name of play by Anaxandr.

fi^a^l-i/dion, to/, Dim. of fia/lh, Hero Spir.1.12:—also fi^a^/l-ion, to/, Eub.69, Arist.Mir.832b26, IG7.303.58 (Orop.), 11(2).161B27, al. (Delos, iii B. C.), etc.; fi^a^l-i/s, i/dos, h(, Luc.Lex.7; fi^a^l-i/skh, h(, Dor. fi^a^l-i/ska, Schwyzer182a8 (Gortyn, v/iv B. C.), Sch.Ar.Ra.1403; fi^a^l-i/skos, o(, prob. in BSA18.184 (Maced.).

fi^a^l-i/ths a)riqmo/s [i_t], an arithmetical puzzle
concerning a number of bowls, Procl. in Euc. p.40F., Sch.Pl.Chrm.165e, Hero
*Deff.135.5 (all pl.).

fi^a/llw, fut. fi^a^lw=,
undertake, take in hand, set about a thing, found twice in codd. of Ar., ou)de\ fialei=s V.1348; o(/pws e)/rgw| fialou=men Pax432: acc. to Eust.1403.16 it is shortd. for e)fia/llw; hence Bentley restored ou)d' e)fialei=s and e)/rgw| 'fialou=men.

fi^a^lo-bwmo/s, o(,
bowl-shaped altar or
libation-table, Zos.Alch.
p.108 B.

fi^a^lo-eidh/s, e/s,
bowl-shaped, Hero Spir.2.24, Hsch. s. vv. pata/nia, pe/daxna; bwmo/s Zos.Alch.p.108B.

fi^a^lo-mantei/a, h(,
divination by gazing into
a saucer, prob. in PMag.Par.1.3243 (-ei=on, to/, prob. ib. 3209).

fi^a^l-o/w,
excavate into the form of a fia/lh, bo/qroi Gp.9.5.7.
fi^a^l-w/dhs, es, = fialoeidh/s, poth/rion Ath.11.488f, Sch.Ar.Ach.1227.

fi^a^l-wto/s, h/, o/n,
saucer-shaped, qumiath/rion IG11(2).161 B36,37 (Delos, iii B. C.); qri/dakes fialwtai/ lettuces
with a broad flat head, Gp.12.13.8.

fi^a^r-o/s, h/, o/n, a word used by Alex. Poets,
gleaming, shining, of the dawn, Call.Fr.257; ai)/glh|sin fiarh=|si Max.594; generally,
bright, of a young girl, fiarwte/ra o)/mfakos w)ma=s Theoc. 11.21; fiaro\n de/mas Max.443;
sleek, of a bird, Nic.Al. 387; of cream, fiarh\ grh=u+s ib.91.

fi^a^r-u/nw,
make bright and clean, Hsch.

fi^ba/lews [a^], w, h(, a kind of
early fig, found in Com. in pl., nom. fiba/lew| （fibale/oi codd.Ath.) Telecl.5: gen., tw=n fiba/lewn sukwn Pherecr.80; fiba/lewn alone, Hermipp.51: acc., fiba/lews i)sxa/das Ar.Ach.802; fiba/lews alone, Apolloph.5.—Sch.Ar. l.c. has ge/nos sukh=s h( fi/balis (taking fiba/lews as gen. sg.) and explains as the name for a district in Megaris or Attica; EM793.26 has fiba/lews: ge/nos sukh=s: le/gousi de\ ou(/tw kai\ ta\s mirri/nas.
a lean, dried-up person, Telecl. l. c., Sch.Ar. l. c., Suid.
fibi/, o(, name of the Ibis, = Hermes Thoth, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.167.

fi/bl-a, h(, = Lat.
fibula, Supp.Epigr.2.776 (Dura), Sch.Call.Ap. 32, Sch.Gen.Il.18.401:—also fibl-i/on Gloss.
fibl-o/omai, Pass., = porpo/omai, Phot., Suid.
fi^da/kn-h, fi^dakn-i/s, v. piqa/knh.

fi^d-i/ths [i_t], ou, Dor. fi^/d-as, a, o(,
member of a fidi/tion, Sphaer.Stoic.1.142, Ath.4.140e (feid- codd.Ath. in both places).

fi^d-i/ti^on [i_t], to/,
common mess at Sparta, later name for the earlier a\ndrei=on (v. a)ndrei=os 111), Arist.Pol.1271a27, 1272a2, b34, Rh.1411a25, Antiph.44.3, Dicaearch.Hist.23, Phylarch.44 J., D.H.2.23, Cic. Tusc.5.34.98, *(ellhnika/ 1.18, 19 (Gytheum, i A. D.), Plu.Lyc.12 (hence Porph.Abst.4.4), Agis 8, Cleom.13, Phoc.20, Paus.7.1.8, IG5(1).128.13, al. (ii A. D.), Philostr.VA4.27, Them.Or.19.227b, Hsch. s. vv. diafoigoimo/r, fidi/tia, Phot. s.v. sussiti/ai, Suid. s.v. *lukou=rgos, fili/tia, Eust.1413.23.
dining-hall in which the meals took place, X.HG5.4.28, Lac.3.5, 5.6, Phld.Mus.pp.18,86 K., D.Chr.2.44, Plu.Lyc.26, Ages.20, Id.2.697e, Ath.4.139c. [Quantity given by ei)s ta\ fidi/tia （feid- codd.Ath.) at end of iambic line in Antiph. l. c., where fi^di^- is possible but involves an unlikely fi^di^ths.] (Written fidei/tia in *(ellhnika/ l. c., feidei/tion (or -a) in IG5(1)Il.cc. (exc. feidi/tion in 1507); but dat. filitei/ois and fileitei/ois in Phld. Il. cc. (Pap.); this contradiction in the early evidence is unexplained; the form fid- or feid- is corroborated by Plu.Lyc.12, where it is suggested that the word comes from fili/a with substitution of d for l, or from feidw/, or from *e)di/tia ('eatings', cf. e)dwdh/) with prefixed f. Codd. have fidi/tia (or on) in Arist.Pol. (v.l. fili/tia), Plu. (exc. fitidi/ois v. l. in Cleom. l. c., filiti/wn all codd. in Phoc. l.c., fili/tia all codd. in 2.714b, file/stion in 2.697e), Hsch.; feidi/tia in Paus., Ath. (who cites Antiph., Dicaearch.Hist., Phylarch.), Eust.; fili/tia in X. (v.l. fidi/tia in HG l. c.), Arist.Rh. (fidi/tia Sch.), D.H., D.Chr., Philostr., Them., Suid.;
philitiis in Cic.）
fie/lh, v. fia/lh.
fikidi/zw, = paideraste/w, Suid.: fikiw=, sine expl., Id.
fikoph/dalos, o(, dub. sens. in PMon.4.11 (vi A. D.), PLond.5.1714.33 (vi A. D.).
fikotu/xh, h(, = fukotu/xh, Paul.Aeg.3.59, v. l. in Aët.15.35.

fi^l-a/boulos, on,
wilfully unaduised, AP12.80 (Mel.), APl.4.133 (Antip.).

fi^/l-abros, on,
loving delicacy or
refinement, Hld.7.12.

fi^la^ga^q-e/w,
love good men or
goodness, IG22.1006.89 (ii B. C.), Michel509.7 (Nacrasa, iii B. C.), BCH5.326 (Maeonia), PTeb.124.17 (ii B. C.), Supp.Epigr.7.62.18 (Seleucia in Pieria, ii B. C.).

fi^la^/ga^q-os, on,
loving goodness, Arist.MM1212b18, LXX Wi. 7.22, Scymn.104, Ph.2.136, Plu.Comp.Thes.Rom.1, Wilcken Chr.20 ii 11 (ii A. D.); as honorary epithet in inscrr. of religious associations, etc., IG22.1326.8, etc.; so in Adv. -qws ib.12(5).860.6 (Tenos), SIG762.13 (Odessus, i B. C.), prob. in Supp.Epigr.2.485 (Panticapaeum, iii A. D.).

fi^la/gla^os, on,
louing splendour, resplendent, Pi.P.12.1, B.17.60; *)/erws AP12.77 (Asclep. or Posidipp.).

fi^la/gr-aulos, on,
fond of the country, *pa/n AP6.73 (Maced.), cf. Nonn.D.8.15.

fi^lagr-e/tis, idos, h(,
fond of the chase, huntress, *)/artemis AP9.396 (Paul.Sil.).

fi^lagr-euth/s, ou=, o(,
lover of the chase, Babr.107.10.

fi^lagr-e/w,
love the country, Epicurei ap.D.L.10.120.

fila/grion or fi^lagr-i/anon, to/, a kind of
bandage, invented by Philagrius, Alex.Trall.1.12; also to\ *filagri/anon (sc. ma/lagma) Paul.Aeg. 7.18.

fi/lagr-os [i^], on,
fond of the country, Luc.Lex.3. (a)/gra)
fond of the chase, *di/ktunna f. Mnemos.4(1936).11 (Athens).
filagr-o/tis, idos, h(, = filagre/tis, Orph.H.36.6.

fi^la/grupnos, on,
wakeful, lu/xnos AP5 196 (Mel); pannuxi/des APl.4.309; po/qos AP5.165 (Mel.).

fi^l-a/gwn [a^], wnos, o(, h(,
loving contests, kisso/s AP7.708 (Diosc.).

fi^l-a^gwnisth/s, ou=, o(,
fond of contests, Ptol.Tetr. 63.
fi^l-a^gwnistiko/s, h/, o/n, = foreg. Sch.Pi.I.4.47.
fi^la^de/lf-eia (sc. i(era/), ta/, name of a festival in honour of Ptolemy Philadelphus, Inscr.Delos 314 B169 (iii B. C.), IG22.2197.15; also in sg., Sardis 7(1).79 C8 (iii A. D.).

fi^la^delf-e/w,
show brotherly affection, Not.Scav. 1919.66 (Jewish).

fi^la^delf-i/a, h(,
brotherly love, Alex. 334, Ph.2.558, J.AJ2.6.9, Babr.47.15; in
NT, love of the brethren, Ep.Rom.12.10, al.

fi^la^de/lf-ion, to, name of a
plaster, Gal.12.756.

fi^la^/delf-os, on,
loving one's brother or
sister, brotherly, sisterly, f. da/krua S.Ant. 527 (anap.); of persons, X.Mem.2.3.17, Plu.Sol.27: Sup., Id.Luc. 43; freq. as a title of kings, as of Ptolemy Il and Arsinoe, Wilcken Chr.106, etc.; of Ptolemy XIII, OGI185, etc., and of Attalus Il; ib.329.38 (Aegina, ii B. C.), etc.; th=s *f. *ku/pridos, of Arsinoe, Posidipp. ap. Ath.7.318d; of Antoninus and Verus, IG22.3405, al.; to\ f. th=s yuxh=s D.S.17.34. Adv. -fws Sch.S.l.c. in
NT, loving the brethren, 1 Ep.Pet.3.8. fila/delfon, to/,
mock orange, Philadelphus coronarius, Apollod. ap. Ath.15.682c. fila/delfoi, oi(, name of fabulous
stones, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.11.4.

fi^l-adu/na^mos [u^], on,
soon weakening, u(/dwr Hp.Acut.62 (Sup.).
fi^l-a/eqlos [a^], on, poet. for fi/laqlos, AP12.143, IG7.2244 (Thisbe).

fi^l-a^qh/naios, on,
fond of the Athenians, Ar.Ach.142, V. 283 (lyr.), Pl.Ti.21e: Sup., D.19.308.

fi^l-aqlhth/s, ou=, o(,
fond of athietes, Plu.2.140c,631a, D.C.Fr.110.4.

fi^/l-aqlos, on,
fond of games (i e. as a competitor), Ph.1.268, Ptol.Tetr.166; qeo/s Plu. 2.724b: metaph.,
fond of exertion, dia/noia, nou=s, Ph.1.543,523; also gumna/sia f. IG3.1344.
