fi=lai, Ep. 2sg. imper. aor. 1 Med. of file/w, Il.5.117, 10.280.

fi^l-ai/aktos, on,
lamentable, po/noi A.Supp.803 (lyr.).

fi^l-aidh/mwn, on, gen. onos,
loving modesty, AP7.450 (Diosc.).
fi^l-aidh/s, e/s, = foreg., Vett.Val.14.25.

fi^l-ai/ma^tos, on,
fond of blood, blood-thirsty, *fo/bos A.Th.45; a)lkai/ E.Rh.932; gh=s filai/matoi (v.l. -tou） r(oai/ Id.Ph.174; *)/arhs Anacr.100.
fi^/l-aimos, on, = foreg., Procl. Par.Ptol.230.
fi^l-ai/mwn, on, gen. onos, = foreg., Hsch.
fi^lai/teros, filai/tatos, irreg. Comp. and Sup. of fi/los (q. v. sub fin.).

fi^lai/tios, on,
fond of bringing accusations, fault-finding, censorious, A.Supp.485, PAmh.2.65.22 (ii A. D.); distd. from filepitimhth/s by Isoc.1.31; ponhro\n o( sukofa/nths . . kai\ filai/tion D.18.242; opp. eu)gnw/mwn, X.Mem.2.8.6; tw=| f. th=s u)melei/as pe/ri qew=n
fond of bringing charges of neglect in their case, Pl.Lg.903a; to\ f.
censoriousness, Plu.Sol.25, cf. 2.813a. Adv. -i/ws Str.2.1.41, Poll.3.139.
liable to censure, D.10.70.

fi^la^kanqi/s, i/dos, h),
fond of thorn bushes, xalki/des prob. in AP6.304 (Phan.).

fi^l-ako/lastos, on,
fond of sensuai indulgence, Plu. Tim.14; to\ f. Id.Galb. 19.

fi^l-a^ko/louqos, on,
readily following, Ar.Ra.417, Aristomen. 15.

fi^l-a/kra_tos, Ion. fi^/l-htos, on,
fond of sheer wine, given to wine, of Anacreon, Simon.183.5; *dio/nusos AP6.169; also f. e(/rpullos ib.4.1.53 (Mel.); a(rmoni/h ib.7.26 (Antip. Sid.).

fi^l-akri_be/w,
to be very precise, Phld Po.Herc.994 Fr.19 (dub.), Hsch.

fi^l-a^leiptew,
to be fond of anointing oneself, of athletes, Hdn. Gr. 1.433, al., EM61.13.

fi^l-a^lecandreu/s, e/ws, o(,
well-disposed towards Alexandria, IGRom.1.1075 (Alexandria).

fi^l-a^le/candros, on,
admirer of Alexander, fond of A., Str.13.1.27, Plu.Pomp.2; as epith. of Apollo, D.S.17.46, etc.: Sup. filalecandro/tatos D.C.77.9.

fi^la^lh/q-eia, h(,
sincerity, ingenuousness, tro/pou Them.Or.15.198b.
fi^la^lh/q-eios, on, v. sq.

fi^lallhl-i/a, h(,
mutual love, Tz.ad Hes.Op.42: metaph. of numbers,
affinity, Nicom.Ar.2.19, Iamb.in Nic.p.30P.

fi/l-almos [i^], on,
fond of leaping, Eustr. in EN82.33.

fil-a/lu_pos, on,
liking to be free from pain or
grief, Orph.H.50.7.

fil-a^lusth/s, ou=, o(,
easily bewildered, Hp.Praec.13.

fil-a^marth/mwn, on, gen. onos,
loving sin, LXX Pr.17.19.

fil-ampele/w,
love the uine, Tz.H.6.73.

fil-a/mpelos, on,
loving the uine, qew=n filampelwta/th Ar.Pax308 (troch.), cf. Nonn.D.12.41.
rich in vineyards, D.H.1.37.

fil-anagnwste/w,
to be fond of reading, D.S.1.3,77.

fil-anagnw/sths, ou, o(,
fond of reading, Plu.Alex.8.

fil-a^na_lwth/s, ou=, o(,
fond of spending, prodigal, c. gen. rei, f. a)llotri/wn di) e)piqumi/an Pl.R.548b; e)s tou\s stratiw/tas D.C.77.9.

fil-andri/a, h(,
love for a husband, Ph.2.36, Luc.Halc.2, IG5(1).1249 (Cyparissia), 14.1976, Lib.Or.29.14: pl.,
examples of wifely affection, App.BC4.36.
wifely jealousy, E. Andr.229. in later Gr. in bad sense,
love of the male sex, Hermog. Id.2.5.
fil-a/ndrios, on, late form for sq. 11.3, JRS18.30 (Phrygia).

fi/l-andros, on,
loving men; of a country,
loving its men, pe/don A.Th.902 (lyr.).
loving masculine habits, of Atalanta, S.Fr.1111; *)amazo/nes Plu.Thes.26. of women,
lewd, Pl. Smp.191e.
loving one's husband, Ep.Tit.2.4, Ph.2.431, Plu. Alc.8, Iamb.post Polem.p.48 Hinck, Luc.Halc.8; freq. in epitaphs, Epigr.Gr.387.12 (Apamea), IG14.1976; yuxh=| filandrota/th| IG14.
607f (Caralis). Adv. -rws, e)/zhse ib.12(3).280 (Anaphe).
fil-a/nqemos, on, = sq., E.Fr.896, Nonn.D.17.83.

fil-anqh/s, e/s,
fond of flowers, melissa AP5.31 (Marc. Arg.); ste/fanoi ib.71 (Pall.).

fil-anqra^keu/s, e/ws, o(,
friend of colliers, Ar.Ach.336 (lyr.).

fi^lanqrwp-eu/omai,
act humanely or
courteously, pro/s tinas D.19.139: c. acc. rei,
to show kindness by granting a thing, Hld.9.27, D.C.50.20; ti peri/ tina Aristid.Or.21 (22).10; ta\ qaumasta/ Id.2.234J. Astrol., = sq. 1.2, Procl.Par.Ptol.200. c. acc. pers.,
treat humanely, J.AJ 13.2.3; f. tina/ ti
do one a
kindness, Hld.9.2:—Pass., filanqrwpeuqe/ntes D.S.18.18, cf. Phld.Herc.1457.9.
conciliate, to\n dh=mon dw/deka a)poiki/ais App.BC1.23.

fi^lanqrwp-e/w, = foreg.,
show kindness, ta\ pro\s h(ma=s PCair.Zen.428.14 (iii B. C.); ta\ loipa\ f. th=| po/lei SIG456.8 (Ziaelas, iii B. C.); tai=s e(autou= duna/mesin pefilanqrw/phke OGI90.12 (Rosetta, ii B. C.). abs. in Astrol.,
to be favourable, filanqrwpou=ntos to/pou Ptol.Tetr.141. trans.,
treat kindly, deal kindly with, tina Plb.3.76.2, al.; to\n to/pon LXX 2 Ma.13.23, cf. POxy.532.20 (ii A. D.):—Pass., proairou/menos . . to\n dh=mon filanqrwpei=sqai Rev.Phil.10(1936).253 (Ilium); filanqrwphqei/s Plb.38.20.11 (ap.Suid.); i(/n' w)= pefilanqrwphme/nos that I may
obtain redress, PTeb.31.21 (ii B. C.).

fi^lanqrwp-i/a, h(,
humanity, benevolence, kind-heartedness, humane feeling, or, in a weaker sense,
kindliness, courtesy, of men, Hp.Praec. 6, Pl.Euthphr.3d, X.Cyr.1.4.1, Act.Ap.28.2, etc.; opp. semno/ths, Isoc. 15.133; opp. fqo/nos, D.20.165; opp. w)mo/ths, ib.109; joined with eu)/noia, Isoc.5.114, D.18.5; with prao/ths, Isoc.5.116; with xrhsto/ths, Iamb. ap. Stob.4.5.76; f. lo/gwn
courtesy, D.18.298; th=s para\ toutwni\ timh=s kai\ f. ib.209; f. dia\ tw=n lo/gwn Plb.28.17.11; f. prosa/gein tini/ Id.1.81.8; f. ei)s or pro\s tou\s ai)xmalw/tous, ib.79.8, 11; u(po\ filanqrwpi/as Pl.l. c.; meta\ f. Isoc.15 l. c.;
clemency, X.Cyr.7.5.73; so filanqrwpi/a| Id.Ages.1.22;
the intercourse of lovers, Aeschin.1.171: pl.,
acts of kindness, courtesies, D.8.70, 25.86, Plb.36.17.13, Phld.Rh.2.160 S., etc. h( sh\ f. as a form of address, your
Clemency, PRyl.296 (ii A. D.), etc. of God,
love to man, Ep. Tit.3.4, al. of things, h( tou= o)no/matos (i. e. no/mos） f. its
mildness, D.24.156; h( f. th=s te/xnhs, of agriculture, X.Oec.15.4, cf. Aeschin.2.15; xw/ra pa/shs f. e)sterhme/nh, of a desert country, D.S. 17.50; in disease,
mild symptoms, Gal.19.219.
concession, privilege, UPZ162 vii 21 (ii B. C.), OGI139.20 (Egypt, ii B. C.), Rev.Phil.10 (1936).253 (Ilium); qei/a f. imperial
grant, SIG888.102 (Scaptopara, iii A. D.).
fi^lanqrw/p-inos, h, on, = sq., IG7.2711.110 (Acraeph., i A. D.). Adv. -nws dub. l. in Plb.33.18.3.

fi^lanqrw/p-ion, to/,
present, 'douceur', Gloss., cf. Ulp. in Dig.50.14.2.

fi^la/nqrwp-os, on,
loving mankind, humane, benevolent, tender-hearted, and, in weaker sense,
kind, courteous, Epich.[274]; f. kai\ filaqh/naios kai\ filo/sofos Isoc.Ep. 5.2; f. kai\ filo/polis Id.2.15; dhmotiko\s kai\ f. X.Mem.1.2.60; yuxh\n filanqrwpo/tatos Id.Cyr.1.2.1; f. de\ pau/esqai tro/pou, of Prometheus, A.Pr.11, cf. 28; of animals that attach themselves to men, as of dogs,
gentle, X.Cyn.6.25; of horses, Id.Eq.2.3; to\ fila/nqrwpon, = filanqrwpi/a, Plu.Cat.Ma.3, etc.; to\ f. kai\ metadotiko/n Phld.Oec.p.54J.; ta\ fila/nqrwpa
humane treatment, tw=n f. tuxei=n PCair.Zen.638.13 (iii B. C.);
kindnesses, Plb.10.38.3, 12.5.3, etc. of the gods,
loving men, Pl.Smp.189c (Sup.), Lg.713d, Plu.Num.4. of things,
humane, humanizing, xa/ris dikai/a kai\ f. E.Fr.953.41; gewrgi/a X.Oec.19.17; yhfi/smata Id.Vect.3.6; lo/goi D.45.4; tro/pos, in Music, Plu.2.1135c, etc.; of wines,
generous, Id.Cleom.13 (Comp.), cf. 2.680b.
appealing to human feeling, of situations, Arist.Po.1452b38, al. (less prob.,
satisfying the sense of poetic justice). Medic., of diet,
generous, trofh\ -ote/ra, opp. o)li/gh, Gal.1.211; but of a medical treatise,
popular, Id.15.551 (Comp.). fila/nqrwpa, ta/,
concessions, grants, privileges, immunities, OGI221.14 (Ilium, iii B. C.), PCair.Zen.37.11 (iii B. C.), SIG548.3 (Delph., iii B. C.), Plb.4.26.8, UPZ162v 22, al. (ii B. C.), OGI331.42 (Pergam., ii B. C.), Epist.Jul.Caes. ap. J.AJ14.10.2, D.S.32.4, etc.; Thess. fila/nqroupa IG9(2).517.16 (Larissa, iii B. C.). sg.,
benefaction, endowment, gratuity, BGU1202.10 (i B. C.), Mon.Anc.Gr.9.10, etc. sg.,
letter expressing friendly feelings, PSI4.439.32, PCair.Zen.56.10 (both iii B. C.). Adv., -ws tini\ kexrh=sqai D.19.225; f. diakei=sqai pro/s tina Plb.1.68.13; f. kai\ dhmotikw=s D.24.24; qeofilw=s kai\ f. Isoc.9.43, cf. 15.132, Phld. Herc.1251.14, etc.: Sup. -o/tata D.24.191, D.C.69.2. fi^la/nqrwp-on, to/, = a)pari/nh, Dsc.3.90, Plin.HN24.176; filanqrw/peios bota/nh in Archig. ap. Gal.12.574.

fi^la/nwr [a_], oros, o(, h(, Dor. for filh/nwr,
fond of a man, amorous, conjugal, sti/boi, tro/poi, A.Ag.411 (lyr.), 856; po/qos Id.Pers.136 (lyr.):—filh/nwr only in late Ep., Musae.267, Coluth.213.
kindly, cei/nwn f. tima/ B.1.40;
fond of men, of dolphins, biota/ Pi.Fr. 236.
fi/lac, Elean for dru=s, Hsch.

fi^l-a/oidos [a^], on,
fond of singing or
singers, Theoc.28.23; te/ttic AP9.372;
musical, kerki/s ib.6.47 (Antip. Sid.): Sup. -o/tatos Epic. ap.D.Chr.32.84.

fi^l-a^pellh=s, o(,
admirer of Apelles, Hdn.Gr.1.82; Dor. fi^l-apella=s cj. Lobeck for filopella=s (v.l. filopela=s), ib.57.

fi^la/peptos, on,
subject to bad digestion, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.8.3.

fi^la^pexq-hmosu/nh, h(,
fondness for making enemies, quarrelsomeness, D.54.37; peri\ tou\s lo/gous Aristid.2.297 J.: pl.,
quarrelsome attempts, Isoc.15.317.

fi^la^pexq-h/mwn, on, gen. onos,
fond of making enemies, quarrelsome, Lys.24.24, Isoc.8.65, D.24.6: Sup., Jul.Mis. 342d. Adv. -nws, e)/xein to be
quarrelsome, Pl.R.500b; pro/s tina Ph. 2.381. -h/s, e/s, = foreg., Plb.12.25.6; loidori/a Id.5.28.4. Adv. -qw=s, kathgorei=n Id.32.10.3.

fi^laploi+ko/s, h/, o/n,
fond of simplicity, Luc.Pisc.20.

fi^la^po/dhmos, on,
fond of travelling, X.HG4.3.2, Dicaearch.1.30, Ael.NA7.24; of Hippocrates, Sor.Vit.Hippocr.12.

fi^largei=os, on,
loving the Argives, Them.Or.27.335c.

fi^largiko/s, h(, o/n, (a)rgo/s)
contemplative, dub. in Fulg.Myth.2.1.

fi^largu^r-e/w,
love money, Epicur.Sent.Vat.43, LXX 2 Ma.10.20, IG9(2).338.12 (Epist. Flaminini), Phld.Herc.1457.12, Alciphr.1.40, S.E.M.11.122.

fi^largu^r-i/a, h(,
love of money, avarice, Hp.Ep.16, Democr. 222, Isoc.8.96, Din.1.22, Diph.94, Plb.9.25.4, al., 1 Ep.Ti.6.10, etc.

fi^la/rgu^r-os, on,
fond of money, avaricious, S.Ant.1055, Fr.587, Pl.R.347b, PPetr.3p.150 (iii B. C.), Phld.Ind.Sto.19, Ev.Luc.16.14, etc.; Sup. -w/tatos X.Mem.3.1.10, 3.13.4.

fi^l-a/retos [a^], on,
lover of virtue, Arist.EN1099a11; qeo/s Ph.1.19; generally,
virtuous, Alex.Trall.8.2.

fi^l-a^ristei/dhs, ou, o(,
admirer of Aristides, APl.4.315 (Thom.Schol.).

fi^l-a^ristote/lhs, ou, o(,
admirer of Aristotle, Phld.Ind.Sto.6.1, Str.13.1.54.

fi^l-a/rma^tos, on,
fond of chariots or
the chariot-race, po/lis Pi.I.8(7).22; *qh=bai E.HF467; as name of a horse, Mélanges Beyrouth 15.111 (Berytus).

fi^l-a/rpac, agos, o(, h(,
fond of rapine, ravenous, AB 1199.

fi^l-arsa/khs [a^k], ou, o(,
devoted, loyal to the Arsacid house, Str.16.1.28.

fi^l-a/rtemis, o(, h(,
lover of Artemis, Ephes.2.29 (ii A. D.).

fi^l-a/rxaios, on,
fond of what is old, fond of antiquity, Phld. Rh.1.157 S., Plu.2.1107e, Ath.3.126b: Rhet.,
old-fashioned, a(rmoni/a D.H.Dem.36, al.

fi^larx-e/w,
to be fond of rule, Plb.6.9.6, D.S.15.5, Plu.Cat.Mi.44, etc.

fi^larx-ia/w,
to be lustful of power, Cels. ap. OrigenesCels. 7.18.

fi^larx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for an ambitious man, Pherecr.14 (troch.(?), Posit. and Comp., filorx- Meineke).

fi^/larx-os, on,
fond of rule or
power, ambitious, Pl.Phd.82c, R.549a, Plb.6.48.8 (Sup.), Phld.Ir. p.37 W., etc.: to\ f. = filarxi/a, Plu.2.793e.

fi^la/rx-wn, ontos, o(,
loving the rulers, Aristox. ap. Stob.4.1.49.

fi^l-askhth/s, ou=, o(,
lover of training or
exercise, Vett.Val.46.28.

fi^l-astra/ga^los [a^g], h, on,
fond of playing at knucklebones, AP6.276 codd. (Antip.).

fi^l-astro/logos, on,
loving astrology, Ptol. Tetr.66.

fi^l-a/swtos, on,
fond of a profligate life, profligate, wanton, AP5.174 (Mel.), 190 (Id.).
fi_la_ti/a, a(, = Dor. for filhsi/a, Foed.Delph.Pell.1 B8, 2A13 (iii B. C.).
fi/la^to [i_], Ep. 3sg. aor. Med. of file/w, Il.20.304, Call.Aet.Oxy. 2080.55:—as Pass., A.R.3.66.
fi^l-auqo/maimos, on, = fila/delfos, Lyc.566.

fi^/l-aulos, on,
fond of the flute, *mou=sai S.Ant.965 (lyr.); delfi/s E.El.435 (lyr.); oi( f. Arist.EN1175b3.

fi^l-au/sthros, on,
devoted to austerity, bi/os Ph.1.39.

fi^laut-e/w,
to be fond of self, Ph.2.558.

fi^laut-i/a, h(,
self-love, self-regard, Cic.Att.13.13.1, Plu.2.48f; in bad sense,
selfishness, UPZ42.10 (ii B. C.), Ph.1.173, al., Porph.Abst.3.2, Jul.Caes.316d, Mis. 349b.

fi^/laut-os, on, (au(tou=)
loving oneself, in good sense, to\n a)gaqo\n dei= f. ei)=nai Arist.EN1169a12: more freq. in bad sense,
selfish, Id.MM1212a29, Phld.Ir.p.60 W., Ph.1.171, al., 2 Ep.Ti.3.2, Plu.Arat.1, al., Arr.Epict.1.19.11; f. ma=llon h)\ dei= Arist.Rh.1389b35; to\ f. = filauti/a, Id.EN1168b14, Plu.2.40f, etc. Adv. -tws Luc.Am.27, S.E.M.7.314.
fi^laut-o/ths, htos, h(, = filauti/a, Vett.Val.345.9.

fi/l-auxos [i^], on,
boastful, Sch.Il.10.249.

fil-a^xaio/s, o(, h(,
friend of the Achaeans, Hdn.Gr.1.228.

fil-a^xilleu/s, e/ws, o(,
friend of Achilles, Eust.1696.63.

fil-ayeudh/s, e/s,
truthful, dub. l. in Ph.1.644 (Sup.).

fil-e/bdomos, on,
fond of the number seven, ib.27; pa/nta f. everything
'goes by sevens', Theol.Ar.42.

fil-e/ggu^os, on,
readily giving security or
bail, E.Fr.923, Str.5.1.9.

fil-egklh/mwn, on, gen.onos,
fond of fault-finding, Ph.1.310, Poll.3.139, Gal.13.485, Sch.Il.1.354, Sch.Ar.Pl.874, etc. Adv. -mo/nws Poll.l.c.

fil-egkw/mios, on,
loving praises, Sch.Ar.Pl.773.

fil-e/qeiros, on,
attached to the hair, sindw/n AP6.307 (Phan.).

fil-eidh/mwn, on, gen. onos,
fond of learning, Str.1.1.23, al., prob. in Cic.Att.12.6.2; to\ f. Str.1.2.29.

fil-eka_ga^qi/a, h( (sic), = filokagaqi/a (nisi hoc legend.),
love of honourable conduct, Rev. Arch.20(1912).461 (Coptos, ii A. D.).
fil-ekdhmhth/s, ou=, o(, = sq., Vett.Val.45.32.
fil-e/kdhmos, on, = filapo/dhmos, to\ f. Str.1.2.29, 2.3.5.

fil-eleh/mwn, on, gen. onos,
compassionate, LXX To.14.9; also contr. fi^lelh/mwn IG22.4514.20.

fil-eleuqe/rios, on,
loving liberality, Lib.Decl.43
Prooem.; v.l. for sq. in D.H.11.15.

fil-eleu/qeros, on,
loving freedom, liberal, Plb.4.30.5; po/lis Plu.Tim.2, etc.; to\ f. Plb.2.55.9, D.S.2.1, D.H.11.15 (cf. foreg.), etc.

fil-e/llhn, hnos, o(, h(,
fond of the Hellenes, mostly of foreign princes, as Amasis, Hdt.2.178, cf. Plu.Ant.23; of Parthian kings,
BMus.Cat.Coins, Parthia p.14, etc.; f. *)arsa/khs PAvrom.1A2 (i B. C.); also of Nero, SIG814.41 (Acraephiae, i A. D.); also of Hellenic tyrants, as Jason of Pherae, Isoc. 5.122: generally of Hellenic patriots, Pl.R.470e; of Hippocrates, Sor.Vit.Hippocr.8; kalo\n *(/ellhna o)/nta file/llhna ei)=nai X.Ages.7.4; ma=llon f. ib.2.31, Isoc.4.96; ma/lista f., of the subjects of Evagoras, Id.9.50; coupled with filobasileu/s, Com.Adesp. in Gött.Nachr.1922.31.

fi/l-elpis, idos, o(, h(,
readily hoping, always hoping, Phryn.PS p.121 B.

fil-e/mporos, on,
fond of traffic and travel, Hld.6.7, Nonn. D.9.88; name of a comedy ascribed to Naevius, Fulg.Serm.Ant. 21.

fi^len-deikte/w,
to be fond of showing off, Eust.702.20.

fi^le/n-docos,
on,
fond of the great, snobbish, Cic.Att.13.19.3.
fi^le/n-dotos, on, expld. as = e)leh/mwn, Hsch.

fi^le/n-qeos, on,
filled with divine influence, deira/s Limen.22; of a person,
religious, IG3.1384; of Pan,
lover of inspired frenzy, Orph.H.11.5.

fi^le/n-tolos, on,
loving the commandments, CIG9904 (Jewish), Sammelb.1540 (v A. D.).

fi^le/codos, on,
fond of going out or
gadding about, Axiop.4.4 codd. Stob.
fi^leort-asth/s, ou=, o(, = sq., Poll.1.20.

fi^le/ort-os, on,
fond of feasts, ei)rh/nh Ar.Th.1147 (lyr.); *su/roi Hdn.2.7.9.

fi^lepainos, on,
loving praise, Phld.Herc.1457.11.

fi^lepi/-sth/mwn, on, gen. onos,
fond of knowledge or
science, Ph.2.374. Adv. -nws ib.300.

fi^lepi/-strofos, on,
tending to recur, pa/qos Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus.58.90.

fi^lepi-ti_mhth/s, ou=, o(,
censorious person, Isoc.1.31, Ath.9.385a.

fi^lepi/-ti_mos, on,
fault-finding, censorious, to\ timai/ou f. Plb.12.4A.6.

fi^lerast-e/w,
to be amorous, Poll.3.68.

fi^lerast-h/s, ou=, o(,
fond of a lover, or
fond of having lovers, Pl.Smp.192b, Arist.Rh.1371b24.

fi^lerast-i/a, h(,
devotion to a lover, Pl.Smp.213d, Aristaenet.1.18.

fi^le/rast-os, on,
amorous, Plb.23.5.7, AP5.143 (Mel.), etc.
dear to lovers, r(o/don AP5.135 (Mel.); pakti/s IG14.793.5 (Naples).

fi^lera/st-ria, h(,
amorous, AP5.3 (Phld.), 10.18 (Marc.Arg.).

fi^lerg-e/w,
love work, be industrious, D.H.5.66, Plu.2.13a; of the spider, Ael.NA1.21.

fi^lerg-i/a, h(,
industry, X.Oec.20.26, D.36.5, Arist. Rh. 1361a8, OGI669.33 (Egypt, i A. D.).

fi^lerg-o/s, o/n,
industrious, D.36.44, Plu.2.552a, etc.: to\ f., = filergi/a, Ael.VH13.1. Adv. -gw=s ib. 12.45.

fi^l-erhmi/a, h(,
love of solitude, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.161.

fi^l-e/rhmos, on,
fond of solitude, Hp.Ep.12, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.7.10, Ph.1.490,506, Corn.ND30, Orph.H.56.2, Vett.Val.43.14, AP5.8 (Rufin.), 9.373.

fi^l-e/ri_qos, on,
fond of wool-spinning, ko/rh *pallantia/s AP6.247 (Phil.): metaph., f. a)laka/ta Theoc.28.1.

fi^/l-eris, idos, o(, h(,
fond of strife, disputatious, quarrelsome, Arist.SE171b26, Axionic.6.9, Phld. Piet.95, Muson.Fr. 16p.86H.

fi^lerist-e/w,
love strife, EM793.32, Phot., Suid.
fi^lerist-h/s, ou=, o(, = fi/leris, Alex.335.

fi^lerist-i/a, h(,
disputatiousness, Simp. in Ph.88.30.

fi^lerist-iko/s, h/, o/n,
pugnacious, combative, fu/sis Sch.Ar.Pax 788.

fi^le/rist-tos, on,
pertinax, Gloss.
filerne/w, cj. for liferne/w in Hsch.
fi/leros, perh. f.l. for file/r<ist>os, Vett.Val.18.9.

fi/l-erws [i^], wtos, o(, h(,
prone to love, amorous, AP5.170 (Mel.), 196(Id.), Luc.Am.12, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.170.

fil-e/speros, on,
fond of evening, a)/nqos AP7.31 (Diosc.).

fil-estia/twr [a_], oros, o(,
lover of feasting, Ph.2.70.

fi^letai/r-eios, a, on,
of Philetaerus. *filetai/reion, to/, with or without a)rgu/rion,
treasure dedicated by P., Inscr. Délos320 B84 (iii B. C.), IG11(2).224A4 (Delos, iii B. C.). fi^letai/r-eia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival in his honour, Inscr. Délos366 A57 (iii B. C.), 442 B54 (ii B. C.):

fi^letai/r-eios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of a month at Pergamon, prob. in
Yale Classical Studies 2.205:

fi^letai/r-eios pou/s a foot containing 16 da/ktuloi, Hero
*Geom.4.3, al.

fi^letair-i/a, h(,
attachment to one's comrades, X.Ages. 2.21, Alex.334, Arist.Rh.1364b2. = filetai/rion, Plin.HN25.64.

fi^letair-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of comradely affection, Sch. Il.4.412.

fi^letai/r-ion, to/, or fi^letai/r-ios, o(, = polemw/nion, Dsc.4.8 (also fi^letairi/s, i/dos, h(, Plin.HN25.99; but = r(a/mnos, a spinous buckthorn, Nic.Th.632, where file/tairin codd.). = w)kimoeide/s, Dsc.4.28. = klhmati/s, Ps.-Dsc.4.7.

fi^le/tair-os, on,
fond of one's comrades or
partisans, true to them, Pl.Ly.211e, Arist. Rh.1389a37, Thphr.Char.29.4; a)ndrei/a, tro/pos, h)=qos, Th.3.82, X. Cyr.8.3.49, Cratin.Jun.12; to\ f., = filetairi/a, Timocl.8.4, Plu.Lys. 5. Adv. -rws, in bad sense, Aeschin.1.110.

fi/l-etnos [i^], on,
fond of pulse-soup, Com.Adesp.1190 (fort. -etnh/s).

fil-eu/di^os, on,
loving clear weather, *)amfitri/ta Hymn.Is. 145.

fil-eu/hxos, on,
fond of loud cries, *dio/pan Epigr.Gr.827.5 (Caesarea Panias).

fil-eu/ios, on,
loving the cry of eu)oi=, epith. of Dionysus, AP 9.524, Nonn.D.12.114.

fil-eu/leixos, on, (lei/xw)
fond of dainties, AP6.305 (Leon., Brunck for fileu/xeilos; fileu/loixos Lobeck, fileu/xumos Hecker).

fi/l-eunos, on,
fond of the marriage-bed, Anacreont. 1.7.
fil-eupoii/a, h(, v. filopoii/a.

fi^leuri_pi/dhs [i^d], ou, o(,
fond of Euripides, Plu.2.755b; name of a comedy by Axionicus, Ath.4.175b; by Philippides, Poll.9.38.
fi^leu/-taktos, on, devoted to discipline, e)fhbosu/na AP6.282 (Theod.).

fi^leu-tra/pelos [a^], on,
loving wit, Arist.VV1251a20, v. l. Rh.1389b11.

fi^leu-fro/su^nos, on,
fond of good cheer, Vett.Val.104.14, Heph.Astr.1.1.
fi^leu/-xeilos, on, v. fileu/leixos.

fi^leu-w/dhs, es,
loving sweet smells, Tz.H.5.399.

fi^le/fhbos, on,
fond of youths, AP12.161 (Asclep.).

fi^lexq-h/s, e/s,
quarrelsome, Theoc.5.137.

fi^lexq-re/w,
exercise enmity, LXX Pr.3.30, Procl.Par.Ptol.171.

fi^/lexq-ros, on,
disharmonic, mi=cis Gal. 19.486.
prone to enmity, Ptol.Tetr.119. Adv., -rws e)/xein pro/s tina to be
hostile towards any one, D.L.3.36; f. diakei/menoi Ptol.Tetr.191.

fi^le/yios, on, (e(yia/omai)
fond of play, sportive, Nonn.D.10.378.

fi^le/w, Aeol. fi/lhmmi Sapph.79, cf. Ead. Oxy.1787 Fr.1 + 2.24; 2sg. fi/lhsqa Ead.22; late 3pl. fi/leisi Epigr.Gr.990.12 (Balbill.): Boeot. fi/leimi Hdn.Gr.2.930: Ep. inf. filh/menai Il.22.265: Ion. and Ep. impf. file/eske 3.388, al.: fut. filh/sw, Ep. inf. filhse/men Od.4.171: aor. 1 e)fi/lhsa Pi.P.2.16, etc.: pf. pefi/lhka ib. 1.13:—Med., Poet. 1 aor. e)fi_la/mhn; 3sg. e)fi/lato, fi/lato, Il.5.61, 20.304, Call.Aet.Oxy. 2080.55; 3pl. fi/lanto Lyc.274; imper. fi=lai Il.5.117, 10.280; subj. fi/lwntai h.Cer.117, Hes.Th.97; but fi/lato as Pass., A.R.3.66; also part. fila/menos IG14.1549 (Rome):—Pass., fut. Med. filh/somai in pass. sense, Od.1.123, 15.281, Antipho 1.19: fut. 3 pefilh/somai Call. Del.270: aor. e)filh/qhn E.Hec.1000, Pl.Phdr.253c: Ep. 3pl. e)fi/lhqen Il.2.668: pf. pefi/lhmai Pi.N.4.45, X.An.1.9.28; Dor. part. pefila_me/nos Theoc. 3.3. [i^ exceptin the forms e)fi/lato, fi_lato, etc.]: (fi/los):—
love, regard with affection, opp. misei=n, Pl.R.334c, Arist.Rh.1380b34; filh/sw to\n dh=mon to\n *)aqhnai/wn IG12.15.36; (on its relation to
sexual love v. infr. 3); of the love of gods for men, f. de/ e( mhti/eta *zeu/s Il. 2.197; pe/ri ga/r m' e)fi/lei (of the love of the master for his swineherd) Od.14.146; (also o(\n peri\ kh=ri f. *zeu\s . . pantoi/hn filo/thta Od.15.245, cf. Il.9.117); ma/la tou/s ge f. e(ka/ergos *)apo/llwn Il.16.94; ei) . . *(/ektora/ per file/eis kai\ kh/deai au)tou= 7.204, etc.; of love for a child reared, Od. 15.370; ai) de\ mh\ fi/lei, taxe/ws filh/sei kwu)ki\ qe/loisa Sapph.1.23; lo/gois filou=san ou) ste/rgw fi/lhn S.Ant.543; file/wn file/onta Pi.P.10.66; o(\n d' e)xrh=n filei=n stugei=s A.Ch.907; ma/lista/ s' . . h)/xqhra ka)fi/lhs' e)n h(me/ra| mia=| S.El.1363; o(\n oi( qeoi\ filou=sin a)poqnh/|skei ne/os Men.125; o(/sa qeoi\ a)nqrw/pois ou(\s filou=sin [dido/asin] SIG 985.48 (Philadelphia, i B. C.); oi( filou=nte/s tina his
friends, freq. in messages and letters, OGI184.10 (Philae, i B. C.), Ep.Tit.3.15, PSI8.971.30 (iii/iv A. D.), etc.; filei=n e)mauth/n, au(to/n, E.Hel.999, Med.86, etc.:—Pass.,
to be beloved by one, e)k *dio/s Il.2.668; par' au)th=| 13.627, etc.; tini E.Hec.1000.
treat affectionately or
kindly, esp.
welcome, entertain a guest, Od.4.29, 5.135, Il.3.207, etc.; fi/los d' h)=n a)nqrw/poisin, pa/ntas ga\r file/esken o(dw=| e)/pi oi)ki/a nai/wn Il.6.15; cei=non e)ni\ mega/roisi f. Od.8.42; cei=non a)/gwn e)n dw/masi . . file/ein kai\ tie/men 15.543, cf. 14.322; qeo\s (i. e. Calypso) h(/ me . . e)fi/lei te kai\ e)/trefen 7.256; ti/s a)\n file/onti ma/xoito; who would quarrel with
a kind host? 8.208; etc.:—Pass., par' a)/mmi filh/seai
welcome shalt thou be in our house, Od.1.123, cf. 15.281. opp. e)ra=n, tou/tous ma/lista/ fasi filei=n w(=n a)\n e)rw=si
regard with affection those for whom they have a passion, Pl.Phdr.231c; w(/ste ou) mo/non filoi=o a)/n, a)lla\ kai\ e)rw|=o u(p' a)nqrw/pwn X.Hier.11.11, cf. Smp.8.21; ei)k<*> to\ filei=n tou\s e)rwme/nous Arist.APr.70a6; but f. is used of lovers, h(/ g' *eu)ruma/xw| misge/sketo kai\ file/esken Od.18.325; *lusi/qeos *miki/wna fili=n fhsi ma/lissta tw=n e)n th=| po/lei IG12.924; ou)k e)/st' e)rasth\s o(/stis ou)k a)ei\ filei= E.Tr.1051, cf. Hdt.4.176 (Pass.), Ar.Lys.905; of the
love of man for wife, o(/s tis a)nh\r a)gaqo\s . . th\n au)tou= file/ei (
cherishes her) kai\ kh/detai w(s kai\ e)gw\ th\n e)k qumou= fi/leon Il.9.343, cf. 486; th\n au)to\s file/esken
loved and cherished as his wife, ib.450; but e)me\ . . a)tima/zei, file/ei d' a)i/+dhlon *)/arha (Hephaestus speaks of Aphrodite) Od.8.309: Com., w)= *dh=m', e)rasth/s ei)mi so\s filw= te/ se kai\ kh/domai/ sou Ar.Eq.1341. of sexual intercourse, Hsch. s.v. bai/nein.
show outward signs of love, esp.
kiss (not in Hom.), f. toi=si sto/masi
kiss on the mouth, opp. ta\s pareia\s file/ontai, Hdt. 1.134, cf. X.Cyr.1.4.27, Smp.9.5; kata\ to\ sto/ma AP5.284 (Agath.); filh/sw . . to\ so\n ka/ra S.OC1131; pate/ra . . peri\ xei=re balou=sa filh/sei A.Ag.1559 (anap.), cf. Ar.Av.671,674, Pl.Phdr.255e, Ev.Marc.14.44, etc.: c. dupl. acc., to\ fi/lama, to\ . . to\n *)/adwnin . . a)poqna/skonta fi/lasen the kiss wherewith
she kissed him, Mosch.3.69:—Med., ta\s pareia/s
kiss each other's cheeks, Hdt.l.c. of things as objects of love,
like, approve, sxe/tlia e)/rga Od.14.83; a)oida/n Pi.N.3.7; ou)/q' i(stw=n e)fi/lhsen o(dou\s ou)/te dei/pnwn . . te/ryias P.9.18, etc.; ai)sxroke/rdeian S.Ant.1056, cf. 312; ta\s leukota/tas [ma/zas] Telecl. 1.6 (anap.); *pra/mnion oi)=non Ephipp.28. of things as the subject, h(suxi/a de\ filei= sumpo/sion Pi.N.9.48; h)\ [mi/trh] mastou\s e)fi/lhse Call.Epigr.39. in making a request, oi)=sq' o(tih\ filw= s' e)gw/, ka)moi\ piqo/menos u(papoki/nei th=s o(dou= Ar.Av.1010; so ti/ pra/ssei *fhliki/wn o( a)gaqo/s; filw= se
pray, how goes it with the worthy Felicio? Arr.Epict.1.19.20; so perh. in Herod.1.66, pei/sqhti/ meu, file/w se (but rather 'I
speak as a true friend'). after Hom., c. inf.,
love to do,
be fond of doing, and so
to be wont or
used to do, file/ei o( qeo\s ta\ u(pere/xonta kolou/ein Hdt.7.10.e/; h)\n a(ma/rtwsi tou= patrikou= tu/pou . . file/ousi diafqei/resqai Democr.228; *moi=sa memna=sqai f. Pi. N.1.12, cf. P.3.18; filei= de\ ti/ktein u(/bris . . u(/brin A.Ag.763 (lyr.); toi=s qanou=si/ toi filou=si pa/ntes keime/nois e)peggela=n S.Aj.989, etc.; rarely with part. for inf., filei=s de\ drw=s' au)to\ sfo/dra Ar.Pl.645. of things, events, etc., au)/rh a)po\ yuxrou= tinos file/ei pne/ein Hdt.2.27; filei= w)di=na ti/ktein nu/c A.Supp.769; e)mpo/rwn e)/ph f. plana=sqai S.OC 304; filei= ga/r pws ta\ toiau=q' e(te/ra| tre/pesqai Ar.Nu.813 (lyr.); filei= mega/la strato/peda e)kplh/gnusqai Th.4.125; o(\ dh\ f. o( e)/rws e)mpoiei=n Pl.Smp.182c: esp. with gi/gnesqai of what
usually happens, a)po\ pei/rhs pa/nta a)nqrw/poisi file/ei gi/nesqai everything comes to man by experience, Hdt.7.9.g/, cf. 7.10.z/, 7.50, Th.3.42, Isoc.6.104, Pl. R.494c, al.; oi(=a f. gi/gnesqai Th.7.79, cf. Hdt.8.128; without gi/gnesqai, oi(=a dh\ filei= as
is wont, Pl.R.467b; o(poi=a f. Luc.Am.9. impers., file/ei de/ kws proshmai/nein (sc. o( qeo/s）, eu)=t' a)\n . . Hdt.6.27; w(s dh\ filei= . . lo/gon e)/xein a)nqrw/pous as
it is usual for . . , Plu.Pomp. 73.
fi/lh, h(, v. fi/los 1.1b.

fi/lhbos [i^], on, (h(/bh)
loving youth: only as pr. n. Philebus.

fi^lhd-e/w,
find pleasure in, take delight in, c. dat., ma/xais Ar.Pax 1130 (lyr.); tai=s u(si/n Antiph.126.3; r(i/zh| Plb.34.10.4; *foi=bos a)ei\ poli/essi f. Call.Ap.56; mh\ f. th=| periwdeume/nh| profora=| Phld.Rh.1.158S.; f. e)rhmi/ais
to like to dwell in . . , Andreas ap. Ath.7.312e; pro\s th\n yu/cin Gal.7.611; f. pro\s toi=s muropwli/ois Alciphr.3.24; e)pi\ th=| xw/ra| Suid. s.v. pene/stai: c. part., f. e)sqi/wn Ael.NA4.21: abs., Thphr.HP9.16.1.

fi^lhd-h/s, e/s,
fond of pleasure, Arist.EN1157a33.
easily pleasing, tini Sch.Pi.P.2.133.

fi^lhd-i/a, h(,
delight, gruli/zein u(po\ filhdi/as, of pigs, Ar.Pl.307 (lyr.), cf. 311 (lyr.).

fi^lhd-oni/a, h(,
fondness for pleasure, Democr.159 (pl.), Agatharch.Fr.Hist.11, Hp.Ep.17, Epict.
Gnom.45, Plu.2.12c, 21c, Sull.2, Max.Tyr.31.5, S.E.M.11.120, etc.

fi^lhd-oniko/s, h/, o/n,
advocating hedonism, lo/goi Olymp. in Grg. p.7N.

fi^lh/d-onos, on, (h(donh/)
fond of pleasure, Plb.39.1.10, 2 Ep.Ti.3.4, Epict.Gnom.46, Plu.Galb.1, al., Luc.Herm.16, Max.Tyr.4.2, etc.: to\ f., = filhdoni/a, Plu.2.1094a.
wont to bring delight, *ba/kxoio na=ma AP10.118.

fi^lhko-e/w,
to be attentive, Plb.3.57.4.

fi^lhko-i/+a, h(,
fondness for listening to, tw=n lo/gwn Isoc.1.18: abs., Plu.2.40a, 44a, Jul.Mis.358d, prob. in Satyr.Vit.Eur.Fr.2i16.

fi^lh/ko-os, on, (a)koh/)
fond of hearing conversation, discourses, etc., f. kai\ zhthtiko/s Pl.R.535d; filo/mousos kai\ f. ib.548e; oi(/ te filoqea/mones oi(/ te f. ib.475d; a)nh\r f. kai\ i(storiko/s Plu.Alc.10:—to\ f., = filhkoi/+a, Id.2.704e: but also,
fond of hearing for mere pastime, opp. oi( filomaqou=ntes, Plb.7.7.8. Adv. -ws, e)/xein Hld.5.16, Aristid.2.230 J., Chor.6.34 p.95 F.-R.

fi^l-hla/ka^tos [a^k], on,
fond of the spindle, kalaqi/skos AP6.160 (Antip. Sid.); prob. in B. 1.74 p.439 Jebb.

fi^l-hli^a/s, a/dos, h(, (h(/lios)
loving the sun, w)|dh/ Telesill.2.

fi^l-hli^asth/s, ou=, o(,
one who delights in the trials of the Heliaea, Ar.V.88.

fi/lhm-a [i^], atos, to/, Dor. fi/la_ma Mosch.1.5:—
kiss, A.Fr.135, X. Mem.1.3.12, etc.; f. dou=nai E.IA679,1238; f. para\ ge/nun tiqe/nta so/n Id.Supp.1154; patri\ . . dia\ filhma/twn i)w/n Id.Andr.416; of kisses as prizes in a game, pai/zwmen peri\ filhma/twn Pl.Com.46, cf. S.Fr.537, Eub.3.4; as a symbol of Christian love, 1 Ep.Cor.16.20. pl.,
cosmetics, Ach.Tat.2.38 (fort. farma/kwn).
filhm-a/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg.; only as pr. n., Luc. DMeretr.11.2.
filh/m-h, h(, = fili/a, Theognost.Can. 112, EM216.3. -mi, v. file/w.

filhm-oni/eios (written filhm-i/hos) a)gw/n, festival
in honour of Philemon, at Aphrodisias, CIG2811: -i/ha, ta/, prob. ib.2812.

filhm-osu/nh, h(,
friendliness, affection, Thgn.284 (v.l. sunhmosu/nh), IG12.1016.

filh/m-wn, on, gen. onos,
kindly, affectionate, EM259.57: elsewh. as pr. n.

fi^l-h/nemos, on, (a)/nemos)
loving the wind, pi/tus Plu.2.676a; (of bellows) au)lo/s AP6.92 (Phil.).

fi^l-h/nios, on, (h(ni/a)
accepting the rein, i(/ppoi A.Pr.465.
fi^l-h/nwr, v. fila/nwr.

fi^l-hrai+sth/s, ou=, o(,
friend of the *(hrai+stai/ (guild of Hera-worshippers), IGRom.4.1732 (Samos).

fi^l-h/remos, on,
lover of silence, epith. of the moon, PMag.Par.1.2808.

fi^lh/retmos, on, (e)retmo/s)
fond of the oar, of the Phaeacians, Od. 8.96, etc.; of the Taphians, 1.181; kudoimo/s Nonn.D.39.214.

fi_lhsi/a, h(,
thievishness, Hsch. (pl.); cf. filh/ths.
fi^lh/sios, o(, epith. of Apollo, Conon 33.4 (prob. for *fili/ou), Varr. ap.Sch.Stat.Theb.3.283, Macr.Sat.1.17. filh/sia, ta/, = filoth/sia, prosfilh=, Hsch.
fi^l-hsi/molpos [si^], on, = filo/molpos, Pi.O.14.13.

fi^l-hsi/mws, Adv.
in love, Hellanic.19（
b）J.

fi^/l-hsis, ews, h(,
loving, affection, Arist.EN1166b32, 1156a6 (pl.), Alex.Aphr.in Top.347.18, Plot.2.3.11.
fi^l-hsiste/fa^nos, on, = filoste/fanos, dai/s Pi.Pae.1.8, cf. Aristid. Or.49(25).31.

fi^l-h/su^xos, on,
fond of rest, peaceful, Paul.Al.M. 4.

fi^l-hte/on,
one must love, S.Ant.524, Arist.EN1165b14.

fi_lhteu/w,
to be a fi_lh/ths, h.Merc.159 (v.l. fhl-).

fi_lh/ths, ou, o(,
thief, voc. filh=ta Archil.46, h.Merc.446; fw=tes filh=tai ib.67; filhte/wn o)/rxamos ib.175 (prob.); filh/ths a)nh/r A.Ch. 987 (1001); o(/rkos ga\r ou)dei\s a)ndri\ filh/th| baru/s S.Fr.933, cf. Ichn. 332; o(\s de\ gunaiki\ pe/poiqe, pe/poiq' o(/ ge filh/th|si Hes.Op.375; *(ermh=s filh/ths Hellanic.19（
b）J.; *(ermh=s filhtw=n a)/nac E.Rh.217; tw=n filhte/wn . . a)/nakta (sc. *(ermh=n) Epigr.Gr.1108 (Chios, date unknown); filh/ths o( *)/erws kaloi=t' a)/n AP5.308 (Dioph.); ou)ke/ti xei=res e)/pagroi filhte/wn Call.Hec.1.4.11;
latronum more, quos filh/tas (
hostilistas, stilistas, psti[l]listas, codd.)
Aegyptii vocant, Seneca Ep.51.13. (The spelling fil-, which is proved correct by filati/a (q. v.), is found in Epigr.Gr.l. c., the Papyri of S.Ichn.l. c., Hellanic. l. c., Call. l. c. (tab. lign.), and the best codd. of the remaining Gr. passages, cf. Trypho and Hdn.Gr. ap. Choerob. in An.Ox.2.271; fil- also in Hsch., Suid.; fhl- has MS. authority in Hes. l. c. (fil- Sch.Vett. cited by Eust.194.31), E. l. c., etc.)

fi^l-hth/s, ou=, o(,
lover, AP5.270 (Maced.).

fi^l-hth/sios, a, on,
productive of love or
friendship, fulakth/rion f. Cyran.40 codd. (fort. filoth/sion).

fi^l-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
disposed to love, tinos Arist. EN1117b30, Pol.1327b39: abs.,
affectionate, Id.EE1239a27, HA 488b21, Plu.2.3d (Comp.): to\ f. Id.Per.1.
fond of kissing, Arist.Pr.953b15.

fi^l-hto/s, h/, o/n,
to be loved, worthy of love, Id.EN1168a15; ta\ f.
objects of love, ib.1156a8. Adv. -tw=s
in a friendly spirit, Eust.1490.47.
fi^/l-htron, to/, the primary form of fi/ltron, acc. to EM795.17; f.l. in AP11.218 (Crates).

fi^l-h/twr, oros, o(,
lover (Cretan), Str.10.4.21, Hsch. as fem., h( de\ . . kei=tai f. tou=de here lies his
paramour, A.Ag.1446 (tw|=de Sch., who derives filh/twr from h)=tor (cf. megalh/twr), the one
dear to his
heart, his
darling). as Adj.,
loving, a)gosto/s, ko/lpos, Nonn.D.3.398, 21.27.

fi^l-h/faistos, o(,
friend of Hephaestus, Eratosth.(?)ap.Apollod. (FGrH244）Fr.85 J.

fi^li/-a, Ion. -ih, h(, (file/w)
affectionate regard, friendship (not in A. or S.), usu. betw. equals, a)/ndressi kakoi=s sunqe/menoi f. Thgn.306, IG12.1037; e)pagge/llesqai f. Hdt.7.130; ei)s a)llh/lous fili/as a)naki/rnasqai E.Hipp.254 (anap.), cf. Democr.109, al., Hippias 17, Antipho Soph.64 (pl.), And.3.29, Pl.Smp.179c, etc.; fili/as, inscr. on a bowl (perh.
loving-cup), BSA32.194 (Haliartus, Hellenistic), etc.; h( th=s yuxh=s f. dia\ to\ a(gnh\ ei)=nai, opp. e)/rws, X.Smp.8.15, cf. Pl.Phdr.255e; opp. e)/xqra, Isoc.1.33, Plot.3.2.2; h( f. tou= ko/smou e)/xqra tou= qeou= e)stin Ep.Jac.4.4; opp. mi=sos, Isoc.15.122; f. qew=n kai\ a)nqrw/pwn Pl.Smp.188d; of family
affection, X.Hier.3.7 (pl.); e)n tai=s f. in the
family circle, Arist.Po.1453b19; of the
regard of dependents towards their superiors, X.An.1.6.3; f. h( pro\s to\n dh=mon Isoc.16.28; of
friendship between States, e)xrhma/tise peri\ fili/as toi=s *)aqhnai/ois Th.5.5; f. kai\ cummaxi/a Id.6.34; th=s f. a)fe/sqai, th\n f. dialu/sasqai, of communities, Isoc.6.11, 14.33: various ei)/dh distd. by Arist.EN1156a7 ff.; by the Stoics, Stoic.3.24, 27, 181: phrases, f. pro/s tinas poih/sasqai X.Mem.2.6.29; para/ tinwn f. labei=n Id.Cyr.3.1.28; tisi\ dia\ fili/as i)e/nai Id.An.3.2.8; ei)s f. i)te/on, e)/rxetai, Pl.Phdr.237c, Ly.214d; e)/stin h(mi=n e)n f. PMich.Zen.33.3 (iii B. C.); a)naneou/menos th\n f. kai\ zeni/an th\n pro/teron u(pa/rxousan Isoc.Ep.7.13; prolipo/nq' h(mete/rhn f. Thgn.1102; e)/lipe f. E.Alc.930 (lyr.); th=s f. e)ci/stasqai/ tini Lys.8.18: with Preps., dia\ fili/as Pl.Plt.304e; meta\ fili/as X. Mem.1.2.10; dia\ fili/an, v. infr.; kata\ fili/an Pl.Lg.823b:—the person is commonly expressed by pro/s tina, Isoc.5.32; pro\s a)llh/lous Id.9.57, etc.; less freq. ei)s a)llh/lous E.Hipp. (v. supr.); also by object. gen., dia\ fili/an au)tou= through
friendship for him, Th.1.91; f. cunetou=
friendship with a wise man, Democr.98; so h(mete/rh f.
friendship with us, Thgn.600, 1102 (v. supr.), Isoc.6.11 (v. supr.); fili/a h( sh/ X.An.7.7.29, E Or.138, etc.: pl., f. i)sxurai/ Hdt.3.82, Pl. Smp.182c.
friendliness, amiability, f. a)/neu tou= ste/rgein Arist. EN1126b22, cf. 1108a28. later, of lovers,
fondness, LXXPr.5.19, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.1.8, AP5.266 (Agath.). c. gen., of things,
fondness, liking for, ke/rdous Pl.R.581a; [tw=n a)rxw=n] Arist.Cael.306a12.
the natural force which unites discordant elements and movements, opp. nei=kos, Emp.18, al., Isoc.15.268. Pythag. name for
three, Theol.Ar.16 (not for
six, Iamb.
In Nic. p.34 P.).

fi^li-a/zw,
to be a friend, tini LXX 2 Ch.20.37, BGU1141.18 (i B. C.), Olymp. Hist.p.470 D.; filia/zousai, title of mime by Herodas.

fi^li-a^ko/s, h/, o/n, = filiko/s, dia/qesis Plot.2.3.11. fi^li-a^ko/n, to/,
friendly society, funeral club, MAMA3.580,780,788 (Corycus).

fi^li-asth/s, ou=, o(,
reconciler, Hsch. s.v. sunallakth/s.

fi^lia_tr-e/w,
to be an amateur doctor, Dsc.5.19(s. v.l.), Alex.Praef., Plu.2.58a, Apollon.Cit.3, Orib.Eup.Praef.

fi^lia_/tr-hs, perh. gen. sg. fem. of sq., Dain
Inscr.du Louvre52.

fi^li/a_tr-os, on,
friend of the art of medicine, A.D.Pron.12.10, Gal.6.269, 13.636, Ptol.Tetr.160. Adv. -rws Apollon.Cit.1, cf. filoi/+atros.

fi^li/drws, wn, gen. wtos,
loving sweat or
toil, kunhgesi/a Inscr.Cret. 1. xxii 59 (Olus, ii A. D.).

fi^li^ko/s, h/, o/n,
friendly, ceni/a Pl.Lg.919a; e)/rga X.Cyr.8.7.15; of persons, Arist.EN1157b14; megalo/yuxos kai\ f. Phld.Rh.1.209 S.; -w/tero/n e)sti X.Cyr.2.4.32; to\ -w/taton h)=qos Id.Mem.3.10.3: filika/
proofs or
marks of friendship, filika\ paqei=n u(po/ tinos Id.Cyr.4.6.6; ta\ f. Id.Mem.2.6.21, Arist.EN1166a1, al.; f. kai\ poihtika\ fili/as ib. 1158a4; filiko\n ou)de\n e)poi/oun X.An.4.1.9; f. e)/rgon Phld.Lib.p.59 O.; f., to/, perh.
contribution, 'benevolence', to\ f. tou= bohqou= th=s ta/cews PSI4.301.16 (v A. D.); to\ f. th=s e)mbolh=s PFlor.297.345, al. (vi A. D.). Adv. -kw=s, e)/xw pro\s se/ Pl.Grg.485e; opp. polemikw=s e)/xein, X.HG 4.8.17; pro\s e(auto\n f. diakei=sqai Arist.EN1166b26; e)/xein pro/s tina Is.7.8; -kw=s soi poih/somen PCair.Zen.15v.38 (iii B. C.): Comp. -kw/teron X Mem.4.3.12: Sup. -kw/tata Id.Smp.9.4.

fi/lios [i^], a, on, also os, on E.Hel.629 (lyr.), Arist.Fr.675.13 (lyr.): (fi/los): Act.,
friendly, u(/mnos, e)/ph, Pi.P.1.60, 4.29; lo/goi, gnw=mai, Hdt.7.163, 9.4; frh/n, o)/mmata, A.Ag.1491 (anap.), Ch.810 (lyr.); xei/r S.OC201 (lyr.), E. l. c. (lyr.); c. dat.,
friendly to . . , f. brotoi=s fe/ggos E.Tr.849 (lyr.): esp. opp. pole/mios,
friendly, [h(gei=sqai] tou\s au)tou\s polemi/ous kai\ f. IG12.116.13; f. po/lis, etc., Th.5.44, etc.; *(ri/on f. toi=s *)aqhnai/ois Id.2.86; f. toi=s summa/xois X.Cyr.6.1.19; ou)demi/an po/lin *)/argeos filiwte/rhn Hdt.7.151; f. trih/rhs a
friendly ship, i.e. one
belonging to a friendly power, Th.4.120; (for 8.102, v. e)pi/ploos）; presbei=ai f. kai\ pole/miai
to friends and foes, X.Lac.13.10; pollw=n . . fili/wn kai\ polemi/wn nauagi/wn wrecks of many ships both
of friends and enemies, Lys.2.38: h( fili/a (sc. gh=, xw/ra)
friendly country, opp. h( polemi/a, X.Cyr.1.6.9, An.5.5.3, D.18.301; ta\ fi/lia, a)naxwri/zein ta\ f.
property of friends, X.Eq.Mag.7.6; tisi\ f. h)=n pro/s tinas
friendship, Hdt.3.49 (v.l. fi/la); for fi/lia te/mnein tini/, v. te/mnw 11.2: Comp. filiw/teros Id.7.151. *zeu\s f., *zeu/s
as god of friendship (his temple at Megalopolis, Paus.8.3.14), Diod.Com.2.5,20; pro\s *dio\s fili/ou Pl.Phdr.234e; martu/romai to\n fi/lion . . *di/a Men.54: in familiar language without *zeu/s, nai\ to\n fi/lion Ar.Ach.730; nh\to\n f. Pherecr.96 (lyr.); pro\s fili/ou Pl.Grg. 500b, 519e, Euthphr.6b; ma\ to\n f. to\n e)mo/n te kai\ so/n Id.Alc.1.109d; to\n so\n lipou=sa f. E.Andr.603:—of other divinities, f. dai/mones Luc. Tox.7; oi( f. qeoi/ Aristaenet.2.14;
kindly, gracious, *ku/pri f. AP5.10; w)= *zeu= basileu= kai\ nu\c fili/a A.Ag.355 (anap.). Pass.,
beloved, dear, of persons and things, gunh/ Id.Supp.533 (lyr.); dmwi/+des Ch.719 (anap.); w)= f. gene/qla S.El.226 (lyr.); f. a)/loxos E.Alc.876 (lyr.), 917 (anap.); bre/fh Id.Tr.557 (lyr.). Adv. -i/ws Th.3.65, X.Cyr.6.3.13, Pl.Lg.768e.

fi^lio/w,
make a friend of, e)xqrou/s Cyran.22:—Pass.,
become friends, Aesop.298, Sch.A.Th.767; censured by Poll.1.154: metaph., filiou=tai yuxh=| sw=ma Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.67.

fi^li/ppeios, on, also a, on, h)nore/h, kefalh/, AP9.288 (Gem.), 519 (Alc.); phgh/ prob. in Paus.8.7.4:—
of Philip, ll. cc., etc. *f. stath=res
gold didrachms coined by Philip, Poll.9.59,84, cf. SIG826 I15 (Delph., ii B. C.), D.S.16.8. fili/ppeion, to/ his temple at Olympia, Paus.5.20.9. *fili/ppeia, ta/, festival in his honour, BCH32.110 (Delos).

fi^lipp-e/w,
to be fond of horses, Theodos.Gr.p.37 G.

fi^lipp-i/a, h(,
love of horses or
riding, Stob.2.7.5b11.

fi^lippi^do/omai,
turn into a very Philippides, pefilippi/dwsai
you have become as thin as a lath, Alex.144 (cf. Ael.VH10.6).

fi^lipp-i/zw,
to be on Philip's side, of his party, D.18.176, Aeschin. 3.130.

fi^lipp-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
against Philip, po/lemos Plb.3.32.7: *f. i(stori/ai, of Theopompus: *f. lo/goi, name of twelve speeches by Demosthenes.
fi^li/pp-ion, to/, Dim. of *fi/lippos, Sch.Il.2.235.

fi^lipp-ismo/s, o(,
siding with Philip, Sch.D.18.143.

fi^/lipp-os, on,
fond of horses, horse-loving, Pi.N.9.32, S.Frr.582,859 (lyr.), E.Hec.9, Pl.Ly.212d, Ocell.4.14, etc.; f. a)/stu *qh/bas restd. in Pi.Pae.1.7, etc.:—Sup. filippo/tatos X.An.1.9.5. as masc. pr. n., Philip.

fi^lippotro/fos, on,
fond of keeping horses, Phalar.Ep.77.3.
fi^li/skos, o(, Dim. of fi/los, only as pr. n., Teles p.46 H., etc.

fi^li/stion, to/, a plant, perh.
cleavers, Galium Aparine, Hp.Nat. Mul.32, Mul.2.201: identified with a)pari/nh and filetai/rion by Gal. 19.151.

fi^listore/w,
love research, Str.17.1.5, v.l. for filiatre/w in Dsc.5.19.
to be curious, Sch.Od.9.174, 229.
fi/listos, on, v. fi/los IV.

fi^li/stwr, oros, o(, h(,
fond of learning, Vett.Val.17.24; f. lo/goi, title of work by Hierocl., Tz.H.7.716; without lo/goi, St.Byz. s. vv. *braxma=nes et *tarkuni/a.

filitianoi/, oi(, dub. sens. ( =
Feliciani?) in PMasp.57i9 (vi A. D.).
fili/tion, v. fidi/tion.

fi/lixqus [fi^], u^os, o(, h(,
fond of fish, Polem. Hist.66, Ath.8.358d.
fi^li/wn [li_], on, v. fi/los IV.

fi^li/-wsis [li^], ews, h(,
making friendly, Sch.E.Ph.375,al.

fi^li-wth/s, ou=, o(,
one who reconciles, Suid. s.v. diallakth/s.

fi^li-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
reconciling, tw=n diaforwta/twn dub. in Theol.Ar.5 (v.l. filwtikh/).
fillu^re/a, h(, v. filure/a.
fi^lo-, very freq. in compos., cf. Ar.V.77.

fi^lo/-bakxos, on,
loving Bacchus or
wine, AP7.222 (Phld.).

fi^lo-barba^ri/zw,
enjoy barbarisms of speech, Phld.Herc.994.6.

fi^lo-ba/rba^ros, on,
fond of barbarians or
foreigners, Plu.2.857a.

fi^lo-ba/rbi^tos, on,
fond of the lyre, *)anakrei/wn Critias 1.4 D.

fi^lo-ba^si/leios [si^], on,
loving monarchy, Plu.Aem.24.

fi^lo-ba^si^leu/s, e/ws, o(,
a friend to the king, Com.Adesp. in Gött.Nachr.1922.31, D.S.17.114, Plu.Alex. 47, Jul.Ep.89b, etc.

fi^lo-ba^si^listai/, oi(,
'the King's Own', regiment in Egypt, UPZ161.4 (ii B. C.), PAmh.2.39.12 (ii B. C.).

fi^lo-ba/ska^nos, on,
envious, Ptol.Tetr.161.

fi^lo-bh/dioi, oi(,
admirers of Vedius, Ephes.3 No.55.

fi^lo/-biblos, on,
fond of books, Str.13.1.54.

fi^lo-boiwto/s, o/n,
fond of the Boeotians, Hdn.Gr.1.228.
fi^lo/-boros, v. filo/brwtos.

fi^lo-borra=s, a=, o(,
loving the North wind, ib. 57.

fi^lo/-botrus, u,
fond of bunches of grapes, Phanocr. ap. Ath.7.276f, Plu.2.668a.

fi^lo/-boulos, o(,
patron of the Senate, POxy.1305 (iii A. D.).

fi^lo-bou/pais, o(, h(, gen. paidos,
loving full-grown boys, AP12.255 (Strat.).

fi^lo/-brwtos, on,
voracious, dub. in Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44 (Sup. -brwta/tou, v. l. -borwtota/tou; -borwta/tou cj. Meineke).
fi^lo-ga_qh/s, e/s, Dor. for filoghqh/s (q. v.).

fi^lo/-gaios, on,
loving the earth, u(/nis AP6.104 (Phil.).

fi^lo-ga/i+os [a_], o(,
friend of Gaius (i. e. Caligula), Milet.7.65.

fi^lo-gallobra^xeionotu/mpa^nos, on,
loving the drum beaten by the arms of *galloi/, Lyr. in Philol.80.334.

fi^lo/-ga^mos, on,
longing for marriage, mnhsth=res E.IA392 (troch.).

fi^lo-ga^re/laios, o(,
fond of fish-pickle and oil, pr. n. of a parasite in Alciphr.

fi^lo-gei/twn, on, gen. onos,
friendly to one's neighbours, Sammelb.6651 (written fi^lo-gi/twn).

fi^lo-geloiasth/s, ou=, o(,
a friend of jesters, Poll.5.161.

fi^lo-ge/loios, on,
fond of the ludicrous, given to jesting, Arist.Rh.1390a23, VV1251a19, Phld.Hom.p.26O.

fi^lo-ge/lws, o(, h(, gen. wtos,
laughter-loving, *parqe/nos *ni/kh Men.616: acc. pl. filoge/lwtas Pl.R.388e, cf. Arist.Rh.1389b10; e)nanti/on to\ o)durtiko\n tw=| filoge/lwti ib.1390a24:— also acc. sg. filo/gelwn Jul.Caes.308d (but dat. -ge/lwti Id.Mis.346a): gen. sg. neut. filo/gelw Philostr.VS1,21.5; nom. pl. filo/gelw (leg. -gelw|) Att. for filoge/lwtes acc. to Moer.p.385 P.: acc. pl. filo/gelws Thphr.Fr.124. as Subst.,
jest-book, title of work by Hierocles.

fi^lo-ge/nesis, fem. Adj
with an impulse towards generation, ou)si/a Plot.3.4.6.

fi^lo-gennai=os, on,
loving what is noble: to\ f. D.L. 4.19.

fi^lo-germa_niko/s, o(,
loyal to Germanicus, IPE2.400 (Gorgippia).

fi^lo-ge/rwn, ontos, o(,
loyal to the Senate, IGRom.4.783 (Apamea).

fi^lo-gewme/trhs, ou, o(,
fond of geometry, Ptol.Tetr. 163.

fi^lo-gewmetri/a, h(,
fondness for geometry, Stob.2.7.5k.

fi^lo-gewrgi/a, h(,
fondness for husbandry, X.Oec.20.25.

fi^lo-ge/wrgos, on,
fond of husbandry, ib. 27, 28, Arist.Fr.571, LXX 2 Ch.26.10, Gal.6.552: Sup. -o/tatos X.Oec.20.26.

fi^lo-ghqh/s, e/s, only in Dor.form fi^lo-ga_qh/s: (gh=qos, ga=qos):—
loving mirth, mirthful, A.Th.918 (lyr.).

fi^lo-gli^xe/w,
to be fractious, perverse, Phld.Rh.2.190 S.

fi^lo/-glu^kus, u,
loving sweet things, me/lissa Plu.2.673e: esp.
fond of sweet wine, Arist.Top.111a3, Pr.875b3, Alex.Aphr.in Top.155.28; filo/glu^kos, on, is prob. f. l. in Arist.EE1227b10, cf. Eustr. in EN82.33.

fi^lo-goni/a, h(,
love of children, Callistr.Stat.13.

fi^lo/-gonos, on,
loving one's children, f.l. in LXX 4 Ma.15.5 (Comp.).

fi^logramma^t-e/w,
love books, Plu. Aem.28, 2.742a.

fi^logramma^t-i/a, h(,
love of books, Stob.2.7.5k.

fi^logra/mma^t-os, on,
loving books, Plu.2.963b, D.L. 4.30, Ptol. Tetr.63.

fi^logra^fe/w,
love painting, Plu.2.1093d.

fi^logumnast-e/w,
love gymnastic exercises, Pl.Prt.342c, 342e, R.452b, Gal.17(1).211.

fi^logumnast-h/s, ou=, o(,
fond of gymnastic exercises, Hp.
Aër.1, Pl.R.535d, Ph.2.356.

fi^logumnast-i/a, h(,
fondness for gymnastic exercises, Pl. Smp.182c, 205d.

fi^logumnast-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a filogumnasth/s, Id.R.456a; e(/ceis Arist.EE1222a31.
fi^logu/mnast-os, on, f.l. for -gumnasth/s, Ph. 1.657.

fi^logu/n-aios [u^], on,
fond of one's wife, Sammelb.411 (iii/iv A. D.): but usu.
fond of women, Theopomp. Hist.240, Arist.Phgn. 808a36, LXX 3 Ki.11.1 cod. Alex., Asp.in EN91.22.

fi^logu/n-hs, ou, o(, = foreg.2, Antiph.102, LXX 3 Ki.11.1 cod. Vat., Ath.13.603e: acc. sg. -gu/nhn Plb.10.19.3: acc. pl. -gu/nas Chrysipp.Stoic.3.167: but in early writers pl. filogu/naikes (no sg. filogu/naic occurs), Pl.Smp. 191d, interpol. in Aristaenet. 1.12.

fi^logun-i/a, h(,
love of women, Cic. Tusc.4.11.25, Plu.2.706b, Stob.2.7.10e; written filogunai/a Sch. Gen.Il.21.498 (perh. fr. filogu/naios).

fi^lo-gw/nios, on,
lurking in corners: retired, bi/os Tz.H.1.283.

fi^lo-daitu/mwn [u^], onos, o(, h(,
fond of guests, Hdn.Gr.2.727.

fi^lo/-dakrus, u, gen. uos,
loving tears, given to weeping, Poll.2.63, 6.202.
fi^lo-damou=sa, f.l. for filo/dhmos ou)=sa in Plu.2.745c.

fi^lo-da/reios [a_], on,
friend of Darius, Them.Or.7.95d.

fi^lo-da/rths, ou, o(,
flagitiosus, plagosus, Gloss.

fi^lo/-dafnos, on,
loving the laurel, epith. of Dionysus, E.Fr.477 (lyr.).

fi^lo-deipnisth/s, ou=, o(,
one who likes giving dinners, D.L.3.98.

fi^lo/-deipnos, on,
fond of good dinners, Alex.163.1, Ath. 1.6d; to\ f. Plu.2.726a.
fond of giving dinners, hospitable, Ph.2.70.

fi^lo-de/mnios, on,
loving the bed, amorous, Opp.C. 1.161.

fi^lo/-dendros, on,
fond of trees or
the wood, APl.4.233 (Theaet.).

fi^lo-depasth/s, ou=, o(,
lover of cups, Eust.868.58.

fi^lodespot-e/w, of a slave,
love his master, Ph.2.340.

fi^lode/spot-os, on,
loving one's lord or
master, a)ndra/poda f. slaves
that hug their chains, cringing slaves, Hdt.4.142, cf. Com.Adesp.24.13 D.; fu/sei f. D.S.17.66; filo/douloi kai\ filode/spotoi J.BJ4.3.10; dh=mos f. Thgn.849; in good sense, f. a)peleu/qeros MAMA4.336 (Eumeneia); of dogs, Plu. 2.491c: to\ f. Luc.Fug.16; f. qerapei=ai Ph.1.474: as Subst., title of plays by Timostratus, AB80 (where dat. -th|), Theognetus, Ath. 14.616a, and Sogenes, IG22.2323.157.

fi^lodhm-i/a, h(,
love of the people, popularity, Poll.3.65.

fi^lo/dhm-os, on,
friend of the commons, Ar.Nu.1187, Poll.4.34; f. e)/rgon a
popular act, Ar.Eq.787 (anap.). Adv. -mws Poll.3.66.

fi^lodhm-otiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to be filo/dhmos, dub. l. in D.H.8.90.
fi^lodhm-w/dhs, es, = foreg., D.L.4.22.

fi^lodi/k-aios [di^], on,
loving the right, loving justice, Arist.EN1099a11, Cic.Fam.15.19.3, Plu.Arist.22; qeo/s Ph.1.495: to\ f. M.Ant.1.14.

fi^lodik-asth/s, ou=, o(,
one who likes being a judge, name of a play by Timocles, Ath.6.245b.

fi^lodik-e/w,
to be fond of litigation, Th.1.77, Arist.Rh.1373a35.

fi^lodik-i/a, h(,
litigiousness, Sch.Ar.Ach.374, Pl. 171.

fi^lo/dik-os, on,
litigious, Lys.10.2, D.56.14, Arist.Rh.1400a19.
fi^l-odi/ths [i_], poet. voc.

fi^l-i=ta, o(,
friend of travellers, *pri/hpe AP 6.102 (Phil.).

fi^lodoc-e/w,
love fame, seek honour, e)pi/ tini
for or
in a thing, Arist.Rh.1387b35; swfrosu/nh| Plb.31.28.10; f. ei)s tou\s *(/ellhnas
seek credit amongst them, Id.1.16.10; ei)s to\ koino/n, ei)s th\n su/nodon, JHS54.142 (Delos, ii B. C.); ei)s to\n dh=mon IG22.1304.40; e)n th=| pro\s *eu)me/nhn diafora=| Plb.31.6.5; e)n a)ristokratikw=| politeu/mati Id.23.14.1; pro/s ti Id.27.9.7, Plu.2.125d; abs., Metrod.Fr.56, Plb.35.4.12, Phld.Vit.p.7. J., al.: prov., pefilodochkw\s e)n *sikeli/a| kaqa/per e)n o)cuba/fw|, i.e. to be a great man in a small way, Plb.12.23.7.

fi^lodoc-i/a, h(,
love of fame or
glory, SIG577.3 (Milet., iii/ii B. C.), Plb.3.104.1, 24.9.8; in bad sense,
concern for one's reputation, Phld.Rh.1.139 S., al., Ph.2.5, al., Gal.15.450: pl., Plu.2.1050d.

fi^lo/doc-os, on, (do/ca)
loving fame or
glory, Pl.R.480a, Phld.Lib.p.61 O. (prob., Comp.); peri/ ti Arist.Rh.1387b33; in bad sense, Ph.2.32, al.; ei)s tou\s *(/ellhnas Plb.7.8.6: Sup., Id.32.8.5; to\ f. Luc.Peregr.38. Adv. -cws JHS54.141 (Delos, ii B. C.), OGI339.98 (Sestos, ii B. C.), etc.: Sup. -o/tata Supp.Epigr.1.397.9 (Samos, i A. D.).
fi^lo-dosi/a, h(, = filodwri/a, in pl., IGRom.4.791 (Apamea), 1572 (Teos).

fi^lo/-dotos, on,
bounteous, Dain
Inscr. du Louvre 53 (near Smyrna, fidolotos lapis).

fi^lo/-doulos, on,
loving slavery, f. kai\ filode/spotoi J.BJ4.3.10. in good sense,
loving one's slaves, despo/ths Ph.1.126.

fi^lo/-doupos, on,
loving noise, noisy, AP6.297 (Phan.).

fi^lo-drh/rios, o(,
friend of Dreros, SIG527.47 (Cret., iii B. C.).

fi^lo/-dromos, on,
loving the course, Orph.H.14.11.

fi^lo/-drosos, on,
loving the dew, Nonn.D.1.357.

fi^lo/dur-mos, on,
fond of lamentation, v. l. for sq. in Poll.6.202.
fi^lo/dur-tos, on = foreg., A.Supp.68 (lyr.); cf. foreg.

fi^lodwr-i/a, h(,
fondness for giving, bounteousness, IG7.101 (Megara), Luc.Vit.Auct.18, AelVH9.1, CIG2870 (Branchidae).

fi^lo/dwr-os, on,
bountiful, Cratin.328, X.Mem.3.1.6, Plu.Alex.48, etc.; of God, Ph.1.50, al.; to\ f., = filodwri/a, Plu.Ant.43. Adv. -rws Pl.Tht. 146d. c. gen.,
giving bountifully of, eu)menei/as Id.Smp.197d.
fond of receiving gifts or
bribes, po/lis App.Sam.11. of actions, etc.,
munificent, pra=gma fila/nqrwpon kai\ f. D.18.112.

fi^lo-eqnh/s, e/s,
patriotic, pa/qos Ph.2.386.

fi^lo-ergo/s, o/n, or filo/ergos, on,
fond of work, industrious, kerki/s AP6.48, cf. 7.423 (Antip.Sid.): Sup., ib.6.288 (Leon.).

fi^lo-ze/fu^ros, on,
loving the west wind, ib. 10.16 (Theaet.), 12.195 (Strat.).

fi^lo-zh/lws, Dor. fi^lo-za/lws, Adv.
zealously, diati/qesqai pot' au)tou/s Hippodam. ap. Stob.4.1.95.

fi^lozw-e/w, = filoyuxe/w,
love life, para\ to\ de/on, para\ to\ kaqh=kon, Plb.11.2.11, 30.7.8; pro\s a)pegnwsme/nas e)lpi/das Id.30.8.3, cf. Fr.164, D.S.17.13, Ph.2.600.
desire long life, Aristo Stoic.1.89.

fi^lozw-i/+a, h(,
love of life, esp. of an ignoble kind,
clinging to life, dia\ filozwi/+an Plb.15.10.5, cf. Andronic. Rhod.p.572 M.; dia\ th=s suggenou=s f. D.S.2.50; u(po\ f. D.L.6.19; to\n e)/ndocon qa/naton th=s a)gennou=s f. h)lla/canto D.S.17.84.

fi^lo/zw-os, on, (zwh/)
fond of one's life, with collat. sense of
cowardly, brotoi/ E.Fr.816.6, cf. Pl.Com.19 D., Charito 3.3, 5.2; f. oi( presbu/teroi Arist.Rh.1389b32; to\ f. Phld.Mort.39
(misspelt -zwion, s. v.l.), Ind.Sto.27: as Subst.,
coward, Ph.2.269. of patients in disease,
desirous of living, Aret.SD2.1. of plants,
tenacious of life, Thphr.HP7.13.4.
evergreen, Nic.Th.68, Al.274,591. fi^lo/zw|os, on, (zw=|on)
fond of animals, dhmiourgo/s X.Mem.1.4.7; qeo/s Ph.2.305.
delighting to produce life, fu/sis Cleom.1.2.

fi^lozw-wte/on,
one must cling to life, Olymp. in Grg.p.183N. (sed leg.
fi^lozw-hte/on).

fi^lo/-qa_kos, on,
sedentary, Hsch.

fi^lo-qea_mosu/nh, h(,
fondness for shows, J.AJ19.1.15.

fi^lo-qea/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos,
fond of seeing, fond of shows or
spectacles, Pl.R.476a, 476b, Ph.1.38, al.; c. gen., a)qlhtw=n f. Luc.Herod.8; generally, to\ f. Plu.2.704e.
fond of contemplating, th=s a)lhqei/as Pl.R.475e; maqhmatikw=n ei)dw=n Iamb.Comm. Math.20: abs.,
contemplative, Plot.3.8.4.

fi^lo-qei/+a, h(,
love of God, piety, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.177.

fi^lo/-qeos, on,
loving God, pious, Arist. Rh.1391b2, Ph.2.8, al., 2 Ep.Ti.3.4, Demoph Sent.44, Luc.Cal.14: Adv. fi^lo/-ws Poll.1.22.

fi^lo-qeo/ths, htos, h(,
the love of God, Men.Rh.p.361 S.; condemned by Poll.1.21.

fi^lo/-qermos, on,
loving warmth, Thphr.CP2.3.3, Plu.2.648d.

fi^lo-qersi/ths [i_], ou, o(,
admirer of Thersites, w)= f. filoke/rtome, misquotation of Od.22.287 by Choerob. in Theod.1.164 H.

fi^loqewr-e/w,
love speculation, v.l. for filoqe/wron in Iamb. in Nic. p.90 P.
fi^loqewr-hth/s, ou=, o(, gloss on filoqea/mwn, Hsch., Phot.

fi^lo-qh/baios, on,
friend of Thebes, name of a play by Antiphanes, cf. Them.Or.7.96a.

fi^lo/-qhlus, u,
loving the female sex or
females, Ael.NA2.43.

fi^lo-qh/c, qh=gos, o(, h(,
often sharpened, Theognost.Can.40.
fi^lo/-qhr, qhros, o(, prob. f.l. for filo/qhros, Polem. Phgn.44.

fi^loqhr-e/w,
to be fond of hunting, Ael.VH9.3.

fi^loqhr-i/a, h(,
love of the chase, X.Cyr.2.4.26, Plu. 2.633a.

fi^lo/qhr-os, on,
fond of hunting, X.Cyn.5.25, Pl.R.535d, 549a: Sup. -o/tatos X.An.1.9.6.

fi^loqhr-qh/sauros, on,
fond of accumulating treasure, Vett.Val.18.11.

fi^lo-qo/ru^bos, on,
fond of noise or
uproar, Ptol.Tetr.159,
Cat.Cod. Astr.2.173.

fi^lo-qouku_di/dhs [i^d], ou, o(,
fond of Thucydides, APl4.315 (Thom.Schol.) [u^ l.c., wrongly].

fi^lo-qre/mma^tos, on, = sq. (or perh.
loving foster-children), Ath.Mitt.24.206 (Pergam.).

fi^lo-qre/mmwn, on, gen. onos,
fond of rearing animals, Max.Tyr.7.7.

fi^lo/-qreskos, on,
loving ceremonies, pious, basilh=es Hymn.Is.5; cf. qresko/s, qrhskei/a.

fi^/lo-qrey, o(,
dear foster-child, dub. in Keil-Premerstein
Zweiter Bericht No. 157 (Lydia, ii A. D.).
fi^lo-qrhnh/s, e/s, = sq., Mosch.4.66.

fi^lo/-qrhnos, on,
fond of wailing, given to lamentations, Poll.6.202, Ptol.Tetr.71, Nonn. D.9.294.

fi^lo/-qursos, on,
loving the thyrsus, of Silenus, Orph.H. 54.11; *gallai/ Lyr.Adesp.121.

fi^lo-qu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
fond of sacrifices, Ar.V.82, Antipho 2.2.12, Plu.Rom.7, etc.; f. peri\ to\ qei=on Thphr. Fr.152.

fi^lo/-qu^tos, on, o)/rgia f.
offered by zealous worshippers, A.Th.179 (lyr.).
fi^loi/+a_tros, on, = fili/atros, Procl.Par.Ptol.225.

fi^l-oi/keios, on,
loving one's relations, Arist.VV1251b35, OGI335.20 (Pergam., ii B. C.), prob. in Arist.Rh.1389a37, Hierocl.p.61A.; to\ f. th=s proaire/sews Plb.31.28.9, cf. Cat.Cod.Astr.2.161; pa/qos
family feeling, Ph.2.74: as Subst., title of play by Timostratus, IG22.2323.155.

fi^l-oikodo/mos, on,
fond of building, X.Oec.20.29, Arist.EN 1175a34.

fi^l-oikti/rmwn, on, gen. onos,
prone to pity, compassionate, E.IT345, Pl.Mx.244e, Plu.Cam.17, Aristid.Or.46(3).39, etc.: to\ f. Plu. 2.959f, Ael.VH1.30. Adv. fi^/l-nws Poll.8.11.
fi^l-oi/ktistos, on, = filoikti/rmwn, ka/rta toi filoi/ktiston gunh/ S.Aj.580.

fi^/l-oiktos, on, = foreg., Sch.Il.22.88.
moving pity, a)p' o)/mmatos be/lei filoi/ktw| with
piteous glance shot from her eyes, A.Ag.241 (lyr.).

fi^l-oini/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
love of wine, Hdt.3.34, D.S.5.26, Ath. 10.430a.

fi^/l-oinos, on,
fond of wine, mou=sa E.Fr.184 (s. v.l.), cf. Theopomp.Com.78, Pl.Ly.212d, R.475a, Arist.Rh.1371a18, Jul. Caes.330c: Sup., Plu.Cic.27; e)/qnos Ael.VH3.13.
fi^l-oistroma^nh/s, e/s, = sq., Orph.H.14.3.

fi^/l-oistros, on,
loving frenzy, ib.27.13.
loving to inspire with frenzy, ib.32.9.
fi^loi/+stwr, oros, o(, h(, = fili/stwr, Steph. in Gal.1.265D., Hsch.

fi^l-oi/fa_s, a, o(, Dor., (oi)fa/w)
loving sexual intercourse, lecherous, Theoc.4.62, Eust.1597.29:—also fi^/l-oifos, on, Hsch.

fi^lo-ka)ga^qi/a, h(,
love of the good, Supp.Epigr.6.68 (Ancyra), Bell
Jews and Christians in Egypt 1927.40 (iv A. D., -eia), cf. fileka)gaqi/a.

-ka)ga^qos, h, on,
loving the good, PLond.5.1677.5 (vi A. D.). (Prob. short for *filokaloka/gaqos.）

fi^lo-ka^qa/rios [a^r], on,
loving cleanliness, Vett.Val.3.24, Procl.Par.Ptol.90:—also fi^lo-ka/qa^ros, on, Ptol.Tetr.63: to\ f. ib.62.

fi^lo-ka/qolos, on,
loving generalization, Olymp. in Alc.p.160C.: also fi^lo-kaqo/lou Id.in Mete.2.11, Ammon. in APr.53.32.

fi^lo/-kainos, on,
loving novelty or
innovation, Plu.2.731b, etc.: to\ f. D.H. 15.6(7), Ph.2.115, Luc.Icar.24.

fi^lo/-kaisar, aros, o(,
loyal to the Emperor, SIG804.11 (Cos, i A. D.), etc.; as epithet of Zeus Polieus, Mnemos.55.265 (Coptos, iii A. D.).

fi^lo/-ka^kos, on,
loving the bad or
base, Phld.Lib.p.24 O., Sch.Pi.P.4.507.

fi^loka^l-e/w,
love the beautiful, Th.2.40; filokalei=n th\n fu/sin . . ei)ko/s e)sti Chrysipp.Stoic.2.334.
to be enthusiastic, esp. for the beautiful or the good, peri\ ta\s eu)wxi/as lampruno/menoi Str.14.1.20; ei)s tau/thn th\n e)pibolh/n this
project (sc. of a beautiful tomb), D.S.1.66, cf. 13.90; peri\ paidotrofi/an J.Ap.1.12; peri\ th\n tw=n lo/gwn e)mpeiri/an D.Chr.18.1: c. inf., f. *(ellhnikai=s futei/ais diakosmh=sai ta\ basi/leia Plu.Alex.35.
beautify, elaborate, ta\ peri\ th\n e)kfora\n basilikw=s D.S.20.37; toi=s plou/tois pefilokalhko/twn [ta\s kth/seis] pro\s a)po/lausin ib.8; in literary style,
study effect, Philostr.VS2.4.2. Arithm.,
elaborate, work out a calculation, w(s e)/nesti/ tina di' e(autou= filokalh/santa katanoh=sai Iamb. in Nic.p.110 P., cf. p.98 P.
repair, put in good order, f. kai\ beltiou=n PLond.3.1044.22 (vi A. D.): —Pass., of a church,
Palestine Dept. of Antiquities Quarterly 3.97 (vi A. D.).

fi^loka^l-i/a, h(,
love for the beautiful, D.S.1.51.
love of cleanliness, Hsch. Arithm.,
calculation, working out, Vett.Val. 361.22.
care, attention, Hippiatr.68.

fi^loka^/l-ion (written -in), to/,
scopa, Gloss.

fi^lo-kallwpisth/s, ou=, o(,
one who loves ornament, Ptol.Tetr.70.

fi^lo/-ka^los, on,
loving the beautiful (both of personal and moral beauty),
loving beauty and goodness, Pl.Phdr.248d, Criti.111e,
Com.Adesp. Oxy.1239.18, etc.; to\ f. Plu.2.61d, 1026d.
fond of effect and elegance, X.Cyr.1.3.3; f. peri\ o(/pla ib.2.1.22; ta\ peri\ th\n e)sqh=ta f. Isoc.1.26, cf. 10.57; of the peacock, Arist.HA488b24. Adv., -lws e)/xein peri/ ti J.AJ12.2.1, cf. Gal.14.218, etc.: Comp. -kalw/teron kopri/sai
more elaborately, Gp.5.26.10.
fond of honour, seeking honour, filokalw/teroi e)n toi=s kindu/nois X.Smp.4.15, cf. Arist.EN 1125b12, 1179b9. kata\ to\ f. peiraqe/nta katanoh=sai to see by
working out the calculation, Iamb. in Nic.p.124 P.

fi^lo-kamph/s, e/s,
easily bending, lithe, ki/rkos AP6.294 (Phan.).

fi^lo-karpofo/ros, on,
bearing fruit abundantly, qe/ros ib.6.42.

fi^lo-kata/skeuos, on,
fond of elaborate diction, lo/gos Phld.Rh.1.164 S., cf. Procl.Chr.ap.Phot.Bibl. p.318 B.

fi^lo/-kenos, on,
loving emptiness, sto/ma ( = mataiolo/gon) Suid.

fi^loke/rd-eia, h(,
love of gain, greed, Pl.Lg.649d, X.Cyn.13.12:— written fi^lokerd-kerdi/a in D.S.5.35, Luc.Sat.14, cf. EM462.16.

fi^lokerd-e/w,
to be greedy of gain, X.An.1.9.16, Cyr.1.6.32.

fi^lokerd-h/s, e/s,
loving gain, greedy of gain, Thgn.199, Pi.I.2.6, Ar.Pl.591 (anap.), X.Oec.14.10, etc.; filoxrh/matos kai\ f. Pl.R.581a: to\ f., = filoke/rdeia, ib. 586d.
fi^lokerd-i/a, v. filoke/rdeia.

fi^lo-ke/rtomos, on,
fond of jeering, Od.22.287, Theoc.5.77, APl. 4.247 (Nilus Schol.).

fi^lo-khdemw/n, o/nos, o(, h(,
fond of one's relatives, X.Ages.11.13.
fi^lo-khdh/s, e/s, = khdemoniko/s, Ar.Fr.732.

fi^lo/-khpos, on,
fond of a garden, D.L.9.112.

fi^lo-ki^qa^risth/s, ou=, o(,
lover of the cithara, Plu.2.633a.

fi^lo-ki/ndu_nos, on,
fond of danger, adventurous, X.An.2.6.7, Cyr.2.1.22, D.11.22; e)pi/ponos kai\ f. bi/os Isoc.10.17; qumoeidh\s kai\ f. Plu.Arist.17: Comp., Luc.Peregr.23: Sup., pro\s ta\ qhri/a filokinduno/tatos X.An.1.9.6: to\ f.
adventurousness, Plu.2.966a, Luc.DMort.14.5, etc.: Adv. -nws X.Smp.4.33, OGI248.39 (Pergam., ii B. C.); f. e)/xein Aristid.1.394J.: Comp. -o/teron Onos.1.24. in bad sense,
foolhardy, -o/tatos pa/ntwn a)nqrw/pwn ei)= D.20.145, cf. Ael.VH12.23, Lib.Ep.14.2. Adv. -nws Luc.DMort. 19.2; diete/qhsan Isoc.8.97.

fi^lo-kissofo/ros, on,
fond of wearing ivy, of Dionysus, E.Cyc.620 (lyr.).

fi^lo-klau/dios, on,
friend of Claudius, IGRom.4.1048, Supp.Epigr.3.740 (both Cos, i A. D.).

fi^lo/-klautos, on,
fond of weeping, u(a/kinqoi Nonn.D.19.188.

fi^lo-kle/arxos, o(,
friend of Clearchus, Plu.Art.13.

fi^lo/-kleia, ta/, festival at Delos,
endowed by Philocles king of Sidon, IG11(2).287 A 57(iii B. C.); i(ero\n *filo/kleion Inscr.Delos 370.39 (iii B. C.); *f., to/ (sc. a)rgu/rion),
fund set up by P., ib.399A124.

fi^lo-knh/mi_s, i_dos, o(, h(,
fond of wearing greaves, fond of arms, Hsch.

fi^lo/-kni^sos, on, (kni/zw)
fond of pinching, prurient, AP11.7 (Nic. or Nicarch.).

fi^lo/-kni_sos, on,
delighting in the savour of banquets, Nonn.D.19.179.

fi^lo-knw/sios, o(,
friend of the Cnossians, SIG527.48 (Crete, iii B. C.).

fi^lo/-koinos, on,
liking to share the common lot, AP9.546 (Antiphil.).
loving the common weal, to\ f. Sch. S.OT669.

fi^lo-ko/lac, a^kos, o(, h(,
fond of flatterers, Arist. EN1159a14, Rh.1371b23, Phld.Herc.1457 Fr.15, Plu.2.49a.

fi^lo-ko/modos, o(,
friend of Commodus, Hdn.1.17.3.

fi^lo/-komos, on,
fond of one's hair, D.Chr.*kom. *)egk. p.386 B.

fi^lo-koni/mwn [i_], o(, h(, gen. onos, (ko/nis)
fond of rolling in the dust, Epich.45 (foinikei/monas cj. Porson).

fi^lo/-kopros, on,
requiring manure, Thphr.HP2.7.1, 6.7.6; zw=|on Gp.12.9.2.

fi^lo-kori/nqios, o(,
loving the Corinthians, Them.Or.27.335d.

fi^lo-kosmi/a, h(,
love of ornament or
show, Plu.Phil.9.

fi^lo-ko/smios, on,
fond of orderly behaviour, ei)s gunai=kas Cat.Cod.Astr.2.171.

fi^lo/-kosmos, on,
loving ornament, Ael.VH12.1; gunh/ Sext.Sent.513, cf.
Cat. Cod.Astr.2.175; f. peri\ ko/mhn Plu.2.976f.

fi^lo/-kouros,
attonsus, Gloss. (sed leg. yilo/kouros).

fi^lo/-kra_ton, to/, name of a
medicine, Gal. 14.161.

fi^lo/-krhmnos, on,
haunting steep rocks, of goatherds, AP 6.221.4 (Leon.).
fi^lo-kri^ne/w, v. fulokrine/w.

fi^lo-kro/ta^los, on,
loving the kro/tala, qume/lai AP9.505.8.

fi^lo/-krotos, on,
loving noise, of Pan, h.Pan.2.

fi^lo-kte/a^nos, on,
loving possessions, greedy of gain, covetous, Il.1.122 (Sup.).
fi^lo-kth/ma^tos, on, = foreg., Ptol.Tetr. 64.

fi^lo-kthmosu/nh, h(,
covetousness, ib.177.
fi^lo-kth/mwn, onos, o(, h(, = filokte/anos, Sol.36.19, Ptol.Tetr.158.

fi^lo-kti/sths, ou, o(,
fond of building, Horap.2.119, Critodem. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).259, Theodos. Gr.p.37G.
fi^lo/-kti^tos, on, = foreg., Nonn.D.40.505.

fi^lo/-ku^bos, on,
fond of dice, Ar.V.75, Arist.Phgn.808a31, Poll.6.167.

fi^lo-ku_dh/s, e/s,
loving glory, glorious, h(/bh, kw=mos, h.Merc.375,481.

fi^lo-ku/maios [u_], on,
friend of the Cymaeans, IGRom.4.1302.32 (Cyme, i B. C./i A. D.).
fi^loku^nhg-e/ths, ou, o(, = filoku/nhgos, X.Cyn.5.14, 12.11.

fi^loku^nhg-i/a, h(,
love of the chase, Stob.2.7.5b11.

fi^loku^/nhg-os, on,
loving the chase, D.S.4.45, Plu.2.310f, Parth.10.1, Palaeph.6, Supp.Epigr.3.499 (Philippi, ii/iii A. D.), etc.; f. e)ne/rgeia Sostrat.4 J.
fi^lo/-ku^nos, f.l. for -kubos in Adam.Phgn.1.9.

fi^lo-ku/rios [u_], o(,
loyal to one's master, of a slave, TAM2.466 (Patara): as pr.n., IG 14.2074 (Rome), etc.

fi^lo/-ku_ros, o(,
friend of Cyrus, Str.11.11.4.

fi^lo-kwqwnisth/s, ou=, o(,
fond of tippling, f.l. for kwqwnisth/s, Ath. 10.433b.

fi^lo/-kwmos, on,
fond of feasting and dancing, epith. of Anacreon,
Simon.183.5; phkti/s AP5.174 (Mel.), cf. Polem.Phgn.13, 67.

fi^lo-kw/mw|dos, on,
loving comedies, title of a work by Dionysiades of Mallos, Suid.
fi^lo/-kwpos, gloss on filh/retmos, Hsch.

fi^lo/-lagnos, on,
fond of sexual intercourse, Hp.Morb.2.51.

fi^lo-la/kwn [a^], wnos, o(, h(,
fond of the Lacedaemonians, Plu.Art.13, etc.; epith. of Cimon, Id.Per.9, Cim.16; name of a Comedy by Stephanus:—also fi^lo-la^kedaimo/nios, on, Them.Or.7.96a.

fi^lo-la^li/a, h(,
talkativeness, Lib.Decl.2.18.

fi^lo/-la^los, on,
fond of talking, D.L.1.92.

fi^lo-la/mpa^dos, on,
loving torches, epith. of Artemis, Hsch.

fi^lo/-la_os, on,
loving the people, title of Asclepius in Laconia, Paus.3.23.9.

fi^lo-lh/i+os, on, Ep. for *filo/leios,
loving booty, h.Merc.335.

fi^lo/-li^qos, on,
fond of precious stones, Plu.2.462d.

fi^lo/-lixnos, on,
loving dainties, lickerish, dainty, AP6.295 (Phan.), 302 (Leon.).

fi^lolog-e/w,
love learning, pursue learning, study, Sopat.6.6, Plu. 2.133b, Cat.Mi.6, Arr.Epict.3.10.10:—Pass., ta\ filologhqe/nta
learned discourses, Plu.2.612e; a(/lis u(pe\r th=s . . tw=n sxhma/twn xrh/sews . . tosau=ta pefilologh=sqai Longin.29.2.

fi^lolog-i/a, h(,
love of argument or
reasoning, Pl.Tht.146a, Phld.Ir.p.18W., Hierocl. in CA 12p.446M.
learned conversation, Antig.Car. ap. Ath.12.548a.
love of learning and literature, eu)trapeli/a kai\ f. Isoc. 15.296, cf. Arist.Pr.18 tit., Cic.Fam.16.21.4, Plu.2.645c, Arr.Epict. 4.4.1.

fi^lo/log-os, on,
fond of words, talkative, oi)=nos filolo/gous poiei= Alex. 284; f. kai\ polu/logos, opp. braxu/logos, of Athens, opp. Sparta, Pl.Lg.641e;
fond of speaking, of Socrates, Id.Phdr.236e.
fond of dialectic, fond of philosophical argument, opp. miso/logos, Id.La. 188c; f. g' ei)= kai\ xrhsto/s Id.Tht.161a; o( filo/sofo/s te kai\ o( f. Id.R.582e, cf. Epicur.Sent.Vat.74, Phld.Lib.p.48 O.
fond of learning and literature, literary, *lakedaimo/nioi . . h(/kista f. o)/ntes Arist.Rh.1398b14; fu/sei *)aqhnai=oi f. Str.2.3.7: opp. logo/filos(lover of reason), Zeno Stoic.1.67; filolo/gw| u(pokatakli/nesqai filomaqh= Plu. 2.618e, cf. 419d; opp. a)pai/deutos, Stob.4.22.107: opp. politiko/s, Plu.Luc.42.
student, scholar, first used by Eratosthenes of himself, Suet.Gramm.10, cf. Str.14.5.15, D.H.Comp.25, Arr.Epict.2.4.1, Gal. Libr.Propr.Prooem.: but filo/logos o( filw=n lo/gous kai\ spouda/zwn peri\ paidei/an: oi( de\ nu=n e)pi\ tou= e)mpei/rou tiqe/asin, ou)k o)rqw=s Phryn. 371. of books,
learned, Cic.Att.13.12.3 (Comp.):
suitable for a literary man, connected with learning, ib.15.15.2. Adv. -lo/gws
learnedly, Poll.4.11, Arg.Ar.Ra. f.
multa, much
learned conversation, Cic.Att.13.52.2.
studious of words, opp. filo/sofos, Plot. ap. Porph.Plot.14, etap.Procl. in Ti.1.86 D., etc. (Freq. written parox. filolo/gos in codd., as Pl.Tht.161a (cod.B), EM406.10: but filo/logos Hdn.Gr.1.233 (from lo/gos, not le/gw).)

fi^lo-loidori/a, h(,
love of abuse, EM463.43.

fi^lo-loi/doros, on,
fond of reviling, abusive, D.18.126, Arist.HA608b10, Pr.875a35, Phgn.808a32, Dionys.Av.1.28. Adv. -rws Poll.3.139, etc.

fi^lo-louste/on,
one must be too fond of bathing, ou) f. Aët.7.50.

fi^lo-loutre/w,
to be fond of bathing, Hp.Acut.68.

fi^lo/-loutros, on,
fond of bathing, ib.66, Arist.HA605a12. of an eye-salve,
suitable for the bath, e)/sti de\ f., o(/qen e)gxri/sas ke/leue lou/esqai Aët.7.102.

fi^lo/-lu_pos, on,
fond of pain, Plu.2.600c.

fi^lo/-lu^ros, on,
lyre-loving, Epich.91.

fi^loma/q-eia [ma^], h(,
love of learning or
knowledge, curiosity, Pl. R.499e, Ti.90b, Arist.EN1117b29; filomaqei/as xa/rin Str.14.1.16: in codd. of Pl.Ti. l.c. and later writers (as Phld.Mort.33, Asp. in EN88.9) freq. -ma^qi/a. -e/w,
to be fond of learning, eager after knowledge, Pl.Lg.810a, Plb.1.13.9, Phld.Mort.38, Corn.ND14; f. peri/ tinos Plb.3.59.4.

fi^lomaq-h/s, e/s,
fond of learning, eager after knowledge, Pl.Phd.67b, 82d, al.; e)a\n h)=|s f., e)/sei polumaqh/s Isoc.1.18: Sup. -e/statos X.Cyr.1.2.1: to\ f., = filoma/qeia, Pl.R.376b, cf. 411d: Adv. -qw=s, e)/xein Ant.Diog.11. c. gen. rei,
eager after, tw=n ei)s to\n po/lemon e)/rgwn X.An.1.9.5 (Sup.).
fi^lomaq-i/a, h(, v. filoma/qeia.

fi^lo-ma^kedw/n, o/nos, o(,
friend of Macedonia, Them.Or.10.132b.

fi^lo-ma/la^kos [ma^], on,
loving effeminacy or
delicacy, Ptol.Tetr.162.

fi^lomant-ei/a, h(,
observance of omens, PMag.Par.1.3243; v. fialomantei/a.

fi^lomant-euth/s, ou=, o(,
one who takes note of divinations or
omens, Pl.Lg.813d.

fi^lo/mant-is, ews, o(, h(,
devoted to oracles, Luc.Cont.11, Astr.27.

fi^lo/mastos, on,
loving the breast, of young animals, A.Ag.142 (lyr.), 719 (lyr.).

fi^loma^x-e/w,
to be fond of fighting, eager to fight, Plu.Pomp.65, Caes.52, Fab.5, etc.; f. pro\s to\n *)anni/ban Id.2.195d: metaph. of argument, ib.122b, etc.

fi/l-ombros [i^], on,
rain-loving, na/rkissos AP5.143 (Mel.):—also fil-o/mbrios, on, of a frog, Pl.Eleg.5.

fi^lo/mbrotos, on,
pleasing to mortals, Max.456, Orph.Fr.280.
fi^lo-meidh/s, e/s, v. filommeidh/s.

fi^lo-meira/kios [a^], on,
fond of boys, Phld.Acad.Ind.p.48 M., D.L.4.40.
fi^lo-mei=rac, a^kos, o(, h(, = foreg., Ath.13.603e: epith. of Artemis, Paus.6.23.8.

fi^lo-memfh/s, e/s,
fond of finding fault, censorious, Democr.109, Plu.2.707a:—irreg. Sup. filomemfo/tatos Id.Comp.Cim.Luc.1.

fi^lo-meta/bolos, on,
fond of change, variable, filometa/bolo/n ti/ e)stin o( ai)w/n S.E.M.1.82.

fi^lo-me/trios, on,
loving moderation, POxy.41.6, al. (iii/iv A. D.).
fi^lomh/dion, to/, = xelido/nion to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.2.180 codd. (fort. filomh/leion).

fi^lo/mhlos, on,
fond of apples or
fruit, Doroth.Hist. ap. Ath.7.276f.

fi^l-o/mhros, on,
fond of Homer, of Alexander, Str.13.1.27; of Cassander, Caryst.8; of Sophocles, Eust.440.38, 851.58.
fi^lo-mh/thr, eros, o(, h(, = filomh/twr, Sammelb.343,5025.

fi^lo-mhto/reios, o( (cf. filomh/twr 11),
member of a deme called after Ptolemy X, OGI169.

fi^lo-mhtori/a, h(,
love of one's mother, PMasp.314 iii 12 (vi A. D.).

fi^lo-mh/twr, oros, o(, h(,
loving one's mother, Ph.1.362, Plu.Sol.27, Lib.Or.1.58, etc.; name of a comedy by Antiph. title of Ptolemy VI of Egypt, OGI103, etc.; of Ptolemy X, ib.168.1, etc. (pl. qeoi\ *f., of Ptol. X and his consort, ib.167, etc.); of Attalus III, ib. 764.39, Plu.TG14: of queen Pythodoris, IG22.3433.

fi^lo-mi/sws [mi_], Adv.
with hearty hatred, Hsch. s.v. filapexqhmo/nws.

fi^lo-mmeidh/s, e/s, poet. for filomeidh/s,
laughter-loving, epith. of Aphrodite, Od.8.362, Il.3.424, Cypr.Fr.5, Hes.Th.989; *glaukono/mh f. ib.256; mh/te f. ma/la gi/gneo Naumach. ap. Stob.4.23.7: of Dionysus, AP9.524.22, in the form filomeidh/s also found in prose, Corn.ND24, Luc.Im.8, Aret.CA 2.3. Cf.sq.

fi^lo-mmhdh/s, e/s, epith. of Aphrodite in Hes.Th.200 (o(/ti mhde/wn e)cefaa/nqh): acc. to Eust.439.36, Hes. here e)k tw=n tou= *kro/nou mhde/wn e)tumologei= as if Boeot.: in later Boeot. (from about iv B. C.) mhd- would be written meid-.

fi^lo/-molpos, on,
loving the dance and song, Pi.N.7.9.

fi^lo-mo/na^xos, on, prob. f.l. for -mono/maxos,
fond of gladiators, or for -maxos,
fond of fighting, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(2).86.

fi^lomous-e/w,
love music, Phld.Mus.pp.17,90 K., Ath.14.633b.

fi^lomous-i/a, h(,
love of music or
of the Muses, Agatharch.7, Str.14.2.21, Plu.2.238b, Luc.DMar.8.2, etc.

fi^lo/mous-os, on,
loving music or
the Muses, delfi=nes Arionl.8, cf. Theoc.14.61: generally,
loving music and the arts, accomplished, Pl.Phdr.259b, R.548e, X.Cyr.5.1.1; mousikoi\ kai\ f. Phld.Mus.p.62 K., etc.; lo/goi f. Ar.Nu.358 (anap.): to\ f., = filomousi/a, Plu.2.984b, etc.

fi^lo-mo/xqhros, on,
loving bad men, Philonid.13.
loving evil, Eustr.in EN16.11.
fond of toil or
labour, v.l. for filo/qhros in Pl.R.535d (ap.Stob.).
fi^lo/-moxqos, on, = filo/ponos, Phalar. Ep.126, Ptol.Tetr.158, Jahresh.23 Beibl.178 (Thrace): neut. pl. as Adv., filo/moxqa Man.4.277.

fi^lomu_q-e/w,
to be fond of legends or
fables, Str.1.2.8, 9.3.11, 10.3.23.

fi^lomu_q-i/a, h(,
love of legends or
fables, Id.11.6.2.

fi^lo/mu_q-os, on,
fond of legends or
fables, o( f. filo/sofo/s pw/s e)stin Arist.Metaph.982b18, cf. Jul.Gal.39b: to\ f., = filomuqi/a, Str.1.2.8, Longin.9.11.
talkative, Arist.EN1117b34, Fr.668 (Comp.).

fi^lo/-mu^ros, on,
loving unguents, Alex.68: to\ f.
fondness for them, Ael.NA16.24.
fi^lo-murtofa^ghko/mos, on, dub. in Lyr. in Philol.80.334.

fi^lo/-mwmos, on,
given to censure, censorious, Pl.Prt.346c, Ptol. Tetr.162, etc.

fi^lo-na/ma^tos [na_], on,
loving water, Orph.H.8.16.
fi^loneik-e/w, fi^loneik-i/a, fi^lo/neik-os, v filonik-e/w, -i/a, -os.

fi^lo/-neos, on,
loving youth or
youths, Luc.Am.24, Hld.7.20; written filo/neios PSI4.340.15 (iii B. C.).

fi^lo-ne/rwn, wnos, o(,
friend of Nero, SIG804.11 (Cos, i A. D.), Herzog
Koische Forschungen 198 (Calymna).

fi^loni_k-e/w,
to be fond of victory, engage in rivalry, be contentious, mostly in bad sense, fronh/mati filonikw=n h)nantiou=to
out of contentiousness, party spirit, Th.5.43 (-neik- codd.), cf. Lys.22.8 (-neik- codd.); filonikou=ntas, a)ll' ou) zhtou=ntas to\ prokei/menon Pl.Grg.457d, cf. R.499e, Lys.33.4 (-neik- codd.); oi(/tines . . nenikhko/tes h)/dh . . ou(/tw filonikou=sin (v.l. -neik-）, w(/ste . . X.HG6.3.16: of the state, f. para\ to\ e)pieike/s Democr.252; f. a)/neu gnw/mhs Thrasym.1.—Constr., abs., v. supr.; f. peri\ paidikw=n pro\s a)llh/lous Lys.3.40 (-neik- codd.); pro\s a)reth/n Pl.Lg.731a; ou) pro/s ge au)to\ tou=to （o(\ add. codd. opt.) filonikou=men, o(/pws . . Id.Phlb.14b; f. peri\ pa/ntwn, peri\ ka/llous, Isoc.2.25, 10.48; a)ristei/wn pe/ri Pl.Lg.935c, cf. D.5.25: simply c. acc., f. to\ e)me\ ei)=nai to\n a)pokrino/menon
to be eager that I should be the answerer, Pl.Prt.360e; the acc. is mostly a neut. Adj., ta\ xei/rw f.
to be so obstinate as to choose the worst, Th.5.111 (-neik- codd.); mhde\n filoni/kei D.20.144 (-neik- codd.); f. o(/pws . . X.Mem.2.3.17: c. inf., f. e)pidei=cai Plu.Pomp.31; e)filoni/khsan (v.l. -neik-） au)tou/s is dub. in Arist.Pol.1306b1. in good sense, a(millw/menoi kai\ f. X. Cyr.1.4.15; peri\ kalli/stwn f. Isoc.4.85; f. o(/pws . . Id.5.113.

fi^loni_k-hdo/n,
certatim, Gloss.

fi^loni_k-i/a, h(,
love of victory, rivalry, contentiousness, mostly in bad sense, f. e(/neka th=s au)ti/ka Th.1.41, cf. 3.82; f. a)no/htos Democr.237; f. h)\ filotimi/as e(/neka Pl.Lg.860d, cf. Alc.1.122c; e)k me/qhs kai\ filoniki/as Lys.3.43; dia\ sta/sin kai\ th
 pro\s a)llh/lous f. Id.33.4; ei)s po/lemon katasta=sai pro\s a)llh/las kai\ f. Isoc.12.158; h( pro\s a)llh/lous e)/ris kai\ f. D.9.14, cf. Pl.Ti.88a; a)lla/ ti/s me f. ei)/lhfen pro\s ta\ ei)rhme/na Id.La. 194a; u(po\ th=s pro\s ta)ma\ e)/rga f. X.Cyr.8.7.12; ou) filoniki/a| ge e)rwtw= Pl.Grg.515b; e)a/n tis filoniki/a| kriqh=| . . dra=n, teqna/tw Id.Lg.938c; ei)s tosou=ton filoniki/as e)lqei=n pro\s th
 po/lin, w(/ste . . Id.Mx.243b; e)ge/neto f. e)n au)toi=s to\ ti/s au)tw=n dokei= ei)=nai mei/zwn Ev.Luc.22.24: pl., f. kai\ filotimi/ai Pl.R.548c, cf. Ti.90b, D.18.246; peri\ o(po/swn a)
 e)gge/nwntai a)nqrw/pois f. X.Cyr.2.1.22; ai( peri\ ta\s xorhgi/as f. Isoc. 7.53; f. kai\ sta/seis Arist.Pol.1308a31. in good sense,
competition, emulation, emulous eagerness, e)/stw tou/twn . . kata\ no/mon a(/milla/ te kai\ f. Pl.Lg.834c; f. au)toi=s e)/mballe X.Cyr.7.1.18; filoniki/as e)mpoiei=n peri\ tw=n kalw=n e)/rgwn ib.8.2.26; f. e)ne/bale pro\s a)llh/lous tisi/ Id.Ages.2.8; esp. in the games, pollh\ f. e)gi/gneto X.An.4.8.27, cf. Lac.4.2; dia\ filoniki/an Id.Hier.9.6; tw=n e)rgatw=n f. pro\s a)llh/lous kai\ filotimi/a Id.Oec.21.10, cf. SIG685.12,36 (Magn. Mae., ii B. C., found in Crete).—On the form filoneiki/a, v. filo/nikos fin.

fi^lo/ni_k-os, on,
fond of victory, contentious. in bad sense, ou)/te du/shris e)w
 ou)/t' w)=n f. a)/gan Pi.O.6.19 (-neik- codd. vett.); f. e)sti pro\s o(\ a)
 o(rmh/sh| Pl.Prt.336e; coupled with filo/timos, Id.R.545a, 582e (v.l. -neik-), cf. 550b; e)pi/ponon kai\ f. kai\ filo/timon . . katasth/sas
to
 bi/on Lys.2.16. in good sense, of spirited horses, X.Eq.9.8 (Sup.): of persons, f. pro\s to\ mh\ e)llei/pesqai Id.Mem.2.6.5, cf. Plu.Ages.2 (Sup.); to\ f., = filoniki/a, e)/sw|zon to\ f. e)n tai=s yuxai=s X.Cyr.7.5.64. Adv. -kws
in eager rivalry, paraqei=n Id.Cyn.6.16; f. e)/xein pro\s a)llh/lous Id.Cyr.3.3.57, 8.4.4; f. e)/xein pro\s to\ ei)de/nai Pl.Grg.505e; opp. a)nqrwpi/nws, D.Ep.3.41. (In codd. the forms filo/nikos, -nike/w, -niki/a and filo/neikos, -neike/w, -neiki/a occur, without any distn. of meaning, e.g. in Isoc. we find peri\ tw=n kalli/stwn e)filoni/khsan 4.85, but ta\s qea\s peri\ tou= ka/llous filoneikou/sas 10.48; mh\ du/seris w)
 . . , mhde\ pro\s pa/ntas filo/nikos 1.31; th=s pro\s h(ma=s filoniki/as 4.19, but filoneiki/a in the same sense, 12.158; filo/ni_kos is implied by Arist.Rh.1389a12 (where -neik-, though found in good codd., as also in 1363b1, 1368b21, 1370b33, Phgn. 809b35, must be f.l.), kai\ filo/timoi me/n ei)si [oi( ne/oi], ma=llon de\

entryFree.foreign: u(peroxh=s ga\r e)piqumei= h( neo/ths: h( de\

div0.entryFree:
ni/kh u(peroxh/ tis, cf. Poll. 1.178, AB315; the compd. of filo- and nei=kos would be *filoneikh/s; the sense
contentious arises naturally from
fond of victory; in SIG 685 (v. filoniki/a sub fin.) we have filoniki/an Il.12,36, and filoniki/a| in OGI335.7 (Pergam., decree of Pitane, ii B. C.); -ni_k- is also found in late documents, as POxy.157.1 (vi A. D.).)

fi^loni_/k-nomos, on,
loving the Jewish law, Supp.Epigr.4.144 (Rome).

fi^loni_k-nose/w,
to be usually sick, Alciphr.2.2.

fi^loni_k-nu/mfios, on,
loving the bridegroom or
bride, AP 10.21 (Phld.).
fi^loni_/k-ceinos, on, poet. for filo/cenos.

fi^loce/neios, on,
invented by Philoxenus, plakou=ntes Ath.1.5d; wrongly written fi^loni_k-ce/nioi in Poll.6.78.

fi^locen-e/w,
entertain hospitably, Phld.Hom.p.63 O., D.S.31.18, Eust.1654.56, EM402.8; f. tina\s xrhstoi=s h)/qesi IPE12.39.22 (Olbia, iii(?) A. D.):—Pass., u(po/ tinos Ant.Diog.3.
love foreign fashions, peri/ ti f. Str.10.3.18.

fi^locen-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
hospitality, IG 12.530, Pl.Lg.953a (pl.), A.R.3.1108, Plb.4.20.1, Ep.Rom.12.13, BMus.Inscr.1061 (Cyrene, ii A. D.), AP9.160, Chor.32.148 p.378.21 F.-R.

fi^locen-iko/s, h/, o/n,
hospitable, Eust.158.37.

fi^lo/cen-os, poet. fi^loce/n-ceinos, on:—
loving strangers, hospitable, Od.6.121, 8.576, al., Pi.O.3.1, N.1.20, X.HG6.1.3, 1 Ep.Ti.3.2, etc.; paqei=n filo/cenon e)/rgon to meet with an act
of hospitality, Pi.I.2.24; to\ ei)=nai f. Arist.VV1250b34, cf. 1251b35; filo/cen' e)sti\n (sc. ta\ dw/mata） *ai)gi/sqou diai/ A.Ch.656: Sup. -w/tatos Id.Fr.196, Cratin.1.2; -e/statos E.Fr.879. Adv. -nws Isoc.4.41.

fi^locenofw=n, w=ntos, o(,
fond of Xenophon, Hdn.Gr.1.40.

fi^l-ocu/tonos [u^], on,
usually oxytone, proqe/seis Eust.72.39.
fi^lo/-oinos, on, poet. for fi/loinos, AP5.260 (Agath.).

fi^lo-pa^qh/s, e/s,
devoted to one's passions, sensual, Ph.1.85, al.

fi^lo-paigmosu/nh, h(,
love of play or
sport, Poll.5.161.

fi^lo-pai/gmwn, on, gen. onos, (pai/zw)
fond of play, sportive, o)rxhqmo/s Od.23.134; o)rxhsth=res Hes.Fr.198, cf. Ar.Ra.333 (lyr.), Them.Or.24.301c, Lib.Decl.30.68: of the lion, pro\s ta\ su/ntrofa kai\ sunh/qh sfo/dra f. Arist.HA629b11: epith. of Pan, BCH50.240 (Thasos, iii/ii B. C.). The more Att. form filopai/smwn occurs in Pl.R.452e, Cra.406c; cf. Poll.5.161. Adv. -mo/nws ibid.

fi^lo-pai/gnios, on,
fond of toys, Vett.Val.3.25.

fi^lopaid-ei/a, h(,
love of boys, Plu.2.1073c.

fi^lopaid-i/a, h(,
love of one's children, Sch.Il.3.259.
fi^lopai/kths, ou, o(, = filopai/gmwn, Vett.Val.75.6, Poll.5.161; also filopai/sths, ibid.

fi^lo/-pais, paidos, o(, h(,
loving boys, Pl.R.474d, Theoc.12.29, Phld. Acad.Ind.p.48 M.; f. xe/lus
singing the love of boys, Simon.183.6; f. no/sos Call.Epigr.47.6.
loving one's children, Aristaenet.1.13, IG12(5).292.7 (Paros), Jul.Ep.89b; xelidw/n AP10.16 (Theaet.). f. no/moi laws
which favour children, Luc.Abd.18, 19. = pra/sion, Plin.HN20.241, Ps.-Dsc.3.105.
fi^lo-pai/smwn, v. filopai/gmwn.
fi^lo-pai/sths, ou, o(, = filopai/gmwn, Poll.5.161, Ael. NA4.34, 5.39, Suid. s.v. *qeo/pompos . . kwmiko/s.

fi^lo-pa/laistros [pa^], on,
loving the palaestra, Vett.Val.43.17, 201.27, Rhetor. in
Cat.Cod. Astr.8(4).214, Critodem. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).259, Hsch. s.v. file/yios.

fi^lo-pa/nnu^xos, on,
friend of all-night festivals, AP5.122 (Phld.), Orph.H.3.5.

fi^lo/-pappos, o(,
loving one's grandfather, title of Antiochus of Commagene, IG22.3451; -pappoi qeoi/
loving their grandparents, title of Ptolemy XI and Tryphaena, Bull.Inst.Ég.1912.176.

fi^lo-para/bolos, on,
fond of daring, venturous, Plu.Phil.9; f. qerapei/a
heroic treatment, Asclep. ap. Cael.Aur.CP1.15.

fi^lo-pa/rqenos, on,
loving virgins, Ach.Tat.8.13, Nonn.D.14.66, al.; as name of a horse, Mélanges Beyrouth 15.111 (Beyrout).
loving virginity, Nonn.D.2.122, al.

fi^lo-parrhsiasth/s, ou=, o(,
lover of frankness, Phld.Lib.p.56 O.

fi^lo-pa/rugros, on,
loving damp, filogew/rgous kai\ f. Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).167.
fi^lo-pa/thr [a^], eros, o(, h(, = filopa/twr, Sammelb.343.14.

fi^lo-patri/a, h(,
love of one's country, patriotism, Ar.V.1465(lyr.).
