burning, Thphr.Ign.69; opp. ph=cis, Iamb. Myst.1.18.
burning heat, inflammation, Th.2.49, Ph.2.101, Gal.7.853, Procop.Pers.2.22.
warming, heating, balanei/wn Them.Or.4.61c (pl.).
flog-w/y, o(, h(, = flogwpo/s, a)ntolai/ A.Pr.791.

flo/h, h(, = xlo/h,
viriditas, Gloss.
floi/ac, a_kos, o(, f.l. for flu/ac (q.v.).

floide/w, floidia/w,
seethe, floidou/menos Lyc.35: but part. pf. pefloidw/s: to\n floio\n a)pobalw/n, Hsch. Cf. fluda/w.

floi/+zomai, (floio/s) Pass.,
have the bark stripped off, Thphr.HP 3.16.3, 5.4.6, 5.9.5, [Gal.] 14.393.

flo/i+nos, h, on,
made from the plant flo/os 11, = fle/ws, e)sqh/s floi/+nh garments
thereof, Hdt.3.98; f. h(ni/ai E.Fr.284; spuri/s, yi/aqos, Poll.10.178.

floio-ba^rh/s, e/s,
heavy with bark, Sch.Il.13.390, Eust.939.5 floio-rra^ge/w,
have the bark burst, Dsc.4.181.

floio-rra^gh/s, e/s,
with the bark or
rind burst, Thphr.HP4.15.2, CP3.18.3, Dsc.1.13.

floio/-rrizos, on,
having roots covered with coats of rind: ta\ f.
bulbous plants, Thphr. Od.63.

floio/s, o(, (fle/w)
bark of trees, esp.
smooth bark (such as one can cut one's name on, Theoc.18.47, Call.Fr.101), Il.1.237, Emp.81, Hdt.4.67, X.Cyn.9.18, Thphr.HP1.5.2, Sor.1.62; eaten in famine, Plb.7.1.3, Plu.Ant.17: pl., Call.l.c., Str.11.8.7, 15.1.60.
husk or
skin of certain fruits, Plu.2.684a, Aët.12.1.
membrane enclosing the eggs of certain animals, Arist. HA558a28.
tissue from which spiders spin their webs, ib.623a32. metaph., of
superficial or
useless coverings, redundancy, o( *lakwniko\s lo/gos ou)k e)/xei floio/n Plu.2.510f; fwnh\n . . floiou= mesth/n Crantorap. D.L.4.27; gumno\s tw=n floiw=n stripped of all
outsides, M.Ant.12.2, 8; peri\ to\n f. a)sxolei=sqai Luc.Herm.79.

floio/w,
change into bark, Nonn.D.36.310.

floi=sbos, o(,
any confused roaring noise, in Hom. of
the noise of battle, Il.5.322, 469, 10.416 (never in Od.): to\n me\n a)/r' e)k floi/sbou . . r(u/santo Euph.23; of the sea, po/ntou perw=sa floi=sbon A.Pr.792, cf. S.Fr.479, Hymn.Is.166; floi/sbwn di/nais Lyc.379; i)luo/eis f. Opp. H.1.777.—Poet. word.

flo-i+smo/s, o(,
stripping off the rind, peeling, Thphr.HP5.1.1.

flo-i+stiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for peeling off the rind, floi+stikh\ futw=n (sc. h( te/xnh)
the art of stripping the inner bark of trees, for making mats, etc., Pl.Plt.288d, cf. Poll.7.209.

floi/w, (fle/w)
burst out, swell, be in full vigour or
bloom, Antim. 36, cf. Plu.2.683f.

floi-w/dhs, es,
like rind or
bast, Arist.HA554b27, Thphr.HP1.6.7, 5.5.2, Dsc.1.23, Plu.2.640e, etc. metaph.,
showy, superficial, Longin.3.2; to\ sobaro\n kai\ f. Plu.2.81b.

floi-w=tis, idos, h(,
made of rind, rind-covered, ske/ph Lyc.1422.

flokti/s, i/dos, h(, = flukti/s, Lat.
papula, pustula, Gloss.

flomi/s, i/dos, h(,
phlome, Phlomis samia, Dsc.4.103 (three kinds distd., one used for lamp-wicks, f. luxni=tis, qrualli/s, ibid.), cf. Plin.HN25.121.

flo/mos, h( （o( Dsc.1.28),
mullein. Verbascum sinuatum, Cratin.325 (lyr.), Eup.14.5 (anap.), Thphr.HP9.12.3, Dsc.4.103 (who distinguishes four kinds, incl. f. a)gri/a
sage of Jerusalem, Phlomis fruticosa); f. o( steno/fullos, distd. fr. f. *)idai=os ( = e(le/nion), Dsc.1.28; cf. plo/mos. f. *)iondai/a, = o)cula/paqon to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.2.114.

flomw/dhs, es,
like mullein, Hsch. s.v. ai)qiopi/s, prob. for flogmw/dhs in Gal.19.152.
floni/s, i/dos, h(, = foli/s, lepi/s, Hsch., cj. in Emp.82.

floni=tis, idos, h(, = o)/nosma,
golden drop, Onosma echioides, Ps.-Dsc.3.131.
flo/nos, o(, = flo/mos, Ps.-Dsc.4.103.

flo/c, h(, gen. flogo/s: (fle/gw):—
flame of fire, Od.24.71, etc.; deinh\ de\ flo\c w)=rto qeei/ou kaiome/noio Il.8.135; th=s de\ [nho\s] kat' a)sbe/sth ke/xuto flo/c 16.123; kata\ pu=r e)ka/h kai\ flo\c e)mara/nqh 9.212; more fully, flo\c *(hfai/stoio Il.17.88, Od. l.c.; puro/s Pi.P.4.225, E.Ba.8, Heracl.914 (lyr.), Pl.Ti.83b, etc. (but also flogo\s ai)qe/rion pu=r Parm.8.56); flogo\s spe/rma, of live charcoal, Pi.O.7.48; a)naiqu/ssein, qu/ein, E.Tr.344, IT1331; e)gei/rein, parakalei=n, X. Smp.2.24, Cyr.7.5.23; e)mbalei=n tini E.Alc.4, Rh.120; sbe/sai Th.2.77; f. a)pe/ssuto Hes.Th.859; a)porre/ousa Pl.Ti.67c; flogo\s a)posbesqei/shs ib.58c: later in pl.,
flames, meteors, Arist.Mete.341b2, Mu.392b3, 400a30, Orph.L.178, Nic.Fr.74.48.
fire as an element, flogo\s ai)=sa Parm.12.2; f. i(la/eira Emp.85. of other kinds of
flame, f. kerauni/a, ou)rani/a, of lightning, A.Pr.1017, E.Med. 144 (anap.); of the
heat of the sun, A.Pr.22, Pers.505, S.Tr.696;
flash of a miraculous cloud, Il.18.206; of precious stones, yuxra\ f. Pi.Fr. 123.5; the
blade of a sword, LXX Jd.3.22, Aq., Thd.1 Ki.17.7. in similes and metaphors, flogi\ ei)/kelos, i)=sos, of
fiery warriors, Il.13.330, 39; f. oi)/nou
the fiery strength of wine, E.Alc.758; f. ph/matos S.OT166 (lyr.).
wallflower, Cheiranthus Cheiri, Thphr.HP6.6.2.

flo/os, o(, metaplast. acc. flo/a Nic.Al.302: contr. flou=s PCair.Zen. 229.10 (iii B. C.), BGU1122.17,20 (i B. C.), v.l. in Dsc.3.147: (fle/w):— rarer form of floio/s, parqe/nio/s moi e)/pi f., of a tree, AP9.706 (Antip.), cf. PCair.Zen. l.c. (iii B. C.). the human
skin, Nic. l.c.; also of the
slough of serpents, Id.Th.355,392. flous, Ion. for fle/ws, Hdt.3.98.
bloom of a plant, Arat.335, cf. Plu.2.683f.

flo/ros, o(, a bird, either
bee-eater or
golden oriole, Suid.; written flw=ros in Sch.Opp.H.1.157.
floua/zw, = fluare/w, Hsch.
flou/dion, to/, Dim. of flo/os, flou=s, Gloss., Zonar.
floumariko/s, h/, o/n, = ploumariko/s, PSI9.1082.14 (iv A. D.).
flou=s, v. flo/os 11.
flu=, a sound made by certain shellfish, Sch.rec.A.Pr.504.

flu^a_ko-gra^fi/a, h(,
composition of flu/akes, Suid. s.v. *(ri/nqwn.

flu^a_ko-gra/fos [gra^], o(,
writer of flu/akes, Ath.3.86a, al.

flu/ac [u^], a_kos, o(, = i(larotragw|di/a,
tragic burlesque, invented by Rhinthon, flu/a_kes tragikoi/ AP7.414 (Noss.). of persons,
jester, St.Byz. s.v. *ta/ras, Poll.9.149, Eust.884.26 (ubi floi/akes).

flu^a_r-e/w, Ion. flu^hre/w:—
talk nonsense, play the fool, tau=ta le/gousi fluhre/ontes Hdt.2.131, cf.7.104, Ar.Eq.545 (anap.), V.85, Pl. 360, 575 (anap.); pau=sai fluarw=n Philem.213.1 (troch.); fluarei=s pro/s me Men.Pk.146; ou) fluarw= (parenthetically) 'no joke', 'seriously', ib.153: c. acc. cogn., fa/skonta . . a)erobatei=n kai\ a)/llhn pollh\n fluari/an fluarou=nta Pl.Ap.19c; polla\ fluhre/eis Hdt.7.103; tau=ta f. Isoc.5.75; toiau=ta Pl.R.337b; a)/fes a)\ fluarei=s tau=ta Men.Sam.313. c. part., ou) mh\ fluarh/seis e)/xwn Ar.Ra.202; fluarei=s e)/xwn Pl.Grg. 490e; e)/xwn f. Id.Euthd.295c; *ai)sxu/los f. fa/skwn Id.Smp.180a; *derkuli/das f. diatri/bwn X.HG3.1.18. trans.,
prate against, h(ma=s 3 Ep.Jo.10:—Pass., fluarhqe/ntes kai\ katakertomhqe/ntes Ph.2.599;
to be made a fool of, D.L.7.173.

flu^a_/r-hma, atos, to/,
nonsense, futility, in pl., D.H.Comp.18, Ph.2.495, J.Ap.2.9.

flu^a_r-i/a, h(,
nonsense, foolery, in word or deed, Timocr.10, Ar.Lys.159, Pl.Tht.162a, etc.; paidia\ kai\ f. Id.Cri.46d; kapno\s ka f. Id.R.581d; xrwma/twn kai\ a)/llhs pollh=s f. qnhth=s Id.Smp.211e, cf. Phd.66c: f. kai\ lh=ros Com.Adesp.5.7 D.: freq. in pl.,
fooleries, lh=ooi kai\ f. Pl.Hp.Ma.304b; ei)/te lhrh/mata . . ,
ei)/te fluari/as Id.Grg.486c; peri\ siti/a kai\ pota\ kai\ i)atrou\s kai\ f. ib. 490c, cf. 519a; a)/nhqa kai\ se/lina kai\ f. Eub.36.
flu^a_ro-gra^fe/w, confused with *fluakografe/w by Sch.Nic.Al. 214.

flu^a_ro-kope/w,
talk folly, Zonar. s.v. *sagga/rios.

flu^a_ro-kopi/a, h(,
tomfoolery, Id. s.v. *paia/n.
flu^a_ro-loge/w, = fluare/w, Sch.Ar.Nu. 1009.
flu^a_ro-logi/a, h(, = fluari/a, Pl.Ax.369d.

flu/a_r-os [u^], o(,
silly talk, foolery, nonsense, ta)/lla pa/nt' e)sti\ f. Ar.Nu.365 (anap.), cf. Men.541.2, Pl.Ax.365e, Plu.Cic.2, etc.: pl.,
fooleries, pollw=n flua/rwn kai\ taw(=n a)nta/cia Stratt.27.
tattler, babbler, Pl.Ax.369a, 1 Ep.Ti.5.13, Str.1.2.5, etc.: as Adj., h( f. filosofi/a LXX 4 Ma.5.10; f. lo/gos D.H.Comp.26; f. glw=tta Alciphr.3.69: Comp. fluaro/teros Arr.Epict.2.19.10. Adv. flua/rws Sch.Ar.V. 855.

flua_r-w/dhs, es,
foolish, Plu.Lyc.6, Id.2.615a; r(h=ma Porph.Chr.61.
flua/ssw, = fluare/w, Hsch.; cf. floua/zw.

flu^da^ro/s, a/, o/n,
soft, flabby, Hp. ap. Gal.19.152.

flu^da/w,
have an excess of moisture, become soft or
flabby, Hp. Morb.Sacr.13 (cf Erot., Gal.19.152), Ep.19 (Hermes53.70); cf. floide/w, floidia/w.
fluza/kion, to/, Dim. of flu/ktaina, Hp.Coac.112, Acut.（Sp.) 26, Cels.5.28.15; cf. fusa/kia.
fluzogra/fos [a^], on, = fluarografw=n, Sch.Nic.Al.214.
flu/zw, v. flu/w.

flu/ktain-a, h(,
blister made by a burn, Hp.VM16, Thphr.Ign.57; IG42(1).126.25 (Epid., ii A. D.), Luc.DMort.20.4;
blister caused by rowing, Ar.V.1119 (troch.), Ra.236(lyr.); e)c ai(/matos f. blood-
blister, Id.Ec.1057; caused by the bite of the mugalh=, Arist.HA604b20.
pustule, Hp.Prog.17, Th.2.49.
fluktain-i/dion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Hp.Epid.1.26.q/, Diocl.Fr.82.
fluktain-i/s, i/dos, h(, = foreg., Hp. Int. 1, Epid.2.1.1, Diocl.Fr.82.

fluktainoeidh/s, e/s,
blister like, Hp.Mul.2.116.

fluktain-o/w,
cause blisters on or
in, to\ sto/ma Dsc.2.173, cf. Archig. ap. Gal.12.406:—Pass.,
have blisters, Hp.Coac.479, Dsc.1.101.
fluktain-w/dhs, es, = fluktainoeidh/s, Philum.Ven.17.1, Orib.Fr. 105.

fluktai/n-wsis, ews, h(,
blistering, Hp.Fract.21, Dsc.Eup.2.8, Gal.14.163.

flukti/s, i/dos (but acc. pl. flu/kteis Dsc.2.101), h(, = flu/ktaina, Thphr.Ign.39;
boil, LXX Ex.9.9, Gal.13.357.

flu/os [u^], eos, to/, = flu/aros,
idle talk, foolery, Archil.197.

flu/sis [u^], ews, h(,
breaking out, eruption, Hp. ap. Gal.19.152.

flu/w [u_. cf. e)piflu/w] and flu/zw, aor. 1 e)/flu^sa v. infr. 11: (fle/w):—
boil over, bubble up: hence,
burst out, e)n th=|si fluzou/sh|si ai(morragi/h|si (Foes for sfu/zousi ai(morrage/si) Hp.Epid.2.3.14, cf. Hsch., Suid.; flu/w expld. by polukarpe/w, Ael.VH3.41. metaph.,
overflow with words, babble, ma/thn flu/sai A.Pr.504; gra/mmata e)p' a)spi/dos flu/onta Id.Th.661: c.acc. cogn., fh/mhn stugerh\n e)/flu^sen AP7.351 (Diosc.); e)/flu^se v.l. for e)/bluse, ib.352 (Mel.(?)); mani/hs u(/po muri/a flu/zein Nic.Al.214; flu/ont' a)nqhrh=| su\n kakodaimoni/h| prob. in Alex.Aet.5.8:—Med. or Pass., flu/etai, = u(grai/netai, Hp. ap.Gal.19.152.

fnei/, Comic imitation of the sound
phn, Luc.Lex.19; expressing the note of a bird, Ar.Fr.885.
fo/a, ta/, = e)canqh/mata, Hsch.

fober-i/zw,
terrify, scare, LXXNe.6.9, al.:—Pass., Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).194.

fober-ismo/s, o(,
a terrifying, LXXPs.87 (88).17 (pl.).
fobero-diakra/tores [kra^], oi(, variant for fobodia/ktores (q.v.), PMag.Par.1.1357.

fobero-eidh/s, e/s,
terrible to behold, LXX 3.Ma.6.18.

fobero-poie/w,
make formidable, Onos.14 1.

fobero/s, a/, o/n, (fo/bos)
fearful, whether Act. or Pass.: Act.,
causing fear, terrible, xrhsth/ria f. Hdt.7.139, cf.A.Pr.127 (anap.), Th. 78 (lyr.), etc.; o(/milos plh/qei -w/tatos
formidable only from numbers, Th.2.98 (but ta\ tw=| plh/qei f. things which are
fearful to the multitude, Isoc.1.7, cf. Pl.Phd.67e): c. inf., f. i)dei=n, f. proside/sqai,
fearful to behold, A.Pers.27 (anap.), 48 (anap.); f. ei)sidei=n E.Ph.127 (lyr.); f. prospolemh=sai D.2.22; f. *poludeu/kea pu\c e)reqi/zein Theoc. 22.2.
regarded with fear, esp. with respect to consequences, ou)/te o(/rkos f. Th.3.83; i(/ppos f. mh\ a)nh/kesto/n ti poih/sh| a horse
that makes one fear he will do some mischief, X.Hier.6.15; semno/teros ei)=nai kai\ foberw/teros dokei= And.4.18; foberoi\ h)=san mh\ poih/seian X. An.5.7.2; toi=s polemi/ois foberw/teroi Id.Eq.Mag.4.11, cf. Ages.11.10 (Sup.): trih/rhs fobero\n polemi/ois Id.Oec.8.8; to\ pro\ tw=n luphrw=n [prosdo/khma] f. Pl.Phlb.32c; foberw/taton e)rhmi/a X.An.2.5.9; to\ f.
terror, danger, Id.Lac.9.1; tw=n foberw=n o)/ntwn th=| po/lei gene/sqai the things which were
dreaded as like ly to happen . . , Id.HG1.4.17; fobero/n [e)sti] mh\ . . there is
reason to dread that . . , Id.Hier.1.12, cf. Cyr.7.5.22; a)gge/llesqai e)pi\ to\ foberw/taton to be
fearfully exaggerated, D.H.1.57. Rhet., of style,
impressive, awe-inspiring, to\ ka/llos to\ *qoukudi/dou f. Id.Pomp.3; to\ f. Id.Lys.13; *(/omhros pai/zwn -w/teros Demetr.Eloc.130. Pass.,
afraid, timid, e)kte/tamai fobera\n fre/na S.OT153 (lyr.), cf.Alc.97, Pherecr.245; o)/mma E.IA620: opp. qarsale/os, Th.2.3, X.Cyr.3.3 19（Comp.); f. th\n yuxh/n Id.Oec.7.25; skopei=n ei) foberoi/ (sc. oi( pw=loi) Pl.R.413d; f. poiei=n tina Id.Lg.647c; f. ei)s to\ tolma=n ib.649d.
caused by fear, troubled, panic, a)naxw/rhsis Th.4.128; fobera\ o)/ssois o(mi/xla prosh=|ce A.Pr.144 (lyr.); f. fronti/des
anxious thoughts, Pl.Thg.127b. Adv. -rw=s
threateningly, in a terrifying manner, Lys.24.15, cf. LXX3 Ma.5.45, etc.: Comp., -w/teron fqe/ggesqai X.Smp.1.10: Sup., -w/tata i)dei=n Id.Cyr.8.3.5.
timidly, -w/tata e)/xein Id.Eq.Mag.8.20.

fobero-o/ths, htos, h(,
terribleness, Arist.Rh.1361b12, J.BJ7.8.3.

fobero-wpo/s, o/n,
terribie of aspect, Orph.Fr. 58.2.
fobero-w/y, w=pos, o(, h(, = foreg., Id.H.70.10.

fobesistra/th [a^], h(,
scarer of hosts, epith. of Athena, Ar.Eq.1177.
fobe/stra^tos, on, = foreg., ai)gi/s, of Athena, Hes.Th.ap.Chrysipp.Stoic.2.257, cf. EM797.54.

fobe/w, 3pl. imper. fobeo/ntwn Hdt.7.235: Ion. impf. fobe/eskon Hes.Sc.162: fut. -h/sw E.Heracl.357 (lyr.), (e)k-) Th.4.126 (dub.): aor. e)fo/bhsa Il.15.15, etc.:—Pass. and Med., Ion. 2 sing. fobe/ai Hdt.1.39; Ion. imper. fobeu= or fobe/o, Id.1.9, 7.52: Ep. 3pl. impf. fobe/onto Il.6.41: fut. fobh/somai 22.250, Pl.Lg.649c, D.15.23, etc.; fobhqh/somai X.Cyr.3.3.30, Plu.Brut.40, Luc.Zeux.9, v.l. in Pl.R. 470a: aor. Pass. e)fobh/qhn Hdt.8.27, etc., Ep. 3pl. e)fo/bhqen or fo/bhqen, Il.15.326,5.498; aor. Med. e)fobhsa/mhn only Anacreont.31.11: pf. pefo/bhmai Il.10.510, etc.: plpf. 3pl. e)pefo/bhnto X.HG7.4.32, Th.5.50, Ep. pefobh/ato Il.21.206. Act., in Hom. (never in Od.) always in the sense
put to flight, [i)/rhc] e)fo/bhse koloiou/s Il.16.583; [*zeu\s] kai\ a)/lkimon a)/ndra fobei= ib. 689; *trw/wn ou(\s e)fo/bhsas 22.11; fobh=sai/te sti/xas a)ndrw=n 17.505; so\s do/los . . e)fo/bhse de\ laou/s 15.15; se/ ge/ fhmi . . douri\ fobh=sai 20.187; once in Hes., fobe/eskon e)pi\ xqoni\ fu=l' a)nqrw/pwn l.c.
terrify, alarm, Hdt.7.235, etc.; mh\ fi/lous fo/bei A.Th.262; w(=| mh/ 'sti drw=nti ta/rbos ou)d' e)/pos fobei= S.OT296, cf. 1013, E.Hipp.572 (lyr.); h( du/namis tw=n ne/wn fobou=sa/ tinas Antipho 4.3.2; ai( ka/mhloi e)fo/boun tous i(/ppous X.Cyr.7.1.48; ro\n *)alkibia/dhn e)fo/boun, mh\ . . e)paga/gwntai Th.5.45; c. dat.modi, lo/gois A.Pers.215 (troch.); megalhgori/aisi fre/nas E.Heracl. 357 (lyr.); tw=| me\n *tissafe/rnei tou\s *)aqhnai/ous f., e)kei/nois de\ to\n *tissafe/rnhn
to frighten the Athenians with T., and T. with the Athenians, Th.8.82; c. part., le/gontes f. tina/s
by saying, X.Eq.Mag.1.8; le/gontes w(s h(/cei basileu/s D 14.25: abs., po/nos o( mh\ fobw=n kra/tistos S.Ph.864 (lyr.), fobh/santes katesth/santo th\n politei/an
by terror, Pl.R.551b. c.acc. rei,
threaten with, f. limo/n D.H.6.51. Pass. and Med., in Hom. always in the sense
to be put to flight (cf. Sch.A Il.5.223, al.), once in Od., ku/nes . . dia\ staqmoi=o fo/bhqen 16.163; freq. in Il., u(pe/meinan a)olle/es ou)de\ fo/bhqen 5.498; toi\ d' e)fo/bhqen . . qespesi/w| o(ma/dw| 16.294; ka\m me/sson pedi/on fobe/onto bo/es w(\s a(/s te le/wn e)fo/bhse 11.172; also part., mh\ kai\ pefobhme/nos e)/lqhs 10.510, cf. 15.4, 21.606; fobhqei\s du/seq' a(lo\s kata\ ku=ma
in flight, 6.135; bh= de\ fobhqei/s 22.137: u(po/ tinos fobe/esqai
to flee before him, 8.149; u(po/ tini 15.637; c. acc., ou)/ s' e)/ti . . fobh/somai w(s to\ pa/ros per 22.250.
to be seized with fear, be affrighted, Hdt. 9.70, E.Tr.1166, etc.—Constr., abs., pefo/bhmai pthnh=s w(s o)/mma pelei/as S.Aj.139 (anap.); fobhqe/ntes w)/|xonto feu/gontes flying
in terror, Aeschin.1.43; a(\ mh\ oi)=da . . ou)de/pote fobh/somai ou)de\ feu/comai, Pl.Ap.29b, etc.: c. dat. instrum., ma/stigi f. E.Rh.37 (anap.): c. acc. cogn., f. ai)sxrou\s fo/bous Pl.Prt.360b; e)fobh/qhsan fo/bon me/gan Ev.Marc.4.41; to\n fo/bon au)tw=n mh\ fobhqh=te 1 Ep.Pet.3.14. folld. by Preps., f. a)po/ tinos
to be afraid of one (prob. a Hebraism), LXXLe.26.2, Je.1.8, Ev.Matt.10.28, Ev.Luc.12.4; e)/k tinos
from some cause, S.Tr.671; ei)/s ti
to be alarmed at a thing, Id.OT980; pro/s ti Id.Tr.1211, Luc.Prom.Es4, Lib.Or.50.18; e)pi/ tini
fear for . . Luc. DMar.14.4; but f. a)mfi\ gunaiki/
fear about . . , Hdt.6.62; peri\ h(mw=n X. Cyr.5.2.35, etc.; peri/ tini Pl.Euthd.275b (peri\ sfi/sin au)toi=s to\ kata/dhlon Th.4.123); peri\ xwri/w| Id.2.90; u(pe\r tw=n mello/ntwn And.4.36; peri/ ti Pl.Cra.404e; pro\s a)ndro\s h)\ te/knwn S.Tr.150. folld. by a relat. clause, fobei_sqai mh\ . .
fear lest a thing will be . . , E.Or.770 (troch.), Ar.Pax606 (troch.), Th.1.95, etc.; f. o(/pws mh\ . . Id.6.13, X.Mem.2.9.3; f. mh\ ou) . . Id.Oec.16.6; freq. c.acc. folld. by mh/, tau=t' ou)=n fobou=mai, mh\ . . S.Tr.550, cf. X.An.7.1.2; f. tou\s ou)si/an kekthme/nous, mh\ . . Pl.Phdr. 232c, cf. Th.1.88, etc.; f. u(pe/r tinos, mh\ . . Pl.R.387c; c. inf. folld. by mh/, foboi/mhn a)\n tw=| h(gemo/ni e(/pesqai, mh\ a)ga/gh| ktl. X.An.1.3.17, cf. Pl.Tht.143e, Grg.457e: also f. o(/ti . . , = f. mh\ . . , in a more positive sense, X.Cyr.3.1.1, D.C.52.26; f. to/de, o(/ti . . Th.7.67 (but f. to\ ka/esqai, o(/ti a)lgeino/n because . . , Pl.Grg.479a): dia\ tou=to f. tinas, o(/ti . . lsoc.6.60; less freq. f. w(s . . X.Cyr.5.2.12; f. pw=s xrh\ . . ib.4.5.19; f. ei) deh/sei . . ib.6.1.17. c. inf. with Art., f. to\ a)poqnh/|skein Pl.Grg.522e, etc.: more freq. c. inf. alone,
fear to do,
be afraid of doing, A.Ch.46 (lyr.), S.Aj.253 (lyr.), E.Ion628, etc.: c. inf. fut., Th. 5.105. c. acc. pers.,
stand in awe of, dread, dai/monas tou\s e)nqa/de A.Supp.893; strato\n *)axaiw=n S.Ph.1250; tou\s a)/nw qeou/s Pl.Lg. 927b, cf. Isoc.1.16, etc.; ta\s ku/nas X.Cyn.5.16, etc. c. acc. rei,
fear or
fear about a thing, bro/mon A.Th.476; to\ prose/rpon S.Aj.227 (lyr.); me/myin E.Alc.1057; to\ toiou=ton sw=ma Pl.Phdr.239d; doulei/an kai\ desmo/n X.Cyr.3.1.24. c. gen., pefobhme/nos nukto/s, qala/sshs, Arat.290, 766. c. part., prodidou\s fobhqei/s Lycurg.17.

fo/bh, h(,
lock or
curl of hair, Sapph.78 (pl.), A.Ch.188; bostru/xwn a)/kras fo/bas S.El.449, cf. OC1465 (lyr.); drako/ntwn fo/bai, i.e. the Gorgon's snaky
locks, Pi.P.10.47.
mane of a horse, S.Fr. 659.7, 10, E.Alc.429, Ba.1188 (lyr.). metaph.,
leafage, foliage, S.Ant.419, E.Alc.172, Ba.684, etc.; i)/wn fo/bai
tufts of violets, Pi.Fr.75.18; a)nqru/skou Cratin.98.6 (lyr.); eu)pe/taloi fo/bai AP6.158 (Sabin.); of
the plumy heads of reed, Thphr.HP8.3.4, cf. 4.4.10.

fo/b-hma, atos, to/,
cause of terror, e)gxe/wn f. dai/+wn
to them, S.OC 699 (lyr.), cf. Aq.De.4.34.

fob-hte/on,
one must fear, Pl.R.452b, Lg. 891a, etc. fobhte/os, a. on,
to be feared, ib.746e.

fob-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
fearful, timid, Arist.Pol.1342a12.

fob-hto/s, h/, o/n,
to be feared, tini S.Ph. 1154 (lyr.).

fo/b-htron, to/,
scarecrow, bugbear, terror, LXXIs.19.17: elsewh. always in pl.
terrors, Hp.Morb.Sacr.1 (s.v.l.), Pl.Ax.367a, Ev.Luc.21.11; *tisifo/nhs ta\ f., prob.
tragic masks of the Furies, AP11.189 (Lucill.).

fob-i/zw,
terrify, scare, Delph.3(2).129 (i B. C.).
fobo-dia/ktores, oi(, name of demons, PMag.Lond.121.354; cf. foberodiakra/tores.

fobo/-diyos, on, = u(drofo/bos,
like one bitten by a mad
dog, Cael.Aur.CP3.9.

fobo-eidh/s, e/s,
fearful, Pempel. ap. Stob.4.25.52.
fobo-qei+/a, h(, = deisidaimoni/a, Hsch.

fobo-poie/w,
cause fear, Sch.Hes.Op.1.

fo/bos, o(, (fe/bomai)
panic flight, the usual sense in Hom., cf. Sch. Il.11.71 (but cf. fu/za, fo/bou kruo/entos e(tai/rh Il.9.2); once in Od., oi( d' e)/sxonto fo/bou 24.57; freq. in Il., *danaw=n ge/neto i)axh/ te f. te 15.396; prw=tos *phne/lews . . h)=rxe fo/boio 17.597; e)s fo/bon a)ndrw=n 15.310; fo/bonde = fu/gade, e(sta/menai kraterw=s, mhde\ trwpa=sqe fo/bonde ib.666; fo/bond' e)/xe mw/nuxas i(/ppous 8.139; mh/ ti fo/bond' a)go/reue counsel not
to flight, 5.252; a)i/+canta fo/bonde 17.579; w)=rsan fo/bon *danaoi=s B.12.145. *fo/bos personified, as son of Ares, Il.13.299; *dei=mo/s te *f. te 11.37, cf. 4.440, 15.119, Hes.Th.934, A.Th.45; worshipped at Selinus, IG14.268.2.
panic fear, [stratw=|] f. e)mba/llein Hdt.7.10.e/; e)n tw=| ginome/nw| f. Id.9.69; generally,
fear, terror (distd. from de/os (q.v.)), toro\s o)rqo/qric f. A.Ch.32 (lyr.); dia/toros f. Id.Pr.183 (lyr.); tarbo/sunos Id.Th.240 (lyr.); neaniko/s E.Hipp.1204; joined with de/os and dei=ma, v. sub vocc.; opp. qa/rros, Pl.Lg.644c; sts. in milder sense,
doubt, scruple, Pl.Phd.101b; e)/xei pollh\n u(poyi/an kai\ f. w(s . . Id.Sph.268a: also,
awe, reverence, for a ruler or divine being, tou= h(gemo/nos POxy.1642.17 (iii A.D.); qeou= LXX Ps.35(36).1, PLond.2.418.4 (iv A.D.): tou=kuri/ou Act.Ap.931.—Construction, a. c. gen. obj.,
fear or
dread of . . , A.Pers.116 (lyr.), Th.3.54, etc.; f. tou= strateu=sai X.An.3.1.18: c. dupl.gen., o)mma/twn ei)lhfo/tas fo/bon . . th=s e)mh=s e)peiso/dou S.OC730: with Preps., f. a)po/ tinos X.An.7.2.37 codd.; o( a)po\ tw=n polemi/wn f. Id.Cyr.3.3.53; ou(c o)neira/twn f. A.Ch. 929; pro/s tinos S.El.783; pro/s tinas D.16.10, 25.93; f. peri\ tou= karpou=
fear for or concerning . . , Th.4.88; f. e(ka/stwn pe/ri Pl.Phlb.20b; u(pe\r tou= me/llontos Th.7.41; to\n e)k tw=n *(ellh/nwn ei)s tou\s barba/rous f. X.An.1.2.18; tw=| kaq' e(anto\n f. from personal
fear, D.19.2: c. inf., fo/bw| ei)sora=n
from fear to see, E.IT1342:—for teqna/nai tw=| fo/bw| tina/, v. qnh/|skw 1.2. with Verbs, teu/xein fo/bon A.Pr.1090 (anap.); kla/zousi kw/dwnes f. Id.Th.386; f. poiei=n toi=s i(/ppois X.An. 1.8.18; parasxei=n E.Hec.1113, etc.; paraskeua/zein D.59.86; fo/bous e)mba/llein, fo/bon e)nqei=nai/ tini, to strike
terror into one, X.Cyr.8.7.18, An.7.4.1; e)nerga/sasqai/ tini Isoc.7.38, 11.25; e)/dwk' *)apo/llwn qh=ras fo/bw| Pi.P.5.61; of the person who feels fear, fo/bon labei=n, e)/xein, E.El.39, X.Hier.11.11; e)k fo/bou f. tre/fw S.Tr.28: acc. cogn., fo/bous fobei=sqai, dedoike/nai, Pl.Prt.360b, E.Supp.548; to\n so\n ou) tarbw= f. I fear not with thy
fear, i.e. not like thee, S.Ph.1251; *tanta/lou f. fobei=sqai Sch.E.Or.6; e)s f. katiste/ato Hdt.8.12, cf. Th.2.81; e)n f. gene/sqai Pl.R.578e; f. m' e)/xei A.Ag.1243, cf. E.Or. 1255; moi f. tis ei)selh/luq', m' u(ph=lqe/ tis f., ib.1324, S.Ph.1231; toi=s *(/ellhsi f. e)mpi/ptei X.An.2.2.19, etc.; dia\ fo/bou e)/rxomai, dia\ fo/bwn gi/gnomai, E.Or.757 (troch.), Pl.Lg.791b: opp. fo/bon lu/ein A.Th. 270, E.Or.104; dialu=sai Pl.Mx.241b; fo/bous e)cai/rei tw=n politw=n Isoc. 2.23; a)pelhlake/nai tini/ X.Cyr.4.2.10; fo/bou a)palla/cesqai to get rid of
it, ib.5.2.32; fo/bou e)klu/sasqai/ tina S.OT1002; fo/bous a)polu/esqai Arist.Rh.1415b18; fo/bou meqei=sa (Valck. fo/bon) E.Hel.555; fo/bou e)/cwqen ei)=nai Id.El.901; i(/na fo/bos ei)/h strateu/ein X.An.2.4.3; ou) f. mh\ . . Id.Mem.2.1.25; f. e)sti\n o(/pws mh\ . . Pl.Smp.193a; but fo/bos ei) pei/sw I
fear I shall not persuade . . , E.Med.184 (anap.); h(me/as e)/xeif. te kai\ de/os o(/kws xrh\ . . Hdt.4.115 (fo/bos h)=n w(/ste mh\ te/gcai is corrupt in E.IT1380): adverbial usages, fo/bw|
by or
through fear, A.Supp.786 (lyr.), Th.240 (lyr.), etc.; a)na/gkh| kai\ f. Pl.R.554d: with Preps., dia\ fo/bon, dia\ to\n f., Democr.41, X.Hier.1.38, Cyr.3.1.24; e)k ti/nos fo/bou; S.OC887; meta\ fo/bwn Isoc.2.26; a)/rxein cu\n fo/boisi S.OT585; proapoqnh/|skein u(po\ tou= f. X.Cyr.3.1.25; Poet., a)mfi\ fo/bw| E.Or.825 (lyr.): pl., not only in Poets, as Pi.N.9.27, A.Th.134 (prob. l.), S.Aj.531, etc., but also in Prose, fo/bous kai\ dei/mata Th.7.80; po/nous kai\ f. Pl. Lg.635c; kindu/nous kai\ f. Id.Tht.173a.
object or
cause of terror, S.OC1652; fo/bos a)kou=sai
a terror to hear, Hdt.6.112: pl., h)\n fo/bous le/gh| S.OT917; pollw=n f. prosagome/nwn X.An.4.1.23.

foib-a/zw, (*foi=bos)
prophesy, AP9.525.22: c. acc., f. o)/pa Lyc.6; *kassa/ndrh foi/ba^se mu/qous AP9.191.
inspire, pa/qos foiba/zon tou\s lo/gous Longin.8.4:—Pass., Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.7.112, Hld.2.22. = foiba/w 1, Lyc.731,875, 1166.

foib-ai/nw,
clean, Hsch.; foibana/tw (aor. imper.) de/ tis a)sa/minqon Anon. ap. EM797.7. = foiba/zw 1.1, Hsch.

foib-a/s, a/dos, h(,
priestess of Phoebus: generally,
inspired woman, prophetess, E.Hec.827: as fem. Adj., = foiba/zousa, Tim.Fr.3.

foib-asth/s, ou=, o(,
vaticinator, Gloss.

foib-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
like inspiration, enthusiastic, Longin.13.2, Ptol.Tetr.159: c. gen., f. e)mme/trwn xrhsmw=n
uttering oracles in verse, Plu.Rom.21.

foib-a/stria, h(,
prophetess, Lyc.1468.

foib-a/w,
cleanse, purify, xei=ras foibh/sasa mu/rois Theoc.17.134, cf. A.R.2.302, Call.Lav.Pall. 11:—Pass., Hsch. dub. sens. as v.l. in LXX De.14.1. = foiba/zw 1, Sch.S.Aj.332.

foi/b-eios, a, on, Ion. foibh/i+os, on E.Ion461 (lyr.):—
of Phoebus, belonging or
sacred to him, i(ro/n Hdt.6.61; da/pedon E.IA756 (lyr.); latrei=ai Id.Ph.225 (lyr.); gunh/ Id.Fr.867:—pecul. fem. foibhi/+s, i/dos, te/xnh AP9.201 (Leo Phil.).

foi/b-h, h(,
Phoebe, daughter of Uranus and Gaia, Hes.Th.136,404, A.Eu.7: acc. to others the mother of Phoebus, ib.8; later, epith. of Artemis, Virg.G.1.431, etc.

foibhla/los [a^], on,
uttering the oracles of Phoebus, tri/pous, ma/ntis, Ps. Callisth.1.45; *foibhla/los, h(, = *puqi/a 1, ibid.

foi/b-hsis, ews, h(,
inspiration, Vett.Val.110.31 (pl.).

foib-hteu/w,
to be a prophet, Hsch.
foib-hth/r, h=ros, o(, = sq., PMag.Lond.47.17 (dub.l.).

foib-hth/s, ou=, o(,
prophet, Man.1.237, CIG4990, al. (Ethiopia, iii A.D.).

foib-hto/s, h/, o/n,
inspired, prophesying, Man. 4.550.

foib-h/tria, h(, = kaqa/rtria,
purifier, Hsch.; h( *f., perh. Isis, CIG4987 (Ethiopia).
foib-h/twr, oros, o(, = foibhth/s, Orph.L. 389.

foibo/-lhptos, Ion. foibo/-lamptos, on,
possessed by Phoebus, Hdt.4.13, Lyc.1460, Plu.Pomp.48, Plot.5.8.10.

foibo-nome/omai, Pass.,
to be ruled by Phoebus, i.e.
to be purified, Thessalian word in Plu.2.393c.

foi=bos, h, on (accented foiba/n in B.12.139 Pap.):—
pure, bright, radiant, u(/dwr Hes.Fr.274, Lyc.1009; h(li/ou foi/bh| flogi/ A.Pr.22; ai)/gla B. l.c. as pr. n., *foi=bos, o(,
Phoebus, i.e.
the Bright or
Pure, an old epith. of Apollo, *f. *)apo/llwn Il.1.43, al.; rarely inverted, *)apo/llwn foi=bos 20.68, Hes.Fr.194: then alone as pr. n., Il.1.443, Alcm.61, etc.
prophet, BCH55.85 (Panamara).
foi/+des, v. fwi/+s.
foi/na_, h(, Lacon. for qoi/nh, Alcm.22.
foin-a/s, a/dos, h(, = e)rusi/bh, Theognost.Can.25.

foin-h/eis, essa, en, (foino/s)
blood-red, deep red, dra/kwn Il.12.202; ai(=ma Mosch.2.58:
bloody, a)spi/s Nic.Th.158.

foi/n-igma, atos, to/,
that which is red, Lib.Descr.30.12.

foin-igmo/s, o(,
the irritation of the skin
by rubefacients, Sor.2.15, al., Gal.10.466, Orib.Fr.56.
foin-i/zw, v.l. for foini/ssw, Nonn.D.12.323.

foini_k-aigu/ptios, o(,
person of mixed Phoenician and Egyptian descent, PSI5.531.1 (iii B.C.).
foini_k-ai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Corinth, Corinth8(1).2.

foini_ka/nqemos, on,
with bright flowers, e)/ar Pi.P.4.64.

foini_ka/rx-e/w,
to be *foinika/rxhs, Rev.Bibl.1895.386 (Gerasa, iii A.D.).

foini_ka/rx-hs, ou, o(,
president of the provincial assembly of Phoenicia, IG22.3817 (Eleusis, iii A.D.), Just.Nov.89.15.

foini_ka/rx-ia, h(,
his office, Cod.Just.5.27.1.
foini_k-a/s, a/dos, h(, = r(a/fanos (Euboean), Hsch. (pl.).

foini_/k-aspis, idos, o(, h(,
bearing red shields, h(mi/qeoi B.8.10.

foini_k-ei/mwn, on, gen. onos,
with garment of red, v. filokoni/mwn.

foini_/k-eios, on,
of the palm-tree, oi)=nos D.S.1.91, Suid.; cf. foinikh/i+os.
foini_keli/kths, ou=, o(, = a)pathlo/s, Com.Adesp.1293.

foini/keos [i_], e/a, eon: (foi=nic B.1):—
purple-red, crimson, and (generally)
red, ne/fos Xenoph.32.2; r(o/da Pi.I.4(3).18(36); promaxew=nes Hdt.1.98; ei(=ma Id.2.132, cf. 7.76, 9.22; o)/nuxes Hp.Int.29; su/kina f., a variety of fig, PCair.Zen.33.12 intr. (iii B.C.); metaph.,
blushing, ai)dw/s Erinn.Fr.i B 34 Diehl2; contr. foini_kou=s, h=, ou=n, Hp. Mul.1.95, X.An.1.2.16, Cyr.7.1.2, Arist.HA592b24, Dsc.3.153; skhnai/ Plb.6.41.7; xitw/n, as signal for battle, Plu.Pomp.68, Brut.40; gra/mmata D.C.40.18; to\ f.
dark red, Arist.Metaph.1057a25, al.; less bright than to\ a(lourge/s, Id.Col.792a14 (foinika/ must be corrected to foinika= in Dsc.2.176, cf. Suid. s.v. foinika= (but foinikia= Id. s.v. a(pla=)). prob. f.l. for *foinikiko/s, Thphr.HP3.12.3.
foini_kew/n, w=nos, o(, = foinikw/n, Gloss.

foini/kh [i_], h(,
Phoenicia, Od.4.83, Hdt.1.2, etc.
the country of Carthage, E.Tr.221 (lyr.).
the constellation Ursa Minor, Eratosth.Cat.2.

foini_k-h/i+os, h, on, Ion. for foini/keios, = foini/kinos 1,
of the datepalm, e)sqh\s f. clothing
of palm leaves, Hdt.4.43; oi)=nos f.
palm-wine, Id.2.86; bi/kous foinikhi/+ous （-hi/+ou Valla) . . oi)/nou ple/ous 1.194; foinikhi/+h nou=sos, = e)lefanti/asis, Hp. ap. Gal.19.153.
Phoenician, Hdt.3.37, 8.90, 97; gra/mmata *foinikh/i+a, of the ancient Ionic alphabet, Id.5.58, cf. Scamon 2; *f. alone, SIG38.37 (Teos, v B. C.).
foini_k-hi/+s, i/dos, h(, = foiniki/s, Hsch. = a)nemw/nh 2, Id.

foini_k-hro/n me/tron, measure
used for dates, prob. in BGU604.15 (foinikh[Pap., ii A. D.), 732.1 (-hgo/s Pap., ii A. D.).

entryFree.sense:
the Phoenician (i.e.
the south-east) wind, Arist.Mete.364a4, Gal.16.408.

div0.entryFree:
foini_k-i/dion, to/, Dim. of *foi=nic,
young or
little Phoenician, D.L.7.3.
ornament in shape of palm, ko/smos or o(/rmos xrusou=s e)pi/ foinikidi/ou *)erifu/lhs Inscr.Délos399B 139, 407.10 (ii B.C.).

foini_k-i/zw,
imitate the Phoenicians, of unnatural vice, Luc.Pseudol.28, Gal.12.249. (foi=nic B. 1.2)
to be dark red or
bay, Gp.16.2.3.

foini_k-iko/s, h/, o/n,
Phoenician, Epich.54, Hdt.6.47, Th. 6.46; ke/dros Thphr.HP9.2.3; gra/mmata Chron.Lind.B.15; sh/mata *ka/dmou Timo61; *f. ti a tale of Cadmus the Phoenician, Pl.R.414c; later, also,
Punic, to express craft and treachery, *f. strath/ghma Plb. 3.78.1; yeu=dos *f. Eust.1757.59. Adv. -kw=s
in Phoenician fashion, D.L.7.25. = foini/keos,
red: metaph., kaka\ f. 'of deep dye', Ar.Pax303 (troch., sed leg. foiniki/dwn). = sq.1, f. a)/rtoi
date-bread, Ph.Bel.86.27; karpoi/ BGU603.10 (ii A.D.), etc.

foini/k-i^nos [ni_], h, on, (foi=nic B. 11) = foinikh/i+os 1,
of the date-palm, f. mu/ron
palm-unguent, Antiph.106.4; oi)=nos o( f.
palm-wine, Ephipp. 24; without oi)=nos, Id.8.2; f. karpoi/ PHamb.5.11 (i A.D.); foiniki/nh, h(, name of a plaster, Gal.13.375.
made of palm-wood, Ath.Mech. 17.14. *foini/kinos, h, on,
Phoenician, h( *f. no/sos
elephantiasis, Gal.19.153.

foini/k-ion, to/, = foi=nic B. 11.3, POxy.1656.12 (iv/v A.D.), etc. = foi=nic B. IV, Arist.Pr.918b8.
palm-wine(?), Supp.Epigr.1.414.5 (Crete, v/iv B. C.).

foini/k-ios, a, on, = foini/keos 1, Epich.31, X.An.1.2.16 (v.l.), IG22.1514.41, Arist.Mete.372a4, Plb.6.23.12 (nisi leg. foinikoi=s）; f. oi)=nos
palm-wine, Schwyzer 182a5 (Gortyn, v/iv B. C.). = *foinikiko/s 1, S.Fr.514, D.S.3.67 codd., 5.74 codd. foinik-iou=s, ou=n, = foini/keos, Ar.Av.272, Arist.Col.792b2, al.; tainidion SIG1018.4 (Pergam., iii B. C.). (Usu. second declension, prob. by 'contamination' of foini/kios and foinikou=s; once third declension, foinikiou=nta Arist.Col.796a32, prob. by 'contamination' of foini/kios and foiniko/eis.) foinikiou=n, to/ (sc. dikasth/rion),
a court of justice at Athens, named from the colour of its walls, Paus.1.28.8.

foinik-i/s, i/dos, h(,
red or
purple cloth, Ar.Pl.731,735; used for horses, X.Cyr.8.3.12.
red cloak, Ar.Ach.320 (troch.); foiniki/d' o)cei=an pa/nu a
red cloak as bright as bright can be, Id.Pax 1173, cf. 1175 (both troch.): esp. the
dark-red military cloak of the Lacedaemonians, Id.Lys.1140, X.Lac.11.3, Arist.Fr.542; also worn by Persians, X.Cyr.6.4.1, cf. foinikisth/s 11; by Macedonians, Plu. Aem.18, etc.; distd. from porfuri/s, X.Cyr.8.3.3.
red curtain or
carpet, Aeschin.3.76 (pl.).
red flag hung out as the signal for action, Plb.2.66.11, D.S.13.77, etc.; generally,
red banner, foiniki/das a)nasei/ein, a form in solemn curses or excommunications, Lys.6.51.
ornamental palm-tree, Inscr. Délos314B137 (iii B. C.).
foini/k-isma, atos, to/, in pl., = ta\ dia\ foini/kwn e)piqe/mata, cj. in Aët. 9.10 (foini/smata codd.).

foinik-isth/s, ou=, o(, (foi=nic B.11)
dyer of purple or
red, Zonar. among the Persians,
wearer of purple, opp. paralourgh/s (q. v.), i.e.
one of the highest rank, X.An.1.2.20; cf. Hsch. = *foiniki/zwn 1, Sch.Ar.Pax883, EM235.47.

foini_kisti/, Adv.
in the Phoenician or
Punic tongue, Plb.1.80.6.

foini_ki/ths [ki_], ou, o(, (foi=nic B. 11) f. oi)=nos
palm-wine, Dsc.5.31.

foini_ko-ba/la^nos [ba^], h(,
palm-nut, i. e.
date, the fruit of the date-palm, Plb.12.2.6, 26.1.8, Dsc.1.109, Gal.6.779, IG22.1013.20.

foini_ko/-baptos, on,
purple-dyed, e)sqh/mata A.Eu.1028.

foini_ko-ba^te/w,
climb palms, Luc.Syr.D.29.
foini_ko-ba^fh/s, e/s, = foiniko/baptos, Hld. 3.3, Sch.Ar.Ach.319, Philostr.Ep.3,36.

foini_ko-genh/s, e/s,
Phoenicianborn, E.Fr.472 (anap.).
foini_ko-gra/fos [a^], o(, title of official at Mytilene, IG12(2).96, 97.

foini_ko-da/ktu^los, on,
crimson-fingered, coined by Arist.Rh.1405b20, on the analogy of r(odod-.

foini_ko/-eis, essa, en, (foi=nic B. 1) = foini/keos,
dark-red, purple or
crimson, xlai=na Il.10.133, Od.14.500; h(ni/a Hes.Sc.95; smw/digges . . ai(/mati foiniko/essai
red with blood, Il.23.717; ai(/mati foiniko/eis Hes.Sc.194. [In Hom. and Hes. foiniko/essai, -o/essan, -o/enta, must be pronounced as if contracted, cf. Nonn.D.41.352.]

foini_/ko-qric, o(, h(, gen. tri^xos,
with red hair, bo/es B.10.105.

foini_ko-krh/demnos, on, Dor. foini_ko-kra/demnos [a_],
with purple kerchief, [*moi=sai] Id.12.222; *latw/ Id.10.97.

foini_ko/-krokos, on, (kro/kh)
of purple woof, zw/na Pi.O.6.39.

foini_ko/-legnos, on,
red-streaked, of the bird phne/loy, Ion Trag.68.

foini_ko/-lofos, on,
purple- or
crimson-crested, dra/kwn E.Ph. 820 (lyr.); o)/rniqes Theoc.22.72; a)lektruo/nes Gp.14.16.2.

foini_ko/-nwtos, on,
red-backed, bo/es B.5.102.

foini_ko-para/deisos, o(,
palm-grove, CPHerm.7 ii 24, PSI2.240.10.

foini_ko-pa/rhos [a^], on,
red-cheeked, epith. of ships, the bows of which were painted red, Od.11.124.

foini_ko-pa/ru^fos, on,
with crimson border, porfurai= f. th/bennai, = Lat.
trabeae, D.H.6.13.

foini_ko/-pedos, on,
with red bottom or
ground, of the Red Sea, foiniko/pedo/n t' *)eruqra=s . . xeu=ma qala/sshs A.Fr. 192 (anap.).

foini_ko/-peza, h(,
ruddy-footed, epith. of Demeter; prob. from the colour of ripe corn, Pi.O.6.94; also of Hecate, Id.Pae.2.77.

foini_ko/-pteros, on,
red-feathered: as Subst., f., o(,
flamingo, Phoenicopterus antiquorum Ar.Av.273 (troch.); also o)/rnis f. Cratin. 114. = foi=nic 111.4, Ps.-Dsc.4.43.

foini_ko/-pteruc, u^gos, o(, h(,
red-winged, nu/mfa Lyr.in
Mitteil. aus der Papyrussamml. d. Nationalbibliothek in Wien 1(1932).139.

foini_ko-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
date-seller, PMasp.58 viii 6 (vi A. D.).

foini_ko/-rodos, on,
red with roses, leimw=nes Pi.Fr.129.2.

foini_ko/-rugxos, on,
with a red bill, koraki/as Arist.HA617b17.

foini_ko-skelh/s, e/s,
red-legged, xhlai/ E.Ion1207.

foini_ko-stero/pas, a, o(, Dor. for *-stero/phs,
hurling red lightnings, *zeu/s Pi.O.9.6.
foini_ko/-stolos, on, epith. of e)/gxea, i.e. e)/gxea tou= tw=n *foini/kwn sto/lou, Id.N.9.28.

foini_ko-tro/fos, on,
bearing palms, to/pos Str.17.3.23.

foini/k-ouros [i_], o(, perh.
red-start (i. e.
red-tail), Luscinia phoenicurus, Arist.HA632b28, Gp.15.1.22.
foinik-ou=s, h=, ou=n, v. foini/keos.

foini_ko-fa^h/s, e/s,
ruddy-glancing, pou/s E.Ion163(lyr.).

foini_ko-fo/ros, o(,
bearer of palms, title of official in religious guild, IG5(2).47.10 (Tegea, foineik- lapis).
bearing a palm as device, no/misma Inscr.Délos 1429 Bii 34 (ii B. C.).

foini_ko/-fu^tos, on,
grown with palms, D.S.2.48, 19.98, J.AJ4.8.1.

foinik-te/on,
one must redden, Ruf. ap. Aët.11.29.

foinik-tikw=s, Adv.
by having a sensation of redness, pa/sxein S.E.M.7.198.

foinik-to/s, h/, o/n,
dyed purple, e)/rion J.AJ4.4.6.

foinik-w/n, w=nos, o(,
palm-grove, PEnteux.18.3 (iii B. C.), P.Amh.2.31.3 (ii B. C.), LXXEz.47.18, Str. 16.2.41, J.BJ4.8.2, Ael.NA16.18, etc.; written foineikw/n, IGRom. 4.1431 (Smyrna).
palm-bearing region, Procop.Pers.1.19, al.

foi=nic, i_kos, o(, h(,
Phoenician, *foi=nic a)nh\r a)path/lia ei)dw/s Od.14.288, cf. 13.272, 15.415; w(s *f. a)nh/r, *sidw/nios ka/phlos S.Fr.909. fem., gunh/ *foi/nissa Od.15.417; *foi/nissai, name of plays by Euripides, Phrynichus, etc.; also *f. e)mpola/ Pi.P.2.67; xqw/n, na=sos, etc., E.Ph.6,204 (lyr.), etc.; *f. boa/ ib.301 (lyr.); kw/ph Id.Hel.1272; *f. a)/mpexos PCair.Zen.33.14 (iii B. C.).
Carthaginian, a)lalato/s Pi.P.1.72; also fem., *foi/nissai nh=es Th.1.116, D.S.13.80. foi=nic, i_kos, o(,
purple or
crimson, because the discovery and earliest use of this colour was ascribed to the Phoenicians, Il. 4.141, 6.219, Od.23.201, etc.:—hence, as Adj. (fem. foi/nissa Pi. (v. infr.); foi=nic as fem., E.Tr.815),
blood-bay, of a horse, Il. 23.454; of
red cattle, foi/nissa a)ge/la Pi.P.4.205, cf. Theoc.25.128: of the colour of fire, foi/nissa flo/c Pi.P.1.24; puro\s f. pnoa/ E.l.c.; also f. i(ma/ntes Simon.17; pe/ploi E.Hel.181 (lyr.), etc.
date-palm, Phoenix dactylifera, Od.6.163, h.Ap.117, Pi.Fr.75 14 (dub.), E. Hec.458 (lyr.), D.S.2.53; to/ca e)k foi/nikos spa/qhs pepoihme/na Hdt.7.69, etc.: the male and female distd. by Hdt. as [o( f.] e)/rshn and [h( f.] balanhfo/ros, 1.193 (but the latter is masc., ibid. and in 4.172, 182); foini/kwn . . tw=n karpi/mwn oi( me\n a)/rrenes ai( de\ qh/leiai Thphr.HP2.6.6, but ai( a)po\ tw=n a)rre/nwn pro\s tou\s qh/leis [boh/qeiai] ib.2.8.4.
palm-frond, as a
badge of victory, Arist MM1196a36, Plu.2.723b, etc.; to\n f. tini\ a)podou=nai Chrysipp.Stoic.3.175.
date, Hellanic.56J., Epich. 18, Antiph.65, Ephipp.24; more correctly, tou=foi/nikos o( karpo/s Hdt.1.193; karpo\s foi/nikos Hermipp.63.22 (hex.); cf. foinikoba/lanos. o( xamairrifh/s
dwarf-palm, Chamaerops humilis, Thphr.HP2.6.11. a Bactrian tree,
Mazri palm, Nannorhops ritchieana, ib.4.4.8. a sea-plant,
Callophyllis laciniata, ib.4.6.2, 10.
rye-grass, Lolium perenne, Dsc.4.43. a musical instrument, like a
guitar, invented by the Phoenicians, Hdt.4.192, Ephor.4 J., Phillis 2 (pl.), Scamon 3; but so called because made from the Delian palm, acc. to Semus 1. the fabulous bird
phoenix, Hes.Fr.171.4, Antiph.175; from Arabia acc. to Hdt.2.73; but from India, Philostr. VA3.49: prov., foi/nikos e)/th biou=n Luc.Herm.53. an
ornament, LXX Ez.41.25.
perfume prepared from the fronds of the date-palm, Thphr.Od.28. a
fish, Ael.NA12.24. a
bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.11.2. = eu)ru/notos, Agathem.2.7. f. e)n o(plh=|, a disease of the hoof, Hippiatr.10. an eye-salve, Aët.7.116. [In all senses of the word i_ in gen., but nom. foi=nic, not foi/nic, Hdn.Gr. ap. Choerob. in Thd.1.292.]
foi/nicis, ews, h(, = foinigmo/s, Antyll. ap. Orib.7.16.3, Dsc.2.154.

foi/nios, a, on, also os, on Pi.I.4(3).35(53):—poet.Adj., used for fo/nios, when the first syll. is to be long,
of or
like blood, blood-red, ai(=ma Od.18.97, A.Th.737(lyr.), S.Ph.783; dro/sos A.Ag.1390; f. sta/lagma, i. e. blood, S.Ant.1239.
bloody, blood-stained, f. a)lka/, of Ajax, Pi.l.c.; f. cunwri/s, prob. of public and private loss, A.Ag.643; xei\r f. S.Aj.772; xei=res Id.OT466 (lyr.); kopi/s prob. for ko/nis in Id.Ant. 601 (lyr.).
bloody, murderous, *sku/lla A.Ch.614(lyr.); pe/plhgmai . . dh/gmati (prob. da/kei） foini/w| Id.Ag.1164 (lyr.), cf. 1278; f. *)/arhs S.El.96 (anap.); e)/xidna Id.Tr.770: metaph., f. sa/los, of pestilence, Id.OT24, cf. Aj.352.—Rare in Com., Ar.Th.694.

foini/skh, h(, dim. of foi=nic,
small palm, BGU227.10 (ii A. D.).
foi/nissa, foi/nissa, fem. of *foi=nic, foi=nic.

foini/ssw, E.Or.1285 (lyr.), etc.; fut. cw B.12.165, etc.: (foino/s): —
redden, make red, ai(/mati *)/arhs po/nton foini/cei Orac. ap. Hdt.8.77, cf. B. l. c.; xeu=ma *kai/+kou Epic.Alex.Adesp.3.15; sfa/gia f. E. l. c.; foini/ssousa parh=|d' e)ma\n ai)sxu/na| Id.IA187 (lyr.);
empurple, mo/ron S.Fr.395:—Pass.,
to be or
become red, ma/stigi nw=ta foinixqei/s S.Aj. 110; ai(/mati f. E.Hec.151 (anap.); po/ntos nai/+ois e)foini/sseto stalagmoi=s Tim.Pers.33, cf. Hp.Epid.7.92; kai\ xro/a foini/xqhn u(po\ tw)/lgeos Theoc.20.16; na=ma d' e)foini/xqh Id.23.61; temno/menoi, foinisso/menoi, kao/menoi Porph.Abst.1.56:—Med., [ski/lla] foini/cato sa/rka Nic.Al. 254, cf. Nonn.D.34.143. in the Perrhaebian dialect, = ai(ma/ssw, Arist.Mir.843b14. causal, qermo\n e)/reuqos foini/ssei
causes a hot
flush, Opp.H.2.428. intr.,
become blood-red, Nic.Th.238; a)/nqh meta\ tou= leukou= foini/ssonta e)k me/rous Dsc.4.159.

foin-o/s, h/, o/n, (fo/nos)
blood-red, parh/i+on ai(/mati foino/n Il.16.159:
blood-red, qumo\n a)popvei/wn h.Ap.362.
deadly, da/kh, o)/leqros, Nic.Th.146, 675; poto/n Id.Al.187.

foin-w/dhs, es,
of blood-red aspect, ib.489.
foi/+s, i/+dos, h(, v. fw/|s.
foit-a/zw, = foiti/zw, Hellad. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.532 B.

foit-a^le/os, a, on, also os, on E.Or.327 (lyr.):—
roaming wildly about, Mosch.2.46, Opp.H.1.45; foitale/ai
distraught, AP9.603 (Antip.) Act.,
maddening, ke/ntra A.Pr.598 (lyr.); lu/ssa E. l.c.; ma/stic Opp.H. 2.513.—Poet. word.
foit-a^lieu/s, e/ws, o(, = sq., Opp.C.4.236.

foit-a^liw/ths, ou, o(, epith. of Bacchus,
the maddener, AP9.524.22.

foit-a/s, a/dos, h(, = foitale/os, of the ba/kxai, E.Ba.165 (lyr., pl.) as Adj., f. a)gu/rtria, of Cassandra, A.Ag.1273; f. no/sos
madness, frenzy, S.Tr.980 (anap.); f. pla/nh Lyc.610; f. r(iph/, of the
flickering of fire, Tryph.231; f. e)mpori/h, of commerce
by sea, AP7.586 (Jul.): also with neut. Subst., foita/si pteroi=s on
wandering wings, E.Ph. 1024 (lyr.): late also with masc., foita/di mo/xqw| Jo.Gaz.Ecphr.1.90; f. i(/ppoi Nonn.D.38.260.
much trodden, frequented, o(doi/ Anon. ap.Suid.

foit-a/w, Il.2.779, etc.; Ion. foit-e/w Hdt.1.37, 7.126 (also late, e)pefoi/tee Nonn.D.1.321); Dor. inf. foith=n Bion Fr.2; impf.Dor. 3sg. e)foi/th Theoc.2.155; Ep. 3dual foith/thn Il.12.266; Ion. foi/teskon Asius 13.1: Aeol. aor. subj. 2sg. -a/sh|s Sapph.68:—
go to and fro, backwards and forwards, and generally, with notion of repeated motion,
stalk; a)n' o(/milon e)foi/ta qhri\ e)oikw/s Il.3.449, cf. 13.760; foi/ta d' a)/llote me\n pro/sq' *(/ektoros, a)/llot' o)/pisqe 5.595; foi/twn e)/nqa kai\ e)/nqa kata\ strato/n 2.779; e)foi/twn a)/lloqen a)/llos Od.9.401., cf.10.119; pa/nth| foith/sasa Il.20.6; foi/ta makra\ biba/s 15.686, cf. Od.11.539; dia\ nho\s f.
keep going from one part to another, 12.420; a)fa/nhs ka)n *)ai/+da do/mw| foita/sh|s Sapph. l.c.; of birds
on the wing, Od.2.182, E.Hipp. 1059, Ion 154 (lyr.); of horses going to feed, Hdt.1.78; of hounds
casting about for the scent, X.Cyn.4.4, 6.19; foita=|s u(perpo/ntios e)/n t' a)grono/mois au)lai=s, of love
frequenting both sea and land, S.Ant. 785 (lyr.), cf. E.Hipp.447; of young men
strutting about to show their persons, lamproi/ t' e)n h(/bh| kai\ po/lews a)ga/lmata foitw=s' Id.Fr. 282.11.
roam wildly about, Il.24.533; oi( de\ mega/la stena/xontes foi/twn Od.14.355; foitw=n mania/sin no/sois S.Aj.59, cf. OT476 (lyr.), 1255: hence,
roam about in frenzy or
ecstacy, e)s *dio/nuson, of a Bacchant, AP6.172. of sexual intercourse,
go in to a man or woman, ei)s eu)nh\n foitw=nte Il.14.296; pro\s a)llh/lous Pl.R.390c; pro\s th\n gunai=ka Lys.1.19; par' au)th/n ib.15; para\ to\n e(wuth=s a)/ndra Hdt.2.111; para\ tou\s dou/lous Id.4.1; e)n peritroph=| ai( gunai=kes foitw=si toi=si *pe/rsh|si Id.3.69.
resort to a person as a friend, f. para/ tina
visit him, Pl.Phd.59d, Euthd.295d, La.181c, etc.; par' h(ma=s
f. w(s para\ fi/lous Id.R.328d; pro\s th\n sunousi/an tino/s Id.Lg.624a; sfin e(kate/rwse Id.Grg.523b.
resort to a person or place for any purpose, e)foi/twn para\ to\n *dhi+o/kea . . dikaso/menoi Hdt.1.96; para/ tina f. e)s lo/gous Id.7.103; f. e)/s te pole/mous kai\ e)s a)/gras, e)/s te a)gorh\n kai\ e)c a)gorh=s, Id.1.37; e)s ta\ xrhsth/ria Id.6.125; ei)s to\ i(ero\n e(ka/sths h(me/ras Pl.Lg.794b; f. pro\s tou\s *)aqhnai/ous, of embassies from the subject states, Th.1.95; foita=n e)pi\ ta\s qu/ras tino/s
frequent, wait at a great man's door, Hdt.3.119, X.Cyr.8.1.8, HG.1.6.10; later, f. e)pi\ qu/ras Plu.Aem.10, Luc.DMort.9.2, etc.; e)pi\ qu/rais Plu.Cat. Mi.21 (s. v. l.); e)pi\ th\n e)mh\n oi)ki/an Lys.3.29, cf. Aeschin.1.58; ei)s to\ i(ero/n IG7.235.2 (Oropus, iv B. C.); also f. ei)s sussi/tia Pl.R. 416e; a)/klhtos foita=|s e)pi\ dei=pnon Cratin.45 (anap.), cf. Eup.162 (lyr.); ei)s kaph/lou f. Plu.2.643c; ei)s *(ippoqwnti/d' e)foi/ta fulh\n xoreu/swn D.39.23; of a company of actors, f. tisi ei)s th\n po/lin Pl.Lg. 817a.: abs., of a suitor, foitw=n e)nargh\s tau=ros, a)/llot' ai)o/los dra/kwn . . a)/llot' a)ndrei/w| ku/tei bou/prw|ros S.Tr.11. of a dream that
visits one
frequently, haunts one, e)n o)nei/rasi foitw=sa E.Alc.355; polla/kis moi foitw=n to\ au)to\ e)nu/pnion Pl.Phd.60e.
resort to a person as a teacher, para/ se tau=ta maqhso/menos Id.Smp.206b; pai=s w)\n e)foi/tas e)s ti/nos didaska/lou (sc. oi)=kon); Ar.Eq.1235, cf. Pl.Prt.326c, Alc.1.109d; tw=n didaska/lwn o(/poi e)foitw=men Is.9.28; ei)s ta\ didaskalei=a f. X.Cyr.1.2.6; ei)s palai/stran Pl.Grg.456d; pro\s ta\s tou= grammatistou= qu/ras Id.Erx.398e: later, c. dat., toi=s ma/gois Philostr. VA1.26; didaska/lois Jul.Or.7.219c: abs.,
go to school, Ar.Nu.916, 938 (anap.); e)di/daskes gra/mmata, e)gw\ d' e)foi/twn D.18.265: oi( foitw=ntes the
schoolboys, Pl.Lg.804d, Isoc.15.183. of a physician,
practise, Hp.Lex4. of things, esp. of objects of commerce,
to come in constantly or
regularly, be imported, e)c e)sxa/ths (sc. *eu)rw/phs） o(/ te kassi/teros h(mi=n foita=| kai\ to\ h)/lektron Hdt.3.115; ke/rea ta\ e)s *)/ellhnas foite/onta
which are imported into Greece, Id.7.126; si=tos de/ sfi pollo\s e)foi/ta corn
came in to them in plenty, ib.23, cf. Lys. 32.15, X.HG1.1.35;
come in, of tribute or taxes, ta/lanton a)rguri/ou *)aleca/ndrw| h(me/rhs e(ka/sths e)foi/ta Hdt.5.17, cf. 3.90: generally, a)ka/mas xro/nos . . a)ena/w| r(eu/mati f. E.Fr.594.2 (anap.); w(=| mi/a tis ph/ra, mi/a diploi/+s, ei(=s a(/m' e)foi/taski/pwn
travelled, AP7.65 (Antip.); of reports, lo/gos e)foi/ta
was current, Plu.Fab.21; to\ *sertwri/ou kle/os e)foi/ta pantaxo/se Id.Sert.23; a)retai\ pa/nth| f. dia\ th=s fh/mhs D.S.10.12; of
fits of pain, h(/de [no/sos] o)cei=a foita=| kai\ taxei=, a)pe/rxetai S.Ph.808, cf. Hes. Op.103; of the katamh/nia, Arist.HA582b4, GA727b27; of
recurrent kaqa/rseis, Id.HA583a26; ta\ ou)=ra kaqara\ e)foi/ta
came clear, Hp. Epid.7.115; a)/nw foita=| h( o)du/nh Id.Mul.1.63; of
recurrent phenomena, such as rain, snow, hail, Arist.Mete.347b12, Pr.931a38.
foit-ei/a, h(, = foi/thsis, Theognost.Can.25, Suid. (-ti/a).
foi/t-hs, ou, o(, = kh=ruc, Hsch.

foi/t-hsis, ews, h(,
regular or
repeated going, mostly in pl., ai( e)pi\ ta\s qu/ras f. X.HG1.6.7; tw=n ei)s tou\s ga/mous kai\ gene/qlia foith/sewn
resortings to marriages . . , Pl.Lg.784d.
going to school, ib.764d (pl.): hence e)k foith/sew/s tinos of his
school, Paus.5.17.4.

foit-hte/on,
one must resort, para/ tina Pl.Tht.161e.

foit-hth/r, h=ros, o(, = foithth/s, Nonn.D.4.270: as Adj., = foitale/os, f. *)/erwtes
in her train, Coluth. 100.

foit-hth/s, ou=, o(,
one who regularly goes or
comes; esp.
disciple, pupil, Pl.R.563a, Euthd.295d, Alc.1.109d, Lg.779d, Phld.Acad.Ind. p.17M., AP7.122 (D.L.).

foit-hto/s, h/, o/n,
frequenting: f. mani/a e)pi\ dei=pnon Com.Adesp.782 (prob. anap.).
foit-i/zw, poet. for foita/w, Ep.impf. -i/zeske h.Hom.26.8, cf. Call.Fr.9c P., A.R.3.54.

foi=tos, o(,
a repeated going or
coming: metaph.,
wandering of mind, su\n foi/tw| frenw=n A.Th.661.
foito/s, late spelling of futo/s (q. v.).
fo/letron, to/, = fo/retron, PSI1.31.16 (ii A. D.), etc.

foli^d-oeidh/s, es,
scaly, Orib.Fr.79.

foli^d-o/omai, Pass.,
to be covered with scales, Philum.Ven.18.1, 21.1.
foli^d-w/dhs, es, = folidoeidh/s, v.l. for follikw/dhs in Hp.Epid.4.30.

foli^d-wto/s, h/, o/n,
clad in scales, of reptiles, opp. lepidwto/s (of fishes), Arist.PA692b11, cf. HA490b24, al.; also of the signs Scorpio and Pisces, Heph.Astr.1.1; qw/rac f. a coat of mail
of small metal plates overlapping one another, scale-armour, Posidipp.26.8, Arr.Tact.3.5 (pl.); f. xitw/n Hld.9.15, v. l. for stolid- in X.Cyr.6.4.2; f. fia/lh
ornamented with a pattern of scales, Inscr.Délos1414aii 20, cf. 1416 Ai 100 (ii B. C.); paroyi/des, o)cu/bafa, BGU781 i6, ii14 (i A. D.); also of the catkins of the filbert, mo/ria f.
imbricated, Thphr.HP3.5.6.

foli/s, i/dos, h(,
horny scale, of reptiles, opp. lepi/s (of fishes), Arist. HA490b22, PA691a16, cf. A.R.1.221, Opp.C.3.438, Epic. ap. Sch. Nic.Th.257; but interchanged with lepi/s, D.S.17.105, etc.; f. xalkou= Hp.Vid.Ac.6.
spot on a panther's or
leopard's skin, Hld. 10.27. f. liqoko/llhtos
a ceiling in mosaic work, D.S.18.26. a
bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.20.11.

folko/s, o(, dub. sens., prob.
bandy-legged, epith. of Thersites in Il.2.217; wrongly expld. by Sch. as
squinting.

follikw/dhs, es, dub. sens. in Hp.Epid.4.30 (cf. folidw/dhs),
full of cavities, spongy, acc. to Gal.19.153;
scabby, acc. to Erot., who has fo/llic, ikos, h(, in sense of a
scab, leprous sore.

fo/llis, ews, o(, Lat.
follis, bellows, AP9.528 (Pall.).
a small coin, 1/288 of a
solidus, OGI521.24, al. (Abydos, v/vi A.D.), Procop. Arc.25, Suid., Eust.136.13.
property-tax, Zos.2.38, Cod.Just.12.2.2.
fo/lues ku/nes, expld. as purroi/, with black mouths, Antim.98.

fo/n-ac, a_kos, o(,
eager for blood, name of a dog, X.Cyn.7.5.

fon-a/w, Desiderative,
to be athirst for blood, to be murderous, fona=|, fona=| no/os h)/dh S.Ph.1209 (lyr.); fonw/saisin . . lo/gxais (Boeckh, after Sch., for foni/aisin) Id.Ant.117 (lyr.), cf. Hp.Virg.1; e)oikw\s fonw=nti Ael. VH2.44; tw=| e)c *)/areos fonw=nti ib.3.9; fonw=n to\ o)/mma Philostr. Jun.Im.9.
fon-erga/ths [a^], ou, o(, = foneu/s, as Adj., Sch.rec.A.Th. 122.

fo/n-euma, a/tos, to/,
that which is destined for slaughter, of Ion, E.Ion1495 (lyr.).

fon-eu/s, o(, gen. e/ws, Ep. h=os Il.9.632; acc. fone/a (in first foot of trim.) S.OT362,721; in E. fone/a^, Hec.882: nom.pl. fone/es Lesb.Rh.3.8, Att. fonh=s Antipho 4.2.7; acc. fone/as Id.2.3.8, 4.3.1, Lys.12.96, Call. in PSI11.1218a32, etc.; but contr. fonei=s Plu.2.162e:—
slayer, Il. l. c., 18.335, Od.24.434, Hdt.1.45, etc.; dikaiota/tou de\ fonh=os Pisand.10; tw=| fonei= ta)delfou= th\n decia\n de/dwke Arist.Ath.18.6.; au)to/xeiras kai\ fone/as Isoc.4.111; fone/as au(tw=n self-
murderers, Lys. l. c.; tosou/tw| ma=llon foneu/s e)stin is so much more justly accounted a
murderer, Antipho 4.3.3; ou)xi\ th\n e)mh\n fone/a nomi/zwn xei=ra E.IT586; a)kousi/ws tino\s f. gene/sqai Pl.R.451a; of the sword on which Ajax had thrown himself, S.Aj.1026: as fem., mhte/ra fone/a ou)=san Antipho 1.3 (o( f., even of a woman, ib.20). sou= fone/ws memnhme/nos you, my
destroyer, S.OC1361. metaph., th=s u(mete/ras eu)sebei/as fonh=s Antipho 4.2.7.

fon-eu/simos, h, on,
that may be slain, Sch.BT Il.22.13.

fon-eute/on,
one must kill, Lib. Or.46.10.
fon-euth/s, ou=, o(, = foneu/s, LXX 4 Ki.9.31, Pr.22.13.

fon-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
murderous, deadly, Sch.Nic.Th.1, etc.

fon-eu/tria, h(, fem. of foneuth/s,
murderess, Sch.E.Or.260.

fon-eu/w,
murder, kill, tina Hdt.1.35, 211, al., A.Th.340 (lyr.), S.OT716, etc.; c. dupl. acc., [fo/non] f. tina/ Sch.E.Hec.335: abs., kai\ ti/s foneu/ei; S.Ant.1174, cf. El.34:—Pass.,
to be slain, Pi.P.11.17, E.IA1317 (lyr.), Th.8.95. of an animal, e)a\n . . zw=|on . . ti foneu/sh| tina/ Pl.Lg.873e.
stain with blood, fasga/nw| de/rhn E.IA875 (troch.).

fon-h/, h(, always, exc. in Suid., in pl.,
carnage, esp. on the field of battle, a)spai/rontas e)n a)rgale/h|si fonh=|sin Il.10.521; e)n fonai=s kalw=s peso/nt' A.Ag.447 (lyr.); e)n fonai=s peptw=t' a)/qapton S.Ant.696; e)/ti e)n th=|si fonh=|si e)o/ntas Hdt.9.76; komisqe/nta e)k tw=n fonw=n Ael.NA5.1; also of slain beasts, qhri\ maxe/ssasqai e(/likos boo\s a)mfi\ fonh=|sin Il.15.633; e)n fonai=s qhrokto/nois E.Hel.154.
blood shed by slaying, qh=ke/ t' *ai)/gisqon e)n fonai=s laid him weltering
in his blood, Pi.P.11.37, cf. Ael.NA1.18,3.21; fonw=n is prob. for fo/nwn in S.El.11, Tr.558; so e(rpeta\ kai\ da/keta . . u(p' e)ma=s pte/rugos e)n fonai=s o)/llutai come to a
bloody end, Ar.Av.1070 (lyr., paratrag.); poi/w| de\ ka)pelu/sat' e)n fonai=s tro/pw|; what was the manner of her
bloody end? S.Ant.1314; fonai=s
murderously, ib.1003 (expld. as Adj. by Sch., cf. fono/s).
fon-h/s, Arc. for foneu/s, IG5(2).262.26, 30 (Mantinea, v B. C.).

fon-iko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to slay, murderous, ge/nos -w/taton Th.7.29, cf. Pl.Phdr.252c, D.S.18.33, J.BJ2.21.1 (Sup.), Ael.VH14.41 (Comp.), Hierocl. in CA11p.440M., etc.; f. a)di/khma
blood-guiltiness, Lycurg.52; to\ f.
a murderous disposition, Ael.VH2.17, 6.8; oi( -w/tatoi (sc. puretoi/)
most malignant, Hp.Judic.7. Adv. fon-kw=s Demetr.Lac.Herc.1014.37, Poll.6.192; polemei=n Polyaen.4.3.30: Comp. -w/teron J.BJ4.9.10; -wte/rws Lyd. Ost.56.
of murder or
homicide, f. di/kai trials
for homicide, Antipho 4.1.1, Arist.Pol.1275b10; f. no/moi laws
respecting homicide, D.9.44, 21.43; f. dikasth/rion Arist.Pol.1300b24; ta\ f.
murderous acts, homicides, Isoc.4.40, Arist.Pol.1269a1, 1274b24.

fo/n-ios, on, also os, a, on A.Ch.312 (anap.), S.Tr.831 (lyr.), poet.Adj. (cf. foi/nios), the prose form being foniko/s,
bloody, f. stago/nes A.Ch.400 (anap.); trau=ma E.Rh.750 (anap.).
blood-stained, xei=res A.Eu.317 (anap.); f. pe/lekus S.El.99 (anap.); o)/nuc E.Hel.1089, etc.
murderous, deadly, dra/kwn A.Pers.82 (lyr.); plhgh/ Id.Ch.312 (anap.); */ai/+das S.OC1689 (lyr.); o(rma/ Ar.Av.345 (lyr.): metaph., f. a)/lgea Pi. Fr.132; a)/xea E.Ph.1031 (lyr.): gh=ras Id.HF649 (lyr., s. v. l.): neut. pl. as Adv., fo/nia derko/menon Ar.Ra.1337 (lyr.). of actions, etc.,
murderous, a)gw/n E.Or.334 (lyr.), Arist.Fr.674 (pl.); e)/rga f. deeds
of blood, E.El.1178 (lyr.); f. kata/rai ib.1324 (lyr.); for foni/a| nefe/la|, S.Tr.831 (lyr.), v. nefe/lh 1.2.

fono-eidh/s, e/s,
blood-coloured, Zos.Alch.p.216 B.

fono/-eis, essa, en,
sanguinary, fa/lagc Epigr.Gr.874a8 (Cyzicus).

fono-ktone/w,
pollute with murder or
blood, LXXNu.35.33, Ps.105(106).38.

fono-ktoni/a, h(,
deed of murder, ib.1 Ma.1.24.

fono-kto/nos, on,
murdering, slaughtering, Hsch. s.v. foni/ais.

fono-li^bh/s, e/s,
blood-dripping, qro/nos A.Eu.164 (lyr.); f. tu/xa
murder, Id.Ag.1427 (lyr.).

fono/-ru^tos, on,
blood-reeking, Id.Th.938 (lyr.).

fo/nos, o(, (qei/nw)
murder, slaughter, teu/casa po/sei fo/non Od.11.430; toi/sdessi fo/non kai\ kh=ra futeu/ei 2.165; f. r(a/ptein 16.379; mermhri/zein 2.325; o(rmai/nein 4.843; smikrh=|si fo/non fe/rei o)rni/qessi Il. 17.757, etc.; fo/non pra/ssein Pi.N.3.46; a)kou/sion f. e)cerga/sasqai Pl. Lg.869a; bouleu=sai/ tini S.Aj.1055; e)/qou fo/non Id.OC542 (lyr.); e)kpori/zein E.Ion 1114; of arrows, f. prope/mpein S.Ph.105; to\n *dwrie/os pro\s *)egestai/wn fo/non e)kprh/casqai exact vengeance for the
killing . . , Hdt.7.158; kata\ zw/|wn fo/nou kai\ mh\ fo/nou w(=de e)/xei
killing or not-
killing, Democr.257; in poet. phrases, f. suri/zein, kinu/resqai, pnei=n, A.Pr.357 (s. v.l.), Th.123 (lyr.), Ag.1309; f. tino/s the
murder of . . , Id.Eu.580, etc.; f. *(ellhniko\s me/gistos
slaughter of Greeks, Hdt.7.170; o(/maimos au)qe/nths f. A.Eu.212; patrw=|os S.El.955; polu/kerws, a)/rneios f., Id.Aj. 55,309; e)pi\ fo/nw| pra/sseis fo/non E.Or.1579, cf. HF1084 (lyr.); ge/rwn f. mhke/t' e)n do/mois te/koi A.Ch.805 (lyr.), etc.; o( u(po\ *qh/bhs *)aleca/ndron f. Plu.2.856a; o( kata\ tw=n politw=n f. D.S.19.8: pl., fo/noi t' a)ndroktasi/ai te Od.11.612 (personified in Hes.Th.228); e)/mfuloi f. a)ndrw=n Thgn.51, cf. S.OC962. in law,
murder, homicide, dika/zein tou\s basile/as ai)tiw=n fo/nou Lex Dracontis ap.IG12.115.12; fo/nou diw/kein tina/ Antipho 6.9; dika/zein di/kas fo/nou Id.5.11; paradou=nai fo/nou di/khn Id.6.42; a(lw=nai Id.5.59, etc.; feu/gein Lycurg. 133 (poet., pai/dwn fo/non feu/gousa fleeing from . . E.Med.795); e)/noxoi
tw=| fo/nw| Antipho 1.11; fo/nou u(po/dikos D.54.25; fo/nou kaqaro/s, a(gno/s, Pl.R.451b, Lg.759c: a)kou/sios f. D.23.72; fo/nwn a)pe/xesqai Ar.Ra.1032 (anap.); ai( tw=n f. di/kai Pl.Lg.778d; fo/noi . . fo/nois deo/menoi kaqai/resqai ib.870c, al.; lagxa/nontai ai( tou= f. di/kai pro\s [to\n basile/a] Arist.Ath.57.2.
death as a punishment, f. prokei=sqai dhmo/leuston S.Ant.36.
blood when shed, gore, a)\m fo/non, a)\n ne/kuas Il.10.298; ke/at' e)n fo/nw| 24.610; e)reugo/menoi fo/non ai(/matos 16.162; f. ke/xutai gunai/kwn Alc.Fr.153 Lobel; fo/non keu/qein Emp. 100.4; me/lani r(ai/nwn fo/nw| pedi/on Pi.I.8(7).55; fo/nou khki/s A.Ch. 1012; e)mou=sa qro/mbous ou(\s a)fei/lkusas fo/nou Id.Eu.184; stago/nes S.OT1278; stalagmoi/ E.Hec.241; xei=ra xrai/nesqai fo/nw| S.Aj.43; of a sacrifice, taurei/ou fo/nou A.Th.44; *(/ellhn ou(= katasta/zei f. E.IT72; rarely in Prose of
blood, Hp.Morb.2.73.
corpse, pri\n i)/dw to\n *(ele/nas fo/non . . kei/menon E.Or.1357 (lyr.); e)pi\ fo/nw| xamaipetei= matro/s ib.1491 (lyr.).
rascal that deserves death, gallowsbird, a Dorian phrase, EM662.4. of the agent or instrument of slaughter, fo/non e)/mmenai h(rw/essi to be
a death to heroes, Il. 16.144, cf. Od.21.24; of poison, Mim.Oxy.413.180; e)n fo/nw| maxai/ras LXX Ex.17.13, De.13.15(16), 20.13; without e)n, Nu.21.24. = a)traktuli/s, Thphr.HP6.4.6.

fono/s, h(,
murderess, ta\n *peli/ao fono/n Pi.P.4.250 (fo/non codd.). fono/s, h/, o/n,
murderous, dub. in S.Ant.1003 (v. fonh/ 11).

fonourgo/s, o/n,
murderous, Sch.rec.S.El.1150.

fono/w,
stain with blood, pefonwme/non e)/gxos Opp.C.4.192.

entryFree.sense: = foneu/s, only in compds., e.g. *)argei-, broto-fo/nths, etc.

div0.entryFree:
fonw/dhs, es,
like blood, o)smh\ f. a smell
as of blood, Thphr.HP6.4.6.
bloodthirsty, LXX 4 Ma.10.17; ble/pein fonw=de/s ti Alciphr. 3.21. Medic.,
deadly, malignant, pureto/s Hp.Morb.2.67.

foci=nos, o(, a river-fish, perh.
minnow, Arist.HA567a31, 568a21, Mnesim.4.33 (anap.).

foci/xeilos [i^], on,
narrowing towards the lip, narrower at the brim than below, ku/lic Semon.27.

foco/s, h/, o/n,
pointed, foco\s e)/hn kefalh/n he was
peaked in the head, had a
sugar-loaf head, Il.2.219, cf. Hp.Epid.6.1.2, Arist. Phgn.812a8, AP10.8 (Arch.), Sor.1.102, Gal.UP9.17; [ku/likes] focai\ to\ xei=los (cf. foreg.) Ath.11.480d.

foco/ths, htos, h(,
pointedness, tapering shape of head, Gal.17(1).822.

fora/, Ion. forh/, h(: (fe/rw):—A. as
an act, (from Act.)
carrying, fora=s . . fqo/nhsis ou) genh/setai there shall be no refusal
to carry thee, S.Tr.1212; e)n fora=|, i. e. in
their arms, Id.Fr.327; qurw/toin fora=s payment
for carrying . . , IG42(1).102.305 (Epid., iv B. C.); yh/fou f.
casting one's vote, E.Supp.484, cf. Pl.Lg.949a; h( f. kaqa/per pettw=n
movement as of the men in draughts, ib.739a.
gestation, trieth\s f. cj. in IG42(1).121.10 (Epid., iv B. C.).
bringing in of money,
payment, xrhma/twn Th.1.96; dasmou=, dasmw=n, Pl.Lg. 706b, X.Cyr.8.6.16; ai( u(po/loipoi forai/ the remaining
instatments, Lys.Fr.1.4, cf. Ostr.Bodl.iii 280 (i A. D.), al. f. e)rga/tou, =
latura, perh. a workman's
pay, Gloss. (latura is also glossed fo/retron, ibid.; also
onus, sarcina, ibid.).
fare, freight, po/sh tis h( f.; Eup.271, cf. Ar.Fr.300.
bringing forth, productiveness, karpou= Thphr.CP3.14.5; opp. a)fori/a, Pl.R.546a, cf. Arist.GA750a23; of animals, Ael.NA17.40; pthnw=n Gp.1.8.9. (from Pass. fe/romai)
being borne or
carried along, motion, of the universe and heavenly bodies. h( . . qei/a tou= o)/ntos f. Pl.Cra.421b, cf. Ti.39b, 81a; h( su/mpasa ou)ranou= o(do\s kai\ f. Id.Lg.897c; h( tw=n a)/strwn f. kai\ h(li/ou Id.Grg.451c; a)/strwn forai/ Id.Smp.188b; xeirw=n f. Hp.Prog.4; sfai/ras forai/ Pl.Lg.898b; h( f. kai\ ki/nhsis Id.Cra.434c, Tht.152d; xro/nos . . me/tron fora=s Id.Def.411b; tu/xh f. a)dh/lou ei)s a)/dhlon ibid.; defined by Arist. as = ki/nhsis kata\ to/pon, Ph.243a8, cf. GC319b32; ki/nhsi/s poqe/n poi Id.EN1174a30; ge/nesi/s poqe/n poi Id.Cael.311b33; fora=| i)e/nai Pl.R.617b; kuklei=sqai . . th\n au)th\n f. ib.a; mi/an fora\n kinei=tai Id.Plt.269e; to/ ta/xos th=s f. Epicur.Ep.1p.10U.
range, f. a)konti/ou Antipho 3.2.5.
rapid motion, rush, pine/tw kata\ fora\n h(mikotu/lion let him drink half a cotyle at a
draught, Hp.Int.35; gastro\s forai/ Thphr.Fr.10.3. of persons,
impulse, h( tou= plh/qous f. Plb.10.4.3; a)/logos f. Id.30.2.4; a)kolouqh/somen a)lo/gws tai=s tw=n pollw=n f. Epicur.Nat.127 G.; pro\s to\n newterismo/n Plu.Galb.4; pai=s . . fora=s mesto/s Id.Them.2; strathgo\s mesto\s fora=s Lib.Or.49.19: pl., ib.1.2; also,
forceful flow of narrative, Luc.Dem.Enc.7.
tendency, line of thought or action, kata\ ta\s f. tw=n *stwi+kw=n on Stoic
lines, Phld.Rh.2.296 S., cf. Id.Herc.1251.19, Luc.Par.29. f. pragma/twn
force of circumstances, D.18.271:
forceful quality, h( tou= oi)/nou [u(gro/ths] f. e)/xei pollh\n kai\ du/namin Plu.2.132e; fora=s swmatikh=s ei)s h(ma=s gignome/nhs, of the
influences of the stars, Plot.2.3.2; a)/xris ou(= f. ge/nhtai, of a
favourable wind, Plu.Mar. 37;
favour, tou= basile/ws Philostr.VS2.32.
time, occasion, pe/nte h)\ e(\c fora\s to\n mh=na Dsc.Eup.2.2 (interpol.), cf. Tz.H.13.58. as
a thing, that which is borne, esp.,
load, freight, burden, mi/an f. e)negkei=n Plu.Ant.68.
rent, tribute, X.Cyr. 3.1.34: pl.,
contributions, D.21.101; fe/ronta swthri/as fora\n plh/rh th=| patri/di Id.25.21; of the
contribution to an e)/ranos, Antiph.124.9, Hyp.Ath.11; of
contributions in kind, oi)/nou forh\ e)s ta\ yukth/ria SIG57.44 (Milet., v B. C.).
that which is brought forth, fruit, produce, crop, katanoh/sas e)laiw=n fora\n e)some/nhn
a large crop, Arist. Pol.1259a11, cf. HA553a22,b23; si/tou f. kai\ tw=n a)/llwn karpw=n SIG 589.30 (Magn.Mae., ii B. C.); h( tou= *nei/lou f. te kai\ au)/chsis CPHerm. 6.4 (iii A. D.): metaph., fora\ prodotw=n
a large crop of traitors, D.18.61, D.S.16.54; r(hto/rwn Aeschin.3.234; f. ga/r ti/s e)stin e)n toi=s ge/nesin a)ndrw=n
a succession of crops, Arist.Rh.1390b25.

fora/dhn [a^], Dor. fono-a/dan, Adv.
borne along, borne or
carried in a litter or the like , as a sick person, E.Andr.1166 (anap.), Rh.888 (anap.), IG42(1).122.27 (Epid., iv B. C.); f. h)=lqon oi)/kade D.54.20; f. a)nakomi/zesqai, e)kkomi/zesqai, D.C.56.45, Luc.DMort.14.5; e)n klinidi/w| f. komisqei/s Plu.Cor.24.
with rushing motion, violently, S. OT1310 (anap.).
fora/dion, to/, Dim. of fora/s 11, POxy.922.9 (vi A. D.), PKlein.Form.1096 (vi A. D.).
forakiw/dhs, v. farkidw/dhs.

fora/s, a/dos, h(,
fruitful, Thphr.HP4.16.2. Subst.,
brood-mare, PHolm.2.32, 9.11, PLond.1821.81, Hsch.

forb-a^diko/s, h/, o/n,
characteristic of the 'herd', o(/son e)/nesti th=| yuxh=| f. kai\ a)gelai=on kai\ a)cu/neton lo/gou Plu.2.713b.
forb-ai/a, h(, late form of forbeia/, LXXJb.40.20(25), Hsch.

forb-ai=os, a, on,
giving pasture, o)/rh Call.Lav.Pall.50.
forb-a/mwn [a_], onos, o(, h(, = forba/s 1, Hymn.Is.9.

forb-a/s, a/dos, o(, h( （fe/rbw)
giving pasture or
food, f. gai=a
bounteous earth, S.Ph.700 (lyr.); but f. gh= land
that nourished me, Id.Fr.300.
out at grass, grazing, forba/des i(/ppoi, opp. trofi/ai (horses kept in the stable), Arist.HA604a22; pw=los o(/pws a(/ma mate/ri forba/di E.Ba.167 (lyr.); oi(=on . . pw/lous e)n a)ge/lh| nemome/nous forba/das tou\s ne/ous ke/kthsqe Pl.Lg.666e; ai)/c Nic.Th.925; su/es A.R. 2.1024: abs.,
mare, Opp.C.1.386, Hippiatr.15, Epic. in BKT5(1).112. metaph. of
women who support themselves by prostitution, Pi.Fr.122.15, S.Fr.720, cf. Poll.7.203.
forb-a^si/a, h(, = forbeia/ 1, Suid.

forb-eia/, h(, (fe/rbw), written forbea/ PCair.Zen.781.16 (iii B. C.), Sor.Fasc.14, al.; forbe/a cod. Hsch.; also forbai/a (q. v.):—
halter by which a horse is tied to the manger, th=s e)pifatnidi/as f. X.Eq.5.1; periezw=sqai th\n f. Arist.Pol.1324b16; oi( i(/ppoi a)po\ forbeia=s a)/gontai Str.15.1.52; e)k f. e(/lkein [o)/non] Luc.Asin.51.
mouthband of leather
put like a halter round the lips of fifers or pipers, to assist them in regulating the sound, Ar.V.582 (anap.), Plu.2.456b: hence fusa=| . . forbeia=s a)/ter blows the pipes without this check, i. e. too loud, S.Fr.768. a
bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.39 tit., Sor.l.c., Paul.Aeg.6.92.

forb-h/, h(,
pasture, food, in Hom. only of horses and asses,
fodder, forage, Il.5.202, 11.562; of men, karpou\s e)s f. katati/qesqai Hdt.1.202, cf.4.121, al.; plhrwqe/ntes forbh=s kai\ oi)/nou Id.1.211, cf. S.Ph.43,162 (anap.); of birds of prey, o)/rnisi f. parali/ois genh/setai Id.Aj.1065, cf. Ar.Av.348 (lyr.). metaph.,
fuel, AP5.238 (Paul.Sil.).
fo/rba, Hsch.

fo/rb-ion, to/, a plant,
Salvia Horminum, Gal.12.152; cf. formi/on.
forb-o/n, to/, = forbh/: pl., forba/, ta/, Orph. A.1113; fo/rba Hsch. s.v. fo/rbia.
fo/rb-uta: ou)=la (Elean), Id.

forea_fo/ros or foreia_fo/ros, o(,
litter-bearer, Plu.Galb.25, D.L. 5.73; foriofo/ros, Gloss.
fo/reqron, v. fo/retron.

for-eia/, h(, = bo/rboros, Hdn.Gr.1.291; cf. Lat.
foria.

for-ei=on, to/, (fora/, fe/rw)
litter, sedan-chair, Din.1.36, Plb.30.25.18 (pl.), Sor. 1.49, Plu.Eum.14, D.L.5.41, etc.; written fo/rion, LXX 2 Ma.3.27.
beast of burden, ib.Ge.45.17.
porter's wages, Poll.7.133.
fo/r-ema, atos, to/, later form for fo/rhma, Phot., Suid. s.v. fa/kellos.

fo/r-esis, ews, h(,
wearing of apparel, Id. s.v. tribh/, Sch.Ar.Av.156.

fo/r-etron, to/,
expenses of transport, PCair.Zen.13.2 (iii B. C.), Wilcken Chr.30i7 (iii/ii B. C.), Ostr.Bodl. ii 14 (ii/i B. C.), Poll.7.133, etc.; also fo/reqron, Gloss.

for-eu/s, gen. e/ws, Ep. h=os, o(,
bearer, carrier, Il.18.566, A.R.1.132.
litter-bearer, Plu.Art.22. [i(/ppos] f.
pack-horse,
sumpter-horse, Id.Aem.19.
for-eu/w, = sq., Hsch.

for-e/w, Ep. subj. 3sg. fore/h|si Od.5.328, 9.10; Ep. inf. forh=nai (as if from *fo/rhmi) Il.2.107, 7.149, Od.17.224; forh/menai Il.15.310: impf. e)fo/reo<*>n Od.22.456, 3sg. e)fo/rei Il.4.137; Ion. fore/eskon 2.770, 13.372: fut. forh/sw Scol.9 (cf. Ar.Lys.632), X.Vect.4.32; later fore/sw LXX Pr.16.23: aor. e)fo/rhsa IG42(1).121.95 (Epid., iv B. C.), Call.Dian. 213, Ep. fo/rhsa Il.19.11, (dia-, e)k-) Is.6.43,42; later e)fo/resa LXX Si.11.5, f.l. in Is.4.7, Aristid.Or.48(24).80, Sammelb.7247.33 (iii/iv A. D.):—Med., fut. forh/somai Hsch.; in pass. sense, Plu.2.398d: aor. e)forhsa/mhn （e)c-) Is.6.39:—Pass., Aeol. pres. forh/meqa Alc.18.4: aor. e)forh/qhn （e)n-) Plu.2.703b: pf. pefo/rhmai Pl.Ti.52a; plpf. pefo/rhto Orph.A.816:—Frequentat. of fe/rw, implying
repeated or
habitual action, i(/ppoi oi(\ fore/eskon a)mu/mona *phlei/+wna Il.2.770, cf. 10.323; ta/ te nh=es fore/ousi Od.2.390; of a slave, u(/dwr e)fo/rei 10.358, cf. Il.6.457; me/qu oi)noxo/os f. Od.9.10; qallo\n e)ri/foisi f. 17.224; of the wind,
bear to and fro, bear along, a)/nemos a)/xnas fore/ei Il.5.499, cf. 21.337, Od.5.328; sw/mata . . ku/maq' a(lo\s . . fore/ousi 12.68; to/fra de/ m' ai)ei\ ku=ma f. 6.171; so a)ggeli/as e)fo/ree
conveyed messages
habitually, served as a messenger. Hdt.3.34 (nisi leg. e)sefo/ree）; f. qrepth/ria, of Oedipus
carrying about food in a wallet, like a beggar, S.OC1262; lo/gxan e)/th e)fo/rhse e(\c e)n ta=| gna/qw| IG42(1).121.95 (Epid . . iv B. C.): abs., e)g gastri\ e)fo/rei tri/a e)/th
was pregnant, ib. 14:—Pass., v. infr.11. most commonly of clothes, armour, and the like ,
bear constantly, wear, [skh=ptron] e)n pala/mh|s f. dikaspo/loi Il. 1.238; mi/trhs h(\n e)fo/rei 4.137; qw/rhc xa/lkeos, o(\n fore/eske 13.372, cf. Od.15.127, Hdt.1.71, etc.; f. e)sqh/mata S.El.269; stola/s Id.OC 1357; zeu=gos e)mba/dwn Ar.Eq.872; i(ma/tion Id.Pl.991, Pl.Tht.197b; daktu/lion Ar.Pl.883. of features, qualities, etc., of mind or
body,
possess, hold, bear, a)glai/+as f. to be pompous or splendid, Od.17.245; f. o)/noma S.Fr.658; h)=qos Id.Ant.705; do/can Arch.Pap. 1.220 (ii B. C.); e(/na gomfi/on mo/non f. Ar.Pl.1059; glw=ttan Pl.Com. 51; a)po/noian forei=s you are mad, PGrenf.1.53.15 (iv A. D.); with gen. or adj. added, ske/lea f. gera/nou Hdt.2.76; i)sxura\s f. ta\s kefala/s Id.3.12, cf. 101; podw/kh to\n tro/pon f. Trag.Adesp.519; ge/neion dihlife\s f. S.Fr.564; u(po/pteron de/mas f. E.Hel.619; lh=ma qou/rion f. Ar.Eq.757; r(u/gxos f. u(/eion Anaxil.11; kala/mina ske/lh f. Pl. Com.184; w(/sper se/linon ou)=la ta\ ske/lh f. Com.Adesp.208; to\ sto/m' w(s komyo\n f. Alex.98.21 (troch.).
bear, suffer, Phld.Lib.pp.59,62O. (dub. l. in both), Plu.2.692d, Opp.C.1.298. of Time,
extend, last, a(\ forei= e)pi\ h(me/ras dekape/nte dub. sens. in PFlor.384.54 (v A. D.). Pass.,
to be borne along, e)n r(oqi/ois A.Th. 362 (lyr.); forou/menos pro\s ou)=das S.El.752; ko/nis d' a)/nw forei=q' ib. 715; a)/nw te kai\ ka/tw f. E.Supp.689; polloi=s diau/lois kuma/twn f. Id.Hec.29, cf. Plu.2.398d; peforhme/non a)ei/ always
in motion, Pl.Ti. 52a: hence,
to be storm-tossed, na=i+ forh/meqa su\n melai/na| Alc.18.4, cf. Ar.Pax144; possi\ f. Theoc.1.83, cf. Bion 1.23: metaph., do/cais forei=tai topazo/mena Pl.Epin.976a.
to be carried away, Th.2.76; simply,
to be shifted, Dam.Pr.293. Med.,
fetch for oneself, fetch regularly, E.El.309; leukani/hnde foreu/menos
putting food into
one's mouth, A.R.2.192.

for-hdo/n, Adv.
bearing like a bundle, f. a)/rasqai/ ti Luc.Tim.21.

fo/r-hma, atos, to/,
that which is carried, load, S.Ph.474; f. fruga/nwn Aen.Tact.29.7; metaph.,
burden, A.Fr.392, E.Fr.643; a)/shron f. Hp.Art.35; oi(=on f. o( fo/bos X.Cyr. 3.1.25, cf. Hier.8.10.
that which is worn, Poll.7.95: hence of ornament or dress, bouba/lia, karpw=n . . forh/mata
worn upon the wrists, Diph.59; h( xlai=na h(rwi+ko\n f. Ammon.Diff.p.140 V., cf. Phld.Piet.17, D.H.2.72, Plu.Dem.30, Luc.Dem.Enc.21; skh=ptron, basiliko\n f. Corn.ND9, etc. of a harp, Paus.9.30.2. = Lat.
ferculum, as borne in triumphs, Plu.Sull.38, Luc.37. collect. for oi( forei=s, Plb.8.29.7.
for-h/menai, for-h=nai, v. fore/w.

fo/r-hsis, ews, h(,
wearing, tw=n pilwtw=n D.H.2.64; i(mati/ou Aeschin.Socr. 41. = fora/ A. 11,
being borne, D.H.2.49.

for-hte/os, e/a, e/on,
bearable, kaka/ Procop.Goth.23.

for-htiko/s, h(, o/n,
producing motion, f. ai)qe/rios ou)si/a Theo Sm.p.149 H.

for-hto/s, h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n E. Hipp.443, Luc.Salt.27:
borne, carried, forhta\ kuma/tessin Pi.Fr. 88.1; f. u(/dwr Str.3.2.8; f. u(po\ (v.l. e)pi\） delfi/nwn Plu.2.163c; of the planets, Poll.4.156.
to be carried, moveable, oi)ki/ai Ph.2.238; i(ero/n ib.146: metaph., a)/statos kai\ f.
constantly moving, Id.1.219; [fu/sis] meta/bolos kai\ f. Plu.2.428b; to\ th=s fu/sews f. Hierocl. in CA7p.429M.
bearable, endurable, A.Pr.979; *ku/pris ga\r ou) forhto/s E.l.c.; forhto\s h( w)|dh/ Luc. l.c., cf. Tim.23, Jul.Gal. 201e; e)mbolh\ ou) f.
irresistible, Arr.Tact.12.10.
fori/: to\n u(pe\r tou= a)grou= si=ton, Hsch. (cf. foriko/s).

fo/rigges, ai(,
truffles, Hsch.

foriko/s, h/, o/n, (fo/ros)
rendered as tribute, si=tos PPetr.2p.62 (iii B. C.); o)/lura PTeb.823.11 (ii B. C.); neut. pl. forika/ POxy.807 (i B. C./ i A. D.).

fori/nh [i_], h(,
skin or
hide of pachydermatous animals, esp. of
swine, Hp.
Acut.(Sp.)50, Ath.9.381c, etc.; of the rhinoceros, Ael. NA17.44; of the ox, Eust.1915.13; of the chamaeleon, Ael.NA4.33; of the tortoise's
shell, dub. in S.Ichn.303: also of
human skin, Antipho Soph.33, Aristomen. 10; metaph., f. paxei=an fe/rwn 'thick-
skinned', Plu.2.57a.
fat, nenhme/nhn xoi=ron pollh=s f. Herod. 4.16.
fo/rion, foriofo/ros, v. forei=on, foreafo/ros.

fo/rkes, ai(, = Lat.
furcae, Hsch.

forki/des [i^], i/dwn, ai(,
the daughters of Phorcys, the three Graiae, A.Pr.794; also title of play by A.
fo/rkos, o(, = *fo/rkus, Pi.P.12.13, S.Fr.861, Lyc.477. = *)/erebos, Phanocl.1.20.
fo/rku_s, u_nos, o(, = sq., Od.1.72, al. (alwaysin gen.), Palaeph.31. = *fo/rkos 11, Euph.94.

fo/rku_s, u^os, o(,
Phorcys, a sea-god, son of Pontus and Gaia, Hes. Th.270.

formalei/a, h(, = Lat.
formula, POxy.1115.12 (iii A. D.); also written formari/a, PMasp.50.11 (vi A. D.), al., and perh. froumari/a, POxy. 43r ii 11, al. (iii A. D.).

formhdo/n, Adv., (formo/s)
like mat-work or
wattling, cross-wise, cu/la . . f. a)nti\ toi/xwn tiqe/ntes setting up planks
arranged cross-wise, Th.2.75; f. e)pi\ a(ma/cas e)pibalo/ntes (sc. tou\s nekrou/s) Id.4.48, cf. Ph.2.530, Aristid.2.312J.
formigkta/s, v. formikth/s.

fo/rm-igc, iggos, h(,
lyre, freq. in Hom., esp. as the instrument of Apollo, fo/rmiggos perikalle/os h(\n e)/x' *)apo/llwn Il.1.603, cf. 24.63, Od.17.270, Hes.Sc.203; of Achilles, fre/na terpo/menon fo/rmiggi ligei/h| kalh=| daidale/h| Il.9.186; with seven strings (after Terpander's time), e(pta/ktupos, e(pta/glwssos, Pi.P.2.71, N.5.24; a)ntiya/llwn e)lefanto/deton f. Ar.Av.219 (anap.). f. a)/xordos, metaph. for a
bow, Arist.Rh.1413a1.

form-i/zw,
play the fo/rmigc, Il.18.[605], Od.1.155, 4.18, 8.266. c. acc.,
sing to the lyre of a thing, Hermesian.7.48.
form-ikth/r, h=ros, o(, = sq., Nonn.D.24.238.

form-ikth/s, ou=, Dor. form-mikta/s, o(,
lyre-player, of Orpheus, Pi.P.4.176 (v.l. -igkta/s); of Apollo, Ar.Ra.231 (lyr.); of Arion, AP9.308 (Bianor).

form-ikto/s, h/, o/n,
sung to the fo/rmigc, kai\ peza\ kai\ f. (sc. me/lh) S.Fr.16.

form-i/on, to/, Dim. of formo/s,
mat, Hippon.137.
faggot, D.L.4.3. = fo/rbion (which is v. l.), Paul.Aeg.7.3.

form-i/s, i/dos, h(, Dim. of formo/s,
small basket, Ar.V.58, Alex.310; used for fishing, Arist.HA547a2.
form-i/skion, to/, = foreg., Poll.7.173.
form-i/skos, o(, = foreg., Pl.Ly.206e, EM798.51.

formo-koite/w,
sleep on a mat, Com.Adesp.1191.

formo-rra^fe/omai, Pass.,
to be stitched like a mat, to be hampered, a word of Demosth. ridiculed by Aeschin.3.166.

formo-rra^fi/s, i/dos, h(,
needle for sewing mats with, Aen.Tact.18.10.

formo/s, o(, (fe/rw)
basket for carrying corn, etc., Hes.Op.482, IG12.334.10, PSI4.332.13 (iii B. C.); f. ya/mmou plh/rees Hdt.8.71; f. plhrou/menoi ya/mmou Aen.Tact.32.2; f. a)xu/rwn sesagme/noi Plb.1.19.13, cf. Poll.7.174; prov., o( e)n *aukei/w| to\n formo\n dou/s 'a friend in need is a friend indeed', Arist.Rh.1385a28.
mat, Hdt.3.98, Ar.Pl. 542 (anap.), Thphr.HP2.6.11; f. sxoi/ninos Ar.Fr.172.
seaman's cloak of coarse plaited stuff, Theoc.21.13, Paus.10.29.8.
a measure of corn, Lys.22.5; f. purw=n Ar.Th.813 (anap.).
sieve, dia\ formou= e)kqli/yas Dsc.1.35.

formosi/kwn, wnos, o(,
obese, corpulent, Hsch.

formofor-e/w,
carry baskets or
faggots, to be a porter, D.C.52.25.

formo/for-os (parox.), o(,
porter, Epicur.Fr.172: oi( f., name of a play by Hermippus.

formu/nios, o(, a kind of
fig, Androt., Philipp., or Hegem. ap. Ath. 3.75d.

forolog-e/w,
levy tribute from, polla\ me/rh th=s *sikeli/as Plb.1.8.1, cf. D.S.5.32, Str.2.5.8, Plu.Sull.24: abs., Poll.4.28, Jul.Or.7.224b; c. dat., forologh/sousin au)tw=| polloi/ Heph.Astr.1.1:—Pass.,
to be subject to tribute, SIG344.83 (Teos, Epist.Antigoni), D.S.19.94.

forolo/g-htos, on,
tributary,
tini LXXDe.20.11.

forolog-i/a, h(,
levying of tribute, BGU1010.3 (iii B. C.), PTeb.736.47 (pl., ii B. C.), LXX 1 Ma.1.29, al., Ph.2.326; e)n forologi/a| ei)=nai PRev.Laws33.20 (iii B. C.).
tribute, OGI90.12 (pl., Rosetta, ii B. C.); h( th=s f. e)pau/chsis PTeb.27.46 (ii B. C.).

foro/log-os (parox.), o(,
tax-gatherer, PPetr.3p.304 (iii B. C.), PSI4.362.8 (iii B. C.), LXX Jb.3.18, al., Plu.Pyrrh.23, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.164, Paul.Al.N.1; f. tetta/rwn po/lewn Str.14.1.41.

fo/ron, to/, = Lat.
forum, *)appi/ou f. Act.Ap.28.15, cf. PLond.3.992.13 (vi A. D.), etc.

foro/s, o/n, (fe/rw)
bearing:
bringing on one's way, forwarding; of a wind,
favourable, a)/nemos Plb.1.60.6, 31.15.8; pneu=ma Str. 6.3.5, D.S.14.55, etc.; so in neut. sense,
tending, ka/tw Arist.Pr. 908a24. metaph., ku/bos Luc.Sat.4; pro\s u(gi/eian f.
conducive to health, Str.6.1.12; fora\ kai\ sunerga\ pro\s a)reth/n Plu.2.5c.
productive, fruitful, gh= Thphr.CP3.20.3; of a woman, Hp.Mul.1.40: c. gen., M.Ant.8.15. Adv. forw=s, c. dat.,
conformably to, pla/ttousi i)/dia f. th=| kataskeuh=| th=s do/chs Phld.Sign.38; also pro\s th\n do/can ib.26; tre/pousin to\ swma/tion f. ei)s a)rrwsti/as Id.Ir.p.29W.

fo/ros, o(, (fe/rw)
that which is brought in by way of payment, tribute, fo/rou a)pagwgh/ Hdt.1.6,27, cf. IG12.65.2, al., Th.1.96, etc.; cumma/xous fo/rou u(potelei=s subject to pay
tribute, Id.1.56; fo/ron u(potele/ein to pay
tribute, Hdt.1.171, cf. Isoc.12.116; a)pa/gein Ar.V.707 (anap.); fe/rein Id.Av.191, X.An.5.5.7, Ath.2.1; po/leis a(\s oi( i)diw=tai e)ne/grayan f. fe/rein IG12.212.88; f. ta/casqai to agree to pay
it Hdt.3.13; fo/ron tai=s po/lesi ta/cai to fix their quotas of
tribute, And.4.11, cf. Isoc.4.120, D.23.209, Aeschin.2.23; f. de/xesqai to receive
it, Th.1.96 (of the *(ellhnotami/ai), cf. X.Ath.3.2; f. prosh/|ei
it came in, And. 3.9; to\n f. a)po\ tw=n po/lewn to\n prosio/nta Ar.V.657 (anap.): pl., fo/roi h(/kousin Id.Ach.505, cf. Eq.313 (troch.): o( basiliko\s f., at Sparta, Pl.Alc.1.123a. generally,
any payment, fo/ron a)pe/feron tw=| dh/mw| X.Smp.4.32; kata\ fo/rous by
instalments, Senatus consultum ap.Plb.18.44.7; e)piballein f. impose a
forced levy, Plu. Ant.24.

foro-telh/s, e/s,
subject to tribute, PFlor.294.42 (vi A. D.).

foro-fore/w,
pay a contribution, GDI1938.21 (Delph., ii B. C.).

forta^gwg-e/w,
carry loads or
burdens, Longin.43.4.

forta^gwg-o/s, o/n,
for carrying loads, kibwtoi/ Aen.Tact.29.4; [nau=s] f. a ship
of burden, Sch.Od.5.250.

fo/rtac, a_kos, o(,
carrier, porter, Com.Adesp.102.
cargovessel, BGU1807.3,8 (i B. C.). like fortiko/s,
a tiresome fool or
knave, Numen. ap. Eus.PE14.7.
forthg-e/w, = fortagwge/w, toi=si ploi/oisi Hdt.2.96; of beasts of burden, Luc.Asin.33.

forthg-i/a, h(,
conveyance of cargo, opp. nauklhri/a and para/stasis, Arist.Pol.1258b23.

forthg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for carrying loads, ploi=a f. ships
of burden, merchantmen, Th.6.88, X.HG5.1.21. f. brw/mata provisions
such as are used in these ships, i. e. sorry fare, Dionys.Com.2.42.

forthg-o/s, o(,
one who carries cargoes, merchant, Thgn.679, Simon.178: as Adj., nauba/ths f. A.Fr. 263; a)/ndres f. Metag.4 (hex.); a)/katoi Critias Fr.2.12D.; nh=es Plb. 1.52.6, 5.68.4, etc.; ploi=a D.S.14.55, 20.85.

fortia_fo/ros, o(,
porter, Gloss.

fort-i/zw,
load, forti/sas to\n o)/non Babr.111.3; forti/a f. tina/s
load them
with burdens, Ev.Luc.11.46; perissh=| dapa/nh| f. ta\ koina/ Dörner
Erlass des Statthalters von Asia Paullus Fabius Persicus 16; u(dati\s -i/zousa to\n o)fqalmo/n
encumbering, Paul.Aeg.6.14; au)xe/na f. Aenigma Sphingis (ap.Sch.E.Ph.50):—Med., ta\ mei/ona forti/zesqai
ship the smaller part of one's wealth, Hes.Op.690; fortiou/menos me/li
to carry away a load of honey, Macho ap.Ath.13.582f:
metaph., futeu/ein kai\ f. Phld.Vit.p.33J.—Pass.,
to be heavy laden, pefortisme/nos Ev.Matt.11.28, cf. Luc.Nav.45.

fort-i^keu/omai,
jest vulgarly, Sch.Ar.Ra.13.

fort-i^ko/s, h/, o/n: (fo/rtos):—prop.
fit for carrying, ploi=on f. a ship
of burden, D.C.56.27, v.l. in Th.6.88.
of the nature of a burden: metaph. (cf. fo/rtos 11),
tiresome, wearisome, to/ le/gein . . f. kai\ e)paxqe/s D.5.4; toi=s sunou=si f. Plu.2.456e, cf. 44a, etc.; f. a)kolou/qwn o)/xlw| because of the crowd . . , Luc.Nigr.13; -wta/th leitourgi/a
most onerous, POxy.904.9 (v A. D.).
coarse, vulgar, common, a)/ndres Ar.Nu.524; opp. pepaideume/nos, Arist.Pol. 1342a20; oi( polloi\ kai\ -w/tatoi, opp. oi( xari/entes, Id.EN1095b16; bwmolo/xoi kai\ f. ib.1128a5; f. kai\ neo/ploutos Plu.2.708c. of things, f. kwmw|di/a a
vulgar, low comedy, Ar.V.66, cf. Pl.Phdr.236c; f. to\ xwri/on Ar.Lys.1218; f. ge/lws Com.Adesp.644; di/aita -wte/ra kai\ a)filo/sofos Pl.Phdr.256b; h(donh\ f. Id.R.581d; f. kai\ dhmhgorika/
base, low arguments,
ad captandum vulgus, Id.Grg.482e; f. me\n kai\ dikanika/, a)lhqh= de/ Id.Ap.32a; tw=| f. prosxrh=sqai Id.Cra. 435c; -w/tero/n ti e)rh/somai Id.Euthd.286e; f. e)/painos Arist.EN1178b16; h( <pro\s> a(/panta mimoume/nh [te/xnh] fortikh/ art that imitates with a view to any and every man is
vulgar, Id.Po.1462a4; le/gw ou) tou= f. e(/neka I do not say it out of
vulgar arrogance, Aeschin.1.41; of an inflated rhetorical style, f. kataskeuh/ D.H.Lys.3; to\ f. th=s le/cews
vulgarity of style, Id.Th.27; to\ f. kai\ stratiwtiko/n, of the speeches of Iphicrates, Id.Lys.12; to\ f. tw=n me/trwn Luc.JTr. 14. Adv. -ikw=s
coarsely, vulgarly, skopei=n Pl.Tht.183e, cf. R. 367a; f. e)painei=n ib.528e; f. kai\ xu/dhn le/gein Isoc.12.24; f. politeu/esqai Id.7.53; f. kai\ sobarw=s Plu.2.634c; -w/teron h)\ filosofw/teron diale/gesqai to discourse
more like a clown than one of liberal education, Id.Sol.3.

fort-i^ko/ths, htos, h(,
vulgarity, bad taste, tw=n a)kroatw=n Arist.Rh.1395b1, cf. Eust.1081.8, 1469.49.
fo/rt-i^mos, h, on, = fortiko/s 1, ploi=on Sch.Ar.Av.599.

fort-i/on, to/,
