load, burden, freight, Sapph.Supp.9.13 (pl.), Alc.Supp.26.1, Ar.Pl.352, Lys.312, X.Mem. 3.13.6, An.7.1.37, al., Lycurg.96, Aq.2 Ki.15.33; libanwtika\ f. OGI132.11 (Alexandria, ii B. C.); fe/rwn a)nqra/kwn f. Ar.Ach.214 (lyr.); f. basta/zein Teles p.10H. pl.,
wares, merchandise, Hes.Op.643, 693, Hdt.1.1, 2.179, al., Ar.Ach.899,910, V.1398, Ra. 573, Hyp.Ath.6. esp. of agricultural
produce, crops, PRev.Laws 43.14, al. (iii B. C.), PTeb.105.24 (ii B. C.), etc. of
a child in the womb, X.Mem.2.2.5; e)/rwtos f.l. in Anacr.170. metaph., mei=zon f. h)\ kaq' au(to\n ai)ro/menon taking too heavy a
burden upon him, D.11.14; me/ga to\ f. Antiph.3; ou)k e)/stin ou)de\n baru/teron tw=n forti/wn . . gunaiko/s Id.329; ou)/toi to\ gh=ra/s e)stin . . tw=n f. me/giston Anaxandr.53; to\ f. mou e)lafro/n e)stin Ev.Matt.11.30; xrusou=n f., of wealth, Secund.Sent.9. (Dim. only in form, commonly used for fo/rtos in Com. and Prose; wrongly condemned as un-Attic by Moer.p.393 P., Thom.Mag.p.16R.）

fort-i/s, i/dos, h(, f. nau=s ship
of burden, merchantman, e)/dafos nho\s . . f. eu)rei/hs Od.5.250, cf. 9.323, Luc.VH1.11, Aret.SD2.13; f. alone, D.S.16.6, Jul.Or.5.159d, etc.

fort-ismo/s, o(,
carrying of loads, Hippiatr.77.

fortobasta/kths, ou, o(,
porter, Sch.Pl.R.600c, Suid. s.v. *prwtago/ras.

fo/rtos, o(, (fe/rw)
load, freight, cargo, Od.8.163, 14.296, Hes.Op. 631, Hdt.1.1, S.Tr.537, and later Prose, as PEnteux.2.11 (iii B. C.), Plu.Marc.14, Luc.VH1.34; e)poih/santo/ me f., expld. as pepragma/teumai, prode/domai, fo/rtos gege/nhmai, Call.Fr.4.10P.; f. e)/rwtos, of Europa on the bull, Batr.78, cf. Nonn.D.4.118. metaph.,
heavy load or
burden, f. xrei/as, kakw=n, E.Supp.20, IT1306; cf. forti/on. Att.,
vulgar stuff, rubbish, balderdash, Ar.Pax748 (anap.) Pl.796.
mass of detail, 'stuff', in semi-colloquial sense, Aret.CD1.4.

forto-sto/los, on, e)mporikou= ploi/ou f.
sending off a freighted merchantman, Man.4.134.

forto-fore/w,
carry a load, cj. for pontopore/w in Plu.Per.26.

forto/w,
load, sfodrw=s o)/non Aesop.322b; ti/ tini Hld.3.5; di/aitan u(perw/|w| katagwgi/w| Lyd.Mag.2.21:—Pass.,
to be burdened, da/krusi pefortwme/nos ta\s o)/yeis ib.3.73; zw=|a - wme/na PAmh.2.150.39 (vi A. D.).
foru/h [u^], h(, name of Titan, Emp.123.3 (from foru/nw(?)).

forukto/s, h/, o/n, (foru/ssw)
stained, ka/lxh| Lyc.864.

foru/nw [u_],
defile, spoil, only impf. Pass., si=to/s te kre/a t' o)pta\ foru/neto Od.22.21; lu/qrw| e)foru/neto gai=a Q.S.2.356, cf. 3.604.

foru/ssw, Act. only in aor. part. and inf., foru/cas, -ai (v.infr.):— Med., aor. e)foru/cato Nic.Th.203:—Pass., pres. foru/ssetai Opp. H.5.269; pf. pefo/rugmai (v. infr.):—
defile, foru/cas ai(/mati Od.18.336; u(/dati foru/cai
mix up, Hp.Mul.1.74; me/liti e(fqw=| foru/canta kai\ furh/santa Id.Steril.221, cf. VM3:—Pass., peforugme/non i)w=| Nic.Th. 302, cf. Q.S.12.550: c. gen., i)ou= Opp.C.1.381; lu/qroio foru/ssetai Id.H.5.269.

foru^to/s, o(,
whatever the wind carries along: hence,
rubbish, such as collects in a farm-yard or a carpenter's shop, su/es e)pi\ forutw=| margai/nousin Democr.147; o(/tan mu/es peri\ forutou= ma/xwntai Thphr. Sign.49, cf. Ar.Ach.72, Com.Adesp.906;
chips or
shavings, Arist. HA628b11, Conon 48.8; cu/lwn f. Aen.Tact.37.2; used for packing earthenware to keep it from breaking, Ar.Ach.927; of the materials of a bird's nest, Arist.HA616a12; brwma/twn f.
a mishmash of all kinds of meat, Alciphr.3.7.
forw, prob. abbreviation of a name of a vessel, e)lai/ou forw a/ PCair.Zen.12.104, cf. 114 (iii B. C.); e)n forw ib. 670.8 (iii B. C.).

fo/ssa_ton, to/, = Lat.
fossatum, boundary, CIG5187b9 (Ptolemais in Cyrenalca, Edict. Anastasii), IGRom.3.1175 (Syria), Suid. s.v. se/deton, Zonar.
foteu/ei: genna=|, Hsch. (Cypr. for futeu/ei).
fou=, to/, = a)gri/a na/rdos, Dsc.1.11. = feu=, Epich.124.
foua/ddei: swmaskei=, Hsch.; also fou/acir (-ae/cier cod.): h( e)pi\ th=s xw/ras (fort. *)orqi/as） swmaski/a tw=n mello/ntwn mastigou=sqai. Id. fou=ai: a)lw/pekes, Id.

fougi/wn, wnos, o(, = Lat.
pugio, dagger, BGU40.3.
fou=ic, = fu/sigc, Hsch. (Lacon. word).
foulbi/n, to/ (?), = sq., PGen.80.13 (iv A. D.).

foulbi=non, to/, = Lat.
pulvinus, cushion, POxy.1290.7 (v A. D.).

foulia=ta, ta/, = Lat.
foliata, a kind of ointment, Gal.6.427,440.

fou/lliklon, to/,
football, Lat.
folliculus, Ath.1.14f.
f<o>ullo/menoi: tillo/menoi (Dorian), Hsch.

foumw=sos, = Lat.
fumosus, turo/s Ath.3.113d.

fou=nda, h(, = Lat.
funda, belly-band, Gloss.
purse, PHamb. 10.34, 38 (ii A. D.).

fourna/kios, a, on,
baked in the oven, Ath.3.113b; so fourni/ths [i_], ou, o(, Archig. ap. Gal.13.264: but fem. forto-i=tis, as epith. of Hecate, is cj. in Hymn.Mag.3.2.

fourno-eidh/s, e/s,
oven-like, ka/minos Zos.Alch.p.173B.

fourno-pla/sths, ou, o(,
potter, gloss on i)pnopla/qhs, Tim.Lex.

fou=rnos, o(, = Lat.
furnus, Ath.3.113c, Erot. s.v. i)pno/s.
fou=sa, Boeot. for fu=sa, aor. 2 part. (fem.) of fu/w, Corinn.21.

fou=ska, h(, = Lat.
posca, sour wine, Aët.3.81, Alex.Trall.5.5.

fo/ws, to/, Ep. = fw=s (q. v.): hence fo/wsde,
to the light, to the light of day, Il.2.309, 19.103, etc.
frage/ll-h, h(, = sq., Sch.Ar.Ach.724.

frage/ll-ion, to/, = Lat.
flagellum, Ev.Jo.2.15. name of a weight, f. sidara= b/ Petersen-Luschan
Reisen in Lykien No.77a (iv A. D.).

fragell-o/w, = Lat.
flagellare, Ev.Matt.27.26, Ev.Marc.15.15.

frag-mi/ths [i_], ou, o(,
growing in hedges, qa/mnos Dsc.1.91; ka/lamos ib.85.

frag-mo/s, o(,
fencing in, blocking up, th=s a)kouou/shs phgh=s S.OT1387.
intestinal obstruction, Cael.Aur.CP3.17.
fence, paling, X.Cyn. 11.4, AP9.343 (Arch.) BGU1119.32 (i B. C.), Ev.Matt.21.33, etc.;
hedge, Aesop.385;
railing of the bridge over the Hellespont, Hdt. 7.36:
fortification, ib.142; of the diaphragm, Hp.Flat.10, Arist.PA 672b20; of the
shard of beetles, ib.682b17; of the teeth, Poll.2.93. metaph.,
partition, Ep.Eph.2.14. nickname of a man
with a bristly beard, Luc.Pseudol.27.
fra/gnu_mi, = fra/ssw, keleu/qous fra/gnu^te AP7.391 (Bass.Loll.); o(dou\s fragnu/ntes J.AJ18.9.1:—Med., Ar.Fr.367, Plu.Phoc.11, Caes. 24, Sert.21.

fra^d-a/zw, (fradh/)
make known, ga=n fra/dasse (poet. aor. 1) Pi. N.3.26.

fra^d-a_th/r, h=ros, o(,
notary, IG14.211, 212 (Acrae).
fra^d-a/w, = bouleu/omai, Hdn.Gr.1.439: but frada/on: e(rmhneu=on, Hsch.
fra^d-eu/w, = frada/zw, Id.

fra^d-h/, h(, poet. Noun,
understanding, knowledge, tw=n de\ mello/ntwn tetu/flwntai fradai/ Pi.O.12.9, cf. Alc.Supp. 2.2.
hint, warning, qeo/qen . . fradai=sin A.Ch.941 (lyr.), cf. E.Ph.667 (lyr.); a)qana/twn fradh=| Theoc.25.52, cf. IG5(2).261.15 (Mantinea, vi B. C.); e(/pou mhnuth=ros a)fqe/gktou fradai=s, i. e. by the scent, A.Eu.245.

fra^d-h/s, e/s (or fra^d-u/s, u/), only found in gen. e/os,
understanding, wise, shrewd, frade/os no/ou Il.24.354. Adv. fra^d-dw=s, = frastikw=s, fanerw=s, Hsch.

fra^d-mosu/nh, h(, poet. Noun,
shrewdness, cunning, in dat. pl. fradmosu/nh|s h.Ap.99, Hes.Op.245, Th.626, etc.; dat. sg. fradmosu/nh| A.R.2.647; cf. frasmosu/nh.
fra^/d-mwn, on, gen. onos, = fradh/s, Il.16.638, Orac. ap. Hdt.3.57, Orph.Fr.233.

fra/zw, S.Ph.25, etc.: poet. impf. fra/zon Pi.N.1.61: fut. fra/sw [a^] A.Pr.781, etc.: aor. 1 e)/fra^sa h.Ven.128, h.Merc.442, Hdt.2.150, etc.; poet. fra/sa [a^] Od.11.22, A.Ag.231 (lyr.); imper. fra/ssate Pi. P.4.117: pf. pe/fra^ka Isoc.5.93, Phld.Po.5.23: Ep. aor. pe/fra^don, e)pe/fradon used by Hom. mostly in 3sg., Il.14.500, al. (in Od.1.273, 8.142, pe/frade is imper.); opt. pefra/doi Il.14.335; inf. pefrade/ein, pefrade/men, Od.19.477, 7.49; 1sg. e)pe/fradon only Il.10.127: also aor. 1 part. gen. fra/dantos dub. in IG5(2).261.15 (Mantinea, vi B. C.):— Med. and Pass., fra/zomai, Ep. imper. fra/zeo, fra/zeu, Il.5.440, 9.251; inf. fra/zesqai Od.1.294: Ep.3sg. impf. fra/zeto, fraze/sketo, 11.624, h.Ap.346: fut. fra/somai [a^] Il.15.234, Ep. fra/ssomai Od.16.238: aor.1 e)fra^sa/mhn 17.161, Ep. fra^sa/mhn 23.75; 3sg. and pl. e)fra/ssato, fra/ssanto, 4.529, Il.15.671; imper. fra/sai Od.24.331, A.Ch.113; Ep. 3sg. subj. fra/ssetai Od.24.217; Ep. inf. fra/ssasqai Orac. ap. Hdt.3.57: aor. Pass. e)fra/sqhn Od.19.485, Hdt.1.84, E.Hec.546: pf. pe/frasmai (in med. sense) A.Supp.438, (in pass. sense) Isoc.15.195; part., pro-pefradme/nos Hes.Op.655.—The aor. Med. is chiefly Ep., also Archil.94, Sol.5.4, 34.1, A.Ch.113, E.Med.653 (lyr.):—
point out, show (never
say, tell, in Hom. acc. to Aristarch.), e)s xw=ron o(\n fra/se *ki/rkh Od.11.22, cf. Il.23.138, Od.15.424; also,
show the way to, show where to find, h(=| oi( *)aqh/nh pe/frade di=on u(forbo/n 14.3, cf. 8.68; sh/mat' . . , ta/ oi( e)/mpeda pe/frad' *)odusseu/s
showed, 19.250; mu=qon pe/frade pa=sin
show, make known the word to all, 1.273, cf. 8.142; dei=ce kai\ e)/frase h.Ven.128; fra/ssate/ moi do/mous
show me them, Pi.P.4.117; e)/frase th\n a)trapo/n Hdt.7.213; ko/poi au)to/matoi fra/zousi nou/sous Hp.Aph.
2.5; dmw/wn dh/ tina . . moi fra/son Theoc.25.47; to\ para/deigma o(\ a)\n fra/zh| o( a)rxite/ktwn IG22.1668.96: abs., fwnh=sai me\n ou)k ei)=xe, th=| de\ xeiri\ e)/fraze Hdt.4.113; a)nti\ fwnh=s fra/ze . . xeri/ A.Ag.1061.
show forth, tell, declare, lo/gon, e)/pos, o)/noma, Pi.O.2.60, A.Pers.173 (troch.), Supp.320; f. toi=si h(/kousi ta\ prh/gmata Hdt.6.100; e(lou= ga/r, h)\ po/nwnta\ loipa/ soi fra/sw safhnw=s, h)\ to\n e)klu/sont' e)me/ A.Pr.781; tipro/s tina Hdt.1.68, Ar.Nu.359 (anap.), etc.: c. dupl. acc., f. tina/ ti Isoc. 15.100; ti Pl.Phdr.267b; peri/ tinos Isoc.15.117 (v. infr.); e)pi/ tinos Id.Ep.6.8: rarely c. gen.,
tell of, th=s mhtro\s h(/kw th=s e)mh=s fra/swn, e)n oi(=s nu=n e)sti S.Tr.1122: folld. by a relat. clause, f. o(/ti . . Lys.1.23, Pl.Phdr.278b, etc.; f. w(s dei= gewrgei=n X.Oec.16.8; f. oi(=' e)porsu/nqh kaka/ A.Pers.267, cf. Pr.995, etc.; with double constr., f. to/ te o)/noma kai\ e)n h(=| kw/mh| oi)kou=sin PRev.Laws 29.5 (iii B. C.): rarely c. part., pefrade/ein po/sin e)/ndon e)o/nta Od.19.477; ou)k e)/frazes sh=s prokei/menon ne/kun gunaiko/s E.Alc.1012: later c. acc. et inf., Phld. l.c.;
explain (opp. le/gw, which means simply
speak, say), fra/son a(/per g' e)/lecas
declare, explain what thou didst say, S.Ph.559; fra/ze dh\ ti/ fh/|s Id.OT655; fra/zousin a(\ le/gei X.An.2.4.18; fra/ze lo/gw| S.Ph.49, Pl.Lg.814c; ou)x a(plw=s ei)pei=n a)lla\ safw=s fra/sai peri\ au)tw=n Isoc.15.117, cf. Ep.1.2; safw=s f. toi=s boulome/nois sunie/nai Aeschin.1.129; of teachers, Antipho 6.13, Pl.Tht.180b; of oracles, Ar.Eq.1048, Pl.46, Pl.Lg.923a, etc.; of letters, Plu.Cic.15: abs., tou=to fra/zei o(/ti this
signifies that . . , X.Smp.8.30.
cultivate style or
phrasing, opp. au)to\ to\ gra/fein, Duris 1 J. c. dat. pers. et inf.,
tell one to do so and so, i(/na ga/r sfin e)pe/fradon h)gere/qesqai Il. 10.127; dh\ ga/r moi e)pe/frade . . *ki/rkh (sc. i)e/nai) Od.10.549; toi=s a)nqrw/poisi f. siga=n Ar.Pax98 (anap.); ta\ o(/pla u(polabei=n Th.6.58, cf. 3.15. abs.,
give counsel, advise, suggest, do/los h)=n o( fra/sas S.El.197 (lyr.). Med. and Pass.,
indicate to oneself, i.e.
think or
muse upon, consider, ponder, Ep., Ion., Trag., but not in Att. Prose; eu)/khlos ta\ fra/zeai a(/ss' e)qe/lh|sqa Il.1.554; fra/zesqai boulh/n, boula/s, 18.313, Od.11.510; e)ni\ fresi\ mh=tin a)mei/nw Il.9.423; pa/nta meta\ fresi/n Hes.Op.688; qumw=| Il.16.646; e)fra/sqh kai\ e)s qumo\n e)ba/leto Hdt.1.84; pro\s tau=ta fra/zou
bethink thee, S.El.383; a)mfi\s f.
to think differently, Il.2.14: folld. by ei) c. fut. indic.,
consider whether . . , 1.83, Od.10.192.
purpose, plan, contrive, f. tini\ kaka/, qa/naton, o)/leqron, 2.367, 3.242, 13.373; me/g' o)/neiar 4.444; e)sqla/ Il.12.212; fra/ssato *patro/klw| me/ga h)ri/on 23.126; fra/ssetai w(/s ke ne/htai
will contrive how . . , Od.1.205; f. o(/pws o)/x' a)/rista ge/noito 3.129, cf. S.Aj.1041. c. acc. et inf.,
think, suppose, believe, imagine that . . , Od.11.624; ou)k e)fra/zeto dunato\s ei)=nai Hdt.3.154.
perceive, observe, oi(=on e)gw\n oi)wno\n . . e)frasa/mhn Od.17.161; th\n (sc. th\n ou)lh\n） a)poni/zousa frasa/mhn 23.75; with a part., to\n de\ fra/sato prosio/nta Il.10.339, cf. 23.453: later c. gen., xeimw=nos Arat.745; pompa=s Theoc.2.84: rarely c. part., yuxa\n *)ai/+da| tele/wn ou) fra/zetai
marks not that he will die, Pi.I.1.68.
watch, guard, [o)rsoqu/rhn] Od.22.129.
beware of, cu/linon lo/xon Orac. ap. Hdt. 3.57: freq. in imper., fra/zeu ku/na
cave canem, Ar.Eq.1030 (hex.); fra/ssai kunalw/peka mh/ se dolw/sh| ib.1067 (hex.); fra/zeo dh/, mh\ . . ma/ryh| Id.Pax 1099 (hex.), cf. Call.Lav.Pall.52: c. inf., fra/zou mh\ po/rsw fwnei=n S.El.213 (lyr.): abs., fra/zou
take care! A.Eu.130. (Perh. cf. Lith
girdziù 'I hear', inf.
girdēti.）

frak-teu/w,
surround, invest, Sammelb.5111.3 (iii B. C.).

fra/k-ths, ou, o(,
sluice with gates, Procop.Aed.2.3; =
saeptor, Gloss.
frak-tiko/s, h/, o/n, = kata/fraktos, Ath.5.214a (nisi leg. katafraktiko/s).

frak-to/s, h/, o/n,
fenced, protected, foli/dessi Opp.H.1.641; cf. farkto/s.
frani/zw, = swfroni/zw, Hsch.

fra/cis, ews, h(,
barricade, Aen.Tact.2.6.
fencing in of an enclosure, BCH23.566 (Delph.).
type of defensive armour, Afric.Cest.p.7V.
fra/sdw, Dor. for fra/zw.
frasi/n, old dat. pl. of frh/n (q. v.).

fra/sis [a^], ews, h(,
speech, ei)s th\n *(ella/daf. cj. in Ael.VH9.16.
way of speaking, expression, a)safh\s ga\r h)=n e)n th=| f. tw=n pragma/twn Ar. Ra.1122; deino\s peri\ th\n f. Arist.Fr.70; ta/xos kai\ o)cu/ths th=s f. Plu.Cat.Ma.12;
style, f. poihtikh/, tragikh/, i(storikh/, Str.1.2.6; to\n xarakth=ra th=s f. Sor. Vit.Hippocr.13; f. kuri/a, tropikh/, D.H.Th. 22; f. a)gkulwte/ra, f. a)sunh/qhs, ib.25,54; f. u(yhlh/ Id.Comp.18; f. a)felh\s kai\ a)poi/htos Id.Pomp.2: pl., Phld.Rh.1.161 S.;
expressiveness, tw=n o)noma/twn interpol. in D.H.Pomp.3; h( gennai/a f. noble
diction, Longin.8.1; opp. eu(/resis, ta/cis, Stoic.2.96; h( tou= lo/gou no/gsis h(/ te f. Longin.30.1.
expression, idiom, phrase, *)attikh\ h( f. Sch. Ar.Nu.488.
text, Asp. in EN4.12.

frasmosu/nh, h(, Dor. frak-su/na, = frad-,
understanding, manteiw=n IG12.503.
fra/ssetai, Ep. aor. 1 subj. of fra/zw (q.v.), Od.24.217.

fra/ssw, Att. -ttw X.Cyn.2.9, D.21.17, al.: fut. fra/cw （dia-) IG 22.1668.63, etc.: aor. e)/fraca, Ep. fra/ca Il.12.263, Od.5.256, etc., Att. inf. fa/rcai IG12.371.20, part. dia-fa/rcas ib.373.251: pf. pe/fra^ka Ph.2.350, later pe/fra^ga （peri-) Sch.Hes.Sc.298: plpf. e)m-pefra/kesan J.AJ12.8.5:—Med., v. fra/gnumi; fut. fra/comai （e)m-) Luc.Tim.19: aor. e)fraca/mhn, Ep. fr- Il.15.566:—Pass., fut. fraxqh/somai （e)m-) Gal.5.616; fra^gh/somai 2 Ep.Cor.11.10: aor. 1 e)fra/xqhn Il.17.268, Pl.Ti.84d: aor. 2 e)fra/ghn [a^], subj. fra^gh=| Ep.Rom.3.19, part. fra^gei/s Hero Spir.1.19: pf. pe/fragmai E.Ph.733, etc.: plpf. e)pefra/gmhn Luc.Sat.11, 3sg. e)pe/frakto Hdt.7.142:—Hom. uses no tense but aor. Act., Pass., and Med. The Att. spellings pefargme/nos and e)fa/rcanto are given by Hdn.Gr.2.384, cf. IG12.ll.cc., and v. farkto/s, nau/farktos. [a^ by nature, for it does not become h in Ion.]:—
fence in, hedge round, hence with collat. notion of defence,
secure, fortify, r(inoi=si bow=n fra/cantes e)pa/lceis
having fenced the battlements with shields, Il.12.263; fra/ce de/ min [th\n sxedi/hn] r(i/pessi he
fenced it with mats, to keep out the water, Od.5.256; a)rku/stat' a)\n fra/ceien A.Ag.1376; f. de/mas o(/ploisi Id.Pers.456; e)/rnesi f. xei=ra
fill them
full with wreaths of victory, Pi.I.1.66:—Med., fra/canto de\ nh=as e(/rkei+ xalkei/w| they
fencedin their ships, Il.15.566, cf. A.Th.63; fraca/menoi th\n a)kro/polin qu/rh|si Hdt.8.51; pu/las . . e)fraca/mesqa prosta/tais A.Th.798; but e)fra/canto to\ tei=xos they
strengthened it, Hdt.9.70: abs.,
strengthen one's fortifications, Th.8.35; f. pro\s ta\s diaba/seis Plu.Mar.23; fraca/menoi
in battle-array, Batr.166:—Pass., fraxqe/ntes sa/kesin
fenced with shields, Il.17.268, cf. E.IA826, etc.; h( a)kro/polis r(hxw=| e)pe/frakto Hdt.7.142; of the Nile, to be
embanked, Id.2.99: abs., pefragme/noi
fortified, prepared for defence, Id.5.34, Th.1.82; of a person,
armed, a)spidi/ths kai\ pefr. S.Fr.426: metaph., e)lpi/dos pefragme/nos
having the defence of hope, cj. in Id.Ant.235 (cod. Laur, pepragme/nos, cett. and Sch. dedragme/nos).
put up as a fence, fra/cantes do/ru douri/, sa/kos sa/kei+
joining spear
close to spear, shield to shield, Il.13.130; fra/cantes ta\ ge/rra
having put up the shields
as a close, thick fence, Hdt.9.61:—Med. pa/gas u(perko/tous e)fraca/mesqa cj. in A.Ag.823. sxa/sasai th\n ou)ra\n kai\ f., of dogs, X.Cyn.3.5.
stop up, block, th\n o(do/n Hdt.8.7; tou\s e)/splous Th.4.13; ta\ paraskh/nia D.21.17:—Pass., u(po\ r(euma/twn fraxqei/s [o( pleu/mwn] Pl. l.c.; pefragme/nwn tw=n po/rwn Arist.Pr.935b14. metaph.,
bar, stop, to\ h(gemoniko/n Ath.4.157d:—Pass., i(/na pa=n sto/ma fragh=| Ep.Rom.3.19; h( kau/xhsis au(/th ou) fragh/setai ei)s e)me/ 2 Ep.Cor. 11.10.

fras-te/on, (fra/zw)
one must indicate, Pl.Ep.312d.

fras-th/r, h=ros, o(,
teller, expounder, tinos
of or
about a thing, X.Cyr.4.5.17; o(dw=n f.
guide, ib.5.4.40, cf. Ph.2.77, Plu.2.243e: f. o)do/ntes, = gnw/mones, the teeth
that tell the age, Sch.Ar.Ra.421.

fra/s-ths, ou, o(, = Lat.
eloquens, Gloss.

fras-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
indicative, expressive, tinos Pl.Def.414d; to\ f. me/ros tou= lo/gou, opp. h( no/hsis, Longin.30.1; f. to/poi
expressive, Id.32.6; f. du/namis M.Ant.1.16, Ael.VH3.1; of persons,
eloquent, D.L.5.65: to\ f.
power of speaking, Placit.5.20.4.

fras-tu/s, u/os, h(,
reflection, Hsch.

fra/s-twr, oros, o(, = frasth/r,
guide, A.Supp.492.

fra/t-hr [a_], o(, gen. fra/teros (v. sub fin.); Dor. fra_th/r Hdn.Gr.1.47; Ion. frh/thr, = a)delfo/s, Hsch.:—
member of a fra/tra: pl.,
those of the same fra/tra,
clansmen, A.Eu.656, IG22.1237.9, al., freq. in Is. (v. infr.); s' o( path\r ei)sh/gag' ei)s tou\s f. (which was done when the boy came of age), Ar.Av.1669, cf. Lys.30.2; ei)s tou\s gennh/tas kai\ f. e)ggrafei/s Is.7.43; ei)sagagei=n ei)s tou\s f. Id.6.21; ou)k e)de/canto oi( f. ib.22; gamhli/an toi=s fra/tersin ei)sfe/rein Id.3.79; ou)k e)/fuse fra/teras, with a play on frasth=ras (v. frasth/r), he has not cut his
citizen-teeth, is no true citizen, Ar.Ra.422, cf. Av.765 (troch.); fra/teres triwbo/lou, of the Athenian dicasts, Id.Eq.255 (troch.). metaph., of birds, f. kai\ suggenh/s Ael.NA8.24. (fra/twr, oros (q.v.) is freq. found in codd., but is a later form acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.49, Eust.239.33; cogn. with Skt.
bhrā´tar-, Lat.
frater, Goth.
brōpar, 'brother', etc.)
frat-ori/a, h(, = fra/tra, Sch.Ar.Av.766, Suid.
frat-oriko/s, h/, o/n, = fra/trios, grammatei=on D.44.41.

fra/tra, h(, dat. fra/trh| OGI483.87 (Pergam., ii B. C.), Ion. frh/trh, Dor. pa/tra (q. v.), Delph. patria/ (q. v.), Att. fratri/a; also fatri/a and fa/tra (v. infr.):—prop.
brotherhood, but among the Greeks always in polit. sense, cf. Dicaearch.Hist.9: in Hom.,
tribe, clan, kri=n' a)/ndras . . kata\ frh/tras, w(s frh/trh frh/trhfin a)rh/gh| choose men by
clans, that
clan may stand by
clan, Il.2.362; of the Persian royal
clan (the Achaemenids), Hdt.1.125. later,
political subdivision of the fulh/, Pl.Lg.746d, 785a, Isoc.8.88, Aeschin.2.147; fratri/ai kai\ fulai/ Arist.Pol.1264a8, cf. 1300a25, 1309a12; freq. in Inscrr., fulh=s kai\ dh/mou kai\ fratri/as w(=n a)\n bou/lhtai a)pograya/menon IG12.110.16; prosgrayame/nois pro\s fulh\n kai\ fratri/an h)\n a)\n bou/lwntai ib.12(5).819.21 (Tenos, ii B. C.);
sub-division of a tribe, PHib. 1.28.10 (iii B. C.); of groups celebrating festivals, e.g. the Carnea at Sparta, Demetr.Sceps. ap. Ath.4.141f; or the Jewish Passover, J.AJ3.10.5, BJ6.9.3; perh. = su/nodos 1.2, Pap. in
Harvard Theological Review 29.40 (i B. C.). used to translate Lat.
curia, Plu. Publ.7; in form fra/tra, D.H.2.7, 6.89, al. later, of any
league or
association, esp. in bad sense,
conspiracy (in form fatri/a), Lib.Or.18.141; tw=n ponhrw=n te kai\ a)kola/stwn fatri/ai ib.17.2. (The form fa/tra is found in Arcadia, IG5(2).510 (ii B. C.), and at Tenos, ib.12(5).798.23 (iii B. C.); fatri/a is found at Chios, Michel 997.28 (iv B. C.); at Tenos, IG12(5).816.16 (iii B. C.); and freq. in codd., e.g. Aeschin. l.c., Arist.Pol. ll.cc., cf. Hdn.Gr.1.298, 2.598, Orusap.EM789.20; cf. frh/trh, frhtri/a.—

fra_tri-a/zw,
belong to the same fratri/a, meq' w(=n . . e)fratri/aze kai\ au)to/s D.43.13 (vv.ll. e)fra/trize, e)fatri/aze).
conspire, Sch. Aeschin.2.77, 189 (in form fatr-).

fra_tri-a^ko/s, h/, o/n,
of the curia, D.H.2.23; f. yhfofori/a, =
comitia curiata, Id.9.41.

fra_triarx-e/w,
to be president of a fratri/a, IG22.1237.11.

fra_tri/arx-os, o(,
president of a fratri/a, D.57.23, IG22.1241.5, al.

fra_tri-asmo/s, o(,
league, combination, conspiracy, Eust.647.34 (written fatr-).

fra_tri-asth/s, ou=, o(, = Lat.
curialis, D.H.4.43.

fra_tri-a_tiko/s no/mos, = Lat.
lex curiata, D.C.37.51,al.

fra_tri-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = Lat.
curialis, D.H.2.23.
fratr-i/zw, = fratria/zw, Crater.4, IG22.1237.37.

fratr-iko/s, h/, o/n, = fratriako/s, e)kklhsi/a f., = Lat.
comitia curiata, D.H.4.20.

fra/tr-ios,
a, on, Ion. frhtr-,
of or
belonging to a fra/tra, at Athens, epith. of Zeus and Athena, as
tutelary deities of the phratriae, Pl.Euthd.302d; *zeu\s f. D.43.14, IG22.1237.1, prob. for *frato/rios in Cratin.Jun.9.5; also at Syros, IG12(5).669; *poteida\n o( f. Schwyzer 323 B14 (Delph., iv B. C.); oi( qeoi\ oi( frh/trioi IG14.759 (Naples), Röm.Mitt.27.303 (Aquila). fra/trion, to/,
a temple of these deities, or
any shrine used by the fratri/a, St.Byz. s.v. fratri/a, Poll.3.52 codd. fra/trios mh/n, o(, name of month at Cyme, IGRom.4.1302.54 (i B. C./i A. D.).
fra/ttw, Att. for fra/ssw (q. v.).
fra/twr [a_], oros, o(, = fra/thr, PHib.1.28.7 (iii B. C.), freq. in codd., v. fra/thr sub fin.: Ion. frh/twr IG14.759.10, al. (Naples).

fre-a/ntlhs, ou, o(,
one who draws from a well, a pun on the name Cleanthes, D.L.7.168.

fre/-ar, ep. frei=ar Nic.Th.486, to/, gen. fre/a_tos (v. sub fin.), contr. frhto/s IGRom.1.1167C6 (Egypt, i A. D.), Hdn.Gr.1.409; Ep. dat. fre/a^ti h.Cer.99 (s. v.l.), frhti/ Call.Cer.15; pl. fre/a_ta, also frh=ta PCair.Zen.499.12 (iii B. C.); Ep. pl. frei/a^ta (v. infr.):—
an artificial well (thus distd. from krh/nh, cf. Hdt.4.120, D.14.30; but f. a)sfa/lton naphtha-
spring, LXXGe.14.10, cf. Hdt.6.119), pa=sai krh=nai kai\ frei/ata makra\ na/ousin Il.21.197; the stem freat - first in h.Cer.l.c. later,
tank, cistern, reservoir, Hdt.1.68, Th.2.48,49, PHal.1.98 (iii B. C.), etc.; ei)s f. katabai/nein kai\ kolumba=n Pl.La.193c, cf. Prt.350a; f. o)rw/ruktai S.E.M.8.129; poihta\ f., v. poihto/s 1: generally,
pit, f. diafqora=s LXX Ps.54 (55). 24. perh.
oil-jar, Ar.Pl.810. metaph., ei)s fre/ata/ te kai\ pa=san a)pori/an e)mpi/ptwn Pl.Tht.174c; e)n fre/ati susxo/menos ib. 165b; h( peri\ to\ f. o)/rxhsis, prov. of persons 'on the brink of a volcano', Plu.2.68b; lu/kos peri\ f. xoreu/ei prov. ap. Hsch., Phot.; pi/nein e)c a)rgurou= fre/atos, i.e. a large wine-cup, Ath.5.192a, cf. Chamaeleon ap.eund.11.461c. [Att. gen. fre/a_tos Ar.Ec.1004, Fr. 295, Stratt.57 (troch.), Alex.179, Apollod.Gel.1.] (Orig. frhvṛ, gen. frhvṇtos, cf. Arm.
albiur 'well', Goth. and OE.
brunna 'stream, burn', Lat.
ferveo, defrutum.）

frea_t-i/a, h(,
tank, cistern, X.HG3.1.7, Plb.10.28.2.
opening in a raft, Apollod.Poliorc.191.3.

frea_t-iai=os, a, on,
belonging to a well or
tank, u(/dwr Hermipp.39, Thphr.CP2.6.3; f. u(/data, opp. r(uta/, Plu.2.954c, cf. Arist.Mete.353b26.
frea_/t-ion, to/, Dim. of fre/ar, PSI4.423.39 (iii B. C.), PCair.Zen.745.18 (iii B. C.), Moer.p.193P.
frea_/t-ios, a, on, = freatiai=os, Ruf.Fr.66, Gp.2.6.33, Anon. ap. Suid.

frea_t-ismo/s, o(,
falling into a well, Supp.Epigr.4.573.7 (Notium, ii B. C.).
frea_toru/kths, ou, o(, = frewru/xos, EM799.41, Suid.

frea_totu/pa^non [u^], to/,
machine for raising water, swipe, waterwheel, Plb.Fr.86 (pl.).

freattw/ or frea_tw/, ou=s, h(, a court in Peiraeus, where banished men accused of murder were allowed to present themselves for trial, the accused being on board ship, the judges on shore; only dat. (loc.), e)n *freattoi= D.23.77,78, Arist.Pol.1300b29:—the nom. is written freattu/s in Paus.1.28.11.

frea_tw/dhs, es,
like a well, xa/sma Sch.Ar.Pl.431.
frei=ar, v. fre/ar.

frena^pa^t-a/w,
deceive, e(auto/n Ep.Gal.6.3.

frena^pa^/t-hs, ou, o(,
soul-deceiver, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.1.18, Ep.Tit.1.10, PLond.5.1677.22 (vi A. D.).
frenarti/ous: frenh/reis, Hsch. frenempa/rwtos [a_, cf. phro/s]: blayi/frwn, Id.

frenh/rhs, es,
sound of mind, opp. e)mmanh/s, Hdt.3.25, cf.30, 35, E.Heracl.150, Phld.Mort.39, Plu.2.323c, Luc.Cal.3, etc.: Sup. -e/statos Harp.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(3).137.
fre/nion, to/, = a)nemw/nh, prob. in Plin.HN21.164.
freni_t-iai=os, a, on, = frenitiko/s, f.l. in Hp.Epid.3.1.ia/.
freni_t-i/a_sis, ews, h(, = freni=tis, Suid. s.v. parakoph\ frenw=n.
freni_t-ia/w, = sq., Plu. Alex.75, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.76.

freni_t-i/zw,
be delirious, D.Chr.66.8, Plu. 2.693a, 1128d, S.E.M.7.247, Gal.16.493, Alex.Trall.1.13.

freni_t-i^ko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from freni=tis, Hp.Aph.4.72; ta\ f. (sc. nosh/mata) Id.Epid.1.6, cf. Arr.Epict.2.15.3, Antyll. ap. Orib.9.22.3, Sor.2.1; f. pureto/s Gal.17 (1).890:—frenh [tiko/s] prob. in Phld.Mus.p.38K., cf. Lat.
phreneticus.

fre/ni_t-is, idos, h(,
inflammation of the brain, phrenitis, Hp.Aph.3.30 (pl.), Com.Adesp.344 (pl.), D.Chr.48.12, Luc.Symp. 20; flegmonh\n tou= diafra/gmatos ei)=nai th\n f. Diocl.Fr.38.

freni_t-ismo/s, o(,
frenzy, Plu.Fr.25.3 (pl., frenet- codd. Stob.).

frenoa/ras [a^r], a, o(, = frenh/rhs,
of sound mind, B.16.118.

frenobla/b-eia [a^], h(,
damage of the understanding, madness, folly, D.H.5.9, Ph.2.49, Luc.Syr.D.18, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.174.

frenoblab-e/w,
to be distraught, frantic, Sch.ABT Il.20.332.

frenoblab-h/s, e/s, (bla/ptw)
deranged, crazy, Hdt.2.120, Eup.181.7, Luc.Syr.D.43, Hierocl.in CA 24p.472M., etc.
frenoblab-i/a, h(, poet. frenoblab-i/h, for frenobla/beia, Man.6.599.

freno-ghqh/s, e/s,
heart-gladdening, AP9.525.22.

freno-da_lh/s, e/s, (dhle/omai)
ruining the mind, parafora/ A.Eu.330 (lyr.).

freno-qelgh/s, e/s,
charming the heart, Procl.H.3.17, Nonn.D.1.406.

fre/no-qen (parox.), Adv.
of one's own mind, S.Aj.182 (lyr.).

freno-klope/w,
steal the understanding, deceive, Hsch.

freno-klo/pos, on,
stealing the understanding, deceiving, *)/erws APl.4.198 (Maec.).

freno/-lhptos, on,
possessed, mad, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).264.

freno-lh|sth/s, ou=, o(,
robber of the understanding, deceiver, AP12.144 (Mel.).

freno-ma^nh/s, e/s,
distracted, maddened, A.Ag.1140 (lyr.), Aristodem.8.1 freno-mo/rws, Adv., (mo/ros)
suffering from a calamity to the mind, nosou=nta f. S. Aj.626 (lyr.; -bo/rws Dindorf).

freno-plhgh/s, e/s,
striking the mind, i.e.
driving mad, maddening, A.Pr.878 (anap.).

freno/-plhktos, on,
stricken in mind, frenzied, ib.1054(anap.).
freno-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(, = foreg., AP9.141.

freno-te/ktwn, on, gen. onos,
building with the mind, ingenious, Ar.Ra.820 (lyr.).

freno-terph/s, e/s,
heart-delighting, Nonn.D.4.135.

fren-o/w, (frh/n)
make wise, instruct, inform, tina A.Pr.337, S. Ant.754, Tr.52, E.Ion526 (troch.); frenw/sw d' ou)ke/t' e)c ai)nigma/twn, i.e.
will teach plainly, A.Ag.1183; poet. Verb, used by X.Mem.4.1.5; f. tina\ ei)/s ti ib.2.6.1:—Pass., Phld.Lib.p.52 O.; pefrenwme/nos Luc. Lex.19; frenwqh=nai ou)de\ pro\s au)th=s th=s *)aqhna=s Jul.Or.7.225b. Pass.,
to be high-minded, elated, LXX 2 Ma.11.4, Babr.101.5. f. is prob. a late spelling of fronw=n (v. frone/w IV fin.) in the phrase zw=n kai\ frenw=n.

fren-w/lhs, es,
distraught in mind, frenzied, A.Th. 757 (lyr.).

fre/n-wsis, ews, h(,
instruction, Hsch.

fren-wth/rion, to/,
means of instruction, Id.

fressi/lu^tos [i^], on,
mad, Stud.Ital.2(1922).394 (Phalasarna, iv B. C., amulet).
fre/w, only in compds. diafre/w, ei)sfre/w, e)kfre/w, e)peisfre/w, qq. v., exc. aor. imperat. fre/s (as if from *frh=mi) Com.Adesp.489.

frewru^x-e/w,
dig wells, Str.16.4.14, Plu.2.776e:—ludicrously, of a gnat, m' e)frewru/xei
was sinking wells in me, Ar.Lys.1033 (troch.).

frewru^x-i/a, h(,
digging of wells, J.AJ1.18.2.

frewru^x-ika/, ta/, treatise on
digging of wells ascribed to Democr., Sch. Basil. in
Gött. Nachr. 1910.220.

frew/ru^x-os (parox.), on,
for digging wells, skeu/h Plu.2.159c: Subst., o( f.
well-sinker, Them.Or.11.152c.—The forms freorukte/w, frewru^x-oru/kths, only in Suid.

frh/n, h(, gen. freno/s, pl. fre/nes, gen. frenw=n, dat. fresi/: older dat. pl. frasi/（n) IG12.971 (vi B. C.), Pi.N.3.62, BMus.Inscr.909 (Halic., i B. C.): (v. sub fin.):
midriff, kradi/a fre/na lakti/zei A.Pr.881 (anap.); elsewh. always in pl., e)/nqa fre/nes e)/rxatai a)mf' a(dino\n kh=r Il.16.481, cf. Hp. VM22, Art.41; ta\s fre/nas dia/fragma ei)s to\ me/son au)tw=n (sc. tou= qw/rakos kai\ tou= ku/tous） tiqe/ntes Pl.Ti.70a; tou=to de\ to\ dia/zwma kalou=si/ tines fre/nas, o(\ diori/zei to/n te pleu/mona kai\ th\n kardi/an Arist.PA672b11, cf. HA496b11, 506a6; also, in Hom., more vaguely, pro\s sth=qos o(/qi fre/nes h(=par e)/xousi Od.9.301; me/neos fre/nes a)mfi\ me/lainai pi/mplant' Il.1.103, al.; fre/nas . . ei)s au)ta\s tupei/s A.Pr.363, cf. Eu.159 (lyr.).
heart, as seat of the passions, e.g. of fear, trome/onto de/ oi( fre/nes e)nto/s Il.10.10; of joy and grief, fre/na te/rpesqai fo/rmiggi 9.186; ga/nutai fre/na poimh/n 13.493; ti/ se fre/nas i(/ketope/nqos; 1.362; a)/xos pu/kase fre/nas 8.124; e)/rws fre/nas a)mfeka/luye 3.442; of anger, Od.6.147; of courage, e(/na fresi\ qumo\n e)/xontes Il. 13.487; e)s fre/na qumo\s a)ge/rqh 22.475, cf. 8.202, etc.; of bodily appetites, such as hunger, etc., 11.89: the shades of the dead are without it, yuxh\ kai\ ei)/dwlon, a)ta\r fre/nes ou)k e)/ni pa/mpan 23.104 (exc. the shade of Teiresias, Od.10.493): so generally in Poets, freno\s e)/ndoqen a)/lgea kei=tai Sol. ap. Arist.Ath.5.2; kh=la daimo/nwn qe/lgei fre/nas Pi.P.1.12; fo/bos m' e)/xei fre/nas A.Supp.379; mainome/na freni/ Id.Th.484 (lyr.); stugei=n mia=| freni/ Id.Eu.986 (lyr.); *dio\s ga\r dusparai/thtoi f. Id.Pr.34; e)k freno/s from one's
very heart, o( e)k freno\s lo/gos a
sincere speech, Id.Ch.107; e)tu/mws dakruxe/wn e)k freno/s Id.Th.919 (lyr.); ou)k a)p' a)/kras freno/s not
superficially and carelessly, Id.Ag.805 (anap.); freno\s e)k fili/as ib.1515 (anap.), cf. 546; fu=sai fre/nas to produce
a haughty spirit, S.El.1463.
mind, as seat of the mental faculties, perception, thought, e)/gnw h(=|sin e)ni\ f. Il.22.296; mh/ moi tau=ta no/ei fresi/ 9.600; meta\ fresi\ mermhri/cai, ba/llesqai, Od.10.438, Il.9.434; i)/dmen e)ni\ fresi/n 2.301; tw=| ga\r e)pi\ fresi/ qh=ke put in his
mind, suggested it, 1.55; sfw=i+n d' w(=de qew=n tis e)ni\ fresi\ poih/seien 13.55; e)n fresi\ qe/sqe e(/kastos ib.121, cf. 1.297, etc.; fre/nas parapei=sai, pei/qein, 7.120, 16.842; e)pigna/mptei fre/nas (v.l. for no/on） e)sqlw=n 9.514; *dio\s e)tra/peto frh/n 10.45; a)nh\r fre/nas a)fneio/s rich (only)
in his imagination, Hes.Op.455; o)rqa=|, e)leuqe/ra| freni/, Pi.O.8.24, P.2.57; fre/nes ga\r au)tou= qumo\n w)|akostro/foun A.Pers. 767; h( glw=ss' o)mw/mox', h( de\ f. a)nw/motos E.Hipp.612; kata\ fre/na kai\ kata\ qumo/n Il.1.193, al.: pl.,
wits, *ku/klwpa peri\ fre/nas h)/luqe oi)=nos Od.9.362, cf.454, 18.331; plh/gh fre/nas a)\s pa/ros ei)=xen Il.13.394; e)k ga\r plh/gh fre/nas 16.403; bla/pte fre/nas *zeu\s h(mete/ras 15.724; e)c . . . toi qeoi\ fre/nas w)/lesan 7.360; fre/nas a)/frwn, fre/nas h)le/ or h)lee/, 4.104, 15.128, Od.2.243: of losing one's
wits, frenw=n a)festa/nai, e)ksth=nai, meqesta/nai, S.Ph.865, E.Or.1021, Ba.944; ta\s f. e)kba/llein S.Ant.648; e)/cw frenw=n Pi.O.7.47; frenw=n ou)k e)/ndon w)/n E.Heracl. 709; frenw=n kekomme/nos A.Ag.479 (lyr.); keno/s S.Ant.754; thtw/menoi Id.El.1326; e)/cedroi, para/kopoi, E.Hipp.935, Ba.33; pou= pot' ei)= frenw=n; S.El.390; fre/nes dia/strofoi A.Pr.673, S.Aj.447; margo/ths frenw=n Id.Fr.846; a)naki/nhsis frenw=n Id.OT727, etc.; of persons in their senses, e)ph/bolos frenw=n Id.Ant.492; a)ndro\s nou=n e)/xontos kai\ fre/nas Ar.Ra.535 (lyr.) (so in later Prose, oi( fre/nas e)/xontes Phld.Po.5.19, Rh.1.240S.; oi( tw=n sofistw=n ta\s koina\s f. e)/xontes ib.202S.); also e)/sw frenw=n le/gein A.Ag.1052; gra/fou frenw=n e)/sw S.Ph.1325; th=s lepto/thtos tw=n f. Ar.Nu.153; fre/nes, opp. sw=ma, Hdt.3.134; so ai( sa/rkes ai( kenai\ frenw=n E.El.387; attributed to animals, meta\ fresi\ gi/gnetai a)lkh/ Il.4.245, cf. 16.157, etc.—The word is not common in early Prose, ti/s au)tw=n no/os h)\ frh/n; Heraclit.104; sumfora\ tw=n f., i.e. madness, And.2.7; paralla/ttei tw=n f. Lys.Fr.90; karpou= me\n a)fqoni/a frenw=n de\ a)fori/a X.Smp.4.55; nou=s kai\ fre/nes D.18.324, cf. 25.33.
will, purpose, ou)/ ti *dio\s be/omai fresi/n Il.15.194; sh=s a)pesta/toun f. S.Ant.993, cf.OC1182.—In usage there is little or no distinction observable between sg. and pl., but the sg. is not found in Prose (exc. Heraclit. l.c.) or Com. (exc. in paratrag., Ar. Ra.886).

frhtai=os, a, on, = freatiai=os,
PLond.ined.2086 (iii B. C.).
frhtarx-e/w, = fratriarxe/w, IG14.724 (Naples).
frh/tarx-os, o(, = fratri/arxos, ib. 759 (ibid.).
frh/thr, v. fra/thr.
frhti/a, h(, Ion. for freati/a, Hsch.: frhti/on, to/, IG14.217 (pl.).
frh/trh, h(, Ion. for fra/tra (q.v.); also frhtri/a, IG14.759 (Naples, fhtr- lapis).
frh/trios, v. fra/trios.
frh/twr, v. fra/twr.
fri/zw, = fri/ssw, PMag.Osl.1.262.

fri_k-a/zw,
shudder, shiver, Poet.
de herb.71, prob. in Hp.Coac. 24.

fri_k-a^le/os, a, on,
shivering with cold, Hp.VM16 (Comp.),
Cat. Cod.Astr.2.165.
dreadful, horrid, AP7.69 (Jul.), 9.300 (Addaeus); spila/s ib.7.382 (Phil.), cf. Tryph.195; a)/xqos po/nwn Androm. ap.Gal.14.33;
awe-inspiring, lo/gos Hymn.Is.12.

fri_k-asmo/s, o(,
shuddering, shivering, LXX 2 Ma.3.17.

fri_/k-h, h(,
shuddering, shivering, Hp.Aph.5.61; a mild form of r(i=gos, Id.Morb.1.24, al.:
cold fit before fever, Pl.Phdr.251a (metaph.,Id.R.387c), Thphr.Ign. 74, Nic.Th.721; fr（e）i/kh kai\ pureto/s IG3.1424.19 (Tab.Defix.), Sor. 1.27: pl., Arist.Pr.863b21.
shivering fear, shuddering, esp. from religious
awe, fri/khs au)to\n u(pelqou/shs Hdt.6.134; toi/an f. pare/xeis moi S.OT1306 (anap.); o)rqo/kerws f. Id.Fr.875, cf. X.Cyr.4.2.15: generally,
shivering fear of any kind,
horror, fri/ka| tromera\n fre/na E.Ph.1284 (lyr.); e)kplhxqei=sa fri/ka| Id.Tr.183 (lyr.); fri/ka| matro/s Id.Ion898 (lyr.); mega/lhn e)mpoiei= f. Phld.Ir.p.19 W.; a)gwni/a kai\ f. Plu.Mar.43; f. kai\ fo/bos Id.Pel.27; f. kai\ de/os Jul.
ad Them. 253b; fri/kh| kai\ siwph=| katexo/menon to\ qe/atron Plu.Marc.20. = fri/c 1, a)ku/matos porqmo\s e)n fri/kh| gela=| Trag.Adesp.336; e)n galh/nh| fri/khs u(potrexou/shs Plu.2.921f; th\n qa/lattan f. kate/xei Alciphr.1.10; e)p' a)/kra| th=| f. th=s qala/tths Ael.NA16.19.
frost, chill, f. peri\ to\n o)/rqron ge/gone Gell.17.8.7.

fri_k-i/a, ta/,
aguish shivering, Dsc.1.127 (v.l. -i/as), 4.14.

fri_k-i/as, o(,
with bristling mane, name of a horse in Pi.P.10.16.

fri_k-i/a_sis, ews, h(,
shivering, Sch.Poet.
de herb. 166.

fri_k-ia/w, (fri/c) like frika/zw,
shudder, shiver, esp. from ague, Cass.Pr.53.
frikno/s, h/, o/n, = frikale/os, Hsch.

fri_ko/omai, Pass., = frika/zw,
shudder or
shiver, (frikw/santa is f.l. for -a/santa in Hp.Coac.24).

fri_kopoio/s, o/n,
causing a shuddering, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.74c.

fri=kos, eos, to/, = fri/kh,
shivering, f.l. in Nic. Th.778.

frikte/on, c. inf.,
one must shudder at the thought of . . , Porph.Chr. 26.
friktopalai/mones (sc. dai/mones) dub. sens. in PMag.Par.1.1357.

frikto/s, h/, o/n, (fri/ssw) (misspelt fiktro/s PMag.Osl.1.261),
to be shuddered at, awful, qeh=s i)/des i(era\ frikth=s Call.Aet.3.1.6, cf. Orph.H. 14.6, Plu.Cic.49, APl.4.110 (Philostr.), AP9.524.22, Zos.Alch.p.117 B., PMasp.97 ii 51 (vi A. D.); [qeoi/] prob. in Phld.D.1.17: Comp. -o/teros Plu.Num.10: Sup. -o/tatos Ath.10.440e. Adv. -tw=s LXX Wi.6.5.
bristling with spears, a)ndrw=n o)/xlos Ezek.Exag.197.

fri_k-w/dhs, es,
attended with shivering, pnreto\s f. a fever
with shivering fits, ague, Hp.Epid.1.2, Sor.1.59; dusouri/a f. Hp.Aph.3.5; oi( f.
those who suffer from such fits, Id.Coac.12, al.; to\ f.
roughness, unevenness of the skin, as in aguish fits, ib.17, cf. Gal.6.195.
that causes shuddering or
horror, awful, horrible, o)/yis Ar.Ra.1336 (lyr.); ta\ deina\ kai\ f. And.1.29; frikw/dh klu/ein
horrible to hear, E.Hipp.1202; freq. in later Prose, do/cai f. Phld.Mus. p.50 K.; f. a)/poyis, qe/ama, Arist.Mir.843a16, Plu.Marc.15, Anon. Oxy. 416.9, Jul.Or.1.31c; to\ -e/staton tw=n kakw=n o( qa/natos Epicur.Ep.3p.61U.; -e/statos o(/rkos PStrassb.48.6 (vi A. D.), etc.: neut. frikw=des, as Adv.,
horribly, E.Hipp.1216.
inspiring religious awe, Plu. TG21 (Sup.), Aristid.1.256J. Adv. Sup., a(giw/tata kai\ frikwde/stata e)/xein, of the terrors of a court of justice, D.23.74.

fri_k-wdi/a, h(,
horribleness, Nicom. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.143 B.
fri_k-w/eis, essa, en, = frikw/dhs, a)/duton Aristonous 1.13.

fri_m-agmo/s, o(,
snorting, of any motions of rampant animals, of horses, Lyc.244; of goats, Poll.5.88, D.H.Comp.16 (pl.).

fri_m-a/ssomai, Att. fri_/m-ttomai,
snort and leap: wanton, of goats, Theoc.5.141, cf. AP9.558 (Eryc.), Poll.5.88; of high-mettled horses, frima/casqai kai\ xremeti/sai Hdt.3.87, cf. AP9.281 (Apollonid.); prosio/ntos e)frima/tteto kai\ e)pikrotou=ntos e)frua/tteto Ael.NA6.44 (the distinctions drawn by Poll.5.87 and Ammon.Diff.p.138 V. do not hold good).
fri_m-a/w, = foreg., Opp.C.1.491.
fri/n, Locr., = pri/n, IG9(1).334.6 (v B. C.).
fri/nion, to/, an unknown utensil, written frinein, PMasp.6 ii 64 (vi A. D.).

fri/c, h(, gen. fri_ko/s: (fri/ssw):—
ruffling of a smooth surface.
ripple caused by a gust of wind sweeping over the smooth sea, u(po\ friko\s *bore/w Il.23.692; melai/nh| friki\ kalufqei/s, of Proteus coming to the surface, Od.4.402; *zefu/roio e)xeu/ato po/nton e)/pi fri/c
ripple spread over the sea from the west wind, Il.7.63; malakh\n fri=ka fe/roi *ze/furos AP7.668 (Leon.); qa/lassa friki\ xarassome/nh ib.10.2 (Antip.Sid.), cf. 14 (Agath.).—Poet. word for Prose fri/kh.
bristling up, as of the hair, krio\s baqei/h| friki\ mallo\n o)rqw/sas Babr. 93.7.
shivering-fit, Hp.Morb.2.68, POxy.924.3 (iv A. D.); fri\c e)pe/sxe nw=ta kai\ knh/mas Babr.95.59.

fricau/xhn, enos, o(, h(,
with ruffling neck, of dolphins, Arion v. 8; ka/pros Trag.Adesp.383.

frico/-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
with bristling hair, *)indoi/ Ps.-Callisth.3.8.
making the hair stand on end, EM800.32, Suid.
frico-ko/mhs, ou, o(, = foreg. 1, APl.4.291 (Anyte).
frico-lo/fos, on, = fricau/xhn, Hsch.

frico/s, h/, o/n,
standing on end, bristling, tri/xes Arist.Phgn.809b 25, 812b28. fri=cos, o(, Comic name for
the genius or
demon of shivering, AP9.617.
fricwpobro/ntac dub. in PMag.Lond.46.19.

fri/ssw, Att. fri/ttw Pl.R.387c: fut. fri/cw Gal.13.365: aor. e)/frica Il.13.339, etc.: pf. pe/fri_ka 11.383, etc.; poet. part. pefri/kontes Pi.P.4.183: plpf. e)pefri/kei Plu.2.781e, Alciphr.1.1:—Med., aor. 1 e)frica/mhn f.l. in Polyaen.4.6.7. [i_ by nature, hence to be accented fri=sson in Hes.Sc.171, fri=cai S.El.1408 (lyr.)]:—
to be rough or
uneven on the surface, bristle, fri/ssousin a)/rourai (sc. staxu/essi) Il.23.599; fri/cas ka/rpimos sta/xus E.Supp.31; of a line of battle, e)/fricen ma/xh e)gxei/h|sin Il.13.339; fa/lagges sa/kesi/n te kai\ e)/gxesi pefrikui=ai 4.282, cf. 7.62; fri/cas eu)lo/fw| sfhkw/mati, of the crest of a helmet, S.Fr.341; of a tree, fri/ssousa zefu/rois Pl.Eleg.25; fia/la xrusw=| pefrikui=a Pi.I.6(5).40; xersi\ deciwnu/mois e)/fricen ai)qh/r, of a crowd holding up their hands to vote, A.Supp.608; of hair, mane, or bristles,
bristle up, stand on end, mhd' o)rqai\ fri/sswsin [tri/xes] Hes.Op.540, cf. Arist.HA560b8, Pr.888a38; e)/frican e)/qeirai Theoc. 25.244; of foliage, fu/lla pefriko/ta, opp. keklime/na, Thphr.HP3.9.4: c.acc. of respect, fri/cas eu)= lofih/n
having set up his bristly mane, Od.19.446; f. tri/xas Hes.Sc.391; f. nw=ton, au)xe/nas, Il.13.473, Hes.Sc.171; xai/tan Ar.Ra.822 (lyr.); also pteroi=si nw=ta pefri/kontes
bristling on their backs with feathers, Pi.P.4.183; le/ontos de/ros xai/th| pefriko/s E.Ph.1121. a)/sqmati fri/sswn pnoa/s
ruckling in his throat, of one just dying, dub.l. in Pi.N.10.74. of the
rippling surface of smooth water (cf. fri/c 1), f. qa/lassai . . pnoih=|si D.P.112, cf. Alciphr.1.1; of breakers, r(hgmi=nes f. A.R.4.1575, cf. Ael.NA7.33; also of rain, fri/ssontes o)/mbroi Pi.P.4.81, expld. by Sch. as fri/ssein poiou=ntes, cf. o(po/tan . . fri/sswn *bore/as e)pispe/rxh| Id.Parth.2.18. freq. of a feeling of
chill, shiver, shudder: of the effect of cold,
shiver, Hes.Op.512, Hp.Aff. 11, Arist.Pr.963a33, 965a33; xwri\s tou= fri=cai unless he
catch a chill, Gal.10.803; of the teeth,
chatter, D.H.Rh.10.9. of the effect of fear,
shudder, S.El.1408 (lyr.), Tr.1044; pe/frik' e)gw\ me/n, au)=o/s ei)mi tw=| de/ei Men.Epit.480; f. gai=a po/ntos te h.Hom.27.8; a(/lw de\ pollh\n . . e)/friza dinh/santos I
shuddered when he swung the vast shield round, A.Th.490; ou) fri/ttousin (sc. animals) w(s fri/ttousin oi( a)/nqrwpoi Phld.D.1.12: c. acc.,
shudder at one, oi(/ te/ se pefri/kasi Il.11.383; pa/ntes de/ me pefri/kasin 24.775, cf. Pi.O.7.38, S.Ant.997, Ar.Nu.1133; tw=n dhmote/wn f. to\n h(/kiston Herod.2.30; tou\s telw/nas pa=sa nu=n qu/rh fri/ssei Id.6.64; pefrike/nai to\n qa/naton Phld.Mort. 39; fri/ttousi th\n su/ntrofo/n te kai\ fi/lhn oi( i)xqu/es qa/lattan Ael.NA9.57: c. acc. et inf., pe/frika . . *)erinu\n tele/sai I
tremble at the thought of her accomplishing . . , A.Th.720 (lyr.) (but not c. dat., for e)retmoi=si fri/cousi they
shall shudder at the oars is f.l. for fru/cousi in Orac. ap. Hdt.8.96): c. part., pe/frika leu/sswn I
shudder at seeing, A.Supp.346; f. se derkome/na Id.Pr.540 (lyr.), cf. 695 (lyr.): c. inf.,
fear to do, D.21.135: c. Prep., f. pro\s tou\s po/nous Plu.2.8f; f. pro\s th\n a)koh\n th=s *(rwmai/wn te/xnhs Lib.Or.24.16; f. u(pe\r w(=n prosh/kei paqei=n D.51.9.
feel a holy thrill or
awe at, e)n i(erw=| f. a(/panta kai\ proskunei=n Plu.2.26b; tou\s qeou\s pe/frika Jul.Or.7.212b, al.
thrill with passionate joy, e)/fric' e)/rwti S.Aj.693, A.Fr.387.—Rare in early Prose, exc. in the sense of
shuddering, fearing, Pl.R.387c, Phdr.251a, D.ll.cc.
froimia/zomai, froimiaste/on, v. prooimia/zomai, -aste/on.
froi/mion, to/, contr. for prooi/mion (q.v.).

fron-e/w, Ep. subj. frone/h|si Od.7.75: Ep. impf. fro/neon Il.17.286, frone/eskon A.R.4.1164: fut. -h/sw Ar.Ec.630 (anap.), etc.: aor. e)fro/nhsa Hdt.1.60, A.Eu.115, etc.: pf. pefro/nhka Emp.103.1, Isoc.5.124, D.S.18.66:—Pass., Arist.Xen.980a9; imper. fronei/sqw v.l. for fronei=te in Ep.Phil.2.5:—
to be minded, either of reflection or of purpose: hence,
have understanding, be wise, prudent, rare in Hom., a)/ristoi . . ma/xesqai/ te frone/ein te best both in battle and
counsel, Il. 6.79: but freq. in Trag. and Att., [*zh=na] to\n fronei=n brotou\s o(dw/santa A.Ag.176 (lyr.); fronou/ntws pro\s fronou=ntas e)nne/peis Id.Supp. 204, cf. 176; fronei=n ga\r oi( taxei=s ou)k a)sfalei=s S.OT617; fronei=n oi)=den mo/nh Id.Tr.313; li/an f.
to be over-
wise, E.IA924; f. ple/on Pl.Hp.Mi.371a; to\ fronei=n
understanding, prudence, S.Ant.1347 (anap.), 1353 (anap.); kra/tistoi fronei=n Antipho 2.1.1; kai\ f. kai\ sumpra/ttein X.Cyr.5.5.44; ei)de/nai kai\ f. Pl.Alc.1.133c; to\ f. kai\ to\ noei=n Id.Phlb.11b; le/gein te kai\ f. Id.Phdr.266b, cf. Isoc.4.50; tw=| fronei=n te kai\ swfronei=n Pl.Lg.712a; to\ mh\ fronou=n, of an infant, A.Ch.753; e)peidh\ ta/xista h)/rxeto f. Is.9.20; h( fronou=sa h(liki/a Aeschin.1.139: Com. of fish, i)xqu=s fronou=ntas
full-grown, Ephipp.21.3; zw=|on logiko\n kai\ fronou=n Phld.Piet.15: c. acc., fronh=sai ta\ kuriw/tata
to be wise in respect of the most important matters, Id.Rh.2.35S. with Advbs., eu)= fronei=n
think rightly, peri/ tinos Hdt.2.16;
to be sane (cf. infr. IV), E.Ba.851, Ar.Nu.817, Lys.19.41, etc.; ke/rdiston eu)= fronou=nta mh\ fronei=n dokei=n A.Pr.387; oi( fronou=ntes eu)= kratou=si pantaxou= S.Aj.1252, cf. El.394, E.Or.99, al. (but eu)= fr., also,
to be well
disposed, v. infr. 11.2); kakw=s, kalw=s f., Od.18.168, S.OT600, Ant.557; o)rqw=s f. And.2.23; o)rqw=s f. pro/s ti A.Pr. 1000; mw=ra, pla/gia f., S.Aj.594, E.IA332 (troch.).
think, Heraclit.113, Parm.16.3, Emp.108.2, cf. Arist.
de.An.427a19; w(s . . , o(/ti . . , S.Ant.49, OC872; fro/nei nin w(s h(/conta Id.Tr.289;
mean, a)/lla f. kai\ a)/lla le/gein Hdt. 9.54; e(/tera me\n le/gwn, e(/tera de\ fronw=n Din.1.47; o( mh\ le/gwn a(\ fronei= D.18.282, cf.19.224.
feel by experience, know full well, soi\ me\n dokei=n tau=t' e)/st', e)moi\ d' a)/gan fronei=n S.Aj.942, cf. OC1741 (lyr.); peirw/menos o(/ ti frone/oien [ta\ manth/i+a] to test the
knowledge of the oracles, Hdt.1.46.
to be fain that . . ,
c. acc. et inf., Il.3.98: c. inf.,
to be minded to do, 9.608, 17.286; without inf., oi( d' i)qu\s fro/neon [i)e/nai]
were minded to go right on ward, 13.135, cf. 12.124; h(=|per dh\ frone/w [tele/sai] 9.310; fronw=n e)/prasson
of set purpose, S.OC271: in Prose,
mean, intend, tou=to fronei= h(mw=n h( . . a)gwgh/ this is what your bringing us here
means, Th.5.85. freq. with neut. Adj., f. tini/ tina
to have certain
thoughts for or
towards any one,
to be so and so
minded towards him, patri\ fi/la frone/wn kindly
minded towards him, Il.4.219, cf. Od.6.313, etc.; kaka\ frone/ousi . . a)llh/loisin Il.22.264; tw=| o)loa\ frone/wn 16.701; malaka\ f. e)sloi=s Pi.N.4.95; pista/ tini Id.O.3.17; fronou=ntas a)/rista au)toi=s Ar.Pl.577 (anap.): with Advbs., eu)= fronei=n tisi (cf. supr. 1.2) Od.7.74, cf. A.Ag.1436, etc.; fronei=s eu)= toi=s h)ggelme/nois you
rejoice at them, Id.Ch.774; also ei)s u(ma=s eu)= f. And.2.4; tisi\ kalw=s f. SIG527.38 (Crete, iii B. C.); toiau=ta peri/ tinos f. Isoc.3.60:
to be minded so and so,
think or
purpose such and such things, a)gaqa\ f. Il.6.162, Od.1.43; fi/la f. ib.307; kaka/ 17.596; ta\ frone/eis a(/ t' e)gw/ per Il.4.361; krupta/dia f.
to have secret
purposes, 1.542; a)tala\ f.
to be gaily
disposed, 18.567, Hes.Th.989; pukina\ f.
have wise
thoughts, be cunningly
minded, Od.9.445; e)fhme/ria f.
think only of the passing day, 21.85; qeoi=sin i)=sa f. Il.5.441; qnhta\ f. S.Fr.590 (anap.), E.Alc.799; a)qa/nata Pl.Ti.90c; ou) kat' a)/nqrwpon f. A.Th.425, S.Aj.777; e)pi\ tai=s eu)tuxi/ais u(pe\r a)/nqrwpon f. X.Cyr.8.7.3; mhde\n u(pe\r th\n ph/ran f. Luc. Tim.57: also kai/ria f. S.El.228 (lyr.); sw/frona Id.Fr.64; ou) ta\ a)/rista f. Th.2.22; h( po/lis xei=ron f. Isoc.8.126; turannika\ f.
to have tyranny
in mind, Ar.V.507 (troch.); a)rxaii+ka\ f.
to have old-fashioned
notions, Id.Nu.821; ta\ tou= qeou=, ta\ th=s sarko\s f., Ev.Matt.16.23, Ep.Rom.8.5; also ou) parda/lios to/sson me/nos o(/sson *pa/nqou ui(=es frone/ousin the panther's courage is not so great as
is the spirit of the sons of Panthus, Il.17.23. esp. freq. in the phrase me/ga fronei=n
to be high-
minded, have high
thoughts, to be high-
spirited, Il.11.296, 13.156; of lions and boars, 16.758, 11.325, cf. X.Cyr.7.5.62; fronei= ga\r w(s gunh\ me/ga S.OT1078, cf. Lys.2.48, Isoc.4.132; in Att., freq. in bad sense,
to be presumptuous, e)f' e(autw=|, e(autoi=s me/ga f., Th.6.16, X.HG7.1.27 (also mega/la f. Ar.Ach.988; f. e)f' au(tw=| thlikou=ton h(li/kon ei)ko/s . . D.21.62): with Comp., mei=zon f.
to have over-high
thoughts, X.An.5.6.8 (but simply,
pluck up courage, e)pi\ tw=| gegenhme/nw| Id.HG3.5.21); f. mei=zon h)\ kat' a)/ndra S.Ant.768; mei=zon tou= de/ontos Isoc.7.7, cf. 6.34: rarely in pl., mei/zw th=s di/khs f. E.Heracl.933; with Sup., oi( me/giston fronou=ntes Pl.Phdr.257e; e)f' i(ppikh=| X.Ages.2.5; also ma/lista f. e)pi/ tini D.28.2; e)pi\ toi=s progo/nois ou) mei=on f. X.Eq.Mag.7.3, cf. Ap.24;
take pride in, e)pi\ paideu/sei me/ga fronou=ntes Pl.Prt.342d; f. e)pi\ th=| w(/ra| qauma/sion o(/son Id.Smp.217a; also f. ei)s h(ma=s me/ga E.Hipp.6; peri\ to\ gra/fein lo/gous Aeschin.2.125; me/ga f. o(/ti . . X.Cyr.2.3.13; me/ga f. w(s eu)= e)rw=n Pl.Smp.198d; me/ga f. mh\ u(pei/cein
haughty in their resolution not to . . , X.HG5.4.45: later f. alone, = me/ga f., fronh/sas e)f' au(tw=| Paus. 1.12.5; dia\ to\n pate/ra a)ciw/mati proe/xonta Id.4.1.2: opp. smikro\n f.
to be poor-
spirited, S.Aj.1120; mikro\n f. Isoc.4.151; mikro\n kai\ tapeino\n f. D.13.25, etc.; h(=sson, e)/lasson f. tinos, E.Andr.313, Ph. 1128; f. e)/latton h)\ pro/teron Isoc.12.47, etc.; ou) smikro\n f. e)s ta\s *)aqh/nas E.Heracl.386: also metriw/teron pro\s h(ma=s f. X.Cyr.4.3.7. of those who agree in
opinion, ta/ tinos fronei=n
to be of another's
mind, be on his
side or
of his
party, Hdt.2.162, etc.; ta\ sa\ f. Id.7.102; eu)= f. ta\ sa/ S.Aj.491; f. ta\ *brasi/don Ar.Pax640 (troch.), cf. D.18.161; also i)=son e)moi\ frone/ousa
thinking like me, Il.15.50, cf. S.Ant.374 (lyr.); tw)uto\ or kata\ tw)uto\ f.
to be like -
minded, make common cuase, Hdt.1.60, 5.3; e)moi\ f. cunw|da/ Ar.Av.635 (lyr.): opp. a)mfi\s f.
think differently, Il.13.345; a)/llh| f.
think another way, h.Ap.469.
comprehend, gignw/skw, frone/w Od.16.136, al.: more freq. c. acc.,
to be well aware of . . , ta\ frone/ous' a)na\ qumo/n, a(\ . . 2.116; ou)k o)/pida frone/ontes e)ni\ fresi/n
paying no
heed to it, 14.82; f. th\n h(me/ran
pay regard to it, Ep.Rom.14.6;
consider, ponder, Il.2.36, 18.4, al.
to be in possession of one's senses, sts. almost = zh=n,
to be sensible, be alive, e)me\ to\n du/sthnon e)/ti frone/ont' e)le/hson, for e)/ti zw=nta, Il.22.59; qano/nti d', ou) fronou=nti, deilai/a xa/ris e)pe/mpeto A.Ch.517; e)n tw=| f. ga\r mhde\n h(/distos bi/os S.Aj.554; mhde\ zh=n . . , mhde\ fronei=n Pl.Sph.249a; but also,
to be in one's senses or
right wits, fronou=nta, opp. memhno/ta, S.Aj.82, cf. 344; e)/cw e)lau/nein tina\ tou= fronei=n E.Ba.853; fronei=s o)rqa\ kou) mai/nh| Id.Med.1129; e)cesthkw\s tou= fronei=n Isoc.5.18; ta\ fala/ggia tou= f. e)ci/sthsi X. Mem.1.3.12; ou)k a)\n parei/mhn oi(=si mh\ dokw= fronei=n S.OC1666; e)gw\ nu=n fronw= to/t' ou) fronw=n E.Med.1329; fronw=n ou)de\n fronei=s
though in thy wits thou'rt nothing
wise, Id.Ba.332 (for eu)= f. v. supr.1.2); o(rw/ntwn, fronou/ntwn, blepo/ntwn u(mw=n Aeschin.3.94: zw=n kai\ fronw=n alive and
in his right mind, freq. in Inscrr., IGRom.1.804 (Perinthus), etc.; zw=n kai\ frenw=n (sic) Jahresh.23 Beibl. 206 (ibid.), Rev.Arch.21 (1925).240 (Callatis); now=n kai\ fronw=n Test.Epict.1.2, PPetr.3p.4 (iii B.C.).

fro/n-hma, atos, to/,
mind, spirit, e)/st' a)\n *dio\s f. lwfh/sh| xo/lou A.Pr.378; *ai)sxu/lou f. e)/xwn Telecl.14; with limiting epithets, f. du/sqeon A.Ch.191; u(pe/rtolmon ib.595(lyr.); w)mo/n Id.Th.537; e)leu/qeron Pl.Lg.865d; turanniko/n Id.R.573b, X. Lac.15.8: pl., Hdt.9.54.
thought, purpose, will, fqe/gma kai\ a)nemo/en f. S.Ant.354 (lyr.); yuxh\ kai\ f. kai\ gnw/mh ib.176, cf. 207; to\ f. th=s sarko/s, tou= pneu/matos, Ep.Rom.8.6: freq. in pl., karteroi=s fronh/masi with stubborn
thoughts, A.Pr.209; matai/wn . . fronhma/twn h( glw=ss' a)lhqh\s gi/gnetai kath/goros Id.Th.438; e)mpe/dois f. S.Ant.169; ta\ sklh/r' a)/gan f. ib.473; ta\ f. a)lhqina\ kai\ pa/nth| mega/la e)ke/kthnto Pl.Criti.120e. either in good or bad sense,
high spirit, resolution, pride, to\ *)aqhnai/wn f. Hdt.8.144, cf. 9.7.b/; a)ndri/ ge f. e)/xonti to a man of
spirit, Th.2.43; f. te kai\ pi/stis Arist. Pol.1313b2; f. e)/xwn e)leu/qeron ib.1314a3;
courage, opp. deili/a, Jul. Or.2.59c (pl.); douloi= to\ f. to\ ai)fni/dion Th.2.61: c. fut. inf., e)n fronh/mati o)/ntes th=s *peloponnh/sou h(gh/sesqai
aspiring to be leaders of the P., Id.5.40: freq. in pl.,
high thoughts, proud designs, diasei/sein ta\ *)aqhnai/wn f. Hdt.6.109, cf. 3.122,125, 9.54; ou) . . cumfe/rei toi=s a)/rxousi f. mega/la e)ggi/gnesqai tw=n a)rxome/nwn Pl.Smp.182c, cf. 190b, Isoc. 6.89; *zeu/s toi kolasth\s tw=n u(perko/mpwn a)/gan f. A.Pers.828; tw=n f. o( *zeu\s kolasth\s tw=n a)/gan u(perfro/nwn E.Heracl.387. in bad sense,
presumption, arrogance, fronh/matos ple/ws o( mu=qo/s e)stin A.Pr. 953, cf. E.Heracl.926 (lyr.), Ar.V.1024 (anap.), Pax25, Pl.Plt.290d, etc.; to\ tw=n *)atreidw=n f. Phld.Rh.2.217 S., etc.: pl., pausa/menoi tw=n f. Isoc.14.37; f. turannika/ Plu.Eum.13. pl., = fre/nes,
heart, breast, i)o\s e)k fronhma/twn . . pesw/n A.Eu.478.

fron-hma^ti/as, ou, o(,
self-confident, high-spirited, Arist.Pol.1313a40, Longin.9.4; f. e)pi\ th=| i(ppikh=| X.Ages.1.24; of a horse, Poll.1.195.

fron-hma^ti/zomai, Pass.,
to become presumptuous, Arist.Pol.1274a13; fronhmatisqe/ntes e)k tw=n e)/rgwn ib.1341a30; pefronhmatisme/noi dia/ ti ib.1284b2, cf. D.S.5.24; e)pi\ toi=s gegono/si Plb.21.25.8, D.S.9.2; c. dat., ni/kh| Id.12.48; plh=qos tw=n -isme/nwn w(s o(moi/wn kat' a)reth/n Arist.Pol.1306b28; f. o(/ti . .
to get a notion that . . , Sch.Theoc.14.48.

fron-hma^tismo/s, o(,
presumptuousness, arrogance, Plb(?).Fr.235, Them.Or.21.251b.
fron-hma^tw/dhs, es, = fronhmati/as, D.C.48.19; f. kai\ gorgo/s Philostr.Her.2.10; to\ f. Id.VS1.25.5.

fro/n-hsis, ews, h(,
purpose, intention, S.OT664 (lyr.); fro/nhsin labei=n lw/|w h(mi=n Id.Ph.1078.
thought, i)di/a f., opp. lo/gos cuno/s, Heraclit. 2; f. e)/xein Emp.110.10, cf. Arist.Metaph. 1009b18.
sense, ei)/ tis a)/ra toi=s e)kei= f. peri\ tw=n e)nqa/de gignome/nwn Isoc.14.61.
judgment, kata\ th\n i)di/an f. ou)dei\s eu)tuxei= Men. Mon.306.
arrogance, pride, E.Supp.216; also in good sense, to\ fu=nai patro\s eu)genou=s a)/po o(/shn e)/xei fro/nhsin
just pride, Id.Fr. 739.
practical wisdom, prudence in government and affairs, Pl. Smp.209a, Arist.EN1140a24, 1141b23, Isoc.12.204,217, Plu.2.97e, etc.; filosofi/as timiw/teron u(pa/rxei f. Epicur.Ep.3p.64U.: opp. a)maqi/a, Pl.Smp.202a; opp. sw=ma, Id.R.461a; opp. r(w/mh, Isoc.1.6; fro/nhsin a)skei=n X.Mem.1.2.10, Isoc.1.40, cf. 15.209: pl., h(donai\ kai\ fronh/seis Pl.Phlb.63a; h(liki/ai kai\ f. Id.Lg.665d; also attributed to
sagacious animals, Arist.GA753a12, HA608a15. Pythag. name for
three, Theol.Ar.14.

fron-hte/on,
one must think, e)pi/ tini me/ga f.
one must pride oneself on . . X.HG2.4.40; mei=zon f. Id.Ages.8.4; mei=on Id.Ap.26.

fron-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
concerned with thought, opp. qumiko/s, e)piqumhtiko/s, Nicom. ap. Theol.Ar.53.

froni/m-euma [i^], atos, to/,
prudent conduct, Stob.2.7.11e.

fronim-eu/omai,
to be wise, prudent, Phyrn.364.

froni/m-eusis, ews, h(,
exercise of prudence, Stoic.3.25, Sch.Luc.
Bis Acc.22.

fro/nim-os, on, also h, on Plu.2.1070b:—
in one's right mind, in one's senses, S.Aj.259 (anap.).
showing presence of mind, e)n toi=s deinoi=s X.An.2.6.7; to\ f.
presence of mind, Id.HG2.3.56.
sensible, prudent, opp. a)/frwn, Gorg. Fr.6; yuxh/ Pl.Sph.247a; opp.a)no/htos, Isoc.2.14 (Comp.); to\n fro/nimon zhtou=ntas . . w(/sper a)podedrako/ta Bato 2.3; w(s a)\n o( f. o(ri/seie Arist. EN1107a1, al.; f. peri/ tinos
possessing sagacity or
discernment in a thing, X.Cyr.1.6.15, 21 (Comp.); peri/ ti Pl.Grg.490b (Comp.), Isoc. 12.161 (Comp.); ei)/s ti Pl.Alc.1.125a; e)n tw=| si/tw| f. kai\ me/trioi X. Cyr.5.2.17. of thoughts, acts, and the like , f. ti e)rga/sasqai Ar. Lys.42; filo/polis a)reth/, fro/nimos ib.547 (lyr.). of birds as giving omens, tou\s a)/nwqen fronimwta/tous oi)wnou/s S.El.1058 (lyr.).
sagacious, of animals, Pl.Plt.263d, Arist.HA488b15, PA648a8 (Comp.), 687a8 (Sup.), GA753a11（Comp.), al. to\ f.
practical wisdom, prudence, E.Fr.52.9 (lyr.), Pl.R.586d, al.; opp. to\ a)/fron, Id.Phdr.235e; i)e/nai e)pi\ to\ fronimw/teron X.Smp.8.14: pl., a)/poros e)pi\ fro/nima helpless in point of
wisdom, S.OT692 (lyr.); ta\ -w/tera poiei=n Isoc.15.211. Adv. -mws Ar.Eq.1364, Av.1333 (lyr.), Pl.La.192e, etc.; opp. a)lo/gws, Isoc.3.9; f. e)/xein X.Cyr.3.3.57; diakei=sqai Isoc. 8.114: Comp. fronimw/teron, diakei=sqai tw=n a)/llwn Id.2.10; -wte/rws Id.13.15: Sup. -w/tata, le/gein X.Ap.20.
fronim-o/ths, htos, h(, = fro/nhsis 11, Gal.19.481, PSI1.94.2 (ii A. D.).
fronim-w/dhs, es, = fronhmatw/dhs, Philostr. Her.7 (s. v.l.).

fro/nis, ews, h(, (frh/n, frone/w)
prudence, wisdom, peri\ oi)=de di/kas h)de\ fro/nin a)/llwn [Nestor] knows the customs and
wisdom above other men, Od.3.244; kata\ fro/nin h)/gage pollh/n he brought back much
wisdom from Troy, 4.258, cf. Lyc. 1456, Opp.H.1.653.

fronou/ntws, Adv. part. pres. Act. of frone/w,
wisely, prudently, A. Supp.204, S.Ant.682.

front-i/zw, fut. Att. iw= E.Tr.1234, Ar.Nu.125, X.Mem.2.1.24, etc.: aor. e)fro/ntisa A.Pers.245 (troch.), etc.: pf. pefro/ntika E.Alc.773, Eup.352, Ar.Ec.263, etc.:—Med., fut. frontiou=mai, E.IT343 (s.v.l.):— Pass., v. infr. IV: (fronti/s): abs.,
consider, reflect, take thought, fronti/zwn eu(ri/skw Hdt.5.24, cf. A.Pr.1034, Supp.418 (lyr.), Ar.Nu.75, al.; zhtei=n kai\ f. kai\ bouleu/esqai Isoc.9.41;
give heed, pay attention, Pl.R.558a.
to be thoughtful or
anxious, pefrontiko\s ble/peis you look
careworn, E.Alc.773; ti/s d' e)/stin o( . . fronti/zwn; Phryn. Com.21; to\ pefrontiko/s, as Subst.,
care, thought, Plu.2.983b. with an object, c. acc. rei,
consider, ponder, e)/xqos e)mo/n Thgn.1247; *swkra/ths . . -i/zwn ti e(/sthke Pl.Smp.220c; deina/ . . toi=s tekou=si fronti/sai A.Pers.245 (troch.); [o)nei/rata] Hdt.7.16.b/;
devise, mhxanh/n Id.5.67; tou=to f. o(/kws mh\ lei/yomai Id.7.8.a/ (nisi leg. tou=ton）; e)kei=no d' ou) pefronti/kamen, o(/tw| tro/pw| . . mnhmoneu/somen Ar.Ec.263; also directly folld. by a relat. clause, f. h(/ntin' [o(do\n] i)/w prote/rhn Thgn.912; f. pro\s e(wuto\n w(s dw/sei Hdt.8.100; e)fro/ntis' h(=| die/fqartai bi/os E. Hipp.376; f. o(/ ti bou/letai e(auto\n kalei=n D.39.2, cf. X.Mem.3.7.6; f.
ti/ pote tou=t' e)/sti Id.Cyr.3.3.32;
take thought that . . ,
see to it that, o(/pws . . Pl.Ap.29e, X.An.2.6.8, PHib.1.82.10 (iii B. C.); later i(/na . . ib.43.7 (iii B. C.), Plb.2.8.8; w(s . . PTeb.10.6, al. (ii B. C.): c. inf., Ep.Tit.3.8, BGU8 ii 4 (iii A. D.), etc.: folld. by mh/ with subj., f. mh\ a)/riston h)=| Hdt.1.155, cf. X.Mem.4.2.39, cf. infr. 111; ou)de\n f. ei) . . Pl.Grg.503a; f. ei)/te . . , ei)/te . . Id.R.344e: c. inf., Plu.Fab.12: c. part., fronti/zeq' w(s maxou/menoi S.El.1370. c. gen.,
take thought for, give heed to a thing,
regard it, mostly with a neg. expressed or implied, soi\ d' e)/meqen me\n a)ph/xqeto fronti/sdhn Sapph. 41 (s.v.l.); *perse/wn ou)de\n f. Hdt.3.97, cf. 100, 151, 4.167; gh= au)xmou= fronti/zousa ou)de/n Id.4.198; *penqe/ws ou) fronti/sas E.Ba.637 (troch.); mhde\n o(/rkou fronti/sh|s Ar.Lys.915; tw=n oi)ketw=n . . mhde\n f. Lys.7.17; mhseno\s a)/llou f., plh\n o(/pws . . Isoc.15.305; ou)de\ tw=n no/mwn fronti/zousi Pl.R.563d; to\ para/pan qew=n mh\ f. Id.Lg.701c; conversely, tou\s qeou\s f. ou)de\n tw=n a)nqrwpi/nwn ib.888c, cf. Men.Epit.552: so with Advbs. implying a neg., smikra\ f. o)/xlou E.Or.801 (troch.); o)li/gon f. despotw=n Id.Cyc.163; smikro\n f. *swkra/tous Pl.Phd.91c; also without neg., ou(=per dei= ma/lista f. E.Heracl.242; tou= me\n o)no/matos f., tou= de\ pra/gmatos a)melei=n And.4.27; sfo/dra sou= f. X.Mem.3.11.10; ei) sofo\s a)nh\r tafh=s frontiei= Demetr.Lac.Herc.1012.26; later,
to be steward or
bailiff, tw=n u(parxo/ntwn tino/s BGU300.4 (ii A. D.): so with Preps., f. peri/ tinos
to be concerned or
anxious about, sfe/wn au)tw=n pe/ri Hdt.8.36, cf. X.Mem.1.1.12, E.Hipp.709; u(pe/r tinos Pl.Euthphr.4d; u(pe\r swthri/as D.1.2; less freq. in this sense c. acc. only, [*swkra/ths] ta)/lla me\n pefro/ntiken Eup.352; a)/llo ou)de\n fronti/zein Pl.Grg.501e; a)ll' ou) ta\ bi/ou . . dei= fronti/sai Men.330; h( d' e)fro/ntis' ou)de\ e(/n Cratin. 302 (troch.). later,
see to, provide for, furnish, sita/rion, xrh/sima, ZUP73.5, 69.2 (both ii B. C.); ta\ e)piba/llonta th=| e(orth=| BGU845.18 (ii A. D.); mhde\n fronti/sas Pherecr.80. c. acc. et part., ou) fronti/zei sklhrw=s se kaqh/menon Ar.Eq.783 (anap.). the object is freq. unexpressed, e)fro/ntize i(store/wn, i. e. inquired carefully, Hdt.1.56; oi)\ tou\s fi/lous bla/ptontes ou) fronti/zete who though ye do mischief to your friends
reck not
of it, E.Hec.256; mh\ fronti/sh|s
heed it not Ar.V. 228; ou), ma\ *di/), ou)d' e)fro/ntisa Id.Ra.493, cf. 650, Pl.215,704; c. part., toiau=ta . . gigno/mena . . o(rw=ntes ou)de\n fronti/zete And.4.23. Med. in signf. 11.1, frontizo/menon mh/ . . X.Hier.7.10: c. acc., E.IT343 (s. v. l.). later in Pass.,
to be an object of thought or
care, pefrontisme/nos
carefully thought out; lo/gos D.S.15.78, 16.32; lo/goi pefr. eu)= Philostr.VS1.11; tre/fontai trofh=| pefrontisme/nh| Ael.NA7.9; of a ward, h(-ome/nh u(p' e)mou= qugatridh= BGU300.16 (ii A. D.).

front-i/s, i/dos, h(, (frone/w)
thought, care, attention bestowed upon a person or thing, c. gen., fronti/d' e)/xein kama/tou Simon.85.10, cf. E.Med.1301; palaisma/twn la/be fronti/da take
thought for them, Pi.N.10.22; h)=san e)n fronti/di a)llh/lwn pe/ri Hdt.1.111, cf. 7.205; peri\ w(=n e)n f. mega/lh| kaqi/statai Phld.Rh.2.27S.; e)kei/nois ou)de\ ei(=s peri\ tou/tou lo/gos ou)de\ f. Pl.Phd.101e; f. e)poih/sato th=s *(ella/dos D.S.11.28, cf. 36, Ocell.4.14; peri/ tinos e)poiou=nto pollh\n f. v.l. in D.S.15.28: folld. by a relat. clause, e)n f. ei)=nai o(/ ti xrh\ poiei=n X.HG6.5.33, cf. Cyr.5.2.5. abs.,
thought, reflection, meditation, ta\ d' a)/lla fronti\s . . qh/sei dikai/ws A.Ag.912; polla\s . . o(dou\s e)lqo/nta fronti/dos pla/nois S.OT67 (parodied by Henioch.4.5, e)/xon . . polla\s fronti/dwn dieco/dous）; e)n fronti/di gi/gnesqai, of a person, X.Cyr.6.2.12; but moi e)n fronti/di e)ge/neto [to\ prh=gma] Hdt.2.104; e)mbh=sai/ tina e)s fronti/da to set one
a-thinking, Id.1.46; fronti/da . . qw/meqa A.Pers.142 (anap.); dei= baqei/as f. swthri/ou Id.Supp.407, cf. 417; poi= tis fronti/dos e)/lqh|; S. OC170 (anap.): pl.,
thoughts, no/on u(po\ glukuta/tais e)/qhke fronti/sin Pi.O.1.19; e)pi\ fronti/dwn zh=n to live
thoughtfully, E.Fr.684.4: prov., ai( deu/terai/ pws f. sofw/terai Id.Hipp.436. esp. of the
speculations of Socrates and the philosophers, Ar.Nu.233, al.; fronti/d' e)ch/mblwkas e)churhme/nhn ib.137; fronti/da filo/sofon e)gei/rein Id.Ec.572.(lyr.)
care, anxiety, Xenoph.8; kai/ me kardi/an a)mu/ssei f. A.Pers.161 (troch.); e)lpi\s a)mu/nei fronti/d' Id.Ag.102 (anap.), cf. 166 (lyr.), Eu.453; ou) fronti\s *(ippoklei/dh| no
matter to H., Hdt.6.129. cf. Hermipp.17; parasxei=n fronti/da tini/ Ar.Eq.612; ei)se/rxetai au)tw=| de/os kai\ f. Pl.R.330d: pl.,
cares, worries, lu/pas kai\ fronti/das e)mbe/blhken Antipho 2.2.2, cf. Isoc.Ep.2.11, Epicur.Ep.1p.28U.; mesto/n e)sti to\ zh=n fronti/dwn Men.452.
heart's desire, Pi.P. 10.62.
hypochondria, f. nou=sos xaleph/ Hp.Morb.2.72.
power of thought, mind, to\ . . a(lw/simon e)ma=| fronti/di S.Ph.863 (lyr.); ou)d' e)/ni fronti/dos e)/gxos Id.OT170(lyr.); to\ ga\r th\n f. e)/cw tw=n kakw=n oi)kei=n gluku/ ib.1390; ne/a ga\r f. ou)k a)lgei=n filei= E.Med. 48.
authority, PLond.1.242.8 (iv A. D.);
guardianship, PMasp.26.5 (vi A. D.).
office, function, department, Lyd.Mag. 2.7, al., Cod.Just.1.3.38.6 (pl.), Just.Nov.8 Not.49.
portion of land entrusted to a person, e(ka/sth f. tw=n futeuome/nwn to/pwn PFlor.148.12 (iii A. D.), etc.

fro/nt-i^sis, ews, h(,
care, consideration, Plot.4.3.4. = foreg.111.1, Just.Edict.13.10.2 (pl.).

fro/nt-isma, atos, to/,
that which is thought out, thought, invention, Ar.Nu.155, Luc.
Bis Acc.34, etc.; ta\ f.
premeditated speeches, Philostr.VS1 Prooem.; of a literary
work, ib.1.18.4, al. = fronti/s 111.2, PLond.5.1648.12 (iv A. D.), Lyd.Mag.1.50, al., Cod.Just.12.60.7.9, Just.Nov.8Ed.1.

front-iste/on,
one must take heed, E.IT468; ou) pa/nu h(mi=n ou(/tw f. ti/ e)rou=sin oi( polloi/ Pl.Cri.48a: c. gen., me/xri po/sou f. [tw=n a)nqrw/pwn] Epicur.Nat.28.6; ou) f. tino/s Str.16.4.16.

front-isth/rion, to/,
place for meditation, thinking-shop, yuxw=n sofw=n f., of Socrates'
school, Ar.Nu.94, al.;
monastic community of Indian sages, Philostr.VA3.50, 6.6: generally,
school, study, Luc.Ner.1, Poll.4.41;
lecture-room, auditorium, Procop.Gaz.Ep.114. = Lat. Curia (as if from
cura), D.C.Fr.5.8.
law-court, PLips.38.14 (iv A.D.).

front-isth/s, ou=, o(,
deep thinker, as Socrates is called in derision by Ar.Nu.266, cf. 414 (anap.), al.; f. tw=n metew/rwn, tw=n ou)rani/wn,
one who meditates on supra-terrestrial things, X.Smp.6.6, Mem.4.7.6; ta\ . . mete/wra f. Pl.Ap.18b: hence, generally,
philosopher, X. Smp.7.2, cf. Hsch.
one who takes care of, tinwn D.S.37.8;
curator, i(erou= *)afrodi/ths IGRom.1.1167C4 (Egypt, ii A. D.); sunagwgh=s JHS28.195 (Side), cf. BMus.Inscr.1069 (Fayum, ii A.D.); tw=n dhmosi/wn pragma/twn Sch.Ar.Pl.908; tw=n a)rxome/nwn Poll.1.40:
manager, kakw=| f. ta\ kaq' e(autou\s e)pitre/yomen Porph.Abst.1.50; paru/grwn Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).177; without gen.,
manager, housekeeper, Phld.Oec.p.51 J.: as transl. of Lat.
procurator, o( f. *drou/sou IGRom.4.219 (Ilium). title of official of a fratri/a, IG14.759.8 (Naples).
bailiff, house-steward, Gp.7.8.1, BGU603.2 (ii A. D.), etc.

front-lstiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for thinking, thoughtful, Arist.Div.Somn.464a23; u(popi/nwn de\ pa/nu f. (sc. gi/gnetai) Antiph. 271; f. th\n pro/soyin Luc.Pisc.12: to\ logistiko\n kai\ f. the faculty
of reasoning and
thought, Plu.2.432c, cf. 966a.
considerate, careful, ta\ qh/lea peri\ th\n tw=n te/knwn trofh\n frontistikw/tera Arist. HA608b2. Adv. -kw=s X.Mem.3.11.10, Ael.NA8.25.
nervous, worried, Gal.10.538.

front-i/stria, h(, fem. of frontisth/s,
guardian, ui(wnou= PLond.3.1164a6 (iii A. D.), cf. BGU1662.4 (ii A. D.).

frou=dos, h, on, also os, on S.El.807, E.IT154 (lyr.), Plu.2.263a: (contr. from pro\ o(dou=, as froi/mion from prooi/mion, frouro/s from *prooro/s): —
gone away, clean gone (as Hom. says in full, oi( d' w)/|xonto i)de\ pro\ o(dou= e)ge/nonto, Il.4.382): of persons,
gone, fled, departed, f. e)sti S.Ant.15, etc.; f. e)c oi)/kwn, do/mwn a)/po, E.Alc.94 (lyr.), Andr.73; skhna\s e)s i(era/s Id.Ion804; beba=si f. Id.IT1289; oi)/xetai f. Ar.Ach.210 (lyr.); c. part., frou=doi/ [ei)si] diw/konte/s se they are
gone in pursuit, S.Ph.561; f. a)narpasqei/s Id.El.848 (lyr.); f. e)cw|kisme/noi Ar.Pax197; f. h)= ple/wn Antipho 5.29; also of the dead, f. au)to\s ei)= qanw/n S.El.1152; *)anti/loxos au)tw=| f. Id.Ph.425, cf. E.Tr.41, al.; f. e)s *(/aidhn Id.Med.1110 (anap., folld. by qa/natos wh. is corrupt).
undone, ruined, ib.722, Heracl.703 (anap.), Or. 390. of things,
gone, vanished, frou=da ta)peilh/mata S.OC660; ou(moi\ lo/goi pro\s ai)qe/ra f. E.Hec.335; f. soi qusi/ai Id.Tr.1071 (lyr.); e)lpi/des Id.Ion866 (anap.); ta\ d' e)n do/mois dapa/naisi f. Id.HF592; frou/dh me\n au)dh/, frou=da d' a)/rqra they are
gone, i.e. refuse their office, Id.Andr.1078, cf. Ar.Nu.718 (anap.).—Rarely found in any case but nom. sg. and pl.: gen. sg. once in S., Aj.264.—Trag. word, once in Antipho l.c.; freq. in later Prose, as Luc.Merc.Cond.24, Aristid. 1.161J.: acc. is found in Plu.Pyrrh.31, 2.405f.

froumenta/rios, o(, = Lat.
frumentarius, SIG830.5 (Delph., ii A.D.), Pelekides 86 (Thessalonica, ii A. D.). froum<ent>ari/a, h(,
cornreceipt, POxy.43 ii 11 (iii A. D., dub., v. formari/a).
frou=nos, o(, late form for fru=nos, PMag.Osl.1.235.

froura/, Ion. front-rh/, h(: (v. frouro/s fin.):—
look-out, watch, guard, as a duty, A.Ag.2, Hdt.2.30, IG12.3.26, etc.; e)s f. do/mwn E.Or. 1252; froura\n e)ta/cant' e)n do/mois Id.Andr.1099; froura\n a)/zhlon o)xh/sw shall keep unenviable
watch, A.Pr.143 (anap.); o)/mmatos froura/ my
watchful eye, S.Tr.226; froura=s a)/|dwn singing
while on guard, to keep oneself awake or while away the time, Ar.Nu.721 (anap.); toi=s . . pistote/rois . . diete/takto h( f. Pl.Criti.117d.
a watch of the night, h( nukterinh\ f. Hdn.3.11.6; v.l. in E.Rh.5 (anap.).
prison, ward, Pl.Phd.62b, Grg.525a. of persons set to watch,
guard, garrison, Hdt.6.26, 7.59, A.Ag.301, Th.3.51, IG22.28.14, etc.; esp. of
frontier-posts, X.HG6.5.24, etc.; strateiw=n kai\ frourw=n Lys.16.18; e)ch/lqomen ei)s *pa/nakton froura=s prografei/shs being ordered on
garrison-duty, D.54.3; ta\ ku/klw| kate/xein a(rmostai=s kai\ frourai=s Id.18.96; froura\n u(pode/xesqai Id.58.38. at Sparta,
a body of men destined for service, froura\n fai/nein proclaim or order out a
levy, 'call out the
ban', of the ephors and kings, X.HG 3.2.23, 6.4.17; e)pi/ tinas ib.4.7.1, etc.; ei)do/tes froura\n pefasme/nhn e)f' e(autou/s ib.5.1.29; f. e)ca/gein ib.2.4.29.

frourarx-e/w,
to be commandant of a garrison, Inscr.Prien.19.6 (iii B. C.), 37.66 (ii B. C.), Plu.Dio11.
froura/rx-hs, ou, o(, = frou/rarxos, Them.Or.10.136b (pl.).

frourarx-i/a, h(,
office or
post of frou/rarxos, X. Mem.4.4.17, Milet.3No.37d (iii B. C.), Plu.Phoc.31.

frou/rarx-os, o(,
commander of a watch, or
commandant of a garrison, IG12.10.13, al., X. An.1.1.6, Cyr.5.3.17, Pl.Lg.760d, Men.Kol.60, Aen.Tact.22.20, Plb.21.42.1, PTeb.6.13 (ii B. C.), OGI111.16 (Egypt, ii B. C.), etc.; oi( f. the
guardians, Pl.Lg.843d: metaph., [qeoi\] e(ka/stw| to\n tro/pon sunh/rmosan f. Men.Epit.554 (spelt frou/arxos Wilcken Chr.162 i 11 (ii B. C.), and v.l. in Plb. l.c.).
gaoler, Aristaenet. 1.20.

frour-e/w, Poet. impf. frou/roun S.Tr.915: fut. -h/sw A.Pr.31, etc.: aor. e)frou/rhsa Hdt.2.30, etc.:—Med., fut. -h/somai in pass. sense, E.Ion603:—Pass., aor. e)frourh/qhn ib.1390: pf. pefrou/rhmai Hp.Ep. 23 (Ps.-Democr.), (dia-) A.Fr.265: (frouro/s):—
keep watch or
guard, e)n *)elefanti/nh| Hdt. l.c., cf. 9.106, IG12.99.21, OGI38.1 (iii B. C.), etc.; of ships, f. peri\ *nau/pakton or e)n *naupa/ktw|, Th.2.80,83; f. e)pi/ tini
to keep watch over . . , E.Alc.35 (anap.); oi( frourou=ntes the
guardians, Pl.Lg.763d; suna/ptein . . frourou=ntas . . frourou=si ib.758b; prov., e)n panti\ . . skorpi/os f. li/qw| S.Fr.37; generally, 'keep a sharp look-out', Id.Tr.915. trans.,
watch, guard, th\n xw/rhn Hdt.3.90; th\n ge/furan Id.4.133; th\n a)trapo/n Id.7.217; bre/tas A. Eu.1024; se\ dai/mwn . . frourh/sas tu/xoi S.OT1479; th\n *potei/daian f.
garrison it, Th.3.[17], cf. X.Cyr.6.1.17, etc.; fulakai=si f. sw=m' *)odusse/ws
set a watch over . . E.Cyc.690: metaph., f. pe/tran
keep watch over it, of Prometheus, A.Pr.31; sto/ma eu)/fhmon frourei=n a)gaqo/n
keep
silence, E.Ion98 (anap.); h( ei)rh/nh tou= qeou= . . frourh/sei ta\s kardi/as u(mw=n Ep.Phil.4.7:—Pass.,
to be watched or
guarded, Hdt.7.203, A.Eu. 218, S.OC1013, E.Hec.995, etc.: of the watch kept by besiegers, ku/klw| frourou/menos u(po\ pa/ntwn polemi/wn Pl.R.579b.
hold in subjection, opp. parafula/ttein, Plb.18.4.6. Astrol.,
occupy, in Pass., Vett.Val.106.18.
bind, a(lu/sesi pefrourhme/nos PMag.Par.1.3093.
watch for, observe, frourw=n to/d' h)=mar E.Alc.27; f. o)/mma e)pi\ sw=| . . kairw=| S.Ph.151 (lyr.); f. xre/os
to be observant of one's duty, Id.El.74. Med.,
to be on one's guard against, beware of, c. acc., frourou/menos be/lemna E.Andr. 1135:—Act. also in the same sense, e)frou/rei mhde\n e)camarta/nein Id.Supp.900; f. o(/pws or o(/pws a)\n . . , with subj., S.El.1402, E.Hel.742; f. mh/ . . , with subj., Id.El.1139.

frou/r-hma, atos, to/, poet. Noun:
that which is watched or
guarded, lei/as bouko/lwn frourh/mata the herdsmen's
charge of spoil, S.Aj.54.
guard, A.Eu.706; of a single man, Id.Th.449; lo/gxai despotw=n frourh/mata E.El.798.
watch, ward, frou/rhma e)/xein Id.Ion511 (troch.).

frou/r-hsis, ews, h(,
watching, Aq., Sm., LXX 2 Ki.5.24.

frour-hth/r, h=ros, o(,
watcher, guard, Man.4.47.

frour-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for watching or
guarding, Iamb.Myst.3.10, Dam.Pr.96,252, Procl.Inst.145,154, Lyd.Mens.4.67.

frour-hto/s, h/, o/n,
watched, guarded, AP6.230 (Quint.).

frour-h/twr, oros, o(,
guardian, qesmw=n ib.9.812.

frour-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of, for a watch, guard, or
garrison, to\ f. D.C.56.42. frourikh/, h(,
guard duty, SIG633.51 (Milet., ii B. C.).

frou/r-ion, Dor. frw/rion Inscr.Cret.1 xvi 17.15 (Lato, ii B. C.), to/,
fort, citadel, A.Eu.919 (lyr.), IG12.93.17, etc.; a)nti\ tou= po/lis ei)=nai frou/rion kate/sth Th.7.28: esp.
hill-fort, as distd. from a fortified town, Id.2.18, 3.18,51, Lys.12.40, X.Cyr.1.4.16, etc.; bi/on w(s oi)ktro\n e)cantlou=sin oi( ta\ f. throu=ntes Men.74; ta\ f. kai\ ta\ o(/ria th=s *)attikh=s IG22.1028.22.
prison, of the body, Pl.Ax.366a.
garrison, of a place, A.Pr.801 (where Sch. also expl. by
thing to be guarded against); fulasso/mesqa frouri/oisi E.Or.760 (troch.); po/lews f., of the Areopagites, A.Eu.949 (anap.).

frour-i/s, i/dos, h( (sc. nau=s),
guardship, IG12.22.74, Th.4.13, X.HG1.3.17.

frourodo/mos, on,
guarding the house, ku/nes AP9.245 (Antiphan.).

frouro/s, o(,
watcher, guard, IG12.11.9, al., 42(1).40.16 (Epid., v/iv B. C.), E.Ion22, Rh.506; frourou\s e)gkate/lipon left
a garrison in a place, Th.2.6, cf. 4.25; e)kba/llein tou\s f. Id.8.108; oi( f. oi( e)n *)/andrw| IG22.123.10; oi(\ . . a)/ristoi f. te kai\ fu/lakes . . ei)si/ Pl.R.560b; identified with fu/lakes, X.Cyr.8.6.1,3; tou\s fu/lakas oi(=on frourou/s Arist.Pol.1264a26. (Contr. from *prooro/s (cf. ou)=ros (B)), as froi/mion from prooi/mion, frou=dos from pro\ o(dou=.）

frouru/ths, htos, h(,
function of a guard, PCair.Preis.15.10(iv A. D.).

fru/-agma [u^], atos, to/,
violent snorting, esp.
neighing or
whinnying of a spirited horse ( = h( tw=n i(/ppwn kai\ h(mio/nwn dia\ mukth/rwn h)xh/, EM801.11), i(ppika\ f. A.Th.245,475, S.El.717; f. kai\ fu/shma X.Eq. 11.12; also of a boar, Opp.C.2.457. metaph.,
wanton behaviour, insolence, M.Ant.4.48; to\ e)p' o)fru/si f. AP12.101 (Mel.); sobaro\n f. ib.5.17 (Rufin.); to\ f. ai)/rein Ael.NA7.12; f. pro/s tina Luc.Cat.26; f. o(mozu/gou plousi/as Aristaenet.2.12, cf. Philostr.Im. 2.2.

fru-agma^ti/as, ou, o(,
hot-tempered, of a horse, Hsch. s.v. pedawristh/s. metaph. as Adj.,
arrogant, wanton, bi/os Plu. Ant.2.
fru-agmo/s, o(, = fru/agma, D.S.19.31; v.l. for frim-, D.H. Comp.16(pl.).

fru-agmose/mna^kos, on,
wanton and haughty, e)/xwn tro/pous f., coined to describe Bdelycleon in Ar.V.135.
fru-akth/s, ou=, o(, = fruagmati/as, i(/ppos D.L.6.7.

fru-a/ssomai, Att. fru-a/ttomai, prop. of spirited, high-fed horses,
neigh, whinny and prance, Call. Lav.Pall.2, AP5.201 (Asclep. or Posidipp.), cf. Thom. Mag.p.381R.; f. pro\s tou\s a)gw=nas
neigh eagerly for the race, Plu.Lyc.22; also of a cock, Ael.NA7.7, cf. infr. 11. metaph. of men,
to be wanton, haughty, insolent, Ph.1.151,297, al., Alciphr.3.27; mh\ gau=ra frua/ssou AP12.33 (Mel.), cf. Gal.10.180: also c. acc., *)/erwtes sku=la fruasso/menoi APl.4.215 (Phil.); f. e)pi/ tini
to be proud of a thing, D.S.4.74; e)/n tisi AP4.3.27 (Agath.). trans., = kataplh/ttw, Men. 1081. Act. frua/ssw LXX Ps.2.1 (quoted in Act.Ap.4.25); of birds, Cyran.81, cf. Gloss.

fru_ga^n-i/zw,
gather firewood, Poll.7.142.
fru_ga^n-iko/s, h/, o/n, = fruganw/dhs, ta\ f. Thphr.HP1.5.3, 6.6.1; f. e)/mblhma Sammelb.7361.13 (iii A. D.): Sup., -w/tata th=| proso/yei Thphr.CP3.7.11.
fru_ga^/n-ion, to/, Dim. of fru/ganon, Dsc.3.91.
fru_ga^n-i/s, i/dos, h(, = fru/ganon, Eust. 862.32.

fru_ga^n-ismo/s, o(,
a gathering of firewood, e)pi\ f. e)celqei=n Th.7.4, cf. 13, Ph.2.167; coupled with laxanei/a, J BJ4.9.8.

fru_ga^n-isth/r, h=ros, o(,
one who gathers firewood, Polyaen. 1.18:—fem. fru_ga^n-i/stria, Ar. Fr.887.

fru_ga^n-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
for fuel, ka/lamos PCair.Zen.86.3 (iii B. C.): fem. fru_ga^n-i=tis, idos, u(/lh Hld.9.8.
fru_ga^noeidh/s, e/s, = fruganw/dhs, Dsc.3.36, 154.

fru/ga^non [u_], to/, (fru/gw)
dry stick; mostly in pl.,
firewood, Hdt. 4.62, Ar.Av.642, Th.3.111, X.An.4.3.11, SIG1027.13 (Cos, iv/iii B. C.), Act.Ap.28.3; fruga/nois kai\ li/qois perifra/cantes Arist.HA 603a9: Com., *fru/ges e)sti\ kaino\n dra=ma tou=t' *eu)ripi/dou . . w(=| kai\ *swkra/ths ta\ fru/gan' u(poti/qhsi prob. in Telecl.40: sg. only in collect. sense = ta\ fru/gana, mantikw=s to\ f. ti/qesqai Ar.Pax1026; to\ f. e)pikai/ousi Plu.2.553c.
undershrub, opp. de/ndra, qa/mnos, po/a, defined as to\ a)po\ r(i/zhs poluste/lexes kai\ polu/kladon, Thphr.HP1.3.1.

fru_ga^nofo/ros, on,
gathering dry sticks, Lys.Fr.257 S.

fru_ga^nw/dhs, es,
of or
belonging to the class of undershrubs, Thphr. HP6.6.2, Dsc.4.48, 159; f. spe/rmata Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11; ta\ f. the
class of fru/gana, Thphr.HP1.3.4: Comp., Dsc.3.155.

fru/g-etron [u_], to/, (fru/gw)
a vessel for roasting barley, Polyzel. 6 (troch.(?)): carried by brides in procession, as a symbol of household duties, LexSolonisap.Poll.1.246.
stick to stir barley while roasting, Hsch.

frug-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = foreg.1, Theopomp.Com. 53.
one who roasts, Poll.7.181.

frug-i/a, h(,
female roaster, Hsch. = a)/splhnos, Ps.-Dsc.3.134.
frugiatiko/n, to/, an unknown plant, Gp.12.1.2.

fru^giau/lion, to/,
music for the flute in the Phrygian mode, BGU 1125.4,30 (i B. C.).

fru^gi/los [i^], o(,
chaffinch, Ar.Av.763,875 (cf. Lat.
fringilla).

fru_g-i/nda pai/zein, play
with roasted beans, Poll.9.110,114, Hsch.

fru_/g-ion, to/,
firewood, LXX Ps.101(102).4.
drying-place, basking-place, EM561.12.

fru_/g-ios, a, on,
dry, Hsch.

fru/gios [u^], a, on, also os, on Luc.Harm.1: (*fru/c):—
Phrygian, di' ai)/as . . *frugi/as A.Supp.548 (lyr.), etc.; dei/mata *f. the terrors
of the Phrygian goddess, E.El.457 (lyr.). *f. no/moi, me/lea, Phrygian music, esp. of music played on the flute, said to have been invented by Marsyas, E.Or.1426 (lyr.), Tr.545 (lyr.); *f. au)loi/ Id.Ba.127 (lyr.): pa=sa bakxei/a . . ma/lista . . e)sti\n e)n toi=s au)loi=s . . : o( diqu/rambos o(mologoume/nws dokei= ei)=nai *f. Arist.Pol.1342b7; th=s *frugi/on [a(rmoni/as] to\ e)/nqeon Luc. l.c.; *f. dia\ pasw=n ei)=dos, to/nos, tro/pos, Phrygian scale, Cleonid.Harm.9,12, Alyp.Diat.7,al. *f. li/qos, an
aluminous kind of
pumice-stone, used by dyers, Dsc.5.123.

fru^gisti/. Adv., of music,
in the Phrygian mode, Pl.R.399a; h( *f. (sc. a(rmoni/a) Arist.Pol.1290a21, 1340b5; ta\ *f. me/lh ib. 1342b6.
fru^g-i=tis, h(, = frugi/a 11, Ps.-Dsc.3.134.

fru^g-mo/s, o(,
drying, roasting, Hsch.

fru^/g-w[u_], Ar.Ec.221, etc. (in late writers also fru/ttw, in Pass., Dsc.2.148 (v.l.), Sch.Od.9.388): fut. fru/cw (v. infr.), Dor. -cw= Theoc.7.66: aor. e)/fruca Cratin.143.2 (hex.), Hp.Ulc.11, 12:—Pass., aor. e)fru/xqhn Hom.Epigr.14.4. Gal.6.289 (v.l.); e)fru/ghn [u^] Hp.Ulc.12, AP7.293 (Isid.Aeg.), Gal.6.289: pf. pe/frugmai Pherecr.159, Th.6.22, Hp.Acut.（Sp.）47:—
roast or
parch, tragh/mata Ar.Ra.511, cf. Ec.221; fru/cas, e(yh/sas ka)p' a)nqrakia=s o)pthsas Cratin. l.c.; fru/cantes a)pe/yousi Hdt.2.94; e)retmoi=si fru/cousi (Kuhn for fri/cousi)
they shall cook with the [wood of the] oars, Orac. ap. Hdt.8.96:—Pass., fru/getai tragh/mata Ar.Ec.844; pefrugme/noi e)re/binqoi Pherecr. l.c.; pefr. kriqai/
roasted barley, Th.6.22; kuminon pefr. Sor.1.119. of the sun,
parch, Theoc.6.16, 12.9; of thirst, e)fru/gh di/yeus u(/po AP l.c. (The relation to Lat.
frīgo 'roast', Skt.
bhṛjjáti 'he roasts',
bhṛ[snull ][tnull ]á- 'roasted', is not clear.)

frukto/s, h/, o/n, (fru/gw)
roasted, u(ma=s . . fruktou\s skeua/sw I'll make
roast meat of you, Ar.V.1331 (lyr.); a)mu/gdala f. Sor.1.123. as Subst., frukto/s, o(,
fire-brand, torch: esp.
signal-fire, beacon, A.Ag.30,282,292; fruktoi\ e)s ta\s *)aqh/nas pole/mioi h)/| ronto Th.2.94, cf. 3.22, Aen.Tact.7.4, Onos.25.3. frukto/s (sc. ku/amos), o(,
a lot, because roasted beans were used for drawing lots, Plu.2.492a: also,
a bean for voting, Poll.8.18. fruktoi/, oi(,
small fish for frying, small fry, Anaxandr.33.11, Alex.155.3; frukta/, ta/, Hsch. frukth/, h(, a kind of
resin, Gal.13.589, Paul.Aeg.3.59.

fruktwr-e/w,
make fire-signals, Din.Fr.9.5, Onos.25.2:—Pass., e)fruktwrh/qhsan nh=es prosple/ousai the approach of ships
was signalled by beacon-fires, Th.3.80.

fruktwr-i/a, h(,
making signals by beacons, A.Ag.33,490 (pl.), S.Fr.432.6; e)/nnuxos E.Rh.55; kaqesth/kasi fruktwri/ai e)n toi=si pu/rgois Ar.Av.1161; ta\ shmei=a th=s f. Th.3.22. concrete, = frukto/s 11, v. l. for sq. in Arist.Mu.398a31,32.

fruktw/r-ion, to/,
beacon-tower, signal-station, ib.398a31,32 Plu.Pomp.24, Hdn.4.2.8.

fruktwr-o/s, o(, (frukto/s 11, ou)=ros (B)),
one who watches on a height to make fire-signals, A.Ag.590, Th.8.102.
fire-signal, beacon, Lyc.345 (proparox., s.v.l.).

fru/nh [u_], h(,
toad, Arist.HA530b34, Timae.156, Ael.NA17.12. = batra/xion 2, Cyran.39. nickname of several Athenian courtesans, from their complexion, Ar.Ec.1101, Macho ap.Ath.13.583b:—so fru=nis, o(, name of a Com. Poet, Ar.Nu.971. (Cf. Skt.
babhrús 'brown', OHG.
brūn 'brown', etc.)
fru_niko/s, h/, o/n, = frunoeidh/s, Asclep.Jun. ap. Gal.13.1023.
fru/nion [u_], to/, = poti/rrion, Dsc.3.15. = batra/xion1, Ps.- Dsc.2.175.

fru_ni/xeios [i^], a, on,
of or
like Phrynichus (the Com. Poet), to\ *f. e)klakti/zein Ar.V.1524 (lyr., ubi v. Sch.).

fru_no-eidh/s, e/s,
like a toad, ba/traxos Arist.Pr.862a11.

fru_no-lo/gos, o(,
toad-catcher, or frunolo/xos, o(, (loxa/w)
