lying in wait for toads, a species of hawk, perh.
marsh-harrier, Id.HA620a21.
fru=nos, o( （h(, Babr.28.6), = fru/nh, Arist.HA609a24, Nic.Al.567, Babr.24.4, App.Anth.5.47 (frou=non ap. Synes.); cf. frou=nos. a stone, = batraxi/ths, Cyran.39. a bird, ibid.

fru_nw/ndeios, o(,
a swindler, cheat, rogue (from Phrynondas, a notorious swindler mentioned by Ar.Th.861, Isoc.18.57), Phryn.PS p.124 B.

fru/c, o(, gen. *fru^go/s,
a Phrygian, Il.2.862, al.; as the name of a slave, Ar.V.433; Phrygians were a byword for cowardice, deilo/teros lagw\ *frugo/s prov. ap. Str.1.2.30, cf. Apollod. Com.6.
fru/c, o( (?), gen. frugo/s, perh. = fru/gana, dub. in Gloss.

fru/cis, ews, h(,
burning, parched state, adustion, Sever.Clyst.22, Sch.Orib.iii p.687 D.
fru/ttw, = fru/gw (q.v.).

fu=,
fie! faugh! an exclam. of disgust, Ar.Lys.295,305, cj. in Th. 245. Ep. for e)/fu.

fu^ga^gwgo/s, o/n, (fuga/s)
dragging along fugitives, f.l. for lafuragwgo/s in Polyaen.8.16.6.

fu/ga^de, Adv., (fu^gh/)
to flight, fu/gade tra/pe mw/nuxas i(/ppous Il.8.157, cf. 257; fu/gad' au)=tis u(postre/yas 11.446; a)/lloi f. mnw/onto e(/kastos 16.697.

fu^ga^d-ei/a, h(,
exile, banishment, Plb.6.14.7, Vett. Val.94.1.
body of fugitives, LXX Ez. 17.21 cod.Alex.

fu^ga^d-ei=on, to/,
place of refuge, fugadei=a dou/lwn LXX2 Es.4.15: written fuga/dion ib.Nu.35.15.

fu^ga^/d-eusis, ews, h(, = Lat.
fugitatio, Gloss.

fu^ga^d-eute/on,
one must banish, Porph.VP22.

fu^ga^d-euth/rion, to/,
city of refuge, LXXNu.35.6, Jo.20.2, al.

fu^ga^d-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
banishing, tinos Hld.8.11. f. xrh/mata the property
of exiles, Phot. s.v. masth=res.

fu^ga^d-euto/s, h/, o/n,
exiled, dub. cj. in Gloss.

fu^ga^d-eu/w, Elean fuga^dei/w Schwyzer 424.1 (iv B. C.):—
banish, X.HG2.3.42, 5.4.19; e)k th=s po/lews D.40.32; deu=r' au)to\n (sc. *)/erwta） e)fuga/deusan w(s h(ma=s ka/tw Aristopho 11.7: opp. o)straki/zw, Arist.Pol.1288a25; metaph., to\ qh=lu tou= bi/ou f. Luc.Am.38:—Pass., X.HG2.4.14, D.S.14.32, etc.; pefugadeume/noi Plu.Ant.15. intr.,
live in banishment, SIG175.20 (Delph., iv B. C.), Schwyzer 424.6 (Elis, iv B.C.), LXXPs.54(55).8: fut. fugadeu/somai POxy.1477.15 (iii/iv A. D.), Plb.10.22.1.

fu^ga^d-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for an exile, f. proqumi/a the reckless zeal
of a refugee, Th.6.92; f. e)lpi/des Plu.Pel.8; f. nh=sos Id.2.603b; f. oi)ki/ai IG12(9).196.24 (Eretria, iv B. C.); oi( fugadikoi/, = oi( fuga/des, Plb.22.10.6; to\ f. D.H.6.63, D.S.14.32. Adv. -kw=s, zw=ntas Plu.Tim.24.
fu^/ga^d-is (parox.), Adv., = fu/gade, Theognost.Can.163, EM806.8.

fu^ga^do-dai/mwn, on, gen. onos, h( (sc. ko/rh), a name for
mercury, Zos.Alch.p.206 B.

fu^ga^do-qh/ras, ou, o(,
one who hunts after runaways or
exiles, Plb.9.29.3, Plu.Dem.28, Procl. in Cra.p.40P.

fu^g-ai/xmhs, ou, Dor. fu^/g-mas, a, o(,
fleeing from the spear, unwarlike, cowardly, A.Pers.1025 (lyr.), Call.Fr.117.

fu^g-anqrwpeu/w,
shun mankind, f. e)s e)rhmi/hn Aret.SD1.6.

fu^g-anqrwpi/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
shunning of mankind, ib.5.

fu^g-arseni/a, poet. fu^g-i/h, h(,
shunning of men, Man.4.64.

fu^g-arxe/w,
shun rule, prob. cj. for filarxe/w or fularxe/w in Arist. Pol.1295b12.

fu^g-a/s, a/dos, o(, h(: (feu/gw):—
one who flees from his country, either voluntarily,
runaway, fugitive, or by legal sentence,
exile, Hdt.1.150, 3.138, etc.; e)cekhru/xqhn f. S.OC430; e)celh/lamai f. ib.1292; f. pa/shs th=s xw/ras X.HG4.1.7; th=s patri/dos Pl.Alc.2.145b; a)nqrw/pwn Plu.Ant.69; f. th=s tw=n e)celasa/ntwn ponhri/as Th. 6.92; f. e)c *)/hlidos, e)k *lari/shs, X.HG3.2.29, 6.4.34; fuga/d' a)p' ou)ranou= qeo/n A.Supp.214; f. e)c *)aqhnw=n u(po\ *)aqhnai/wn X.HG1.5.19; f. par' u(mw=n
a deserter from . . , Id.Cyr.6.3.11; e)/nqen . . ei)mi\ f. Id.An. 5.6.23; tou\s de\ f. e)nteu=qen e)poi/hse Lys.13.64, cf. X.HG4.1.40; kata/gein fuga/das to restore
them, Hdt.5.31; f. kaqei=nai, katade/xesqai, X.HG2.2.20, 5.2.10: prov., ai( e)lpi/des bo/skousi fuga/das E.Ph. 396; ai( f. pu/lai D.H.1.46; mhde/na ei)=nai . . u(perori/an fuga/da, is dub. in Pl.Lg.855c. of an army,
put to flight,S.Ant.108 (lyr.).
fugga/nw, collat. form of feu/gw, A.Pr.513, S.El.132 (lyr.), Hp. Int.12:—the compds. with a)po-, dia-, e)k-, kata- occur in Prose.

fu/gda^, Adv.
in flight, A.Eu.256 (lyr.); fu/gdhn, Nic.Th.21.

fu/geqron, to/,
a swelling of the glands, esp. of the groin or armpit, Ruf. ap. Orib.44.21.1, Heliod. ap. Sch.ad l.c. (iii p.687 D.): also spelt fu/geqlon, Gal.11.72; Lat.
phygetron, Cels.5.18.19, 28.10. (Perh. for flu/g-eqron, cf. flukti/s.）

fu/gergos [u^], on,
shunning work, EM199.1.

fu^gh/, h(, (feu/gw)
flight in battle, a)i/+cante fugh=| Od.10.117; ou)de/ tis a)lkh\ . . ou)de\ f. 22.306; e)s f. e)tra/ponto Hdt.8.89; e)s f. o(rma=sqai, o(rma=n, E.Rh.143, X.Cyr.4.2.28; fugh\n ai(rei=sqai, a)rei=sqai, A.Pers. 481 (sed leg. ai)/rontai), E.Rh.54; i)sxura\n th\n f. toi=s polemi/ois . . e)poi/ei X.Cyr.1.4.22; i)sxura\ f. e)ge/neto ib.7.1.26; generally,
flight, Ev. Matt.24.20; f. e(le/sqai take
to flight, PGnom.102 (ii A. D.): dat. fugh=|, used adverbially,
in hasty flight, fuga=| po/da nwma=n S.OT468 (lyr.); fuga=| podi\ i)/xnos e)/fere E.Or.1468 (lyr.); f. e)calu/cwmen podi/ Id.El.218, cf. Ba.437, Hec.1066 (lyr.); feu/gein f., f. a)naxwrei=n, Pl. Smp.195b, 221a; f. feukte/on Luc.Ind.16: pl., e)n tai=s fugai=s, of the
flight of the country people of Attica into the city, in the Pelop. war, Ar.Ec.243; feu/gousi/ tinas ou)k ai)sxra\s f. Pl.Lg.706c.
flight or
escape from a thing,
avoidance of it, c. gen., ga/mon A.Supp. 395 (lyr.); no/swn a)mhxa/nwn fuga\s cumpe/frastai S.Ant.364 (lyr.), cf. OC280; le/ktrwn fugai/ E.Hel.799; a)gaqw=n fuga/s Pl.Ti.69d; tw=n siti/wn Gal.15.180; opp. ai(/resis, Epicur.Ep.3p.62U., al., cf. S.E.P. 1.87; ta\s o)rqa\s ai(re/seis kai\ f. Phld.Herc.1251.11; opp. di/wcis, Epicur.Sent.25.
place of refuge, D.S.17.78.
slipping of a bandage, Hp.Off.9.
banishment, exile, nu=n me\n dika/zeis e)k po/lews fugh\n e)moi/ A.Ag.1412, cf. Ch.254; e)k gh=s S.OT659, etc.; e)niausi/a e)/kdhmos f. E.Hipp.37; th=s fugh=s h(=s au)toi\ e)/fugon Lys.13.74; sumfugei=n th\n f. tau/thn (sc. u(mi=n) to go into
banishment with . . Pl.Ap.21a; fugh\n e)pibalw\n e(wutw=| imposing
banishment on oneself Hdt.7.3; fugh=| zhmiou=n E.Or.900, cf.IG12.39.7, Pl.Grg.516d; fugh\n katagnw=nai/ tinos And.1.106, Lys.14.38; fugh=s timh/sasqai (sc. di/khn) the penalty of
exile, Pl.Ap.37c, cf. Cri.52c; e)pi\ fo/nw| . . f. Decr. ap. And.1.78 (dub.l.); th=s patri/dos f. poih/sasqai Lys.3.42; eu)qu/nas . . ei)=nai . . plh\n fugh=s kai\ qana/tou kai\ a)timi/as IGl.c. 73: pl., E.Hipp. 1043, Pl.Prt.325b, etc.; fuga\s e)ma\s xqono/s E.Med.400; fugai\ kai\ diw/ceis Pl.Lg.638a. as a collect. Noun, = fuga/des,
body of exiles or
refugees, A.Supp.74 (lyr.), Th.8.64, Aeschin.2.143; kata/gein th\n fugh/n to recall
them, X.HG5.2.9; pl., sulle/cai ta\s fuga/s Pl.Lg.682e, cf. Plu.Flam.12.

fu/gi^mon [u^], to/,
place of refuge, asylum, toi=s dou/lois IG5(1).1390.80 (Andania, i B. C.).
fu^gi/nda, f.l. for frugi/nda, Theognost.Can.165.

fu^go-de/mnios, on,
shunning the marriage-bed, of Pallas, AP6.10 (Antip.).
fu^go/-demnos, on, = foreg., Nonn.D.2.98, al.

fu^go-di^ke/w,
shirk a trial, D.40.16, PPetr.3p.39 (iii B. C., cf. p.xiii), PEnteux.65.4 (iii B. C.), etc.

fu^go-di^ki/a, h(,
avoidance of a trial, Gloss.

fu^go/-di^kos, o(,
one who shirks his trial, Sammelb.5250.4 (ii B. C.).
fu^go/-lektros, on, = fugode/mnios, Orph.H.32.8.

fu^go-ma^xe/w,
shun battle or
fighting, Plb.3.90.10, al., D.S.17.27, Plu.Lyc.16, Onos.11.3;
avoid action, Id.31.1.

fu^go/-ma^xos, on,
shunning battle, Simon.65.

fu^go/-cenos, on,
shunning strangers, inhospitable, f. strato/s Pi.O.11(10).17.

fu^go/-patris, idos, o(, h(,
fugitive from one's country, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.198.

fu^go/-polis, idos, o(, h(,
fleeing from a city, EM328.54.

fu^go-poni/a, h(,
aversion to work, Plb.3.79.4, Hierocl.p.50A.

fu^go/-ponos, on,
shunning work or
hardship, Plb.39.1.10.

fu^go-pto/lemos, on, poet. for *fugopo/lemos,
shunning war, cowardly, Od.14.213, Q.S.1.740.
fu^go/-ptolis, o(, h(, poet. for fugo/polis, Max.349.

fu/z-a (not fu=za, Hdn.Gr.1.251), h(, expld. as h( meta\ deili/as fugh/ by Aristarch. ap. Apollon.Lex.s.v. fo/bos:—
headlong flight, rout, fu/za, fo/bon kruo/entos e(tai/rh Il.9.2, cf. 14.140; a)na/lkida fu/zan e)no/rsas 15.62; qa/naton kai\ f. e(tai/rwn 17.381; e)n de\ *zeu\s . . fu/zan e)moi=s e(ta/roisi kakh\n ba/len Od.14.269.

fuz-a^ki^no/s, h/, o/n,
flying, runaway, shy, e)/lafoi Il.13.102.
fuz-a^le/os, a, on, = foreg., AP6.237 (Antist.).
fuz-a/nai (inf. of *fu/zhmi）: fugei=n, deilia/sai, Hsch.
fuz-hlo/s, h/, o/n, = fuzale/os, Id.
fu/z-w, late Ion. for feu/gw, Heraclid. ap. Eust.1643.2: part. aor. Pass. fuzhqe/ntes (as if from fuza/omai) Nic.Th.825.

fu^h/, Dor. fu^a/, h(, (fu/w)
growth, stature, esp.
fine growth, noble stature, in Hom., always (as in Hes.) of the human form, and only in acc., qhh/santo fuh\n kai\ ei)=dos a)ghto/n Il.22.370; fuh\n e)da/hn kai\ mh/dea 3.208; most freq. in adv. sense, *ne/stori di/w| ei)=do/s te me/geqo/s te fuh/n t' a)/gxista e)w/|kei in shape and in stature and
in size (or
growth), 2.58, cf. Od.6.152; ou)/ e(qe/n e)sti xerei/wn, ou) de/mas ou)de\ fuh/n, ou)/t' a)\r fre/nas Il.1.115, cf. Od.5.212, 7.210; fuh/n ge me\n ou) kako/s e)sti 8.134; xruse/w| [ge/nei] ou)/te fuh\n e)nali/gkion ou)/te no/hma Hes.Op.129, cf. Sc.88, B.5.168; later, in gen., ou)/te fuh=s e)pideue/es ou)/te no/oio Theoc.22.160; rare in Trag., th\n ta/lainan eu)/morfon f. A.Niob. in PSI11.1208.8; fua\n *gorgo/nos i)/sxein E.El.461 (lyr.). after Hom., of animals, plants, or objects, e)mba/llwn e)ripleu/rw| fua=| ke/ntron Pi.P.4.235; ka/nqaros . . *ai)tnai=os fuh/n S.Ichn.300; also terpo/menai r(ode/h| f. of roses, Mosch.2.36; of beans, Luc.Vit.Auct. 6; of things, a)ne/bh h( f. toi=s tei/xesin their
original form was restored, LXXNe.4.7(1); e)a\n kata\ fua\n diafqarh=| tis tw=n li/qwn IG7.3073.40 (Lebad., ii B. C.). poet. for fu/sis,
nature, genius, sofo\s o( polla\ ei)dw\s fua=| Pi.O.2.86; ma/rnasqai fua=| Id.N.1.25, cf. I.7(6).22; fua=| to\ gennai=on e)pipre/pei Id.P.8.44; to\ de\ fua=| kra/tiston a(/pan Id.O. 9.100; deino\s fuh/n Cratin.221.
the flower or
prime of age, eu)a/nqemos fua/ Pi.O.1.67.
substance, a)nai/mwn e)sti\ fuh\ mele/wn Opp.H.1.639; nefroi\ th\n f. a)denw/dees Aret.SD2.3. mero/pwn fuh/
the race of men, APl.4.183.7.
produce of a year,
harvest, f. tou= e)nestw=tos e)/tous BGU708.4 (ii A. D.), cf. Pland.26.12 (i A. D.), etc.—Poet. and later Prose.
fu/h or fui/h, v. fu/w.
fu_ka^ri/zw, = fuko/w, ta\s pareia/s Sch.Opp.H.1.127.
fu_ka/rion, to/, = fu=kos, Hsch. s.v. a)/fuka, Zonar.

fu/khs [u_], ou, o(, (fu=kos) a fish
living in seaweed, prob. a species of
wrasse, Labrus, Arist.HA567b20:—the female was fu_ki/s, i/dos, Mnesim.4.38 (anap.), Arist.HA567b19, 591b13, Antiph.132.8 (anap.), Anaxandr.41.49 (anap.), Numen. ap. Ath.7.282a: but Alex. 110.12,13, distinguishes fuki/s and fu/khs.
fu_ki/a, h(, = fu=kos, f.l. in Ph.Bel.85.25.

fuki/asis, ews, h(, =
ignia, Gloss. (fort. puri/asis).
fu_ki/dion, to/, Dim. of fuki/s, AP5.184 (Ascl.), PCair.Zen.66.14 (iii B. C.).

fu_ki^o/eis, essa, en,
full of seaweed, weed-strewn, qi/n' e)n fukio/enti Il. 23.693; e)p' a)i+o/nos . . fukioe/ssas Theoc.11.14, cf. 21.10.

fu_ki/oikos [i^], o(,
dweller among sea-wrack, i.e. Poseidon, Call. Iamb.1.263.

fu_ki/on or fu/kion, to/, = fu=kos 1, Arist.HA568a6, IG11(2).145.23, 146A67 (Delos, iv B. C.): mostly in pl., Pl.R.611d, Arist.HA 590b11, Theoc.7.58, etc. a fish, perh. = fu/khs, AP7.637 (Antip.), Orib.inc.13.25. = fu=kos 11,
orchil used as
rouge, f. e)ntri/bein Luc.Hist.Conscr.8; kommou=n tou\s lo/gous oi(=on fuki/w| Them. Or.27.336c.
rouge-pot, f. xrusou=n IG11(2).161B42,101 (Delos, iii B. C.).

fu/kios [u_], o(,
god of sea-wrack, epith. of Poseidon at Myconus, SIG1024.9 (iii/ii B. C.).

fu_kio-fa/gos, on,
eating seaweed, of a fish, Arist.HA602a20; cf. fukofa/gos.

fu_kio-fo/ros, on,
bearing seaweed, a)ktai/ Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.110.

fu_kio-xai/ths, ou, o(,
with hair like seaweed, Hsch. (expld. by yafaroxai/ths), PSI8.892 (iv (?) A. D.).
fu_kio/w, = fuko/w:—Pass., dub. l. in A.Dict. in PSI11.1209a13, cf. Tz.H.3.418.
fu_ki/s, h(, v. fu/khs.

fu_ki=tis, idos, h(,
a precious stone, so called from its colour, Plin. HN37.180.

fu_kiw/dhs, es,
covered with seaweed, li/qoi Sch.Opp.H.3.420.

fu_ko-gei/twn, onos, o(, h(,
near the seaweed, dwelling by the sea, epith. of Priapus, AP6.193 (Flacc.).

fu_/ko-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
shaggy with seaweed, pe/trh Matro Conv.26.

fu=kos, eos, to/,
seaweed, wrack, Il.9.7; o)/streia . . fu=kos h)mfiesme/na
Alex.110.2; differing from bru/on in size, Arist.HA603a17, cf. Thphr.HP4.6.2: Ep. dat. pl. fu/kessi Alcm.6: f. qala/ssion ou)=lon
orchella-weed, Roccella tinctoria, Dsc.4.99; called f. po/ntion in Thphr.HP4.6.4; f. q. platu/
peacock's tail, Padina mediterranea, Dsc. l. c.; f. u(po/mhkes kai' u(pofoiniki/zon
Nitrophyllum punctatum, ibid.; f. o(/moion th=| a)grw/stei
mattress grass-weed, Zostera marina, Thphr.HP4.6.6; f. platu/fullon, = pra/son 2, ib. 2; f. trixo/fullon w(/sper to\ ma/raqon,
Cystoseira foeniculosa, ib.3.
sedge or
weed growing in a lake, Nic.Al.576.
orchil, prepared from fu=kos 1.1 and used as
rouge by Greek women, Ar.Fr.320.5, Theoc.15.16, IG5(1).1390.22 (Andania, i B. C.), Alciphr.1.33. = fuki/s, Gloss.

fukotu/xh, h(, a kind of
plaster, Aët.15.35, Paul.Aeg.7.17; cf. fikotu/xh.
fu_kofa/gos [a^], on, = fukiofa/gos, Arist.Frr.319,331.

fu_ko/w, in Med. or Pass.,
to be rouged, f. to\ pro/swpon, Plu.2.142a; fukou/menai kai\ murizo/menai ib.693b. Pass.,
to be stuffed with seaweed, difqe/rai fukou/menai D.S.17.45.
fu/kti^mos, = fu/cimos, to\ i(ero\n a)/sulon kai\ f. ei)=men SIG550.5 (Delph., iii B. C.).

fukto/s, h/, o/n, older and poet. form of feukto/s,
to be shunned or
escaped, avoidable, ou)ke/ti fukta\ pe/lwntai Il.16.128, cf. Od.8.299, 14.489.

fu_kw/dhs, es,
full of seaweed, to/poi Arist.HA602a19.
of seaweed, a)pofora/ Dsc.5.118.
like seaweed, Thphr.HP4.7.6.

fu/lagma [u^], atos, to/, gloss on e)/ruma, Sch.Th.6.66; on ei)=lar, EM298.4.
protection, gh= ai)w/nion f. Secund.Sent.15, cf. Simp. in Cat.373.36.
precept, commandment, LXXLe.8.35, 22.9, al., Jul.Gal.238c.

fu_l-a^do/n, Adv.
by tribes, Sch.BT Il.12.3.

fu_l-a/zw,
form into tribes, fula\s fula/cai Rhetraap.Plu.Lyc.6.

fu^la^k-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
commandant of the watch, PCair.Zen.6.23 (iii B. C.), OGI754.5 (Hieropolis).

fu^la^k-ei/a, h(,
guard, protection, Poet.
de herb.181, Gloss.

fu^la^k-ei=on, to/,
post, watch-tower, fort, Plb. 10.30.6: pl., = Lat.
stationes, Id.5.75.10, 76.3; fula/kion, Aen.Tact. 20.5 cod.M, App.Ill.26, PRyl.288 (pl., iii A. D.).
a watch, party consisting of four soldiers, Plb.6.33.7: pl., in form fula/kia, Id.Fr. 87 (ap.Suid.). in Alex. Greek,
a menstruous cloth, Dam. Isid.52.

fu^la^k-eu/s, e/ws, o(, Ep. for fu/lac, Ep. pl. fulakh=es Opp.C.4.295. -h/, h(, （fu/lac)
watching or
guarding, esp. by night, fulakh=s mnh/sasqe Il.7.371; fulaka\s e)/xein keep
watch and ward, 9.1,471; f. kate/xein E.Tr.194 (lyr.); fulakh\ e)/xei au)to/n
watching engages him, v.l. in Hes.Fr.188.4; f. nukterinh/ Ar.V.2: prov., gumnw=| fulakh\n e)pita/ttein tell an unarmed man to stand on the defensive, i.e. to give commands that cannot be obeyed, Pherecr.144, cf. Philem.12; peri\ fulakh=s *eu)boi/as . . e)pime/lesqai IG12.39.76; o(/pws a)fanh\s ei)/h h( f. that there might be nothing visible
to watch, Th.4.67; fulakh\n [tw=n teixw=n] e)/rhmon katalipei=n Lycurg.17; fulaka\s fula/cein keep
watch and ward, X.An.2.6.10, cf. Pl.Lg.758d; th\n e)n qala/tth| f. fula/ttein D.7.14; f. poih=sai X.An.5.7.31; th\n f. poiei=sqai Lys.12.16; fulaka\s poih/sasqai X.An.6.3.21; i)sxura\s f. poiei=sqai Id.Cyr.1.6.37; fulaka\s katasth/sasqai, kataskeua/sasqai, Ar.Av.841, X.HG7.2.23.
watch or
guard, of persons, Pl.Prt.321d (pl.), Act.Ap.12.10, etc.; f. e(wutou= poieu/meno/s [tinas] Hdt.2.154; f. tou= sw/matos a body
guard, D.23.3; tw=n swma/twn Din.1.9; f. peri\ to\ sw=ma X.Cyr.7.5.58, cf. PHib.1.59.5 (iii B. C.), etc.;
garrison of a place or fortress, Hdt.2.30; h( e)n th=| *naupa/ktw| f., of a squadron of ships, Th.7.17, cf. X.HG1.1.22.
the rank of fu/lakes, Pl.R.415c.
station, post, Il.10.408 (pl.), 416 (pl.), X.HG5.4.49; fulaka\s prolipw/n E.Rh.18 (anap.); *dio\s f., Pythag. name for the centre of the universe, Arist.Cael. 293b3. of time, a
watch of the night, e)pea\n th=s nukto\s h)= deute/rh f. Hdt.9.51; prw/ths f. a)rxome/nhs Wilcken Chr.1 ii 18 (iii B. C.); fulakai=si nukte/roisin E.Rh.765; f. nukterina\s kai\ h(merina\s kaqista/nai X.Cyr.1.6.43: of these there were
three, acc. to Sch.E. Rh.5; but
five are mentioned in Stesich.55, Simon.219 A, E.Rh. 543 (lyr.); and the Roman division was
four, Ev.Matt.14.25, Suid.
place for keeping others in,
ward, prison, dhmosi/a f. D.S.10.30; ei)s fulakh\n blhqei/s AP11.276 (Lucill.); balei=n tina\ ei)s f. Ev.Matt.18.30, cf. Arr.Epict.1.1.24; qe/sqai tina\ e)n fulakh=| LXX Ge.40.3, cf. Ev.Matt.14.3; politikh\ f. the town-
prison, POxy.259.8 (i A. D.). Astrol. = tapei/nwma, PMich. in Class.Phil.22.22 (pl.).
guarding, keeping, preserving, whether for security or custody, e)n fulakh=| e)/xein tina/ Hdt.1.24; e)n f. a)de/smw| e)/xein tina/ Th.3.34; e)n fulakh=|si mega/lh|si e)/xesqai Hdt.2.99; to\n *)isqmo\n e)/xein e)n f. to keep the Isthmus
guarded or
occupied, Id.7.207, cf. 8.40; to\n h)nei/kanto glw/sshs xarakth=ra tou=ton e)/xein e)n f.
to preserve the same character of language, Id.1.57; e)/xein no/on e)n f. Thgn.439; ta\ para\ pa=sin e)n plei/sth| f., pai=das kai\ gunai=kas D.18.215; ta\ kata\ to\ strato/pedon dia\ fulakh=s e)/xwn Th.7.8; to\n plou=n dia\ f. poihsa/menoi Id.8.39; sto/matos fulaka=| katasxei=n fqo/ggon prob. in A.Ag.236 (lyr.); e)n f. sxeqe/men mega/la|
be very
ware of, Pi.P.4.75; fulakh\n e)/xein, = fula/ttesqai,
keep guard, be on the watch, peri/ tina Hdt.1.39; f. e)/xwn ei)/ kws dunai/mhn . . ib.38; f. e)/xein mh/ . . Th.2.69; f. lamba/nein mh/ . . Men.Pk.20; deinw=s h)=san e)n fulakh=|si were straitly on their
guard, Hdt.3.152, cf. A.Pers.592 (lyr.).
custody of property, Arist.Pol.1309b6, EN1120a9.
safeguard, th\n megi/sthn f. a)nh/|rhke th=s po/lews its chief
safeguard, And.4.19; f. pare/xein Isoc.11.13; dhmokrati/as, monarxi/as f., Lys.25.28, Arist. Pol.1315a8. (from Med.)
precaution, pollh=s f. e)/rgon Pl.R. 537d; f. qaumasth=s deome/nh Id.Lg.906a, al., cf. Th.5.99. c. gen.,
precaution against, eu)la/beia f. kakou= Pl.Def.413d; u(poyi/as fulakh\n poih/sasqai Antipho 2.1.2; f. tw=n pa/nta moluno/ntwn Epicur. Sent.Vat.80, cf. 73.
fu^la^k-i/a, h(, = foreg., PRyl.90.13 (iii A. D.); i(erou= POxy.1627.12 (iv A. D.).

fu^la^k-i/zw,
throw into prison, Act.Ap.22.19:— Pass., LXXWi.18.4.

fu^la^k-iko/s, h/, o/n,
watchful, careful, Pl.R.375e, 456a, al.; -w/tatoi po/lews ib.412c; h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) ib.428d.
disposed to observe, do/gmatos ib.412e.
fu^la^/k-ion, v. fulakei=on,

fu^la^k-i/s, i/dos, fem. of fu/lac, tou/s te fu/lakas kai\ ta\s fulaki/das (cf. fu/lac 1 fin.) ib.457c; f. nh=es
guard-ships, D.S.20.16.

fu^la^/k-issa, h(, = foreg., LXXCa.1.6. -isth/s, ou=, o(, Lat.
phylacistes in Plaut.Aul. 3.5.44,
gaoler, epith. of a
harsh creditor. = Lat.
cuspator, Lyd. Mag.1.46.

fu^la^k-i_teu/w,
serve as fulaki/ths, Sammelb.4309.3 (iii B. C.): c. acc., f. th\n toparxi/an PHib.1.34.1 (iii B. C.).

fu^la^k-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
police official in Egypt, PSI4.359.8 (iii B. C.), PTeb.22.9 (ii B. C.), OGI85.4 (iii B. C.), 139.6 (ii B. C.); in Syria, ib.238.2.

fu^la^k-i_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
pertaining to police, esp. in neut. -i_tiko/n, to/,
tax for maintenance of police, PSI5.509.9 (iii B. C.), PTeb.5.15 (ii B. C.), etc.

fu^la^k-i=tis, idos, h(, Pythag. name for
seven, Nicom. ap. Theol.Ar.43.

fu^la^k-o/s, o( (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.150, 2.128), Ep. and Ion. for fu/lac, Il.24.566, IG12(8).356 (Thasos, vi B. C.), Hdt. 1.84,89, 2.113, al.; dub. in OGI674.12 (Coptos, i A. D.); f. neku/wn *ke/rberon Theoc.29.38, cf. A.R.1.132; h(/rws po/lews f. Inscr.Prien. 196: as fem., kou=rai ai( fulakoi/ Call.Hec.1.2.12. *fu/lakos, o(, as pr. n., Il.6.35, Od.15.231: so *fula/kh (Il.2.695, etc.), as distd. from fulakh/.

fu^la^k-te/os, a, on,
to be observed, pro/noia tou= qeou= S.OC1180; (from Med.)
to be guarded against, E.Andr.63. fulakte/on,
one must observe, obey, a)na/gkhn Id.IT620;
one must preserve, ta\ presbei=a Aristid.1.99J. (from Med.)
one must guard against, ti A.Th.499; h(donh/n Arist.EN1109b7; f. mh/ . . Pl.R.416a; o(/pws mh/ . . X.Oec.7.36, cf. Isoc.6.94: c. inf., tou=to pra/ttein Porph.Abst. 2.31.
fu^la^k-th/r, h=ros, o(, poet. for fu/lac, in pl., Il.9.66,80, 24.444 fu^la^k-thri/a, h(, = pannuxi/s, Hsch.

fu^la^k-thria/zw, in Pass.,
to be furnished with an amulet or
preservative, PMag.Par.1.789, 2627.

fu^la^k-th/rion, to/,
guarded post, fort, castle, Hdt.5.52: esp.
an outpost communicating with fortifications, Th.4.31,33,110, X.Cyr. 7.5.12: pl.,
guardrooms, Arist.Pol.1331a20.
safeguard, security, Pl.Lg.917b:
preservative, D.6.24;
amulet, Dsc.5.154, Plu. 2.378b, etc.; among the Jews fulakth/ria were small rolls of parchment with texts from the Law written on them, bound to the forehead by persons praying, Ev.Matt.23.5; f. xrusa=,
symbols denoting the kingdoms of Upper and Lower Egypt, OGI90.45 (Rosetta, ii B. C.);
amulet, PMag.Lond.121.298 (pl.); metaph., to\ o)/noma/ sou e)/xw e(\n f. e)n kardi/a| PMag.Leid.W.18.2. perh.
guard or
chain, PLond.ined.2199.

fu^la^k-th/rios, a, on,
serving as a protection, ta\ peri/ ti f. Pl.Lg.842d, fu^la^/k-ths, ou, o(,
one who preserves, tw=n i)di/wn e)qw=n Ph.2.577 (pl.), sed leg. -tikoi/. = fulakth/r, a magistrate at Cumae, Plu.2.291f.

fu^la^k-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
preservative, opp. lhptiko/s, proetiko/s, Arist.EN1120b15; u(giei/as Id.Top.106b36, cf. Rh.1366a37; of persons, f. tw=n o)/ntwn X.Mem.3.4.9; f. e)gklhma/twn
cherishing the recollection of them, Arist.Rh.1381b4; to\ f. Phld.Oec.p.34J., Gal.10.638, Porph.Antr.16. Adv. -kw=s Arist.Top. 106b37. (from Med.)
cautious, opp. pisteutiko/s, Id.Rh. 1372b28. Adv. -kw=s Plb.6.8.3, al.: Comp., -w/teron xrh=sqai tai=s pronomai=s Id.1.18.1, al.

fu^la^k-to/s, h/, o/n,
capable of being preserved, u(gi/eia Alex.Aphr.Febr.22.
fu^/la^k-tron, to/, = fulakitiko/n, POxy.502.43 (ii A. D.), PGoodsp.Cair.10.10 (ii A. D.).
fu^la^/k-twr, oros, o(, h(, poet. for fu/lac, xqw\n a( fqime/noio f. Bull.Soc.Alex.7.244 (Egypt, i B. C./i A. D.), cf. Nonn.D.2.176.

fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, also h( (v. infr.): (fula/ssw):—
watcher, guard, sentinel, Hom. (only in Il., always masc. and in pl.), fu/lakes a)/ndres 9.477; h(gemo/nes fula/kwn ib.85, cf. 10.58; freq. in Trag. and Att. (Hdt. uses fulako/s, exc. in signf. 11), fu/lak' e)pe/sthsen boi/+ A.Supp. 303; new\s sh=s f. S.Ph.543; dra/konta mh/lwn f. Id.Tr.1100, al.; f. tou= tei/xous Th.2.78, cf. IG12.44.14, al.; f. kata\ ta\s pu/las X.HG4.4.8; fu/laka katasth=sai Lys.19.31; oi( f. the
garrison, Th.6.100, X. An.4.2.5, etc.; fu/lakes tou= sw/matos body-
guards, Pl.R.566b; o( tou= desmwthri/ou f. Id.Cri.43a; tw-n ai)xmalw/twn X.HG4.5.6, etc.: lo/xoi fu/lakes bodies
of reserve, Id.An.6.5.9: as fem., e)/sti ka)moi\ klh\|s e)pi\ glw/ssh| f. A.Fr.316, cf. S.Aj.36, OC355, E.Andr.86: metaph., flames (flo/ges) are called fu/lakes *(hfai/stou ku/nes Eub.75.7 (dub. l.); and the hospitable table is f. fili/as Timocl.13.
guardian, keeper, protector, Hes.Op.123,253; ktea/nwn Pi.P.8.58; dwma/twn, xw/ras f., A.Ag.914, S.OT1418, etc.; paido/s Hdt.1.41; th=s gunaiko/s X.Cyr.6.3.14; th=s politei/as And.4.16, cf. Pl.R.374d, al.; th=s a)rxh=s Lys.12.94; tw-n no/mwn Pl.Lg.966b; th=s ei)rh/nhs Isoc.4.175: as fem., E.Tr.462, Pl.Plt.305c, X.Mem.2.1.32; of a divinity, *)/aggdistin . . fu/laka kai\ oi)kode/spoinan tou=de tou= oi)/kou SIG985.51 (Philadelphia, i B. C.): also f. *)argei/ou doro/s a
protector against it, E.Ph.1094; e)pi\ toi=s w)ni/ois fu/lakas katesth/sate, of the a)gorano/moi, Lys. 22.16.
observer, tou= do/gmatos Pl.R.413c; tou= e)pitattome/nou X.Cyn.12.2. of things, [sth/lhn] w(/sper f. th=s dwrea=s Plu. Nic.3.
chain, keeper, f. a)rgurou=s, xalkou=s, IG7.3498.8 (Orop.), Inscr.Délos1426 Bii 45; o)mfalo\n kai\ fu/laka peri\ au)to/n ib.1417B i93(ii B. C.). bandage, Gal.19.144. (Cf.Lat.
bubulcus (Ital.
bifolco), subulcus.）

fu^laci^qa^la/sseios, on,
belonging to the Phylaxithalassian tribe at Alexandria, POxy.513.52 (ii A. D.).

fu/lacis [u^], ews, h(,
watching, guarding, u(/pnou fula/ceis S.Fr.432.9, cf. Aq.Is.26.3.
a security, E.Hel.506 (pl.).

fu_larx-e/w,
to be or
act as fu/larxos, Ar.Lys.561 (anap.), X.Eq.11.10, Is.11.41, Sardis7 No.56.10 (ii A. D.), f.l. in Arist.Pol.1295b12 (cf. fugarxe/w): c. gen., f. th=s *)olusi/as Is.5.42: c. dat., f. fula=| *)ialusi/a| Maiuri
Nuova Silloge 19 (Rhodes).
fu_la/rx-hs, ou, o(, = fu/larxos, IG12 (2).505.4 (Methymna), LXX 2 Ma.8.32, Ph.1.497, al.

fu_larx-i/a, h(,
office of fu/larxos, Arist.Pol.1322b5 (pl.), Com.Adesp.25.4 D. (pl.).

fu_/larx-os, o(,
chief officer of a fu_lh/, X.Cyr.1.2.14, al., BMus.Inscr.1005 (Cyzic.), CIG3773 (Nicomedia), Sammelb.6257 (v/vi A. D.). = Lat.
tribunus militum, D.H.2.7, Plu.Rom.20.
chief priest of a tribe among the Jews, LXX 1 Es.7.8: pl.,
elders of a tribe, ib.De.31.28.
sheikh, tw=n *)ara/bwn Str.16.1.28, cf. Procop.Pers.1.19; Parthian term, = duna/sths, Arr.Fr.171 J. as a military term, at Athens,
the commander of the cavalry furnished by each tribe, Hdt.5.69. oi( f., an oligarchical council at Epidamnus, Arist.Pol.1301b22.

fula/sios [a_], o(,
a man of Phyle (in Attica), Ar.Ach.1028.

fu^la/ssw, Att. fu_la/rx-ttw, Ep. inf. fulasse/menai Il.10.312,419; poet. impf. fu/lasse Pi.Pae.6.91: fut. fula/cw Od.22.195, etc.: aor. e)fu/laca, Ep. fu/l- Il.16.686, etc.: pf. pefu/la^xa Ath.10.408f, (dia-) X.Cyr.8.6.3 (-pefulak- codd.), Din.1.9 (-pefulak- codd.), (para-) Pl.Lg.632a; pefu/laka LXX 1 Ki.25.21, Arg.E.Med. (pefulake/nai and pefuke/nai codd.):—Med., fut. -a/comai A.Supp.205, S.El.1012, Ar. Ec.831, etc.; also in pass. sense, S.Ph.48, X.Oec.4.9: aor. e)fulaca/mhn Hdt.7.130 (v.l.), Antipho3.4.7, etc.:—Pass., fut. -axqh/somai D.H.Rh.5.6, Gal.1.426: aor. e)fula/xqhn Luc.Pisc.15: pf. pefu/lagmai E.Fr.472.19 (anap.), cf. infr. c. 1, Lib.Or.54.74 (in pass. sense); imper., only in med. sense in early writers, pefu/laco Hes. Op.797, Orac. ap. Hdt.7.148; part., Il.23.343, etc. abs.,
keep watch and ward, keep guard, esp. by night, a)ni/h kai\ to\ fula/ssein pa/nnuxon e)grh/ssonta Od.20.52; ou)d' e)qe/lousi nu/kta fulasse/menai Il.10.312, cf. 419,421; ei) me/n k' e)n potamw=| duskhde/a nu/kta fula/ssw Od.5.466, cf. 22.195; (Med., v. infr. c); su\n kusi\ . . fula/ssontas peri\ mh=la Il.12.303; au)tou= f. A.Eu.243; th\n me\n h(me/ran kata\ diadoxh\n f. th\n de\ nu/kta kai\ cu/mpantes Th.7.28; e)fu/latton peri\ ta\ basi/leia X.Cyr.7.5.68; oi( fula/ttontes Isoc.10.34; f. toi=s *)aqhnai/ois
keep watch for . . , Th.7.53; kata\ qa/lattan e)fu/latten o(/pws mhde\n ei)sple/oi X.HG2.4.29; f. e(/ws . .
watch or
wait till . . , Lys.1.15; f. phni/ka . . D.18.308: c. acc. cogn., fulaka\s f. X.An.2.6.10, Ev.Luc. 2.8.
to be on one's guard, And.1.135. trans.,
watch, guard, defend, a)qana/twn o(/stis se fula/ssei Od.15.35, cf. Il.10.417, al.; su/as, mh=la, Od.17.593, 12.136; th\n e(wutw=n Hdt.8.46; po/lin f. A.Th.136 (lyr.), IG12.108.46; pu/las E. Andr.950; se fula/ttoi *zeu/s Ar.Eq.499 (anap.); bre/tas h(=sai fula/sswn A.Eu.440; f. tina\ a)po\ tw=n dusxwriw=n
guard one from . . X.Cyr.1.4.7 (but th\n grau=n f. a)po\ tw=n kerami/wn
keep away from . . , Men.Sam. 87): c. acc. et inf., tou)mo\n fula/cei o) o)/noma mh\ pa/sxein kakw=s S.OC 667; o( no/mos f. mh\ a(/ptesqai Pl.Lg.838b; f. mhde/na peraiou=sqai Th. 7.17; f. to\ mhde\n e)nanti/on gene/sqai D.18.313: folld. by a relat. clause, f. e(auto\n o(/pws mh\ a)dikh/sei Pl.Grg.480a; fu/latte/ me mh\ parakrou/swmai/ se Id.Cra.393c; f. tina/, ei) . . Id.Smp.220d:—Pass.,
to be watched, kept under guard, Hdt.3.45, X.An.6.4.27.
watch for, lie in wait or
ambush for, au)to\n i)o/nta loxh/somai h)de\ fula/cw e)n porqmw=| *)iqa/khs Od.4.670; no/ston f. Il.2.251; f. to\ su/mbolon
look out for the signal-fire, A.Ag.8; tou\s polemi/ous X.Lac. 12.2; f. tou\s para/noma gra/fontas D.58.34;
keep a watch on, [tina] Lys.1.6; tou\s parabai/nontas Arist.Pol.1289a19. esp.
watch, wait for, observe an appointed time or a fixed event, th\n knri/hn tw=n h(mere/wn Hdt.1.48; f. th\n h(me/ran Antipho 6.37; fula/cantes nu/kta
wait for night, Th.2.3; fula/ssousi grafo/menoi to\ a)pobai=non Hdt.2.82; tou\s e)thsi/as D.4.31: with a part. added, dei/lhn o)yi/hn ginome/nhn fula/cantes Hdt.8.9: f. *ce/rchn . . dei=pnon protiqe/menon Id.9.110; a)ristopoioume/nous f. tou\s stratiw/tas 23.165: folld. by a relat. clause, f. o(/ ti xrh/setai . . Hdt.5.12. metaph.,
preserve, maintain, cherish, [xo/lon] Il.16.30; ai)dw= kai\ filo/thta 24.111; o(/rkia 3.280; f. e)/pos
observe a command, 16.686; f. r(h=ma Pi.I.2.9; teleta/s Id.O.3.41; no/mon S.Tr.616; tou\s no/mous Pl. Plt.292a, cf. Grg.461d, etc.; to\ so\n pisto/n S.OC626; ta\s sunqh/kas Isoc.17.20; ta\ tou= ga/mou di/kaia POxy.905.9 (ii A. D.); lo/gon pro/s tina PFlor.56.21 (iii A. D., Pass.); f. sigh/n E.IA542; ou) ga\r a)peila\s u(mete/ras e)fu/laca I
regarded not your threats, Call.Del.204; f. skaiosu/nan
cling to it,
foster it, S.OC1213 (lyr.); a)/cia h)/qh E.Ion736; f. th=| mnh/mh| ta\ lexqe/nta Pl.Lg.783c; f. to\n qumo/n ib.867a; th\n timwri/an D.21.40; f. kai\ tamieu/ein pa/nta tini/ Lys.19.40; to\ me/ros toi=s qeoi=s X.An.5.3.4; ta)gaqa/, opp. kth/sasqai, D.1.23; ma=la e)n ko/lpoisi Theoc.2.120, cf. 7.64; ei) mh\ fula/sseis mi/kr', a)polei=s ta\ mei/zona Men. Mon.172; a)qa/naton e)/xqran mh\ fu/latte ib.4: with a predic. added, f. tina/ dedeme/non Antipho 5.47; a)de/kaston f. th\n dia/noian D.H.Th. 34; a)ku/maanton to\ pe/lagos Luc.DMar.5.1:—Pass., o(/sos par' u(mi=n o( fqo/nos fula/ttetai
is fostered by . . , S.OT382.
keep in a place,
continue in, to/de dw=ma fula/ssois, a)qa/nato/s t' ei)/hs Od.5.208.
notice, observe, Ath.l.c.
maintain, hold fast to a view, tina\ spoudai=on ei)=nai Plot.1.4.9. c. acc.,
beware of, avoid, a(/panta tau=ta fula/ttein keleu/ei Gal.18(2).791. f. mh\ c. subj.,
take care lest . . E.IA145 (anap.), Pl.Tht.154d; f. e)me\ kai\ threi=n o(/pws mh/ . . D.18.276. Med., fula/casqe tou= a)gapa=n *ku/rion
be careful to . . , LXXJo.23.11. Med., abs.,
to be on one's guard, keep watch, Ar.Ec. 769; used by Hom. only in part., nu/kta fulassome/noisi Il.10.188; pefulagme/nos ei)=nai to be
cautious, prudent, 23.343, cf. X.HG7.5.9; fulattome/nous poreu/esqai
with caution, Id.Cyr.5.2.30, cf. Cyn.10.10. c. acc.,
keep a thing
by one, bear it
in mind or
memory, Hes. Op.263,561; more fully, e)n qumw=| d' eu)= pa/nta fula/sseo ib.491; fresi/ h.Ap.544, cf. Pi.O.7.40; ta\ lelegme/na S.El.1012.
guard, keep safe, kai\ kefalh\n pefu/laco Orac. ap. Hdt.7.148. c. gen., fula/ssesqai tw=n new=n mh\ cuntri/ywsin
act cautiously with regard to the ships, Th.4.11;
beware of, tw=n eu)= fu/lacai S.OC161 (lyr.); *)/arktoi pefulagme/nai w)keanoi=o Arat.48; pefu/laco pantoi/wn a)ne/mwn Id.930. fula/ssesqai/ ti or tina
to beware of, be on one's guard against, avoid a thing or person, Sapph.27, etc.: tau=ta Hdt.1.108, 7.130, cf. Ar.Ra.4; tinas A.Pr.715,804; tou\s *)atrei/das ei)sorw=n fula/comai S.Ph.455; te/ttic poime/nas . . pefulagme/nos Theoc.16.95. e)fulaca/mhn diale/ktous I
put in as a precaution 'except in dialects', Hdn.Gr.2.932. f. pro/s ti Th.7.69; a)po/ tinos X.Cyr.2.3.9, HG7.2.10. c. inf., fula/comai de\ ta/sde memnh=sqai . . e)fetma/s A.Supp.205, cf. Ocell.4.13; f. mhde\n e)camartei=n Hdt.1.108, cf. D.25.11; f. mhde/na balei=n Antipho3.4.7; but also without mh/, i(/na . . tis u(/steron fula/sshtai e)pi\ gh=n th\n sh\n strateu/esqai Hdt.7.5; f. to\ luph=sai D.18.258; f. o(ra=sqai Arist.HA611a28, cf. D.H.1.70; le/gein Arist.Rh.Al.1441b20:—two constructions joined, dissa\ ga\r fula/ssetai [yuxh/], fi/lwn te me/myin ka)s qeou\s a(marta/nein S.Fr.472. f. mh/ folld. by subj.,
take care lest . . , tou/tou fula/ssou mh/ pot' a)xqesqh=| ke/ar A.Pr.392, cf. Supp.498, E.IT67, Ar. Ach.257, X.An.2.2.16, etc.; so f. o(/pws mh/ . . Id.Mem.1.2.37; a(\s e)gw\ fula/comai . . mh\ katourh/swsi/ mou Ar.Ec.831, cf. X.Mem.2.2.14.

fu_let-eu/w,
adopt into a tribe, ce/nous kai\ metoi/kous Arist.Pol.1275b37.

fu_le/t-hs, ou, o(, (fulh/)
one of the same tribe, fellow-tribesman, Antipho 6.13, And.1.150, Pl.Lg.955d, IG22.1165.26, 1749.71, SIG1023.49 (Cos, iii/ii B. C.); w)= fule/ta Ar.Ach.568 (lyr.): as Adj., f. xoro/s the chorus
of one's tribe, IG22.3114.

fu_let-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a fule/ths, dikasth/ria, di/kai, Pl.Lg.768c, 915c; f. fili/ai Arist.EN1161b13. Adv. -kw=s
like tribesmen, Id.SE164a27. = Lat.
tributus, f. e)kklhsi/a, =
comitia tributa, D.H.7.59; h( f. (sc. e)kklhsi/a) App.BC 3.30; f. a)rxairesi/ai D.C.53.23.
belonging to a fulh/, ge/ai BSA22.212 (Mylasa).

fu_lh/, h(, (fu/w) prop., like fu=lon,
a race, tribe; but acc. to Dicaearch.Hist.9
a union formed in an organized community (whether po/lis or e)/qnos): hence,
tribe, i.e.
a body of men
united
by supposed ties of blood and descent, clan, such as the three Dorian
tribes, Rhetra ap.Plu.Lyc.6, Hdt.5.68, St.Byz. s. vv. *(ullei=s, *duma=nes, IG4.596 (Argos); of the four Ionic
tribes, Hdt.5.69, Arist.Ath.8.3, Plu.Sol.19, etc.; of the Laconian, Hdt.4.145; of the old Roman, D.H.2.7, etc.; of the Persian, X.Cyr.1.2.5 and 12; of the Jewish, LXXNu.1.4, al. (but also of subdivisions of the tribe (skh=ptron), ib. 1 Ki.10.20.21), Ev.Matt.19.28, etc.
by local habitation, such as the ten local
tribes at Athens formed by Cleisthenes, Hdt.5.69, 6.131, IG12.10.44, al.; or those formed by Servius at Rome, f. topikai/, opp. genikai/, D.H.4.14, cf. Plu. Rom.20; in Roman Egypt, BGU1113.3 (i B.C.), PFlor.39.4 (iv A. D.), etc., cf. (in general) Arist.Pol.1264a8, 1300a25, 1309a12, Pl. Lg.753c, etc.
subdivision of the priests in each Egyptian temple, OGI56.24 (Canopus, iii B. C.), PAmh.2.112.7 (ii A. D.), etc.
military contingent furnished by a tribe, among the Athenians, Hdt.6.111, IG12.1085; o(plitw=n Th.6.98, cf. 3.90, X.HG 4.2.19, Pl.Lg.755c, 755d; taci/arxos ei)s th\n fulh\n katata/cas Lys.13.79.
representatives of a tribe, on political bodies, fulh=s prutaneuou/shs, proedreuou/shs, IG1.26a16, SIG589.2 (Magn.Mae., ii B.C.), etc. of things, = ge/nos,
kind, species, kata\ fula\s diekri/nomen ta\ e)/pipla X.Oec.9.6.

fulhris, = Lat.
cercedula (i.e.
querquedula), Gloss. (s.v.l.).

fu^li/a, poet. fu_let-i/h, h(, a tree mentioned with the olive in Od.5.477 (doiou\s . . qa/mnous, e)c o(mo/qen pefuw=tas—o( me\n fuli/hs, o( d' e)lai/hs), apptly. (cf. Sch.ad loc., Hsch.) a kind of
wild olive, but distd. fr. ko/tinos and said to be Troezenian by Paus.2.32.10 (written fulli/a), cf. Philostr.Gym.43, Nonn.D.5.474; wrongly identified by Ammon. Diff. p.135V. with sxi=nos.

fu/lios [u_], a, on,
of a tribe, qeoi/ Poll.8.110.

full-a/zw, =
frondesco, Gloss.

full-a/kanqos [a^k], on,
with prickly leaves, Thphr.HP1.10.7, 6.1.3.

full-a/mpelon, to/, =
pampinus, Gloss.

full-analoghmo/s, =
racematio, ib.

full-anqe/s, to/, a plantname, perh.
Anthemis chia, cj. in Thphr.HP7.8.3, cf. Plin.HN 21.99; also full-a/nqion, to, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.42B.
full-a/rion, to/, Dim. of fu/llon, Inscr.Délos1441 Aii 67 (ii B. C.), Dsc.1.4, 3.158: metaph., fulla/ria . . ta\ tekni/a sou M.Ant.10.34.

full-a/s, a/dos, h(, as Adj.,
leafy, lo/xmh Nonn.D.21.340. usu. as Subst.,
heap, bed, or
litter of leaves, fulla/da e)pibalw/n Hdt.8.24; f. stipth/ S.Ph.33, cf. Bion 1.69, A.R.1.1183, etc.
foliage, r(i/zhs ga\r ou)/shs f. i(/ket' A.Ag.966; f. murio/karpos, of a thick grove, S.OC676 (lyr.); temeni/a f. Id.Tr.754; f. *parnasi/a E.Andr.1100: metaph., fulla/dos h)/dh katakarfome/nhs A.Ag.79 (anap.); also,
leafy branch, E.Supp.32, Ar.V.398 (anap.); klisi/ai e)k fulla/dos D.S.19.22, cf. Str.16.4.13, etc.: pl., Gp.3.10.6, etc.
salad, Mnesim.4.31 (anap.), Diphil. 18.4, cf. Poll.6.71.

full-ei=on, to/, mostly in pl.,
green-stuff, small herbs, such as mint and parsley, that were given into the bargain, Ar.Ach.469; fullei=a r(afani/dwn radish-
tops, Id.Pl. 544 (anap.).
full-i/a, v. fuli/a,
full-i^a/s: qri=a, Id.

full-i^a/w,
run to leaf without fruiting, fullio/wsai Arat.333.

full-i/zw,
strip of leaves, Gp.5.2.12 (Pass.).
strip of petals, interpol. in
Orib.5.33.6.

full-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of a leaf, bla/sthsis Thphr.HP3.5.5.
leaf-like, sfairi/on ib.3.7.5. *fulliko/s (sc. mh/n), o(, name of a month in Thessaly, IG9(2).224.4 (Angeae), 562.5 (Larissa).

full-i/nhs, ou, o(,
where the prize is a wreath of leaves, a)gw=nes Poll.3.153, Hsch.: also fullinai/ous a)gw=nas EM802.38.

fu/ll-inos, h, on,
made of leaves, toi=xos Theoc.21.8; ste/fanos Luc.Merc.Cond.13.

fu/ll-ion, to/, Dim. of fu/llon, Pl.Com.171, Aristid.1.283J., Poll.6.94: pl., = h(du/smata khpai=a, Hp. ap. Gal.19.153. perh. a kind of
plate, f. a)rgura= o)ktw/ PLond.1.191.11 (ii A. D.).

full-i/s, i/dos, h(, = fulla/s 11.2, Gp.7.18.1. = fulli=tis, Ps.-Dsc.3.107.
salad, Heraclid. Tar. ap. Ath.3.120d.

full-i=tis, idos, h(,
hart's-tongue, Scolopendrium officinale, Dsc.3.107.
fulliw/n, w=nos, o(, name of month at Iasos, Rev.Ét.Gr.6.172.

fullobol-e/w,
shed the leaves, Ar.Nu.1007 (anap.), Arist.GA783b10, 784a12, Thphr.HP1.9.6, Call.Epigr.44.3.
pelt with leaves, qea/n (sc. Demeter) Philic. in Stud.Ital.9.48, cf. Hdn.8.7.2; r(o/dois, i)/ois, stefa/nois, Charito 3.8:—Pass., Ph.2.589, Hdn.7.10.8, Sch.E. Hec.574.

fullobol-i/a, h(,
shedding of the leaves, Thphr.HP1.9.6.
pelting with leaves or
leafy crowns, as a token of applause bestowed on winners in the games, Eratosth. ap. Sch.E.Hec.574.

fullo/bol-os (parox.), on,
shedding leaves, Thphr.HP1.9.3. fullo/bola, ta/,
fallen leaves, IG22.1362.7.

fullo/-komos, on,
thick-leaved, mi=lac Ar.Av.215 (anap.); meli/a ib.742 (lyr.)

fullo-ko/pos, =
frondator, Gloss.
fullo-kri/nw, f.l. for fulokrine/w (q.v.).

fullo-loge/w,
strip the leaves off, th\n sukh=n Poll.7.143, cf. PHamb.23.27 (vi A. D.), Gloss.

fullo-logi/a, h(,
thinning of foliage, POxy.1692.20 (ii A. D.), 1631.13 (pl., iii A. D.).

fullo-lo/gos, o(,
leafpicker, one who thins foliage, PLond.1821.384.

fullo-ma^ne/w,
run to leaf, without seeding, Thphr.HP8.7.4.

fullo-ma^nh/s, e/s,
running to leaf, Sch. rec. S.Aj.143, EM474.51.

fu/llon, to/
leaf; in Ep. and Hdt. always in pl.
leaves, or collectively
foliage, fu/lla kai\ o)/zous Il.1.234, al.; fu/lla d' e)/raze xe/ei Hes. Op.421; ta\ f. katadre/pontes kath/sqion Hdt.8.115; o(/ssa te xqw\n h)rina\ f. a)nape/mpei Pi.P.9.46; yuxa\s e)da/h . . oi(=a/ te fu/ll' a)/nemos donei= B.5.65; sg., S.OC701 (lyr.), Thphr.HP1.10.6, etc.; oi(/h per fu/llwn geneh/, toi/h de\ kai\ a)ndrw=n Il.6.146, cf. Mimn.2.1; fu/llwn genea=| proso/moioi Ar.Av.685 (anap.); fu/llois ba/llein E.Hec.574; plekta\ fu/lla wreathed
leaves, Id.Hipp.807; fu/llon e)lai/as, poet. for e)la/a, S.l.c.: metaph. of choral songs, fu/ll' a)oida=n Pi.I.4(3).27; of
leaves used as
voting-papers, IG12(5).595A12 (Ceos, iii/ii B. C.). of flowers,
petal, [r(o/don] e)/xon e(ch/konta fu/lla Hdt.8.138; u(aki/nqina f., leimw/nia f., Theoc.11.26, 18.39.
plant, in general, f. o)\n e)pinhxo/menon tw=| u(/dati Dsc.1.12, cf. Numen. ap. Ath.9.371b; h( kata\ fu/llon (with or without gewmetri/a) survey according to
plants, i. e.
crops grown, PTeb.38.3, 78.4 (ii B. C.): poti/sai ei)s fu/llon ib.72.362, 105.32 (ii B. C.): esp. of medicinal
herbs, f. ei)/ ti nw/dunon ka/toide S.Ph.44; h)pi/oisi f. ib.698 (lyr.), cf. 649. as a name of definite species: = bruwni/a,
dog Mercury, Mercurialis perennis, Thphr.HP9.18.5, Dsc.3.125. the leaf-like fruit of silphium, Hp.Nat.Mul.72, Thphr.HP6.3.1, Polyaen.4.3.32. = leuka/kanqa, Dsc.3.19.

fullo-ro/os, on,
leaf-shedding, fqino/pwron Opp.C.1.116.

fullo-rroe/w,
shed the leaves, Hp.Insomn.90, Pherecr.130.10 (anap., fulloroh/sei, metri gr.), Arist.APo.98a37, Thphr.HP3.13.5, CP2.19.2, Dsc.1 Prooem.9, 4.143, Plu.2.366e, Pap. in Hermes40.548: metaph., of
becoming bald, Arist.GA783b17; Com., a)spi/das f.
shed, drop one's shields, Ar.Av.1481 (lyr.).

fullo/-rroia, h(,
falling of the leaves, Thphr. HP3.13.4, CP2.19.2.

fullo/-skepos, on,
covered with leaves, v. filo/skepos.
fullo-sta/fu^lon [a^], to/, = ka/pparis, f. l. for o)fiost- in Ps.-Dsc. 2.173.

fullo/-strwtos, on,
made of leafy branches, xameu=nai E.Rh.9 (anap.):
leaf-strewn, heterocl. dat. fullostrw=ti pe/dw| Theoc.Ep. 3.

fullo-to/kos, on,
producing leaves, Opp.C.1.116.

fullo-to/mos, on,
cutting off leaves, Gloss.

fullo-trw/c, w=gos, o(, h(, (trw/gw)
nibbling or
eating leaves, Antiph.172.2 (anap.).

fullo-fore/w,
bear leaves, Thphr.CP3.9.2.

fullo-fo/ros, on,
bearing leaves, f. a)gw=nes, = fulli/nai a)gw=nes, Pi.O.8.76; later in literal sense, Dsc.4.146.

fullo-fu^e/w,
put forth leaves, Gloss.

fullo-xoe/w,
shed leaves, Plu.2.735b, Phryn.PSp.123B.; f. ko/mhn AP7.141.6 (Antiphil.).

fullo-xo/os, on,
shedding the leaves, f. mh/n the
leaf-shedding month, Hes.Fr.240 (fort. mei/s, as in Call.Hec.1.1.12), A.R.4.217, cf. Him.Or.9.1, Eust.1555.6: pl., Plu.2.734d, 735d.

full-o/w,
clothe with leaves, Hp.Nat.Puer.23 (Pass.).

full-w/dhs, es,
like leaves, Thphr.HP1.13.1; spe/rma Dsc.3.80.
belonging to leaves, duna/meis Thphr.HP9.8.1.
having petalled flowers, ib.7.8.3.

fu/ll-wma, atos, to/,
foliage, D.S. 3.19 (pl.).

fu_loba^si^l-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
a basileu/s
chosen from each fulh/ to perform sacrifices, Hesperia4.21 (Athens, iv B. C.), Arist.Ath.8.3, al., IG22.1357, Poll.8.111,120, Hsch.

fu_loba^si^l-ika/ (sc. xrh/mata), ta/,
funds at the disposal of the fulobasilei=s, IG22.1357, Hesperia4.21 (Athens, iv B. C.).

fu_lokri^ne/w,
make distinctions of tribe, ei) . . fulokrinoi=en oi(=s xrew\n bohqei=n Th.6.18; e)le/xqh to\ mh\ fulokrinei=n pro\s tou\s e)ceta/zein ta\ ge/nh boulome/nous Arist.Ath.21.2: hence metaph.,
classify, Luc.Abd.4, Phal.2.9; also,
distinguish precisely, e(/kaston o(poi=o/n e)sti S.E.M.7.183; cf. Phryn.PSp.123B., Poll.8.110, etc.
select carefully, to\ bouleutiko\n pa=n kai\ f. kai\ diale/cai D.C.52.19, cf. Aristid. 1.218J. (s.v.l.).
pick out, a)po\ tw=n fau/lwn tou\s xrhstou/s Lib.Or.16.51, cf. Porph.Phil.Hist.Fr.11; ta\s e)c h(li/ou kai\ selh/nhs proi+ou/sas ei)s th\n ge/nesin poih/seis parathrhtikw=s f. Procl. in Cra. p.74P. (filokrine/w is freq. f.l.; fullokri/nein Hsch.）

fu=lon, to/, (fu/w)
race, tribe, or
class, ou)/ pote f. o(moi=on a)qana/twn te qew=n xamai\ e)rxome/nwn t' a)nqrw/pwn Il.5.441; gunaikw=n fu=lon Hes.Th. 1021; qew=n e)s fu=lon ib.202, cf. 965, Op.199: fu=lon a)oidw=n Od.8.481: in Ep. more freq. in pl., fu=la a)nqrw/pwn, qew=n, Il. 14.361, 15.54; fu=la gunaikw=n, e)pikou/rwn, *giga/ntwn, 9.130, 17.220, Od.7.206; a)/gria fu=la, mui/as Il.19.30; fu=la melisse/wn, of a
swarm of bees, Hes. Fr.14.5; in later Poets and Prose usu. in sg. (but pl., f. poiki/la qhrw=n Ar.Av.777 (lyr.); fu=la po/ntou, of fishes, E.Fr.27 (lyr.)), f. mataio/taton Pi.P.3.21; e(\n f. a)nqrw/pwn S.Fr.591.1 (lyr.); to\ a)/llo f. the rest of the
people, Id.OT19; fu=lon o)rni/qwn
the race of birds, Id.Ant. 342 (lyr.), cf. Ar.Av.231,253 (both lyr.): pthnw=n ib.1088 (lyr.); to\ pthno\n f. Pl.Sph.220b; to\ khrukiko\n f. Id.Plt.260d, cf. Cra.398e; to\ f. . . ou) . . r(a=|ston sullabei=n ti/ pot' e)sti/n, o( sofisth/s the sophist
tribe, Id.Sph.218c; kata\ *(/omhron kai\ *(hra/kleiton kai\ pa=n to\ toiou=ton f. and all the
tribe of them, Id.Tht.160d; f. a)mforeafo/rwn Eup.187; f. bouleutiko/n, = Lat.
ordo senatorius, D.C.59.9: metaph., f. tw=n h(donw=n Luc.Nigr.16.
sex, to\ gunaikei=on f. Ar.Th.786 (anap.); to\ qh=lu, to\ a)/rren, X.Lac.1.4.
nation, fu=la *pelasgw=n Il.2.840; kelaino\n f., of the Aethiopians, A.Pr.808, cf. Supp.544 (lyr.); ba/rbara f. E.IT887 (lyr.); *su/rous, fu=lon pa/mpolu X.Cyr.1.5.2; polemikw/tata f. Plu.Sull.29. = fulh/ 11.1,
clan or
tribe, acc. to blood or descent, kri=n' a)/ndras kata\ fu=la, kata\ frh/tras Il.2.362, cf. 363; fu=lon *(ele/nhs, fu=lon *)arkeisi/ou, Od.14.68, 181; f. tri/a triw=n strateuma/twn E.Supp.653.

fu/lopis [u_], idos, acc. ida and in (v. infr.), h(,
battle-cry, din of battle, freq. in Hom., e)/geire de\ fu/lopin ai)nh/n Il.5.496, cf. 4.65, al.; fulo/pida sth/sein pole/moio Od.11.314, cf. Hes.Sc.114, Il.13.635; po/lemos kai\ f. 4.15,82; nei=kos fulo/pidos 20.141.—Ep. word, used once by S.El. 1072 (lyr.), and in a mock oracle, Ar.Pax1076: pl., fulo/pidas prote/rwn u(/mnhsan a)oidoi/ Theoc.16.50.

fu_lw/dhs, es,
of many races, plh=qos neosu/llogon kai\ f. D.S. 34/5.6.

fu=ma, atos, to/, (fu/w)
growth, e)paneklh/qh w(s e)s fu=ma zwh=s
beginning of a fresh life, Aret.SD2.13: but usu.,
that which grows, Archil.136; freq. of diseased growths,
tumour, tubercle, etc., Hdt.3.133, Hp.VM22, Pl.Ti.85c, Thphr.HP9.11.1, Od.59, IG42(1).123.4 (Epid., iv B. C.), etc.; fu=ma fu/ein, fu=ma fu/etai, Hp.Prorrh. 2.10,11. [u_ Archil. l.c.; fu^ma/tessi only late, Marc.Sid.83.]

fu_ma^t-i/as, ou, o(,
one who has tumours, f. sklhrw=n fuma/twn Hp. Art.41, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.9.
fu_ma^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of fu=ma, Hp.Mul.2.133, Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.15.

fu_ma^t-o/omai, Pass.,
have tumours, Hp.Epid. 5.59, 7.81.

fu_ma^t-w/dhs, es,
full of tumours, ske/lea Id.
Acut.(Sp.)26.
fu=n, fu=nai, v. fu/w.
fu/c, coined as nom. to fu/gade, EM802.46, Eust.1080.17.

fuca_nori/a, h(,
aversion to wedlock, prob. for fulaca/noran (sic) in A. Supp.8 (anap.).

fuch/lios, on,
shunning the sun, Nic.Th.660.

fu/chlis, ios and idos, o(, h(,
cowardly, fu/chlin e)o/nta Il.17.143, cf. Nic.Al.472, Lyc.943.

fuci/mhla [i^] de/ndra, ta/, trees
that have grown too large to be hurt by sheep (mh=la), A.Fr.447, cf. Plu.2.293a.

fu/ci^mos, on, (feu/gw) older and poet. form of feu/cimos, of places,
whither one can flee, or
where one can take refuge, o(/qi moi fa/to fu/cimon ei)=nai where she said it was
possible for me
to escape, Od.5.359; f. to/pos Plb.13.6.9; fu/cimon ou)de/n Id.9.29.4; i(ero\n f.
an asylum, Plu.Rom.9; f. limh/n a harbour
of refuge, Id.2.823a: cf. fu/cion.
which one can escape; hence,
affording a chance of recovery, nou=sos Hp.Int.2;
avoidable, h)=mar Max.358.
which one would flee from, i. e.
loathsome, o)dmh/ Simon.250, Nic.Th.54 (s.v.l.). c. acc., s' a)qana/twn fu/cimos ou)dei/s is
able to escape thee, S.Ant.788 (lyr.).

fu/cion, to/, f.l. for fu/cimon,
place of refuge, Plu.Thes.36.

fu/cios, on,
of banishment, oi)=tos A.R.4.699.
putting to flight, epith. of Zeus, Apollod.1.9.1, cf. Lyc.288, Paus.2.21.2, Supp.Epigr.7.894.9 (Gerasa, i A. D.); of Apollo, Philostr.Her.10.4, Suid.

fuci/polis [ci^], ews, o(, h(,
fleeing the city, banished, Opp.H.1.278.

fu/cis, ews, h(, older and poet. form of feu=cis, = fugh/, Il.10.311, 447.
refuge, escape, qana/tou Nic.Th.588.
fu/os, to/, = fu/teuma, Hsch. (fuo/s cod.).
fu/ppac, = pu/ppac, Hsch.
fura/dhn, Adv., a doubtful word (vv. ll. fu/rdhn, frou/dhn）, to\ f. kai\ r(u/dhn ou)k oi)=da ei) a)nekta/ Poll.6.175 (fort. fora/dhn).
fu/rakes: e)lafroi/, Hsch. (fort. fu/zakes: e)/lafoi).

fu/r-a_ma [u_], atos, to/,
that which is mixed or
kneaded, dought, Mnesim.4.11 (anap.), Arist.Pr.929a25, LXXEx.8.3 (7.28), 12.34, al., Ep.Gal.5.9, Ep.Rom.9.21, al.; in brewing, PTeb.401.27 (i A. D.); generally,
paste, koni/as kai\ bolbi/tou f. Gp.15.2.8; kala/mou Dsc.1.55; opp. qrau=sma, Id.3.84: metaph., of the human frame as
a mixture, compound, Ph.1.184, M.Ant.7.68. generally,
mixture, su/mmigma kai\ f. a)e/ros kai\ puro/s Plu.2.922a, etc.: in pl.,
cements, ib.811c.
fur-a_matika/, ta/, = koniatika/, Jahresh.28.58 (Aphrodisias).

fur-a_te/on,
one must mix, knead, Dsc.5.88.

fur-a_th/s, ou=, o(,
mixer, i.e. '
cooker' of accounts, Cic.Att.6.9.2, 7.1.9; = Lat.
decoctor, fraudulent debtor, Gloss.; dub. sens. in Jahresh.1Beibl.75 (Ephesus).

fur-a_to/s, h/, o/n,
kneaded, a)/rtos Sor.2.10.

fur-a/w, 3pl. furw=si Hdt.2.36: fut. -a/sw [a_] A.Th.48: aor. e)fu/ra_sa Pl.Ti.73e, Ion. -hsa Hp.Fist.10: pf. pefu/ra_ka Cic.Att.6.4.3, 6.5.1:—Med., aor. e)fura_sa/mhn Ar.Nu.979
(anap.); Ion. -hsa/mhn Nic.Th.932:—Pass., aor. e)fura/qhn [a_] Pl. Tht.147c, APl.4.191 (Nicaen.); Ion. -h/qhn AP7.748 (Antip.Sid.): pf. pefu/ramai, Ion. -hmai (v. infr.):—lengthd. form of fu/rw (but almost limited to the sense of
mixing flour and similar substances), f. to\ stai=s toi=si posi/ Hdt. l.c.; oi)/nw| furh/sas Hp. l.c., cf. PHolm.4.9; ei)s u(/dwr f. ib.6.18; f. meta\ u(drargu/rou ib.4.35; ma=zan f. Hp. Vict.2.40; oi( furw=ntes
bread-kneaders, X.HG7.2.22; gh=n th/nde fura/sein fo/nw|
to make earth
into a bloody
paste, A. l.c.; gh=n . . e)fu/rase kai\ e)/deuse muelw=| Pl.Ti.73e: Pass., a)/rtos pollw=| u(/dati pefurhme/nos Hp.VM14; i)sxurw=s pef. ibid.; oi)/nw| kai\ e)lai/w| a)/lfita pefurame/na (v.l. pefurme/na) Th.3.49; gh= u(grw=| furaqei=sa phlo\s a)\n ei)/h Pl.Tht. 147c. metaph., malakh\n furasa/menos th\n fwnh\n pro\s to\n e)rasth\n e)ba/dizen
making one's voice
supple, i.e.
soft, towards one's lover, Ar. l.c.; pole/essi pefu/rhsai xalepoi=si, qume/
art confounded by . . Philet.7.1; pefurake/nai ta\s yh/fous
to have cooked the accounts, Cic. Il. cc.

fu/r-dhn, Dor. fu/rdan S.Fr.210.39 (lyr.), AP7.531 (Antip. Thess.):—Adv.
in utter confusion, A.Pers.812; f. ma/xesqai X.Cyr. 7.1.37; seswreu=sqai Plb.16.8.9; pa/nta ei)kh=| kai\ f. e)pra/tteto Id.30.11.6; su/rei f. drags
headlong, S. l.c. (fu/rw 1)
with defilement, si/daron . . f. mesto\n e)/xousa fo/nou APl.c.; f. tei/rwn fw=tas e)kbia/zetai Keil-Premerstein
Erster Bericht p.9.
fu/rkos, to/, Dor. fou=rkos, = tei=xos, Hsch., who also has fu/rkop: o)xu/rwma, and furkhli=tai (-ei/toi cod.): teixh/reis.

fu/rma, atos, to/,
mixture, dung, filth, Nic.Al.485 (pl.), Th.723.

furmo/s, o(,
mixture, confused mass, disorder, D.S.18.30, M.Ant. 12.14; f. kai\ su/gxusis tw=n kata\ no/mous dikai/wn D.S.36.11; a)nqrw/pwn o(mou= kai\ pragma/twn Ph.Fr.33 H.: metaph., 'a pretty kettle of fish', Cic.Att.14.5.1.
furo/s, a/, o/n, = sq., bou=s PGen.48.8 (iv A. D.); perh. cf. Hsch. s.v. furti/zesqai.
furo/xrwmos, on, dub. sens. (of the colour of a cow), PBaden19.5 (ii A. D.).

fu/r-si^mos, on,
mixed up, Nic.Al.324.

fu/r-sis, ews, h(,
mixing, kneading, a)leu/rou kai\ u(/datos Sch.D.T.p.215 H.

furth/ths (leg. -i/ths）: oi)=nos, Hsch. furti/zesqai: to\ pai/zein sunestramme/nois furoi=s toi=s i(mati/ois, Id. furto/s, h/, o/n,
mixed, kneaded up, Id.

fu/rw [u_], Hes.Op.61, Pl.Phd.97b: impf. e)/fu_ron Il.24.162, A.Pr. 450: fut. fu/rsw Pi.Pae.2.73, Hsch.: aor. subj. fu/rsw Od.18.21, inf. fu/rsai A.R.2.59; later e)/fu_ra AP7.476 (Mel.), Luc.Prom.13:— Med., aor. part. fursa/menos Nic.Th.507:—Pass., fut. pefu/rsomai Pi.N.1.68 codd.; later fu^rh/somai （sum-) Sch. ad loc.: aor. e)fu/rqhn A.Ag.732 (lyr.); later aor. 2 e)fu/rhn [u^] （sunan-) Luc.Ep.Sat.28: pf. pe/furmai (v. infr.):—
mix something
dry with something
wet, mostly with a sense of
mixing so as to spoil or
defile, gai=an u(/dei f. Hes.Op.61; esp. of tears or blood, da/krusin ei(/mat' e)/furon
they wetted, sullied their garments with tears, Il.24.162: c. gen. pro dat., mh/ se . . sth=qos kai\ xei/lea fu/rsw ai(/matos Od.18.21:—Pass., da/krusi pefurme/nh 17.103, etc.; o)/mma dakru/ois pefurme/noi E.Or.1411 (lyr.); pefurme/nos ai(/mati Od.9.397; gh= ai(/mati pef. X.Ages.2.14; ai(/mati d' oi)=kos e)fu/rqh A. l.c. (lyr.); mhtro\s . . e)n ai(/masi pefurme/noi E.El.1173; pa/nta borbo/rw| pefurme/na Semon.7.3; i(sti/on . . pefurme/non prino\s a)/nqei+
stained, dyed, Simon.54: dub. in signf. of fura/w, e)lai/w| a)/lfita pefurme/na, v.l. for pefurame/na in Th.3.49; te/fra| pefurme/nh| o)/cei, v.l. for pefurame/nh| in Gp.5.39.2. of dry things, ko/nei fu/rousa . . ka/ra E.Hec.496; gai/a| pefu/rsesqai ko/man
to be doomed to have one's hair
defiled with earth, Pi. l.c.; a)/nqos e)/fure ko/nis AP7.476 (Mel.). metaph.,
jumble together, confound, confuse, e)/furon ei)kh=| pa/nta
they mingled all things up together, did all at random, A.Pr.450, cf. Ar.Ra.945, Pl.Phd.97b; (Med., ou)k a)\n fu/roio would not
jumble your arguments, ib.101e); fu/rousi d' au)ta\ qeoi\ pa/lin te kai\ pro/sw taragmo\n e)ntiqe/ntes E.Hec.958; e)n tai=s o(mili/ais fu/rein
to speak confusedly among themselves, M.Ant.8.51:—Pass.,
to be mixed up, e)n tw=| au)tw=| Pl.Grg.465c, cf. d; bi/oton e)k pefurme/nou kai\ qhriw/dous diestaqmh/sato from a
confused and savage state, E.Supp. 201. Med.,
mix with others, mingle in society, Pl.Lg.950a; fu/resqai pro\s to\n a)/nqrwpon
associate, have dealings with him, Id.Hp. Ma.291a; furome/noisin a)ei\ peri\ gaste/ros o(rmh/n
wallowing in the lusts of the belly, Opp.H.3.440, and cf. mei/gnumi B.
confound, Pi.Pae.2.73 (expld. by Sch. as = a)poktenei=). Pass., metaph.,
to be mutually befouled by abuse, Plu.2.89d. (Prob. cogn. with porfu/rw.）
fu/s, Dor. = o)sfu/s, AB1096. aor. part. of fu/w.

fu=sa, hs, h(,
pair of bellows, mostly in pl., to\n d' eu(=r' . . e(lisso/menon peri\ fu/sas, sc. Hephaestus, Il.18.372, cf. 409; fu/sas e)sqe/ntes e)fu/swn Th.4.100; ai( f. ai( e)n toi=s xalkei/ois Arist.Resp.474a12; tou= xalke/os du/o fu/sas Hdt.1.68: hence e)n th=|si fu/sh|s in the
smithies Herod.3.21.
bladder, Dsc.5.94, Hippiatr.33,
Gloss.; fu=san u(phne/mion AP9.486 (Pall.); f. xhnei/a PMag.Lond.46.382; of the castoreum
pouches of the beaver, Dsc.2.24. = fare/tra, Hsch. = a)sko/s, Id.
breath, wind, blast, a)gri/ais fu/saisi fusa=n S.Fr. 768; e)s to\n a)sko\n fu=san e)nie/nai . .
to inflate, Hp.Art.47, cf. 77.
wind in the body, flatus, Id.VM10,22, Aph.4.73;
breaking of wind, opp. e)rugmo/s, ptarmo/s, Arist.Pr.962a35: pl., Pl.R.405d, Arist.HA 604a12; peri\ fusw=n, title of work by Hippocrates. of fire,
stream, jet, flo\c fu=san i(ei=sa puro/s h.Merc.114.
bubble, f. e)pi/xrusoi Luc.Merc.Cond.22.
crater of a volcano, Str.13. 4.11, Oros.6.2.17.
calyx of fusalli/s 111, Dsc.Eup.1.51. name of
a fish found in the Nile, Str.17.2.4, Ath.7.312b. (Cf. Lith.
pučiù 'I blow', Lat.
pustula, etc.; onomatop.; v. may be Egyptian.)

fu^sa/d-eia [a^d], h(, name of a fountain in Argos, Call.Lav.Pall. 47: hence fu^sad-eio/qen, Adv.
from P., Antim. in PMilan.17.12.

fu_s-a^le/os, a, on,
windy, full of wind, Cerc.6.15, Nonn.D.43.405.

fu_s-alli/s, i/dos, h(,
bladder, bubble, Luc.Cont.19.
a wind instrument, a kind of
pipe, Ar.Lys.1245 (pl.). = a(lika/kkabos 1, Ps.-Dsc.4.71, Paul.Aeg.3.45.
bolus, pill, Aen. Gaz.Ep.20.

fu_/s-a^los, o(, a kind of
toad said to puff itself up even to bursting, and to have poisonous breath, Luc.Philops.12, Dips. 3. a poisonous
fish which puffs itself out, prob.
Tetrodon, Ael. NA3.18. a kind of
whale (cf. fushth/r 11.2), Opp.H.1.368, Ael.NA9.49.

fu/sansis [u^], ews, h(, '
naturation', Phlp. in Ph.211.8.
fu_s-a/rion, to/, Dim. of fu=sa 1.2, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.26.1.

fu_s-asmo/s, o(,
blowing, opp. a)asmo/s, Arist.Pr.964a17.
fu_s-a_th/rion, Dor. for fusht-.

fu_sa/w, Ion. pres. part. fuse/wn Call.Iamb.1.101 (rightly censured by Sch. in PSI9.1094.30): (fu=sa): abs.,
blow, puff (opp. a)a/zw, Arist.Pr.964a11), of bellows, fu=sai . . e)fu/swn Il.18.470; of the wind, 23.218; of men, fushth=ras e)sqe/ntes . . fusw=si toi=si sto/masi Hdt.4.2, cf. Th.4.100, Call.l.c.; deina\ fusa=|
snorts furiously, E.IA381 (troch.); metaph. from a flute-player, fusa=| ga\r ou) smikroi=sin au)li/skois S.Fr. 768; me/gafusa=n, Lat.
magnum spirare, E.IA125 (anap.); oi( fusw=ntes e)f' e(autoi=s me/ga Men.302; mega/la f. Id.Epit.492, Ph.2.85; h(li/kon e)fu/sa to/te Luc.Nec.12; ai(=mafusw=n *)/arhs
breathing blood and murder, S.El.1385 (lyr.); politiko\n fu/shma f.
swell with political pride, Pl. Alc.2.145e; abs., pau/ou fusw=n Ephipp.5.20 (anap.); ou)k e)fu/swn oi( *la/kwnes w(s a)po/rqhtoi/ pote; Antiph.117 (troch.); th=| ge/nh=| fusw=ntes Herod.2.32; fusw=sa e)pi\ tw=| ge/nei D.Chr.58.5. trans.,
puff or
blow up, distend, f. ku/stin
blow up a bladder, Ar.Nu.405 (anap.); of bag-pipers, Id.Ach.863; f. di/ktuon, prov. of labour in vain, Phryn. PSp.121 B.; f. th\n gna/qon, of one going to be shaved, Ar.Th.221 (but f. ta\s gna/qous to
puff them
up, of pride, D.19.314);
distend, of disease, AP11.13 (Ammian.):—Pass., a)skoi\ pefusame/noi Sophr. in PSI11.1214d9 (cf. Epich.246); fle/bas fuswme/nas Hdt.4.2; h( gasth\r e)pefu/shto/ mou Ar.Pl.699; pro/bata a)podare/nta kai\ fushqe/nta X.An.3.5.9; pefushme/noi
puffy, swollen, opp. eu)/xrooi, Id.Lac.5.8. later of a solid
swelling, e.g. of the tongue, o(/tan fushqh=| Aët.8.40; of the male breasts at puberty, fusw=ntai kata\ poso/n Paul.Aeg.6.46. metaph.,
puff one
up, make him
vain, and so
cheat him, D.13.12, 59.38; f. au)to\s e(auto/n Aristaenet.1.27:—Pass.,
to be puffed up, e)pi\ duna/mei X.Mem.1.2.25, cf. D.59.97, Arr.Epict.2.16.10; u(po\ th=s tu/xhs Plu. 2.68f; pefushme/noi th\n yuxh/n D.Chr.30.19.
blow up, kindle, to\ pu=r Pherecr.60, Dionys.Com.2.16; to\n fano/n Philippid.16: but also,
blow out, extinguish, th\n lampa/da Ar.Ra.1098 (anap.), cf. Thphr.Ign.28 (Pass.).
blow out, spurt or
spout out, fusw=nt' a)/nw pro\s r(i=nas . . ai(=ma S.Aj.918.
blow a wind instrument, f. ko/xlous E. IT303; also fusa=n abs., Ar.Av.859, cf. Epigr. ap. Ath.8.337f; fusa=ntes (Boeot.) Ar.Ach.868; xe/r' e)fu/sh
blew into . . , Theoc.19.3:—Pass., ko/xlou fushqe/ntos Id.22.77. Pass.,
to be blown about, a)ka/nqhs pa/ppos w(\s fusw/menos S.Fr.868; pe/tetai [o( pa/ppos] . . , u(po\ tw=n paidi/wn f. Eub.107.22.
fu^se/xh, h(, word coined from fu/sin e)/xein or o)xei=n, as etymol. of yuxh/, by Pl.Cra.400b.
fuse/wn, v. fusa/w.

fu_s-hla/tai,
folles fabriles, Gloss.

fu_/s-hma, atos, to/,
that which is blown or
produced by blowing, f. a)nei\s du/stlhton a hard-drawn
breath, E.Ph.1438; dnofw/dh . . ai)qe/ros fush/mata, of stormy
blasts, Id.Tr.79, cf. Rh.440; po/ntion f. the
roaring of the sea, Id.Hipp. 1211.
that which is blown up, of half-formed shells, Plin. HN9.108; dou/reion . . xh=na tw=| fush/mati like the Trojan horse (dou/reios i(/ppos)
in inflation, i.e.
stuffed, Diph.90:
state of inflation, Luc.Cont.19.
blowing, puffing, snorting, of a horse, X.Eq.11.12: metaph.,
conceit, politiko\n f. fusw=ntes Pl.Alc.2.145e; ge/montes o)/gkou kai\ f. Plu.2.39d; and, in double sense, of a flute-player, mei=zon th=s mhtro\s e)/xwn to\ f. Hyp. ap. Ath.13.591f; r(h/mata . . a)pospw=n ghgenei= fush/mati Ar.Ra.825 (lyr.). me/lanos ai(/matos fush/mata black blood
blown from the nostrils, of newly slaughtered cattle, E.IA1114.
pine-resin, Gal.13.475, Aët. 15.3.

fu_s-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Gloss.: metaph. of
petty conceit, Arr.Epict.2.16.10.

fu_/s-hsis, ews, h(,
blowing upon or
up, of coals, Thphr.HP5.9.3.

fu_s-hte/on,
one must blow up, to\ pu=r Ar. Lys.293 (lyr.). fushte/os, a, on,
to be blown up, inflated, a)sko/s Hp.Art.77.

fu_s-hth/r, h=ros, o(,
instrument for blowing, blowpipe or
tube, f. o)ste/i+noi Hdt.4.2, cf. Opp.H.4.463.
bellows, LXX Jb.32.19, Poll.10.147, Gal.2.717.
blow-hole or
spiracle of whales, etc., Arist.HA566b3; the
funnel through which the cuttle-fish squirts its ink, ib.541b17.
one who blows a pipe or
bellows, Dsc.5.75 (v.l.), Suid. s.v. e)ce/lipe. a kind of
whale, perh.
Biscay whale, Str.3.2.7.

fu_s-hth/rion, Dor. fusa_t-, to/,
wind-instrument, pipe, Ar.Lys.1242 (pl.); gloss on fusalli/des, Hsch. =
spiramentum, Gloss. a
furnace with bellows, opp. au)tomata/reion, Olymp.Alch.p.91 B.

fu_s-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
causing flatulency, flatulent, Hp.Mul.1.75, Arist.HA595b6; f. th=s koili/as Id.Pr. 908b1.

fu_s-hto/s, h/, o/n,
blown, blown out, u(/elos fushth/ Herod.Med.
ap.Orib.5.30.32. fushto/n, to/,
fan for kindling the fire, IG22.1388.77.
fu_s-h/twr, oros, o(, = fushth/r, as Adj., a)skoi/ Nonn.D.30.70.

fu_s-h/frwn, onos, o(, h(,
puffed up in mind, Hsch. (but the order of the letters requires fusi/frwn).

fu_si/-a_ma [i^], atos, to/,
breathing hard, blowing, r(e/gkousi d' ou) platoi=si fusia/masin A.Eu.53.

fu_si-asmo/s, o(,
the sound made in expiration, Arist.Pr.904a2.

fu_sia/w, Ep. part. fu_sio/wn:—intr.,
blow, puff, snort, breathe hard, pant, i(/ppoi fusio/wntes Il.4.227, 16.506; mo/xqois a)ndrokmh=si fusia=| spla/gxnon A.Eu.248; fusiw=n . . e)kba/llei r(oh\n . . foini/ou stala/gmatos S.Ant.1238: metaph., me/sf' o( dai/mwn ou)/ria fusia/ei Cerc.4.49.
hiss, fusio/wsa e)/xis Opp.C.3.439, cf. 1.262. metaph.,
to be puffed up, Naumach. ap. Stob.4.23.7.
fu_si/ggh, h(, = fu=sigc 11, Sch.Ar.Ach.525, Suid.

fu_siggisth/s, ou=, o(, = Lat.
plagiaula, Gloss. (dub. l.).

fu_siggo/omai, Pass., (fu=sigc)
to be excited by eating garlic, prop. of fighting cocks, hence o)du/nais pefusiggwme/noi
infuriated by vexations, of the Megarians (who were large growers of garlic), Ar.Ach.526.

fu_si/gna^qos, o(,
Puff-cheek, name of a frog in Batr.56: hence fu_signa^qe/w, = fusw= ta\s gna/qous, Tz.H.8.tit.201.
fu^signw/mwn, on, gen. onos, = fusiognw/mwn, Theoc.Ep.11.1.

fu=sigc, iggos, h(,
blister on the heel caused by a burn, Poll.4.198.
stalk of garlic, Hp.Fist.3, Thphr.HP7.4.12; or (acc. to Sch.Ar.Ach.525)
the outer coat of a clove of garlic.
a particular kind af garlic, Diocl.Fr.120.

fu_si/-zoos, on, as epith. of earth, prob.
producing ze/a, ai)=a Il.3.243, Od.11.301, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.67; gh= Il.21.63; but reinterpreted as from zwh/ （zo/h),
producing life, fusizo/ou . . ge/nos *zhno/s prob. in A. Supp.584 (lyr., fusi/zoon cod.M); f. u(/dwr AP9.383.12; a)h/r Tryph. 77, etc.

fu_si/-zw|os, on,
producing life, *diw/nusos IGRom.4.360.15 (Pergam., ii A. D.) (elsewh. as f.l. for foreg.).

fu^si/k-euma [i^], atos, to/,
physical explanation, th=s a)straph=s Tz.H. 11.480.

fu^sik-eu/omai,
to be or
speak like a natural philosopher, Julian. ap.Gal.18(1).255.

fu^si/k-illos, o(, a kind of
bread, Lacon. word in Ath.4.139a.

fu^siklei/dion, to/,
a spell to open the fu/sis (i.e. pudendum muliebre), PMag.Osl.1.283.

fu^siko/s, h/, o/n,
natural, produced or
caused by nature, inborn, native, once in X.,Mem.3.9.1, not in Pl., freq. in Arist. (ta\ peri\ ge/nesin f. Ph.191a3, al.), and later Prose; opp. didakto/s, X. l.c.; opp. nomiko/s (conventional), di/kaion Arist.EN1134b19; h( f. xrh=sis, opp. h( para\ fu/sin, Ep.Rom.1.26; of style,
natural, simple, a)lhqe\s kai\ f. xrw=ma D.H.Th.42; to\ f., opp. to\ texniko/n, ib.34: f. ui(o/s, = o( e)k pornei/as gegonw/s, opp. gnh/sios, Thom.Mag.p.362 R.; ui(o\s gnh/sios kai\ f. PLips.28.18 (iv A. D.). Adv. -kw=s
by nature, naturally, kinhto/n, kinei=sqai, Arist.Ph.201a24, Cael.307b32; w)xurwme/nh f. li/mnh| D.S.20.55; a)kataskeu/ws kai\ f. Plb.6.4.7, etc.
belonging to the nature of a plant,
characteristic, Thphr.HP8.4.4, al.
belonging to growth, Stoic.2.205, al. f. o)do/ntes
milk-teeth, Nicom. ap. Theol.Ar.49.
of or
concerning the order of external nature, natural, physical, h( f. e)pisth/mh Arist.PA640a2; f. filosofi/a ib.653a9; h( f. Id.Metaph.1026a6, etc.; opp. maqhmatikh/, qeologikh/, ib.1064b2; ta\ f. ib.1026a4; oi( f. lo/goi f.l. for oi( fusiolo/goi, Id.EN1154b7; f. prota/seis, opp. h)qikai/, logikai/, Id.Top.105b21; to\ f., to\ h)qiko/n, to\ logiko/n, the three branches of philosophy, Zeno Stoic.1.15, etc., cf. S.E.P.2.13; ta\ prw=ta kai\ -w/tata the primal
elements of things, Plu.2.395d. o( f.
an inquirer into nature, natural philosopher, Arist.de An.403a28, PA641a21, Metaph.1005a34; peri\ pasw=n [tw=n ai)tiw=n] ei)de/nai tou= f. Id.Ph.198a22, cf. Metaph. 1026a5: esp. of the Ionic and other pre-Socratic philosophers, Id.Ph.184b17, 187a12, 205a5, al.: also o( f., of Epicurus, Phylarch. 24J.; o( fusikw/tatos, of Thales, Luc.Ner.4. army
surgeon, dub. in IG12.950.153. h( f. a)kro/asis, title of a treatise by Arist.; ta\ fusika/, a name given to his
physical treatises, Id.Ph.267b21, Metaph.1042b8; e)pitomh\ fusikw=n Id.Pr.10tit. Adv. -kw=s
according to the laws of nature, Id.Ph.198a23; opp. logikw=s, ib.204b10: Comp. -w/teron ei)pei=n Id.GC335b25. later,
belonging to occult laws of nature, magical, f. fa/rmaka
spells or
amulets, Alex. Trall.1.15; fusikoi=s xrh=sqai Gp.2.18.8; f. qerapei/a ib.2.42.3; f. daktu/lioi Sch.Ar.Pl.884. Adv. -kw=s Gp.9.1.5.

fu/si^mos [u^], on,
able to produce, productive, spe/rma Thphr.CP4.4.7, al.; si=tos ib.4.16.3.
fu^siognwm-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(, perh. = fusiologi/a, cited from Hippocrates by [Gal.]19.530.

fu^siognwm-one/w,
study the features, judge of a man's
character thereby, tina D.25.98: abs., Arist.APr.70b7; f. e)k tw=n genw=n tw=n zw/|wn, kata\ ta\ h)/qh, Id.Phgn.805a20,b1, al.:—Pass.,
to be inferred from the features, ib.806a25.

fu^siognwm-oni/a, h(,
the science or
art of judging a man by his features, physiognomy, Hp.Epid.2.5 tit., Arist.Phgn.806a19.

fu^siognwm-oniko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for physiognomy, Hp. Epid.2.6 tit.; f. sofi/a S.E.P.1.85: -kh/, h(, Philostr.Gym.25: -ko/n, to/, name of a work by Antisthenes, Ath.14.656f; ta\ f., title of a treatise ascribed to Aristotle. Adv. -kw=s Eust.838.19.
fu^siognwm-osu/nh, h(, = fusiognwmoni/a, Pall. in Hp.2.124 D.

fu^siognw/m-wn, on, gen. onos,
judging of a man's
character by his
features, Arist.GA769b20, Phgn.805a18, 806a33, etc.

fu^siolog-e/w,
discourse on nature, investigate natural causes and phenomena, f. peri\ pa/ntwn Arist.Metaph.988b27, cf. Polystr.p.12 W., D.S.3.62, Plu.2.921d, al.: abs., o)rqw=s f. Phld.Rh.2.42 S., cf. Plu.2.118d, al., Diog.Oen.3: c. acc., tou\s i)xqu=s Philostr.Gym.44.
explain from natural principles, *timai=os f. th\n yuxh\n kinei=n to\ sw=ma Arist.de An.406b26:—Pass., Ph.2.506.

fu^siolo/g-hma, atos, to/,
scientific proposition, Epicur.Ep.2p.36U.

fu^siolog-hte/on,
one must theorize scientifically, ibid., S.E.P.1.18.

fu^siolog-i/a, h(,
inquiring into natural causes and phenomena, h( f. h( peri\ tw=n futw=n Arist.Sens.442b25; generally, Epicur. Ep.1p.4U., 2p.35U., Metrod.Herc.831.8, etc.; f. kai\ qeologi/a, f. kai\ maqhmatikh/, D.S.5.40, Str.14.1.7, cf. Cic.Div.1.41.90, Ph.1.139, Plu.2.420c, etc.; h( *zh/nwnos f., title of work by Cleanthes: pl., Longin.12.5, etc.

fu^siolog-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for inquiry into nature, esp.
the nature of man, Gal.19.351; f. e)pisth/mh Hierocl.in CA22p.468M.; Subst., o( f. Ph.1.139.

fu^sio/log-os (parox.), o(,
one who inquires into natural causes and phenomena, esp. of the pre-Socratic philosophers, Arist.Metaph.986b14, 990a3, de An.426a20, PA641a7, al.; f. ma=llon h)\ poihth/n, of Empedocles, Id.Po.1447b19; o( f., title of play by Sopater, Ath.3.101a; oi( a)rxai=oi f., title of work by Chrysippus, D.L. 7.187; as Adj., parrhsi/a f. cj. in Epicur.Sent.Vat.29: Sup., a)nh\r -w/tatos tw=n palaiw=n Phld.Mus.p.108K. Adv. -gws M.Ant.10.31.

fu^siopoie/w,
remould as by a second nature, Democr.33.

fu^sio/w, (fu/sis)
dispose one naturally, c. inf., Simp. in Epict. p.58 D.:—Pass., pefusiwme/nos, h, on,
having become a second nature, inveterate, Arist.Cat.9a2.

fu_sio/w, (fu=sa)
puff up, 1 Ep.Cor.8.1 (for Ep. part. fusio/wn v. fusia/w):—Pass., pro\s ta\ qe/mata pefusiwme/nos Phld.Po.Herc.1676.9, cf. 1 Ep.Cor.4.6; u(polh/yeis pef. Phld.Mus.p.26 K.

fu/sis [u^], h(, gen. fu/sews, poet. fu/seos prob. (metri gr.) in E.Tr. 886, cf. Ar.V.1282 (lyr.), 1458 (lyr.), Ion. fu/sios: dual fu/sei (v.l. fu/sh) Pl.R.410e, (fu/w):
origin, f. ou)deno/s e)stin a(pa/ntwn qnhtw=n ou)de\ . . teleuth/ Emp.8.1 (cf. Plu.2.1112a); f. bou/lontai le/gein ge/nesin th\n peri\ ta\ prw=ta Pl.Lg.892c; h( f. h( legome/nh w(s ge/nesis o(do/s e)stin ei)s fu/sin Arist.Ph.193b12; f. le/getai h( tw=n fuome/nwn ge/nesis Id.Metaph.1014b16; freq. of persons,
birth, fu/sei new/teros S.OC1295, cf. Aj.1301, etc.; fu/si gegono/tes eu)= Hdt.7.134; fu/sei, opp. qe/sei (by adoption), D.L.9.25; fu/sei *)ambrakiw/ths, dhmopoi/htos de\ *sikuw/nios Ath.4.183d; so o( kata\ fu/sin path/r, ui(o/s, a)delfo/s, Plb. 3.9.6, 3.12.3, 11.2.2; also in acc., e)k patro\s tau)tou= fu/sin S.El.325; h)\ fi/lwn tis h)\ pro\s ai(/matos fu/sin ib.1125, cf. Isoc.3.42.
growth, trixw=n, paidi/ou, Hp.Nat.Puer.20,29, cf. 27: pl., geneia/seis kai\ fu/seis kera/twn Plot.4.3.13.
the natural form or
constitution of a person or thing
as the result of growth (oi(=on e(/kasto/n e)sti th=s gene/sews telesqei/shs, tau/thn fame\n th\n f. ei)=nai e(ka/stou Arist.Pol.1252b33): hence,
nature, constitution, once in Hom., kai/ moi fu/sin au)tou= (sc. tou= farma/kou） e)/deice Od.10.303; f. th=s xw/rhs Hdt.2.5; th=s *)attikh=s X.Vect.1.2, cf. Oec.16.2, D.18.146, etc.; th=s trixo/s X.Eq.5.5; ai(/matos, a)e/ros, etc., Arist.PA648a21, Mete.340a36, etc.: pl., fu/seis e)ggignome/nas karpw=n kai\ de/ndrwn Isoc.7.74; ai( f. kai\ duna/meis tw=n politeiw=n Id.12.134; h( tw=n a)riqmw=n f. Pl.R.525c; h( tw=n pa/ntwn f. X.Mem.1.1.11, etc.; h( i)di/a tou= pra/gmatos f. IG22.1099.28 (Epist.Plotinae).
outward form, appearance, me/zonas h)\ kat' a)nqrw/pwn fu/sin Hdt.8.38; h)\ no/on h)/toi fu/sin either in mind or
outward form, Pi.N.6.5; ou) ga\r f. *)wariwnei/an e)/laxen Id.I.4(3).49 (67); morfh=s d' ou)x o(mo/stolos f. A.Supp.496; to\n de\ *la/i+on fu/sin ti/n' ei)=xe fra/ze S.OT740 (read ei(=rpe, taking f. with e)/xwn), cf. Tr.379; drakai/nhs f. e)/xousan a)gri/an prob. in E.Ba.1358; th\n e)mh\n i)dw\n f. Ar.V.1071 (troch.), cf. Nu.503; th\n tou= sw/matos f. Isoc.9.75. Medic.,
constitution, temperament, Hp.Aph.3.2 (pl.), al.; h( f. kai\ h( e(/cis Id.Acut.43; f. fu/sios kai\ h(liki/a h(liki/hs diafe/rei Id.Fract.7; fu/sies nou/swn i)htroi/ Id.Epid.6.5.1.
natural place or
position of a bone or joint, a)pophda=n a)po\ th=s f., e)s th\n f. a)/gesqai, Id.Art.61, 62, al.; o)ste/on me/non e)n th=| e(wutou= f. Id.VC5, al.; fu/sies tw=n a)/rqrwn Id.Nat.Puer.17. of the mind, one's
nature, character, h)=qos e(/kaston, o(/ph| f. e)sti\n e(ka/stw| Emp.110.5; eu)genh\s ga\r h( f. ka)c eu)genw=n . . h( sh/ S.Ph.874; th\n au(tou= f. lipei=n, dei=cai, ib.902,1310; f. freno/s E.Med.103 (anap.); h( a)nqrwpei/a f. Th.1.76; f. th=s morfh=s kai\ th=s yuxh=s X.Cyr.1.2.2; o)no/mati mempto\n to\ no/qon, h( f. d' i)/sh E.Fr.168; f. filo/sofos, turannikh/, etc., Pl.R.410e, 576a, etc.; decioi\ fu/sin A.Pr.489; a)kmai=oi fu/sin Id.Pers.441; to\ ga\r a)posth=nai xalepo\n fu/seos, h(\n e)/xoi tis Ar.V.1458 (lyr.), cf. 1282 (lyr.); *so/lwn . . h)=n filo/dhmos th\n f. Id.Nu.1187; e)/nioi o)/ntes w(s a)lhqw=s tou= dh/mou th\n f. ou) dhmotikoi/ ei)si X.Ath.2.19; fu/sews i)sxu/s force
of natural powers, Th.1.138; fu/sews kaki/a badness
of natural disposition, D.20.140; a)gaqoi\ . . gi/gnontai dia\ triw=n, ta\ tri/a de\ tau=ta/ e)sti f. e)/qos lo/gos Arist. Pol.1332a40; xrw= th=| fu/sei, i.e. give rein to your
natural propensities, Ar.Nu.1078, cf. Isoc.7.38; th=| f. xrw/menos Plu.Cor.18; qei/as koinwnoi\ f. 2 Ep.Pet.1.4: pl., Isoc.4.113, v.l. in E.Andr.956; oi( a)/ristoi ta\s f. Pl.R.526c, cf. 375b, al.: prov., e)/qos, fasi/, deute/rh f. Jul.Mis.353a.
instinct in animals, etc., Democr.278; ou)k e)pisth/mh| ou)de\ te/xnh| a)lla\ fu/sei Herm. ap. Stob.1.41.6; e)n toi=s a)/llois zw/|ois h( ai)/sqhsis th=| f. h(/nwtai, e)n de\ a)nqrw/pois th=| noh/sei Corp.Herm. 9.1, cf. 12.1. freq. in periphrases, kai\ ga\r a)\n pe/trou fu/sin su/ g' o)rga/neias, i.e. would'st provoke a stone, S.OT335; xqono\s f. A.Ag.633; esp. in Pl., h( tou= pterou= f. Phdr.251b; h( f. tw=n swma/twn Smp.186b; h( f. th=s a)sqenei/as its
natural weakness, Phd.87e; h( tou= muelou= f. Ti.84c; h( tou= dikai/ou f. Lg.862d, al.; h( f., with gen. understood, Smp.191a, Phd.109e.
the regular order of nature, tu/xh . . a)be/baios, f. de\ au)ta/rkhs Democr.176; kata\ fu/sin Pl.R.444d, etc.; tri/xes kata\ fu/sin pefukui=ai growing
naturally, Hdt.2.38, cf. Alex.156.7 (troch.); kata\ fu/sin "no/mos o( pa/ntwn basileu/s" Pi.Fr. 169 (cf. Pl.Grg.488b); kata\ f. poiei=n Heraclit.112; opp. para\ fu/sin, E.Ph.395, Th.6.17, etc.; para\ th\n f. Anaxipp.1.18; prodo/ths e)k
fu/sews a traitor by
nature, Aeschin.2.165; pro\ th=s f. h(/kein ei)s qa/naton before the
natural term, Plu.Comp.Dem.Cic.5: freq. in dat. fu/sei （e)n f. Hp.
Aër.14)
by nature, naturally, opp. tu/xh|, te/xnh|, Pl.Lg.889b, cf. R.381b; fu/sei toiou=tos Ar.Pl.275, cf. 279, al.; o( a)/nqrwpos f. politiko\n zw=|o/n e)sti Arist.Pol.1253a3; o( mh\ au(tou= f. a)ll' a)/llou a)/nqrwpos w)/n, ou(=tos f. dou=lo/s e)stin ib.1254a15; f. ga\r ou)dei\s dou=los e)genh/qh pote/ Philem.95.2; opp. no/mw| (by convention), Philol.9, Archelaus ap.D.L.2.16, Pl.Grg.482e, cf. Prt.337d, etc.; ta\ me\n tw=n no/mwn o(mologhqe/nta, ou) fu/nt' e)sti/n, ta\ de\ th=s fu/sews fu/nta, ou)x o(mologhqe/nta Antipho Soph.44Ai32 (Vorsokr.5); a(/pas o( tw=n a)nqrw/pwn bi/os fu/sei kai\ no/mois dioikei=tai D.25.15; tou\s th=s f. ou)k e)/sti lanqa/nein no/mous Men.Mon.492; ou) sofi/a|, a)lla\ fu/sei tini/ Pl. Ap.22c; f. mh\ pefuko/ta toiau=ta fwnei=n S.Ph.79, cf. Pl.Phlb.14c, etc.; fu/sei pa/nta pa/ntes o(moi/ws pefu/kamen kai\ ba/rbaroi kai\ *(/ellhnes ei)=nai Antipho Soph.44Bii10 (Vorsokr.5); fu/sin e)/xei c. inf., it is
natural, kw=s fu/sin e)/xei polla\s muria/das foneu=sai (sc. to\n *(hrakle/a); Hdt.2.45, cf. Pl.R.473a; ou)k e)/xei fu/sin it is contrary to
nature, ib.489b; ou)/t' eu)/logon ou)/t' e)/xon e)sti\ fu/sin D.2.26; to\ to/lmhma fu/sin ou)k e)/xei Polem.Call.36. in Philosophy:
nature as an originating power, f. le/getai . . o(/qen h( ki/nhsis h( prw/th e)n e(ka/stw| tw=n fu/sei o)/ntwn Arist.Metaph.1014b16; o( de\ qeo\s kai\ h( f. ou)de\n ma/thn poiou=sin Id.Cael.271a33; h( de\ f. ou)de\n a)lo/gws ou)de\ ma/thn poiei= ib.291b13; h( me\n te/xnh a)rxh\ e)n a)/llw|, h( de\ f. a)rxh\ e)n au)tw=| Id.Metaph.1070a8, cf. Mete.381b5, etc.; f. kru/ptesqai filei= Heraclit.123; h( gohtei/a th=s f. Plot.4.4.44; f. koinh/, the
principle of growth in the universe, Cleanth.Stoic.1.126; as Stoic t.t., the inner fire which causes preservation and growth in plants and animals, defined as pu=r texniko\n o(dw=| badi/zon ei)s ge/nesin, Stoic.1.44, cf. 35, al., S.E.M.9.81;
Nature, personified, xa/ris th=| makari/a| *f. Epicur.Fr.469; *f. kai\ *ei(marme/nh kai\ *)ana/gkh Phld. Piet.12; h( katwferh\s *f. Corp.Herm.1.14.
elementary substance, kinduneu/ei o( le/gwn tau=ta pu=r kai\ u(/dwr kai\ gh=n kai\ a)e/ra prw=ta h(gei=sqai tw=n pa/ntwn ei)=nai kai\ th\n f. o)noma/zein au)ta\ tau=ta Pl.Lg. 891c, cf. Arist.Fr.52 (defined as th\n prw/thn ou)si/an . . u(pobeblhme/nhn a(/pasi toi=s gennhtoi=s kai\ fqartoi=s sw/masi Gal.15.3); tw=n fu/sei o)/ntwn ta\ stoixei=a/ fasin ei)=nai fu/sin Arist.Metaph.1014b33: pl., Epicur.Ep. 1p.6U., al.; a)/tomoi f.
atoms, Democr. ap. Diog.Oen.5, Epicur.Ep. 1p.7U.; a)/fqartoi f. Phld.Piet.83. concrete, the
creation, 'Nature', a)qana/tou . . fu/sews ko/smon a)gh/rwn E.Fr.910 (anap.); peri\ fu/sew/s te kai\ tw=n metew/rwn a)stronomika\ a)/tta dierwta=n Pl.Prt.315c; peri\ fu/sews, title of works by Xenophanes, Heraclitus, Gorgias, Epicurus, etc.; [sofi/a] h(\n dh\ kalou=si peri\ fu/sews i(stori/an Pl.Phd.96a; peri\ f. a)forizo/menoi diexw/rizon zw/|wn te bi/on de/ndrwn te fu/sin laxa/nwn te ge/nh Epicr.11.13 (anap.); so later, h( f. to\ u(po\ yuxh=s th=s pa/shs taxqe/n Plot.2.2.1; ta\ stoixei=a th=s f. Corp.Herm.1.8; ai( du/o f., i.e. heaven and earth, light and darkness, etc., PMag.Leid.W.6.42. Pythag. name for
two, Theol.Ar.12. as a concrete term,
creature, freq. in collect. sense, qnhth\ f. man
kind, S.Fr.590 (anap.), cf. OT869 (lyr.); po/ntou ei)nali/a f. the
creatures of the sea, Id.Ant.345 (lyr.); o(\ pa=sa f. diw/kein pe/fuke Pl.R.359c, cf. Plt.272c; h( tw=n qhleiw=n f. woman-
kind (opp. to\ a)/rren fu=lon) X.Lac.3.4: also in pl., S.OT674, Pl.R.588c, Plt.306e, X.Oec.13.9; in contemptuous sense, ai( toiau=tai f. such
creatures as these, Isoc.4.113, cf. 20.11, Aeschin.1.191. of plants or material
substances, f. eu)w/deis karpoforou=sai D.S.2.49; u(gra/n tina f. kapno\n a)podidou=san Corp.Herm. 1.4.
kind, sort, species, tau/thn . . e)/xein bioth=s . . fu/sin S.Ph.165 (anap.); e)kle/gontai e)k tou/twn xrhma/twn mi/an f. th\n tw=n leukw=n Pl.R. 429d; f. [a)lwpeki/dwn]
species, X.Cyn.3.1;
natural group or
class of plants, Thphr.HP6.1.1 (pl.).
sex, qh=lus fu=sa (prob. for ou)=sa） kou)k a)ndro\s fu/sin S.Tr.1062, cf. OC445, Th.2.45, Pl.Lg.770d, 944d: hence,
the characteristic of sex, = ai)doi=on, Tab.Defix.89a6 (iv B.C.), Nic.Fr.107, D.S.32.10, S.E.M.1.150, etc.: esp. of the female organ, Hp.Mul.2.143, Ant.Lib.41, Artem.5.63, PMag.Osl.1.83,324, Horap. 1.11: pl., tw=n du/of., of the testes, Sch.Ar.Lys.92, cf. PMag.Par.1.318.

fu^si/-wma, atos, to/,
natural tendency, bent, Hipparch. ap.Stob.4.44.81 (pl.).

fu^si/-wsis, ews, h(,
natural tendency, character, [nou/swn] Aret.CD1.1; f. kai\ zwh/ Porph.Abst.1.29.

fu_si/wsis, ews, h(,
inflation, [Gal.]14.386 (pl.): metaph.,
being puffed up, pride, 2 Ep.Cor.12.20 (pl.).

fu/skh, h(, (fusa/w)
the large intestine, esp. as
stuffed with pudding, sausage, black-pudding, gen. fu/skhs Ar.Eq.364, Pherecr.45; pl. fu/skai Cratin.164 (troch.); nom. sg. fu/skh Eub.63.6 (anap.), Dor. fu/ska prob.a nickname, 'pot-belly', Sophr.23; acc. fu/skhn Philem. 60.2.
blister or
weal on the hand, Sch.Ar.V.1114 (nom. fu/ska).
gall-bag on a plant, Dsc.Alex.22.

fuski/a,
botellus (written
botellius), Gloss. (s.v.l.).
fu/skion, to/, Dim. of fu/skh 1, Gloss.

fu/skos, o(, =
botellus, Gloss.

fu/skwn or fuskw/n, w=nos, o(,
pot-belly, nickname given to Pittacus, Alc.37B; freq. of Ptolemy VII, J.AJ12.4.11, etc.
a throw of the dice, Poll.7.205.

fu_so/-baqron, to/, (fu=sa)
frame or
stand for bellows, Suid.

fu_so-eidh/s, e/s,
like a bladder, bladder-shaped, w)|a/ Sch.Nic.Al.293.

fu_so/omai, Pass.,
to be swollen, f.l. in Dsc.4.68.
fu/ss-a, fuss-alli/s, fuss-alo/s, fuss-hth/r, etc., incorrect forms for fu=sa, etc.

fusth/ (sc. ma=za), h(, Att. name for a kind of
light pastry or
puff, Chionid.7, AP7.736 (Leon.): in full, f. ma=za Ar.V.610 (anap.), Harmod.1, cf. Ath.3.114f (accented fusth= by Moer.p.384 P.: heterocl. pl. fu/sta, ta/, EM803.1).
fu/stis, f.l. in A.Pers.926 (anap., leg. pa/nu tarfu/s tis, for pa/nu ga\r fu/stis).

fusw/, ou=s, h(,
Growth, personified, Emp.123.

fu_sw/dhs, es, (fu=sa)
full of wind, windy, to\ f. Pl.Cra.427a: metaph.,
bombastic, Longin.28.1.
flatulent, causing flatulency, Hp.Acut.50, Arist.HA522b32, 588a7, Sor.2.85; f. nosh/mata Arist. HA605a23.

fu^ta^gwge/w,
raise a plant, in Pass., EM686.30.

fu^ta^lia/ [u_ metri gr. in Ep.], -ia=s, Ion. fuss-ih/, -ih=s, h(, （futo/n)
planted place, esp.
orchard or
vineyard, opp. corn-land, Il.6.195, 12.314, 20.185, IG11(2).161A14 (Delos, iii B. C.), Jul.Or.3.125a.
plant, h( i)di/a f. (of Athena, i.e. olive) Call.Lav.Pall.26; also of the
vine, AP6.44 (Leon. (?)); f. kala/mou ib.7.714.
planting-time, i.e. the latter part of winter, Hp.Hebd.4, Gal.17(1).18.
planting, f. karpoi=o A.R.2.1003.
fu^ta^li/zw, = futeu/w, Hsch.
fu^ta/lios [a^], on, = sq., qeoi/ Poll.1.24; of Poseidon, Corn.ND22; *zeu/s Orph.H.15.9 [u_ metri gr.]

fu^ta/lmios, on, also a, on Lyc.341: (fu/w):—
producing, nourishing, fostering, epith. of gods, as of Poseidon, Clara Rhodos 6/7.386 (Camirus, iii/ii B. C.), Plu.2.158e, IG22.5051, 12(1).905 (Rhodes), etc.; of Zeus, Hsch., cf. IG12(5).13（Ios); of parents, futa/lmioi ge/rontes A.Ag.327; mhtri\ kai\ f. patri/ S.Fr.788; le/ktra f.
the marriage bed, E.Rh.920; f. xqw/n Lyc.l.c.: to\ f.
productive power, Plu.2.994b.
by birth, a)law=n o)mma/twn a)=ra kai\ h)=sqa futa/lmios; didst thou
bring blind eyes with thee
to life? S.OC151 (lyr.). (futa/lmios is said by EM803.4. to be formed by metath. from futa/limos, which is prob. coined
ad hoc.）
fu^t-a^ri/dion, to/, Dim. of sq., dub. in Gloss.
fu^t-a/rion, to/, Dim. of futo/n, Ar.Byz.Epit.90.19, Ath.5.210c, Sch.Ar.Av.663, etc.

fu^t-a/s, a/dos, h(,
plant, f. ne/a Plu.2.411d.

fu^t-ei/a, h(,
planting, X.Oec.7.20, 19.1, PSI4.433.5 (iii B. C.), etc.: pl., X.Oec.19.12, Thphr.HP2.5.1.
generation, production, Pl.Thg.121c.
growth, habit of a plant, Thphr.HP3.8.4.
plantation or simply
a plant, Moschio ap.Ath.5.207d, Ev.Matt.15.13, OGI606.7 (Abila, i A. D.).

fu^/t-eiron, to/, =
panucla, Gloss.

fu^/t-euma, atos, to/,
that which is planted, plant, Pi.O.3.18, Pl.Lg.761b: metaph., A.Fr.99.10, S.OC 698 (lyr.), cf. Poll.3.12.
Montpellier rocket, Reseda Phyteuma, Dsc.4.128, Plin.HN27.125.

fu^t-eu/simos, on,
fit for planting or
for rearing trees, D.S.1.36.
fu^/t-eusis, ews, h(, = futei/a, gh=s Arist.Mu. 399b17 (pl.), cf. Hp.Hebd.4, PHal.1.81 (iii B. C.), Gp.5.6.2, al.

fu^t-eute/on,
one must plant, ib.3.3.2: neut. pl. futeute/a Poll.1.226.

fu^t-euth/rion, to/,
layer, Hp.Nat.Puer.23, X.Oec.19.13, Thphr.HP2.2.4.
nursery or
plantation, IG12.94.33, 22.2493, D.53.15 (all pl.).

fu^t-euth/s, ou=, o(, =
pastinator, Gloss.

fu^t-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for planting, h( -kh/ Poll.7.140; ta\ -ka/ Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11.
