fu^t-euto/s, h/, o/n,
planted, pa=n to\ f. Pl.R.510a.

fu^t-eu/w, Od.5.340, etc., Ep. inf. futeue/men Hes.Op.812; fut. eu/sw X.Oec.19.13; aor. e)fu/teusa Il.6.419, etc.: pf. pefu/teuka, 3pl. pefu/teukan LXX Ez.19.13:—Med., fut. -eu/somai Pi.P.4.15: aor. -eusa/mhn X.Mem.1.1.8:—Pass., fut. -euqh/somai Gp.5.19.1: aor. e)futeu/qhn X.An.5.3.12, poet.3pl. fu/teuqen Pi. P.4.69: pf. pefu/teumai Hdt.2.138, etc.: (futo/n). c. acc.
of the thing planted, plant trees, esp. fruit-trees, ou)/te futeu/ousin xersi\n futo\n ou)/t' a)ro/wsin Od.9.108; de/ndrea f. 18.359, cf. Alc.44, etc.; a)/lsos pefuteume/non Hdt. l.c.; suka=s Ar.Fr.108 (troch.); o)/rxous, a)mpe/lous, X.Oec.20.3,4; joined with spei/rw, ib.11.16, Mem.2.1.13, Pl. Phdr.276e; futei/an Ev.Matt.15.13; a)rw/menai h)de\ f. Hes.Op.22; f. e)n gh=| X.Oec.19.2; e)n a)fo/rw| ib.20.3; ei)s gh=n Plu.2.986f; f. a)po\ koru/nhs Gp.10.8.1:—Med.,
plant for oneself, Pi.P.4.15, Luc.Cat.20:— Pass., de/ndra pefuteume/na, opp. to those of spontaneous growth, D.55.13. metaph.,
beget, engender, Hes.Op.812, Sc.29, Hdt.4.145, Pi.N.7.84, etc.; futeu/wn pai=das E.Alc.662, cf. Or.11, Ar.V. 1133, Pl.Cri.50d; o( futeu/sas path/r S.OT793, 1514, E.IA1177 (s. v.l.); o( futeu/sas alone, the
father, S.Ph.904, Tr.1244; o( f. au)to/n E.Andr.49, etc.: opp. h( tekou=sa, Lys.11.4 (rarely of the mother, se\ . . fu/teusen *ai)/qra *poseida=ni B.16.59); oi( futeu/santes the
parents, S. OT1007, OC1377; tou\s teko/ntas kai\ fut. Id.Fr.64, cf. E.Supp.1092: metaph., u(/bris futeu/ei tu/rannon S.OT873 (lyr.); *mou/sas le/gousi *(armoni/an futeu=sai E.Med.832 (lyr.):—Pass.,
to be begotten, spring from parents, kei/nwn Pi.P.4.144; e)k *kro/nou Id.N.5.7; tou= kakou= po/tmou futeuqei/s S.OC1324. generally,
produce, bring about, cause, mostly of evils, o(/ti toi kaka\ polla\ futeu/ei Od.5.340; pri\n h(mi=n ph=ma futeu=sai 4.668 (v.l.); fo/non kai\ kh=ra f. 2.165, 17.82; once in Il., kako\n me/ga pa=si f. 15.134; fu/teue/ oi( qa/naton Pi.N.4.59; f. ph=ma S.Aj.953; also in good sense, f. ga/mon, do/can, Pi.P.9.111, I.6 (5).12; *mi/nwi+ tima/n B.16.68; kade/wn a)na/pausin Id.18.35:—Pass., su\n qew=| futeuqei/s o)/lbos Pi.N.8.17.
implant in, tou=q' h(mi=n Pl. Ti.80e; ti ei)/s ti Id.Phdr.248d.
set up, a)/galma e)n tw=| oi)/kw| Iamb.VP18.84. less freq. c. acc.
of the ground planted, plant with fruit-trees, f. gh=n Th.1.2; xwri/on f. kai\ gewrgei=n Is.9.28: abs., Eup.13, Philem.116:—Med., a)gro/n f. X.Mem.1.1.8:—Pass., gh= pefuteume/nh Hdt.4.127, cf. X.HG3.2.10; opp. yilh/, Eup.230, D.20.115; ta\ pefuteume/na PHal.1.102 (iii B.C.), etc.; gewrgi/a kai\ yilh\ kai\ pef. Arist.Pol.1259a2.

fu^thkom-e/w,
take care of plants, garden, Opp.C.1.122, Lib.Decl. 40.67.
produce plants (i.e. vines), Opp.C.4.254.

fu^thkom-i/a, h(,
care of vines, in pl., Id.H.1.309, C.4.331, Nonn.D.47.72.

fu^th/kom-os (parox.), o(,
gardener, vine-dresser, Lib.Decl.40.72.

fu^tiai=os, a, on,
of plants, o)/rxoi IG22.2493.27 (iv B. C.).

fu^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
belonging to plants, to\ f. the
vegetative principle, Arist.EN1102b29; f. zwh/ Porph.Gaur.3.2; peri\ f. ai)tiw=n, title of treatise by Thphr. Adv. -kw=s, zh=n Porph.Gaur.1.1. f. zw=|on, = zwo/futon, Arist.PA681a33.

fu/tios [u^], on, also a, on, (fu/w)
generative, epith. of *(/hlios, *zeu/s, Hsch.; of Leto at Phaestus, Ant.Lib.17: hence as pr. n., Hecat.15J.

fu/tlh, h(, poet. word,
stock, generation, race, Pi.O.9.55, P.9.33, Orph.A.430, Besant.Ara9. late word for fu/sis, AP7.744 (D.L.).

fu/tlon [u^], to/,
plant, Epigr.Gr.1036.4 (Nicomedia).
fu^to-ba^si/leion [i^], to/, = zw|o/nuxon ( = kh=mos), Ps.-Dsc.4.133.

fu^to-eidw=s, Adv.
after the fashion of plants, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.43.
fu^to-ergo/s, o/n, poet. for futourgo/s, D.P.997, AP9.4 (Cyllen.).
fu^tokom-e/w, = futhkome/w, Eust.1616.31.
fu^toko/m-ia, h(, = futhkomi/a, Gp.Prooem.7.

fu^to/n, to/, (fu/w)
plant (opp. zw=|on, Diog.Apoll.2, Pl.Phd.70d, R. 532b, Lg.889c), esp.
garden plant or
tree, futw=n o)/rxatoi Il.14.123; to\n me\n e)gw\ qre/yasa futo\n w(\s gounw=| a)lwh=s 18.57, cf. Hes.Op.571, Pi.P. 9.58 (pl.), A.Eu.940 (lyr., pl.), E.Heracl.281(pl.), etc.; futa\ a)krodru/wn D.53.15; a)mpe/lwn Thphr.CP1.12.9; f. e)/ggeia Pl.R.546a; ta\ e)k gh=s f. Id.Ti.60a: prov., au)ti/ka kai\ futa\ dh=la a(\ me/llei ka/rpim' e)/sesqai Lib.Ep.32.3.
sucker, slip, Arist.Mir.834a16. = kuno/glwsson, Ps.-Dsc.4.127. generally,
creature, A.Supp. 281, etc.; gunai=kes . . a)qliw/taton f. (collective) most miserable
creatures, E.Med.231; ei)=t' ou) peri/ergo/n e)stin a)/nqrwpos f.; Alex.141.1; kako\n f. pe/fuken . . gunh/ Men.Mon.304; also in Pl., e)me\ kai\ se\ kai\ ta)=lla f. Sph.233e; swma/twn kai\ tw=n a)/llwn f. Id.R.401a.
offspring, *xari/twn futo/n Theoc.28.7; futo\n ou)ra/nion
plant rooted in the sky, i.e. man, Pl.Ti.90a, cf. AP10.45 (Pall.(?)). exceptionally, of iron, kako\n f. Call. in PSI9.1092.49.

fu^to/omai, Pass.,
grow into a vegetative creature, opp. brefou=sqai, Theol.Ar.6.

fu^to/s, h/, o/n, (fu/w) of a wooden statue,
shaped by nature, without art, Pi.P.5.42; pu/alon . . foith/n (sic) SIG1231.8 (Bithynia, iii/iv A. D.).
fruitful, pedi/on LXXEz.17.5.

fu^toska^fi/a, poet. fu^tokom-i/h, h(,
gardening, APl.4.202.

fu^toska/fos [a^], on,
digging round plants, f. a)nh/r
gardener, Theoc.24.138, cf. 25.27, A.R.1.1172, AP6.102 (Phil.). proparox. futo/ska^fos,
dug or
prepared for plants, gh= EM803.13.

fu^tospor-i/a, h(,
planting of trees, esp.
of vines, Man.4.433.

fu^to/spor-os (parox.), on,
planting: generative, a)lkh/ Orph.Fr.274: metaph.,
begetting, o( f.
father, S.Tr.359; futospo/roi, oi(,
ancestors, hence metaph.,
predecessors, Vett.Val.239.10: c. gen., ge/nous f. Ar.Byz.Arg.S.OT

fu^totrof-e/omai, Pass.,
to be trained, of vines, Diotog. ap. Stob. 4.1.96.

fu^totrof-i/a, h(,
rearing of plants or
trees, gardening, Gp.9.5.11.

fu^to/trof-os (parox.), on,
rearing plants or
trees, A.R.3.1403; gh= Gp.5.12.4.

fu^tourg-ei=on, to/,
nursery-garden, D.S.2.10,13; vulg., futou/rgion, as in Gloss.

fu^tourg-e/w,
do gardener's work, Luc.
Bis Acc.1.

fu^tou/rg-hma, atos, to/,
care of plants, planting, Poll.7.140.

fu^tourg-i/a, h(,
cultivation of plants, gardening, Thphr.CP3.7.5, D.S.20.8 (pl.), Str.11.5.1.
plantation, Id.3.2.3 (pl.).

fu^tourg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
skilled in gardening: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), = futourgi/a,
gardening, Poll.7.140. Adv. -kw=s ib. 141.

fu^tourg-o/s, o/n,
tending plants or
trees, f. de/ndrwn Secund.Sent.16: as Subst.,
planter, gardener, f. i(eroi\ *)apo/llwnos SIG22 (Epist.Darei), cf. APl.4.255, Plu.2.2b. metaph.,
begetting, generating, path\r f. A.Supp.592 (lyr.); tou= f. patro/s S.OT1482; o( f. (without path/r) E.Tr.481; futourgo\s *qe/tidos Id.IA949; in later Prose, pate/ra kai\ f. Jul.Or.2.83a.
creator, author, Pl.R.597d.

fu^tou/rion, to/, =
seminarium, Gloss.; cf. futw/rion.

fu^to-fo/ros, on,
bearing plants, gh= Eust.636.17.

fu^to-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
keeper of plants, PRein.54.5 (iii/iv A. D.).
fu/tra, h(, = fu/tlh, fu/sis, Hsch.

fu^t-w/dhs, es,
like a plant, Erot. s.v. e)kxloiou/mena (e)gx- codd.).

fu^t-w/n, w=nos, o(,
place planted, esp.
vineyard, Hdn.Epim.146.

fu^t-w/nu^mos, on,
named from a plant or
tree, AP14.34, Ach.Tat.2.14.

fu^/t-wr, oros, o(,
father, Sch.rec.A.Pr.233, Hsch.; cj. Dind. for to\n fu/sant' in S.Tr.1032 (hex.).

fu^t-w/rion, to/,
nursery, Gp.5.3.1, al.; cf. futou/rion.

fu/w, Il.6.148, etc.; Aeol. fui/w fort. leg. in Alc.97: impf. e)/fuon, Ep.3sg. fu/en Il.14.347: fut. fu/sw [u_] 1.235, S.OT438: aor. e)/fu_sa Od.10.393, etc.:—Pass. and Med., 9.109, Pi.O.4.28, etc.: fut. fu/somai A.Pr.871, Hp.Mochl.42, Pl.Lg.831a, etc.: similar in sense are the intr. tenses, pf. pe/fu_ka Od.7.114, etc., Ep.3pl. pefu/a_si Il.4.484, Od.7.128; 3sg. subj. pefu/h| （e)m-) Thgn.396; Ep. part. fem. pefuui=a （e)m-) Il.1.513, acc. pl. pefuw=tas Od.5.477; Dor. inf. pefu/kein Epich.173.3: plpf. e)pefu/kein X.Cyr.5.1.9, Pl.Ti. 69e; Ep. pefu/kein Il.4.109; Ep. 3pl. e)pe/fu_kon Hes.Th.152, Op.149: aor. 2 e)/fu_n (as if from fu=mi) Od.10.397, etc.: Ep. 3sg. fu= Il.6.253, etc., 3pl. e)/fun (for e)/fu_san, which is also 3pl. of aor. 1) Od.5.481, etc.; subj. fu/w or fuw= E.Fr.377.2, Pl.R.415c, 597c, Hp.Carn.12; 3sg. opt. fu/h Theoc.15.94, (sum-) Sor.2.89; inf. fu=nai, Ep. fu/menai Theoc. 25.39, fu=n Parm.8.10; part. fu/s Od.18.410, etc., Boeot. fem. fou=sa Corinn.21: e)/fusen, = e)/fu, dub. in IG14.2126.5 (Rome); conversely e)/fu, = e)/fusen, ib.3.1350, Sammelb.5883 (Cyrene): later, fut. fuh/sw LXXIs.37.31, Pass. fuh/somai Gp.2.37.1, Them.Or.21.248c (in Luc. JTr.19 a)nafu/sesqai is restored): aor. 2 Pass. e)fu/hn J.AJ18.1.1, prob. in BSA28.124 (Didyma), (a)n-) Thphr.HP4.16.2; inf. fuh=nai Dsc.2.6, (a)na-) D.S.1.7; part. fu^ei/s Hp.Nat.Puer.22, Trag.Adesp. 529, PTeb.787.30 (ii B. C.), Ev.Luc.8.6: aor. 1 Pass. sum-fuqei/s Gal. 7.725. [Generally u^ before a vowel, Ep., Trag. (A.Th.535, S.Fr. 910.2), etc., u_ before a consonant; but fu_/ei Trag.Adesp.454.2, fu_/etai S.Fr.88.4, Trag.Adesp.543 ( = Men.565); fu_/omen Ar.Av.106; e)fu_/eto prob. in Ar.Fr.680, cf. Nic.Al.14, D.P.941, 1013; even in thesi, prosfu_/ontai Nic.Al.506, fu_/ousin D.P.1031; also in compds.] trans., in pres., fut., and aor. 1 Act.:—
bring forth, produce, put forth, fu/lla . . u(/lh thleqo/wsa fu/ei Il.6.148; toi=si d' u(po\ xqw\n di=a fu/en neoqhle/a poi/hn 14.347, cf. 1.235, Od.7.119, etc.; a)/mpelon fu/ei brotoi=s E.Ba.651; so tri/xes . . , a(\s pri\n e)/fusen fa/rmakon
made the hair
grow, Od.10.393, cf. A.Th.535; f. xei=re, po/de, o)fqalma\ a)nqrw/pois X.Mem.2.3.19; of a country, karpo/n te qwmasto\n fu/ein kai\ a)/ndras a)gaqou/s Hdt.9.122; o(/sa gh= fu/ei Pl.R.621a, cf. Anaxag.4.
beget, engender, E.Ph.869, etc.; *)/atlas . . qew=n mia=s e)/fuse *mai=an E. Ion3, cf. Trag.Adesp.454.2; so of God
creating man, Antipho 4.1.2, cf. Plu.2.1065c; o( fu/sas the
begetter, father (opp. o( fu/s the
son, v. infr. B.1.2), S.OT1019, Ar.V.1472 (lyr.); o( f. path/r E.Hel.87; o( f. xh) tekou=sa Id.Alc.290; th\n tekou=san h)\ to\n fu/santa Lys.10.8; of both parents, goneu=si oi(/ s' e)/fusan S.OT436; oi( fu/santes E.Ph.34, cf. Fr. 403.2; f. te kai\ genna=n Pl.Plt.274a; w)= ga/moi ga/moi, e)fu/saq' h(ma=s S.OT 1404; h(/d' h(me/ra fu/sei se
will bring to light thy
birth, ib.438; xro/nos fu/ei t' a)/dhla kai\ fane/nta kru/ptetai Id.Aj.647. of individuals in reference to the growth of parts of themselves, f. pw/gwna, glw=ssan, ke/rea,
grow or
get a beard, etc., Hdt.8.104, 2.68, 4.29; f. ptera/ Ar. Av.106, Pl.Phdr.251c; sa/rka Id.Ti.74e; f. tri/xas, po/das kai\ ptera/, etc., Arist.HA518a33, 554a29, etc.: for the joke in fu/ein fra/teras, v. fra/thr. metaph., fre/nas fu=sai
get understanding, S.OC 804, El.1463 (but also qeoi\ fu/ousin a)nqrw/pois fre/nas Id.Ant.683): prov., a(lieu\s plhgei\s nou=n fu/sei 'once bit, twice shy', Sch.Pl.Smp. 222b; ge/ronta to\n nou=n sa/rka d' h(bw=san fu/ei A.Th.622; do/can fu=sai
get glory or
to form a high opinion of oneself, Hdt.5.91; qeo\s . . ai)ti/an fu/ei brotoi=s A.Niob.in PSI11.1208.15; au(tw=| po/nous fu=sai S. Ant.647. in pres. seemingly intr.,
put forth shoots, ei)s e)/tos a)/llo fu/onti Mosch.3.101; dru/es . . fu/onti Theoc.7.75, cf. 4.24: so a)ndrw=n geneh\ h( me\n fu/ei h( d' a)polh/gei one generation
is putting forth scions, the other is ceasing to do so, Il.6.149; e)n sth/qesi fu/ei (fort. fui/ei)
grows up, appears, Alc.97; r(i/za a)/nw fu/ousa e)n xolh=| LXXDe. 29.18. Pass., with intr. tenses of Act., aor. 2, pf. and plpf.,
grow, wax, spring up or
forth, esp. of the vegetable world, qa/mnos e)/fu e)lai/hs Od.23.190, cf. 5.481; prasiai\ pantoi=ai pefu/asin 7.128; ta/ g' a)/sparta fu/ontai 9.109, cf. Il.4.483, 14.288, 21.352; fu/etai au)to/mata r(o/da Hdt.8.138, cf. 1.193; u(po\ fhgw=| pefukui/h|
growing there, Id.2.56; pefuko/ta de/ndra trees
growing there, X.Cyr.4.3.5; ta\ fuo/mena kai\ ta\ gigno/mena Pl.Cra.410d, cf. Phd.110d, Plt.272a; tou= ke/ra e)k kefalh=s e(kkaideka/dwra pefu/kei from his head
grew horns sixteen palms long, Il.4.109, cf. Hdt.1.108, 3.133; fu/ontai poliai/ Pi.O.4.28; kefalai\ pefukui=ai qrici/
grown with hair, D.S.2.50 (s. v.l.); pe/fuke li/qos e)n au)th=|
is produced, X.Vect.1.4: metaph., no/shma e)n o)ligarxi/a| fuo/menon, fuome/nh po/lis, Pl.R.564b, Lg.757d; o( spe/rma parasxw/n, ou(=tos tw=n fu/ntwn ai)/tios [kakw=n]
of the things produced, D.18.159; also kata\ pa/ntwn e)fu/eto
waxed great by or
upon their depression, ib. 19. —In this sense aor. 2 is rare (v. supr.), exc. in phrases such as e)/n t' a)/ra oi( fu= xeiri/ (v. e)mfu/w), Od.2.302. of persons,
to be begotten or
born, most freq. in aor. 2 and pf., o( lwfh/swn ou) pe/fuke/ pw A.Pr. 27; ti/s a)\n eu)/caito broto\s w)\n a)sinei= dai/moni fu=nai; Id.Ag.1342 (anap.); mh\ fu=nai to\n a(/panta nika=| lo/gon not
to be born is best, S.OC1224 (lyr.); gonh=| pefukw\s . . geraite/ra| ib.1294; ou)x u(po\ qusiw=n ou)d' u(po\ eu)xw=n fu/s Pl.R.461a; fu/s te kai\ trafei/s ib.396c; mh/pw fu=nai mhde\ gene/sqai X.Cyr.5.1.7, cf. Pl.Smp.197a: construed with gen., pefmke/nai or fu=nai/ tinos
to be born or
descended from any one, to\ koino\n spla/gxnon ou(= pefu/kamen A.Th.1036, cf. S.OC1379, etc.; qnata=s a)po\ matro\s e)/fu Pi.Fr.61, cf. S.OT1359 (lyr.), Ant.562; a)p' eu)genou=s r(i/zhs E.IT610; a)po\ druo/s Pl.Ap.34d, etc.; f. e)/k tinos S.OT 458, E.Heracl.325, Pl.R.415c, etc.; e)k xw/ras tino/s Isoc.4.24, etc.; oi( met' e)kei/nou fu/ntes, opp. oi( e)c e)kei/nou gegono/tes, Is.8.30; e)k qew=n gegono/ti . . dia\ basile/wn pefuko/ti X.Cyr.7.2.24. in pres.,
become, ou)dei\s e)xqro\s ou)/te fu/etai pro\s xrh/maq' oi(/ te fu/ntes . . S.Fr. 88.4; pistou\s fu/sei fu/esqai X.Cyr.8.7.13; the pf. and aor. 2 take a pres. sense,
to be so and so
by nature, kako/s, sofo/s pe/fuka （-kw/s), etc., S.Ph.558, 1244, etc.; dra=n e)/fun a)mh/xanos Id.Ant.79; fu/nt' a)reta=|
born for virtue, i.e. brave and good
by nature, Pi.O.10(11).20; so of things, to\ me\n eu)= pra/ssein a)ko/reston e)/fu A.Ag.1331 (anap.), cf. Pl.Grg.479d, etc.; eu)xrow/teroi o(rw=|nto h)\ pefu/kasin X.Cyr.8.1.41, cf. Oec.10.2; [to\ pu=r] pe/fuke toiou=ton Id.Cyr.5.1.10; ta)/lla e(/kastos h(mw=n, o(/pws e)/tuxe, pe/fuken D.37.56: with Advs., i(kanw=s pefuko/tes
of good
natural ability, Antipho 2.1.1; dusko/lws pef. Isoc.9.6; ou(/tws pef. X.HG7.1.7; also oi( kalw=s pefuko/tes S.El.989, cf. Lys.2.20; oi( be/ltista fu/ntes Pl.R.431c: then, simply,
to be so and so, fu=nai *zhni\ pisto\n a)/ggelon A.Pr.969; qeou= mh/thr e)/fus Id.Pers.157 (troch.); gunai=ke . . e)/fumen S.Ant.62; *(/aidhs o( pau/swn e)/fu ib.575; a(plou=s o( mu=qos th=s a)lhqei/as e)/fu E.Ph.469: c. part., nika=n . . xrh/|zwn e)/fun S.Ph. 1052; pre/pwn e)/fus . . fwnei=n Id.OT9, cf. 587; tou=to i)/dion e)/fumen e)/xontes Isoc.4.48, cf. 11.41, X.Smp.4.54. c. inf.,
to be formed or
disposed by nature to do so and so, ta\ deu/tera pe/fuke kratei=n Pi.Fr.279; pollw=| g' a)mei/nwn tou\s pe/las frenou=n e)/fus h)\ sauto/n A.Pr.337; e)/fun ga\r ou)de\n e)k te/xnhs pra/ssein kakh=s S.Ph.88, cf. Ant.688; fu/sei mh\ pefuko/ta toiau=ta fwnei=n Id.Ph.79; pefu/kasi d' a(/pantes . . a(marta/nein Th.3.45, cf. 2.64, 3.39, 4.61, etc.; pe/fuke . . trufh\ . . h)=qos diafqei/rein Jul.Or.1.15c. with Preps., gunh\ . . e)pi\
dakru/ois e)/fu
is by nature prone to tears, E.Med.928; e)/rws ga\r a)rgo/n, ka)pi\ toi=s a)rgoi=s e)/fu
is inclined to idleness, Id.Fr.322; also e)pi/ ti Pl.R.507e; ei)/s ti Aeschin.3.132; most freq. pro/s ti, oi( a)/nqrwpoi pro\s to\ a)lhqe\s pefu/kasi Arist.Rh.1355a16; eu)= pro\s a)reth\n pefuko/tes X. Mem.4.1.2; pro\s po/lemon ma=llon . . h)\ pro\s ei)rh/nhn Pl.R.547e; ka/llista f. pro/s ti X.HG7.1.3, etc.; also pro/s tini Id.Ath.2.19 (s. v.l., cf. Plb.9.29.10); also eu)= pef. kata/ ti D.37.55. c. dat.,
fall to one
by nature, be one's
natural lot, pa=si qnatoi=s e)/fu mo/ros S.El. 860 (lyr.); xai/rein pe/fuken ou)xi\ toi=s au)toi=s a)ei/ Id.Tr.440; e)fu/eto koino\s pa=si ki/ndunos D.60.18, cf. X.Cyr.4.3.19. impers.,
it is natural, it happens naturally, c. inf., D.14.30, Arist.Pol.1261b7, Po. 1450a1. abs., w(s pe/fuke as
is natural, X.Cyn.6.15, al.; h(=| pe/fuken Pl.Ti.81e; also expressed personally, toi=s a(plw=s, w(s pefukasi, badi/zousi D.45.68: also freq. in part., ta\ fu/sei pefuko/ta the order of
nature, Lys.2.29; fu/nta, opp. o(mologhqe/nta, Antipho Soph. 44Ai 32 (Vorsokr.5); a)/nqrwpos pefukw/s man
as he is, X.Cyr.1.1.3. (Cf. Skt.
bhū- 'to be, become', Lith.
búti 'to be', Lat.
fui, Eng.
be, etc.)
fw=|, shortd. dat. of fw=s, E.Fr.534.
fw/ga^non, to/, = fru/getron in the *koinh/, Poll.10.109.

fw/gw, imperat. fw=ge Epich.151; fw/|zw Stratt.65, cf. Hp.Vict.2.56; also fwgnu/w (Valck. for fwgu/nw) Suid.; inf. fwgnu/nai (as if fr. fw/gnumi) Eust.962.50, EM803.32 (so in Pass. 3sg. fw/gnutai Dsc. 1.68, 4.64): aor. e)/fwca Hp.Mul.1.78, Nic.Al.607, but e)/fwsa Hp.Mul. 2.113, Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.7.1:—Pass., aor. e)fw/xqhn Dsc.2.97, Aret. CA1.10, (pro-) Dsc.2.90: pf. pe/fwgmai Pherecr.68; pe/fwsmai Hp. Epid.7.80, Morb.2.64, Iatrocl. ap. Ath.14.647c, Gp.6.6.2:—
roast, toast, parch, ll.cc.; i)sxa/des pefwgme/nai (v.l. pefrugme/nai) Pherecr.l.c. (Cf. ONorse
baka, Engl.
bake.）

fwi/+s, i/+dos, h(, contr. fw/|s, fw|do/s, only found in pl. fwi/+des, fw=|des (erroneously written foi=des in Arist.Pr.967a27), gen. fw/|dwn (Hdn. Gr.2.342):—
blister on the skin, caused by a burn, Hippon.59, Ar. Pl.535 (anap.), Fr.345, Hp.Morb.2.54, Diocl.Fr.80.

fw/kaia, h(,
Phocaea, h.Ap.35, Hdt.1.80, etc.:—fwkah=qen, Adv.
from Ph., Luc.Lex.7:—hence fwkaieu/s, Att. fwka_eu/s, o(,
Phocaean, Hdt.1.163, Th.1.13, etc.; also fwkai+ko/s, h/, o/n, o)bolo/s IG11(2).161B21 (Delos, iii B. C.); stath=re ib.22.1388A42; stath=res *fwkaei=s, v. stath/r:—fem. fwkai/+s, i/+dos, Ael.VH12.1, St.Byz. s.v. *fw/kaia; fwkai/+des e(/ktai xrusi/ou, of coins, IG12.310.105, cf. 22.1382.18; *fwkai/+s alone, IG11(2).161A4, al. (Delos, iii B. C.): Dim. fwkaii/dion, to/, Inscr.Délos 1429 Bi68 (ii B. C.); fwkai/+dion, ib. 1432 Abii 41 (ii B. C.).

fw/kaina, h(,
porpoise, Delphinus phocaena, Arist.HA566b9, 598b1.

fwkarx-e/w,
hold office of *fwka/rxhs, IG9(1).99 (Elatea).

fwka/rx-hs, ou, o(,
one of the chief officials of the Phocian city league, ib.97, 101 (ibid.).

fw/keios, a, on,
of seals, de/rmata Lyd.Ost.45, cf. Cyran.77.

fwkeu/s, e/ws, o(,
Phocian, Ep. gen. pl. *fwkh/wn Il.2.517, al.; nom. pl. *fwke/es Hdt.1.146, *fwkh=s S.El.1107, 1442, Th.2.9; gen. *fwke/wn A.Pers.485, etc. fwki/s (sc. gh=), i/dos, h(,
Phocis, X.HG3.5.4, etc.; as Adj.,
Phocian, gh=, xqw/n, S.OT733, E.IA261 (lyr.); o(do/s Id.Ph.38; glw=ssa A.Ch.564. Adj. fwkiko/s, h/, o/n,
Phocian, po/lemos D.2.7, etc.

fw/kh, h(,
seal, esp.
Phoca monachus, f. ne/podes kalh=s a(losu/dnhs Od.4.404; f. zatrefe/es ib.451, cf. Ar.V.1035, Pax758 (both anap.); e)sqh=ti xra=sqai fwke/wn de/rmasi Hdt.1.202.

fwki/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
pear, Thphr.CP2.15.2, Androt.(?) ap. Ath.14.650e. a kind of
fish, Gal.1.551 (v.l. foki/s: fuki/s cj. Helmreich).

fwki/wn, onos, o(, a kind of
bird, Hsch. fw=kos, o(, = fw/kaina, Id.

fwkto/s, h/, o/n, (fw/gw)
roasted, broiled, Nic.Fr.68, Dsc.Eup.2.39: fw=ktai, ai(, as Subst., of barley-cakes, Luc.Lex.3.
fwl-a/zw, = fwleu/w, Hsch.

fwl-a/s, a/dos, h(,
lurking in a hole, a)raxnai/h, si/lfh, AP9.233 (Eryc.), 251 (Even.), etc.: of the bear,
lying torpid in its cave, Theoc.1.115, Hymn.Is.46; metaph., of a
shy maiden (opp. po/rnh）, fwla/da parqenikh/n AP11.34 (Phld.); a)gku/ras fwla/das, of anchors
buried in the sand, ib.10.2 (Antip.Sid.). as Subst., a mollusc
that makes holes in stones, Lithodomus, Ath. 3.88a: Hsch. has fwlai/+des, from a confusion of fwla/des and fwli/des.
full of holes or
lurking places, pe/trh Nonn.D.1.163; u(/lh 6.270, 22.116; e)/kqore fwla/dos koi/ths, of a lion, Babr.82.3. fwla/s: ei)=dos no/sou (i.e. = fwlei/a 1), Suid.
fwl-ea/, h(, = fwleo/s, Arist.Mir.835b21; incorrectly used for kalia/, Thom.Mag. p.195 R.

fwl-ei/a, or fwl-i/a, h(,
life in a hole or
cave, of
the hibernation of bears, Arist.HA600b18, Thphr.Od.63 (pl.), Ael.NA6.3; to\ pa/qos o(\ kalou=si f. Plu.2.971d. of fishes, Thphr.Fr.171.7 (pl.).

fwl-eo/s, o(, Ep. gen. fwleioi=o Opp.H.2.249, heterocl. pl. fwlea/ Nic.Fr.83, Ep. dat. fwleioi=s Id.Th.79, Opp.C.2.578, al.:—
den, lair, esp. of
the caves of bears, in which they hibernate, Plu.2.169e; of lions, Babr.106.2; of molluscs, Arist.HA622b4; of a serpent, Luc. Philops.11; of foxes, Ev.Matt.8.20, Ev.Luc.9.58; of animals in general, Sor.2.29; of cave-dwellers, Str.11.5.7, cf. Luc.VH1.37, etc.
schoolhouse, Hsch.
fw/l-eusis, ews, h(, = fwlei/a, Ael.NA 16.15 (pl.).

fwl-eute/on,
one must lie hid, lurk, Eun.VSp.476B.

fwl-eu/w,
lurk in a hole or
den, of lizards, Arist.HA503b27; of bears, ib.579a26; of hedgehogs, ibId.29; of porfu/rai, ib.547a15; of wasps and hornets, ib.628a8, 629a14; of beetles (in dung), ib.552a17; of certain birds, ib.542b21; of serpents, knw/dala fwleu/onta Theoc.24.85, cf. Nic. Th.394; of a lion, Babr.92.5; of a mouse, Id.108.2; ta\ fwleu/onta
hibernating animals, Arist.GA783b11, Thphr.HP1.1.3; of suspended animation, Arist.Fr.43; of disease,
lurk, e)n spla/gxnoisi Aret.SD1. 8, cf. 2.1; of
hidden fire, Stoic.2.187; of the womb, Hp.Ep.23.
fwl-e/w, = foreg., Arist.HA599a9, al., v.l. in Suid.

fwl-ew/dhs, es,
like a hole, xeia/ dub.l. in Plu.2.418a.

fwl-hth/r, h=ros, o(,
one who lurks in a hole or
keeps in one place, Hsch.

fwl-hth/rion, to/,
place of secret assembly, Poll.6.8.
fwl-i/a, h(, v. fwlei/a.

fwl-i/on, to/, Dim. of fwleo/s,
fox's hole, Paus.4.18.7.

fwl-i/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
fish, Arist.HA 621b8.
fwn-a/eis, v. fwnh/eis.
fwn-a/rion, to/, Dim. of fwnh/, Clearch.Com. 2, AP5.131 (Phld.).

fwnask-e/w,
train one's voice, learn to sing or
declaim, Pl.Lg. 665e, D.18.308, 19.255,336, Ph.2.537; oi( fwnaskou=ntes e(/wqe/n te kai\ nh/steis o)/ntes ta\s mele/tas poiou/menoi Arist.Pr.901b1:—Med., Plu.2.349a.
fwnask-hth/s, ou=, o(, = fwnasko/s, Gloss.

fwnask-i/a, h(,
practice of the voice, declamation, D.18.280, Thphr.HP9.9.2 (pl.), Phld.Acad.Ind. p.4 M., Sor.1.23 (pl.), Aret.CD2.6.

fwnask-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for exercising the voice, f. o)/rganon a pitch-pipe, Plu.TG2; oi( f.
voice-trainers, Pall. in Hp.2.93 D. Adv. -kw=s Arr.Epict.1.4.20.

fwnask-o/s, o( (also h(, Sor. 1.22, 2.7),
one who trains the voice, teacher of singing and declamation, IGRom.4.1432.22 (Smyrna), Arr.Epict.1.4.20, Vett.Val.7.28, Alex. Aphr.Pr.1.119; Lat.
phonascus, Suet.Aug.84, Quint.Inst.11.3.19.
fwnastikoi\ sti/xoi, dub. sens. in Diom.p.498 K.

fwn-e/w, (fwnh/)
produce a sound or
tone: prop. of men,
speak loud or
clearly, or simply,
speak, give utterance, Hom. only in aor. (pres. and impf. only in compds.); w(\s a)/ra fwnh/sas a)pe/bh Il.6.116, cf. 11.531, al.; e)/pos fa/to fw/nhse/n te Od.4.370; fwnh/sas prose/fh Il.14.41; kai/ min fwnh/sas e)/pea ptero/enta proshu/da addressed him
with a loud voice in winged words, 1.201, cf. 4.284, al.; fwnou=ntos h)\ h)xou=ntos h)\ yofou=ntos Epicur.Ep.1p.13U.; folld. by the words spoken, fw/nhse （fw/nase codd.) d', "eu(/deis, basileu=" Pi.O.13.67; xrusoi=s de\ fwnei= gra/mmasin, "prh/sw po/lin" A.Th.434, cf. Ag.1334 (anap.); oi( bouleutai\ e)fw/nhsan . . the Senators
exclaimed . . , POxy. 2110.6 (iv A. D.); "be/kos" f.
utter the word be/kos, Hdt.2.2: c. acc. cogn., o)/pa fwnhsa/shs
having made her voice
sound, Od.24.535; f. fa/tin S.El.329: with neut. Adj., f. me/giston a)nqrw/pwn
to have the loudest
voice, Hdt.4.141, 7.117; o)/rqion f. Pi.N.10.76; a)/llo ti f. A.Pr. 1063 (anap.); ta/de f. Id.Ch.314 (anap.); me/ga f. Id.Eu.936 (anap.), S.Ph.574; a)/pusta f. Id.OC489; o(/sia f. Id.Ph.662; deino\n f. ib. 1225; eu)/fhma Id.Aj.362, 591, E.IT687, etc.; mhdei\s e)/pos fwnei/tw IG22.1368.108; to\n r(hi+di/ws fwneu=nta pa=n e)/pos Anaxarch.1: abs.,
cry aloud, as in joy, S.Tr.202; of a singer, a)oido\s . . ai)o/la fwne/wn Theoc.16.44:—Pass., ta\ fwnhqe/nta
sounds or
words uttered, Pl.Sph. 262c, Ti.72a, cf. Longin.39.4. of animals,
utter their cries, Arist. HA578a32; of birds, ib.593a14; [ta\ sela/xh] fwnei=n ou)k o)rqw=s e)/xei fa/nai, yofei=n de/ ib.535b25; e)fw/nhse pe/rdic LXXJe.17.11; of the cock,
crow, Ev.Matt.26.34, al. as law-term,
affirm, testify in court, Leg.Gort.1.18, al. (written pwni/w). of a musical instrument,
sound, E.Or.146 (lyr.); of sounds, h(du\ fwnei=n
sound sweetly, Plu.2.1021b; but bronth\ f. it
has a voice, is significant, X.Ap.12. a)/fwna kai\ fwnou=nta consonants and
vowels, E.Fr.578 codd. Stob. (fort. a)/fwna fwnh/enta). c. acc. pers.,
call by name, call, *ai)/anta fwnw= I
call 'Ajax' S.Aj.73, cf. Ph.229, Ev.Matt.27.47, etc.;
call by a name, u(mei=s fwnei=te/ me "o( dida/skalos" Ev.Jo.13.13:—Pass.,
to be called, ta\ a)rxai=a e)kpw/mata kissu/bia fwne/etai Nic.Fr.1. f. tina c. inf.,
command, se\ fwnw= nekro\n . . mh\ sugkomi/zein S.Aj.1047.
invite, tou\s fi/lous Ev.Luc.14.12. c. dat. pers.,
call to, cry to, *zeu= a)/na, soi\ fwnw= S.OC1485 (lyr.), cf. OT1121; e(/rponti fwnei=s Id.Aj. 543. c. acc. rei,
speak or
tell of, prosbola\s *)erinu/wn A.Ch. 283; o(dou= te/los . . oi(=on ou)de\ fwnh=sai/ tini e)/cesq'
tell to any one, S.OC 1402; f. to\ *)epixa/rmeion
recite it, Pl.Ax.366c.

fwn-h/, h(,
sound, tone, prop.,
the sound of the voice, whether of men or animals with lungs and throat (h( fwnh\ yo/fos ti/s e)stin e)myu/xou Arist.de An.420b5, cf. 29, HA535a27, PA664b1); opp. fqo/ggos (v. fqo/ggos 11): mostly of human beings,
speech, voice, utterance, f. a)/rrhktos Il.2.490; a)teire/a f. 17.555; f. de/ oi( ai)qe/r' i(/kanen, of Ajax' battle-
cry, 15.686; of the battle-
cry of an army, *trw/wn kai\ *)axaiw=n . . f. deino\n a)u+sa/ntwn 14.400: pl., of the
cries of market-people, X.Cyr.1.2.3; o( to/nos th=s f. Id.Cyn.6.20, D.18.280, Aeschin.3.209; o)cei=a, barute/ra, lei/a, traxei=a f., Pl.Ti.67b; f. malakh/ Ar.Nu.979 (anap.); miara/, a)naidh/s, Id.Eq.218,638: with Verbs, fwnh\n r(h=cai Hdt.1.85, Ar.Nu.357 (anap.); f. i(e/nai Hdt.2.2, 4.23, Pl.Phdr.259d, etc.; f. h(/sei E.HF1295; proi/+esqai Aeschin.2.23; a)rqrou=n X.Mem.1.4.12; diarqrw/sasqai Pl.Prt.322a; e)ntei/nasqai Aeschin.2.157; f. e)parei= D.19.336; fwnh=|
with his voice, aloud, Il.3.161, Pi.P.9.29; ei)=pe th=| fwnh=| ta\ a)po/rrhta Lys.6.51; dia\ zw/shs fwnh=s Anon.Geog.Epit.1p.488M.; mia=| f.
with one
voice, Luc. Nigr.14; a)po\ fwnh=s, c. gen.,
dictated by . . , Choerob.in Thd.1.103 tit., Marin.
in Euc.Dat.p.234 M., Olymp. in Grg.p.1 N., Pall. in Hp.2.1 D.: pl., ai( f. the
notes of the voice, Pl.Grg.474e; sxh/masi kai\ fwnai=s Arist. Rh.1306a32: prov., fwnh=| o(ra=n, of a blind man, S.OC138 (anap.); pa=san, to\ lego/menon, f. i(e/nta, i.e. using every effort, Pl.Lg.890d, cf. Euthd.293a; pa/sas a)fie/nai fwna/s Id.R.475a, D.18.195; fwna\s a)prepei=s proi/+ento PTeb.802.15 (ii B. C.). the
cry of animals, as of swine, dogs, oxen, Od.10.239, 12.86,396; of asses, Hdt.4.129; of the nightingale,
song, Od.19.521; a)/nqrwpos polla\s fwna\s a)fi/hsi, ta\ de\ a)/lla mi/an Arist.Pr.895a4.
any articulate sound, opp. inarticulate noise (yo/fos）, f. kwkuma/twn S.Ant.1206; w(/sper fwnh=s ou)/shs kata\ to\n a)e/ra polla/kis kai\ lo/gou e)n th=| fwnh=| Plot.6.4.12: stoixei=o/n e)sti f. a)diai/retos Arist.Po.1456b22; also esp. of
vowelsound, opp. to that of consonants, Pl.Tht.203b, Arist.HA535a32; in literary criticism, of
sound, opp. meaning, Phld.Po.5.20 (pl.),
21. of
sounds made by inanimate objects, mostly Poet., kerki/dos f. S.Fr.595; suri/ggwn E.Tr.127 (lyr.); au)lw=n Mnesim.4.56 (anap.); rare in early Prose, o)rga/nwn fwnai/ Pl.R.397a; freq. in LXX, h( f. th=s sa/lpiggos LXX Ex.20.18; f. bronth=s ib. Ps.103(104).7; h( f. au)tou= w(s f. u(da/twn pollw=n Apoc.1.15. generally,
sound, defined as a)h\r peplhgme/nos, plhgh\ a)e/ros, Zeno Stoic.1.21, Chrysipp.ib.2.43.
faculty of speech, discourse, ei) fwnh\n la/boi S.El.548; pare/sxe fwnh\n toi=s a)fwnh/tois tina/ Id.OC1283.
language, hdt.4.114, 117; f. a)nqrwphi/+h Id.2.55; a)gnw=ta f. ba/rbaron A.Ag.1051; fwnh\n h(/somen *parnhsi/da Id.Ch.563, cf. E.Or.1397 (lyr.), Th.6.5, 7.57, X.Cyn.2.3, Pl.Ap.17d, etc.; tw=n barba/rwn pri\n maqei=n th\n f. Id.Tht.163b; kata\ th\n *)attikh\n th\n palaia\n f. Id.Cra. 398d, cf. 409e.
phrase, saying, th\n *simwni/dou f. Id.Prt. 341b; h( tou= *swkra/tous f. Plu.2.106b, cf. 330f, etc.; of
formulae, stoixeiw/mata kai\ f. Epicur.Ep.1p.4U., cf. Sent.Vat.41 (= Metrod. Fr.59); ai( skeptikai\ f. S.E.P.1.14, cf. Jul.Or.5.162b, etc.
report, rumour, LXXGe.45.16.
message, Sammelb.7252.21 (iii/iv A. D.).
loud talk, bragging, Epicur.Sent.Vat. 45.

fwn-h/eis, essa, en, contr. fwnh=s, h=ntos Cratin. in PSI11.1212.13, cf. Hdn.Gr.2.618; Aeol. and Dor. fwna/eis [a_], also in later Prose, as Zeno Stoic.1.41, Plu.Sull.7, S.E.M.1.100, etc.; contr. in pl. fwna=nta, Pi.O.2.85:—
endowed with speech, vocal, zw/|oisin e)oiko/tafwnh/essin Hes. Th.584; tou=to ga\r a)qa/naton fwna=en e(/rpei Pi.I.4(3).40(58), cf. E.Tr. 440; be/lh (i.e. e)/ph） fwna=nta sunetoi=si Pi.O.2.85; f. qe/atra Pl.Lg. 701a; o)/xlos Plu.l.c.; f. zw=|a
endowed with speech, X.Mem.2.7.13; opp. zw=|a yofhtika/, Arist.HA488a32; epith. of certain signs of the Zodiac, Vett.Val.10.19, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.166; to\ fwna=en the
power of speech, Zeno l.c.
musical, of the lyre, Sapph.45. of a song,
sounding, Pi.O.9.2.
clear, lo/gos B.14.31. ta\ fwnh/enta （fwna/onta Mélanges Beyrouth 15.71 (Syria, gem))
vowels, toi=s a)/llois fwnh/esi/ te kai\ a)fw/nois Pl.Cra.393e, cf. IG22.2783.4,17, Phld.Rh.1.163 S., etc.; in full, ta\ f. gra/mmata Aen.Tact.31.30; stoixei=a f. S.E.M.1.100.
consisting of vowels only, of a spell, PMag.Par.1.2634.

fw/n-hma, atos, to/,
sound made, utterance, S.Aj. 16, Ph.1295, Ichn.39; of a singer's
voice, D.C.61.20; of a dog's bark and ass's bray, Gal.18(1).291.
thing spoken, speech, language, S.Ph.234, OT324.

fw/n-hsis, ews, h(,
sounding, speaking, calling, Poll.2.111.

fwn-hth/rios, a, on, = fwnhtiko/s, f. o)/rgana organs
of speech, Str.14.2.28, cf. Poll.2.114; f. o)/rganon Ph.1.28.

fwn-hth/s, ou=, o(,
clear speaker, Hsch. s.v. h)pu/ta.

fwn-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
vocal, to\ f. the
faculty of speech, Zeno Stoic.1.39, D.L.7.110; ta\ f. o)/rgana Poll. 2.115, cf. Gal.2.690; f. du/namis, [ai)/sqhsis], Arr.Epict.2.23.2, Theol.Ar.49.
endowed with speech, zw=|a Corn.ND17, Porph.Abst.3.3.

fwn-hto/s, h/, o/n,
to be spoken, a(/ t' ou) fwnhta\ pro\s a)ndro/s AP6.210 (Philet.).
utterable, to\ e)/sxaton f., opp. to\ prw=ton a)kousto/n, Nicom.Harm.2.

fwn-iko/s, h/, o/n = fwnhtiko/s, Phld.Mus.p.35 K.; oi( f.
declaimers, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).213,214.
fwn-i/on, to/, Dim. of fwnh/, Arist.Aud.803b24.
fwn-i/s, i/dos, h(, = foreg., Hdn.Gr.1.94, 2.859.

fwno-bo/los, on,
causing to sound, c. gen., sa/lpiggos Hsch. s.v. salpigkth/s.

fwno-ma^xe/w,
dispute about words, Phld.(?)Herc.19.24, S.E.P.1.195.

fwno-ma^xi/a, h(,
dispute about words, Ptol.Judic. 9.

fwno/-mi_mos, on,
imitating the voice, Ptol.Heph. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.149 B.
fw=nos, on, = megalo/fwnos, Eup.294 (ap.Sch.Ar.Av.42), cf. Theognost. Can.66.

fw=cis, ews, h(,
roasting, Gal.12.618.

fw/r, o(, gen. fwro/s, dat. pl. fwrsi/ Ael.NA9.45:—
thief, Hdt.2.174, etc.; fw/r tinos Pl.R.334a; *)argei=oi fw=res Ar.Fr.57; f. a)/nqrwpoi Paus.10.15.5; e)/gnw de\ fw/r te fw=ra kai\ lu/kos lu/kon prov. in Arist. EE1235a9; ta\ tw=n f. krei/ttw prov. in Hyp.Fr.1: Sup. fw/rtatos
most thievish, Sophr.1. a kind of
bee, prob.
robber-bee, Arist.HA553b9, 625a5. fwrw=n limh/n, a harbour near Athens, a little westward of the Piraeus, used by
smugglers, D.35.28,53, Str.9.1.14. (Like Lat.
fur, from
bher- (root of fe/rw), cf. a)/gein kai\ fe/rein.）

fwr-a/, Ion. fwrh/, h(, (fw/r)
theft, h.Merc.136 (prob. for fwnh=s), 385, BionFr.8.6, Nic.Al.273; i(erw=n xrhma/twn SIG672.16 (Delph., ii B. C.); e)/noxoi o)/ntes fwra=| Sammelb.4638.17 (ii B. C.); e)p' au)th=| th=| fwra=|, = e)p' au)tofw/rw|, Poll.8.69.
detection, discovery, th=s a)llotriologi/as Phld.Acad.Ind.p.67 M.; a)lgei=n e)pi\ th=| f. D.L.1.96; mei=zon th=s f. to\ au)to\n e(autou= kateipei=n Ach.Tat.7.11. (fw/rhs codd. Nic. l.c.; Hsch. has fwra/: kloph/, but fw/rhn: th\n e)/reunan.）

fwr-a_to/s, h/, o/n,
that can be detected, S.E.P.1.183.

fwr-a/w, fut. a/sw [a_] Ar.Nu. 499, etc.: (fw/r, fwra/):
search after a thief or
theft, search a house to discover stolen goods, fwra/swn e)/gwg' ei)se/rxomai Ar.l.c., cf. Ra.1363 (lyr.); fwra=n para/ tini Pl.Lg.954a. generally,
detect, discover, ta\ plei=sta fwrw=n ai)sxra\ fwra/seis S.Fr.853; ou)de/na a)/n tis fwra/sai tw=n . . kaloume/nwn dunatw=n . . r(hto/rwn o(/s ou) . . Phld.Rh.2.247 S.: freq. c. part., a)rgu/rion pw=s fwra/seien a)/n tis e)cago/menon; X.Vect.4.21; tou=to f. drw=ntas h(ma=s Pl.Ti.63c; f. tina\s e)pibouleu/santas Arist.Pol.1306b30; yeu=dos o)
 e)fwra/samen Phld.Mus.p.55 K.: c. acc. et inf., to
 *)axille/a e)ra=n pefw/rakas Philostr.Im.2.7:—Pass.,
to be detected, D.2.10; pefwrame/nos e)pi\ toiau/th| pra/cei Plb.6.56.15; o( fwraqei/s BGU1730.8 (i B. C.): mostly c. part., fwraqh=nai ta\ yeudh= memarturhkw/s D.45.19; kle/pths w)
 f. Id.22.71, cf. 21.41; ei)/ tis fwraqei/h futeu/sas IG7.2226.28 (Thisbe, iii A. D.); a)du/natos w)
 f. Th.8.56: also with Adjs., kako\s (sc. w)/n） e)fwra/qh fi/lois E.Or.740 (troch.), cf. Jul.Or.2.62a: c. inf., *(ellhniko
 ei)=nai pef. Plu.2.714d.

fw/r-eion, to/,
penalty for theft, pentapla/sion to\ f. e)kti/nein PLit.Lond.138 iv 20, cf. 30.

fwri^a^mo/s, h(,
chest, trunk, coffer, esp. for clothes and linen: pl. in Hom., Il.24.228, Od.15.104: sg. in A.R.3.802. (Acc. to Eratosth. 4 from fw/r, fw/rios 11,
a place for keeping secret.）
fwr-ia/w, = fwra/w, Hsch.

fwr-i/dios, a, on, poet. for fw/rios,
stolen, AP9.348 (Leon.Alex.), Max.411, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 6.104.

fw/r-ion, to/, (fwra/ 11)
damning evidence, J.AJ15.3.9, Lib. Decl.49.69; ta\ f. tou= a)dikh/matos Them.Or.26.314a.

fw/r-ios, on, (fw/r)
stolen: ta\ f.
stolen goods, IG5(2).445.13 (Megalopolis, ii/i B. C.), Luc.Herm.38, Philops.20, Tox.28, Jul.Or.2.52c, Chor.p.72 B.; a)/grh Eratosth.4. metaph.,
secret, clandestine, eu)nh/ Theoc. 27.68; le/ktra, ble/mma, AP5.218 (Paul.Sil.), 220 (Id.).

fw=ros, o(,
detecter, discoverer, Hsch., Suid.
fw/rtatos, Sup. of fw/r (q. v.).

fw/s, gen. fwto/s, o(: dual fw=te, fwtoi=n: pl. fw=tes, fwtw=n, fwsi/: poet. Noun (Com., only paratrag., as Ar.Pax528, or pseudo-orac., Diph.126.3 (hex.); also in late Prose, PRyl.77.34 (ii A. D.)):—
man, sts. coupled with a)nh/r, du/o d' ou)/pw fw=te pepu/sqhn, a)ne/re kudali/mw . . Il. 17.377; a)llo/trios f. 5.214, cf. 11.462, 614, al.; in gen., equivalent to a possessive pronoun,
his, xro/a fwto/s 4.139, al.; in Trag. either of heroes, as A.Th.499, S.Ant.107 (lyr.), or of men generally, A. Pers.242 (troch.); fw=t' a)/dikon Id.Ag.398 (lyr.); f. a)no/sios, a)mauro/s, S.OC281,1018; w)= skh=ptra fwto/s, i.e. e)mou=, ib.1109; joined with other Nouns, fw=t' *)asklhpiou= ui(o/n Il.4.194, cf. 21.546, Od.21.26; fwti/ . . de/kth| 4.247; fw=tes *ai)gei/+dai Pi.P.5.75; klwpo\s fwto/s E.Rh. 709.
man, opp. woman, Od.6.129, S.Ant.910, Tr.177, etc.; but du/' oi)ktrw\ fw=te, of a man and his wife, E.Hel.1094; so of lovers, AP5.248.5 (Iren.).
mortal, opp. a god, pro\s dai/mona fwti\ ma/xesqai Il.17.98; fwtw=n a)lao\n ge/nos A.Pr.549 (lyr.); fw=ta bro/teion E.Ba.542 (lyr.).

fw=s, contr. for fa/os,
light (q.v.). fw/|s, h(, pl. fw=|des, contr. from fwi/+s (q.v.).

fw/skw,
dawn, Hsch. (mostly in compds. dia-, e)pi-).
fw/ssw, = fw/gw, fw/|zw, Gal.12.618.

fw/sswn or fw/swn, wnos, o(,
a coarse linen garment, used in Egypt, Poll.7.71; e)n fw/swni th\n i)/shn e)/xwn met' e)mou= dih=ges Cratin.250.
sail, sail-cloth, Lyc.26, Suid., Eust.1151.12. (Perh. Egyptian.)

fwssw/nion or fwsw/nion, to/, Dim. of foreg.,
coarse towel, Luc.Lex. 2, EM804.24.

fwsth/r, h=ros, o(,
that which gives light, oi( f. the
lights of heaven, stars, LXXGe.14, al., Simp. in Epict.p.72 D.; oi( du/o f., i.e. sun and moon, ibid., cf. Procl.Hyp.4.72, etc.; fai/nesqe w(s fwsth=res e)n ko/smw| Ep.Phil.2.15.
splendour, radiance, o( f. au)th=s o(/moios li/qw| timiwta/tw| Apoc.21.11. metaph., of a king, tw=| f. tw=| h(mete/rw| Them.Or.16.204c. of the
eyes, Vett.Val.110.22.
opening for light, door or
window, Hsch.

fwsfo/r-eia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
a festival at which there were torchprocessions, or,
which was sacred to one of the fwsfo/roi qeoi/, Plu.2.1119e, Hsch.

fwsfor-e/w,
bear or
bring light, BGU597.33 (poet., i A. D.);
shine, Nech. ap. Vett. Val.280.2, Ph.1.511, Man.1.65; esp. of the moon or planets,
draw away more than 15o
from the sun, rise, Heph. Astr.1.20; oi( fwsforou=ntes to/poi the positions
of such risings in the zodiac, Ptol.Tetr.89. trans.,
bring into the light, ta\ e)/mbrua Olymp. in Alc.p.12 C.

fwsfor-i/a, h(, Astron.,
rising and shining of the moon or planets
when they have drawn away more than 15o
from the sun, Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).227, Ptol.Tetr.76, Heph.Astr.1.20. Archit., in pl.,
lights (i.e. windows, etc.) of a building, PHamb.15.7 (iii A. D.), etc.

fwsfo/r-ion, to/,
small figure of h( *fwsfo/ros as device on a signet-ring, IG11(2).203B74 (Delos, iii B. C.), al.
shrine of h( *f., Supp.Epigr.4.446.17 (Didyma, iii/ii B. C.). = foreg. 2, PStrassb.9.8 (iv A. D.).

fw/sfor-os (parox.), on, poet. faosfo/ros Lyr.Adesp. in PLit.Lond.51.5, faesfo/ros Call.Dian.204, etc.:—
bringing or
giving light, *(/ews E.Ion1157; f. a)sth/r, of Dionysus at the mysteries, Ar.Ra.342 (lyr.); f. peu=kai Id.Fr.599; ai)/glh, *)=hmar, Orph.A.1246, *eu)xh/ 24. Subst., o( f. (sc. a)sth/r),
the light-bringer, i.e.
the morning-star, a name specially given to the planet Venus, Ti.Locr.96e,97a, Arist.Mu.392a27, 399a8, Cic.ND2.20.53, Ph.1.504, cf. Alex.Eph. ap. Theo Sm. p.138H. of the eye, f. o)/mmata Pl. Ti.45b; f. ko/rai, of the Cyclops, E.Cyc.611 (lyr.). name of an
eye-salve, Gal.12.747.
torch-bearing, epith. of certain deities, esp. of Hecate, E.Hel.569, Ar.Th.858, Fr.594a; f. qea/ (sc. *)/artemis) E.IT21, cf. Call.l.c.; nh\ th\n *fwsfo/ron Ar.Lys.443, Antiph. 58.6; of Hephaestus, Orph.H.66.3: pl., i(ereu\s *fwsfo/rwn Hesperia 4.49 (Athens, ii A. D.). fwsfo/ros, h(,
torch-bearer, title of a priestess, *kleopa/tras qea=s PRein.10.8, etc. (ii B. C.).
fw/swn, fwsw/nion, v. fw/sswn, fwssw/nion.

fwta^gwg-e/w,
guide with a light, guide, pro\s th\n eu)se/beian f. tina/ LXX 4 M.17.5.
draw down supernatural illumination by a magical process, Iamb.Myst.3.14.

fwta^gwg-i/a, h(,
magical process of drawing down supernatural illumination, PMag.Par.1.955, Vett. Val.301.22 fwta^gwg-o/s, o/n,
enlightening, illuminating, of the sun, Mich. in EN554.29;
bringing to light, a)qemi/stwn pragma/twn PMag.Lond. 46.190. h( f. (sc. quri/s)
opening for light, window, Luc.Symp. 20, Dom.6.

fwtau/geia, h(,
brightness of light, Suid., Zonar.; written fwta^gwg-augi/a, Mich. in EN554.30.
fw/taugos: o( h(/lios, Zonar.; fwtaugo/s Suid. (v.l.).

fwteinoeidh/s, es,
like light, Sch.D.T.p.175 H., Sch.E.Hipp.740.

fwteino/s, h/, o/n, (fw=s)
shining, bright, h(/lios X.Mem.4.3.4; skoteina\ kai\ f. [sw/mata] ib.3.10.1, cf. LXXSi.17.31 (Comp.), Plu.2.
1110b, Hierocl. in CA26p.478M.; a)h/r Ath.Med. ap. Orib.9.5.2; oi)/khma Sor.2.10, al. metaph.,
clear, distinct, lo/gos Plu.2.9b (Comp., s.v.l.); also in moral sense, Hierocl. in CA3p.424M.; o(/tan o( o)fqalmo/s sou a(plou=s h)=|, kai\ o(/lon to\ sw=ma/ sou f. e)stin Ev.Luc. 11.34, cf. 36.
fwti/ggion, to/, Dim. of fw=tigc, Posidon.2J., Ael.NA6.31.

fwtiggisth/s, ou=, o(,
fifer, Gloss.

fw=tigc, iggos, h(, Plu.2.961e, o( Jubaap.Ath.4.175e, cf. Ath.4.182d:—Alexandrian name for a kind of
flute (plagi/aulos) said to be invented by Osiris, ll. cc.

fwti/zw, fut. fwti/sw 1 Ep.Cor.4.5:—I. abs.,
shine, give light, o( a)/nqrac [ou) du/natai] fwti/zein w(/sper h( flo/c Thphr.Ign.30, cf. Nic.Fr.74.66. trans.,
illuminate, o( h(/lios f. to\n ko/smon D.S.3.48, cf. Plu. 2.931b (Pass.):—Pass., to\ fwtizo/menon, opp. to\ fwti/zon, ib.936b: opp. skoti/zomai, ib.1120e, cf. Luc.Luct.2, Plot.2.3.5; of a planet, Cat.Cod.Astr.11(2).110; pefwtisme/nai h(me/rai Orph.Fr.272.
bring to light, make known, th\n e(kate/rwn ai(/resin Plb.22.5.10, cf. 28.13.10; ta\ krupta\ tou= sko/tous 1 Ep.Cor.1.c., cf. 2 Ep.Ti.1.10:—Pass., gra/mmata e(alwko/ta kai\ pefwtisme/na Plb.30.8.1; fwtisqe/ntos tou= qana/tou Id.15.25.8.
enlighten, instruct, teach, f. tina/s, pw=s . . LXX 4 Ki.17.28; f. pa/ntas, ti/s h( oi)konomi/a Ep.Eph.3.9.
illuminate with spiritual light, o( u(po\ tou= qeou= pefwtisme/nos Corp.Herm. 9.3, cf. 13.18 (Pass.). in a special sense,
baptize, in Pass., Ep.Heb.6.4, 10.32.
throw light upon, illustrate, of commentators, *(/omhron D.L.1.57.

fw/t-i^sis, ews, h(,
illumination, Procl. in Prm.p.490S.

fw/t-isma, atos, to/,
phase, of the moon, Eustr. in EN31.33.

fwt-ismo/s, o(,
illumination, light, Diocl(?).ap.Gal.19.530, Plu.2.929e, 931b, S.E.M.10.224: pl., Dam.Pr.23; selh/nhs Vett.Val.28.7, Jul.Or.5.167d; [h(misfairi/wn] ib.4.147b. metaph.,
light, *ku/rios f. mou LXXPs.26(27).1, cf. 2 Ep.Cor.4.4,6.

fwt-isth/rion, to/,
lanternwindow, Gloss. (pl.).

fwt-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
illuminating, Ascl. in Metaph.323.11, Sch.E.Hipp.192; f. du/namis tou= h(li/on Ammon. in Int.133.2, cf. Dam.Pr.96; to\ f. tou= puro/s Eustr. in EN117.7. Adv. -kw=s Eust.161.19.

fwto-bi/as [i^], ou, o(,
powerful by light, PMag.Par.1.598.

fwto-boli/a, h(,
beam, ray, Sch.Par.A.R.4.728 (pl.).

fwto-do/ths, ou, o(,
giver of light, Simp. in Epict.p.13 D.; also fwto-dw/ths, voc. -dw=ta, PMag.Par.1.596.

fwto-qu^ri/s, i/dos, h(,
window, CPR105.6 (iii A. D.).

fwto-ki_nh/ths, ou, o(, voc. -kinh=ta,
mover of light, PMag.Par.1.599.

fwto-kra/twr [a], oros, o(,
lord of light, ib.595.

fwto-lamph/s, e/s,
blazing with light, kli/makes Zos.Alch.p.108 B.

fwto-plh/c, plh=gos, o(, h(,
smiting with rays of light, PMag.Par. 1.2242.

fwto-poio/s, o/n,
making light, enlightening, Iamb.Protr.21.g/.

fwt-oulko/s, o/n, (e(/lkw)
drawing, i.e.
admitting, light, a)/noigma TAM2.174C14 (Sidyma).

fwt-ourgo/s, o/n,
light-giving, Prisc.Lyd. 8.15.

fwtofa/n-eia [fa^], h(,
illumination, Anon. ap. Suid.s.v. e)kplagei=s. -h/s, e/s,
brilliant, Eust.226.6.
fwtofo/ros, gloss on faesfo/rous, Suid., cf. EM786.33.
fwtw/dhs, es, = fwtoeidh/s, Hsch. s.v. xione/a.
fw=uc, v. pw=uc.
fw/y, = fa/os, fw=s, Hsch.
